Gbanna uno ri, un o gbo, un o mo
Ohun gbogbo ti mo ti n fe,
Gbogbo ipa mi yoo dalu
Lati se 'fe Re titi lae.

title_english: Ere another Sabbath close
passage_english: For We Which Have Believed Do Enter Into Rest. Hebrews 4:3
passage_yoruba: Nitori Awa Ti O Ti Gbagbo Wo Inu Isinmi. Heberu 4:3
verses_english:
Ere another Sabbath close,
Ere again we seek repose,
LORD, our song ascends to thee,
At thy feet we bow the knee.

For the mercies of the day,
For this rest upon our way,
Thanks to thee alone be given,
LORD and King of earth and heaven.

Whilst this throny path we tread,
May thy love our footsteps lead:
When our journey here is past,
May we rest within Thee at last.

May our earthly Sabbaths prove
Foretastes of our joys above;
While our pilgrim steps we bend
To the rest, which knows no end.
verses_yoruba:
K'ojo 'sinmi yii to tan,
K'a to lo f'ara le 'le,
A wa wole lese Re,
A n korin iyin si O.

Fun aanu ojo oni,
Fun isinmi lona wa,
'Wo nikan l'a f'ope fun,
Oluwa at'Oba wa,

Isin wa ko nilari
Adura wa lu m'ese,
Sugbon 'wo l'o n f'ese ji
Oor'-ofe Re to fun wa.

Je k'ife Re maa to wa,
B'a ti n rin 'na aye yii,
Nigbat'ajo wa ba pin,
K'a le sinmi lodo Re.

K'ojo 'sinmi wonyi je
Ibere ayo orun,
B'a ti n rin ajo wa lo
S 'isinmi ti ko l'opin.

title_english: O Spirit of the living God
passage_english: I Will Pour Out My Spirit On All Flesh.  2:17
passage_yoruba: Emi O Tu Emi Mi Jade Si Ara, Gbogbo Enia. Ise 2:17
verses_english:
O Spirit of the living God,
In all thy plentitude of grace,
Where'er the foot of man hath trod,
Descend on our apostate race.

Give tongues of fire and hearts of love,
To preach the reconciling word,
Give pow'r and unction from above,
When e'er the joyful sound is heard.

Bye darkness, at Thy coming, light
Confusion order in Thy path,
Souls without strength inspire with might,
Bid mercy triumph over wrath.

Oh Spirit of the Lord, prepare,
All the round earth her God to meet,
Breath thou abroad, like morning air,
Till hearts of stone begin to beat.

Baptize the nations, far and nigh,
The triumphs of the cross record,
The name of Jesus glorify,
Tilt every kindred Him confess.
verses_yoruba:
Emi Olorun alaaye,
N'nu ekun oore-ofe Re,
Nibit' ese eniyan ti te,
Sokale sori gbogbo wa.

F'ebun ahon, okan ife,
Fun wa lati soro 'fe Re,
K'ibukun at'agbara Re,
Ba l'awon t'o ngbo oro naa.

K'ookun kase ni bibo Re;
Ki darudapo di tito,
F'ilera f'okan ailera,
Je ki aanu bori 'binu.

Emi Olorun, joo pese,
Gbogbo aye fun Oluwa;
Mi si won b' afefe ooro,
K'okan okuta le soji.

Baptis' gbogb' orile-ede,
Rohin 'segun Jesu yika,
Yin Oruko Jesu logo,
Tit'araiye yio jewo Re.

title_english: O Thou Who makest souls to shine
title_yoruba: Iwo t'o n mu okan mole
passage_english: Your Blessing Is Upon Your People. Psalms 3:8
passage_yoruba: Ibukun Re Si Mbe Lara Awon Eniyan Re. Orin Dafidi 3:8
verses_english:
O Thou Who makest souls to shine
With light from brighter worlds above;
And droppest glistening dew Divine
On all who seek a Saviour's love.

Do Thou Thy benediction give
On all who teach, on all who learn,
That all Thy Church may holier live,
And every lamp more brightly burn.

Give those that teach pure hearts and wise,
Faith, hope, and love, all warmed by prayer;
Themselves first training for the skies,
They best will raise their people there.

Give those that learn the willing ear,
The spirit meek, the guileless mind;
Such gifts will make the lowliest here
Far better than a kingdom find.

Oh! bless the shepherd; bless the sheep,
That guide and guided both be one;
One, in the faithful watch they keep,
Until this hurrying life be done.

If thus, good Lord, Thy grace be given,
Our glory meets us ere we die;
Before we upward pass to Heaven,
We taste our immortality.
verses_yoruba:
Iwo t'o n mu okan mole
Nipa 'mole atorun wa;
T'o si n se iri ibukun,
Sor' awon ti n saferi Re.

Joo masai fi ibukun Re,
Fun oluko at'akeko,
Ki ijo Re le je mimo,
K'atupa Re maa jo gere.

F'okan mimo fun oluko,
Igbagbo, 'reti at'ife,
Ki won j' enit'Iwo ti ko,
Ki won le j'oluko rere.

F'eti igboran f'akeko,
Okan 'rele at'ailetan;
Talaka to kun f'ebun yii,
San ju oba aye yii lo.

Buk'oluso; buk' agutan
Ki won j'okan labe 'so Re;
Ki won maa f'okan kan sona,
Tit'aye osi yii yoo pin.

Baba b'awa ba m'oore Re,
Laye yii l'a o ti l'ogo,
K'a to koja s'oke orun
L'ao mo ohun ti aiku je

title_english: Praise, O praise our God and King
passage_english: Who Gives Food To All Flesh. Psalms 136:25
passage_yoruba: Eniti O Nfi Onje Fun Eda Gbogbo. Orin Dafidi: 136:25
verses_english:
Praise, O praise our God and King
Hymns of adoration sing,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

Praise Him that He made the sun,
Day by day his course to run,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

And the silver moon by night,
Shinning with her gentle lights,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

Praise Him that We gave the rain,
To mature the swelling grain,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

And hath bid the fruitful field,
Crops of precious increase yield,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

Praise Him for our harvest store,
He hath filled the gamer floor,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

And for richer food than this,
Pledge of everlasting bliss,
For His mercies still endure,
Ever faithful, ever sure.

Glory to our bounteous King!
Glory let creation sing!
Glory to the Father, Son
And blest Spirit, Three in One.
verses_yoruba:
Yin Qlorun Oba wa,
E gbe ohun Iyin ga,
Aanu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju.

Yin Enit'o da oorun
Ti o nran lojoojumo,
Aanu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju.

Ati osupa loru,
Ti o tan mole jeje,
Aanu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju.

Yin Enit'o n m'ojo ro,
T'o n mu irugbin dagba,
Aanu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju.

Enit' o pase fun 'le
Lati mu eso po sii;
Aanu Re o wa titi
Lododo dajudaju.

Yin In fun ikore oko,
O mu ki aka wa kun,
Aanu Re, o wa titi;
Lododo dajudaju.

Yin In f ounje t'o ju yii lo,
Eri 'bukun ailopin
Aanu Re, o wa titi;
Lododo dajudaju.

Ogo f 'Qba oloore
Ki gbogbo eda gberin,
Ogo fun Baba, Omo
At'Emi: Metalokan.

title_english: Lord of the harvest, Thee we hail!
passage_english: They Joy Before Thee According To The Joy In Harvest. Isaiah 9:3
passage_yoruba: Nwon Nyo Niwaju Re Gege Bi Ayo Ikore. . 9:3
verses_english:
When spring doth wake the sound of mirth,
When summer warms the fruitful earth,
When autumn yields its ripened grain,
Or winter sweeps the naked plain,
We still do sing, To Thee our King;
Through all their changes Thou dost reign.

But chiefly when Thy liberal hand
Bestows new plenty o'er the land,
When sounds of music fill the air,
As homeward all their treasures bear;
We too will raise, Our hymn of praise,
For we Thy common bounties share.

Lord of harvest, all is Thine:
The rains that fall, the suns that shine,
The seed once hidden in the ground,
The skill that makes our fruits abound:
New every year, Thy gifts appear;
New praises from our lips shall sound.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa 'kore 'Wo l'a n yin
Ileri Re 'gbani ko ye
Orisi igba si n yipo,
Orodun kun fun oore Re
Lojo oni, awa dupe
Je k' iyin gba okan wa kan

B' akoko 'rugbin mu wa yo,
B' igba eerun n mu ooru wa,
'Gbat' owo ojo ba n rinle,
Tabi' gba ti ikore ba pon,
'Wo Oba wa l' a o maa yin,
'Wo l'akoso gbogbo won.

Ju gbogbo re lo, nigbati
Owo Re fun opo ka 'le,
'Gba t'ohun ayo gbile kan
B' eda ti n ko ire won jo
Awa pelu yoo maa yin O
Oore Re ni gbogbo wa n pin.

Oluwa 'kore, Tire ni
Ojo ti n ro, oorun ti n ran
Irugbin ti a ngbin sile
Tire l'ogbon ti n mu un dagba
Otun l'ebun Re l'odoodun
Otun n'iyin Re l'enu wa.

title_english: Praise to God, immortal praise
passage_english: Yet I Will Rejoice In The Lord. Habakkuk 3:18
passage_yoruba: Emi O Maa Yo Ninu Oluwa . Habakuku 3:18
verses_english:
Praise to God, immortal praise,
For the love that crowns our days;
Bounteous Source of every joy,
Let Thy praise our tongues employ.

For the blessings of the fields,
For the stores the garden yields,
For the vine's refreshing juice;
For the generous olive's use.

All that Spring with bounteous hand
Scatters o'er the smiling land;
All that liberal autumn pours
From her rich o'erflowing stores.

These to Thee, my God, we owe,
Source whence all our blessings flow;
And for these my soul shall raise
Grateful vows and solemn praise.

Yet, should rising whirlwinds tear
From its stem the ripening ear;
Should the fig-tree's blasted shoot
Drop her green untimely fruit,

Should the vine put forth no more,
Nor the olive yield her store;
Though the sickening flocks should fall,
And the herds desert the stall,

Yet to Thee my soul shall raise
Grateful vows and solemn praise;
And, when every blessing's flown
Love Thee for Thyself alone.
verses_yoruba:
Yin Olorun, yin In laelae,
Fun ife ojoojumo;
Orisun ayo gbogbo,
K' iyin Re gb' enu wa kan.

Gbogbo nkan t' erun n mu wa
Kaakiri gbogbo ile;
At' eso igba ojo
Lat' inu ekun re wa.

'Wo l' elebun gbogbo won
Orisun ibukun wa;
'Torinaa okan wa yoo
F' iyin at' ope fun O.

Iji lile I ba ja
K'o ba gbogbo oka je:
K' eso igi wo danu
Ki akoko re to pe;

Ajara 'ba ma so mo,
Ki igi gbogbo sigbe,
K' eran osin gbogbo ku
K' eran igbe tan pelu;

Sibe, Iwo l' okan wa
Yoo fi iyin at' ope fun;
Gbat' ibukun gbogbo tan
Ao sa fe O fun 'ra Re.

title_english: Now thank we all our God
passage_english: For This God Is Our God For Ever And Ever. Psalms 48:14
passage_yoruba: Olorun Yii Olorun Wa Ni Lae Ati Laelae. Ps. 48:14
verses_english:
Now thank we all our God
With hearts and hands and voices
Who wondrous things have done
In whom His world rejoices
Who from our mother's arms
Hath blessed us on our way
With countless gifts of love
And still is ours to-day.

O may this bounteous God
Through all our life be near us
With ever-joyful hearts
And blessed peace to cheer us
And keep us in His grace
And guide us when perplexed
And free us from all ills
In this world and the next.

All praise and thanks to God
The father now be given
The Son and Him who reigns
With them in highest heaven
The one Eternal God
Who earth and heaven adore
For thus it was, is now,
And shall be evermore.
verses_yoruba:
A f'ope f'Olorun
L'okan ati lohun wa
Eni s'ohun 'yanu
N'nu Enit'araye n yo
'Gbat'a wa l'om 'owo
Oun naa l'o n toju wa
O si n f'ebun ife
Se 'toju wa sibe.

Oba Onib'ore
Ma fi wa sile laelae
Ayo ti ko lopin
Oun 'bukun yoo je tiwa
Pa wa mo n'nu ore
To wa, gb'a ba damu
Yo wa ninu ibi
Laye ati l'orun

K'a f'iyin oun ope
F'Olorun, Baba, Omo
Ati Emi mimo
Ti O ga julo l'orun
Olorun kan laelae
T'aye at'orun n bo
Bee l'o wa d'isiyii
Beni yoo wa laelae.

title_english: Come, ye thankful people, come,
passage_english: He That Goeth Forth And Weepeth. Psalms 126:6
passage_yoruba: Eniti N Fi Ekun Rin Lo. Ps 126:6
verses_english:
Come, ye thankful people, come,
Raise the song of harvest home;
All is safely gathered in,
Ere the winter storms begin.
God our Maker doth provide
For our wants to be supplied;
Come to God's own temple, come,
Raise the song of harvest home.

All the world is God's own field,
Fruit unto His praise to yield;
Wheat and tares together sown
Unto joy or sorrow grown
First the blade and then the ear,
Then the full corn shall appear;
Lord of harvest, grant that we
Wholesome grain and pure may be.

For the Lord our God shall come,
And shall take His harvest home;
From His field shall in that day
All offenses purge away,
Giving angels charge at last
In the fire the tares to cast;
But the fruitful ears to store
In His garner evermore.

Even so, Lord, quickly come,
Bring Thy final harvest home;
Gather Thou Thy people in,
Free from sorrow, free from sin,
There, forever purified,
In Thy garner to abide;
Come, with all Thine angels come,
Raise the glorious harvest home.
verses_yoruba:
Wa, eyin olope wa,
Gbe orin Ikore ga:
Ire gbogbo ti wole
K'otutu oye to de:
Olorun Eleda wa
L'o ti pese f'aini wa
Wa k'a re 'le Olorun
Gbe orin ikore ga.

Oko Olorun l'aye,
Lati s'eso iyin Re:
Alikama at'epo
N dagba faro tab'ayo
Ehu naa, ipe tele,
Siri oka, nikehin;
Oluwa 'kore, mu wa
Je eso rere fun O.

Tori Olorun wa n bo
Yoo si kore Re sile:
Oun o gbon gbogbo panti
Kuro l'oko Re n'jo naa;
Yoo pase f'awon Angel'
Lati gba epo s'ina,
Lati ko alikama
Si aba Re titi lai.

Beeni, maa wa, Oluwa
Si ikore ikehin;
Ko awon eniyan Re jo
Kuro l'ese at'aro:
So won di mimo lailai
Ki won le maa ba O gbe:
Wa t'Iwo t'Angeli Re
Gbe orin ikore ga.

title_english: Thou God of love, Spring of Mercy
passage_english: While The Earth Remains, Seedtime And Harvest. Genesis 8:22
passage_yoruba: Niwon Igbati Aye Yoo Wa. Gen 8:22
verses_english:
Thou God of love, Spring of Mercy,
How great is thy goodness!
Various Seasons as they come
Do proclaim thy concern.

Soon as the farmer plants his seed
He puts it in the soil,
You do know when it germinates,
And You send down the rain.

Yours is the power the rain has,
That makes the plants to grow;
You send light that comes from the sun,
And the dew drops also.

Thou spring of love, Thou art our praise;
To Thee we raise our voice,
All creatures, in earnest, do join
In the sweet praise worship.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun 'fe, Isun aanu,
Oore Re ti po to!
Orisi akoko t'o nde
L'o n kede ajo Re.

Nigbat' agbe 'gbin ogbin re,
T'o ri mo 'nu ile,
Iwo m' akoko ti o nhu,
O si ran ojo wa.

Tire l' agbara t' ojo ni,
T'on mu 'rugbin dagba;
'Wo l'o n ran 'mole oorun wa,
Ati iri pelu.

Isun ife, 'Wo n' iyin wa;
Iwo l'a n korin si,
Gbogbo eda l' o si dalu
N'nu iyin didun naa.

title_english: There shall be showers of blessing
passage_english: And I Will Cause The Shower To Come Down. Ezekiel 34:26
passage_yoruba: Emi O Se Je Ki Ojo Ki O Ro. Ezek. 34:26
verses_english:
There shall be showers of blessing:
This is the promise of love;
There shall be seasons refreshing,
Sent from the Savior above.
Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need:
Mercy-drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.

There shall be showers of blessing,
Precious reviving again;
Over the hills and the valleys,
Sound of abundance of rain.
Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need:
Mercy-drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.

There shall be showers of blessing;
Send them upon us, O Lord;
Grant to us now a refreshing,
Come, and now honor Thy Word.
Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need:
Mercy-drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.

There shall be showers of blessing:
Oh, that today they might fall,
Now as to God we're confessing,
Now as on Jesus we call!
Showers of blessing,
Showers of blessing we need:
Mercy-drops round us are falling,
But for the showers we plead.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ibukun yoo si ro!"
Ileri ife l'eyii;
A o ni itura didun
Lat' odo Olugbala.
Ojo ibukun!
Ojo ibukun l'a n fe
Iri aanu se yi wa ka,
Sugbon ojo l'a n toro

"Ojo ibukun yoo si ro!"
Isoji iyebiye;
Lori oke oun petele
Iro opo ojo n bo
Ojo ibukun!
Ojo ibukun l'a n fe
Iri aanu se yi wa ka,
Sugbon ojo l'a n toro

"Ojo ibukun yoo si ro!"
Ran won si wa Oluwa!
Fun wa ni itura didun
Wa, f'ola fun oro Re.
Ojo ibukun!
Ojo ibukun l'a n fe
Iri aanu se yi wa ka,
Sugbon ojo l'a n toro

"Ojo ibukun yoo si ro!"
Iba je le ro loni!
B'a ti n jewo f'Olorun wa
T'a n pe oruko Jesu.
Ojo ibukun!
Ojo ibukun l'a n fe
Iri aanu se yi wa ka,
Sugbon ojo l'a n toro

title_english: Hark the glad sound! the Saviour comes
passage_english: For He Has Visited and Redeemed His People. Luke 1:68
passage_yoruba: O Ti Bojuwo, O Siti Da Awon Eniyan Re Ni Ide Luku. Luku 1:68
verses_english: Hark the glad sound! the Saviour comes, The Saviour promised long; Let every heart prepare a throne, And every voice a song.
He comes the prisoners to release, In Satan's bondage held; The gates of brass before Him burst, The iron fetters yield.
He comes, from thickest films of vice To clear the mental ray, And on the eye-balls of the blind To pour celestial day.
He comes the broken heart to bind, The bleeding soul to cure; And with the treasures of His grace To enrich the humble poor.
Our glad hosannas, Prince of Peace, Thy welcome shall proclaim, And Heaven's eternal arches ring With Thy belove name.
verses_yoruba: Gbo 'gbe ayo! Oluwa de, Jesu t'a se 'leri; Ki gbogbo okan mura de, K'ohun mura korin.
O de lati t'onde sile L'oko eru Esu, 'Lekun 'de fo niwaju Re Sekeseke 'rin da.
O de laarin 'baje aye Lati tan 'mole Re. Lati mu k'awon afoju Le f'oju won riran.
O de,'tunu fokan 'rora, Iwosan f'agbogbe! Pelu 'sura oor'ofe Re Fun awon talaka.
Hosana, Oba 'laafia, A o kede bibo Re; Gbogbo orun yoo maa korin Oruko t'a feran.

passage_english: Therefore, Be Ye Also Ready. Matthew 24:44
passage_yoruba: Ki Eyin Ki O Mura Sile. Matt. 24:44
verses_english:
Are the world of men seeking for?
 Second coming of the Lord
 If the world and heaven passes
 His word will ever remain.

As it was in the day of Noah
 So cometh the Son of Man
 Therefore let us be prepared
 E're the bridegroom comes again.

Blessed is He that is waiting
 Whom the Lord shall found watching
 And He will make him the captain
 In the everlasting reign.

On the day of resurrection
 How mighty the joy would be
 Husband, wife, children and brethren
 They shall sing redemption song.

Lord Jesus Christ, count us worthy
 Unto this glorious kingdom
 That above we may join with them
 To praise Thee forever more.
verses_yoruba:
Aye ha n saferi 
 Bibo Kristi nigba keji?
 Bi orun oun aye koja,
 Oro naa ki yoo ye lae.

Gege bi ojo Noa ti ri,
 Beni wiwa Omo Eniyan;
 'Torinaa e je ka mura,
 Ki oko 'yawo to de.

Alabukun ni fun
 eni Ti Kristi ba ti n sona;
 Oun yoo si fi se Olori,
 N'nu 'joba ayeraye.

A! ayo ojo ajinde!
 Ayo naa yoo ti po to!
 T'oko, aya, omo, ara,
 Yoo maa korin 'rapada.

title_english: Jesus whom God hath exalted
title_yoruba: Jesu ti Baba ti gbega Lat' ipilese aye
passage_english: And Behold, I Am Coming QuicklyRevelation 22:12
passage_yoruba: Kiyesi I, Emi Mbo Kankan. Ifi. 22:12
verses_english: Jesus whom God hath exalted. From foundation of the World, The same Jesus will soon come back, To judge the quick and the dead.
Behold, Jesus will surely come, Shall we not prepare for him? Then full salvation we shall have On that great and glorious day.
Jesus will appear in the sky, All the eyes shall there see Him, And those that nail'd Him on the cross All people shall give account.
Now with faith, I can boldly say, That I 'll go up with my Lord, With Him to reign for thousand years, And at eternity too.
But others would not be able, With the lord, go to the sky, Because their works has no reward, Which were done while here on earth.
We are waiting for Thy coming, Thou who art the hope of world Come Thou Lord, Jesus our Saviour All our sorrows cease to be.
verses_yoruba: Jesu ti Baba ti gbega Lat' ipilese aye, Oun kanna yoo pada wa Lati se 'dajo aye.
Woo! pipada bo Re daju, A ki yoo ha mura de E? K'a ba le ni 'gbala kikun L'ojo ologo nla ni.
Yoo f'ara han l'awosanma, Gbogbo oju ni yoo rii, Ati awon t'o kan mo 'gi Gbogb' aye ni yoo jiyin.
Mo 'le fi 'gbagbo so wipe Un o ba Jesu goke lo, Si 'joba egberun odun, Ati ti ayeraye.
Sugbpn awon miran ki yoo Ba Oluwa goke, Nitori 'se won ko lere, Ti won se l'oj'aye won.
A n reti dide Re sibe, 'Wo ni 'reti gbogb'aye, Maabo, 'Wo Olugbala wa, Mu wahala wa d'opin.

title_english: Thou art coming, O my Saviour
title_yoruba: Iwo n bo wa, Oluwa mi
passage_english: I Will Come Again. John 14:3
passage_yoruba: Emi O Si Tun Pada. Johanu. 14:3
verses_english: Thou art coming, O my Saviour, Thou art coming, O my King, In Thy beauty all-resplendent, In Thy glory all-transcendent, Well may we rejoice and sing; Coming-in the opening east Herald brightness slowly swells; Coming – O my glorious Priest, Hear we not Thy golden bells?

Thou art coming, Thou art coming; We shall meet Thee on Thy way, We shall see Thee, we shall know Thee We shall bless Thee, we shall show Thee All our hearts could never say: What an anthem that well be, Music rapturously sweet, Pouring out our love to Thee At Thine own all-glorious feet.

Thou art coming, at Thy table We are witnesses for this; While remembering hearts Thou meetest In communion, clearest, sweetest, Earnest of our coming bliss, Showing not Thy death alone, And Thy love exceeding great, But Thy coming, and Thy throne, All for which we long and wait.

Oh the joy to see Thee reigning Thee my own beloved Lord; Every tongue Thy name confessing; Worship, honour, glory, blessing Brought to Thee with one accord, Thee, my Master and my Friend, Vindicated and enthroned, Unto earth's remotest end Glorified, adore, and own'd.
verses_yoruba: Iwo n bo wa, Oluwa mi, Iwo n bo wa, Qba mi, Ninu itansan ewa Re, Ninu titayo ogo Re, O ye k'a yo, k'a korin; O n bo, ni ila orun Awon akede n po sii, O n bo: Alufa ogo; A ko ha n gbo aago Re?.
Iwo n bo wa, iwo n bo wa A o pade Re l'ona A o ri O, a o mo O, A o yin O: gbogbo okan L'a o sipaya fun O; Orin kil'eyii o je Orin t'odun rekoja; A o tu 'fe wa jade Si ese Re Ologo.

Iwo n bo wa, ni tabil' Re, L'awa n jeri si eyii; T'a mo p'O n pade okan wa Ni idapo mimo julo Eri ibukun ti n bo Ko f'iku Re nikan han, At'ife titobi Re; Sugbon bibo Re pelu T'a n fe, t'a si n duro de.
Yoo dun lati ri O n 'joba, Oluwa mi, Olufe; Ki gbogbo ahon jewo Re, Iyin, ola, ati ogo, Ki won jumo fi fun O; 'Wo, Oga mi, Ore mi, K'o segun k'o si gunwa Titi de opin aye Ninu ogo at'ola.

title_english: Day of judgement
passage_english: Judgment of the Great Day. Jude 1:6
passage_yoruba: Idajo Ojo Nla Ni. Juda 1:6
verses_english: Day of judgement, day of wrath A day Jesus thine soul seek What a great day it shall be.
Loudly shall the trumpet sound, All the graves shall loose their hold, All the dead shall to life rise.
Death shall thus metamorphose, Creatures shall resurrect Call of God, all to attend.
The books shall be opened up, Contents there-in shall be read For by them shall all be judged.
Jesus Christ the Righteous Judge Atone for my sins I plead Ere the judgement day shall come.
verses_yoruba: Ojo 'dajo oun 'binu, Ojo ti Jesu pe ni, Gongo a so n' ijo naa!
Kikan n' ipe o maa dun, Isa oku yio si, Gbogbo oku yoo dide.
Iku paapaa yoo diji, Eda gbogbo yoo dide Lati j' ipe Olorun.
A o si Iwe sile, A o si ka ninu re Fun 'dajo t'oku t'aaye.
Onidajo Ododo, Joo w' ese mi gbogbo nu K' ojo 'siro naa to de.

title_english: That day of wrath, that dreadful day
passage_english: They Will Perish, But You Will Endure. Psalms 102:26
passage_yoruba: Won O Segbe, Sugbon Iwo O Wa Titi Lae. Orin Dafidi 102:26
verses_english: That day of wrath, that dreadful day, When heav'n and earth shall pass away What pow'r shall be the sinner's stay! How shall he meet that dreadful day!
When, shriveling like a parched scroll, The flaming heav'ns together roll, When louder yet, and yet more dread, Swells the high trump that wakes the dead.
Oh, on that day, that wrathful day, When man to judgement wakes from clay, Be Thou, O Christ, the sinner's stay, Though heav'n and earth shall pass away.
verses_yoruba: Ojo ibinu, ojo eru T'aye at'orun yoo fo lo, Kin' igbekele elese? Yoo se le yoju l'ojo naa?
Nigbati orun yoo kako Bi awo ti a f'ina sun, T' ipe ajinde yoo maa dun Kikankikan, teruteru.
A! l'ojo naa, ojo'binu. T' eda yoo ji si dajo. Kristi, joo se gbekele wa. 'Gbat'aye, t'orun ba fo lo

title_tune: H.C. 70. T. H.C. 52. D.S.M. with refrain
title_english: The Church has waited long
title_yoruba: Ijo ti nduro pe Lati ri Oluwa
passage_english: Surely, I Am Come Quickly. Revelation 22:20
passage_yoruba: Beeni Ma Abo Oluwa. Ifi. 22:20
verses_english: The Church has waited long, Her absent Lord to see, And still in loneliness she waits, A friendless stranger she. Age after age has gone, Sun after sun has set, And still of her dear Lord bereft She weeps a mourner yet. Come then, Lord Jesus, come!

Saint after saint on earth Has lived, and loved, and died; And as they left us one by one, We laid them side by side; We laid them down to sleep, But not in hope forlorn; We laid them but to slumber there, Till the last glorious morn. Come then, Lord Jesus, come!

The serpent's brood increase, The powers of hell grow bold, The conflict thickens, faith is low, And love is waxing cold. How long, O Lord our God, Holy, and true, and good, Wilt Thou not judge Thy suffering Church, Her sighs, and tears, and blood? Come then, Lord Jesus, come!

We long to hear Thy voice, To see Thee face to face, To share Thy crown and glory then, As now we share Thy grace. Come, Lord, and wipe away The curse, the sin, the stain, And make this blighted world of ours, Thine own fair world again, Come then, Lord Jesus, come!
verses_yoruba: Ijo ti nduro pe Lati ri Oluwa, O si wa bakanna sibe, Ko s'alabaro fun! Odun nyii lu Odun, Ojo n gori ojo, Sibe lairi Oluwa re, O wa ninu ofo. Maa bo, Jesu, maa bo.
Awon mimo l'aye, Opo won l'o ti ku; Bi won si ti n lo l'okookan L'a n te won gbe ra won; A te won lati sun, Ki se l'ainireti; A te won lati reju ni, K'ile ogo to mo, Maa bo, Jesu maa bo!
Awon ota n po sii, Agbara esu n ga; Ogun n gbona, igbagbo nku, Ife si di tutu Yoo ti pe to! Baba, Olooto, Oloore! 'Wo ki y'o koya omije At' eje Ijo Re, Maa bo, Jesu maa bo!
A n fe gbo ohun Re, A n fe f'oju kan O. K'a le gba ade at'ogo B'a ti n gba oore Re; Joo, wa m'ese kuro, At'egun at'eeri, K'o si so aye osi yii D'aye rere Tire Maa bo, Jesu maa bo.

title_english: he Lord of might from Sinai's
passage_english: Whose Voice Then Shook the Earth. Hebrews 12:26
passage_yoruba: Ohun Eniti O Mi Aye Nigbanna. Heberu 12:26
verses_english: The Lord of might from Sinai's brow Gave forth His voice of thunder, And Israel lay on earth below: Outstretch'd in fear and wonder: Beneath His feet was pitchy night, And at His left hand and His right The rocks were rent asunder.

The Lord of love on Calvary, A meek and suff'ring stranger, Upraised to heav'n His languid eye In nature's hour of danger; For us He bore the weight of woe, For us He gave His blood to now, And met His Father's anger.

The Lord of love, the Lord of might The King of all created, Shall back return to claim His right, On clouds of glory seated; With trumpet-sound, and angel song, And Hallelujahs loud and long, O'er death and hell defeated.
verses_yoruba: Oluwa, agbara fo 'hun Bi ara l'oke Sinai, Awon Israeli gbohun Re, Won si gbon fun iberu; Okunkun su biribiri, Ati l'otun ati l'osi Awon apata n faya
Oluwa ife je 'rora L'ori oke Kalfari, O gbe oju soke orun, L'akoko wahala Re; Fun wa l'o ru eru egbe Fun wa l'o teje Re sile, T'o si tu Baba l'oju.
Oba ife at'agbara Oluwa eda gbogbo O n pada bo ninu ogo Lati wa gba ijoba; Ipe yoo dun, angeli yoo ho, Halleluyah yoo j'orin won, L'ori Esu at'iku.

title_english: Hark! tis the watchman's cry Wake
passage_english: Now It Is High Time To Awake Out Of Sleep. Romans 13:11
passage_yoruba: O To Wakati Ati Ji L'oju Orun. Romu. 13:11
verses_english: Hark! tis the watchman's cry Wake, brethren, wake! Jesus Himself is nigh Wake, brethren, wake! Sleep is for sons of night: Ye are children of the light; Yours is the glory bright; Wake, brethren, wake!

Call to each wak'ning band, Watch brethren, watch! Clear is our Lord's command, Watch, brethren, watch! Be ye as men that wait Always at their Master's gate; E'e though He tarry late; Watch, brethren, watch!

Heed we the Steward's call Work, brethren, work! There's room enough for all; Work, brethren, work! This vineyard of the Lord Constant labour will afford; He will your work reward; Work, brethren, work!

Hear we the Shepherd's Voice Pray, brethren, pray! Would ye His Heart rejoice, Pray, brethren, pray! Sin calls for ceaseless fear, Weakness needs the Strong One near Long as ye struggle here, Pray, brethren, pray!

Sound now the final chord, Praise, brethren, praise! Thrice Holy is the Lord, Praise, brethren, praise! What more befits the tongues Soon to join the Angels' songs, Whilst Heav'n the note prolongs Praise, brethren, praise!
verses_yoruba: Gbo ohun alore, Ji ara ji Jesu ma a fere de, Ji, ara, ji, Omo oru ni sun, Omp imole l'eyin, Ti iyin logo didan, Ji, ara, ji.
So f'egbe t'o ti ji, Ara, sora, Ase Jesu daju, Ara, sora. E se b'Olusona N'ilekun Oluwa yin, Bi O tile pe de, Ara, sora.
Gbo ohun iriju, Ara, sise: Ise naa kari wa, Ara, sise; Ogba Oluwa wa, Kun fun 'se nigbagbogbo Yoo si fun wa l'ere, Ara, sise.
Gb'ohun Oluwa wa, E gb'adura, B'e fe k'inu Re dun, E gb'adura, Ese mu 'beru wa, Alailera si ni wa, Ni ijakadi yin, E gb'adura.
Ko orin ikeyin Yin in ara yin in, Mimo ni Oluwa, Yin in, ara, yin in, Kil'o tun ye ahon T'o fere b'Agenl' Korin T' yoo ro l'orun titi Yin in, ara, yin in.

title_english: Our Lord doth come
title_yoruba: Oluwa n bo; aye yo mi
passage_english: For He Cometh to Judge the Earth. Psalms 96:13
passage_yoruba: O Mbo, Lati Se Idajo Aye. Orin Dafidi. 96:13
verses_english: Our Lord doth come, the world will quake, And every mountain shall be moved, And all the stars of heaven too Shall cease to shine nor give their light.
Our Lord doth come, unlike before When He came in humility; When He was slain as Lamb of God, Our suff'ring Saviour who has died.
Our Lord doth come, doth come in fear, In flaming fire and in great wrath Coming, on Cherub wings doth fly. Coming, the great Judge of the earth.
Is this the one who walked on earth Just like a pilgrim on life's road Was persecuted and oppress'd, Is this the one, He that was slain.
The wicked hid themselves in vain, Hid in the rocks and in the dens; But faith that has the victory. Shall sing at last, "the Lord hascome.
verses_yoruba: Oluwa n bo; aye yo mi, Oke yoo sidi n'ipo won; At' irawo oju orun, Yoo mu imole won kuro.
Oluwa n bo; bakanna ko Bi o ti wa n'irele ri; Odo-agutan ti a pa, Eni-iya ti o si ku.
Oluwa n bo; li eru nla, L'owo ina pelu ija L'or' iye apa Kerubu, N bo, Onidajo araye.
Eyii ha li eniti n rin, Bi ero l'opopo ayo? Ti a se 'nunibini si? A! Eniti a pa l'eyii?
Ika; b'e wo 'nu apata, B'e wo 'nu iho, lasan ni; Sugbon igbagbo t'o segun, Yoo korin pe, Oluwa de.

title_english: Jesus the most high in heaven
passage_english: Prepare Your Hearts Unto the Lord. 1 Samuel 7:3
passage_yoruba: E Pese Okan Nyin Sile. I Samueli 7:3
verses_english: Jesus the most high in heaven Made the world with His might Thou who left Thy great majesty That the world might be saved.
With humble He came to the world In the likeness of men That all souls in humility May thro' the Lord be sav'd.
The angels marvell'd at His sight At great love He bestowed We have the privilege of life Which the angels have not.
Therefore rejoice thy time has come And shout, O ye for joy Deliverance cometh for sinners Through Jesus Christ our Lord.
Let Thy return on earth O Lord To us at second time That waiting for Thee all our days In joy, may we be found.
verses_yoruba: Jesu t'o ga julo l'orun, Ipa Re l'o d'aye; 'Wo f'ogo nlanla Re sile, Lati gba aye la.
O w'aye ninu irele Ni ara osi wa; Nitori k'okan t'o rele Le t'ipase Re la.
Wiwa Re ya angel' l'enu, Ife t'o tobi ni; Eniyan l'anfani iye Angeli se, ko ni.
N je araye yo; saa yin de, E ho iho ayo: Igbala n bo fun elese; Jesu, Olorun ni.
Oluwa, je ki bibo Re, Nigba erinkeji, Je ohun ti a n duro de, K'o le ba wa l'ayo.

title_english: Behold, see yonder horizon
passage_english: AWAKE THOU THAT SLEEPEST. EPHESIANS 5:14
passage_yoruba: JI, IWO ENITI O SUN. EFESU 5:14
verses_english:
Behold, see yonder horizon
Behold the morning sunrise
Wake from thy deep sleep, thou my heart
Arise and be thou watchful;
Blessed Saviour, blessed Saviour
Coming again to the earth.

It's long I've been expecting Thee
My weary heart long doth wait
The world has no more joy for me,
E'er its light has become dark
Blessed Saviour, blessed Saviour,
When will Thou come back again.

My salvation doth draw nearer
The dark night is almost gone
Let me be in humble estate
Let me keep watching for Thee,
Blessed Saviour, blessed Saviour,
Until I, Thy face behold

Let my lamp now keep burning
That I may not stray again,
Just to expect Thy coming back
And to take me to Thy home
Blessed Saviour, blessed Saviour,
I am waiting, quickly come.
verses_yoruba:
Wo oju sanma ohun ni,
Wo lila oorun ooro,
Ji l'ojo oorun, okan mi
Dide k'o si maa sora!
Olugbala, Olugbala,
Tun n pada bo wa s'aye

O pe ti mo ti n reti Re
L'aare l'okan mi n duro
Aye ko ni ayo fun mi
Nibikibi ko tan 'mole
Olugbala, Olugbala,
'Gbawo ni 'Wo o pada?

Igbala mi sun m'etile
Oru fere koja na
Je ki n wa n'ipo irele
Ki n s'afojusona Re
Olugbala, Olugbala,
Titi un o fi r'oju Re.

Je ki fitila mi maa jo,
Ki n ma sako kiri mo,
Ki n sa maa reti abo Re
Lati mu mi lo s'ile;
Olugbala, Olugbala,
Yara k'o maa bo kankan

title_english: Thou long expected Jesus
title_yoruba: Wo Jesu t'a ti n reti
passage_english: TRULY MY SOUL WAITETH UPON GOD FROM HIM COMETH MY SALVATION. PSALMS 62:1
passage_yoruba: OLORUN NIKAN LI OKAN MI DURO JE DE; LATI ODO RE WA NI IGBALA MI. OD. 62:1
verses_english:
Thou long expected Jesus
Who from our sins would save us
When shall the salvation come
And the love of sin shall cease.

O Thou Saviour of mankind
Bid the sorrow of heart cease
Take away the heavy load
Make us rejoice in Thy work.

There are many fake Prophets
Tho' they perform miracles
To deceive all beloved
Bid them cease, Lord from henceforth.

Lord Jesus we beseech Thee
Give us spirit to endure
That we may serve Thee to end
And yield not to temptation.

Lord revive the sleeping souls
Drive our weaknesses away
That we may'n unity be
Until we see Thy face, Lord.

Almighty blessed Saviour
Source of our joy come from Thee
Give Thy grace, O Lord to us
May we ever live with Thee.
verses_yoruba:
'Wo Jesu t'a ti n reti
Lati gba wa low'ese.
'Gbawo ni 'gbala yoo de,
Ti ao da ide ese?

'Wo Olugbala aye,
Wo 'banuje okan san,
Gbe eru wuwo kuro,
M'okan wa yo n'nu 'se Re.

Awon woli eke po,
Won si n fi 'se 'yanu han,
Lati tan ayanfe je;
Oluwa da won lekun.

Oluwa awa n be O,
Fun wa l'emi 'farada,
Lati le sin O d'opin,
Ka ma f'ara fun 'danwo.

Mu okan t'o sun soji,
Le ailera wa jinna,
K'a le wa ni isokan
Titi ao fi ri O.

Oluwa Olubukun,
Lodo Re ni ayo wa,
Fun wa l'oore-ofe Re
K'o maa ba wa gbe titi.

title_english: Light of those whose dreary dwelling
passage_english: THE DESIRE OF ALL NATIONS SHALL COME. HAGGAI 2:7
passage_yoruba: IFE GBOGBO ORILE-EDE YOO SI DE. HAGGAI 2:7
verses_english:
Light of those whose dreary dwelling
Borders on the shades of death,
Come, and by Thy love's revealing
Dissipate the clouds beneath.
The new heaven and earth's Creator,
In our deepest darkness rise,
Scattering all the night of nature,
Pouring eyesight on our eyes.

Still we wait for Thine appearing;
Life and joy Thy beams impart,
Chasing all our fears, and cheering
Every poor benighted heart.
Come, and manifest the favor
God hath for our ransomed race;
Come, Thou universal Savior,
Come, and bring the Gospel grace.

Save us in Thy great compassion,
O Thou mild, pacific Prince;
Give the knowledge of salvation,
Give the pardon of our sins.
By Thine all-redeeming merit
Every burdened soul release;
Every weary, wandering spirit
Guide into Thy perfect peace.
verses_yoruba:
Imole awon t'o joko
Leti ibebe iku,
Wa, jek' itansan ife Re
Tu okunkun aye ka;
Eleda orun oun aye,
La si okunkun eda,
Ki aimoye wa le kuro,'
Ki oju wa le riran.

A n reti dide Re sibe,
'Mole Re fun wa l'ayo
O le gbogbo eru wa lo,
O fi 'tunu f'okan wa;
Wa, f'oju 're Olorun han
Ti O fi ra wa pada;
Wa, Iwo Olugbala wa,
Mu 'hinrere wa fun wa.

Fi iyonu nla Re gba wa,
Olorun alaafia;
Jek'a mo adun igbala,
Dari ese wa ji wa,
Fi itoye irapada
Da okan ebi sile;
To gbogbo okan ti n sako
Si ona alaafia.

title_english: Rejoice, all ye believers
passage_english: AND AT MIDNIGHT A CRY WAS HEARD: 'BEHOLD, THE BRIDEGROOM IS COMING; GO OUT TO MEET HIM!. MATTHEW 25:6
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI O DI AARIN OGANJO, IGBE TA SOKE WIPE, WO! OKO IYAWO N BO, E JADE LO IPADE RE. MATT. 25:6
verses_english:
Rejoice, all ye believers,
And let your lights appear;
The ev'ning is advancing
And darker night is near.
The Bridegroom is arising,
And soon will He draw nigh;
Up, pray and watch and wrestle,
At midnight comes the cry.

See that your lamps are burning,
Replenish them with oil;
Look now for your salvation,
The end of earthly toil.
The watchers on the mountain
Proclaim the Bridegroom near;
Go meet Him as He cometh,
With Hallelujahs clear.

Ye wise and holy virgins,
Raise your voices higher,
Until in songs of triumph
They meet the angel choir.
The marriage feast is waiting,
The gates wide open stand:
Up up! Ye heirs of glory;
The Bridegroom is at hand.

Ye saints, who here in patience
Your cross and suff'rings bore,
Shall live and reign for ever,
When sorrow is no more:
Around the throne of glory
The Lamb ye shall behold,
In triumph cast before him
Your diadems of gold.

Our hope and expectation,
O Jesus, now appear:
Arise, Thou Sun, so long'd for,
O'er this benighted sphere:
With hearts and hands uplifted
We plead, O Lord, to see
The day of our redemption
That brings us unto Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Yo eyin onigbagbo,
Je k'imole yin tan;
Igba ale n bo tete,
Oru si fere de,
Oko iyawo dide
O fere sunmole,
Dide, gbadura; Sora
L'oru n'igbe yoo ta.

E be fitila yin wo,
F'ororo sinu Won;
E duro de 'gbala yin
Ipari 'se aye:
Awon oluso n wipe,
Oko 'yawo detan
E pade Re, b'O ti n bo
Pelu orin iyin.

Eyin wundia mimo,
Gbe ohun yin soke
Titi n'nu orin ayo
Pelu awon Angeli
Ounje iyawo se tan,
'Lekun naa si sile,
Dide, arole ogo,
Oko iyawo n bo.

Eyin ti e n fi suuru
Ru agbelebu yin,
E o si joba laelae,
'Gbati' ponju ba tan,
Yi ite ogo Re ka,
E o r'od'agutan,
E o f'ade ogo yin,
Lele niwaju re

Jesu, 'Wo ireti wa;
F'ara Re han fun wa;
'Wo Oorun t'ati n reti,
Ran s'ori ile wa,
A gbe owo wa s'oke
Oluwa je k'a ri
Ojo 'rapada aye
T'O mu wa d'odo Re.

title_english: Come, Thou long-expected Jesus
title_yoruba: Wa, iwo Jesu t'a n reti
passage_english: THE DESIRE OF ALL NATIONS SHALL COME HAGGAI 2:7
passage_yoruba: IFE GBOGBO ORILE-EDE YIO SI DE. HAGGAI 2:7
verses_english:
Come, Thou long-expected Jesus
Born to set Thy people free,
From our fears and sins release us,
Let us find our rest in Thee.

Israel's strength and consolation,
Hope of all the earth Thou art
Dear Desire of every nation,
Joy of every longing heart.

Born Thy people to deliver,
Born a child' and yet a king
Born to reign in us for ever
Now Thy gracious kingdom bring.

By Thine own eternal Spirit
Rule in all our hearts alone;
By Thine all-sufficient merit
Raise us to Thy glorious throne.
verses_yoruba:
Wa, iwo Jesu t'a n reti,
T'a bi lati da ni n'de,
Gba wa l'ow 'eru at'ese,
Je k'a ri isinmi Re.

Iwo ni itunu Israel',
Ireti Onigbagbo,
Ife gbogb'orile ede
Ayo okan ti n wona.

'Wo t'a bi lati gba wa la.
Omo ti a bi l'Oba,
Ti a bi lati joba lae,
Jeki ijoba Re de.

Fi Emi Mimo Re nikan
Se akoso aya wa;
Nipa itoye kikun Re,
Gbe wa s'ori ite Re

title_english: Light, that from the dark abyss
passage_english: I AM THE LIGHT OF THE WORLD. HE WHO FOLLOWS ME SHALL NOT WALK IN DARKNESS, BUT HAVE THE LIGHT OF LIFE. JOHN 8:12
passage_yoruba: EMI NI IMOLE AYE: ENITI O BA TELE MI KI YIO RIN NINU OKUNKUN, SUGBON YOO NI IMOLE. JOHANU 8:12
verses_english:
Light, that from the dark abyss
Madest all things, none amiss,
To share Thy beauty share Thy bliss
Come to us; come.

Light, that dost o'er all things reign,
Light that dost all life maintain;
O Light, that dost create again,
Come to us; come:

Light of men, that left the skies,
Light that look'd through human eyes,
And died in darkness as man dies
Come to us; come.

Light that stoop'd to rise and raise,
Soar'd to God above our gaze,
And still art with us all the days,
Come to us; come.

Light that makest manifest,
Beautifiest, hallowest,
Light in Thy joyous strength at rest,
Come to us come.

Leave us not to say we see,
While we shut our eyes to Thee,
Who knockest very patiently
Come to us come.

Works of darkness put away
With Thy harness us array
To walk in light and wait for day,
And Thee to come.

We have done great wrong to Thee,
Yet we do belong to Thee;
Oh make our life one song to Thee
Come to us come.

Come, in all the majesty
Of Thy great humility;
Come, the whole world cries out to Thee,
Come to us: come.
verses_yoruba:
Mole t'o da gbogbo nkan,
Ni pipe, lati n'okun,
K'a pin, n'n' ewa oun bukun Re,
Wa s'odo wa.

'Mole t'o joba aye,
'Mole t'o fun wa n'iye,
A! Imole t'o n s'atunda,
Wa s'odo wa.

Imole t'O wa s'aye
'Mole t'o n w'oju eda
T'o ku l'okunkun b'eniyan;
Wa s'odo wa.

'Mole t'o de 'po 'rele
T'o tun lo soke giga,
T'o si wa pelu wa sibe
Wa s'odo wa.

'Mole t'o n fun wa l'oye
'Mole t'o n se wa lewa,
Imole ti n f'ayo sinmi,
Wa s'odo wa.

Mase je k'a pe, ri,
'Gbat' a diju wa si O,
Enit'O n fi suru kankun
Wa s'odo wa.

Tire ni gbogbo 're wa
Tiwa ni gbogbo ibi;
Joo, le won kuro lodo Re
Wa s'odo wa.

Mu 'se okunkun kuro;
Di wa ni 'hamora Re,
K'a rin n'nu'mole k'a maa so
Atunwa Re.

Awa se O pupo ju,
Sibe, Tire l'awa se,
Je k'aye wa j'orin si O,
Wa s'odo wa.

Wa ninu Ola-nla Re
Ni titobi 'rele Re,
Wa, gbogbo aye n kepe O,
Wa s'odo wa.

title_english: O my brother sow a good seed
passage_english: BLESSED ARE YOU WHO SOW BESIDE ALL WATERS. ISAIAH 32:20
passage_yoruba: ALABUKUN, FUN NI EYIN TI N FONRUGBIN NIHA OMI GBOGBO. ISA. 32:20
verses_english:
O my brother sow a good seed
At the time of our seedlings
Labour in the names of Jesus
Until He comes back again.

The Saviour has now commanded
Us to work when it is day
O be prepared, night is coming
The farmer will soon be here.

Old and young are jointly saying
Thou art our helper O Lord
Make us to plant the seed of faith
Fruit to acceptance to reap.

The struggle for work will soon end
And its reward will soon come
If He now return in glory
He will tell us now to stop.
verses_yoruba:
Ara mi fun 'rugbin rere,
Nigba ifunrugbin wa,
Maa sise l'oruko Jesu,
Tit 'Oun o tun pada wa,

Olugbala pase wipe,
Sise nigbat'o j'osan;
Oru n bowa, mura giri,
Oloko fere de na.

T'agba t'ewe jumo ke, pe,
'Wo l'oluranlowo wa;
Mu ni funrugbin igbagbo,
K'a s'eso itewogba.

Laalaa ise fere d'opin,
Owo wa fe ba ere;
B'O de ninu olanla Re,
Yoo so fun wa pe, "Siwo".

title_english: Draw nigh, draw nigh, Emmanuel
passage_english: THE REDEEMER WILL COME TO ZIONISAIAH 59:20
passage_yoruba: OLURAPADA YIO SI WA SI SIONI. ISAIAH 59:20
verses_english:
Draw nigh, draw nigh, Emmanuel,
And ransom captive Israel,
That mourns in lonely exile here,
Until the Son of God appear,

Draw nigh, O Jesse's Rod, draw nigh
To free us from the enemy;
From hell's infernal pit to save,
And give us victory o'er the grave.

Draw nigh, Thou Dayspring, who shalt cheer
And comfort by Thine Advent here,
And banish far the brooding gloom
Of sinful night and endless doom.

Draw nigh, draw nigh, O David's Key,
The heavenly gate will ope'to Thee;
Make safe the way that leads on high,
And close the path to misery.

Draw nigh, draw nigh, O Lord of might,
Who to Thy tribes from Sina's height,
In ancient time didst give the law
In cloud, and majesty, and awe.
verses_yoruba:
Sunm'odo wa Emmanuel',
Wa ra Israeli pada,
T'o n sofo li oko eru,
Titi Jesu yoo tun pada.

Wa, opa Alade Jesse,
K'O gba wa l'owo ota wa,
Gba wa l'ow' orun apadi.
Fun wa ni 'segun l'ori 'ku.

Sunmo wa, 'Wo ila oorun,
Ki bibo Re se 'tunu wa,
Tu gbogbo isudede ka
M'ese ati egbe kuro.

Wa, Omo, 'lekun Dafidi,
'Lekun orun yoo si fun O
Tun ona orun se fun wa;
Joo se ona osi fun wa.

Sunmo wa Oluwa ipa,
T'o f'ofin fun eniyan Re,
Nigbani, l'or' oke Sinai,
'Nu eru at' agbara nla.

title_english: On Jordan's bank the Baptist's cry
passage_english: I WILL COME AGAIN. JOHN 14:3
passage_yoruba: EMI O SI TUN PADA. JOHANU 14:3
verses_english:
On Jordan's bank the Baptist's cry
Announces that the Lord is nigh;
Awake and hearken, for he brings
Glad tidings of the King of kings.

Then cleansed be every breast from sin;
Make straight the way for God within,
Prepare we in our hearts a home
Where such a mighty Guest may come.

For thou art our salvation, Lord,
Our refuge and our great reward;
Without thy grace we waste away
Like flowers that wither and decay.

To heal the sick stretch out thine hand,
And bid the fallen sinner stand;
Shine forth and let thy light restore
Earth's own true loveliness once more.

All praise, eternal Son, to thee,
Whose advent doth thy people free;
Whom with the Father we adore
And Holy Ghost for evermore.
verses_yoruba:
L 'eba odo Jordani ni
Onibaptisi n ke wipe
Oluwa n bo! Oluwa n bo,
E gbo 'hin ayo! Qba n bo!

K'ese tan ni gbogbo okan,
K'Olorun ba le ba wa gbe;
K'a pa ile okan wa mo
Ki alejo nla yii to de.

Jesu, iwo n'igbala wa,
Esan, ati alaabo wa,
B'itanna l'awa 'ba segbe
Bikose t'oore-ofe Re.

S'awotan awon alaisan,
Gb'elese t'o subu dide,
Tan 'mole Re ka 'bi gbogbo,
Mu ewa aye bo s'ipo.

K'a f' iyin f'Omo Olorun;
Bibo eni 'mu 'dande wa
Eni t'a n sin pelu Baba
At'Olorun Emi Mimo.

title_english: Thou judge of quick and dead
passage_english: TAKE YE HEED, WATCH AND PRAY. MARK 13:33
passage_yoruba: E MAA SORA, E SI MAA GBADURA. MARKU 13:33
verses_english:
Thou judge of quick and dead,
Before whose bar severe,
With holy joy, or guilty dread,
We all shall soon appear.
Our cautioned souls prepare
For that tremendous day,
And fill us now with watchful care,
And stir us up to pray.

To pray, and wait the hour,
That wondrous hour unknown,
When, robed in majesty and power,
Thou shalt from Heaven come down.
The immortal Son of Man,
To judge the human race,
With all Thy Father's dazzling train,
With all Thy glorious grace.

O may we thus be found
Obedient to His Word,
Attentive to the trumpet's sound,
And looking for our Lord!
O may we thus ensure
A lot among the blest;
And watch a moment to secure
An everlasting rest!
verses_yoruba:
Iwo Onidajo,
A fere duro na
Pelu ayo tabi eru
Ni waju ite Re;
Joo, pese okan wa
Fun ojo nlanla ni,
Fi emi irora kun wa
At'emi adura.

K'a maa wo ona Re
L'akoko aimo ni;
Nigbat' Iwo o sokale
Ninu Olanla Re
Iwo eni aiku,
Lati da wa lejo
T'iwo ti ogun Baba Re
At' oore-ofe Re.

K'a le ba wa bayii,
Nigboran s'oro Re
K'a maa teti s'ohun ipe,
K'a maa wo ona Re,
K'a wa ipo ayo
T'awon olubukun,
K'a si sora nigba die,
Fun sinmi ailopin.

title_english: The Great Judge now is come, He's come
passage_english: AND WE KNOW THAT THE SON OF GOD HAS COME. 1 JOHN 5:20
passage_yoruba: AWA MO PE OMO OLORUN DE. 1 JOHANU 5:20
verses_english:
The Great Judge now is come, He's come!
Thus the sound of the seventh trump
The lightening and the thunders strike,
How great shall be believers joy!

We hark the Angel sayeth thus,
That Christ Jesus our Lord is crowned,
With grace His girdle He gird on,
And with glory His face is veiled.

Though hath descendeth from Thine throne,
The reigns receiveth all for Thee
Thine reigns acceptable to all,
Receiveth as God conqueror.

Rejoice ye all the heav'ly host,
All ye of earth below rejoice,
Our Saviour Lord, glory hath earned.
Shall reign for ever and evermore.
verses_yoruba:
Onidajo naa de, O de!
Beeni 'pe keje ti n dun n wi,
Manamana n ko, ara n san,
Onigbagbo yoo ti yo to!

A gbo, Angeli orun n wipe,
Jesu Oluwa wa d' ade,
Oor'- ofe l' Oun fi damure,
Ogo l' Oun fi s' oso boju.

'Wo sokale lor' ite Re,
O gba ijoba fun 'ra Re;
Ijoba gbogbo gba Tire,
Won gba b' Oluwa t'o segun.

Gbogbo ara orun, e ho,
At' eniyan; Oluwa wa,
Oga ogo t' o gba ola
Yio joba lae ati lae.

title_english: The night is almost gone
passage_english: THE NIGHT IS FAR SPENT, THE DAY IS AT HAND. ROMANS 13:12
passage_yoruba: ORU BUKOJA TAN, OSAN KU SI DEDE. ROMU 13:12
verses_english:
The night is almost gone
The day is near at hand
The veil will soon be rent
That veils the Saviour's face
The huge clouds that cover our sight
Shall soon be swept off from our view.

Lift up your heads, for your
Salvation draweth nigh
See, the sun in splendour
Behold the sky grows bright
Ye saints of God, rejoice, be glad
The Lord our God will soon appear.

If men in mockery, laugh
If they would not believe
But, you believe His word
He cannot deceive you
And when the world will pass away
Ye shall behold His glory then.

The Lord has provided
For you a mansion bright
There is no sorrow there
But joy forever more
Ye saints of God, your joys begin
Ye shall soon hear the angels' voice
verses_yoruba:
B'eniyan n rerin yin,
Ti won ko fe gbagbo,
Eyin gb'oro Re gbo,
Oun ko le tan yin je
Nigbati aye ba koja,
Eyin o ri ogo Re naa.

title_english: Jesus cries out that ''I am come
passage_english: BEHOLD, I COME QUICKLY. REV. 22:7
passage_yoruba: KIYESII EMI N BO NISISIYII. IFIHAN 22:7
verses_english:
Jesus cries out that ''I am come
I am come with great love''
My heart in answer says come Lord
And bring salvation nigh.

Come, Thou and do Thy father's will
And glorify His name
Come, wake up Thy dead messengers
And quicken them once more.

Come, Thou amidst Thy glorious throng
And take Thy own title
And bring back our full assembly
All to surround Thy throne.

Our great Redeemer, come quickly
Make Thou the day draw near
Come quickly that our hearts faint not
When you tarry too long
verses_yoruba:
Jesu kigbe pe, 'Emi de,
T'emi ti ife nla"
Okan mi dahun pe, 'Maa bo,
K'o mu igbala wa.

Maa bo wa 'laarin ogun Re
Lati gb'oruko won;
K'o si m'ajo kikun pada
Lati y'ite Re ka.

Olurapada, wa kankan,
Mu ojo nla ni wa.
Wa, k'okan wa ma baa daku,
Nitori pipe Re.

title_english: Rejoice, the Lord is King
passage_english: REJOICE IN THE LORD ALWAYS: AND AGAIN I SAY, REJOICE. PHILIPPIANS 4:4
passage_yoruba: E MAA YO NINU OLUWA, NIGBAGBOGBO, MO SI TUN WI PE, E MAA YO. FILLIP 4:4
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ni Oba,
E bo Oluwa yin,
Eni kiku, sope,
Y'ayo 'segun titi,
Gb'okan at'ohun yin soke
"E yo", mo si tun wi, "E yo".

Olugbala joba,
Olorun otito,
'Gbat' O we 'se wa nu
O g'oke lo joko
Gb'okan at'ohun yin soke
"E yo", mo si tun wi, "E yo".

O n be lodo Baba
Titi gbogbo ota
Yoo teri won ba
Nipa ase Tire
Gb'okan at'ohun yin soke
"E yo", mo si tun wi, "E yo".

Yo, n'ireti ogo
Onidajo n bo wa,
Lati mu 'ranse Re
Lo 'le ayeraye.
Gb'okan at'ohun yin soke
"E yo, mo si tun wi, 'E yo.

title_english: All ye that abide in heav'n
title_yoruba: Eyin t'o n gb' oke orun
passage_english: WHO IS THIS KING OF GLORY? PSALMS 24:8
passage_yoruba: TANI OBA OGO YI? ORIN DAFIDI. 24:8.
verses_english:
All ye that abide in heav'n
Who is the King of glory?
Who is the greatest in heav'n
That has all omnipotence.

The Lamb is Jesus only
Who call'd the title His own
Our Saviour is on the throne
And He is the glorious King.

Great tidings, Jesus is King
He alone now reign supreme
Come to Him with Thy offering
And bow down before His face.

When the world tends to scorn thee
Teach them how to serve the Lord
Angels rejoice at His name
All the hosts of heav'n serve Him.

Thou whom angels serve we praise
Thou that is the Lamb of God
Be Thou for ever more reign
Thou art worthy to be king.
verses_yoruba:
Eyin t'o n gb' oke orun
E so 'Ta l'Oba ogo?
Ta l'o ga julo nibe?
T'o si l'agbara gbogbo?

Od'agutan nikan ni,
L'o pe oye naa ni t'Oun;
Oun l'o wa lori ite,
Oun si ni Oba ogo.

Ihin nla! Jesu l'Oba,
Oun nikan l' Osi joba;
W'odo Re t'eyin t'ore
E wole niwaju Re.

Je k'aye k'O rerin Re,
Je ki won ko lati sin;
Angel n yo l'oruko Re,
Gbogbo eda orun n sin.

A yin O, 'Wo t'Angel' n sin
Od'Agutan Olorun,
Maa joba titi laelae,
Oba ye O, Oluwa.

title_english: Lo! He comes, with clouds descending
passage_english: BEHOLD, HE COMETH WITH CLOUDS. REVELATION 1:7
passage_yoruba: KIYESI I, O N BO NINU AWOSANMA. IFIHAN 1:7
verses_english:
Lo! He comes, with clouds descending,
once for our sinners slain;
thousand thousand saints attending
swell the triumph of His train:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
Amen.

Every eye shall now behold Him,
robed in dreadful majesty;
those who set at nought and sold him,
pierced, and nailed him to the tree,
deeply wailing (3ce)
shall the true Lord see.

Now redemption, long expected,
see in solemn pomp appear;
all his saints, by man rejected,
now shall meet him in the air:
Hallelujah! Hallelujah! Hallelujah!
See the day of God appear!
verses_yoruba:
Wo! Oluwa l'awosanma,
O n bo l'ogo, l'ola Re,
Eni t'a pa fun elese.
N bo pelu Angeli Re;
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Amin.

Gbogbo eda, wa wo Jesu,
Aso ogo l'a wo fun un;
Awon t'o gan an, awon t'o paa
T'o kan mo agbelebu.
Won o sokun,
Bi won ba ri Oluwa.

Erekusu, okun, oke
Orun, aye, a fo lo,
Awon t'o ko a da won ru,
Nigbati won gbohun Re,
Wa s'idajo,
Wa s'idajo, wa kalo!

Irapada t'a ti n reti,
O de pelu ogo Re;
Awon ti a gan pelu Re
Y'o pade Re loj' orun!
Halleluya! Halleluya!
Ojo Olugbala de.

title_english: Great God, what do I see and hear?
passage_english: THE TIME OF THE DEAD, THAT THEY SHOULD BE JUDGED. REVELATION 11:18
passage_yoruba: IGBA AWON OKU DE TI AO DA WON LEJO. IFIHAN 11:18
verses_english:
Great God, what do I see and hear?
The end of things created;
The Judge of mankind doth appear
On clouds of glory seated.
The trumpet sounds; the graves restore
The dead which they contained before:
Prepare, my soul, to meet Him.

The dead in Christ shall first arise
At that last trumpet's sounding,
Caught up to meet Him in the skies,
With joy their Lord surrounding.
No gloomy fears their souls dismay;
His presence sheds eternal day
On those prepared to meet Him.

But sinners, filled with guilty fears,
Behold His wrath prevailing,
For they shall rise and find their tears
And sighs are unavailing;
The day of grace is past and gone;
They trembling stand before his throne,
All unprepared to meet Him.

O Christ, who diedst and yet dost live,
To me impart Thy merit;
My pardon seal, my sins forgive,
And cleanse me by Thy Spirit.
Beneath Thy cross I view the day
When heav'n and earth shall pass away,
And thus prepare to meet Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun! Kinni mo ri yii!
Opin de f'ohun gbogbo!
Onidajo araye yo,
O gun wa n'ite 'dajo,
Ipe dun, iboji si tu,
Gbogbo awon oku sile,
Mura, lo koo, okan mi.

Oku'nu Krist yoo ko jinde
Nigba 'pe keyin ba dun,
Won o lo koo l'awosanma,
Won o fi ayo yii ka;
Ko s'eru ti yoo b'okan won;
Oju Re da imole bo
Awon ti o mura dee.

Sugbon elese t'oun t'eru!
Ni gbigbona 'binu Re,
Won o dide, won o si rii
Pe, o se, won ko baa mo;
Ojo oore-ofe koja;
Won n gbon niwaju 'te 'dajo,
Awon ti ko mura dee.

Olorun, kinni mo ri yii!
Opin de f'ohun gbogbo!
Onidajo araye yo,
O gunwa n'ite 'dajo,
L'ese agbelebu mo n wo,
Gbat' ohun gbogbo yoo koja,
Bayii ni mo n mura dee.

title_english: The great judge is coming
passage_english: EVERY EYE SHALL SEE HIM. REVELATION 1:7
passage_yoruba: GBOGBO OJU NI YOO RII. IFIHAN 1:7
verses_english:
The great judge is coming
The dead all, shall arise
No one may try to escape yet
From the light of His face.

His holy, righteous lips
It shall condemn all those
Who turned and spurned His great mercy
And practise wickedness.

Depart and go from me
To everlasting hell
That was prepared for the devil
Who rebelled against me.

Thou hast waited too long
The day is drawing nigh
When earth and heav'n shall fly away
And melt at His coming
verses_yoruba:
Onidajo n bo wa,
Awon oku jinde,
Enikan ko le yo kuro
'Nu mole oju Re.

Enu ododo Re
Yio da ebi fun
Awon t'o so aanu Re nu;
Ti won se buburu.

'Lo kuro l'odo mi
S'ina 'ti ko l'opin
Ti ati pese fun Esu
T'o ti n sote si mi

Iwo ti duro to!
Ojo naa o n bo wa,
T'aye at'orun o fo lo
Kuro ni wiwa Re.

title_english: Day of judgement! Day of wonders!
passage_english: FOR THE HOUR IS COMING, IN THE WHICH ALL THAT ARE IN THE GRAVES SHALL HEAR HIS VOICE. JOHN 5:28
passage_yoruba: WAKATI N BO, NINU EYITI GBOGBO AWON TI O WA NI ISA OKU YOO GBO OHUN RE, WON O SI JADE WA. JOHANU 5:28
verses_english:
Day of judgement! Day of wonders!
Hark! the trumpet's awful sound,
Louder than a thousand thunders,
Shakes the vast creation round:
How the summons, how the summons
Will the sinner's heart confound!

See the Judge, our nature wearing,
Clothed in majesty divine;
Ye who love the Lord's appearing
Then shall say, ?This God is mine!?
Gracious Saviour, gracious Saviour,
Own me on that day as Thine.

At His call the dead awaken,
Rise to life from earth and sea;
All the powers of nature, shaken,
At His call prepare to flee:
Careless sinner, careless sinner,
What will then become of thee?

The devil that deceives thee now
Listen thou not unto him
When these riches shall pass away
It shall find thee in the fire
My friend, think thou,
Of thy place in burning hell.

Under affliction and mockery
Let this word thy counsel be
The day of the Lord comes quickly
Then our tears will turn to joy.
We shall conquer
When the world shall be on fire.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo 'dajo, ojo eru!
Gbo bi ipe ti n dun to!
O ju egbaarun ara lo
O si n mi gbogbo aye.
Bi esun naa, Bi esun naa
Yoo ti damu elese!

Wo Onidajo l'awo wa,
T'o wo ogo nla l'aso.
Gbogbo won ti n wo ona Re.
'Gbanaa ni won o maa yo
Olugbala, Olugbala,
Jewo mi ni ijo naa.

Ni pipe Re o ku o ji
Lat' okun, ile s'ile:
Gbogbo ipa aye yoo mi,
Won o salo loju Re.
Alaironu, Alaironu,
Yoo ha ti ri fun o?

Esu n tan o nisisiyi,
Iwo ma se gbo tire,
'Gbati oro yi koja tan,
Yoo ri o ninu ina;
Iwo ronu, Iwo ronu,
Ipo re ninu ina!

Labe iponju, at'egan,
K' eyii gba o n' iyanju;
Ojo Olorun n bo tete,
'Gbanaa ekun yoo d'ayo,
A o segun
Gbati aye ba gbina.

title_english: Lift up your heads, eternal gates!
passage_english: THE LORD OF HOSTS, HE IS THE KING OF GLORY. PSALM 24:10
passage_yoruba: OLUWA AWON OMO-OGUN, OUN NAA LI OBA OGO. ORIN DAFIDI 24:10
verses_english:
Lift up your heads, eternal gates!
Unfold, to entertain
The King of glory; see! He comes,
With His celestial train.
Who is this King of glory—who?
The Lord, for strength renowned;
In battle mighty; o'er His foes
Eternal Victor crowned.

Lift up your heads, ye gates! unfold
In state to entertain
The King of glory; see! He comes
With all His shining train.
Who is this King of glory—who?
The Lord of hosts renowned:
Of glory He alone is King,
Who is with glory crowned.
verses_yoruba:
Gbe ori yin s 'oke, eyin
'Lekun ayeraye,
Gba Oba ogo, woo, o n bo,
Pel 'ogun orun Re
Ta l' Oba Ogo yii? Taani?
Oluwa t'O n 'ipa,
T'o l' agbara l' ori 'ota Re
Asegun Alade,

Gbe ori yin si oke, eyin
'Lekun lati gba,
Oba Ogo; e woo, o n bo,
Pel' ogun didan Re:
Ta l' Oba Ogo yii? Taani?
Oluwa t'o n' ipa
L'ogo Oun nikan li Oba,
T'a f'ogo de l'ade.

title_english: Christians, awake, salute the happy morn
title_yoruba: Ji, 'wo Kristian, k'o ko oro ayo
passage_english: BEHOLD, I BRING YOU GOOD TIDINGS OF GREAT JOY. LUKE 2:10
passage_yoruba: SA WO O, MO MU IHIN-RERE AYO NLA FUN YIN WA. LUKU 2:10
verses_english:
Christians, awake, salute the happy morn
Whereon the Saviour of the world was born.
Rise to adore the mystery of love
Which hosts of angels chanted from above;
With them the joyful tidings first begun
Of God incarnate and the Virgin's Son.

Then to the watchful shepherds it was told,
Who heard the angelic herald's voice: Behold,
I bring good tidings of a Saviour's birth
To you and all the nations upon earth;
This day hath God fulfilled His promised word,
This day is born a Saviour, Christ the Lord.

He spake; and straightway the celestial choir
In hymns of joy, unknown before, conspire,
The praises of redeeming love they sang,
And heaven's whole orb with hallelujahs rang;
God's highest glory was their anthem still,
Peace upon earth, and unto men goodwill.
verses_yoruba:
Gbanaa l'a ran akede Angeli;
T'o so f'awon olus'agutan pe,
'Mo mu 'hinrere Olugbala wa
T'a bi fun yin ati gbogbo aye,
Olorun mu l'eri Re se loni
A bi Olugbala, Kristi' Oluwa.

Bi akede Angeli naa ti so tan,
Opolopo ogun orun si de;
Won n korin ayo t'eti ko gbo ri,
Orun si ho fun 'yin Olorun pe,
Ogo ni f'Olorun l'oke orun,
Alaafia at'ife s'eniyan.

O ye k'awa k'o maa roo l'okan wa
Ife na t'Olorun nis' araiye,
K'a si ro t'omo naa t'a bi loni
T'o wa jiya oro agbelebu;
Ki awa si tele lana Re,
Titi a o fi de 'bugbe l'oke.

title_english: Hear the chorus of the angels
passage_english: TO PREACH GOOD TIDINGS TO THE POOR; HEAL THE BROKENHEARTED, TO PROCLAIM LIBERTY TO THE CAPTIVES, ISAIAH 61:1
passage_yoruba: LATI WASU IHINRERE FUN AWON OTOSI, LATI SE AWOTAN AWON ONIROBINUJE OKAN, LATI KEDE IDASILE FUN AWON IGBEKUN. ISAIAH. 61:1.
verses_english:
Hear the chorus of the angels
That sound around the world
Saviour is born into the world
He becomes Son of man.

Lord Jesus Christ is born truly
Unto all human race
To save us from the satan's pow'r
And from perdition way.

All the hosts of heaven appear'd
To view the coming light
Glory to God in the highest
And unto men be peace.

How 'tis to know how difficult
His throne in heav'n to leave
To drink the cup of agony
For redemption of men.

Let us give praises to our Lord
For His great love to us
He sent th' only begotten Son
Into this world of woe.

Thou Son of God that's born today
For the peace of the world
Abide with us Lord, with Thy grace
And the joy of thy birth.
verses_yoruba:
Gbo iro orin angeli
Ti n dun yi aye ka;
A bi Olugbala s'aye
Om'Olorun d'eeyan.

A bi Olugbala looto
Fun gbogbo agbaye;
Lati da wa n'de low'esu
Kuro ninu egbe.

Opo ogun orun si yo
Fun 'Mole to de yii,
Ogo f'Olorun lok'orun,
Alaafia f'eeyan.

A ha mo b'o ti soro to
Lati f'ite sile,
Lati mu aago kikoro
Fun 'rapada eeyan!

E fi ope fun Olorun
Fun ife nlanla yii
To ran Omo Re kansoso
Wa s'aye osi yii.

'Wo Omo naa t'a bi loni
F'alaafia fun aye,
F'oore-ofe Re ba wa gbe
At'ayo ibi Re

title_english: Peace on earth goodwill unto men
passage_english: AND ON EARTH PEACE, GOODWILL TOWARD MEN!" LUKE 2:14
passage_yoruba: A TI LI AYE ALAFIA; IFE INU RERE SI ENIYAN. LUKU. 2:14.
verses_english:
Peace on earth goodwill unto men
Was the song of the angels
Shepherd abiding in the field
Heard, and herald Jesus birth.

'T was upon the mount of Judea
There was great light of stars seen
To guide the wise men on their way
To look for this precious gift.

And the three wise men saw the light
As it was shown unto them
To the child they brought precious gifts
Gold silver and Frankincense.

By the manger where Jesus laid
They fell and worshipp'd their King
In humble they offer'd their gifts
To Him that brought salvation.

Our Lord Jesus is born newly
As the year is passing by
In the heart of all His children
As foretold by the angels.

Behold we see the star newly
Like the time of Jesus birth
May His blessing be upon us
As the year is passing by.
verses_yoruba:
Alaafia f'aye at'eeyan
L'orin t'awon angel ko;
Awon Olusaguntan gbo
T'ikede ibi Kristi.

Ni ori oke Judea
N'imole 'rawo nla tan
Lati s'amona fun awon
Ti n wa ebun 'yanu yii.

Awon amoye meta ni
Ri imole nlanla naa;
Won mu ebun wa f'Omo naa,
Wura, turari, ojia.

Leba ibuje eran naa
Won juba fun Oba won,
N'irele won f'ebun lele
F'eni to mu 'gbala wa.

Bi odun ti n yi lu odun
L'a tun n bi Krist' ni titun
N'nu okan awon omo Re,
B'angeli ti so tele.

A n ri 'rawo naa nisisiyi
B'akoko t'abi Kristi;
Ki 'bukun Kristi je tire
B'odun ti nyi lu odun.

title_english: All thanks to Thee Almighty God
passage_english: FOR THERE IS BORN TO YOU THIS DAY, WHO IS CHRIST THE LORD. LUKE 2:11
passage_yoruba: A BI OLUGBALA FUN YIN LONI TI ISE KRISTI OLUWA. LUKU. 2:11.
verses_english:
All thanks to Thee Almighty God
For sending Thy son to us
Let the whole world be filled with joy
For the child born on this day.

All thanks to Thee, Almighty God
For thy great love upon us
Thou hast sent the Saviour to us
On this day as we rejoice.

Let all the seeds of the forest
Cocoa, Palm tree and Rubber
All the hidden treasures of ground
Give praises unto our King.

Let all fishes in the Ocean
And all the birds of the air
Let all the beasts of the forest
Now give praises to our Lord.

As we are rejoicing today
We beseech Thee Trinity
Give us, that we may adore Thee
And the coming year to praise.
verses_yoruba:
A f'ope fun Olorun wa
To ran Omo Re w'aye;
K'ayo gba gbogbo aye kan
F'omo naa t'a bi loni.

A fope fun Olorun wa
Fun 'fe nla to ni si wa;
O ran Olugbala w'aye,
Lojo oni awa n yo.

Ki gbogb' eso inu igbo,
Koko, ope oun roba,
Gbogbo isura 'nu ile
Ba wa f'iyin f'Oba wa.

Je ki eja inu ibu
At'eye oju orun,
Ki gbogbo eranko igbe,
Wa f'iyin f'Oluwa wa.

Bi a ti n se ti odun yii,
A n be O, Metalokan,
Je k'a le wa f'iyin fun O
Niwoyi odun to n bo.
chorus_english:
Shout and rejoice, all ye people
Let us praise our mighty God
Shout and rejoice, ye believers
Let our souls be fill'd with joy.
chorus_yoruba:
E ho, e yo, gbogbo' eeyan,
E fiyin f'Olorun wa,
E ho, e yo, onigbagbo;
K'iyin gba okan wa kan.

title_english: While shepherds watched their flocks by night
passage_english: FOR UNTO YOU IS BORN THIS DAY IN THE CITY OF DAVID A SAVIOUR, WHICH IS CHRIST THE LORD. LUKE 2:11
passage_yoruba: NITORI A BI OLUGBALA FUN YIN LONI NI ILU DAFIDI TI I SE KRISTI OLUWA. LUKU 2:11
verses_english:
While shepherds watched their flocks by night,
All seated on the ground,
The angel of the Lord came down,
And glory shone around.

"Fear not," said he, for mighty dread
Had seized their troubled minds;
"Glad tidings of great joy I bring
To you and all mankind.

"To you, in David's town, this day,
Is born of David's line
A Savior, who is Christ the Lord;
And this shall be the sign.

The heavenly Babe you there shall find
To human view displayed,
All meanly wrapped in swaddling-clothes
And in a manger laid."

Thus spake the seraph and forthwith
Appeared a shining throng
Of angels, praising God, and thus
Addressed their joyful song:

"All glory be to God on high,
And to the earth be peace;
Good will henceforth from Heaven to men
Begin and never cease."
verses_yoruba:
Bi awon olus'agutan
Ti ns'agbo won l'oru;
Angel' Oluwa sokale,
Ogo ran yi won ka.

Eru ba won pupo, sugbon
O ni - E ma beru,
Ihin ayo ni mo mu wa
Fun yin at'araye.

Fun yin n'lu Dafidi, loni,
N'idile Dafidi,
A bi Olugbala ti I se
Kristi, Oluwa wa;

Eyii ni yoo j'ami-Eyin
O ri om-Owo naa,
A fi oja wee, a si te e,
Si ibuje eran.

Bi angel' naa ti soro tan
Opo awon angel'
Fo de, won si nyin Olorun
Won n korin ayo pe.

Ogo ni f'Olorun loke
Alaafia l'aye,
K'ife 'nu rere s'eniyan
Bere, laini opin.

title_english: Awake, awake all nations
passage_english: AND THE WORD WAS MADE FLESH, AND DWELT AMONG US. JOHN 1:14
passage_yoruba: ORO NAA SI DI ARA, OUN SI MBA WA GBE. JOHANU 1:14
verses_english:
Awake, awake all nations
No longer slumber on
Our light of lights supernal
Now makes its rays appear
The sun gives natural light
Christ illuminates the heart
Must the hope of our fathers
Dawn upon us in vain?

He comes from sin to set free
And darkness to dispel
Rejoice Christ's kingdom bring us
A great era of peace
To him let's bring our offerings
Of worship, love and praise
Wise men brought gifts from afar
Shall we not give our hearts.

Let us give our hearts to Him
Let us be enthroned there
Surrender all to Jesus
Be subject to His will,
Rejoice! again rejoice,
For Christ the Lord is come,
For the riches and the poor,
Our Lord Jesus is come.
verses_yoruba:
E ji, eyin, eniyan
E ma se sun titi;
A! Imole wa nlanla
Oun li o yo de yii.
Oorun n'imole ara,
Jesu ni ti Okan?
Ireti awon baba
Yio ha de lasan?

O de k'ewon ese tu
O de k'okunkun lo;
E yo, ijoba Jesu
O ni rorun pupo,
E je k'a mu ore wa
K'a juba Oba wa
Awon amoye mu wa
A ki o mu wa bi?

Je k'a fi Okan wa fun un,
K'o te 'te Re sibe;
K'a fi ohun gbogbo fun un,
K'a si se ife Re.
E yo! E yo! E tun yo!
Jesu Oluwa de
F'otosi at'oloro,
Kristi Oluwa de.

title_english: Angels from the realms of glory
passage_english: AND ARE COME TO WORSHIP HIM. MATT. 2:2
passage_yoruba: AWA WA LATI FORIBALE FUN UN. MATT. 2:2
verses_english:
Saints, before the altar bending,
Watching long with hope and fear,
Suddenly the Lord, descending,
In His temple shall appear;
Come and worship, Come and worship,
Worship Christ, the new-born King.

Sinners, wrung with true repentance;
doomed for guilt to endless pains,
Justice now revokes the sentence,
Mercy calls you; break your chains,
Just come and worship, just come and worship,
Worship Christ, the new-born King.

All creation, join in praising
God, the Father, Spirit, Son,
Evermore your voices raising,
To th 'Eternal three in one,
Just come and worship, just come and worship,
Worship Christ, the King of glory.
verses_yoruba:
Eyin Angeli l'orun ogo,
To yi gbogbo aye ka;
E ti korin dida aye,
E so ti 'bi Mesaiah
E wa josin, E wa josin
Fun Kristi Oba titun.

Eyin Oluso-aguntan
Ti nso eran yin loru,
Emmanueli wa ti de,
Irawo Omo naa tan.
E wa josin, E wa josin
Fun Kristi Oba titun.

Onigbagbo ti n teriba
Ni 'beru, at'ireti,
L'ojiji l'Oluwa o de
Ti yoo mu yin re 'le.
E wa josin, E wa josin,
Fun Kristi Oba titun.

Elese 'wo alaironu
Elebi ati egbe
Ododo Olorun duo
Aanu n pe o, pa 'wa da
Sa wa josin, Sa wa josin,
Fun Kristi Oba titun.

Gbogbo eda e fo f'ayo
Jesu Olugbala de,
Anfaani miran ko si mo,
B'eyi ba fo yin koja,
N je, e wa sin, N je e wa josin
Sin Kristi Oba ogo.

title_english: Christians lift your voice in Praises
passage_english: WE WILL REJOICE AND BE GLAD IN IT. PS. 118:24
passage_yoruba: AWA O MAA YO, INU WA YOO SI MAA DUN. ORIN DAFIDI 118:24
verses_english:
Christians lift your voice in Praises
On this memorable day
Hear the voices of the angels
Singing praises to our God
Singing praises, Singing praises
Peace on the earth goodwill to men.

Let the whole earth now sing praises
To the glorious Lord and King
The begotten son of father
Who is born of virgin's birth?
Wonderful Lord, Wonderful Lord
Is the saviour born today.

In the midst of chaos and danger
And the evils of the world
In the distraction of our sins
The son of God come to save
The Counselor, The Counselor
Jesus Christ the prince of peace.

Almighty and most gracious Lord
Born today as newly babe
Father, who is everlasting
Now our controller to be
O be joyful, O be joyful
The son of David now reings.

He has come to save us from sin
Our Advocator to be
Satan's Chain the lord hath broken
He is made the glorious being
Therefore rejoice, Therefore rejoice
We are now sav'd from the death.
verses_yoruba:
Onigbagbo, e bu s'ayo,
Ojo nla l'eyii fun wa;
E gbo bi awon Angeli
Ti n f'ogo fun Olorun:
Alaafia, Alaafia
Ni fun gbogbo eniyan.

Ki gbogbo aye ho f'ayo,
K'a f'ogo fun Olorun,
Omo bibi Re l'o fun wa
T'a bi ninu wundia:
En' Iyanu, En' Iyanu
Ni Omo t'a bi loni.

Ninu gbogbo rudurudu,
Ohun ibi t'o kun aye,
Ninu idamu nla ese
L'Om' Olorun wa gba wa:
Olugbimo, Olugbimo,
Alade Alaafia.

Olorun Olodumare
L'a bi, bi omo titun;
Baba! Eni ayeraye
L'o di alakoso wa:
E bu s'ayo, E bu s'ayo,
Omo Dafidi joba.

O wa gba wa lowo ese,
O wa d'onigbowo wa
Lati fo itegun Esu
A se ni Oga ogo:
E ku ayo, E ku ayo,
A gba wa lowo iku.

title_english: The happy day at last has dawned
passage_english: BEHOLD, I BRING YOU GOOD TIDINGS OF GREAT JOY. LUKE 2:10
passage_yoruba: MO MU IHIN AYO NLANLA FUN YIN WA. LUKU 2:10
verses_english:
The happy day at last has dawned
Long awaited by all kindred
When the promised Saviour appears
Here on earth in human form.

Shepherds in the fields abiding
Watching over their flocks by night
First e'er, the glad tidings were told
Glad tidings of the Saviour's birth.

Angel's God's ministering spirits
Who came in shining white app'rel
Brought to them the blessed message,
The true, glad tidings of great joy.

A mighty dread had seized their mind
Because of this strange sight they saw
''Fear not'' was the comforting words
That came from the angelic lips.

Christ the Saviour is born today
Yet Christ the Lord on earth is He
In David's city is He born
In a humble manger forlon.

`All glory be to God on high`
Will be the chorus by all clime
For his tender and endless love
That to a world in need brought peace
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ayo nlanla naa de,
Eyii t' araye ti n reti;
Nigbat' Olugbala w'aye
Nigbat' a bi ninu ara.

Olusaguntan ni papa
Bi won ti n so aguntan won,
Ni ihin ayo naa ko ba.
Ihin bibi Olugbala.

Angel iranse Oluwa
L'aran si won, alabunkun,
Pelu ogo t'o tan julo,
Lati so ihin ayo yii.

Gidigidi l'eru ba won,
Fun ajeji iran nla yii;
"Ma beru" l'oro nla yii
T'o t'enu Angeli naa wa.

A bi Olugbala l'oni,
Kristi Oluwa aye yii;
N'ilu nla Dafidi l'o wa,
N'ibuje eran l'a te si.

"Ogo fun Olorun" l'o rin
Ti eniyan yoo ko s'orun:
Fun ife Re laini opin,
T'o mu alaafia w'aye.

title_english: Millions groping yet in darkness
passage_english: A LIGHT TO LIGHTEN THE GENTILES. LUKE 2:32
passage_yoruba: IMOLE LATI MOLE SI AWON KEFERI. LUKU 2:32.
verses_english:
Millions groping yet in darkness
Think, my heart and be thou still!
Each of God's own promise tells us
Of a glorious happy morn
Day of gladness, day of gladness,
May that day dawn on me soon.

Let all India and Africa
Men of different tribes and creed
Know the great and glorious vict'ry
Freely giv'n on Calvary
May the Gospel, may the Gospel,
Be proclaimed from shore to shore.

All the kingdoms yet in darkness
Send the gospel light to them
From the sunrise to the sunset
May the light dispel the gloom
May Redemption, may Redemption,
Freely bestowed have full sway.

March on, March on blessed Gospel
March on to full victory
May Thy everlasting kingdom
Multiply and never cease,
Blessed Saviour, blessed Saviour,
Come and reign all o'er the earth
verses_yoruba:
Wo! gbogbo ile okunkun,
Wo! okan mi, duro je:
Gbogbo ileri ni n so
T'ojo ayo t'o l'ogo;
Ojo ayo, ojo ayo,
K'owuro re yara de!

Ijoba t'o wa l'okunkun,
Jesu, tan 'mole fun won
Lat' ila-oorun de 'wo re,
K'imole le okun lo;
K'irapada, k'irapada.
Ti a gba l'ofe bori.

Maa tan lo 'wo ihinrere,
Maa segun lo, ma duro,
K'ijoba Re ayeraye
Maa bi si, k'o si maa re;
Olugbala, Olugbala,
Wa joba gbogbo aye.

title_english: HARK! the herald-angels sing
passage_english: FOR UNTO US A CHILD IS BORN. ISAIAH 9:6
passage_yoruba: NITORI A BI OMO KAN FUN WA. ISAIAH 9:6
verses_english:
HARK! the herald-angels sing,
Glory to the new-born King,
Peace on earth, and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled.
Joyful, all ye nations, rise,
Join the triumph of the skies;
With angelic host proclaim,
Christ is born in Bethlehem.

Mild, he lays his glory by,
Born that man no more may die,
Born to raise the sons of earth,
Born to give them second birth:
Come, desire of nations, come,
Fix in us thy humble home;
Rise, the woman's conquering seed,
Bruise in us the serpent's head.

Adam's likeness, Lord, efface,
Stamp Thy image in its place.
O, to all thyself impart,
Form'd in each believing heart.
Glory to the new-born king
All creature joyfully sing
Peace on earth and mercy mild,
God and sinners reconciled.
verses_yoruba:
Gbo eda orun n korin:
'Ogo fun Oba t'a bi.
Alaafia laiye yii,
Olorun ba wa laja,
Gbogbo eda, n de layo,
Dapo mo hiho orun,
W' Alade alaafia!
Woo' Oorun ododo de.

O bo 'go Re sapaka,
A bi k'eniyan ma ku,
A bi ko gb' eniyan ro,
A bi k'O le tun wa bi,
Wa, Ireti eniyan!
Se ile Re ninu wa,
N' de, iru omobinrin,
Bori Esu ninu wa.

Pa aworan Adam run,
F' aworan Re s' ipo Re;
Joo, masai f' Emi Re kun
Okan gbogb' onigbagbo.
"Ogo fun Oba t' a bi,"
Je ki gbogbo wa gberin,
"Alaafia l'aye yii,"
Olorun ba wa laja.

title_english: Songs of praise the angels sang
passage_english: GLORY TO GOD IN THE HIGHEST. LUKE 2:14
passage_yoruba: OGO NI FUN OLORUN LOKE ORUN. LUKU 2:14
verses_english:
Songs of praise the angels sang,
Heaven with alleluyas rang,
When creation was begun,
When God spoke and it was done.

Songs of praise awoke the morn
When the Prince of Peace was born;
Songs of praise arose when He
Captive led Captivity.

Heaven and earth must pass away,
Songs of praise shall crown that day;
God will make new heavens and earth,
Songs of praise shall hail their birth.

And will man alone be dumb
Till that glorious kingdom come?
No, the Church delights to raise
Psalms and hymns and songs of praise.

Saints below, with heart and voice,
Still in songs of praise rejoice,
Learning here by faith and love
Songs of praise to sing above.

Borne upon their latest breath,
Songs of praise shall conquer death;
Then amidst eternal joy,
Songs of praise their powers employ.
verses_yoruba:
'Gba Jehofa da aye,
'Gbat' o Soro t'o si se
Awon Angeli n korin
Halleluya gb'orun kan.

Orin 'yin l'a ko l'ooro
Gbat' a bi Olugbala;
Orin'yin ni a si ko
Nigbat' o digbekun lo.

'Gbat' aye yoo koja lo,
Iyin o gb'ojo naa kan;
'Gbat' a o d'aye titun,
Orin iyin l'a o ko.

Awa o ha dake bi?
Titi joba naa o de?
Beeko! Ijo o maa ko
Orin mimo at'iyin.

Eniyan mimo l'aye,
N f' ayo korin iyin naa;
Nipa 'gbagbo ni won n ko,
Bi won o ti ko o l'oke.

Nigba emi o ba pin
Orin ni o segun 'ku;
Ninu ayo ailopin
Won o maa korin titi.

title_english: Joy to the world! The Lord is come
passage_english: THE LORD REIGNS. PSALMS 97:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA JOBA ORIN DAFIDI 97:1.
verses_english:
No more let sins and sorrows grow,
Nor thorns infest the ground;
He comes to make His blessings flow
Far as the curse is found, (2ce)
Far as, far as the curse is found.

He rules the world with truth and grace,
And makes the nations prove
The glories of His righteousness
And wonders of His love (2ce)
And wonders, and wonders of His love.
verses_yoruba:
Ayo b'aye! Oluwa de,
K'aye gba Oba re?
Ki gbogbo okan mura de,
K'aye korin s'oke (2x),
K'aye K'aye korin s'oke

Ayo b'aye! Jesu joba,
E je k'a ho fayo,
Gbogbo igbe, omi, oke,
Won n gberin ayo naa (2x),
Won n gbe, Won n gberin ayo naa.

K'ese oun 'yonu pin l'aye,
K'egun ye hu n'ile,
O de lati mu 'bukun san,
De 'bi t'egun gbe wa (2x),
De 'bi, De 'bi t'egun gbe wa.

O f'ooto at'ife joba,
O je k'oril 'ede
Mo, ododo ijoba Re,
At'ife 'yanu Re (2x),
At'ife, At'ife 'yanu Re

title_english: Joy fills our inmost heart today!
passage_english: AND THEY SHALL CALL HIS NAME EMMANUEL. MATT. 1:23
passage_yoruba: WON A MA PE ORUKO RE NI EMMANUELI. MATT. 1:23
verses_english:
Joy fills our inmost heart today!
The Royal Child is born:
And Angel hosts in glad array
His Advent keep this morn.

Low at the cradle Throne we bend,
We wonder and adore;
And feel no bliss can ours transcend,
No joy was sweet before.

For us the world must lose its charms
Before the manger-shrine,
When, folded in Thy Mother's arms,
We see Thee, Babe Divine.

Thou Light of uncreated Light,
Shine on us, Holy Child:
That we may keep Thy Birthday bright,
With service undefiled.
verses_yoruba:
Ayo kun okan wa loni,
A bi omo Oba!
Opo awon ogun orun
N so ibi Re loni!

A wole n'ibuje eran,
N'iyanu l'a josin,
Ibukun kan ko ta 'yi yo,
Ko s'ayo bi eyii.

Aye ko n'adun fun wa mo
'Gbati a ba n wo O
L'owo Wundia iya Re,
'Wo Omo Iyanu.

Imole lat'inu 'Mole,
Tan 'mole s'ookun wa!
K'a le maa fi isin mimo
Se 'ranti ojo Re.
chorus_english:
Rejoice, rejoice! The Incarnate WORD
Has come on earth to dwell;
No sweeter sound than this is heard?
Emmanuel!
chorus_yoruba:
E yo, Olorun d'eniyan!
O wa joko l'aye!
Oruko wo l'odun to yii
Emmanueli.

title_english: Come, Thou long-expected Jesus
passage_english: THE PRINCE OF PEACE. ISAIAH 9:6
passage_yoruba: OMO ALADE ALAAFIA. ISAIAH 9:6
verses_english:
Come, Thou long-expected Jesus
Born to set Thy people free;
From our fears and sins release us,
Let us find our rest in Thee.

By Thine own eternal Spirit
Rule in all our hearts alone;
By Thine all-sufficient merit,
Raise us to Thy glorious throne.
verses_yoruba:
O de, Kristi Oluwa,
Lat' ibugbe Re l'orun,
Lat' ite alaafia,
O wa si aginju wa.

Alade Alafia
De, lati ru 'ponju wa,
O de, lati f'imole
Le ookun oru wa lo.

title_english: Christians lift your voice in praises
passage_english: AND ARE COME TO WORSHIP HIM. MATT. 2:21
passage_yoruba: AWA SI WA FORIBALE FUN UN. MATT. 2:21
verses_english:
Christians lift your voice in praises
On this memorable day
Sing in gladness, let your voices
Sing all over vale and dale
Laud Hosannas, laud Hosannas,
Sea and streams all join the strain.

Come ye people, raise the anthem
On the earth, and heaven above
All creatures above and beneath
Sing the praise in Jesus' Name
Praise Him! Praise Him!
Praise to our king born this day.

Sing the praises, all Africans,
Though your skin be dark or light
Sing Hosannas, laud Hosannas
Right round all our continent,
Let every king, let every king
Prostrate fall to Christ our King.

Sing Hosannas, laud Hosanna,
Sing aloud and shout for joy;
The stronghold of Satan vanquished,
For the woman's Seed appears
Allelujah, Allelujah,
Great Redeemer, King of kings.

Seraphs lift on high your voices,
With the Cherubs round the throne;
Angels and the saints in Heaven
Join with them ye heav'ly hosts,
Rejoice with us, rejoice with us,
Year of jubilee is come.

Laud and honour to the Father
Laud and honour to the Son
Laud and honour to the Spirit
