Three-in-One and One-in-Three
Hear us and accept our praises
Thine the glory thine alone.
verses_yoruba:
Onigbagbo e bu s'ayo!
Ojo nla l'eyi fun wa
K'orun f'ayo korin kikan,
K'igbo at'odan gberin
E ho! E yo! E ho! E yo!
Okun at'odo gbogbo.

E jumo yo, gbogbo eda,
Laye yii ati lorun,
Ki gbogbo ohun alaaye
Nile, l'oke, yin Jesu
E f'ogo fun, E f'ogo fun
Oba nla t'abi loni!

Gb'ohun yin ga, "Omo Afrika"
E yin iran Yoruba;
Ke "Hosanna" l'ohun gooro
Jake-jado ile wa.
K'oba gbogbo, K'oba gbogbo
Juba Jesu Oba wa.

E damuso! E damuso!
E ho yee! K'e si maa yo,
Itegun esu fo wayii,
"Iru-omobinrin" de.
Halleluyah! Halleluyah!
Olurapada, Oba.

E gb'ohun yin ga, Serafu,
Kerubu, l'eba ite;
Angeli at'eyin mimo,
Pelu gbogb' ogun orun.
E ba wa yo! E ba wa yo!
Odun idasile de.

Metalokan, Eni Mimo
Baba Olodumare
Emi Mimo, Olutunnu,
Jesu, Olurapada,
Gba iyin wa! Gba iyin wa!
'Wo nikan l'ogo ye fun.

title_english: Come, all ye faithful
passage_english: LET US NOW GO EVEN UNTO BETHLEHEM, AND SEE THIS THING WHICH IS COME TO PASS. LUKE 2:15
passage_yoruba: E JE KI A LO TARA SI BETLEHEMU, KI A LE RI OHUN TI O SE. LUKU 2:15
verses_english:
Come, all ye faithful,
Joyful and triumphant,
O come ye, O come ye, to Bethlehem.
Come and behold Him,
Born the King of angels;
verses_yoruba:
Wa eyin olooto,
L'ayo at' isegun,
Wa ka lo, wa ka lo si Betlehem,
Wa ka lo wo o!
Oba awon Angeli.

Olodumare ni!!
Imole ododo,
kosi korira inu Wundia;
Olorun papa ni,
Ti a bi, t'a ko da.

Angeli e korin,
Korin itoye Re;
ki gbogbo eda orun si gberin:
Ogo f'Olorun
L'oke orun l'ohun.

Ni tooto, a wole,
F'Oba t'a bi loni;
Jesu iwo ni awa n f'ogo fun:
'Wo omo Baba,
To gbe ara wa wo.
chorus_english:
O come, let us adore Him,
O come, let us adore Him,
O come, let us adore Him, Christ the Lord.
chorus_yoruba:
E wa ka lo juba Re,
Ewa ka lo juba Re,
E wa k'a lo juba, Kristi Oluwa.

title_english: A few more years shall roll
passage_english: A LITTLE WHILE, AND YE SHALL NOT SEE ME. JOHN 16:16.
passage_yoruba: NIWON IGBA DIE, EYIN O SI RI MI. JOHN 16:16.
verses_english:
A few more years shall roll,
A few more seasons come,
And we shall be with those that rest
Asleep within the tomb;

A few more suns shall set
O'er these dark hills of time,
And we shall be where suns are not
A far serener clime:

A few more storms shall beat
On this wild rocky shore,
And we shall be where tempests cease,
And surges swell no more;

A few more struggles here,
A few more partings o'er,
A few more toils, a few more tears,
And we shall weep no more:

'Tis but a little while,
And He shall come again
Who died that we might live, Who lives
That we with Him may reign;

'Tis but a little while,
And He shall come again
Who died that we might live, who lives
That we with Him may reign;
verses_yoruba:
Leyin odun die,
Leyin lgba die,
A o ko wa jo pel'awon
Ti o sun n'iboji

Leyin ojo die
L'aye buburu yii,
A o de'b'orun ko si mo,
Ile daradara.

Leyin igbi die,
L'ebute lile yii,
A o de b'iji ko si mo,
T'okun ki bu soke

Leyin 'yonu die,
Leyin 'pinya die,
Leyin ekun ati aro,
A ki o sokun mo.

Ojo 'sinmi die,
L'a ni tun ri l'aye,
A o de ibi isinmi
Ti ki o pin laelae.

Ojo die l'o ku,
Oun o tun pada wa,
Eniti O ku, k'awa le pe
K'a ba le ba joba.
chorus_english:
Then, O my Lord, prepare
My soul for that great day.
O wash me in Thy precious blood,
And take my sins away.
chorus_yoruba:
Oluwa, mu mi ye
Fun ojo nlanla na!
Joo, we mi ninu eje Re
Si ko ese mi lo.

title_english: My times are in Thy hand
title_yoruba: Igba mi n be li owo Re
passage_english: MY TIMES ARE IN THY HAND. PSALM 31:15
passage_yoruba: IGBA MI N BE LI OWO RE. O.D 31:15
verses_english:
My times are in Thy hand;
Why should I doubt or fear?
My Father's hand will never cause
His child a needless tear.

Our times are in Thy hand;
We'll always trust to Thee,
Till we possess the promised crown,
And all Thy glory see.

My times are in Thy hand,
Jesus, the crucified!
Those hands my cruel sins had pierced
Are now my guard and guide.

My times are in Thy hand,
I'll always trust in Thee;
And, after death, at Thy right hand
I shall forever be.
verses_yoruba:
Igba mi n be li owo Re,
A fe k'o wa nibe;
A f'ara wa, at'ore wa
Si abe iso Re.

Igba mi n be li owo Re,
Awa o se beru?
Baba ki yoo je k'omo Re
Sokun li ainidi

Igba mi be li owo Re
'Wo l' ao gbekele,
Tit' ao f'aye osi 'le,
T'a o si r'ogo Re

Igba mi n be li owo Re,
Jesu t'a kan mo gi;
Owo naa t'ese mi dalu
Wa di alaabo mi.

Igba mi n be li owo Re,
Un o maa sinmi le O,
Leyin iku, l' ow' otun Re
L'em' o wa titi lae.

title_english: O God, the rock of ages
passage_english: BUT THOU ART THE SAME, AND THY YEARS SHALL HAVE NO END. PSALM 102:27
passage_yoruba: BAKANNAA NI IWO, ODUN RE KO L'OPIN. ORIN DAFIDI 102:27
verses_english:
O God, the rock of ages,
Who evermore hast been,
What time the tempest rages,
Our dwelling place serene:
Before Thy first creations,
O Lord, the same as now,
To endless generations,
The everlasting Thou.

Our years are like the shadows
On sunny hills that lie,
Or grasses in the meadows
That blossom but to die;
A sleep, a dream, a story
By strangers quickly told
An unremaining glory
Of things that soon are old.

O Thou, who dost not slumber,
Whose light grows never pale,
Teach us aright to number
Our years before they fail;
On us Thy mercy lighten,
On us Thy goodness rest,
And let Thy Spirit brighten
The hearts Thyself hast blessed.

Lord, crown our faith's endeavor
With beauty and with grace,
Till, clothed in light forever,
We see Thee face to face:
A joy no language measures,
A fountain brimming o'er,
An endless flow of pleasures,
An ocean without shore.
verses_yoruba:
Apata ayeraye,
Enit'o n be laelae
Nigbakugba t'iji ja,
'Wo 'bugbe alaafia:
Saju dida aye yii
Iwo, n be; bakannaa
Tit'aye ainipekun
Ayeraiye ni 'Wo.

Oj' odun wa ri b'ooji.
T'o han l'ori oke;
Bi koriko ipado,
T'o ru ti o si ku:
Bi alaa, tabi b'itan
T'enikan n yara pa:
Ogo ti ko ni si mo,
Ohun t'o gbo tan ni.

'Wo eniti kii togbe,
'Mole enit'itan
Ko wa bi a o ti ka
Ojo wa k'o to tan;
Je k'aanu Re po fun wa
K' Oore Re po fun wa;
Si je k'Emi Mimo Re
Mole si okan wa.

Jesu, f'ewa at'oore
De' gbagbo wa l'ade
Tit' a o fi O gbangba
Ninu mole laelae
Ayo t'enu ko le so,
Orisun akunya;
Alaafia ailopin,
Okun ailebute

title_english: Days and moments quickly flying
passage_english: SO TEACH US TO NUMBER OUR DAYS, THAT WE MAY APPLY OUR HEARTS UNTO WISDOM. PSLAM 90:12.
passage_yoruba: BEENI, KI IWO KI O KO WA LATI MAA KA IYE OJO WA, KI AWA KI O LE FI OKAN WA SIPA OGBON. ORIN DAFIDI 90:12
verses_english:
Days and moments quickly flying
Blend the living with the dead;
Soon our bodies will be lying
Each within its narrow bed.

Soon our souls to God Who gave them
Will have sped their rapid flight:
Able now by grace to save them,
O that, while we can, we might!

Jesus, infinite Redeemer,
Maker of this mighty frame,
Teach, O teach us to remember
What we are, and whence we came.

Whence we came and whither wending,
Soon we must through darkness go,
To inherit bliss unending,
Or eternity of woe.

Jesus, merciful Redeemer,
Rouse dead souls to hear Thy voice;
Wake, O wake each idle dreamer
Now to make the eternal choice.

Wise that we our days may number,
Strive and wrestle with our sin,
Say not in our work, nor slumber
Till Thy glorious rest we win.

Soon before the Judge all glorious
We with all the dead shall stand:
Savior, over death victorious,
Place us then on Thy right hand.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ati akoko n lo;
Won n sun wa s'eti 'boji
Awa fere dubule na,
Ninu iho 'busun wa.

Jesu 'wo Olurapada
Ji okan t'o ku s'ese:
Ji gbogbo okan ti n toogbe
Lati yan ipo iye.

Bi akoko ti n sunmole,
Je k'a ro 'bi ti a n lo
Bi lati r'ayo ailopin,
Tabi egbe ailopin.

Aye wa n lo! iku de tan
Jesu, so wa di abo Re,
K'a ba O gbe, K'a ba o ku,
K'a ba O joba titi.

Aye wa n koja b'ojiji
O si n fo lo bi 'kuuku,
Fun gbogbo odun t'o koja
Dariji wa, mu wa gbon.

Ko wa lati ka ojo wa,
Lati ba ese wa ja,
K'a ma saare, k'a ma toogbe
Tit'a o fi ri 'sinmi.

Gbogbo wa fere duro na
Niwaju ite 'dajo
Jesu 'wo t'o segun iku
Fi wa s'apa otun Re.

Aye wa n lo! iku de tan
Olugbala, pa wa mo,
K'a ba O gbe, k'a ba O ku
K'a ba O joba titi.

title_english: O God, our help in ages past
passage_english: LORD, THOU HAST BEEN OUR DWELLING PLACE IN ALL GENERATIONS. PSALM 90:1
passage_yoruba: OLORUN, IWO LI O TI NSE IBUJOKO WA LATI IRANDIRAN. PS 90:1
verses_english:
O God, our help in ages past,
our hope for years to come,
our shelter from the stormy blast,
and our eternal home:

Under the shadow of thy throne,
thy saints have dwelt secure;
sufficient is thine arm alone,
and our defense is sure.

Before the hills in order stood,
or earth received her frame,
from everlasting thou art God,
to endless years the same.

A thousand ages in thy sight
are like an evening gone;
short as the watch that ends the night
before the rising sun.

Time, like an ever-rolling stream,
bears all its sons away;
they fly, forgotten, as a dream
dies at the opening day.

O God, our help in ages past,
our hope for years to come,
be thou our guide while troubles last,
and our eternal home!
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, t'odun t'o koja
Iret' eyi ti n bo;
Ib'isadi wa ni iji
At'ile wa laelae.

Labe ojiji ite Re
L'awon eeyan Re n gbe,
Tito l'apa Re nikanso,
Aabo wa si daju.

K'awon oke k'o to duro,
Tabi k'a to d'aye,
Laelae Iwo ni Olorun
Bakanna, l'ailopin!

Egberun odun loju Re
Bi ale kan l'o ri;
B'iso kan l'afemojumo
Ki oorun k'o to la.

Ojo wa, bi odo sisan,
Opo l'o si n gbe lo;
Won n lo, won di eni 'gbagbe
Bi alaa ti a n ro '

Olorun t'odun t'o koja,
Iret' eyi ti n bo,
Maa s'abo wa 'gba 'yonu de
At' ile wa laelae.

title_english: O Lord, God of our salvation
passage_english: AND CALLED THE NAME OF IT EBENEZER, SAYING, HITHERTO HATH THE LORD HELPED US. I SAMUEL 7:12
passage_yoruba: O SI PE ORUKO RE NI EBENISERI WIPE; TITI DE IHIN LI OLUWA RAN WA LOWO. I SAMUELI 7:12
verses_english:
O Lord, God of our salvation,
Our guide, our leader and our might,
Has brought us together tonight,
Let us lift our Ebenezer,
The old year that we have gone through,
Has the Lord crowned with His goodness,
Each morning, new is Thy mercy,
Let our appreciation increase.

Jesus who sits upon the Throne,
We raise Halleluyah to thee,
Because of thee and thee alone,
We have been spared to come and sing;
Help us to have contrition for,
The many sins of the past year,
Help us to use this coming year,
To praise thee more than the past year.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa at' igbala wa,
Amona at' agbara wa,
L'o ko wa jo l'ale oni,
Je k'a gbe Ebeneser ro;
Odun t'a ti la koja yii,
Ni oun f'oore Re de l'ade,
Otun l'aanu Re l'owuro;
N je ki ope wa maa po si!

title_english: As moving sun did not stop
passage_english: THE LIVING, THE LIVING MAN, HE SHALL PRAISE YOU, AS I DO THIS DAY. ISAIAH 38:19
passage_yoruba: ALAAYE, ALAAYE OUN NI YOO YIN O, BI MO TI N SE LONI YII. ISAIAH. 38:19.
verses_english:
As moving sun did not stop,
That appeared thro' the past years
So many had reach'd their end
Never to be seen again.

They are kept eternally
No more to see in the world
We would wait for little time
For how long we cannot tell.

We thank Thee for mercies past
And forgive our trespasses
Teach us Lord so that we may
Remember the world to come.

Bless the children and adults
Fill us with the love of God
And when our days end on earth
For ever to live with Thee.
verses_yoruba:
B 'oorun l'aiduro ti rin,
La odun ti o lo ja,
Bee l'opo ti d'opin won
A ki o si ri won mo.

A so won l'ojo laelae
Ti won pari li aye;
Awa duro die na,
Yoo ti pe to, a ko mo.

Gb'ope f'aanu t'o koja,
Tun dari ese ji wa;
Ko wa b'a ti wa, k'a maa,
Se 'ranti aye ti n bo.

Bukun f'ewe at'agba,
F'ife Oluwa kun wa;
'Gba ojo aye wa pin
K'a gbe odo Re l'oke.

title_english: O Lord my God thou art hope
passage_english: LET THY WORK APPEAR UNTO THY SERVANTS. PSALM 90:16
passage_yoruba: JE KI ISE RE KI O HAN SI AWON OMO ODO RE. ORIN DAFIDI 90:16
verses_english:
O Lord my God thou art hope,
Thy word is food to me,
Thy hand raise me from infancy,
And through my childhood days.

And yet I tell the wondrous news,
Of thy care, year to year,
I leave the last remaing days,
Under thy watch care.

Be thou my guide when strength shall fail,
And when my hairs turn white,
Let thy great glory shine round me,
When it's my time to die.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun at' ireti mi,
Oro Re l'ounje mi,
Owo Re gbe mi ro l'ewe
Ati l'odomode.

Sibe mo n rohun iyanu
T'O n se ni odoodun;
Mo fi ojo mi ti o ku
S'iso Tire nikan.

Maa ko mi, nigba 'gbara ye,
Ti ewu ba bo mi,
Ki ogo Re ran yi mi ka
Nigbati mo ba ku.

title_english: Father, let me dedicate
passage_english: THAT GOD IN ALL THINGS MAY BE GLORIFIED. I PETER 4:11
passage_yoruba: KI A LE MAA YIN OLORUN LOGO NINU OHUN GBOGBO. I PETER 4:11
verses_english:
Father, let me dedicate,
All this year to Thee,
In whatever worldly state
Thou wilt have me be:
Not from sorrow, pain or care,
Freedom dare I claim;
This alone shall be my prayer,
Glorify Thy Name.

Can a child presume to choose
Where or how to live?
Can a Father's love refuse
All the best to give?
More Thou givest every day
Than the best can claim
Nor withholdest aught
That may glorify Thy Name.

If in mercy Thou wilt spare joys
That yet are mine;
If on life, serene and fair,
Brighter rays may shine;
Let my glad heart,
While it sings, Thee in all proclaim,
And, whate'er the future brings,
Glorify Thy Name.

If Thou callest to the cross,
And its shadow come,
Turning all my gain to loss,
Shrouding heart and home;
Let me think how
Thy dear Son to His glory came,
And in deepest woe pray on,
"Glorify Thy Name."
verses_yoruba:
Baba je n 'ya Odun yii
Si mimo fun O,
N'ipokipo ti o wu,
T'O fe ki n wa,
Bi 'banuje oun 'rora
N ko gbodo kominu,
Eyii sa l'adura mi,
Ogo f' Ooko Re

Om' owo ha le pase
Biti oun yoo gbe?
Baba 'fe ha le du ni
L'ebun rere bi?
'Joojumo n'lwo n fun wa
Ju bi o ti to,
O ko du wa l'ohun kan
T' yoo yin O l'ogo.

Ninu aanu, b'Iwo ba
Fun mi, li ayo,
B' alaafia oun 'rora
Ba m'oju mi dan,
Gba okan mi ba n korin
Je k'o maa yin o,
Ohun t'ola ba mu wa,
Ogo f' Ooko Re.

B'O mu 'ponju wa ba mi
T'ona mi sookun
T'ere mi di adanu,
Ti ile mi kan;
Je ki n ranti bi Jesu
Se d 'Eni ogo,
Ki n gbadura n'nu 'ponju,
Ogo f' Ooko Re.

title_english: Another year has rolled by
passage_english: FOR WHAT IS YOUR LIFE. JAMES 4:14
passage_yoruba: KILI EMI YIN. JAKOBU 4:14
verses_english:
Another year has rolled by
The time flies so quickly by,
This year which is to pass by
May be the last year for some,
It's Thy mercy kept us through
Have we been benefited?
We should ask, are we prepared
If we are called home this year?

This world is a battle ground,
Thousands are falling down dead,
The arrows of death that fly
Can be sent to me, to you
When the word is preached, we hear
Help our hearts to meditate,
Eternity's close at hand
We are standing on the brink.

If we are saved from our sins
By the grace of God divine
We shall hear Him say, `Come home,`
May we see His face in heav'n;
For Thy people here on earth
Grant us mercy this new year;
The year that's more full of joy
Is the one that sees them home.
verses_yoruba:
Odun miran ti koja
Wawa l'akoko naa lo
Ninu eyii t'a wa yi
Yoo s'arimo opo;
Aanu l'o fi da wa si,
A ha lo aanu naa bi?
K'a bi 'ra wa ba se tan?
B'a o pe wa l'odun-ni.

Aye bi ibi ija,
Egbeegberun l'o n subu;
Ofa iku t'o si n fo,
A le ran s'emi b'iwo;
Nigb'a n waasu t'a si n gbo
Oluwa je k'a saro
P'ayeraye sunmole
A n duro l'eti, bebe.

B'a gba wa lowo ese
Nipa oore-ofe Re.
N je maa bo n'ipe o je,
K'a le lo, k'a r'oju Re:
F'eniyan Re l'aye yii
K'anu wa l'odun titun;
Odun t'o l'ayo ju yii,
L'eyii t'o mu won de 'le.

title_english: O God of Bethel, by whose hand
passage_english: SHALL THE LORD BE MY GOD. GENESIS 28:21
passage_yoruba: N JE OLUWA NI YOO MAA SE OLORUN MI. GENESISI. 28:21.
verses_english:
O God of Bethel, by whose hand
Thy people still are fed;
Who through this earthly pilgrimage
Hast all our fathers led:

Our vows, our prayers, we now present
Before thy throne of grace:
O God of Israel, be the God
Of their succeeding race.

Through each perplexing path of life
Our wandering footsteps guide;
Give us each day our daily bread,
And raiment fit provide.

Such blessings from thy gracious hand
Our humble prayers implore;
And thou shalt be our covenant God
And portion evermore.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun Betel' eniti
O n bo awon Tire,
Enit' o mu baba wa la
Ojo aye won ja.

A mu eje at'ebe wa
Wa iwaju 'te Re,
Olorun awon baba wa
Maa je Olorun wa.

Ninu idamu aye yii
Maa toju ipa wa,
Fun wa ni ounje oojo wa
At'aso t'o ye wa.

Iru ibukun bi eyii
L'a n bere l'owo Re,
Iwo o je Olorun wa.
At'ipin wa laelae.

title_english: Almighty, Thou God of our peace
passage_english: WHILE THE EARTH REMAINETH, ……. AND COLD AND HEAT, AND SUMMER AND WINTER, AND DAY AND NIGHT SHALL NOT CEASE. GENESIS 8:22.
passage_yoruba: NIWON IGBA TI AYE YOO WA… IGBA ERUN OUN OJO ATI OSAN ATI ORU KI YOO DEKUN. GENESISI 8:22.
verses_english:
Almighty, Thou God of our peace
Decreed that the year roll by;
Thy children have come to thank Thee
For the new year just begun.
Praise ye the Lord, praise ye the Lord
The great king who spared our lives.

We thank Thee for our protection
In the year that has just passed,
We implore Thee for Thy help, Lord
For all of us this new year.
Let Thy flock here, let Thy flock here,
Keep growing in Jesus Christ.

May the adults prepare themselves
To serve with one heart this year,
May the young ones too be ready
To seek God with all their hearts.
May the Lord's peace, may the Lord's peac
Be the crown of this new year.

May the Holy Ghost from on high
Come upon us, this new year;
May the pastor and the teacher
And all the congregation
Prepare themselves, prepare themselves,
To do service for the Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa alaafia wa
L'O pase t'odun yipo;
Awa omo Re wa dupe
F' odun titun t' a bere
Yin Oluwa! Yin Oluwa,
Oba nla t'O da wa si.

A dupe fun ipamo wa
Ni odun ti o koja;
A n bebe iranlowo Re
Fun gbogbo wa lodun yii.
Je k' Ijo wa! Je k' Ijo wa
Ma dagba ninu Kristi.

K' agba k'o mura lati sin In,
Lokan kan ni odun yii;
K'awon omode k'o mura
Lati saferi Jesu.
K'alaafia! K'alaafia,
K'o se ade odun yii.

K'Emi Mimo lat'oke wa
Be le wa ni odun yii;
Ki Alufa at'Oluko,
Pelu gbogbo Ijo wa
Mura giri! Mura giri,
Lati josin f'Oluwa.

title_english: The Chief Controller of heaven
passage_english: THE LORD REIGNETH. PSALM 93:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA JOBA. ORIN DAFIDI 93:1
verses_english:
The Chief Controller of heaven,
Merciful and all wise God;
My times are in Thy hand, Lord,
Thy word is the end of all.

By Thy word the world was made
My birth also by the word,
Parents, lands and things of time
They are all made by the word.

Times of sickness and of health,
Times of poverty and wealth,
Times of temptations and wrath,
Times of vict'ry and of help.

Times to know Satan's tactics
Times of taste of Jesus love,
Seasons come and seasons go,
As our friend in heaven wills.

Thou who art full of all grace,
I to Thee my soul commend,
I will confess Thy great love,
I bend down my knees to Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Alakoso ti orun,
Alaanu at'Ologbon;
Igba mi n be lowo Re,
Opin gbogbo l'ase Re.

Ase Re l'o da aye
Ati ibi mi pelu,
Obi, ile, oun igba
Nipa Re ni gbogbo won.

Igb' aisan oun ilera,
Igba ise oun oro,
Igba 'danwo, ibinu,
Igba 'segun, iranwo.

Igba iridi Esu,
Igba 'to 'fe dan Jesu wo,
Won o wa, won o si lo,
B'Ore wa orun ti fe.

Iwo Oloore-ofe,
'Wo ni mo f'emi mi fun,
Emi jewo ife Re,
Emi teriba fun O

title_english: Almighty God, grant that Thy praise
passage_english: AND GOD SAID, LET THERE BE LIGHTS IN THE FIRMAMENT AND LET THEM BE FOR SIGNS, AND FOR SEASONS, AND FOR DAYS, AND YEARS. GEN. 1:14
passage_yoruba: OLORUN SI WIPE, KI IMOLE KI O WA L'OFURUFU FUN AAMI FUN AKOKO, FUN OJO ATI FUN ODUN. GENESISI 1:14
verses_english:
Almighty God, grant that Thy praise
All our voices employ
Thy hands has made the days go by
Another year has come.

Our sacrifice rise up to Thee
Father of all goodness
For Thy mercy, from year to year
That flows from Thy bosom.

In all the changing scenes of life
May Thy mercy endure
As much goodness to us
So let our praises be.

In all the changing scenes of life
We feel Thy anxious care
Let that same mercy, Lord we plead
Bless the new year begun.

And if Thou gives joy, may that joy
Draw us closer to Thee;
And if suffering, then we shall sing
As long as Thou bless us.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun wa, je k'iyin Re
Gb'ohun gbogbo wa kan;
Owo Re yi ojo wa po,
Odun miran si de.

Ebo wa n goke sodo Re,
Baba, Oloore wa:
Fun aanu odoodun ti n san
Lati odo Re wa.

N'nu gbogbo ayida aye,
K'aanu Re wa sibe:
B'oore Re si wa si ti po,
Beeni k'iyin wa po.

N'nu gbogbo ayida aye,
A n ri aniyan Re;
Jowo, je k'aanu Re 'kannaa
Bukun odun titun.

B'ayo ba si wa, k'ayo naa
Fa wa si odo Re;
B'iya ni, awa o korin
B'ibukun Re pelu.

title_english: As with gladness, men of old
passage_english: I AM THE BRIGHT AND MORNING STAR. REVELATION 22:16
passage_yoruba: EMI NI IRAWO IMOLE OWURO. IFIHAN 22:16
verses_english:
As with gladness, men of old
Did the guiding star behold
As with joy they hailed its light
Leading onward, beaming bright
So, most glorious Lord, may we
Evermore be led to Thee.

As with joyful steps they sped
To that lowly manger bed
There to bend the knee before
Him whom Heaven and earth adore;
So may we with willing feet
Ever seek Thy mercy seat.

As they offered gifts most rare
At that manger rude and bare;
So may we with holy joy,
Pure and free from sin's alloy,
All our costliest treasures bring,
Christ, to Thee, our heavenly king.

Holy Jesus, every day
Keep us in the narrow way;
And, when earthly things are past,
Bring our ransomed souls at last
Where they need no star to guide,
Where no clouds Thy glory hide.
verses_yoruba:
B 'awon ara igbaani
Ti f'ayo, ri 'rawo naa,
Bi won ti f'inu didun
Tele 'mole didan re,
Bee, Oluwa Oloore
Ni k'a mu wa d'odo Re

Bi won ti fi ayo lo
Si ibuje eran naa,
Ti won si wole nibe,
F'Eni t'orun t'aye n bo,
Gege bee ni k'a maa yo
Lati wa s'ite aanu.

Bi won ti mu ore wa
Si ibuje eran naa,
Bee ni k'awa maa f'ayo
Mimo t'ese ko baje,
Mu 'sura wa gbogbo, wa
Sodo Re, Jesu Oba.

Jesu mimo, pa wa mo.
L'ona tooro l'ojoojo
'Gbat' ohun aye ba pin
M'okan wa de ilu, ti
'Rawo ko n samona mo,
'Biti won n wo ogo Re.

Ni 'lu orun mimo naa,
Won ko wa imole mo,
'Wo l' Oorun re ti ki wo,
'Wo l'ayo at'ade re,
Nibe titi l'ao maa ko
Halleluya s'Oba wa.

title_english: Hail, Thou Source of every blessing
passage_english: A LIGHT … TO THE GENTILES. LUKE 2:32
passage_yoruba: IMOLE …. FUN AWON KEFERI. LUKU 2:32.
verses_english:
Hail, Thou Source of every blessing,
Sovereign Father of mankind!
Gentiles now, Thy grace possessing,
In Thy courts admission find.
Grateful now we fall before Thee,
In Thy Church obtain a place,
Now by faith behold Thy glory,
Praise Thy truth, adore Thy grace.

Once far off, but now invited,
We approach Thy sacred throne;
In Thy covenant united,
Reconciled, redeemed, made one.
Now revealed to Eastern sages,
See the Star of Mercy shine;
Mystery hid in former ages,
Mystery great of love divine.

Hail, Thou all-inviting Savior!
Gentiles now their offerings bring;
In Thy temple seek Thy favor,
Jesus Christ, our Lord and King.
May we, body, soul, and spirit,
Live devoted to Thy praise,
Glorious realms of bliss inherit,
Grateful anthems ever raise!
verses_yoruba:
A ti jina, O si pe wa
Sunmo ite mimo Re:
A dapo n'nu majemu Re
T'ilaja, t'irapada.
Amoye, ni ila- orun,
Ri 'rawo anu tin tan
Ijinle t'o sin latijo
Ijinle 'fe Olorun.

Kabiyesi; Olugbala,
Keferi mu ore wa:
Ni tempili Re l'a nwa O,
Jesu Krist' Oluwa wa;
K'ara, okan, at' emi wa
Wa fun iyin Re nikan;
K'a le jogun ilu Ogo,
K'a si ma yin O titi.

title_english: How perfect be their feet!
passage_english: HOW BEAUTIFUL UPON THE MOUNTAINS ARE THE FEET. ISAIAH 52:7
passage_yoruba: ESE WON L' ORI OKE TI DARA TO! ISAIAH 52:7
verses_english:
How perfect be their feet!
Who in Zion doth wait;
Who gospel of salvation brought,
Who revealeth their joy.

How pleasant be their voice!
How pleasant be the news!
Zion behold thy God thine King
As He hath conquered here.

How great our ears rejoice!
Hearing the words of joy;
The Prophet and, King waiting on,
They sought but found Him not.

How great our eyes rejoice!
That hath seen light divine;
The Prophet and King they hath sought,
They passed on, Him not found.
verses_yoruba:
Ese won ti da to!
Ti n duro ni Sion;
Awon t'o mu 'hin 'gbala wa,
Awon t'o f'ayo han.

Ohun won ti wo to!
Ihin naa ti dun to!
"Sion, w' Olorun Oba re"
B'o ti segun nihin.

Eti wa ti yo to!
Lati gboro ayo;
Wolii, Oba, ti duro de,
Won wa, won ko si rii.

Oju wa ti yo to!
T'o ri 'mole orun;
Oba, Woli, nwon wa titi,
Nwon si ku, nwon ko ri.

title_english: Beloved Son of the Father
passage_english: YOU WHO SIT ENTHRONED BETWEEN THE CHERUBIM, SHINE FORTH PSALM 80:1
passage_yoruba: IWO TI O JOKO LAARIN AWON KERUBU, TAN IMOLE JADE. ORIN DAFIDI 80:1
verses_english:
Beloved Son of the Father,
Come now to claim the heritage,
Which Father has preserved from time
For Your never-ending kingdom.

Come to show Thyself to the world,
Come that all men may worship you;
Before your great presence all tongues
Will there proclaim your worthiness.

They who dwell in the eastern clime
Thousand thousands! How numerous!
And those who dwell in Western parts
Shall worship the King of Glory.
verses_yoruba:
'Wo omo ayanfe Baba,
Wá lati gbà il? ini,
Ti Baba ti pam? lailai
Fun ijoba Re ailopin.

Wá f' ara Re hàn araiye
Wá ki gbogbo w?n juba Re;
Niwaju Re, gbogbo ahon
Ni y'o jewo itoye Re.

Awon t' o wà n' ila-orùn
egegberun! Nwon ti po to!
Pelu awon t' ìwo-orùn
Yio sìn oba ologo.

Sugbon Olorun Oluwa
Tan imole si’ ookun wa,
K’a le ri were’ sina wa,
Ki a si le ko won sile.

‘Gbanaa ilu wa yoo logo,
Yio mu oore fun O wa,
Oore t’ise atinuwa,
Ati isin ti otito.
 (Amin)

title_english: Blow ye the trumpet, blow!
passage_english: HE HATH SENT ME …. TO PROCLAIM LIBERTY TO THE CAPTIVES ... TO PROCLAIM THE ACCEPTABLE YEAR OF THE LORD. ISA 61:1-2
passage_yoruba: O TI RAN MI …. LATI KEDE IDASILE FUN AWON IGBEKUN …. LATI KEDE ODUN ITEWOGBA OLUWA. ISA. 61:1-2.
verses_english:
Blow ye the trumpet, blow!
The gladly solemn sound
Let all the nations know,
To earth's remotest bound:

Extol the Lamb of God,
The sin atoning Lamb;
Redemption by His blood
Throughout the lands proclaim:

Ye who have sold for naught
Your heritage above
Shall have it back unbought,
The gift of Jesus' love:

Jesus, our great high priest,
Hath full atonement made,
Ye weary spirits, rest;
Ye mournful souls, be glad:

Heart that are weary come,
Rest on the saviour's breast,
Disconsolate heart come
Be cheerful and rejoice
verses_yoruba:
E funpe naa kikan,
Ipe ihinrere
K'o dun jake jado
L'eti gbogbo eda;

Fun 'pe t' Odaguntan
T' a ti pa s'etutu;
Je ki agbaiye mo
Agbara eje Re.

Eyin eru ese
E so 'ra yin d' omo
Lowo Kristi Jesu
E gba omnira yin.

Olori alufa
L' Olugbala ise;
O fi 'ra Re rubo
Arukun, aruda.

Okan alaare, wa,
Sinmi lara Jesu:
Onirobinuje
Tujuka, si maa yo.
chorus_english:
The year of jubilee is come!
Return, ye ransomed sinners, home.
chorus_yoruba:
Odun idasile ti de;
Pada elese, e pada.

title_english: When Moses, in the wilderness
passage_english: AND AS MOSES LIFTED UP THE SERPENT IN THE WILDERNESS. JOHN 3:14
passage_yoruba: BI MOSE TI GBE EJO SOKE LI AGINJU. JOHANU 3:14
verses_english:
When Moses, in the wilderness,
Lifted the serpent up,
Those the live-serpent bit were healed;
They tasted death no more.

In the same way, from Lord Jesus
Doth healing total come.
Whosoever in faith looks on Him
Shall salvation receive.

He has come to raise us all up
And to bequeath us life,
Let our faith make us draw near Him.
So that we doubt no more.
verses_yoruba:
Bi 'gba ti Mose gbe ejo
S' oke li aginju,
Awon ti ejo san, won san;
Won dekun lati ku.

Beni lati odo Jesu
N' imularada n de;
Eni t'o si f' igbagbo wo o
Yio si ri 'gbala.

O wa lati gbe wa dide,
Lati fun wa n' iye,
Igbagbo mu wa sunmo O
K' a ma se foya mo.

title_english: Lord, be it wan't or suffering
title_yoruba: Jesu, b' ise tab' iya ni
passage_english: TAKE UP HIS CROSS, AND FOLLOW ME. MATTHEW 16:24
passage_yoruba: GBE AGBELEBU RE KI O SI MAA TO MI LEYIN. MATTEU 16:24
verses_english:
Lord, be it wan't or suffering,
I'll surely follow you!
What you do, Lord, that I will do;
As you are, I will be.

Humility, and meekness, all
In your actions, we see,
Lord, like Your good behaviour,
So I wish mine will be.

With the assurance of Your grace
I'll steadfastly press on;
Then I will follow your footsteps,
To Your heavenly home.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, b' ise tab' iya ni,
Emi o tele O !
Bi O ti se, l' emi o se;
B' O ti wa, l' em' o wa.

Irele at' inu tutu
Ni a ri n' iwa Re,
Oluwa b' iwa Re ti ri,
Beeni ki t' emi ri.

N' igbekele oor' ofe Re
Ni emi o maa lo;
Emi o to ipase Re,
De 'bugbe Re orun.

title_english: All ye the holy saints of God
passage_english: "CRY ALOUD, SPARE NOT; LIFT UP YOUR VOICE LIKE A TRUMPET. ISAIAH 58:1
passage_yoruba: KE RARA, MAA DASI, GBE OHUN RE SOKE BI IPE. ISAIAH 58:1
verses_english:
All ye the holy saints of God,
Darkness overwhelmed the earth;
Spread the good tidings of Jesus
All over the universe:
Oh! Good tidings, oh! Good tidings
Of the Saviour, Jesus Christ.

Shy not to spread His good tidings,
It's the Mightiness of God.
The city, first Christ is proclaimed,
To all captives deliverance.
Oh deliverance, oh! Deliverance
Like unto the Zionists.

World and satan may conspire
'Gainst the work of our Saviour,
Courageously work on for Him,
Do not be frightened of men.
They'll try in vain, they'll try in vain
His work can ne'er be destroyed.

When perilous season shall come
Thou, Christ Jesus will protect
Amidst all foes and the strangers
Jesus ever thine friend be,
Oh! His guidance, oh! His guidance
Be thine till eternity.
verses_yoruba:
Ma tiju Ihinrere Re,
Agbara Olorun ni.
N' ilu t' a ko waasu Jesu,
Kede 'dasile f' onde;
Idasile, Idasile
Bi t' awon omo Sion.

B' aiye oun Esu dimolu
S' ise Olugbala wa,
Ja fun ise Re, ma foya,
Mase beru eniyan.
Nwon nse lasan, Nwon nse lasan,
Ise Re ko le baje.

title_english: Let love dwell in christ's fold
passage_english: FOR YE ARE ALL ONE IN CHRIST JESUS. GAL. 3:28
passage_yoruba: "OKAN NI GBOGBO WA JASI NINU KRISTI JESU". GALATIA 3:28
verses_english:
Let love dwell in christ's fold,
Let it surround us all;
Those who share the heirship of grace
Shall together receive his call.

Let envy, the child of sin,
Be far from our midst today;
Let all who heed the savior's voice
In true love walk his way.

Then shall the church below
Reflect the church above,
Where streams of holy love shall flow,
And hearts are filled with love.
verses_yoruba:
Larin ij? kristian
J? k' if? wà yika;
Aw?n t' i?' ajum??-jogun
Ti y'o j? gba 'bukun.

K' Ilara, ?m' è?u,
Jina si ?d? wa;
Ki aw?n ti ngb? t' olulwa,
Wà n' if? t' o daju.

Bayi n' ij? t' ihin
Y'o farawe t' okè,
Nibi i?àn if? gbe wà
If? l' ?kan gbogbo.

title_english: Hark! the song of jubilee
passage_english: FOR THE LORD GOD OMNIPOTENT REIGNETH. REVELATION 19:6
passage_yoruba: OLUWA OLORUN OLODUMARE JOBA. IFIHAN 19:6
verses_english:
Hark! the song of jubilee,
Loud as mighty thunders roar,
Or the fullness of the sea
When it breaks upon the shore:
Hallelujah! for the Lord
God omnipotent shall reign;
Hallelujah! let the word
Echo round the earth and main.

Hallelujah! hark! the sound
From the depths unto the skies,
Wakes above, beneath, around,
All creation's harmonies;
See Jehovah's banner furled,
Sheathed His sword; He speaks; 'tis done!
And the kingdoms of this world
Are the kingdoms of His Son.

He shall reign from pole to pole
With illimitable sway;
He shall reign, when, like a scroll
Yonder heavens have passed away:
Then the end; beneath His rod
Man's last enemy shall fall;
Hallelujah! Christ in God,
God in Christ, is all in all.
verses_yoruba:
Halleluia! gbo iro
Lati aye de orun,
N ji orin gbogbo eda,
L'oke, nisale, yika,
Woo, Jehofa ti sete,
Ida w'ako; O pase,
Awon ijoba aye
Di ijoba Omo Re.

Yoo joba yi aye ka,
Pelu agbara nlanla;
Yoo joba gbati orun
At'aye ba koja lo:
Opin de: lab'opa Re
L'ota eniyan subu:
Halleluia! Olorun
Ni gbogbo l'ohun gbogbo.

title_english: Behold, what star is this
passage_english: WE HAVE SEEN HIS STAR IN THE EAST. MATT. 2:2
passage_yoruba: AWA TI RI IRAWO RE NI IHA ILA-OORUN. MATT 2:2
verses_english:
Behold, what star is this
How beautiful and bright!
A guide it is to the Gentiles
To the king of glory.

Behold, the wisemen all
Came from the Orient,
They came and made their obeisance
To Jesus Christ the Blest.

May Thou light of the soul
Do illumine our land,
Show the way and how to follow
Our Lord Emmanuel.

May ancestral spirits
And their groves and green trees
That are worshipped in heathen lands
Give way to Jesus Christ.

May high priests of the groves
All over Africa
Become true wise men indeed, to
Receive Jesus' offering.

Father and Creator
Who revealed Jesus to
The heathens of those early days
Reveal Him to us too.
verses_yoruba:
Irawo wo l'eyii?
Woo b'o ti dara to,
Amona awon keferi
S' odo Oba ogo.

Woo awon amoye
Ti ila-oorun wa;
Won wa fi ori bale fun
Jesu Olubukun.

Imole ti Emi,
Ma sai tan n' nu ilu wa;
Fi ona han wa k' a le to,
Emmanueli wa.

Gbogbo irun- mole,
Ati igba' mole,
Ti a n bo n' ile keferi,
K' o yago fun Jesu.

Ki gbogbo Abore
Ti n be ni Afrika,
Je amoye li otito,
Ki won gb' ebo Jesu.

Baba Eleda wa,
Ti o fi Jesu han
Awon keferi igbaani;
Fi han fun wa pelu.

title_english: Hail to the Lord's Anointed
passage_english: AND DAILY SHALL HE BE PRAISED. PSALM 72:15
passage_yoruba: LOJOOJUMO LI A O SI MAA YIN IN. ORIN DAFIDI 72:15
verses_english:
Hail to the Lord's Anointed,
Great David's greater Son!
Hail, in the time appointed,
His reign on earth begun!
He comes to break oppression,
To set the captive free;
To take away transgression,
And rule in equity.

Arabs ? the nomadic race
Shall bow themselves to Him;
Strangers from Ethiopia
Shall seek His glory bright;
Ships on the high seas shall meet,
All offering their worship,
Bringing treasures of the seas
To worship before Him.

Kings shall fall down before Him,
And gold and incense bring;
All nations shall adore Him,
His praise all people sing;
With offerings of devotion,
Ships from the aisles shall meet
To pour the wealth of ocean
In tribute at His feet.

To Him shall prayer unceasing,
And daily vows ascend;
The mountain dews shall nourish
His kingdom without end:
A seed in weakness sown,
Whose fruit shall spread, and flourish,
And shake like Lebanon
verses_yoruba:
Alaafia fun Jesu
Omo nla Dafidi.
Ni akoko ti a yan,
N'ijoba Re bere;
O de lati tan iya,
Lati tu igbekun,
Lati mu ese kuro.
Yoo joba laisegbe

Arab' alarinkiri,
Yio wole fun un;
Alejo Etiopea
Yio wa w'ogo Re:
Oko okun o pade
Pelu ore isin:
Lati f'isura omi,
Josin lab'ese Re.

Oba yio wole fun un,
T'awon ti turari
Gbogbo orile ede
Yio o si maa yin in,
Lojojumo l'adura
Oko okun yoo pade;
Lati f'isura omi
Juba niwaju Re.

L'ojoojumo l'adura,
Yio maa goke lo,
Ijoba Re yoo maa po,
Ijoba ailopin,
Yoo joko n'ite Re,
Ogo Re yio maa ran,
Alabukun laelae.

title_english: Rejoice, for Jesus reigns
passage_english: AND HE SHALL REIGN OVER THE HOUSE OF JACOB FOR EVER. LUKE 1:33
passage_yoruba: YIO SI IJOBA NI ILE JAKOBU TITI AYE. LUKU 1:33
verses_yoruba:
Eyo Jesu joba
'Nu omo eniyan
O da ara tubu
O so won d'ominira:
K'esu koju s'Omo Olorun,
Lai f'ota pe, ise Re n lo.

Ise ti ododo
Ooto, alaafia
Fun rorun aye wa,
Yio tan ka kiri
Keferi, ju, won o wole
Won o jeje isin yiye.

Agbara l'owo Re
Fun aabo eni Re,
Si ase giga Re;
L'opo kiyesi
Orun ayo ri ise Re
Ekusu rere gb'ofin Re.

title_english: Arm of the Lord! awake, awake!
passage_english: AWAKE, AWAKE, PUT ON STRENGTH, O ARM OF THE LORD. ISAIAH 51:9
passage_yoruba: JI, JI GBE AGBARA WO, IWO APA OLUWA. ISAIAH 51:9
verses_english:
Arm of the Lord! awake, awake!
Put on Thy strength, the nations shake:
And let the world, adoring, see
Triumphs of mercy wrought by Thee.

Say to the heathen, from Thy Throne,
`I am Jehovah, God alone!`
Thy voice their idols shall confound,
And cast their altars to the ground.

Let blood be shed no, never more
Vain sacrifice to mortal man,
The blood from Jesus side should be
Used to wash every sinful heart

Almighty God! stretch forth Thine arm
End the deceipt of false doctrines,
Wipe out all unholy isms,
Stop the wrath of the wicked one.

Let Zion's time of favour come;
Oh, bring the tribes of Israel home:
And let the wondering eyes behold
Gentiles and Jews in Jesus' fold!

Almighty God! Thy grace proclaim
In every clime, of every name;
Let adverse powers before Thee fall,
And crown the Saviour Lord of all.
verses_yoruba:
Ji, apa Olorun, k'o ji,
Gbe 'pa Re wo, mi orile
Ni sisin Re, je k'aye ri
Isegun ise aanu Re.

T'ite Re wi fun keferi,
"Emi Jehofa Olorun"
Ohun Re yoo d'ede won ru,
Yio wo pepe won lule.

Ma je k'a ta' je sile mo,
Ebo asan fun eniyan,
Si okan gbogbo ni k'a lo,
Eje t'o tiha Jesu po.

Olodumare, n'apa Re,
F'opin s'itanje imale,
J'ewon isin eke popu,
Da 'binu agberaga ro.

Ki 'gb'oju rere Sion' de,
K'a m'eya Israeli wa 'le;
N'iyanu k'a f'oju wa ri
Keferi, Ju, l'agbo Jesu.

Olodumare, lo 'fe Re
L'oruko ile gbogbo;
Ki gbogb' ota wole fun O
Ki won gba Jesu l'Oluwa.

title_english: What is the cause of these wailings?
passage_english: "COME OVER TO MACEDONIA AND HELP US." ACTS 16:9.
passage_yoruba: REKOJA WAS I MAKEDONIA, KI O SI RAN WA LOWO. ISE 16:9
verses_english:
What is the cause of these wailings?
We hear all over the world?
They are the weeping of heathens
Crying, "Save us lest we die."

Hear the petitions of heathens,
Christians, hear their death groaning;
Let the love of Christ entreat you,
Save them before they perish.
verses_yoruba:
Gbo! eredi ekun wonyii,
Ti a n gbo kiri aiye?
Ekun awon keferi ni
Pe, "Gba wa k'a wa to ku."

Gb' aroye awon keferi,
Kristian, gbo 'gbe iku won;
Je k' ife Kristi k' o ro nyin,
K' e gba won ki nwon to ku.

title_english: From Greenland's icy mountains
passage_english: COME OVER AND HELP US. ACTS. 16:9
passage_yoruba: WA KI O SI RAN WA LOWO. ISE 16:9
verses_english:
From Greenland's icy mountains,
From India's coral strand,
Where Afric's sunny fountains
Roll down their golden sand;
From many an ancient river,
From many a palmy plain,
They call us to deliver
Their land from error's chain.

Can we whose souls are lighted
With wisdom from on high,
Can we to men benighted
The lamp of life deny?
Salvation! Oh, Salvation!
The joyful sound proclaim
Till each remotest nation
Has learned Messiah's name.

Waft, waft, ye winds, His story,
And you, ye waters, roll,
Till like a sea of glory
It spreads from pole to pole;
Till o'er our ransomed nature
The lamb for sinners slain,
Redeemer, King, Creator,
In bliss returns to reign.
verses_yoruba:
Afefe oorun didun,
N fe jeje ni Seilon;
Bi ohun t'a n ri dara.
Eniyan l'o buru;
Lasan, lasan l'Olorun
N t'ebun Re gbogbo Ka!
Keferi, ni 'foju won
N wole bo okuta.

N je awa ti a m'oye
Nipa ogbon orun,
O to ka f'imole du
Awon t'o wa l'ookun?
Igbala A! Igbala!
Fon rere ayo naa
Titi gbogbo orile
Yio mo Messiah.

Efufu, mu 'hin re lo,
Ati eyin odo,
Titi bi okun ogo
Yoo tan yi aye ka;
Tit'Odagutan t'a pa
Fun irapada wa
Yio pada wa joba,
L'alaafia laelae.

title_english: The heathen perish;- day by day
passage_english: HAVING NO HOPE, AND WITHOUT GOD IN THE WORLD. EPHESIANS 2:12
passage_yoruba: LAINI IRETI ATI LAINI OLORUN LI AYE. EFESU 2:12
verses_english:
The heathen perish;- day by day,
Thousands on thousands pass away!
O Christians! to their rescue fly,
Preach Jesus to them ere they die.

Wealth, labour, talents, freely give,
Yea, life itself, that they may live;
What hath your Saviour done for You?
And what for Him will ye not do?
verses_yoruba:
Keferi n segbe lojoojo,
Egbegberun l'o n koja lo;
Mura Kristian s' igbala won.
Waasu fun won, ki won to ku.

Oro, owo e fi tore
Wa k'e sin a ki won le ye;
Ohun ti Jesu se fun yin,
Ki l'eyin ki ba se f' Oun?.

title_english: Lord, how soon will You return
passage_english: WHILE THE BRIDEGROOM TARRIED, THEY ALL SLUMBERED AND SLEPT. MATT. 25:5
passage_yoruba: "NIGBATI OKO IYAWO PE, GBOGBO WON TOOGBE, WON SI SUN. MATIU. 25:5
verses_english:
Lord, how soon will You return,
Will You come back again?
The world is weary and faint,
As we walk in Your way.
Lord, how soon will You return,
Shall we still wait for You?
Many no longer believe
That You will come again.

Lord, how soon will You return,
Will You appear to us?
We who are waiting for You
Shall rejoice when You come.
Awake, O sleeping virgins,
Proclaim His coming now,
That all who slumber may know
The Lord is on His way.

Rise up, keep your lamps burning,
Put on your garments white,
Prepare to meet the Savior,
For He will soon arrive.
Lord, how soon will You return,
Will You come back again?
Let not the world overcome
Till we behold Your face.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, yoo ti pe to
Ti' wo o tun pada;
Aare fere mu wa tan,
Bi a ti n w' ona Re;
Oluwa, yoo ti pe to
Ta o ma reti Re?
Opo ni ko gbagbo mo
Pe 'Wo o tun pada.

Oluwa yoo ti pe to
T' Iwo o kesi wa?
Ti awa, ti nreti Re
Yio ri O l' ayo?
Ji, wundia ti o sun,
Lo kede bibo Re,
Ki gbogbo awon t' o sun
Le mo pe O mbo wa.

Dide, tan fitila re,
Gbe ewu mimo wo,
Mura lati pade Re,
'Tori Oun fere de.
Oluwa, yoo ti pe to
Ti' wo o tun pada?
Ma je ki aare mu wa
Tit' a o fi ri O.

title_english: In pity, look on me my God
passage_english:
THOU SHALT GUIDE ME WITH THY COUNSEL, AND AFTERWARD RECEIVE ME TO GLORY.
PSALM 73:24
passage_yoruba:
IWO O FI IMO RE TO MI LI ONA, NIGBEYIN IWO O GBA MI SINU OGO.
ORIN DAFIDI 73:24.
verses_english:
In pity, look on me my God
Show Thy wonderful love to me
Forbid that I should plan my life
Thou art the One who plans for me.

Oh do not let me choose for Thee,
For Thou, my portion ever art
Oh do that which Thou has ordained
For me, in Thy great heart of love.

Lord, who can know Thy beginning
Thou Lord of glory, good and kind
Thou hast with Thee a thousand ways
When I have not yet thought out one.

As far and high as is the heaven
So are Thy thoughts higher than mine
Lead me, that I may follow Thee
In the way of Thy righteousness.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun mi bojuwo mi
F‘iyanu ‘fe nla Re han mi:
Ma je ki n gbero fun ‘ra mi
‘Tori ‘Wo ni n gbero fun mi

Ma je ki n bu le O lowo,
‘Tori Wo li onipin mi:
S‘eyi ti ‘Wo ti pinnu re,
Ibaa je ponju tab‘ ogo.

Oluwa tal‘o ridi Re,
Iwo Olorun ologo?
Iwo l‘egbegberun ona,
Nibi ti n ko ni ‘kansoso.

B‘orun ti ga ju aye 1o
Beeni ‘ro Re ga ju t‘emi;
Maa dari mi k‘emi le lo
S‘ipa ona ododo Re.
chorus_english:
My Father, lead me here on earth
Let me, Thy great salvation find.
chorus_yoruba:
Baba mi, to mi l‘aye yii
Je ki ‘gbala Re to fun mi.

title_english: Sinners do come to the Saviour
passage_english:
“COME NOW, SAYS THE LORD, “THOUGH YOUR SINS ARE LIKE SCARLET, THEY SHALL BE AS WHITE AS SNOW.
ISAIAH 1:18
passage_yoruba:
OLUWA WIPE, WA, NISISIYI, BI ESE YIN BA RI BI ODODO, WON O FUN BI SNO.
ISAIAH 1:18
verses_english:
Sinners do come to the Saviour
Who has come to save your soul,

Your pain He bore on His body
When He suffered in your place.

Eternal God is the One, who
Gave of His spirit to you
Heaven and earth shall pass away
But God lives for ever more.

Before your days here are ended
Before death, your eyelids close
Hasten and seek for your Saviour
Now before it is too late.

Here how His voice sweetly calls you
''Sinners, do come unto me''
Bring to me your burden of sin
Have hope, believe, do not fear.
verses_yoruba:
Elese, wa sodo Jesu
Enit’ o wa gba o la;
Enit’ o gbe ara re wo
Lati ru irora re.

Olodumare ni Eni
T’ o fi emi Re fun o;
Orun at’ aiye yoo koja
Sugbon Oun wa titi lai.

Ki ojo aiye re to pin,
K’ iku to p’ oju re de,
Yara, wa Olugbala re,
K’ akoko naa to koja.

Gbo b’ ohun Re ti n kepe o,
“Elese wa sodo Mi
Ko eru re naa to Mi wa;
Gbagbo, reti, ma beru.”

title_english: Heav’nly Father I want to be
passage_english:
FOR I KNOW THAT IN ME, (THAT IS, IN MY FLESH) NOTHING GOOD DWELLS.
ROM. 7:18
passage_yoruba:
EMI MO PE NINU MI KO SI NKAN TO DARA.
ROMU 7:18
verses_english:
Heav’nly Father I want to be
In holiness and in truth:
But the love of flesh attacks me
Deceiving me everyday.

I am but a feeble creature,
In my spirit and body:
All my frequent sins committed
Now a burden press’d me down.

There is one command in my heart
Which Thou inserted in me;
For this reason I will follow
Thy love and Thy holy laws.

Many times I permit my soul
To satan for temptation:
Even though Thy word has warn’d me
To depart from all my sins.

Father above, Thou and just Thou
My salvation, Thy arm art;
Blessed Saviour hath Thou sendeth,
To Him alone l’cleaveth.

Lead Thou me with Holy Spirit
To the new and wholesome path;
Teach me, watch me and lead me on
Thou Spirit of Most High God.
verses_yoruba:
Baba orun! emi fe wa
N’ iwa mimo, l’ ododo:
Sugbon ife eran- ara
N tan mi je nigbagbogbo.

Ailalera ni emii se,
Emi mi at’ ara mi;
Ese ’gbagbogbo ti mo n da
Wo mi l’ orun b’ eru nla.

Ofin kan n be li okan mi
’Wo paapaa l’ o fi sibe;
’Tori eyii ni mo fi fe
Tele ’fe at’ ase Re.

Nigba pupo ni mo n jowo
Ara mi fun idanwo:
Bi a tile n kilo fun mi
Lati gaafara f’ ese.

Baba orun, Iwo nikan
L’ o to lati gba mi la;
Olugbala ti o ti ran,
Oun naa ni ngo gbamora.

Fi Emi Mimo Re to mi
S’ ona titun ti n ba gba;
Ko mi, so mi, k’ o si to mi
Iwo Emi Olorun.

title_english: Earth has many a noble city;
passage_english:
AND THOU BETHLEHEM, IN THE LAND OF JUDA ……. FOR OUT OF THEE SHALL COME A GOVERNOR.
MATT. 2:6
passage_yoruba:
IWO BETLEHEMU NI ILE JUDEA ……. LATI INU RE NI BAALE KAN YIO JADE.
MATT. 2:6
verses_english:
Earth has many a noble city;
Bethlehem, thou dost all excel:
out of thee the Lord from heaven
came to rule his Israel.

Fairer than the sun at morning
was the star that told his birth,
to the world its God announcing
seen in fleshly form on earth.

Eastern sages at his cradle
make oblations rich and rare;
see them give, in deep devotion,
gold and frankincense and myrrh.

Jesus, whom the Gentiles worshiped
at thy glad epiphany,
unto thee, with God the Father
and the Spirit, glory be.
verses_yoruba:
Ilu t‘o dara po l‘aye
Betlehem’ wo ta won yo,
Ninu re l‘Oluwa ti wa
Lati joba Israeli‘.

Ogo ti irawo ni ju
Ti oorun owuro lo,
Irawo t‘o kede Jesu
Ti a bi ninu ara.

Awon ‘logbon ila-orun
Mu ‘yebiye oore wa;
E woo, bi won ti fi wura,
Turari, ojia fun.

Jesu, ‘Wo ti keferi n sin
Li ojo ifihan Re;
Fun O, Baba l‘a f’ ogo fun
Ati fun Emi Mimo.

title_english: Go, labor on: spend, and be spent,
passage_english:
BE YE STEDFAST, UNMOVEABLE, ALWAYS ABOUNDING IN THE WORK OF THE LORD, ... YOUR LABOUR IS NOT IN VAIN IN THE LORD.
CHRONICLE 15:58
passage_yoruba:
E MA DURO SINSIN LAIYESE, KI E MAA PO SI NI ISE OLUWA ……. ISE YIN KI YIO JASI ASAN NIPA TI OLUWA
1 KOR. 15:58.
verses_english:
Go, labor on: spend, and be spent,
Thy joy to do the Father’s will:
It is the way the Master went;
Should not the servant tread it still?

Men die in darkness at thy side,
Without a hope to cheer the tomb;
Take up the torch and wave it wide,
The torch that lights time’s thickest gloom.
verses_yoruba:
Ma sise lo, mase saare,
Fi ayo sise Baba re,
Bayi ni Jesu se l‘aye:
Ko ha ye, k‘awa ko se be?

Maa sise lo, lojoojumo,
Okunkun aye fere de;
Mura si ‘se, mase s‘ole,
Ko ba le gba okan re la.

Pupo, pupo l‘awon t’o ku,
Ti won ko n‘ireti orun,
Gbe ina ‘gbagbo re, maa fi;
Maa fii si okunkun aye.

title_english: The Lord God has made Jesus Christ
passage_english:
WHOM GOD SET FORTH AS A PROPITIATION BY HIS BLOOD.
ROMANS 3:25
passage_yoruba:
KRISTI JESU …….. TI OLORUN TI YAN LATI SE ETUTU.
ROMU 3:25
verses_english:
The Lord God has made Jesus Christ
An atonement for sin
He it is on whom my heart trusts,
On whom I hang my faith.

God has shown favour to the blood
Of His Son, Jesus Christ
He has taken the blood into
The holy place on high.

There, the blood of sprinkling speaketh
Better things for us all
And there sweet incense is offered
Up, by our Great High Priest.

The angels look on with surprise,
And they bow down their heads
Because of the mercy of God
That saved us by His blood.

I shall come near by faith unto
This holy place to plead;
I will sing unto the Saviour,
Him pray to save my soul.

The song I sing is sanctified,
By that same precious blood;
By faith, it is a sweet refrain,
A foretaste of heaven.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun ti fi Jesu se
Etutu fun ese;
Oun naa l’ okan mi duro ti,
Ninu igbagbo mi.

Olorun si ni iyonu
Si eje Omo Re;
Omo si ti mu eje naa
Wo ibi mimo lo.

Nibe ni eje ibuwon
N soro rere fun wa;
Nibe ni turari didun
Ti Alufa nla wa.

Angeli n woo, enu ya won;
Won si n teri won ba
Nitori aanu Olorun
T’ o f’ eje gba ni la.

Emi o maa fi igbagbo
Sunmo ’bi mimo yii;
Un o ma korin s’ Olugbala,
Un o bee k’o gb’ okan mi.

A ya orin mi si mimo,
Nipa eje Re naa;
O si dun nipa igbagbo,
O je ’towo orun.

title_english: Speed Thy servants, Saviour, speed them;
title_yoruba: Sin awon onse Re, sin won:
passage_english:
AND LO, I AM WITH YOU ALWAYS, EVEN TO THE END OF THE AGE.”
MATT. 28:20
passage_yoruba:
KIYESII, EMI WA PELU YIN ANI TITI DE OPIN AYE.
MATTEU 28:20
verses_english:
Friends and home and all forsaking,
Lord, they go at Thy command,
As their stay Thy promise taking,
While they traverse sea and land:
Oh, be with them! Oh, be with them!
Lead them safely by the hand.

Where no fruit appears to cheer them,
And they seem to toil in vain:
Then in mercy, Lord, draw near them,
Then their sinking hopes sustain:
Thus supported, Thus supported,
Let their zeal revive again.
verses_yoruba:
Nibiti won o f’ayo ka
Eso irugbin aiye;
Nibiti nwon o wa titi,
Lodo Olupamo won:
Pelu ’segun, Pelu ’segun,
Won o maa korin Jesu.

title_english: He that sitteth at the right hand
title_yoruba: Eni t’ o joko low’ otun
passage_english:
WE HAVE AN ADVOCATE WITH THE FATHER, JESUS CHRIST THE RIGHTEOUS.
1 JOHN 2:1
passage_yoruba:
AWA NI ALAGBAWI KAN LODO BABA, JESU KRISTI OLODODO.
1 JOHANU 2:1
verses_english:
He that sitteth at the right hand
Of the Father in heaven,
The same One is pleading for us
So that we may all be saved.

He pleads for our deliverance
From sin and from the anger,
And the judgment that is to come,
He pleads we may inherit life.

He pleads that we may inherit
The divine inheritance;
Who is able to describe
The glory and the honour.

He alone is the Advocate
For his own special people;
No other person’s blood can pay
The debt we all have incurred.

And thou art the most righteous One
Perfect before Thy Father;
So also in your holy name
Promises shall be fulfilled.
verses_yoruba:
Eni t’ o joko low’ otun
Ti Baba l’ oke orun,
Oun naa l’ o si n bebe fun wa
Nitori k’ a ba le la.

O n bebe, k’ a ba le gba wa
Lowo Oludanwo ni;
Ati n’nu ese, oun ’binu
Ati ’dajo ti n bowa.

O n bebe k’ a ba le jogun
Ile ti Oba orun;
Tani l’ aye, t’ o le royin
Ogo ati ola naa.

Oun nikan ni Alagbawi
Fun awon eni Tire;
Eje enikeni ko le
Pa igbese t’ a je re.

Iwo si je Olododo
T’ o pe lodo Baba Re;
Be gege ni oruko Re
Gbogbo ileri yoo se.

title_english: God, all the human kind are but
passage_english:
GOODWILL TOWARD MEN!
LUKE 2:14
passage_yoruba:
IFE INU RERE SI ENIYAN
LUKU 2:14
verses_english:
God, all the human kind are but
Creation of thine hand,
And in all Thy works that we see
Thy shining glory shows.

But Your marvelous love has sent
Good tidings to the world;
Which reveals the work of thy grace,
Which thou hast entreasured.

When will this good tidings be spread
All over the whole world,
So that all tribes and all the tongues
May hear the joyous news?

When will children of Africa
Know the joy of the word;
That those who have been slaves for longs,
May regain their freedom.

When will all the unbelievers
Who are still in the dark;
Sit at the feet of Jesus,
To learn of His goodness?

Lord bless the work of ministry
Of spreading of Thy word;
And build thy temple of praise on
The collapsed throne of sin.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, gbogbo araiye
Ni eda owo Re;
Ati ni ise Re t’ a n ri
Ogo didan Re n tan.

Sugbon ife nla Re ti ran
Ihinrere s’ aiye;
Ti n fi oro oore nla han,
T’ o ti fi se ’sura.

’Gbawo n’ ihin yi yio tan
Yi gbogbo aye ka,
Ti gbogbo eya at’ okan
Yio gbo iro naa?

’Gbawo ni omo Afrika
Yoo m’ adun oro naa;
At’ awon t’ o ti s’ eru pe,
Yoo di omnira?

’Gbawo ni awon keferi
T’ o wa ni okunkun;
Yio joko l’ ese Jesu,
Lati ko oore Re?

Oluwa bukun fun ise
Itanka oro Re;
K’ o si ko ’le iyin Re le
Ite ese t’o wo.

title_english: Hark, creation's alleluia,
passage_english:
THE VOICE OF A GREAT MULTITUDE, SAYING, “ALLELUIA!
REVELATION 19:6
passage_yoruba:
OHUN OPOLOPO ENIYAN N WIPE ALLELUIA.
IFIHAN 19:6
verses_english:
Hark, creation's alleluia,
Rising from a thousand shores,
Vibrates sweet as angel voices,
Loud as many waters, roars--
"Blessing, glory, power, salvation
To our God upon the throne,
Father, Son and Holy Spirit,
Infinite, supreme, alone."

On and on, from dawn to sunset
Borne on every changeful wind
From the myriad-minded peoples
Of the hoary climes of ind
From the ransomed sons of afric
From old sinim's crowded lands
From the freeborn wanderers roaming
Araby's unconquer'd sands.

From the coasts of ice to regions
Where perpetual summer smiles
From the sunny-hearted children
Of the far pacific isles
From the numbers without number
Of rejoicing Christendom
From the watchers for his advent
Who will soon to Zion come.

Gathering strength from every nation,
Every kindred, tribe, and tongue,
Hark, that everlasting anthem,
Hark, that glorious tide of song,
Floods the valleys with its music,
Echoes from the lasting hills,
Onward, upward, till the temple
Of the living God it fills.

Hark, it mingles with the raptures
Of the armies of the sky,
Who have passed through tribulation
Into perfect rest on high,
Clothed in robes of spotless beauty,
Palms of triumph in their hand,
Harping on their harps hosannas,
As before his face they stand:

"Glory unto him who loved us,
Him who washed us with his blood,
Kings and priests henceforth for ever
To our Father and our God.
Alleluia! saints and angels,
Raise your loudest, loftiest strains!
Alleluia! hell is vanquished;
God, the Lord Almighty, reigns."
verses_yoruba:
Gbo orin ’yin dida aiye,
T’ egberun orile n ko,
Orin didun bi t’angeli
O n dun bi omi pupo
“Bukun, ogo, ipa, ’gbala
Fun Olorun lor’ite,
Baba, Omo, Emi Mimo
Olola ’lainipekun.”

Titi lo, lat’ooro d’ale,
Lor’olukuluku ’le,
Lat’ opolopo eniyan,
Ilu alawo pupa,
’Lawo dudu t’ a da n’ide,
Funfun ti o po niye,
Omnira alarinkiri
De ’le awon Arabu.

Lati ebute otutu
De ile ti o moru,
Awon olokan gbogbona
Leba okun Pasifik,
Lat’opo aimoye okan
Onigbagbo alayo,
Awon to nsona bibo Re,
Nwon fere de Sion na.

Akojo orile- ede,
Lat’ inu eya ahon wa,
Gbo, nwon n korin iyin titi,
Gbo orin ologo ni,
O b’afonifoji mole,
O si n dun lori oke,
O n dun siwaju tit’ o fi
Kun ibugbe Olorun.

Gbo, didun orin naa dapo
Mo orin awon t’orun,
Awon to koja n’nu ’danwo
Sinu isinmi loke,
Won wo aso ailabawon,
Imo ’segun lowo won,
Won n fi duuru ko Hosanna,
Ni’waju Olorun won.

“Ogo fun Enit’ o fe wa,
T’ O we wa n’nu eje Re,
K’oba, alufa, maa korin
Si Baba, Olorun wa.
K’eniyan mimo oun Angeli,
Ko Alleluia titi:
A segun orun apaadi:
Olodumare joba.”

title_english: Thou, whose almighty Word
passage_english:
AND GOD SAID, LET THERE BE LIGHT: AND THERE WAS LIGHT.
GEN. 1:3
passage_yoruba:
OLORUN SI WIPE, JE KI IMOLE KI O WA, IMOLE SI WA.
GEN. 1:3
verses_english:
Thou, whose almighty Word
Chaos and darkness heard,
And took their flight;
Hear us, we humbly pray,
And, where the Gospel’s day
Sheds not its glorious ray,
Let there be light!

Thou, who didst come to bring
On Thy redeeming wing
Healing and sight,
Health to the sick in mind,
Sight to the inly blind,
O now, to all mankind,
Let there be light!

Spirit of truth and love,
Life giving, holy Dove,
Speed forth Thy flight;
Move on the water’s face
Bearing the lamp of grace,
And, in earth’s darkest place,
Let there be light!

Blessèd and holy Three,
Glorious Trinity,
Wisdom, love, might!
Boundless as ocean’s tide,
Rolling in fullest pride,
Through the world far and wide,
Let there be light!
verses_yoruba:
Iwo ti okunkun
Gb‘ oro agbara Re,
T’o si fo lo:
Gbo tiwa, a n be O,
Nibi t‘ ihinrere
Ko ti tan mole Re,
K‘imole wa.

Wo t‘iye apa Re
Mu iriran w‘aye,
At‘ ilera:
Ilera ti inu;
Iriran ti okan;
Fun gbogbo eniyan
K‘imole wa.

Iwo Emi ooto,
Ti o n f‘iye fun wa,
Fo kakiri:
Gbe fitila anu
Fo ka oju omi,
Nibi okunkun nla,
K‘imole wa

Metalokan Mimo,
Ogbon, ife, Ipa,
Alabukun!
B‘igbi omi okun
Ti n yi ni ipa re,
Bee ka gbogbo aye,
K‘imole wa.

title_english: Go and tell of the glad tidings,
passage_english:
GO YE THEREFORE, AND TEACH ALL NATIONS.
MATT. 28:19
passage_yoruba:
E LO E MAA KO ORILE-EDE GBOGBO.
MATT. 28:19
verses_english:
Go and tell of the glad tidings,
Make all the world to hear the news
Who hears and believes shall be saved
Those who refuse shall be condemned.

I'll reveal to you great mysteries,
Ye shalll show forth my word of truth
In all the works that I have done
And the miracles ye shall do.

Go, heal the sick and raise the dead,
In my great name cast out demons,
Let not my prophet ever fear,
Though Jews and Gentiles should deride.

Teach all the world my commandments
And lo, I am with you alway;
To me belong all power and might
I can kill and can make alive.

A light encircled Him around;
He ascended in great glory,
The news was proclaimed far and near
The ascension of our Saviour
verses_yoruba:
Lo waasu ihinrere Mi
Mu gbogbo aye gb‘oro Mi;
Enit‘o gb‘oro Mi yoo la,
Enit‘o ko yio segbe.

Emi o f‘oye nla han yin,
E o f‘oro ooto Mi han;
Ni gbogbo ise ti Mo se,
Ni gbogbo ise t‘e o se.

Lo wo arun, lo j‘oku nde,
F‘oruko Mi l‘Esu jade;
Ki Woli Mi mase beru,
Bi Giriki ati Ju kegan.

Ko gbogbo aye l‘ase Mi,
Mo wa lehin yin de opin;
Lowo Mi ni gbogbo ipa,
Mo le pa, mo si le gbala.

Imole si ran yi i ka,
Ogo nla l‘o fi lo s‘orun;
Won si mu de ile jinjin,
Ihin igoke Olorun.

title_english: Look with compassion on the coasts
passage_english:
FOR THE DARK PLACES OF THE EARTH ARE FULL OF THE HABITATIONS OF CRUELTY.
PSALM 74:20
passage_yoruba:
IBI OKUNKUN LAYE, O KUN FUN IBUGBE IKA.
ORIN DAFIDI 74:20
verses_english:
Look with compassion on the coasts
And the lands of the heathen
See, how in their thousands, they are
Struggling and dying in sin
Darkness covers, darkness covers
Many lives in our vast land.

The Light of people in darkness
Arise, bring blessings to us
Light for those in heathen darkness
Come, with healing in Thy wings
Let all the kings, let all the kings
Come into Thy blazing light.

Let all the heathens who worship
Gods of wood and gods of stone
Come, that they might fall down and bow
Before the Almighty God
Let Thy glory, let Thy glory
Cover all the land and sea.

Thou, to whom all might is given
Speak the word, give the decree
Let the company of preachers
Proclaim Thy name all abroad.
Be Thou with them, be Thou with them
Even, Lord, unto the end.
verses_yoruba:
E fi oju iyonu wo
Ookun ile keferi:
Sa woo bi opolopo won
Ti n jo were ‘nu ese,
Okunkun bo, Okunkun bo,
Oju ile aye wa.

Imole eni okunkun,
Dide, mu ibukun wa
Imole f’awon keferi,
Wa, pelu ‘mularada;
Ki gbogb‘Oba ki gbogb‘Oba
Wa sinu imole naa.

Je k‘awon keferi ti n bo
Igi ati okuta
Wa lati Fi ori bale
Fun Olorun alaaye
Je k‘ogo Re, je k‘ogo Re,
Bo gbogbo ile aye

Iwo t‘a f’ ipa gbogbo fun,
Soro naa! Pa ase Re;
Jeki egbe Oniwasu
Tan ‘ruko Re kaa kiri:
Wa pelu won, Wa pelu won
Oluwa titi d‘opin.

title_english: Oh from the Island bank
passage_english:
THE KINGS OF SHEBA AND SEBA WILL OFFER GIFTS.
PSALMS 72:10
passage_yoruba:
AWON OBA SEBA ATI TI SEBA YOO MU EBUN WA.
ORIN DAFIDI 72:10
verses_english:
Oh from the Island bank
To the end of the sea,
All kings bow for Jesus,
And bring offerings to Him,

Arab should sing
The heav’nly song
And Afric join
To sing His praise.
verses_yoruba:
Lati erekusu
De ikangun okun,
K’ oba juba Jesu,
Kin won mu ore wa.

Ki Arab le
Orin orun;
K’ Afrik dapo
Gbe ’yin Re ga.

title_english: Hark! the swelling breezes, rising from afar,
title_yoruba: Gbo iro efufu, lat‘ ona jinjin,
passage_english:
GOD HIMSELF IS WITH US FOR OUR CAPTAIN.
2 CHRONICLES 13:12
passage_yoruba:
OLORUN TIKAARE SI WA PELU WA LI OLORI WA.
II KRON 13:12
verses_english:
Hark! the swelling breezes, rising from afar,
Brings the sounds of conflict from the holy war.
God is with our armies, He the word has given,
He is watching o'er you, messengers of heaven.

O Thou blessed Saviour reigning now on high,
May Thy faithful soldiers find Thee ever nigh,
Bid the glorious mission speed from sea to sea.
Till the whole creation worship only Thee
verses_yoruba:
Gbo iro efufu, lat‘ ona jinjin,
O n soro jakadi ti ogun mimo;
Olorun n be fun wa. O ti soro Re,
O si n so gbogbo yin, Ojise orun.

Lo! ‘wo ihinrere, maa segun titi,
Okunkun n dimole, ni gbogbo aye;
Oosa wole fun O, ile won si wo,
Gbogb‘eda bu jewo pe ‘Wo l‘Oluwa.

Olugbala mimo ti n joba loke,
K‘awon om‘ogun Re maa ri O titi;
Je k‘oro Re maa tan lat‘ile de ‘le,
Ki gbogbo agbaye teriba fun O.

title_english: Thy kingdom come, O God,
passage_english:
THEY KINGDOM COME.
MATT. 6:10
passage_yoruba:
JOBA RE DE.
MATT. 6:10
verses_english:
Thy kingdom come, O God,
Thy rule, O Christ, begin;
Break with Thine iron rod
The tyrannies of sin.

Where is Thy reign of peace,
And purity, and love?
When shall all hatred cease,
As in the realms above?

When comes the promised time
That war shall be no more—
Oppression, lust, and crime,
Shall flee Thy face before?

We pray Thee, Lord, arise,
And come in Thy great might;
Revive our longing eyes,
Which languish for Thy sight.

Men scorn Thy sacred name,
And wolves devour Thy fold;
By many deeds of shame
We learn that love grows cold.

O’er heathen lands afar
Thick darkness broodeth yet:
Arise, O Morning Star,
Arise, and never set!
verses_yoruba:
Krist’ ki ‘joba Re de,
Ki ase Re bere;
F’ opa-rin Re fo
Gbogbo ipa ese.

Ijoba ife da,
Ati t’ Alaafia?
Gbawo ni irira
Yio tan bi t’orun?

Akoko na ha da,
T’ ote yio pari,
Ika at’ ireje,
Pelu ifekufe?

Oluwa joo, dide,
Wa n’nu agbara Re;
Fi ayo fun awa
Ti o nsaferi Re.

Eda ngan ooko Re,
‘Koko nje agbo Re;
Iwa ‘tiju pupo
Nfihan pe ‘fe tutu.

Ookun bole sibe,
Ni ile keferi:
Dide ‘Rawo ooro,
Dide, mase wo mo.

title_english: Tell it out among the nations that the Lord is King;
title_yoruba: Wi jade laarin keferi p'Oluwa l‘Oba,
passage_english:
SAY AMONG THE HEATHEN THAT THE LORD REIGNETH.
PSALM 96:10
passage_yoruba:
E WI LAARIN AWON KEFERI PE, OLUWA LI OBA.
ORIN DAFIDI 96:10
verses_english:
Tell it out among the people that the Savior reigns,
Tell it out! Tell it out!
Tell it out among the heathen, bid them break their chains;
Tell it out! Tell it out!
Tell it out among the weeping ones that Jesus lives,
Tell it out among the weary ones what rest He gives,
Tell it out among the sinners that He still receives;
Tell it out! Tell it out!
verses_yoruba:
Wi jade laarin keferi p'Oluwa
l‘Oba,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade f’orile-ede, mu ki won korin,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade tiyintiyin pe, Oun o maa
po si,
Pe, Oba nla Ologo l‘Oba alaafia,
Wi jade tayotayo, bi iji tile n ja
Pe, O joko lor‘isan omi,
Oba wa titi lae.

Wi jade laarin keferi pe, Jesu n joba,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade f‘orile-ede mu k‘ide won ja,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade fun awon ti nsokun pe,
Jesu ye,
Wi jade f‘alaare pe, O n fun ni
nisinmi,
Wi jade f‘elese pe O wa lati gbala;
Wi jade fun awon ti n ku pe, O ti segun
iku.

Wi jade laarin keferi, Krist‘ n joba loke,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade fun keferi, ife ni ijoba Re,
Wi jade! Wi jade!
Wi jade lona opopo, l‘abuja ona
Je ko dun jake jado ni gbogbo agbaye,
B‘iro omi pupo ni k‘iho ayo wa je,
Titi gbohun-gbohun yoo fi gbe
Iro naa de'kangun aye

title_english: Ye servants of God, your Master proclaim,
passage_english:
BLESSED BE THE NAME OF THE LORD, FROM THIS TIME FORTH AND FOREVERMORE!
PSALMS 113:2
passage_yoruba:
IBUKUN NI ORUKO OLUWA LATI IGBAYI LO ATI TITI LAE.
ORIN DAFIDI 113:2
verses_english:
Ye servants of God, your Master proclaim,
and publish abroad his wonderful Name;
the Name all-victorious of Jesus extol:
his kingdom is glorious; he rules over all.

God ruleth on high, almighty to save;
and still he is nigh: his presence we have.
The great congregation his triumph shall sing,
ascribing salvation to Jesus our King.

Salvation to God who sits on the throne!
Let all cry aloud, and honor the Son.
The praises of Jesus the angels proclaim,
fall down on their faces, and worship the Lamb.

Then let us adore, and give him his right:
All glory and power, all wisdom and might,
all honor and blessing, with angels above,
and thanks never ceasing and infinite love.
verses_yoruba:
’Ranse Olorun, e maa kede Re,
E maa k’ okiki oruko Re nla;
E gbe oruko Jesu asegun ga,
Ijoba Re l’ ogo lor’ ohun gbogbo.

Olodumare, O n joba loke,
O si sunmo wa, O n be lodo wa;
Ijo nla ni yoo korin isegun Re,
O n jewo pe, ti Jesu ni igbala.

Igbala ni t’ Olorun t’ o gunwa!
Gbogbo aye kigbe, e fola fomo.
Iyin Jesu ni gbogbo Angeli nke,
Nidojubole, won n sin Od’ agutan.

E je k’awa sin in, k’a f’ iyin Re fun un,
Ogo, agbara, ogbon at’ ipa,
Ola at’ ibukun, pel’ awon Angel,
Ope ti ko lopin at’ ife titi.

title_english: Praise to the Holiest in the height,
passage_english:
AND I WILL PUT ENMITY BETWEEN THEE AND THE WOMAN, AND BETWEEN THY SEED AND HER SEED; IT SHALL BRUISE THY HEAD, AND THOU SHALT BRUISE HIS HEEL.
GEN. 3:15.
passage_yoruba:
EMI O SI FI OTA SAARIN IWO ATI OBINRIN NAA, ATI SAARIN IRU OMO RE, OUN O FO O LI ORI, IWO O PA A NI GIGISE.
GEN 3:15.
verses_english:
Praise to the Holiest in the height,
And in the depth be praise;
In all His words most wonderful,
Most sure in all His ways.

O loving wisdom of our God!
When all was sin and shame,
A second Adam to the fight
And to the rescue came.

O wisest love! that flesh and blood,
Which did in Adam fail,
Should strive afresh against the foe,
Should strive and should prevail.

And that a higher gift than grace
Should flesh and blood refine,
God’s Presence and His very Self,
And Essence all divine.

O generous love! that He, who smote,
In Man for man the foe,
The double agony in Man
For man should undergo.

And in the garden secretly,
And on the cross on high,
Should teach His brethren, and inspire
To suffer and to die.

Praise to the Holiest in the height,
And in the depth be praise;
In all His words most wonderful,
Most sure in all His ways.
verses_yoruba:
Iyin f'Eni Mimo julo,
Loke ati n'ile,
Oro Re gbogbo je 'yanu,
Gbogb' ona Re daju.

Ogbon Olorun ti po to!
Gba’t eniyan subu;
Adam keji wa s' oju ja,
Ati lati gbala.

Ogbon ife! P' eran ara
T'o gbe Adam subu,
Tun b' ota ja ija otun,
K'o ja k'o si segun.

Ati p'ebun t'o j'oor' ofe
So ara di otun;
Olorun paapaa Tikare,
J'Olorun ninu wa.

Ife 'yanu! Ti Eniti,
O pa ota eniyan,
Ninu awo awa eniyan,
Je irora f'eniyan.

N’ikoko ninu ogba ni,
Ati l'ori igi,
To si ko wa lati jiya,
To ko wa lati ku.

Iyin f'Eni Mimo julo,
Loke ati n'ile;
Oro Re gbogbo je 'yanu,
Gbogb' ona Re daju.

title_english: Jesus shall reign where'er the sun
passage_english:
HE SHALL HAVE DOMINION ALSO FROM SEA TO SEA.
PSALM 72:8
passage_yoruba:
OUN O JOBA LAT’OKUN DE OKUN.
ORIN DAFIDI 72:8
verses_english:
Jesus shall reign where'er the sun
Doth his successive journeys run;
His kingdom stretch from shore to shore,
Till suns shall rise and set no more.

For Him shall endless prayer be made,
And praises throng to crown His head;
His name like sweet perfume shall rise
With every morning sacrifice

People and realms of every tongue
Dwell on His love with sweetest song;
And infant voices shall proclaim
Their young hosannas to His name.

Let every creature rise, and bring
Its grateful honours to our King;
Angels descend with songs again,
And earth prolong the joyful strain.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu yoo joba ni gbogbo
Ibit‘a ba le ri oorun:
‘Joba Re yoo tan kaakiri,
‘Joba Re ki o nipekun.

Oun l’a o maa gbadura si,
Awon oba yoo pe l‘Oba;
Oruko Re b‘oorun didun
Yoo ba ebo ooro goke.

Gbogbo oniruru ede,
Yoo fi ‘fe Re korin didun;
Awon omode o jewo,
Pe ‘bukun won t‘odo Re wa.

‘Bukun po nibit‘Oun joba,
A tu awon onde sile,
Awon alaare ri ‘sinmi,
Alaini si ri ‘bukun gba.

Ki gbogbo eda k’o dide,
Ki won f‘ola fun Oba wa;
K‘angel‘ tun wa t‘awon t‘orin
Ki gbogb‘aye jumo gberin.

title_english: Lord in this Thy mercy's day,
passage_english:
LET THEM SAY, SPARE THY PEOPLE, O LORD, AND GIVE NOT THINE HERITAGE TO REPROACH.
JOEL 2:17
passage_yoruba:
JE KI WON WIPE, DA AWON ENIYAN RE SI, OLUWA, MA SI SE FI INI RE FUN EGAN.
JOELI 2:17
verses_english:
Lord in this Thy mercy's day,
Ere the time shall pass away,
On our knees we fall and pray.

Holy Jesus, grant us tears,
Fill us with heart-searching fears
Ere the hour of doom appears.

Lord on us Thy Spirit pour,
Kneeling lowly at Thy door,
Ere it close for evermore

By Thy night of agony,
By Thy supplicating cry,
By Thy willingness to die.

By Thy tears of bitter woe,
For Jerusalem below,
Let us not Thy love forgo.

Judge and Saviour of our race
When we see Thee face to face,
Grant us 'neath Thy wings a place.

On Thy love we rest alone,
And that love will then be known
By the pardon'd round Thy throne.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, l‘ojo anu yi,
Ki akoko to koja,
A wole ni eekun wa.

Oluwa m‘ekun gbon wa,
Fi eru kun aya wa,
Ki ojo iku to de.

‘Tori ‘waya - ija Re,
‘Tori oogun - eje Re.
‘Tori iku Re fun wa.

‘Tor‘ ekun kikoro Re,
Lori Jerusalemu,
Ma je k‘agan ife Re

Iwo Onidajo wa,
‘Gbat ‘oju wa ba ri O,
Fun wa n‘ipo lodo Re*

Ife Re l‘a sinmi le,
N‘ile wa l‘oke l’ a o mo
B‘ife naa ti tobi to.

title_english: Did Christ o'er sinners weep?
passage_english:
JESUS WEPT.
JOHN 11:35
passage_yoruba:
JESU SOKUN.
JOHANU 11:35
verses_english:
Did Christ o'er sinners weep?
And shall our cheeks be dry?
Let floods of penitential grief
Burst forth from every eye.

The son of God in tears
Angels with wonder see!
Be thou astonished, O my soul,
He shed those tears for thee.
verses_yoruba:
Kristi sun f’ elese,
Oju wa o gbe bi?
K’ omi ’ronu at’ ikaanu,
Tu jade l’ oju wa.

Omo Olorun n sun,
Angeli si ji wo!
K’ o damu, iwo okan mi,
O d’ omi ni fun o.

O sun k’ awa k’o sun,
Ese beere ekun:
Orun nikan ni ko s’ ese,
Nibe ni ko s’ ekun.

title_english: O Lord, turn not Thy face away
passage_english:
I HAVE SURELY HEARD EPHRAIM BEMOANING HIMSELF THUS.
JER. 31:18
passage_yoruba:
LOOTO EMI TI GBO EFRAIMU N POHUNRERE ARA RE.
JEREMIAH 31:18
verses_english:
O Lord, turn not Thy face away
From them that lowly lie,
Lamenting sore their sinful life
With tears and bitter cry.

Thy mercy-gates are open wide
To them that mourn their sin;
O shut them not against us, Lord,
But let us enter in.

We need not to confess our fault,
For surely Thou canst tell;
What we have done, and what we are,
Thou knowest very well.

And need we, then, O Lord, repeat
The blessing which we crave,
When Thou dost know, before we speak,
The thing that we would have?

Mercy, O Lord, mercy we seek,
This is the total sum:
For mercy, Lord, is all our prayer;
O let Thy mercy come.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, ma moju kuro
L‘odo mi t‘o n yile,
Ti n sokun ese aye mi,
N’ite aanu ‘fe Re.

Ma ba mi lo sinu ‘dajo,
Bi ese mi ti po to
Nitori mo mo daju pe,
Emi ko wa lailebi

Iwo mo, ki n to jewo re;
Bi mo ti n se laye mi,
At‘ iwa isisiyi mi,
Gbogbo re l’o kiyesii.

Emi ko ni f’atunwi se
Ohun ti mo fe toro,
Ni Iwo mo ki n to bere
Aanu ni opolopo.

Aanu Oluwa ni mo fe,
Eyi l‘opin gbogbo re;
Tori aanu ni mo n toro
Jeki n ri aanu gba.

title_english: Approach, my soul, the mercy-seat,
passage_english:
LET US THEREFORE COME BOLDLY UNTO THE THRONE OF GRACE.
HEBREWS 4:16
passage_yoruba:
E JE KI A FI IGBOYA WA SI BI ITE OORE-OFE.
HEBERU 4:16
verses_english:
Approach, my soul, the mercy-seat,
Where Jesus answers prayer;
There humbly fall before His feet,
For none can perish there.

Thy promise is my only plea,
With this I venture nigh;
Thou callest burden'd souls to Thee,
And such, O Lord, am I.

Bow'd down beneath a load of sin,
By Satan sorely press'd,
By war without, and fears within,
I come to Thee for rest.

Be Thou my shield and hiding-place,
That, shelter'd near Thy side,
I may my fierce accuser face,
And tell him, Thou hast died.

Oh wondrous love, to bleed and die,
To bear the cross and shame,
That guilty sinners, such as I,
Mighty plead Thy gracious name.
verses_yoruba:
Okan mi, sunmo ‘te aanu,
Nibi Jesu n gb‘ebe,
F‘ irele wole l’ese Re.
‘Wo ko le gbe nibe.

Ileri Re, ni ebe mi,
Eyi ni mo mu wa
Iwo n pe okan t'eru n pa
Bi emi Oluwa.

Eru ese wo mi l‘orun,
Esu n se mi n‘ise;
Ogun l‘ode, eru ninu
Mo wa isinmi mi.

Se apata at‘ asa mi,
Ki n fi O se abo;
Ki n doju ti Olufisun,
Ki n so pe, Kristi ku.

Ife iyanu! Iwo ku,
Iwo ru itiju
Ki elese b‘iru emi
Le be l‘oruko Re.

title_english: Sinful, sighing to be blessed;
passage_english:
GOD BE MERCIFUL TO ME A SINNER.
LUKE 18:13
passage_yoruba:
OLORUN SAANU FUN MI, EMI ELESE.
LUKU 18:13
verses_english:
Goodness I have none to plead,
sinfulness in all I see,
I can only bring my need:
God be merciful to me.

Broken heart and downcast eyes
dare not lift themselves to thee;
yet thou canst interpret sighs:
God be merciful to me.

From this sinful heart of mine
to thy bosom I would flee:
I am not mine own, but thine:
God be merciful to me.

There is One beside the throne,
and my only hope and plea
are in him and him alone:
God be merciful to me.

He my cause will undertake,
my interpreter will be;
he's my all; and for his sake
God be merciful to me.
verses_yoruba:
Elese: mo nfe ‘bukun
Onde: mo fe d’ominira
Alare: mo nfe sinmi;
Olorun, saanu fun mi.

Ire kan, emi ko ni,
Ese sa l‘o yi mi ka,
Eyi nikan l‘ebe mi
Olorun, saanu fun mi.

Okan ese mi yi n fe
Sa wa sinmi laya Re,
Lat‘ oni, mo di ti Re
Olorun, saanu fun mi.

Enikan nbe lor‘ Ite.
Ninu Re nikan soso
N‘ireti at' ebe mi
Olorun, saanu fun mi.

On O gba Oran mi ro,
On ni alagbawi mi,
Nitori Tire nikan,
Olorun', saanu fun mi‘

title_english: Jesus, my strength, my hope,
passage_english:
PUT ON THE WHOLE ARMOUR OF GOD.
EPHESIANS 6:11
passage_yoruba:
E GBE GBOGBO IHAMORA OLORUN WO.
EFESU 6:11
verses_english:
Jesus, my strength, my hope,
On Thee I cast my care,
With humble confidence look up,
And know Thou hear'st my prayer.
Give me on Thee to wait,
Till I can all things do,
On Thee, almighty to create,
Almighty to renew.

I want a sober mind,
A self-renouncing will,
That tramples down and casts behind
The baits of pleasing ill;
A soul inured to pain,
To hardship, grief and loss,
Bold to take up, firm to sustain,
The consecrated cross.

I want a godly fear,
A quick-discerning eye
That looks to Thee when sin is near,
And sees the tempter fly:
A spirit still prepared,
And armed with jealous care,
For ever standing on its guard
And watching unto prayer.

I rest upon Thy word;
The promise is for me;
My succour and salvation, Lord,
Shall surely come from Thee:
But let me still abide,
Nor from my hope remove,
Till Thou my patient spirit guide
Into Thy perfect love
verses_yoruba:
Fun mi l’okan ‘rele,
Ti’ maa se ara re,
Ti n tan ‘mole, ti ko naani,
Ilekun Satani,
Okan t’ara re mo,
Irora at’ise;
T’o n fi suuru at’igboya,
Ru Agbelebu re.

Mo gbeke l‘oro Re
‘Wo l‘o leri fun mi;
Iranwo at‘igbala mi
Yoo t‘odo Re wa se;
Sa je ki n le duro,
K‘ireti mi ma ye,
Tit‘Iwo o fi m‘okan mi
Wo ‘nu isinmi Re

title_english: Thou, from whom all goodness flows,
passage_english:
LORD, REMEMBER ME.
LUKE 23:42
passage_yoruba:
OLUWA RANTI MI.
LUKE 23:42
verses_english:
Thou, from whom all goodness flows,
I lift my heart to Thee;
In all my sorrows, conflicts, woes,
Dear Lord, remember me.

When on my aching burden'd heart
My sins lie heavily,
Thy pardon grant, Thy peace impart:
In love remember me.

When trials sore obstruct my way
And ills I cannot flee,
Oh let my strength be as my day:
For good remember me.

If on my face for Thy dear name
Shame and reproaches be;
All hail reproach, and welcome shame
If Thou remember me.

And oh, when in the hour of death
I own Thy just decree,
Be this the prayer of my last breath,
Dear Lord, remember me
verses_yoruba:
Iwo low‘ enit‘ire n san
Mo gb‘okan mi si O
N‘ibanuje at‘ise mi,
Oluwa, ranti mi.

Gba mo n ke ‘rora l‘okan mi
T‘ese wo mi lorun
Dari gbogbo ese ji mi,
Ni Ife, ranti mi.

Gba ‘danwo kikun yi mi ka
Ti ibi le mi ba,
Oluwa fun mi l‘agbara,
Fun rere, ranti mi.

Bi ‘tiju at‘egan ba de
‘Tori oruko Re
Un o yo s‘egan, un o gba ‘tiju
B‘Iwo ba ranti mi.

Oluwa ‘gba iku ba de,
Em‘o sa ku dandan,
K‘eyi j‘adura gbehin mi:
Oluwa, ranti mi.

title_english: Our heavenly Father calls,
passage_english:
COME, MY PEOPLE.
ISAIAH 26:20
passage_yoruba:
WA, ENIYAM MI.
ISAIAH 26:20
verses_english:
Our heavenly Father calls,
And Christ invites us near;
With both our friendship shall be sweet,
And our communion dear.

How large His bounties are!
What various stores of good,
Diffused from my Redeemer’s hand,
And purchased with His blood!

Jesus, my living head,
I bless Thy faithful care;
Mine advocate before the throne,
And my forerunner there.

Here fix, my roving heart,
Here wait, my warmest love,
Till the communion be complete,
In nobler scenes above.
verses_yoruba:
Baba wa orun n pe,
Krist‘ n pe wa sodo Re;
Ore wa pelu won o dun,
‘Dapo wa yoo s‘owon.

Olorun n kaanu mi;
O dar‘ ese mi ji,
Olodumare s‘okan mi.
O f‘ogbon to ‘pa mi.

Ebun Re ti po to!
O l‘opo isura,
T‘a t‘owo Olugbala pin,
Ti a f’eje Re ra!.

Jesu Ori ‘ye mi,
Mo fi bukun fun O;
Alagbawi lodo Baba,
Asaju lodo Re.

Okan at‘ife mi,
E duro je nihin;
Titi ‘dapo yio fi kun
L‘oke orun l'ohun.

title_english: Far from my heavenly home,
passage_english:
WE WEPT WHEN WE REMEMBERED ZION.
PSALMS 137:1
passage_yoruba:
AWA SOKUN NIGBATI AWA RANTI SIONI.
ORIN DAFIDI 137:1
verses_english:
Far from my heavenly home,
Far from my Father’s breast,
Fainting I cry, blest Spirit, come
And speed me to my rest.

Upon the willows long
My harp has silent hung:
How should I sing a cheerful song
Till Thou inspire my tongue?

My spirit homeward turns
And fain would thither flee;
My heart, O Zion, droops and yearns,
When I remember thee.

To thee, to thee I press,
A dark and toilsome road;
When shall I pass the wilderness,
And reach the saint’s abode?

God of my life, be near;
On Thee my hopes I cast:
O guide me through the desert here,
And bring me home at last.
verses_yoruba:
Jina s’ile orun,
S’ookan aiya Baba,
Emi ’bukun, wa, mo n daku,
Mu mi re ’bi ’sinmi.

Mo fi duuru mi ko
S’ori igi willo;
Ngo se korin ayo, gbati
’Wo koi t’ahon mi se?

Emi mi lo sile,
A! maa le fo de ’be:
Ayun re n yun mi, ’wo Sion
Gba mo ba ranti re.

Sodo Re mo nt’ona,
To kun fun isoro;
Gbawo ni ngo koj’a ginju,
De ’le awon mimo?

Sunmo mi, Olorun,
’Wo ni mo gbekele;
Sin mi la aginju aiye,
Ki n’ de ’le nikehin.

title_english: When they turned against mount Zion,
passage_english:
“DO YOU ALSO WANT TO GO AWAY?”
JOHN 6:67
passage_yoruba:
EYIN PELU N FE LO BI?
JOHANU 6:67
verses_english:
When they turned against mount Zion,
How numerous they are,
Our Saviour then send to others;
Goest ye in the ways.

If that spirit I do possess
Except Thou uphold me
I cannot do but to backslide,
And fall into their shoes.

I know Thou art omnipotent
To save a poor Sinner
To whom shall I cling in hardship?
If I turn against Thee.

I am undoubtedly convinced
That Thou art only Christ
Who has resurrecting Spirit,
Through His Soul precious blood.

Thine Sweet voice gives a perfect peace
And drives away my fears
It is Thy love that can save me
Thou art sole sufficient.

As Thy great demand is to me
That I should go again
Lord in full confidence in Thee
I am nothing but No.
verses_yoruba:
Nigba won keyin si Sion,
A! opo n’iye won;
Mo se b’ Olugbala wi pe,
’Wo fe ko mi pelu?

T’ emi t’ okan b’ iru eyii,
A fi b’ O di mi mu;
N ko le se ki n ma fa seyin,
K’ emi si dabi won.

Mo mo, Iwo l’ o l’ agbara
Lati gba otosi;
Odo tani emi o lo?
Bi mo k’ ehin si O?

O da mi loju paapaa pe,
Iwo ni Kristi naa!
Eni t’ o ni emi iye,
Nipa ti eje Re.

Ohun Re f’ isinmi fun mi,
O si l’ eru mi lo;
Ife Re lo le mu mi yo
O si to f’ okan mi.

Bi ’beere yii ti dun mi to,
“Pe emi o lo bi ?”
Oluwa, ni ’gbekele Re,
Mo dahun pe “Beeko.”

title_english: Jesus Christ make me hear Thy voice
title_yoruba: Jesu mi, mu mi gb’ ohun Re,
passage_english:
“SON, BE OF GOOD CHEER; YOUR SINS ARE FORGIVEN YOU.”.
MATT 9:2
passage_yoruba:
