OMOKUNRIN TUJUKA, A DARI ESE RE JI O.
MATTEU 9:2
verses_english:
Jesus Christ make me hear Thy voice
Speak Thou the word of peace
And all my strength shall be employed
In praise of Thy goodness.

In Thy mercy, call me Thy child
Forgive me all my sins
And then, Thy voice will sound sweet
Like heaven's harmony.

Wherever Thou wants me to go
I'll gladly follow Thee
And gladly will I fellowship
With thosed who are asleep.

When this burden of sin is gone
No other load remains
The hand that scattered forgiveness
Will give the crown of life.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu mi, mu mi gb’ ohun Re,
S’ oro Alaafia;
Gbogbo ipa mi yoo dalu
Lati yin oore Re.

Fi iyonu pe mi l’ omo,
K’ o si dariji mi;
Ohun naa yio dunmo mi,
B’ iro orin orun.

Ibikibi t’ o to mi si,
L’ emi o f’ ayo lo;
Tayotayo l’ emi o si
Dapo m’ awon oku.

’Gba eru ebi ba koja,
Eru mii n ko si mo;
Owo t’ o fun ’dariji ka,
Yoo pin ade iye.

title_english: Jesus, my Lord and King,
passage_english:
"THEREFORE, I ABHOR MYSELF, AND REPENT IN DUST AND ASHES."
JOB. 42:6.
passage_yoruba:
"EMI KORIRA ARA MI, MO SI RONUPIWADA NINU EKURU ATI ERU."
JOB. 42:6.
verses_english:
Jesus, my Lord and King,
O Lord Almighty God!
How can I draw near to You,
I, burdened with my sin?

This heavy weight of sin
Crushes my troubled heart;
How can such evil stand at all
Before Your holy eyes?

Shall I then die in grief,
Without a ray of hope?
Yet joy I find within Your death,
For one so poor as me.

The blood You shed for all,
The work of boundless grace,
Can cleanse the vilest sinner’s soul,
And make the heart anew.

I bow before Your feet,
O Lord, forgive my sins;
Here will I wait until You speak,
And bid me rise again.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa mi,
Olorun Oluwa!
Emi ha gbodo sunmo O,
T’ emi t’eru ese?

Eru ese yii n pa
Okan buburu;
Yio ha si ti buru to,
L’ oju Re mimo ni!

Emi o ha si ku,
Ni alainireti?
Mo r’ayo ninu iku Re,
Fun otosi b’emi.

Eje ni ti o ta,
T’ise oor’ ofe Re,
Le w’elese t’o buruju,
Le m’okan lilo ro.

Mo wole l’ese Re,
Joo k’O dariji mi,
Nihin l’emi o wa titi,
‘Wo o wipe “Dide”

title_english: It is not meet for Saints to fear
title_yoruba: Ko to k’ awon mimo beru
passage_english:
THE NAME OF THAT PLACE JEHOVAH-JIREH.
GEN. 22:14.
passage_yoruba:
O SI PE ORUKO IBE NAA NI JEHOFA-JIRE.
GEN. 22:14.
verses_english:
It is not meet for Saints to fear
Nor for them to despair,
For when they least expect His help;
The Saviour will appear.

When Abraham took up his knife
God's voice said to him, `stop`
The yonder ram caught by the horn
Shall substitute thy son.

When Jonah sank beneath the waves
No hope of escape near
God sent a fish that swallowed him
And brought him to the shore.

With such great might and love as this
Abounding in His word;
I pray to bring my anxious cares
And leave them all to Him.

Lift up your eyes and wait His help
It may be long but wait;
Though the promise may tarry long,
It soon shall come to pass.
verses_yoruba:
Ko to k’ awon mimo beru
Ki won so ‘reti nu
‘Gba won ko reti ranwo Re
Olugbala yoo de.

Nigbati Abram mu obe
Olorun ni, “Duro”,
Agbo ti o wa lohun ni
Yoo dipo omo naa.

‘Gba Jona ri sinu omi
Ko ro lati yo mo
Sugbon Olorun ran eja
T’ o gbe lo s’ ebute.

B’ iru ipa at’ ife yii
Ti po l’ oro Re to
Emi ‘ba ma k’ aniyan mi
Le Oluwa lowo.

E duro de iranwo Re
B’ o tile pe, duro
B’ ileri naa tile fale,
Sugbon ko le pe de.

title_english: With joy we meditate the grace
passage_english:
FOR WE HAVE NOT AN HIGH PRIEST WHICH CANNOT BE TOUCHED WITH THE FEELING OF OUR INFIRMITIES.
HEB 4:15
passage_yoruba:
AWA KO NI OLORI ALUFA TI O SE ALAIMO EDUN AILERA WA.
HEB 4:15
verses_english:
With joy we meditate the grace
Of our high priest above;
His heart is made of tenderness,
His bowels melt with love.

Touched with a sympathy within,
He knows our feeble frame;
He knows what sore temptations mean,
For He has felt the same.

He in the days of feeble flesh
Poured out His cries and tears,
And in His measure feels afresh
What every member bears.

Then let our humble faith address
His mercy and His power;
We shall obtain delivering grace
In the distressing hour.
verses_yoruba:
Tinutinu l‘o n daro wa,
O mo ailera wa:
O mo bi idanwo ti ri,
Nitori o ti rii.

Oun paapaa l’ojo aye Re
O sokun kikoro;
O n ba olukuluku pin
Ninu iya ti n je.

Je ka f’igbagbo ‘rele
W‘aanu at‘ipa Re;
Awa o si ri igbala
L‘akoko iyonu.

title_english: Lord Jesus, think on me
passage_english:
REMEMBER ME, O LORD.
PSALM 106:4
passage_yoruba:
RANTI MI OLUWA.
ORIN DAFIDI 106:4
verses_english:
Lord Jesus, think on me
And purge away my sin:
From earth born passions set me free
And make me pure within.

Lord Jesus, think on me
With many a care oppressed
Let me Thy loving servant be,
And taste Thy promised rest.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
Nor let me go astray;
Through darkness and perplexity
Point Thou the heavenly way.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
That, when the flood is past,
I may the eternal brightness see
And share Thy joy at last.

Lord Jesus, think on me,
That I may sing above
To Father, Holy Ghost, and Thee
The songs of praise and love
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, joo ranti mi
K’O si we ‘se mi nu
Gba mi low‘ese ‘binibi,
Si we okan mi mo.

Jesu, joo ranti mi,
Em’ eni ‘nilara,
Ki n se ‘ranse t’o n’ ife Re
Ki n to ‘sinmi Re wo.

Jesu, joo ranti mi,
Ma je ki n sako lo
N‘nu damu oun okun aye
F‘ ona orun han mi.

Jesu, joo ranti mi,
Gba gbogbo re koja.
Ki n le r‘ogo ainipekun,
Ki n si le ba O yo.

Jesu, joo ranti mi,
Ki n le korin loke’
Si Baba, Emi at’Iwo,
Orin ‘yin at’ife.

title_english: Think of my affliction O Lord.
passage_english:
HIDE YOUR FACE FROM MY SINS.
PSALMS 51:9
passage_yoruba:
PA OJU RE MO KURO LARA ESE MI.
ORIN DAFIDI 51:9
verses_english:
Think of my affliction O Lord.
Send Thy only help
My heart fainteth for salvation
And will my work not end?

It is more proportion for me
If my father whips me,
Punish me for refusing Thee
That I may believe Thee.

I know righteous is thy judgement
As harsh as it may be,
Paints that I have already borne
Cometh from Thee alone.

Before I knew Thy guiding hand
I always went astray,
When I read Thy consoling words
I do not go astray.
verses_yoruba:
Ro iponju mi, Oluwa,
Ran iranlowo Re!
Okan mi daku fun’ gbala,
Ise mi ki o pin?

Mo ri pe o dara fun mi,
Ki Baba mi na mi;
Iya mu mi ko ofin Re,
Ki n gbeke mi le O.

Mo mo pe idajo Re to,
Bi o tile muna;
Iponju ti mo foriti
O ti odo Re wa.

K’ emi to m’owo ina Re,
Emi a maa sina;
Sugbon bi mo ti k’ oro Re,
Emi ko sako mo.

title_english: When at Thy footstool, Lord, I bend,
passage_english:
THEN HE IS GRACIOUS UNTO HIM, AND SAITH, DELIVER HIM FROM GOING DOWN TO THE PIT: I HAVE FOUND A RANSOM.
JOB 33:24
passage_yoruba:
NIGBANNA NI O SAANU FUN UN, O SI WIPE, GBAA KURO NINU LILO SINU IHO EMI TI RI IRAPADA.
JOBU 33:24
verses_english:
When at Thy footstool, Lord, I bend,
And plead with Thee for mercy there,
Think of the sinner's dying Friend,
And for His sake receive my prayer.

Oh think not of my shame and guilt,
My thousand stains of deepest dye;
Think of the blood which Jesus spilt
My pardon and my life to buy.

Think, Lord, how I am still Thine own,
The trembling creature of Thy hand;
Think how my heart to sin is prone,
And what temptations round me stand.

Oh think upon Thy holy word,
And every plighted promise there;
How prayer should evermore be heard,
And how Thy glory is to spare.

Oh think not of my doubts and fears,
My strivings with Thy grace divine,
Think upon Jesus' woes and tears,
And let His merits stand for mine.
verses_yoruba:
Bi mo ti kunle, Oluwa,
Ti mo n be f‘aanu l‘odo Re,
Wo t‘Ore ‘lese ti n ku lo
Si tori Re gb‘adura mi.

Ma ro ‘tiju at‘ebi mi,
At‘ aimoye abawon mi,
Ro t‘eje ti Jesu ta sile
Fun dariji oun iye mi.

Ranti bi mo ti je Tire,
Ti mo je eda owo Re;
Ro b‘okan mi ti fa s‘ese
Bi ‘danwo si ti yi mi ka.

A! ronu Oro mimo Re,
Ati gbogbo ileri Re,
Pe, Wo o gbo adua titi
Ogo Re ni lati da si.

A! ma ro ti ‘yemeji mi,
Ati ailo oor‘-ofe Re;
Ro ti omije Jesu mi,
Si fi ‘toye Re di t‘emi.

Oju oun eti Re ko se,
Agbara Re ko le ye lae,
Joo wo mi, okan mi wuwo,
Da mi si, k‘O ran mi lowo

title_english: O Almighty, use Thy rod
passage_english:
O LORD, REBUKE ME NOT IN THINE ANGER.
PSALM 6:1
passage_yoruba:
OLUWA MASE BA MI WI NI IBINU RE.
ORIN DAFIDI 6:1
verses_english:
O Almighty, use Thy rod
To touch thou my head gently,
Make Thou Thine anger to cease,
Let me not fall under it.

Heal Thou my infirmity
Look on me, I seek Thy grace;
This alone, my only plea
Look on me in Thy mercy.

Who is it, deep in the grave
Who can talk of deliverance?
O Lord, sustain Thou my soul,
Utter Thy voice, I will live.

Look! He comes, He heard my plea,
Here He comes, and shadows flee!
What glory surrounds me now!
O my soul, arise, and sing.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, fi opa Re
Ba mi li ori jeje.
Dawo ‘binu Re duro,
Ki n ma subu labe re.

Wo ailera mi yi san,
Wo mi, mo n wa oore Re;
Eyii nikan l‘ebe mi,
Wo mi, nipa aanu Re.

Tal‘ o wa n‘isa-oku,
T‘o le so ti gbala Re?
Oluwa, d‘okan mi ro,
Fohun, emi o si ye.

Wo! o de! o gb‘ebe mi,
O de! ojiji koja;
Ogo si tun yi mi ka,
Okan mi, dide, k‘o yin in.

title_english: Lord my God, hear my complaint
passage_english:
GIVE EAR TO MY WORDS, O LORD.
PSALM 5:1
passage_yoruba:
OLUWA KIYESI AROYE MI.
ORIN DAFIDI 5:1
verses_english:
Lord my God, hear my complaint
O listen to my secret prayers
To Thee alone, O Lord my King
Will I retire to seek for aid.

In the morning, Thou'lt hear my prayer
Quite early, I'll rise with the dawn
I will lift up my eyes to Thee
My supplications I'll present.

But when Thy grace shall bring me o'er
To Thy celestial courts above
Unto Thee will I set my face
And worship Thee in humbleness.

Let those who have their trust in Thee
With great acclaim declare their joy
Let those whom Thou keepest rejoice
Even those who love Thy holy name.

Unto the righteous, God didst strectch
His hands to scatter blessings free
Thy favour shall Thy people own
As their great shield and protection
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, gbo aroye mi,
Gbo adura ikoko mi;
Lodo Re nikan, Oba mi,
L‘emi o maa wa iranwo.

Sugbon nigb‘ oore-ofe Re
Ba mu mi de agbala Re.
Odo Re l‘em‘ o teju mo,
Nibe un o sin O n‘irele.

Je k‘awon t‘o gbekele O,
L‘ohun rara wi ayo won:
Je k‘awon t‘Iwo pamo yo,
Awon t‘o fe oruko Re.

Si olododo l‘Oluwa
O na owo ibukun Re;
Ojurere Re l‘eeyan Re
Yio si fi se asa won.

title_english: O Lord, turn not Thy face away
passage_english:
OH, SAVE ME FOR YOUR MERCIES’ SAKE!
PSALMS 6:4
passage_yoruba: GBA MI LA NITORI AANU RE ORIN DAFIDI 6:41
verses_english:
O Lord, turn not Thy face away
From them that lowly lie,
Lamenting sore their sinful life
With tears and bitter cry.

Thy mercy-gates are open wide
To them that mourn their sin;
O shut them not against us, Lord,
But let us enter in.

We need not to confess our fault,
For surely Thou canst tell;
What we have done, and what we are,
Thou knowest very well.

Wherefore, to beg and to entreat,
With tears we come to Thee,
As children that have done amiss
Fall at their father's knee.

And need we, then, O Lord, repeat
The blessing which we crave,
When Thou dost know, before we speak,
The thing that we would have?

Mercy, O Lord, mercy we seek,
This is the total sum:
For mercy, Lord, is all our prayer;
Lord, let Thy mercy come.
verses_yoruba:
Baba ma yi oju kuro,
Fun emi otosi;
Ti n pohunrere ese mi
N’ iwaju ite Re.

’Lekun aanu t’ o si sile,
F’ akerora ese,
Mase tii mo mi Oluwa
Je ki emi wole.

Emi ko ni pe mo n jewo
B’ aiye mi ti ri ri;
Gbogbo re l’at’ eyin wa, ni
’Wo mo dajudaju.

Mo wa si ’lekun aanu Re,
Nibiti aanu po:
Mo fe ’dariji ese mi,
K’ o mu okan mi da.

Emi ko ni maa tenumo
Itunu ti mo n fe:
’Wo mo, Baba, ki’n to beere,
Ibukun t’emi n wa.

Aanu, Oluwa, ni mo fe
Eyiyii l’ opin naa;
Oluwa, aanu l’ o ye mi,
Je ki aanu Re wa.

title_english: Be Thou with me to where I go,
title_yoruba: Pelu mi nibi ti mo n lo,
passage_english: MY DEFENSE IS OF GOD, PSALMS 7:10
passage_yoruba: AABO MI N BE LODO OLORUN. O/DAF 7:10
verses_english:
Be Thou with me to where I go,
Teach Thou me what I ought to do,
Listen to my words of complaint
And guide my feet into Thy paths.

Grant me abundance of Thy love,
Be my protection ever more,
Put Thou Thy seal within my heart
And let Thy spirit be with me.

Do, teach me, dear Lord, how to pray,
Help me to believe Thee wholly
That I might hate things Thou hatest
And love those things which Thou lovest
verses_yoruba:
Pelu mi nibi ti mo n lo,
Ko mi l’ ohun t’ emi o se;
Sa gbo aro at’ oro mi,
K’ o f’ ese mi le ona Re.

Fi opo ife Re fun mi,
Maa se alaabo mi laelae;
Fi edidi Re s’ aya mi,
Je ki Emi Re pelu mi.

Ko mi bi a ti gbadura,
Je ki emi gba Iwo gbo;
Ki n korira nkan ti O ko fe,
K’ emi si fe ’hun ti O fe.

title_english: Weary of wandering from my God,
title_yoruba: O su mi lati maa sako,
passage_english: WE COME UNTO THEE; FOR THOU ART THE LORD OUR GOD. JEREMIAH 3:22
passage_yoruba: SA WO O, AWA TO O WA, NITORI IWO LI OLUWA OLORUN WA. JEREMIAH 3:22
verses_english:
O Jesus, full of pardoning grace,
More full of grace than I of sin,
Yet once again I seek Thy Face;
Open Thine Arms, and take me in,
And freely my backslidings heal,
And love the faithless sinner still.

Ah, give me, Lord, the tender heart
That trembles at the approach of sin;
A godly fear of sin impart,
Implant, and root it deep within,
That I may dread Thy gracious power,
And never dare offend Thee more
verses_yoruba:
O su mi lati maa sako,
O to gee, un o wa Olorun;
Mo teriba fun opa Re,
Fun O, mo n s‘ofo n‘nu ‘reti,
Mo n‘ Alagbawi kan l‘oke,
Ore niwaju ‘te ife.

A! Jesu t‘o kun f’ oor‘-ofe
Ju bi mo ti kun fun ese,
Leekan sii mo tun nwo ‘ju Re
N‘apa Re, si gba mi mora
L‘ofe, wo ‘faseyin mi san;
Fe em‘ alaigbagbo sibe.

‘Wo m‘ona lati pe mi bo,
Lati gb‘ eni t‘o subu ro;
A! tor‘ aanu at‘ooto Re
Dariji, ma je ki n‘se mo,
Tun ibaje okan mi se,
K’o si se n‘ile adura.

A! fun mi ni kan riro
Ti yoo maa wa riri f‘ese,
Fun mi ni iberu f‘ese
Mu k’o ta gbongbo ninu mi;
Ki n le beru agbara Re,
Ki n ma tun d‘ese si O mo.

title_english: O Saviour, like the publican
passage_english: GOD BE MERCIFUL TO ME A SINNER. LUKE 18:13
passage_yoruba: OLORUN SAANU FUNMI EMI ELESE. LUKE 18:13
verses_english:
O Saviour, like the publican
I lift my heart to Thee
In Thy mercy and in Thy grace
Be merciful to me.

I smite, O Lord, my eager heart
It's broken and in tears
Lord deliver, my aching heart
And have mercy on me.

In shame, I confess all my sins
Grant me, Thy hope, O Lord
I plead because of Jesus' blood
Be merciful to me.

I am the chiefest of sinners
Plentiful are my sins
Because of the death of Jesus
Come, have mercy on me.

Beneath the cross of Christ I stand
It's shadow, my delight
And God whose mercy is boundless
Has had mercy on me
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, b‘agbowoode ni,
Mo gb‘okan mi le O:
Oluwa, f’ oore-ofe wi,
K‘ O se aanu fun ml.

Mo lu aiduro aya mi,
Ekun at‘ irora;
K‘o gb‘okan mi ‘nu irora,
K‘o se aanu fun mi.

N‘itiju mo jew‘ ese mi,
Joo fun mi n‘ ireti;
Mo be, ‘tori eje Jesu,
K‘o se aanu fun mi.

Olori elese ni mi,
Ese mi papoju;
Nitori iku Jesu wa,
K‘o se aanu fun mi.

Mo duro ti agbelebu,
N ko sa fojiji re:
Ti Olorun t‘o po l‘aanu,
O ti saanu fun mi.

title_english: Thou Who didst on Calvary bleed,
passage_english: OUT OF THE DEPTHS I HAVE CRIED TO YOU, O LORD. PSALMS 130:1
passage_yoruba: LATI INU IBU WA LI EMI KEPE O, OLUWA ORIN DAFIDI 130:1
verses_english:
Thou Who didst on Calvary bleed,
Thou Who dost for sinners plead,
Help me in my time of need;
Jesu, hear my cry.

In my darkness and my grief,
With my heart of unbelief,
I, who am of sinners chief,
Lift to Thee mine eye.

Foes without and fears within,
With no plea Thy grace to win,
But that Thou canst save from sin,
To Thy cross I fly.

Others, long in fetters bound,
There deliverance sought and found,
Heard the voice of mercy sound,
Surely so may I.

There on Thee I cast my care,
There to Thee I raise my prayer,
Jesu, save me from despair,
Save me, or I die.

When the storms of trial lower,
When I feel temptation’s power,
In the last and darkest hour,
Jesu, be Thou nigh.
verses_yoruba:
’Wo t’ o ku ni Kalfari,
’Wo t’ o n bebe f’ elese,
Ran mi lowo nigb’ aini;
Jesu, gbo ’gbe mi.

Ninu ibanuje mi,
At’ okan aigbagbo mi,
Em’ olori elese
Gb’ oju mi si O.

Ota lode, eru n’nu,
Ko s’ ire kan lowo mi,
Iwo l’ ongb’ elese la,
Mo sa to O wa.

Awon miran dese pe,
Won si ri igbala gba,
Won gbo ohun aanu Re,
Mu mi gbo pelu.

Mo k’ aniyan mi le O,
Mo si n gbadura si O,
Jesu, yo mi n’nu egbe,
Gba mi, ki n ma ku.

’Gbati wahala ba de,
Nigb’ agbara idanwo,
Ati lojo ikehin,
Jesu, sunmo mi.

title_english: There is a cleansing fountain
passage_english: THE BLOOD OF JESUS CHRIST HIS SON CLEANSES US FROM ALL SIN. 1 JOHN 1:7
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU KRISTI OMO RE NI NEW WA NU KURO NINU ESE GBOGBO. 1 JOHANU 1:7
verses_english:
There is a cleansing fountain
It flows from Calvary
‘T was opened by the Saviour
From sin each soul to free
And now His voice is calling
With accents, oh, so sweet
Come to the cleansing river
Down at the Mercy-seat!

Though worn and heavy laden
And burdened with your sin
There's virtue in the river
Oh, will you enter in?
There's healing in its waters
There's cleansing in its stream
Then look away to Calv'ry
Where mercy's light does beam.

This stream of life eternal
For you is flowing free
Oh, bow yourself for cleansing
And gain your liberty
Then Christ shall be your Saviour
And out of you shall flow
A life of peace and heaven
God's Paradise below.
verses_yoruba:
Isun ‘wenumo kan n be
Lati oke Kalfari,
Oluwa si isun naa
Fun gbogbo elese,
Nisisiyi ohun re n pe
Lati soo d‘ominira
E wa fun iwenumo
Nibi ite-aanu.

Bi eru ese npa o
Ti are si mu o,
Agbara mbe n‘isun na,
Wa we n‘nu isun na.
Iwosan mbe ninu re
Pelu iwenumo,
Omi anu nsan titi
Lat‘ oke Kalfari.

Orisun iye n‘ise,
Lofe l‘o nsan fun wa,
Bere, we ki o si mo,
Si gba omnira re,
Gba Kristi l‘Oluwa re
Y‘o SO o di kanga
Alafia at‘ayo
Y‘o ma san ninu re.
chorus_english:
Oh! Calvary's stream is flowing
Calvary's stream is flowing
Flowing so free for you and for me
Calvary's stream is flowing.
chorus_yoruba:
Isun ti n san ni Kalfari
Isun Kalfari naa nsan
L’ ofe l’ o nsan, fun gbogbo wa ni
Isun Kalfari naa nsan.

title_english: I've a message from the Lord, Hallelujah!
passage_english: WHEN HE LOOKETH UPON IT, SHALL LIVE. NUMBERS 21:8
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI O BA WOO, YOO YE. NUMERI 21:8
verses_english:
I've a message from the Lord, Hallelujah!
The message unto you I'll give;
'Tis recorded in His Word, Hallelujah!
It is only that you ?look and live.?

I've a message full of love, Hallelujah!
A message, O my friend for you;
'Tis a message from above, Hallelujah!
Jesus said it ? and I know 'tis true!

Life is offered unto thee, Hallelujah!
Eternal life thy soul shall have,
If you'll only look to Him, Hallelujah!
Look to Jesus who alone can save.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ran mi ni ‘se, Alleluya!
Iwo ni un o je ise naa fun;
A ko s‘inu Oro Re, Alleluya!
P‘eni t‘o ba wo Jesu yoo ye.

Aran mi n‘ise ayo, Alleluya!
Un o j‘ise naa fun o ore mi;
Ise lat‘ oke wa ni; Alleluya!
Jesu so, mo mo pe ooto ni.

A n‘owo iye si O, Alleluya!
A o fi ‘ye ailopin fun O;
T‘o ba wo Jesu nikan, Alleluya!
Wo o, Oun nikan l‘o le gbala.
chorus_english:
Look and live,' my brother, live!
Look to Jesus now and live;
'Tis recorded in His Word, Hallelujah!
It is only that you `look and live!`
chorus_yoruba:
Wo, k‘o ye, Arakunrin,
Wo Jesu ki o si ye,
A ko s‘inu Oro Re, Alleluya!
P‘enit‘o ba wo Jesu yoo ye.

title_english: To the altar of God
passage_english: EVEN YOUR ALTARS, O LORD OF HOSTS, MY KING AND MY GOD. PSALMS 84:3
passage_yoruba: NI PEPE RE WONNI, OLUWA AWON OMO OGUN. ORIN DAFIDI 84:3
verses_english:
To the altar of God
My grief brought I to Thee;
Wouldest Thou with mercy receive
This unworthy offering.

Christ Jesus Lam of God
My faith looks up to Thee:
Would Thou unworthy gift reject?
My offering receiveth.

When my Christ Jesus died,
The law though satisfied;
No more am I scared of the law
‘Cos Jesus Christ hast died.
verses_yoruba:
Si pepe Oluwa,
Mo mu ’banuje wa;
’Wo ki o f’ aanu tewogba
Ohun alaye yii?

Kristi Odagutan
Ni igbagbo mi n wo:
’Wo le ko ’hun alaye yii?
’Wo o gba ebo mi.

’Gbati Jesu mi ku,
Ate ofin l’ orun;
Ofin ko ba mi l’ eru mo
’Tori pe Jesu ku.

title_english: Christ Jesus our cross and our song,
title_yoruba: Kristi t’ agbelebu l’ orin wa,
passage_english: THE GOSPEL OF CHRIST ….. FOR IT IS THE POWER OF GOD TO SALVATION. ROMS 1:16
passage_yoruba: IHINRERE KRISTI ……… AGBARA OLORUN NI SI IGBALA. ROMU 1:16
verses_english:
Christ Jesus our cross and our song,
Deepest mystery revealed;
Mockery it seemeth to the Jews,
Insanity to Greeks.

But all hearts converted of God
Gladly receive the word;
Wisdom, strength, love they receiveth,
Revealeth in their God.

The Saviour of His living name
All dead souls reviving;
Disbelief can our soul defile,
Unto condemnation.

Save by chance God His grace showered
Aliked downpour of rain;
Apollos may sow all in vain,
Paul irrigate in vain.
verses_yoruba:
Kristi t’ agbelebu l’ orin wa,
Ijinle t’ awa n so;
O j’ egan loju awon ju,
Were lowo Griki.

Sugbon okan t’ Olorun ko
F’ ayo gba oro naa;
Won ri ogbon, ipa, ife,
T’ o han n’ Oluwa won.

Adun oruko Re yiye
Mu ’soji s’ okan won;
Aigbagbo l’ohun t’ o ba ni je,
Si ebi at’ iku.

Lai j’ Olorun t’ oor’ ofe ka
Bi owara ojo;
Lasan l’ Apollo fun rugbin,
Paul si le gbin lasan.

title_english: No, not despairingly
passage_english: FOR THY NAME'S SAKE, O LORD, PARDON MINE INIQUITY. PSALM 25:11
passage_yoruba: NITORI ORUKO RE DARI ESE MI JI. ORIN DAFIDI 25:11
verses_english:
No, not despairingly
Come I to Thee;
No, not distrustingly
Bend I the knee:
Sin hath gone over me,
Yet is this still my plea,
Yet is this still my plea,
Jesus hath died.

Ah! Mine iniquity
Crimson has been,
Infinite, infinite,
Sin upon sin;
Sin of not loving Thee,
Sin of not trusting Thee,
Sin of not trusting Thee,
Infinite sin.

Faithful and just art Thou,
Forgiving all;
Loving and kind art Thou
When poor ones call:
Lord, let the cleansing blood,
Blood of the Lamb of God,
Blood of the Lamb of God,
Pass o'er my soul.

Then all is peace and light
This soul within;
Thus shall I walk with Thee,
The loved Unseen;
Leaning on Thee, my God,
Guided along the road,
Guided along the road,
Nothing between.
verses_yoruba:
Ki se l‘ainireti
Ni mo too wa
Ki se l’aini ‘gbagbo
Ni mo kunle,
Ese ti gori mi
Eyii sa l‘ebe mi,
Eyii sa l‘ebe mi,
Jesu ti ku.

A! Ese mi poju,
O pon koko
Adale, adale
Ni mo n d‘ese;
Ese aiferan Re
Ese aigba O gbo,
Ese aigba O gbo,
Ese nlanla.

Oluwa, mo jewo
Ese nla mi,
'O mo bi mo ti ri,
Bi mo ti wa;
Joo, we ese mi nu,
K‘okan mi mo loni,
K‘okan mi mo loni,
Ki n di mimo.

Olododo ni O,
O dariji
L‘ese agbelebu
Ni mo wole;
Jek‘eje iwenu
Eje odagutan,
Eje odagutan,
We okan mi.

‘Gbana alaafia
Yoo d‘okan mi,
‘Gbanna un o ba o rin,
Ore airi;
Em‘ o f‘ara ti O;
Joo maa to mi s'ona,
Joo maa to mi s‘ona,
Titi aye.

title_english: Jesus, lover of my soul,
passage_english: O LORD …….. I FLEE UNTO THEE TO HIDE ME. PSALM 143:9
passage_yoruba: OLUWA …….. ODO RE NI MO SA PAMO SI. ORIN DAFIDI 143:9
verses_english:
Jesus, lover of my soul,
Let me to Thy bosom fly,
While the nearer waters roll,
While the tempest still is high;
Hide me, O my Saviour, hide!
Till the storm of life be past;
Safe into the haven guide,
O receive my soul at last!

Thou, O Christ, art all I want,
More than all in Thee I find;
Raise the fallen, cheer the faint,
Heal the sick, and lead the blind.
Just and holy is Thy name,
I am all unrighteousness;
Vile and full of sin I am,
Thou art full of truth and grace.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Oluf‘okan mi,
Je ki n sala s‘aya Re,
Sa t‘irumi sunmo mi.
Sa ti iji n fe s’oke;
Pa mi mo Olugbala
Tit‘ iji aye yoo pin,
To mi lo s‘ebute Re,
Nikeyin, gba Okan mi.

Kristi ‘Wo nikan ni mo fe;
N‘nu Re, mo r‘ohun gbogbo
Gb‘eni to subu dide,
W‘alaisan, to afoju,
Ododo l‘oruko Re,
Alaisododo l‘emi
Mo kun fun ese pupo,
Iwo kun fun ododo.

‘Wo l‘opo oore-ofe,
Lati fi bo ese mi;
Je ki omi iwosan
We inu Okan mi mo;
Iwo l‘orisun iye,
Je ki n bu n‘nu Re l‘ofe,
Ru jade n‘nu okan mi,
Si iye ainipekun.

title_english: Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
passage_english: THAT I WILL PUT THEE IN A CLIFT OF THE ROCK. EKS. 33:22
passage_yoruba: EMI O FI O SI PALAPALA APATA. EKS 33:22
verses_english:
While I draw this fleeting breath,
when mine eyes shall close in death,
when I soar to worlds unknown,
see thee on thy judgment throne,
Rock of Ages, cleft for me,
let me hide myself in thee.
verses_yoruba:
Apata ayeraye
Se ibi isadi mi;
Je ki omi oun eje,
T'o san lati iha Re,
Se iwosan f'ese mi,
K'o si so mi di mimo.

'Gbati emi mi ba n lo,
T'iku ba p'oju mi de,
T'i mba n lo s'aye aimo,
Ti n ri O n'ite 'dajo;
Apata ayeraye,
Se ibi isadi mi.

title_english: Quiet be thou my heart,
passage_english: “WHY ARE YOU FEARFUL, O YOU OF LITTLE FAITH?”. MATTHEW 8:26
passage_yoruba: EESE TI EYIN FI SE OJO BEE, EYIN ONIGBAGBO KEKERE? MATTEU 8:26
verses_english:
Quiet be thou my heart,
Thy redeemer liveth
He that has given thee promise
Must surely fulfil it.

He holds you to follow,
And He has brought you here;
He would keep you safe though danger
Till the end of your life.

Once thou hast been thrown in
Nothing but dreadful sin,
Thy repentant voice in the sin
Has made Him to save you.

Rugged the way might seem
He is taking you home,
When billows of life are over,
Just all He has paid for.
verses_yoruba:
Sa dake okan mi,
Oluwa re wa mbe;
Enit’ o ti se ileri,
Yio fe mu u se.

Oun ti fa o lowo,
O mu o de ’hin iyi;
Yoo pa o mo la ewu ja,
Tit’ opin aiye re.

Nigbat’ iwo ti bo
Sinu wahala ri,
Igbe re naa ki Oun ha gbo,
Too si yo o kuro?

B’ ona ko tile dan,
Yio mu o de ’le;
Sa ti wahala aye tan,
O san fun gbogbo re.

title_english: As pants the hart for cooling streams
passage_english: MY SOUL THIRSTS FOR GOD. PSALMS 42:2
passage_yoruba: OUNGBE OLORUN N GBE OKAN MI. ORIN DAFIDI 42:2
verses_english:
As pants the hart for cooling streams
When heated in the chase,
So longs my soul, O God, for Thee,
And Thy refreshing grace.

Why restless, why cast down, my soul?
Trust God, who will employ
His aid for thee, and change these sighs
To thankful hymns of joy.

For Thee, my God, the living God,
My thirsty soul doth pine;
Oh, when shall I behold Thy face,
Thou Majesty Divine?

God of my strength, how long shall I,
Like one forgotten, mourn,
Forlorn, forsaken, and exposed
To my oppressor’s scorn?

Why restless, why cast down, my soul?
Hope still, and thou shalt sing
The praise of Him who is thy God,
Thy health’s eternal spring.
verses_yoruba:
Bi agborin ti nmi hele,
S’ ipa odo omi;
Beni okan mi nmi si O,
Iwo Olorun mi.

Orungbe Re n gbe okan mi,
Olorun alaaye;
Nigbawo ni ngo r’oju mi,
Olorun Olanla?

Okan mi, o se rewesi?
Gbekele Olorun;
Eniti y’o so ekun re
D’orin ayo fun o.

Y’o ti pe to, Olorun mi,
Ti ngo d’eni ’gbagbe?
Tao ma ti mi sihin sohun,
B’eni ko ni ’bugbe?

Okan mi o se rewesi?
Gbagbo, ’wo o si ko
Orin iyin s’ Olorun re,
Orisun emi re.

title_english: Just as I am without one plea,
passage_english: AND HIM THAT COMETH TO ME I WILL IN NO WISE CAST OUT. JOHN 6:37.
passage_yoruba: ENIKENI TI O TO MI WA, EMI KI YIO TAA NU BI O TI WU KO RI. JOHN 6:37
verses_english:
Just as I am without one plea,
But that Thy blood was shed for me,
And that Thou bidst me come to Thee
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

Just as I am—and waiting not
To rid my soul of one dark blot,
To Thee whose blood can cleanse each spot
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

Just as I am, though tossed about
With many a conflict, many a doubt,
Fightings and fears within, without
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

Just as I am, poor, wretched, blind;
Sight, riches, healing of the mind,
Yea, all I need in Thee to find
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

Just as I am Thou wilt receive,
Wilt welcome, pardon, cleanse, relieve;
Because Thy promise I believe
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.

Just as I am Thy love unknown
Hath broken every barrier down;
Now, to be Thine, yea, Thine alone
O Lamb of God, I come, I come.
verses_yoruba:
Bi mo ti ri - laisawawi,
Sugbon nitori eje Re
B‘ o si ti pe mi pe ki n wa;
Olugbala, mo de.

Bi mo ti ri-laiduro pe,
Mo fe k‘ okan mi mo toto,
S‘odo Re t’o le we mi mo,
Olugbala, mo de.

Bi mo ti ri - b‘o tile je
Ija l‘ode ija ninu
Eru l‘ode, eru ninu,
Olugbala, mo de.

Bi mo ti ri - osi are;
Mo si n wa imularada,
Iwo lo le s‘awotan mi,
Olugbala, mo de.

Bi mo ti ri - ife Tire,
L‘o sete mi patapata,
Mo di Tire, Tire nikan;
Olugbala, mo de.

title_english: In the hour of trial,
passage_english: BUT I HAVE PRAYED FOR THEE, THAT THY FAITH FAIL NOT. LUK 22:32
passage_yoruba: MO TI GBADURA FUN O KI IGBAGBO RE MASE YE. LUK 22:32
verses_english:
In the hour of trial,
Jesus, plead for me,
Lest by base denial
I depart from Thee.
When Thou seest me waver,
With a look recall,
Nor for fear or favor
Suffer me to fall.

With forbidden pleasures
Would this vain world charm,
Or its sordid treasures
Spread to work me harm,
Bring to my remembrance
Sad Gethsemane,
Or, in darker semblance,
Cross-crowned Calvary.

If with sore affliction
Thou in love chastise,
pour thy benediction
On the sacrifice,
Then upon thine altal
Freely offered up;
though the flesh may faltar
Faith shall drink the cup.

When in dust and ashes,
To the grave, I sink,
while heav’ns glory flashes
O’er the shelving brink,
On Thy truth relying,
Through that mortal strife,
Lord receive my dying,
To eternal life.
verses_yoruba:
B'aye ba si n fa mi,
Pelu adun re;
T'ohun 'sura aye
Fe han mi l'eemo:
Joo mu Gestsemane
Wa s' iranti mi,
Tabi irora Re,
L'oke Kalfari.

B'O ba pon mi l'oju
Ninu ife Re;
Da ibukun Re le,
Ori ebo naa;
Ki n f' ara mi fun O,
Lori pepe Re
B'ara ko aago naa,
Igbagbo y'o mu.

Gba mo ba n re ‘boji
Sinu ekuru;
T' ogo orun si n ko,
L’eti bebe naa;
Un o gbekel'ooto Re,
N' ijakadi 'ku
Oluwa, gb'emi mi,
S'iye ailopin.

title_english: I lay my sins on JESUS,
passage_english: MADE US ACCEPTED IN THE BELOVED. EPH. 1:6
passage_yoruba: ENI ITEWOGBA NINU AYANFE. EFESU 1:6
verses_english:
I lay my sins on JESUS,
The spotless Lamb of God!
He bears them all, and frees us
From the accursed load
I bring my guilt to JESUS,
To wash my crimson stains
White in His Blood most precious,
Till not a spot remains

I rest my soul on JESUS,
This weary soul of mine;
His Right Hand me embraces,
I on His Breast recline.
I love the Name of JESUS,
Immanuel, CHRIST, the LORD;
Like fragrance on the breezes,
His Name abroad is pour'd

I long to be like JESUS,
Meek, loving, lowly, mild;
I long to be like JESUS,
The FATHER's holy Child:
I long to be with JESUS,
Amid the heav'nly throng;
To sing with saints His praises,
To learn the Angels' song
verses_yoruba:
Mo kese mi le Jesu,
Od’ agutan Mimo,
O ru gbogbo eru mi,
O so mi d‘omnira
Mo ru ebi mi to wa
K’o we eeri mi nu,
K‘eje Re iyebiye
Le so mi di funfun.

Mo k‘aini mi le Jesu,
Tire l‘ohun gbogbo;
O w‘arun mi gbogbo san,
O r‘emi mi pada,
Mo ko ibanuje mi,
Eru at‘aniyan
Le Jesu, O si gba mi,
Ogba irora mi.

Mo gb’ okan mi le Jesu,
Okan aare mi yii;
Ow‘otun Re gba mi mu,
Mo sinmi l‘aya Re,
Mo fe oruko Jesu
Emanueli, Krist‘
Bi oorun didun yika
Ni oruko Re je.

Mo fe ki n ri bi Jesu,
T’okan Re kun fun ‘fe
Mo fe ki n ri bi Jesu,
Omo Mimo Baba;
Mo fe ki mba Jesu gbe
Larin egbe mimo,
Ki n korin iyin titi,
Orin t'Angeli n ko.

title_english: Come, ye sinners, poor and wretched,
passage_english: AND WHOSOEVER WILL, LET HIM TAKE THE WATER OF LIFE FREELY. REV. 22:17
passage_yoruba: ENIKENI TI O BA SI FE, KI O GBA OMI IYE NAA LOFE. IFIHAN 22:17
verses_english:
Let not conscience make you linger,
Nor of fitness fondly dream;
All the fitness He requireth
Is to feel your need of Him.
This He gives you,’Tis the Spirit’s rising beam.

Saints and angels joined in concert,
Sing the praises of the Lamb;
While the blissful seats of Heaven
Sweetly echo with His name.
Hallelujah, sinners here may sing the same.
verses_yoruba:
Otosi elese, e wa,
Wa ni wakati aanu,
Jesu setan lati gba yin,
O kun f’ aanu at‘ife.
O si le see, o mura tan, ma foya.

Eyin alaini, e wa gba
Ogo Olorun lofe
Gbagbo tooto, ‘ronu tooto
Oor‘-ofe ti o n fa wa
Wa ‘do Jesu laini owo, sa wa ra.

Ma je k‘okan yin da yin ro,
Mase ro ti aye yin,
Gbogbo yiye t‘O n beere ni
Ki e si mo aini yin
Eyii to fun yin bi ‘mole lokan yin.

Eyin t’eru n pa, t’aare mu
T’e sonu t’e si segbe
Bi e duro tit‘e o fi san
E ki yoo wa rara;
F‘elese ni, Oun ko wa f‘olododo.

Olorun goke l‘awo wa;
O n fi eje Re bebe,
Gbe ara lee patapata,
Ma gbekele ohun mi,
Jesu nikan l‘O le s‘elese loore.

Angeli at‘awon mimo
N korin ‘yin Odaguntan;
Gbohungbohun oruko Re
Si gba gbogbo orun kan,
Halleluya! elese lee gberin na.

title_english: Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
passage_english: FOR WHY WILL YE DIE, O HOUSE OF ISRAEL? EZEK. 33:11
passage_yoruba: NITORI KINI EYIN O SE KU ILE ISRAELI? ESEK. 33:11
verses_english:
Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Maker, asks you why?
God, who did your being give,
Made you with himself to live -
He the fatal cause demands,
Asks the work of his own hands,
Why, ye thankless creatures, why
Will ye cross his love, and die?

Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, your Saviour, asks you why?
God, who did your souls retrieve,
Died himself, that ye might live;
Will you let him die in vain?
Crucify your Lord again?
Why, ye ransomed sinners, why
Will you slight his grace, and die?

Sinners, turn, why will ye die?
God, the Spirit, asks you why?
He who all your lives hath strove,
Wooed you to embrace his love:
Will you not his grace receive?
Will you still refuse to live?
Why, ye long-sought sinners, why
Will you grieve your God, and die?

Dead, already dead within,
Spiritually dead in sin,
Dead to God while here you breathe,
Pant ye after second death?
Will you still in sin remain,
Greedy of eternal pain?
O ye dying sinners, why,
Why will you for ever die?
verses_yoruba:
Elese, e yipada,
Eese ti e o fi ku?
Eleda yin ni n bere
T’O fe ki e ba Oun gbe;
Oran nla ni Oun n bi yin,
Ise owo Re ni yin;
A! eyin alailope
Eese t‘ e o ko ‘fe Re?

Elese e yi pada,
Eese ti e o fi ku?
Olugbala ni n bere;
Enit‘O gb‘emi yin la;
Iku Re yoo jasan bi?
E o tun kan mo ‘gi bi?
Eni ‘rapada eese
Ti e o gan oore Re?

Elese, e yipada,
Eese ti e o fi ku?
Emi mimo ni n bere
Ti n f’ojo gbogbo ro yin;
E ki o ha gb‘oore Re?
E o ko iye sibe?
Ati n wa yin pe, eese
T‘ e n bi Olorun ninu?

Iyemeji ha n se yin
Pe, ife ni Olorun
E ki o ha gb’oro Re?
K‘e gba ileri Re gbo?
W‘Oluwa lodo yin,
Jesu sun, w‘omije Re;
Eje Re pelu n ke pe:
Eese ti e o fi ku?

title_english: Jesus, I will trust thee, trust thee with my soul;
title_yoruba: Jesu, emi o fi okan mi fun O
passage_english: HE IS ABLE TO KEEP THAT WHICH I HAVE COMMITTED UNTO HIM AGAINST THAT DAY. II TIM. 1:12
passage_yoruba: OUN LE PA EYII TI MO FI LE E LOWO MO. II TIM. 1:12
verses_english:
Jesus, I will trust thee, trust thee with my soul;
guilty, lost, and helpless, thou canst make me whole.
There is none in heaven or on earth like thee:
thou hast died for sinners--therefore, Lord, for me.

Jesus, I will trust thee, Name of matchless worth,
spoken by the angel at thy wondrous birth;
written, and for ever, on thy cross of shame,
sinners read and worship, trusting in that Name.

Jesus, I will trust thee, pondering thy ways,
full of love and mercy all thine earthly days;
sick men gathered round thee, sinners sought thine aid,
and on sick and sinful healing hands were laid.

Jesus, I will trust thee, trust thy written word,
though thy voice of pity I have never heard.
When thy Spirit teacheth, to my taste how sweet--
only may I hearken, sitting at thy feet.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, emi o fi okan mi fun O
Mo jebi, mo gbe, sugbon
‘Wo le gba mi,
L’aye ati l’orun, ko seni bi Re,
Iwo ku f’elese, f’ emi na pelu.

Jesu, mo le sinmi le oruko Re,
Ti Angeli wa so, l’ojo ibi Re,
‘Yi t’a ko ti o han lor’agbelebu,
Ti elese si ka, won si teriba.

Jesu, emi ko le sai gbekele O.
Ise Re l’ aye kun f’aanu at’ ife
Elese yi O ka, adete ri O,
Ko s’eni buruju, t’ Iwo ko le gba.

Jesu, mo le gbeke mi le oro Re,
Bi n ko tile gbo ohun aanu Re ri,
Gbat’ Emi Re n koni, o ti dun po to,
Ki n sa f’ibarale k’ eko lese Re.

Jesu toto-toto, mo gbekele O,
Enikeni t’ o wa, ‘Wo ki o ta nu,
Ooto ni ‘leri Re owon l’eje Re,
Wonyi n’ igbala mi, ‘Wo l’Olorun mi.

title_english: Abide among us with Thy grace,
title_yoruba: F’oore- ofe Re ba wa gbe,
passage_english: GRACE BE WITH YOU. II TIMOTHY 4:22
passage_yoruba: OORE-OFE KI O WA PELU YIN. II TIM 4:22
verses_english:
Abide among us with Thy grace,
Lord Jesus, evermore,
Nor let us e'er to sin give place,
Nor grieve Him we adore.

Abide among us with Thy word,
Redeemer, whom we love,
Thy help and mercy here afford,
And life with Thee above.

Abide among us with Thy ray,
O Light that lighten'st all,
And let Thy truth preserve our way,
Nor suffer us to fall.

Abide with us to bless us still,
O bounteous Lord of peace;
With grace and power our souls fulfill,
Our faith and love increase.

Abide among us as our shield,
O Captain of Thy host;
That to the world we may not yield,
Nor e'er forsake our post.

Abide with us in faithful love,
Our God and Saviour be,
Thy help at need, oh, let us prove,
And keep us true to Thee.
verses_yoruba:
F’oore- ofe Re ba wa gbe,
Jesu Olugbala;
Ki eni arekereke,
K’ o ma le kolu wa.

F’ oro mimo Re ba wa gbe,
Jesu iyebiye;
K’ a ri igbala oun iye,
Lohun, bi nihinyi.

Fi ’bukun Tire ba wa gbe,
Oluwa Oloore;
Fi ebun orun rere Re,
Fun wa l’ opolopo.

Fi ’pamo Tire ba wa gbe,
Iwo Alagbara:
K’ awa k’ o le sa ota ti,
K’ aiye k’ o ma de wa.

Fi otito Re ba wa gbe,
Olorun Oloore:
Ninu ’ponju, wa ba wa gbe,
Mu wa fi ori tii.

F’ Alaafia Re ba wa gbe,
Nigbat’ iku ba de;
N’ iseju naa, so fun wa, pe,
Igbala yin ti de.

title_english: Father of mercy who loved us
passage_english: HEAR MY PRAYER, O LORD. PSALM 102:1
passage_yoruba: GBO ADURA MI, OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 102:1.
verses_english:
Father of mercy who loved us
I lift my heart to Thee
Thy mighty power has saved our soul
We raise our song to Thee.

Thine all alone we love to be
We offer, Lord, our hearts
Your creatures who are born again
Submit ourselves to Thee.

O Holy Spirit, come to me
Reveal the Saviour's love
Grant Lord, to me that I may walk
E'er in my Saviour's love
verses_yoruba:
Tire paapaa l‘awa fe se,
Gb‘okan wa fun ebo;
O da wa, o si tun wa bi,
Af’ara wa fun O.

Emi Mimo, wa sodo mi,
Fife Oluwa han;
Fun mi k‘emi k‘o le maa rin,
N‘ife Oluwa mi.

title_english: By faith, I crave to walk with God
passage_english: WALK BEFORE ME, AND BE THOU PERFECT. GENESIS 17:1
passage_yoruba: MAA RIN NIWAJU MI KI IWO KI O SI PE. GENESISI 17:1.
verses_english:
By faith, I crave to walk with God
The end of my journey is heaven
?Thy rod and staff, they comfort me?
The way Thou hast paved is the best.

I walk amidst great wilderness
Where many souls have lost their way
But He that leads me on the way
Will not allow my foot to stray.

I walk amidst dangers and snares
Earth and hell against me arrayed
By Thy great power I have gone through
By faith alone, I have victory.

I pity those who are boasting
Of fleeting pleasures of this life
Oh, Jesus, let me walk with Thee
My Lord, my Saviour and my friend.
verses_yoruba:
Mo f‘igbagbo b‘Olorun rin
Orun ni opin ajo mi;
Op‘at‘ ogo Re tu mi n‘nu,
Ona didun l‘ona t‘o la.

Mo n rin l‘aarin aginju nla,
Nibi opolopo ti nu;
Sugbpn oun t‘o samona wa,
Ko je ki n sina, ti n ba nu.

Mo n la ‘kekun t‘oun ewu ja,
Aye at‘Esu kolu mi;
Agbara Re ni mo fi la,
Igbagbo si ni ‘segun mi.

Mo n kanu awon ti n hale,
F‘afe aye ti n koja yii;
Oluwa je ki n ba O rin,
Olugbala at‘Ore mi.

title_english: God of mystery, The only way
passage_english: WHO IS A GOD LIKE YOU, PARDONING INIQUITY. MICAH 7:18
passage_yoruba: TANI OLORUN BI IWO, TI O N DARI AISEDEDE JI. MIKA 7:18
verses_english:
God of mystery, The only way
No other way like unto Thee;
All Thine glory and all Thine grace,
Reveal Thee as Holy God.
Who art the God that forgives?
Benevolence of who’s like Thine?

In mystery and joy we receive
Forgiveness and pardon from God;
Total pardon for greatest sin,
Sealed with precious Jesus’ blood.
Who art the God that forgives, etc.

May Thy worthy grace we plead,
Thy worthy loving kindness,
Fill all the earth with Thy praise,
With Angelic host above.
Who art the God that forgives, etc.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun ’yanu! ona kan
Ti o dabi Tire ko si:
Gbogb’ ogo oore- ofe Re,
L’ o farahan bi Olorun.
Tal’ Olorun ti n dariji,
Oore tal’ o po bi Tire?

N’ iyanu at’ ayo l’ a gba
Idariji Olorun wa;
’Dariji f’ ese t’ o tobi,
T’ a f’ eje Jesu s’ edidi.
Tal’ Olorun, & c.

Je ki ore- ofe Re yi,
Ife iyanu nla Re yi,
K’o f’ iyin kun gbogbo aiye,
Pelu egbe Angel l’ oke.
Tal’ Olorun, & c.

title_english: Art thou weary, art thou languid,
title_yoruba: Aare mu o, aye su o,
passage_english: IF ANY MAN SERVE ME, LET HIM FOLLOW ME; AND WHERE I AM, THERE SHALL ALSO MY SERVANT BE. JOHN 12:26
passage_yoruba: ENIKENI TI O BA N SIN MI KI O MAA TO MI LEYIN, NIBITI MO BA WA, NIBE NI IRANSE MI YIO MAA GBE PELU. JOHANU 12:26
verses_english:
Art thou weary, art thou languid,
Art thou sore distressed?
Come to Me, saith One, and coming,
Be at rest.

Hath He marks to lead me to Him,
If He be my Guide?
In His feet and hands are wound prints
And His side.

Hath He diadem, as monarch,
That His brow adorns?
Yes, a crown in very surety,
But of thorns.

If I find Him, if I follow,
What His guerdon here?
Many a sorrow, many a labor,
Many a tear.

If I still hold closely to Him,
What hath He at last?
Sorrow vanquished, labor ended,
Jordan passed.

If I ask Him to receive me,
Will He say me nay?
Not till earth and not till Heaven
Pass away.

Finding, following, keeping, struggling,
Is He sure to bless?
Saints, apostles, prophets, martyrs,
Answer, Yes!
verses_yoruba:
Aare mu o, aye su o,
Laalaa po fun o?
Jesu ni “Wa si odo Mi,
K’o sinmi.

Aami wo l‘emi o fi mo
Pe Oun l‘O npe mi?
Aam‘iso wa lowo ati
Ese Re.

O ha ni ade bi Oba
Ti mo le fi mo?
Tooto ade wa lori Re,
T‘egun ni.

Bi mo ba rii, bi mo telee,
Kinni ere mi?
Opolopo iya ati
‘Banuje

Bi mo tele tit‘aye mi
Kini un o ri gba?
Ekun a dopin un o sinmi
Tit‘aye.

Bi mo beere pe k‘O gba mi
Yoo ko fun mi bi?
B‘orun at‘aye n koja lo
Ko je ko.

Bi mo ba rii, ti mo tele,
Yoo ha bukun mi?
Awon ogun orun wipe,
Yio see.

title_english: Not all the blood of beasts
passage_english: THE BLOOD OF JESUS CHRIST HIS SON CLEANSETH US FROM ALL SIN. 1 JOHN 1:7
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU KRISTI OMO RE NI N WE ‘WA NU KURO NINU ESE WA GBOGBO. 1 JOHN 1:7
verses_english:
Not all the blood of beasts
On Jewish altars slain
Could give the guilty conscience peace
Or wash away the stain.

But Christ, the heav’nly Lamb,
Takes all our sins away;
A sacrifice of nobler name
And richer blood than they.

My faith would lay her hand
On that dear head of Thine,
While, like a penitent, I stand,
And there confess my sin.

My soul looks back to see
The burdens Thou didst bear
When hanging on the cursèd tree,
And hopes her guilt was there.

Believing, we rejoice
To see the curse remove;
We bless the Lamb with cheerful voice,
And sing His bleeding love.
verses_yoruba:
Gbogbo eje eran
Ti pepe awon Ju
Ko le f’okan l‘ alaafia,
Ko le we eeri nu.

Krisiti Od‘aguntan,
M’ese wa gbogbo lo;
Ebo t‘o ni oruko nla,
T’o ju eje won lo.

Mo f’ igbagbo gb’owo
Le ori Re owon,
B’ enit’o ronupiwada
Mo jewo ese mi.

Okan mi n pada wo
Eru t’Iwo ti ru
Nigbati a kan O mo ‘gi
Ese re wa nibe.

Awa n yo ni ‘gbagbo
Bi, egun ti kuro
Awa n yin Odo-aguntan,
A n korin ife Re

title_english: Come, O Thou all-victorious Lord!
passage_english: TURN YE FROM YOUR EVIL WAYS; FOR WHY WILL YE DIE, O HOUSE OF ISRAEL? EZEK. 33:11
passage_yoruba: E YIPADA KURO NINU ONA BUBURU YIN, NITORI KINI EYIN O SE KU? ESEK. 33:11
verses_english:
Come, O Thou all-victorious Lord!
Thy power to us make known;
Strike with the hammer of Thy Word,
And break these hearts of stone.

O that we all might now begin
Our foolishness to mourn;
And turn at once from every sin,
And to our Savior turn.

Give us ourselves and Thee to know,
In this our gracious day;
Repentance unto life bestow,
And take our sins away.

Conclude us first in unbelief,
And freely then release;
Fill every soul with sacred grief,
And then with sacred peace.

Impoverish, Lord, and then relieve,
And then enrich the poor;
The knowledge of our sickness give,
The knowledge of our cure.

That blessèd sense of guilt impart,
And then remove the load;
Trouble, and wash the troubled heart
In Thine atoning blood.

Our desperate state through sin declare,
And speak our sins forgiv’n;
By perfect holiness prepare,
And take us up to Heaven.
verses_yoruba:
Wa, Oluwa Olusegun,
Fi ipa Re han wa;
Si fi agbara oro Re
Fo okan lile wa.

Gbogbo wa ‘ba t‘oni bere
Si kaanu ‘sise wa,
K‘ a peyinda si ese wa,
K‘ a wa Olugbala!

Jek‘ a mo O k‘a mo ‘ra wa
Lojo aanu wa yii;
Yi wa pada k‘a ba le ye,
Si ko ese wa lo.

Fi opin si aigbagbo wa
K‘O si da wa n‘ide;
Jek‘a kedun fun ese wa.
K‘a le r‘ alaafia.

Re wa sile, tun gbe wa ro
Si bukun otosi;
Jek‘a mo riri arun wa,
Ati iwosan re.

Jek‘ a mo ebi ese wa.
Si m‘ebi naa Kuro;
We okan ti ese n daamu
N‘nu eje etutu.

F‘ ipo ewu t‘a wa han wa,
Si fese wa ji wa;
Se wa pe ni iwa-mimo,
Si mu wa lo s‘orun.

title_english: Ho! every one that thirsts, draw nigh:
title_yoruba: Gbogbo eni t‘oungbe n gbe, wa!
passage_english: HO, EVERY ONE THAT THIRSTETH, COME YE TO THE WATERS. ISAIAH 55:1
passage_yoruba: N JE GBOGBO ENITI OUNGBE N GBE E WA SI IBI OMI. ISAIAH 55:1
verses_english:
Ho! every one that thirsts, draw nigh:
’Tis God invites the fallen race:
Mercy and free salvation buy;
Buy wine, and milk, and gospel grace.

Come to the living waters, come!
Sinners, obey your Maker’s call;
Return, ye weary wanderers, home,
And find My grace is free for all.

See from the rock a fountain rise!
For you in healing streams it rolls;
Money ye need not bring, nor price,
Ye laboring, burdened, sin-sick souls.
verses_yoruba:
Wa s‘ibi omi iye, wa!
Elese, je ‘pe Eleda,
Pada, asako, bo wa ‘le,
Ofe ni oore mi fun yin!

Wo apatati n sun jade!
Isun ‘marale n san fun o,
Eyin ti eru ese n pa,
E wa, laimu owo l‘owo.

Ko s‘iparo t‘e le mu wa,
E f’ini yin gbogbo seyin,
F‘igboya gb‘ebun Olorun,
Ni idariji n‘nu Jesu.

title_english: Jesus upon Thee revealeth
passage_english: CHRIST AND AARON. HEBREWS 7:11
passage_yoruba: KRISTI AT’AARONI. HEBERU 7:11
verses_english:
Jesus upon Thee revealeth
Multitude of glories
More in quantum than precious stones
Seen upon Aaron’s robe.

Of ought sacrifice offered,
All for sins committed:
Jesus Thou unblemished and pure
And sacred is Thine being.

Jesus King of glory reigneth
In hea-venly Zion:
Similitude of the slain Lamb,
And of our Greatest priest.

Solicitor before our God,
Forever shall endure;
Grant Him my soul thy petitions,
Fatherly grace receive.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, l’ara Re l’awa nwo
Egbeegberun ogo:
Ju t’ okuta iyebiye,
T’ agbada Aaroni.

Won ko le sai ko rubo naa,
Fun ese ara won:
Iwa Re pe, ko l’abawon,
Mimo si l’Eda Re.

Jesu Oba ogo gunwa
L’Oke Sion t’ orun:
Bi Odo- agutan t’a pa,
Bi Alufa nla wa.

Alagbawi lodo Baba,
Ti yoo wa titi lai;
Gb’ ejo re fun, ’wo okan mi,
Gb’ oore- ofe Baba.

title_english: Wonderful story of love;
passage_english: WHAT MANNER OF LOVE THE FATHER HATH BESTOWED UPON US. I JOHN 3:1
passage_yoruba: E WO IRU IFE TI BABA FI FE WA. 1 JOHN 3:1
verses_yoruba:
Itan iyanu t’ife!
So fun mi l’ekan si
Itan iyanu t’ife!
E gbe orin naa ga!
Awon Angeli rohin re,
awon oluso si gbaagbo
Elese, iwo ki o gbo?
Itan iyanu t’ ífe!

Itan iyanu t’ife!
B’ iwo tile sako
Itan iyanu t’ife!
Sibe o n pe loni
Lat’ ori oke kalfari,
lati orisun didun ni
Lati isedale aiye;
Itan iyanu t’ife.

Itan iyanu t’ife!
Jesu ni isinmi
Itan iyanu t’ife!
Fun awon olooto
To sun ni ile nla orun,
Pel’awon t’o saju wa lo
Won nko orin ayo orun,
itan iyanu t’ife.
chorus_english: Wonderful! Wonderful! Wonderful, wonderful story of love.
chorus_yoruba: Iyanu! Iyanu! Iyanu! Itan iyanu t’ife

title_english: O Jesus, thou art standing
passage_english: BEHOLD, I STAND AT THE DOOR AND KNOCK. REVELATION 3:20
passage_yoruba: WO O! EMI DURO TI ILEKUN EMI SI NKANKUN. IFIHAN 3:20
verses_english:
O Jesus, thou art standing
Outside the fast-closed door,
In lowly patience waiting
To pass the threshold o'er:
Shame on us, Christian brothers,
His name and sign who bear,
O shame, thrice shame upon us,
To keep him standing there!

O Jesus, thou art knocking;
And lo, that hand is scarred,
And thorns thy brow encircle,
And tears thy face have marred:
O love that passeth knowledge,
So patiently to wait!
Oh sin that hath no equal,
So fast to bar the gate!

Jesus, thou art pleading
In accents meek and low,
"I died for you, my children,
And will ye treat me so?"
O Lord, with shame and sorrow
We open now the door;
Dear Savior, enter, enter,
And leave us nevermore.
verses_yoruba:
A! Jesu, Iwo n duro,
Lode, lehin ’lekun;
Iwo fi suuru duro,
Lati koja sile :
’Tiju ni fun wa, Kristian,
Awa ti n j’ooko Re!
Itiju gidigidi,
Bi a ba joo Re sode.

A! Jesu, Iwo n kankun
Owo na si l’ apa;
Egun yi ori Re ka,
Ekun b’ oju Re je:
A! ife ’yanu l’ eyii,
T’o n fi suuru duro!
A! ese ti ko l’ egbe,
T’o ha ’lekun pinpin!

A! Jesu, Iwo mbebe
L’ ohun pelepele,
“Mo ku f’ enyin omo mi
Bayi l’ e se mi si ?
Oluwa, a silekun
N’ ikanu on ’tiju !
Olugbala, wa wole
Ma fi wa sile lo.

title_english: Revive Thy work, O Lord,
passage_english: REVIVE THY WORK. HABAKKUK 3:2
passage_yoruba: OLUWA, MU ISE RE SOJI. HABAKKUKU 3:2
verses_english:
Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Thy mighty arm make bare;
Speak with the voice that wakes the dead,
And make Thy people hear.

Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Create soul-thirst for Thee;
And hungering for the bread of life
O may our spirits be.

Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Exalt Thy precious name;
And, by the Holy Ghost, our love
For Thee and Thine inflame.

Revive Thy work, O Lord!
And bless to all Thy Word!
And may its pure and sacred truth
In living faith be heard!

Revive Thy work, O Lord,
Give Pentecostal showers;
The glory shall be all Thine own,
The blessing, Lord, be ours.
verses_yoruba:
Ji’se Re nde, Jesu!
Fi agbara Re han,
Fo’hun to le j‘oku dide,
Mu k‘eniyan Re gbo

Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu,
Mu k‘ongbe Re gbe wa,
Si mu k‘ebi pa okan wa;
Fun onje iye na.

Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu,
Gbe oruko Rega,
Mu k‘ife Re kun okan wa,
Nipa Emi Mimo.

Ji ‘se Re nde, Jesu,
F‘agbara f‘oro Re,
Ka gbo ‘hinrere ‘bukun Re.
Ni igbagbo aye.

Ji‘se Re nde, Jesu,
Ro ‘jo itura Re,
Ogo yo je Tire nikan,
K‘ibukun je tiwa.

title_english: There were ninety and nine that safely lay
passage_english: ‘REJOICE WITH ME, FOR I HAVE FOUND MY SHEEP WHICH WAS LOST!’ LUKE 15:6
passage_yoruba: BA MI YO, MO RI AGUNTAN MI. LUKU 15:6
verses_english:
There were ninety and nine that safely lay
In the shelter of the fold.
But one was out on the hills away,
Far off from the gates of gold.
Away on the mountains wild and bare.
Away from the tender Shepherd’s care.

“Lord, whence are those blood drops all the way
That mark out the mountain’s track?”
“They were shed for one who had gone astray
Ere the Shepherd could bring him back.”
“Lord, whence are Thy hands so rent and torn?”
“They are pierced tonight by many a thorn;

And all through the mountains, thunder riven
And up from the rocky steep,
There arose a glad cry to the gate of Heaven,
“Rejoice! I have found My sheep!”
And the angels echoed around the throne,
Rejoice, for the Lord brings back His own!”
verses_yoruba:
Mokandilogorun dubule je
Labe ooji nin’ agbo;
Sugbon okan je lo or’ oke,
Jinna s’ ilekun wura:
Jina rere lor’ oke sisa,
Jinna rere s’ Olusagutan.

“Mokandilogorunn Tire leyii :
Jesu, won ko ha to fun O?”
Olusagutan dahun, “Temi yii
Ti sako lo lodo mi;
B’ ona tile ri palapala,
Ngo w’ aginju lo w’ agutan mi”

“Nibo ni eje ni ti n kan wa,
T’ o f’ ona or’ oke han?
“ A taa sile f’ enikan t’o sako,
K’ Olusagutan to mu un pada.”
“Jesu kil’ o gun owo Re be?”
“Egun pupo l’ o gun mi nibe.”

Sugbon ni gbogbo ori oke
Ati lori apata,
Igbe ta d’ oke orun wipe,
“Yo mo r’ agutan mi he.”
Yite ka l’ awon angel n gba,
“Yo, Jesu m’ ohun Tire pada.”

title_english: My God, my Father, does Thou call,
title_yoruba: Olorun, Baba mi, Wo n pe,
passage_english: INCLINE YOUR EAR, AND COME UNTO ME: HEAR, AND YOUR SOUL SHALL LIVE. ISAIAH 55:3
passage_yoruba: E TETILELE, KI E SI WA SI ODO MI, E GBO OKAN YIN O SI YE" - ISAIAH. 55:3
verses_english:
My God, my Father, does Thou call,
Thy long-lost wandering child to thee,
And canst thou wilt thou pardon all?
I come, I come, Lord save thou me

O Jesus, art thou passing by,
With all thy goodness, grace, and powar,
And dost thou hear my broken cry?
I come, I come, in mercies hour.

O Holy Spirit, is it thou,
My tenderest Friend refused too long?
And dost Thou pleading, striving now?
I come, I come, make weakness strong.

Yes, Lord, I come, Thy heart of love,
ls moving, kindling, drawing mine,
I cast me at thy feet to prove,
The bliss, the heaven of being Thine.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, Baba mi, Wo n pe,
Asako omo Re mora?
Iwo o ha dariji mi?
Mo de, mo de, joo gba mi la.

A! Jesu, Iwo n rekoja,
Pelu ore at‘agbara?
'Wo ko ha n gbo igbe mi?
Mo de, mo de, saanu fun mi.

A! Emi Mimo Iwo ni?
Ore ti mo ti sati pe!
Wo ha n bebe fun mi sibe?
Mo de, mo de, m'alailera le.

Mo de, Oluwa, ife Re,
Ni o n ro mi t'o si nfa mi,
Mo wole lese re, ki n mo,
B'o ti dun lati je Tire.

title_english: Return, O wanderer, to thy home ?
passage_english: O ISRAEL, RETURN UNTO THE LORD THY GOD. HOSEA 14:1
passage_yoruba: ISRAELI YIPADA SI OLUWA OLORUN RE. HOSEA 14:1
verses_english:
Return, O wanderer, to thy home ?
Thy Father calls for thee;
No longer now an exile roam,
In guilt and misery:
Return, return, return.

Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
'Tis Jesus calling for thee:
The Spirit and the bride say, Come,
Oh, now for refuge flee:
Return, return, return.

Return, O wanderer, to thy home,
'Tis madness to delay;
There are no pardons in the tomb,
And brief is mercy's day:
Return, return, return
verses_yoruba:
Pada, asako s'ile re,
Baba re l‘o n pe o,
Ma se alarinkiri mo,
Nin‘ese at‘osi;
Pada; pada.

Pada, asako s‘ile re,
Jesu l‘o sa pe o,
Emi pelu Ijo si n pe,
Yara, sa asala;
Pada, pada.

title_english: Depth of mercy! Can there be,
passage_english: HOW SHALL I GIVE THEE UP HOSEA 11:8
passage_yoruba: "EMI O HA SI JOWO RE IOWO" HOSEA - 11:8
verses_english:
Depth of mercy! Can there be,
Mercy still reserve for me?
Can my God His wrath forbear?
Me, the chief of sinners, spares,
l have long withstood His grace,
Long provoked Him to His face,
Would not hearken to His calls,
Grieved Him by a thousand falls.

His patience, grace l exploit,
Me He still delights to spare,
Cries- how shall I give thee up,
Bids me take salvation‘s cup,
There for me the saviour stands,
Show His wounds, and spreads,
His Hands God is love, I know,
I feel Jesus weeps, and loves me still.

Jesus, answer from above,
Is not all thy nature love,
Wilt thou not the wrong forget,
Suffer me to kiss Thy feet?
If I rightly read thy heart,
If thou all compassion art,
Bow thine ear, in mercy low,
Pardon and accept me now.

Pity from thine eye let fall,
By a look my soul recall,
Now the stone of flesh convert,
Cast a look, and break my heart,
Now incline me to repent Fasting!
my sin cast away
Let me foul revolt deplore,
Weep, believe, and sin no more.
verses_yoruba:
Ibu aanu! O le je,
Pe aanu si n be fun mi?
Olorun le mu suuru,
F’ em’ olori elese?
Mo ti ko oor‘ofe Re,
Mo bi n'nu lojukoju,
N ko f‘eti si ipe Re,
Mo so ninu I'ainiye.

Mo tan a ni suuru to;
Sibe o si da mi si,
O n ke, ‘Un o se jowo re!
Sa gba aago igbala,
Olugbala mi n duro,
O si n fi ogbe Re han,
Mo mo, ife l‘Olorun,
Jesu, n sun, O feran mi.

Jesu, dahun lat‘oke,
Ife k'iwa Re gbogbo
‘Wo ki y'o dariji mi,
Ki n wole ii ese Re?
Bi m'ba mo inu ‘re Re,
B’Iwo 'ba se alaanu,
F’aanu deti Re sile,
Dariji, k'o si gba mi.

F’oju iyonu wo mi,
Fi wiwo oju pe mi,
Mu okan okuta ro;
Yipada, ro mi lokan,
Mu’mi ronupiwada;
Je ki n gbaawe f’ese mi,
Ki n si kaanu ise mi,
Ki ngbagbo, ki nye dese.

title_english: Lord, I hear of showers of blessing,
passage_english: THERE SHALL BE SHOWER OF BLESSING. EZEK. 34:26
passage_yoruba: OJO IBUKUN YIO SI RO. ESEK. 34:26
verses_english:
Have I been in sin long sleeping,
long been slighting, grieving thee?
Has the world my heart been keeping?
O forgive and rescue me;
Even me, even me,
O forgive and rescue me.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, mo gbo pe, Iwo
Nro ojo 'bukun kiri;
Itunu fun okan are,
Ro ojo naa sori mi.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

Ma koja Baba Olore,
Bi ese mi tile po;
'Wo le fi mi sile, sugbon
Je k'anu Re ba le mi.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

Ma koja mi, Olugbala
Jek' emi le ro mo O;
Emi n wa oju rere Re,
Pe mi mo awon t' O n pe.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

Ma koja mi, Emi Mimo,
'Wo le la 'ju afoju;
Eleri itoye Jesu,
Soro ase naa si mi.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

Mo ti sun fonfon nin' ese,
Mo bi O binu koja;
Aiye ti de okan mi, jo
Tu mi, k' o dariji mi.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

Ma koja mi, dariji mi,
Fa mi mora, Oluwa;
'Gba O nf' ibukun f' elomi,
Ma sai f' ibukun fun mi.
An' emi! An’emi
Ro ojo naa sori mi!

title_english: The Spirit O sinner in mercy doth move,
title_yoruba: lwo elese, Emi n fi aanu pe,
passage_english: "QUENCH NOT THE SPIRIT" - 1 THESS. 5:19
passage_yoruba: IKILO META - MA BA A JA, MA BI I NINU, MA PA INA EMI" - 1 TESS. 5:19
verses_english:
The Spirit O sinner in mercy doth move,
Thy heart so long hardened or sin to reprove,
Resist not the spirit nor longer delay,
God's gracious entreaties may end with today.

O Child of the kingdom, from sin‘s service cease,
Be filled with the spirit, with comfort and peace,
Oh, grief not the spirit, thy teacher is He,
That Jesus thy Saviour may glorified be.

Defiled is the temple it is beauty laid low,
On God‘s holy altar the embers faint glow,
By love yet rekindled, a flame may be fann'd,
Oh, quench not the spirit, the Lord is at hand.
verses_yoruba:
lwo elese, Emi n fi aanu pe,
Okan re t‘o ti yigbi ninu ese;
Mase ba Emi ja, ma pe titi mo,
Gb ‘ebun Olorun re Ie pari loni.

Omo Ijoba, mas'eru ese mo;
Gb’ebun Emi Mimo ati itunu,
Ma bi Emi ninu, Oluko re ni,
K’a ba le se Olugbala re logo.

Tempili d'ibaje, ewa re d‘ile,
lna pepe Olorun fere ku tan,
Bi a fi ife daa, O si le tun ran;
Mase pa ‘na Emi, Oluwa n bo wa.

title_english: Abundant joy who can’st recount
title_yoruba: Tani le so t’ayo ti n be
passage_english: BRING OUT THE BEST ROBE AND PUT IT ON HIM. LUKE 15:22
passage_yoruba: E MU AAYO ASO WA KANKAN, KI E SI FI WO O. LUKU 15:22
verses_english:
Abundant joy who can’st recount
In the courtyard of paradise;
When the prodigal shall return,
To attain heirship of glory?

Heartily, gladly Father gaze
On the fruit of His endless love;
Gladly the son gaze on to see
The reward of His painful strife.

Gladly the Holy Spirit gaze.
On the renewed and sacred heart;
All heav’nly saints and Angels sing
The salvation hymns of their King.
verses_yoruba:
Tani le so t’ayo ti n be
Ni agbala Paradise;
Gbat’ amusua ba pada,
T’o si di arole ogo?

Ni ayo ni Baba fi wo,
Eso ife Re ailopin;
L’ayo l’ Omo wo ’le, t’o ri
Ere iwaya- ija Re.

Tayotayo l’ Emi si n wo,
Okan mimo t’ O n so dotun;
Awon mimo at’ Angel n ko
Orin ibile Oba won.

title_english: Praises, honour and majesty,
passage_english: “REJOICE GREATLY, O DAUGHTER OF ZION! SHOUT, O DAUGHTER OF JERUSALEM! BEHOLD, YOUR KING IS COMING TO YOU. ZECH. 9:9
passage_yoruba: YO GIDIGIDI IWO OMOBINRIN SIONI, HO, IWO OMOBINRIN JERUSALEMU, KIYESII OBA RE N BOW A SOSO RE. SEKERAIAH 9:9
verses_english:
Praises, honour and majesty,
Be unto the Lord Jesus Christ.
The children singing Hosanna,
When Jesus rode upon donkey.
Hosanna is our song today,
Accept our praises, Jesus Christ.

We spread our garments and palm leaves,
On path for the King of Israel.
In lowliness entered Salem,
Behold our King riding on me
O Thou who clear'd the Temple clean,
Accept our praise Jesus Christ.

Hosanna unto David's Son,
Hosanna sing song of sweetness.
To the king who humble Himself,
Who came to the world in our form,
Work'd for salvation of our form,
Accept our praises Jesus Christ.

O that we could be He is
O that we could be known as Him.
Humble thyself ye arrogant,
That the work of Jesus on us
May make us the children of light,
And His praises may be abound.

Holy Jesus Christ Thee we praise,
Clean us as Thou cleansed Thy temple.
Wash away our unfilthiness,
Make us know the worth of Thy work.
That Thy work may not be vain,
And take us to eternal life.
verses_yoruba:
Iyin, ope at‘olanla
Fun Jesu Kristi Oluwa;
Awon ‘mode n ke Hosaanah
‘Gba Jesu gun ketekete,
Hosanna l‘orin wa loni,
Jesu, jowo gba iyin wa.

A te aso at‘imo ‘pe
S‘ona fun Oba Israel;
O wo Salemu ni ‘rele,
W‘ Oba lori ketekete,
‘Wo to we Tempili ni mo,
Gba iyin ati ope wa.

Hosanna s‘Omo Dafidi,
Hosanna, e korin didun
S‘Oba to mu ipo ‘rele,
T‘O wa s‘aye l‘awo eda
Fun ise ‘gbala iran wa;
Jesu, jowo gba iyin wa.

A ba le ri bi Oun tiri,
A ba le wa bi Oun ti wa,
K‘agberaga re ‘ra sile
Ki ise Jesu lori wa
Le so wa di omo ‘mole
Ki iyin Re le maa po si.

Jesu Mimo, Iwo l‘a yin,
We wa mo bi Tempili Re,
We egbin okan wa kuro,
Je k‘a mo riri ise Re
Ki laalaa Re ma ba j‘asan;
Si mu wa de ibi iye.

title_english: All glory, laud, and honor
passage_english: "HOSANNA TO THE SON OF DAVID!" MATT 21:9
passage_yoruba: HOSANNA, FUN OMO DAFIDI. MATT. 21:9
verses_english:
All glory, laud, and honor
to thee, Redeemer, King!
to whom the lips of children
made sweet hosannas ring.

The company of Angels
are praising thee on high;
and mortal men and all things
created make reply.

The people of the Hebrews
with palms before thee went;
our praise and prayer and anthems
before thee we present.

To thee before thy passion
they sang their hymns of praise;
to thee, now high exalted,
our melody we raise.

Thou didst accept their praises;
accept the prayers we bring,
who in all good delightest,
thou good and gracious King.
verses_yoruba:
Gbogb‘ogo, iyin, ola
Fun O, Oludande,
S‘Eni t‘awon omode
Nko Hosanna didun!

Egbe awon Maleka
N yin O l‘oke giga;
Awa at‘eda gbogbo
Si dapo gbe’rin naa.

Awon Hebru lo s‘aju
Pelu imo 0pe;
Iyin, adua at’orin
L‘a mu wa ‘waju Re

Si O saju iya Re,
Won korin iyin won!
‘Wo t‘a gbega nisiyi
L‘a nkorin iyin si.

‘Wo gba orin iyin won,
Gb‘adura t‘a mu wa,
‘Wo ti n yo s‘ohun rere,
Oba wa Oloore,
chorus_english:
Thou art the King of Israel,
thou David's royal Son,
who in the Lord's Name comest,
the King and Blessed One.
chorus_yoruba:
‘Wo l‘Oba Israeli,
Om‘alade Dafid‘
T‘O wa l‘oko Oluwa;
Oba Olubukun,

title_english: Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
passage_english: AND IN THY MAJESTY RIDE PROSPEROUSLY. PS 45:4
passage_yoruba: ATI NINU OLANLA RE MAA GESIN LO. ORIN DAFIDI 45:4.
verses_english:
Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
Hark! all the tribes Hosanna cry;
O Savior meek, pursue Thy road
With palms and scattered garments strowed.

Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die!
O Christ! Thy triumph now begin
Over captive death and conquered sin.

Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
The wingèd squadrons of the sky
Look down with sad and wondering eyes
To see the approaching sacrifice.

Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
Thy last and fiercest strife is nigh;
The Father, on His sapphire throne,
Expects His own anointed Son.

Ride on, ride on, in majesty!
In lowly pomp ride on to die;
Bow Thy meek head to mortal pain,
Then take, O God, Thy power, and reign.
verses_yoruba:
Maa gesin lo L‘olanla Re,
Gbo! gbogb‘ aye nke, “Hosanna”
Olugbala, Ma lo pele
Lori im‘ope at‘aso.

Maa gesin lo L‘olanla Re,
Ma f irele gesin lo ku;
Kristi, ‘segun Re bere na
Lori ese ati iku.

Maa gesin lo L‘olanla Re,
Ogun angeli lat‘ orun
Nfiyanu pelu ikanu
Wo ebo to sun mole yi.

Maa gesin lo L‘olanla Re,
Ija ikehin na de tan,
Baba lor‘ite Re lorun
Nreti ayanfe Omo Re.

Maa gesin lo L‘olanla Re,
Ma fi rele ge sin lo ku,
F‘ara da irora f’eda,
Leyin na nde, k‘O ma joba.

title_english: Hosanna unto David's son
passage_english: "HOSANNA TO THE SON OF DAVID!" MATT 21:9
passage_yoruba: HOSANNA, FUN OMO DAFIDI. MATT. 21:9
verses_english:
Hosanna unto David's son
Hosanna, raise the strain
For blessed is He that will come
In the name of the Lord

Hosanna unto David's son
The angel host did sing
All creatures, join the loud refrain
Hosanna to our king

Hosanna for the Hebrew throng
Spread palm fronds on the road
Hosanna we have brought our gifts
For to prepare His way

Both young and old sing hosanna
Before His suffering comes
Today we all sing hosanna
As Jesus reigns above

As Thou received the children's praise
Accept the prayers we bring
And join the heavenly host to sing
Hosanna to our king
verses_yoruba:
Hosana s‘Omo Dafidi:
Hosana! e korin!
Olubukun l‘ eni ti mbo
Loruko Oluwa.

Hosana s‘Omo Dafidi
L‘egbe Angeli nke;
Gbogb‘eda, e jumo gberin,
Hosana! s‘Oba wa.

Hosana! awon Heberu
Ja im‘ope s‘ona;
Hosana! a mu ebun wa
Fi tun ona Re se

T‘agba t‘ewe nke, Hosana!
Kijiya Re to de;
L‘oni, a si nko Hosana!
B‘o ti njoba loke.

B‘o ti gba 'yin won nigbana,
Jo, gba ebe wa yi
Lorun, k‘a le b' Angel‘ korin,
Hosana s‘Oba wa

title_english: Great High Priest, we see Thee stooping,
passage_english: FOR HE SHALL BEAR THEIR INIQUITIES. ISAIAH 53:11
passage_yoruba: OUN O RU AISEDEDE WON. ISAIAH 53:11
verses_english:
Great High Priest, we see Thee stooping,
With our names upon Thy breast;
In the garden groaning, drooping,
To the ground with horrors prest:
Wondering angels stood confounded,
To behold their Maker thus;
And can we remain unwounded,
When we know 'twas all for us?

Nothing but hy blood, O Jesus,
Can our wayward souls convert;
Nothing else from guilt release us,
Nothing else can melt the heart.
Law and terrors do but harden,
All the while they work alone;
But the sense of blood-bought pardon
Can dissolve a heart of stone

Jesus, all our consolations
Flow from Thee, the sovereign good;
Love, and faith, and hope, and patience,
All purchased by Thy blood:
From Thy fullness we receive them;
We have nothing of our own:
Freely Thou deligh'st to give them
To the needy who have none

title_english: Come let‘s unto Jesus attend,
title_yoruba: E je k’ a to Jesu wa lo,
passage_english: THESE ARE THEY WHICH FOLLOW THE LAMB WHITHERSOEVER HE GOETH. REV. 14:4
passage_yoruba: "AWON WONYI NI N TO ODOAGUTAN LEYIN, NIBIKIBI TI N RE." - IFIHAN. 14:4
verses_english:
Come let‘s unto Jesus attend,
At Garden Getsemane,
Where in deeper supplicalions,
Mercies of God His plea.

Behold the sacred head He bow‘d,
Deeply and sore depress‘d,
Our sins with agony,
He bore Iniquities of men.

Wretehed sinners' Thy Lord behold Saviour lmmaculate, Forsaken of Father above,
Rejecteth sake of thee.

Will thou un-repent on,
Him gaze Embracing yet thy sin,
Mercies day here and passing bye,
Mercies day shall be gone.
verses_yoruba:
E je k’ a to Jesu wa lo,
Ni agbala nla ni;
Nibiti O n lo gbadura,
Nibit' O n lo kaanu.

K' a wo b’ O ti dojubole,
T'o n mi imi edun;
Eru ese wa l‘O gberu,
Ese gbogbo aiye.

Elese, wo Oluwa re,
Eni mimo julo;
Nitori re ni Baba koo,
Aye si d‘ota Re.

Iwo O ha wo laironu,
Lai k’ ese re sile?
Ojo idariji n koja,
Ojo igbala nlo.

title_english: O come and mourn with me awhile;
title_yoruba: Ara, e wa ba mi sofo;
passage_english: “FOR THESE THINGS I WEEP; MY EYE, MY EYE OVERFLOWS WITH WATER. LAMENTATIONS 1:16
passage_yoruba: EMI N SOKUN NITORI NKAN WONYI; OJU MI! OJU MI SAN OMI SILE. EKUN JEREMIAH 1:16
verses_english:
Have we no tears to shed for Him,
While soldiers scoff and foes deride?
Ah! look how patiently He hangs;
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.

O break, O break, hard heart of mine!
Thy weak self-love and guilty pride
His Pilate and His Judas were:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.

A broken heart, a fount of tears,
Ask, and they will not be denied;
A broken heart love’s cradle is:
Jesus, our Lord, is crucified.
verses_yoruba:
Ko ha s’omije loju wa,
Bi awon Ju ti n fi sefe?
A! e wo, b’ O ti teriba;
A kan Jesu m’ agbelebu.

Bu s’ekun, okan lile mi!
Ese at’ igberaga re
L’o da Oluwa re l’ ebi;
A kan Jesu m’ agbelebu.

Wa duro ti agbelebu,
K’ eje ti n jade niha Re
Ba le maa san le o lori;
A kan Jesu m’ agbelebu.

Ibanuje at’ omije,
Beere, a ki o fi dun o;
’Banuje l’o n f’ ife re han:
A kan Jesu m‘ agbelebu.

Ife Baba, ese eda,
Nihin l’a ri agbara re;
Ife l’o si di Asegun,
A kan Olufe wa mo’gi.

title_english: Glory be to Jesus,
passage_english: THE PRECIOUS BLOOD OF CHRIST. I PETER 1:19
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU IYEBIYE. I PETER 1:19
verses_english:
Glory be to Jesus,
Who, in bitter pains,
Poured for me the lifeblood
From His sacred veins!

Grace and life eternal
In that blood I find;
Blest be His compassion,
Infinitely kind.

Blest through endless ages
Be the precious stream
Which from endless torments
Doth the world redeem.

Abel’s blood for vengeance
Pleaded to the skies;
But the blood of Jesus
For our pardon cries.

Oft as it is sprinkled
On our guilty hearts,
Satan in confusion
Terror struck departs.

Oft as earth exulting
Wafts its praise on high,
Angel hosts, rejoicing,
Make their glad reply.

Lift we then our voices,
Swell the mighty flood;
Louder still and louder
Praise the precious blood!
verses_yoruba:
Ogo ni fun Jesu
T‘o fi irora n la
Ta eje Re fun mi
Lati iha Re.

Mo r‘iye ailopin
Ninu eje naa;
Iyonu Re sa po,
Oore Re ki tan!

Ope ni titi lae
F‘eje ‘yebiye
T‘o ra aye pada
Kuro n‘nu egbe.

Eje Abel‘ n kigbe
Si orun f‘esan;
Sugbon eje Jesu n ke
Fun ‘dariji wa.

Nigbati a bu won
Okan ese wa,
Satan, n‘idamu re
F‘eru sa jade.

Nigbat‘ aye ba n yo,
T‘o n gbe ‘yin Re ga;
Awon ogun Angel'
A maa f‘ayo gbe.

N je e gbohun yin ga,
Ki iro naa dun!
Kikan lohun gooro
Yin Odagutan.

title_english: There is a green hill far away,
title_yoruba: Oke kan n be jinna rere,
passage_english: AND WHEN THEY WERE COME TO THE PLACE, WHICH IS CALLED CALVARY, THERE THEY CRUCIFIED HIM. LUKE 23:33
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI WON DE IBI TI A N PE NI IBI AGBARI, NIBE NI WON GBE KAN AN MO AGBELEBU. LUKE 23:33
verses_english:
There is a green hill far away,
Outside a city wall,
Where the dear Lord was crucified,
Who died to save us all.

We may not know, we cannot tell,
What pains He had to bear;
But we believe it was for us
He hung and suffered there.

He died that we might be forgiv’n,
He died to make us good,
That we might go at last to Heav’n,
Saved by His precious blood.

There was no other good enough
To pay the price of sin;
He only could unlock the gate
Of heaven and let us in.

O dearly, dearly, has He loved,
And we must love Him, too,
And trust in His redeeming blood,
And try His works to do.
verses_yoruba:
Oke kan n be jinna rere,
Leyin odi ilu;
Nibit‘ a kan Oluwa mo
Enit‘O ku fun wa.

A ko le mo, a ko le so
B‘irora Re ti to!
Sugbon a mo pe ‘tori wa
L‘o se jiya nibe.

Oku k‘a le ri‘dariji,
K‘a le huwa rere;
K‘ a si le d‘ orun nikeyin,
N’itoye eje Re

Ko tun s‘eni‘re miran mo
T‘o le sanwo ese!
Oun l‘O le silekun orun,
K‘o si gba wa sile.

A! b‘ife Re ti sowon to;
O ye k’a feran Re;'
K‘a si gbekele eje Re.
K‘a si se ife Re

title_english: Dark was the night, and cold the ground (Part I) / Must Jesus bear the cross alone (Part II)
title_yoruba: Ookun l‘ale tutu n'ile (Apa I) / Ki Jesu ha nikan jiya (Apa II)
passage_english: TARRY YE HERE, AND WATCH WITH ME. MATTHEW 26:38 / THE FELLOWSHIP OF HIS SUFFERINGS. PHILIP. 3:10
passage_yoruba: E DURO NIHINYI KI E SI MAA BA MI SONA MATT. 26:38 / ALABAPIN NINU IYA RE. FILLIPI 3:10
verses_english: **Part I**

"Father, remove this bitter cup,
if such thy sacred will;
if not, content to drink it up
thy pleasure I fulfill."
**Part II**

Must Jesus bear the cross alone,
And all the world go free?
No, there’s a cross for everyone,
And there’s a cross for me.

The consecrated cross I'll bear
Till death shall set me free,
And then go home my crown to wear,
For there's a crown for me..

Upon the crystal pavement, down
At Jesus' pierced feet,
Joyful, I'll cast my golden crown
And his dear name repeat.

O precious cross! O glorious crown!
O resurrection day!
Ye angels, from the stars come down
And bear my soul away.
verses_yoruba: **Apa I**

Ookun l‘ale tutu n'ile
Nibi Kristi wole;
Oogun Re bi iro eje
Ninu ‘waya ija.

Baba gb‘ago kikoro yii
‘B’o ba se ife Re,
Bi beeko, Emi o si mu un,
Ife Re ni k‘a se.

Elese lo woo l‘agbala
Eje mimo wonni;
O r‘eru wuwo ni fun o
O re’ ra ‘le fun o.

Ko lati gbe agbelebu,
Se ife ti Baba;
Nigba idanwo sunmole
Ji, sora, gbadura.
**Apa II**

Ki Jesu ha nikan jiya,
K‘araye lo lofo?
Iya n be f’olukuluku
Iya si n be fun mi.

Em‘o ru agbelebu mi
Tit‘ iku yoo gba mi,
‘Gbanaa un o lo ‘le lo d‘ade
Tor‘ ade n be fun mi.

Nile ita kristali naa,
Leba ese Jesu,
Un o f’ade wura mi lele;
Un o yin oruko Re.

A! agbelebu! A! ade!
A! ojo ajinde
Eyin Angeli, e sokale,
Wa gbe okan mi lo.

title_english: Hark! the voice of love and mercy
passage_english: IT IS FINISHED. JOHN 19:30
passage_yoruba: O PARI. JOHANU 19:30
verses_english:
Hark! the voice of love and mercy
Sounds aloud from Calvary;
See, it rends the rocks asunder,
Shakes the earth, and veils the sky:
It is finished! It is finished!
Hear the dying Savior cry.

It is finished! O what pleasure
Do these precious words afford;
Heav’nly blessings, without measure,
Flow to us from Christ the Lord:
It is finished! It is finished!
Saints the dying words record.
verses_yoruba:
E gb‘ohun ife at‘aanu
Ti n dun l‘oke Kalfari!
Wo! o san awon apata!
O mi ‘le, o m‘orun su!
O ti pari, O ti pari
Gbo b‘Olugbala ti n ke.

O ti pari, b‘o ti dun to.
Ohun t‘oro wonyii wi,
Ibukun orun lainiye
Ti odo Krist san si wa;
O ti pari, O ti pari
E ranti oro wonyii.

Ise igbala wa pari,
Jesu ti mu ofin se!
O pari nkan t'Olorun wi,
Awa ki o ka ‘ku si;
O ti pari, O ti pari,
Ayanfe, ‘tunu l‘eyi.

E tun harpu yin se Seraf‘
Lati korin ogo Re;
Ar’aye at‘ara orun
Yin oruko Emmanuel‘
O ti pari, O ti pari,
Ogo fun Od'-agutan.

title_english: Behold the lamb of God, who bore,
passage_english: BEHOLD THE LAMB OF GOD. JOH 1:36
passage_yoruba: WO ODO-AGUNTAN OLORUN. JOH 1:36
verses_english:
Behold the lamb of God, who bore,
Thy burdens on the trees;
He died the captives to restore,
His blood was shed for thee.

Look to Him, till the sight endears,
The saviour to the heart;
His pierced feet bedew with tears,
Nor from His cross depart.

Look to Him, till His dying love,
Thy every thought control;
Its vast constraining influence prove
O’er body, spirit, soul.

Look to Him, as the race you run,
Your never-failing friend;
He will complete the work begun,
And grace in glory end.
verses_yoruba:
Wo Odaguntan ti o ru
Eru re lor‘ igi;
O ku lati da igbekun,
O t‘eje Re fun o

W‘Olugbala tit‘ iran na
Y‘o fi fa okan re;
Fi omije orin ese Re,
Ma kuro lodo Re.

Wo, tit‘ ife yio fi
Joba lor‘okan re,
Tit‘ agbara Re y‘o fi han
Lor‘ ara oun emi.

Woo, b’ iwo ti n sare ije
Ore re titi;
Y‘o pari ‘se Re t‘O bere,
Oor‘ofe y‘o j‘ogo.

title_english: God the Father lov’d the world
passage_english: FOR GOD SO LOVED THE WORLD. JOHN 3:16
passage_yoruba: OLORUN FE ARAYE TOBEE GE. JOHANU 3:16
verses_english:
God the Father lov’d the world
He loved the world so much
That He sent his only son
Who died for the sinners
For God has already known
That I will offend Him
His law and also his love
Loves thou me also?

It is true, that God loves me
This fact is without doubt
Those who repent of their sins
Have received salvation
See how much Jesus suffers
He was nailed to the cross
Behold, His life blood flowing,
Look, repent, sin no more.

Jesus underneath Thy cross
I’ll wash away my sins
Underneath thy precious cross
I’ll was my sins away
And when I shall behold Thee
Up there upon thy throne
I shall not cease praising thee
Thy majesty and might.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun fe araye,
O fe tobee ge,
T‘O ran Omo Re w‘aye
T‘O ku fun elese;
Olorun ti mo tele
Pe, emi o se si
Ofin ati ife Re;
Iwo ha fe Mi bi?

Looto, Olorun fe mi,
Ani-ani ko si,
Awon t‘o yipada sii,
Igbala ni won ri:
Woo! Jesu Kristi jiya,
Igi l‘a kan a n mo:
Woo! eje Re ti o n san,
Woo! roo! Ma dese mo.

Jesu agbelebu Re ni,
Un o kan ese mi mo;
Labe agbelebu Re,
Un o we ese mi nu;
Nigbat‘ emi o ri O,
Ni orun rere Re,
N ki yio dekun yin O,
F‘ogo at‘ola Re.

title_english: Sweet the moments, rich in blessing,
passage_english: LOOK UNTO ME, AND BE YE SAVED. ISAIAH 45:22
passage_yoruba: KOJU SI MI KI A SI GBA YIN LA. ISAIAH 45:22
verses_english:
Sweet the moments, rich in blessing,
Which before the cross I spend;
Life, and health, and peace possessing,
From the sinner's dying Friend.

Here I'll sit, for ever viewing
Mercy's stream in streams of blood:
Precious drops, my soul bedewing,
Plead, and claim my peace with God.

Truly blessed is this station
Low before His cross to lie;
While I see divine compassion
Beaming in His languid eye.

Love and grief my heart dividing,
With my tears His feet I'll bathe;
Constant still in faith abiding,
Life deriving from His death.

Lord, in ceaseless contemplation
Fix my thankful heart on Thee;
Till I taste Thy full salvation,
And Thine unveil'd glory see
verses_yoruba:
Wakati didun ni fun mi
Ni wiwo agbelebu;
Nibe, Jesu fun mi n‘Iye,
‘Lera at‘alaafia.

Nihin l‘emi o gbe joko
Lati wo isun eje
Eyiti yoo we okan mi
K‘Olorun ba le gba mi

Niwaju agbelebu Re,
L‘emi o ba buruburu
‘Gbat‘ emi ba ri yonu nla
T‘o farahan loju Re

Ife ati omije mi
Ni un o fi we ese Re;
‘Tori mo mo pe iku Re
Yoo mu iye wa fun mi.

Oluwa, joo gba ebe mi,
Se okan mi ni Tire,
Tit‘ emi o fi ri ‘gbala
At‘oju Re n’nu ogo.

title_english: When I survey the wondrous cross
passage_english: BUT GOD FORBID THAT I SHOULD GLORY, SAVE IN THE CROSS OF OUR LORD JESUS CHRIST. GALATIANS 6:14
passage_yoruba: KI A MA RI PE, EMI N SOGO, BIKOSE NINU AGBELEBU JESU KRISTI OLUWA WA. GALATIA 6:14
verses_english:
When I survey the wondrous cross
On which the Prince of glory died,
My richest gain I count but loss,
And pour contempt on all my pride.

Forbid it, Lord, that I should boast,
Save in the death of Christ my God!
All the vain things that charm me most,
I sacrifice them to His blood.

See from His head, His hands, His feet,
Sorrow and love flow mingled down!
Did e’er such love and sorrow meet,
Or thorns compose so rich a crown?

Were the whole realm of nature mine,
That were a present far too small;
Love so amazing, so divine,
Demands my soul, my life, my all.
verses_yoruba:
‘Gbati mo ri agbelebu
Ti a kan Oba Ogo mo
Mo ka gbogbo oro s‘ofo
Mo kegan gbogbo ogo mi.

K‘a ma se gbo pe mo n hale
B‘o ye n‘iku Oluwa mi
Gbogbo nkan asan ti mo fe
Mo da sile fun eje Re.

Woo lat‘ ori, owo ese
B‘ikaanu at‘ife ti n san;
‘Banuje at‘ ife papo,
A f’egun se ade ogo.

Gbogbo aye ‘ba je t‘emi.
Ebun abere ni fun mi;
Ife nla ti n yanilenu
Gba gbogbo okan, emi mi.

title_english: The rugged cross is all my gain,
passage_english: AND, HAVING MADE PEACE THROUGH THE BLOOD OF HIS CROSS. COL. 1:20
passage_yoruba: O SI TI SE ALAAFIA NIPA EJE AGBELEBU RE. KOL. 1:20
verses_english:
The rugged cross is all my gain,
There the great sacrifice was made,
There the Saviour was crucified,
And there He bled and died for me

What could have moved His heart to bear,
And to suffer for all my sins,
Not knowing why, is the reason,
My heart is so cold towards Thee.

Silently, there I grew ashamed,
Before my Holy Saviour, Lord
Who shed His life blood for my sake,
His love to ne, beyond compare.
verses_yoruba:
Agbelebu ni ere mi,
Nibe ni a rubo fun mi;
Nibe l‘a kan Oluwa mo,
Nibe l‘Olugbala mi ku.

Kini o le fa okan Re
Lati teri gba iya mi?
Aimohun naa daju l‘o se
T‘okan mi tutu be si O

Aifohun naa oju ti mi
Niwaju Jesu mimo mi,
T'o ta ‘je Re sile fun mi,
Tori o fe mi l‘afeju.

title_english: Behold the Saviour of mankind
passage_english: FOR CONSIDER HIM WHO ENDURED SUCH HOSTILITY FROM SINNERS AGAINST HIMSELF. HEBREWS 12:3
passage_yoruba: SA ROT I ENITI O FADARA IRU ISORO-ODI YII LATI ODO AWON ELESE SI ARA WON. HEBERU 12:3
verses_english:
Behold the Saviour of mankind
Nailed to the shameful tree
How vast the love that Him inclined
To bleed and die for tree!

Hark, how He groans! While nature shakes,
And earth's strong pillars bend;
The temple's veil in sunder breaks,
The solid marbles rend.

‘Tis done! The precious ransom's paid;
Received My soul! He cries:
See where He bows His sacred head!
He bows His head, and dies!

But soon He'll break death's envious chain,
And in full glory shine;
O Lamb of God, was ever pain,
