Was ever love, like Thine?
verses_yoruba:
Wo Olugbala araye
T‘a kan m‘agbelebu!
Ife naa ti po to, t‘ ofe
Lati wa ku fun o!

Gbo ‘ke ro ra Re! bo ti ke,
Isele nlanla se;
Ikele tempil' pin meji,
Okuta re si san.

O pari! A ti san ‘gbese,
O ke, “gba emi Mi”;
Wo b’o ti te ori Re ba,
O te ba O si ku.

title_english: perfect life of love!
passage_english: IT IS FINISHED. JOHN 19:30
passage_yoruba: O PARI. JOHANU 19:30
verses_english:
perfect life of love!
All, all is finished now;
All that He left His throne above
To do for us below.

No work is left undone
Of all the Father willed;
His toil, His sorrows, one by one,
The Scripture have fulfilled.

No pain that we can share
But He has felt its smart;
All forms of human grief and care
Have pierced that tender heart.

And on His thorn crowned head,
And on His sinless soul,
Our sins in all their guilt were laid,
That He might make us whole.

In every time of need,
Before the judgment throne,
Thy work, O Lamb of God, I’ll plead,
Thy merits, not my own.

Yet work, O Lord, in me,
As Thou for me hast wrought;
And let my love the answer be
To grace Thy love has brought.
verses_yoruba:
Ife lo to bayii!
Ohun gbogbo pari,
O ti pari gbogbo ise
T‘O tori re w‘aye.

Ohun ti Baba fe
Ni Jesu ti se tan;
Wahala ati iya Re,
Mu iwe mimo se.

Ko s‘irora wa kan
Ti Jesu ko je ri;
Gbogbo edun at‘aniyan
L'okan Re si ti mo.

L‘ori t‘a f‘egun de,
At‘okan Re mimo
L‘a ko gbogbo ese wa le
K‘O ba le wo wa san.

Ife lo mu k‘o ku
Fun emi otosi,
‘Wo etutu f’ese gbogbo,
Mo f’ igbagbo ro mo

Nigba aini gbogbo,
Ati n‘ite ‘dajo
Jesu, ododo Re nikan
Ni igbekele mi.

Joo, sise ninu mi,
Bi O ti se fun mi,
Si je ki ife mi si O
Maa fi oore Re han.

title_english: You that are passing by,
passage_english: IS IT NOTHING TO YOU, ALL YOU WHO PASS BY? LAMENTATIONS 1:12
passage_yoruba: KO HA KAN YIN BI, GBOGBO EYIN TI NKOJA? EKUN JEREMIAH 1:12.
verses_english:
On that day the Lord
in His wrath, did place
Your sins on the lamb, who carried them away,

Let us embrace the grace
of redemption,
Because he suffered much and died in our place.

When this life ends
we shall always adore
That great love, that does not ever die.
verses_yoruba:
Enyin ti n koja,
Ya sodo Jesu:
O s’asan fun nyin bi, pe ki Jesu ku?

Alaafia yin:
Onigbowo yin:
Wa wo bi banuje kan ri bayi ri.

Oluwa n’ jo naa,
N’ ibinu Re gbe
Ese yin l’ Odagutan, O ko won lo.

O ku, k’ o s’ etu
Nitor’ ese yin:
Baba se Omo Re n’ ise ’tori yin.

K’ a gb’ oore- ofe
Irapada mu,
Fun Eni t’ o jiya t’o ku nipo wa.

Nigb’ aye ba pin
Awa o maa bo
Ife titobi naa, ti ki tan laelae.

title_english: Alas! and did my Savior bleed
passage_english: SEE IF THERE BE ANY SORROW LIKE UNTO MY SORROW. LAMENTATIONS 1:12
passage_yoruba: WO KI E SI RII, BI IBINUJE KAN BA WA BI IBINUJE MI. EKUN JEREMIAH 1:12
verses_english:
Alas! and did my Savior bleed
And did my Sovereign die?
Would He devote that sacred head
For sinners such as I?

Was it for crimes that I had done
He groaned upon the tree?
Amazing pity! grace unknown!
And love beyond degree!

Well might the sun in darkness hide
And shut his glories in,
When Christ, the mighty Maker died,
For man the creature’s sin.

Thus might I hide my blushing face
While His dear cross appears,
Dissolve my heart in thankfulness,
And melt my eyes to tears.

But drops of grief can ne’er repay
The debt of love I owe:
Here, Lord, I give my self away
’Tis all that I can do.
verses_yoruba:
Olugbala mi ha gbogbe!
Oba Ogo ha ku!
Oun ha je f’ara Re rubo
F‘eni lile b‘emi?

Iha se ese ti mo da
L‘o gbe ko s‘ori igi?
Aanu at‘oore yii ma po
Ife yii rekoja!

O ye k‘Orun f’oju pamo,
K‘o b‘ogo re mole,
‘Gbati Kristi Eleda ku
Fun ese eda Re

Bee l‘o ye k‘oju ba ti mi
‘Gba mo r‘agbelebu,
O ye k‘okan mi kun f’ope
Oju mi f omije.

Sugbon omije ko le san
‘Gbese ‘fe ti mo je;
Mo f’ara mi f‘Oluwa mi
Eyi ni mo le se.

title_english: Seven Words on the Cross of Calvary (Various first lines)
title_yoruba: ORO MEJE KRISTI L’ORI AGBELEBU (Various first lines)
passage_english: SEVEN WORDS ON THE CROSS OF CALVARY: LK 23:34; LK 23:43; JN 19:26 & 27; MAT. 27:46; JN. 19:28; JN. 19:30; LK 23:46
passage_yoruba: ORO MEJE KRISTI L’ORI AGBELEBU: Lk. 23:34; LK. 23:43; JN. 19:26 & 27; MAT. 27:46; JN.19:28; JN. 19:30; Lk 23.46
verses_english: **"FATHER, FORGIVE THEM: FOR THY KNOW NOT WHAT THEY DO." LK 23:34**

1. Jesus, in Thy dying woes,
Even while Thy lifeblood floes,
Craving pardon for Thy foes;
Hear us, holy Jesus.

2. Savior, for our pardon sue,
When our sins Thy pangs renew,
For we know not what we do:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

3. Oh may we, who mercy need,
Be like Thee in heart and deed,
When with wrong our spirits bleed:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
**"TO-DAY SHALT THOU BE WITH ME IN PARADISE."LK 23:43**

4. Jesus, pitying the sighs
Of the thief, who near Thee dies,
Promising him paradise;
Hear us, holy Jesus.

5. May we, in our guilt and shame,
Still Thy love and mercy claim,
Calling humbly on Thy name:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

6. O remember us who pine,
Looking from our cross to Thine;
Cheer our souls with hope divine:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
**"WOMAN, BEHOLD THY SON! BEHOLD THY MOTHER!"JH 19:26 & 27**

7. Jesus, loving to the end
Her whose heart Thy sorrows rend,
And Thy dearest human friend:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

8. May we in Thy sorrows share,
And for Thee all peril dare,
And enjoy Thy tender care:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

9. May we all Thy loved ones be,
All one holy family,
Loving for the love of Thee,
Hear us, holy Jesus.
**"MY GOD, MY GOD, WHY HAST THOU FORSAKEN ME?" MAT. 27:46.**

10. Jesus, whelmed in fears unknown,
With our evil left alone,
While no light from Heav’n is shown:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

11. When we seem in vain to pray
And our hope seems far away,
In the darkness be our stay
Hear us, holy Jesus.

12. Though no Father seem to hear,
Though no light our spirits cheer,
Tell our faith that God is near:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

13. Jesus, in Thy thirst and pain,
While Thy wounds Thy lifeblood drain,
Thirsting more our love to gain:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

15. May we thirst Thy love to know;
Lead us in our sin and woe
Where the healing waters flow:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
**"IT IS FINISHED." JN. 19:30.**

16. Jesus, all our ransom paid,
All Thy Father’s will obeyed,
All Thy suff’rings perfect made:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

17. Save us in our soul’s distress,
Be our help to cheer and bless,
While we grow in holiness:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

18. Brighten all our heaven ward way
With an ever holier ray
Till we pass to perfect day;
Hear us, holy Jesus.
**"FATHER, INTO THY HANDS I COMMIT MY SPIRIT". LK 23.46**

19. Jesus, all Thy labor vast,
All Thy woe and conflict past,
Yielding up Thy soul at last:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

20. When the death shades round us lower,
Guard us from the temper’s power,
Keep us in that trial hour:
Hear us, holy Jesus.

21. May Thy life and death supply
Grace to live and grace to die,
Grace to reach the home on high:
Hear us, holy Jesus.
verses_yoruba: **BABA DARIJI WON NITORI TI N WON KO MO OHUN TI NWON NSE Lk. 23:34.**

1. Wo t‘O mbebe f‘ota Re,
L‘ori ‘gi agbelebu;
Wipe, Fiji won, Baba?,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

2. Jesu jo bebe fun wa,
Fun ese wa ‘gba gbogbo,
Ako mo ohun t‘a se;
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

3. Je k‘awa ti nwa anu
Dabi Re l‘okan n‘iwa,
Gbat‘ a ba se wa n‘ibi;
Jesu, sanu fun wa.
**LONI NI IWO O WA PELU MI NI PARADISE LK. 23:43.**

4. Jesu,‘Wot‘O gbo aro
Ole t‘o ku l‘egbe Re.
T‘O si mu d‘orun rere
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

5. Ninu ebi ese wa,
Je k‘atoro anu Re;
K‘a ma pe oruko Re,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

6. Ranti awa t‘o nrahun,
T‘a nwo agbelebu Re,
F‘ireti mimo fun wa,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.
**OBIRIN, WO OMO RE: OMO WO IYA RE. JN. 19:26 & 27**

7. ‘Wo t‘O fel‘afedopin
Iya Re t‘o nkanu Re
Ati ore Re owon;
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

8. Jeka pin n‘nu iya Re,
Ka ma ko iku fun O,
Jek‘ari‘toju Re gba;
Jesu, sanu fun wa.
**OLORUN MI, OLORUN MI, ESE TI IWO FI KO MI SILE? MAT. 27:46.**

10. Jesu ‘Wo ti eru mba,
‘Gbat‘O si ku ‘WO nikan
Ti okunkun su bo O,
Jesu, sanu fun wa

11 ‘Gbati a ba npe lasan,
T‘ireti wa si jina,
N‘nu ok un na di wa mu.
Jesu, sanu fun wa

12 B‘o dabi Baba ko gbo,
B‘o dabi ‘mole ko si,
Jeka f‘igbagbo ri O.
Jesu, sanu fun WA
**ORUNGBE NGBE MI. JN.19:28**

13 Jesu, ninu ongbe Re
Ni ori agbelebu,
‘WO ti O fe wa sibe,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

15 Jeka kongbe ife Re
Ma s‘amona wa titi,
Sibi omi iye ni,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

16 Jesu Olurapada,
‘Wo t‘Ose‘fe Baba Re,
T‘O si jiya tori wa
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

17 Gba wa l‘OJO idamu,
Se Oluranlowo wa,
Lati ma t‘ona mimo,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

18 F‘imole Re s‘ona wa
Ti yo ma tan titi lae,
Tit‘ao fi de odo Re;
Jesu, sanu fun wa
**BABA, LI OWO RE; NI MO FI EMI MI LE. Lk 23.46**

19 Jesu, gbogbo ise Re,
Gbogbo idamu Re pin,
O jow‘ emi Re lowo
Jesu sanu fun wa

20 ‘Gba ti ‘ku bu de ba wa,
Gba wa lowo ota wa,
Yo wa ni wakati na,
Jesu, sanu fun wa.

21 Ki iju at‘iye Re,
Mu ore ofe ba wa,
TI yio mu wa doke,
Jesu, sanu fun Wa

title_english: Wrestling in agony, wrestling alone;
passage_english: PEOPLE WILL LOOK AT HIM WHOM THEY PIERCED. JN. 19:37
passage_yoruba: WON O MA WO ENITI A GUN LI OKO. JN. 19:37
verses_english: **GETSEMANE**

1. Wrestling in agony, wrestling alone;
Weary for human love, finding none.

2. While over Olivet sleeps the moonlight,
Whose is that broken prayer troubling night?

3. What are those drops of blood falling like rain,
Wrung from that heart of Thine, Man of pain?

4. Anguish unspeakable writ on Thy brow,–
Suppliant Sufferer, Who art Thou?
**QNA IKANU (The Cross)**

1. Hark, in thy bosom’s depths speaks He to thee,
“Child of My dying love, follow Me.

2. “Shall I not drink the cup My Father gave?–
Drink it, when drinking it thee will save?

3. “Buffeted, spitted on, loaded with scorns,
Smitten, scourged, purple-robed, crowned with thorns:

4. “Onward to Golgotha; there I must die;
All for the love of thee: it is I.”
**ORO MEJE LORI AGBELEBU (The Seven Words)**

1. Nailed to the bitter wood; never a groan:
Bearing our guilt and sin, not His own.

2. Sun of my soul, canst Thou suffer eclipse?
What words are those from Thy quivering lips?

3. “Father, forgive them,” the Crucified prays:
And Him the Father hears, hears always.

4. Listen, the dying thief for mercy sighs:–
Calmly He promises Paradise.

5. Standing beside His cross kinsfolk, and friend,
Mary, and Magdalene wait the end:

6. Two of them henceforth are mother and son,
Broken hearts by His word bound as one.

7. Darkness wraps earth and sky: night at midday:
Moments like centuries pass away.

8. Hark, through the gloom is heard one dreadful cry,
“Thou hast forsaken Me, Father, why?”

9. Oh that abandonment! Oh death accursed!
What means that plaint of woe, that “I thirst?”

10. Hark, “It is finished,” Thy warfare is done;
Death and hell grappled with; victory won.

11. “Father, receive My soul,” His latest breath,
Jesus, the Lord of life, sleeps in death.
**IKESI (The Call)**

1. “Child of My agonies, bought with My blood,
Ransomed from Satan’s thrall, saved for God;

2. “Come to Me, weary one, come to My breast:
Here in My bleeding wounds hide and rest.

3. “Come to Me, weary one, come to My breast:
Here in My bleeding wounds hide and rest.

4. “Drink of the Spirit’s grace, all things are thine:
I am thy heritage, thou art Mine.”
**IDAHUN (The Answer)**

1. “Yea, Lord, I give myself wholly to Thee:
Only Thy priceless love give Thou me.

2. “All I have, all I am, body and soul,
Nothing refuse I Thee; take the whole.

3. “Only abide with me, Lord, to the end;
Jesus, Emmanuel, Savior, Friend.

4. “And when Thy time is come, let me adore
Thee in Thy home of light evermore.”
verses_yoruba: **GETSEMANE**

1. N 'iwaya ‘Jakadi, / On nikan nja,
O n fe iranlowo / sugbon ko ri.

2. B‘osupa ti nwo / l‘or‘oke Olif,
Adura tani ngoke / l‘oru yi?

3. Eje wo l‘eyi ti nro bi ojo,
Lat‘okan Re wa, ?Eni ‘banuje

4. Irora ailese / mbe l‘oju Re,–
Ojiya ti mbebe, tan‘ Iwo?
**QNA IKANU (The Cross)**

1. Gbo b‘O ti mba o so / ‘ro lokan re
Omo ti mo ku fun / tele mi

2. Ki nma m‘ago ti/Baba fun mi bi
‘Gbati mimu re je? / ‘gbala re

3. A lu, a tuto si, / a fi s‘efe;
A na, a si de / l‘ade egun.

4. Mo nlo si Golgota/ nibe, Uno ku,
‘Tor‘ ife Misi o/Emi ni.
**ORO MEJE LORI AGBELEBU (The Seven Words)**

1. A kan mo ‘gi esin, / ko ke rora,
O r‘eru wa, / ‘Tire ko.

2. ‘Wo orun mi ole/ wo okun bi?
Oro wo lo nte / ‘nu Re wa ni

3. Baba dariji won/l‘adura Re,
Baba si gbo, bi/‘ti ma gbo‘ri.

4. Gbo bi ole ni ti / ntoro anu;
On se 'leri Pa / radise fun.

5. Ibatan at‘ore / rogba yika,
Maria on Magdalen ropin re.

6. Meji ninu won di / tiya t‘omo,
Okan t‘oro Re / ti so d‘okan.

7. Okunkun bo ile / osan d‘oru,
Iseju koja b‘ / odun pipo.

8. Gbo ‘gbe ‘rora lat‘ i /nu okun na
Baba, ‘Wo ko mi / sile ese?

9. A! ikosile nla / iku egun!
Igbe kil‘eyi, / ?Ongbe ngbe Mi!

10. Gbo ?O ti pari / Ijakadi pin,
Iku at‘ipoku, / a se won.

11. Baba, gba emi mi,? / L‘o wi keyin,
Krist‘ Oluwa iye / O si ku.
**IKESI (The Call)**

1. O mo ‘rora mi ti / mo feje ra,
Mo gba o low‘esu, f‘ Olorun;

2. Wa alare, wa f‘ori / laya mi,
Sapamo sodo mi, / ko simi.

3. Wa sodo Baba mi, / wa laiberu.
Alagbawi re, / wa nitosi.

4. Wa mu ninu ore / ofe emi;
Emi ni ini re / ‘Wo t‘emi.
**IDAHUN (The Answer)**

1. M o fara mi fun O / Oluwa mi,
Sa fi ‘fe Re ‘yebiye fun mi.

2. Gbogb‘ohun ti mo ni / t‘ara t‘okan
Nko je fi du O / gba gbogno re

3. Sa ba mi gbe dopin / Oluwa mi,
Jesu, Olugbala / Oluwa mi

4. B‘a koko Re ba de / Je ki nyin O
Yin O nile Re/ titi laelae

title_english: By Jesus’ grave on either hand,
passage_english: AND LAID IT IN HIS NEW TOMB WHICH HE HAD HEWN OUT OF THE ROCK ….. AND MARY MAGDALENE WAS THERE, AND THE OTHER MARY, SITTING OPPOSITE THE TOMB MATTHEW 27:60-61.
passage_yoruba: O SI TE E SINU IBOJI TITUN TI OUN TIKALARE, EYI TI A GBE NINU APATA, MARIA MAGDALENE SI WA NIBE, ATI MARIA KEJI WON JOKO LI ETI IBOJI NAA. MATTUE 27:60 - 61
verses_english:
By Jesus’ grave on either hand,
While night is brooding o’er the land,
The sad and silent mourners stand.

2. At last the weary life is o’er,
The agony and conflict sore
Of Him who all our sufferings bore.

3. Deep in the rock’s sepulchral shade
The Lord, by whom the worlds were made,
The Savior of mankind, is laid.
verses_yoruba:
Leba iboji Jesu mi,
Nigbat’ okunkun bo ile,
Awon asofo duro je.

2. Ara are jaja simi,
Irora ati wahala
Enit’ o jiya wa pari.

title_english: Sabbath of the saints of old.
passage_english: LET US THEREFORE BE DILIGENT TO ENTER THAT REST. HEBREWS 4:11
passage_yoruba: JE KI A SE LAALAA LATI WO INU ISINMI NAA. HEBERU 4:11
verses_english:
Sabbath of the saints of old.
Day of mysteries manifold,
By the great Creator blest,
Type of His eternal rest;
Resting from His work the Lord
Spake to-day the hallowing word.

2. Resting in the tom today
Still the Saviour’s body lay;
Wrapt in sleep, from head to feet
Shrouded in the winding sheet,
Lying in the rock alone,
Hidden by the sealed stone.

3. Lord, with Thee till life shall end
We would solemn vigil spend;
Close the door from sight and sound
Of the busy world around,
And in patient watch remain
Till Thou shalt appear again.
verses_yoruba:
Isinmi awon mimo,
Ojo ohun ijinle,
Ti Eleda ti bukun,
Apere isinmi Re.
Oluwa sinmi ’se Re,
O ya ’jo naa si mimo.

2. Loni oku Oluwa
Ni’sinmi ninu iboji;
A ti wee l’aso oku,
Lat’ori titi d’ese,
A si fi okuta see,
A si fi edidi dii.

3. Oluwa, titi aye,
L’a o maa pa eyii mo,
A o t’ilekun pinpin,
K’ariwo maa ba wole;
A o fi suuru duro,
Tit’ Iwo o tun pada.

4. Gbogbo awon t’o ti sun,
Won o wa ba O sinmi;
Won o bo lowo laalaa,
Won nreti ipe ’kehin,
T’a o di eda titun,
T’ayo wa ki y’o l’opin.

5. Jesu yo wa nin’ ese,
K’a ba le ba won wole,
Ewu ati ’se y’o tan,
A o f’ayo goke lo,
A o ri Olorun wa,
A o si ma sin lailai.

title_english: Be not fretful, my soul, rest in hope;
passage_english: “SURELY THE BITTERNESS OF DEATH IS PAST”. 1 SAMUEL 15:32
passage_yoruba: “DAJUDAJU IKORO IKU TI KOJA”. I SAMUEL 15:32
verses_english:
2. Fret not, my soul, indeed Jesus died,
But He has resurrected also,
This is enough assurance for me
Though I die, yet I live in Jesus.

4. Glory to resurrected Jesus!
You were born and sacrificed for man:
Glory to the Trinity ever!
The Father, Son and Holy Spirit.
verses_yoruba:
2. Sinmi okan mi, Jesu ti ku,
Looto o si ti jinde pelu;
Eyii to fun ireti mi, pe
Mo ku, mo si ye, ninu Jesu.

3. Sinmi okan mi, “O ti pari;”
Jesu pari ’se igbala Re;
Sinmi, a ti se gbogbo re tan
Lekan lae; igbala di tire.

4. Ogo fun Jesu ti O jinde!
’Wo t’a bi, t’a pa fun araye:
Ogo fun Metalokan laelae!
Fun Baba, Omo, ati Emi.

title_english: On the resurrection morning
passage_english: I SHALL BE SATISFIED, WHEN I AWAKE, WITH THY LIKENESS PSAMLS. 17:15
passage_yoruba: AWORAN RE YIO TE MI LORUN NIGBATI MO BA JI. ORIN DAFIDI 17:15.
verses_english:
On the resurrection morning
Soul and body meet again
No more sorrow, No more weeping
No more pain

2. Here a while they must be parted
And the flesh its Sabbath keep
Waiting in a holy stillness
Wrapt in sleep.

3. For a while the tired body
To its resting place its borne
Till there breaks the last and brightest
Easter morn

4. But the soul in contemplation
Utters earnest prayer and strong
Breaking at the Resurrection
Into song

5. Soul body reunited
Thence forth nothing shall divide
Waking up in Christ’s own likeness
Satisfied.

6. Oh the beauty, oh the gladness
Of that resurrection day
Which shall not through endless ages
Pass away!

7. On that happy Easter morning
All the graves their dead restore,
Father, sister, child and mother
Meet once more.

8. To that brightest of all meetings,
Bring us, Jesus Christ, at last
To thy cross, through death and judgment,
Holding fast.
verses_yoruba:
L’owuro ojo Ajinde,
T’ara t’okan yoo pade,
Ekun, ’kanu on irora
Y’o dopin.

2. Nihin won ko le sai pinya
Ki ara ba le sinmi,
K’o si fi idakeroro
Sun fonfon.

3. Fun ’gba die ara are yi
L’a gbe s’ibi ’sinmi re;
Titi di imole ooro
Ajinde.

4. Okan t’o kanu nisinyi
T’o si n gbadura kikan,
Y’o bu s’orin ayo l’ojo
Ajinde.

5. Ara at’okan y’o dapo
Ipinya ko ni si mo
Won o ji l’aworan Kristi
Ni’Telorun.

6. A! ewa na at’ayo na
Y’o ti po to l’Ajinde!
Y’o duro, b’orun at’aye
Ba fo lo.

7. L’ooro ojo Ajinde wa
’Boji y’o m’oku re wa;
Baba, iya, omo, ara
Y’o pade.

8. Si ’dapo ti o dun bayi
Jesu masai ka wa ye
N’nu ku, dajo ka le ro
Ma'Gbelebu.

title_english: The happy morn is come!
passage_english: THOU HAST LED CAPTIVITY CAPTIVE. PS. 68:18
passage_yoruba: IWO TI DI IGBEKUN NI IGBEKUN LO. ORIN DAFIDI 68:18.
verses_english:
The happy morn is come!
The Savior leaves the the grave,
His glorious work is done
Almighty now to save.

2. Now the ungodly dares
The holy God draw near;
Justice itself declares
No cause remains for fear.
verses_yoruba:
Oro ayo nade,
Olugbala bori;
O fi iboji sile
Bi Olodumare,

2. Onigbowo wa ku,
Tani to fi wa sun?
Baba da wa lare,
Tal‘o to da ebi?

3. Kristi ti san gbese,
Ise ogo pari;
O ti ran wa lowo,
O ti ba wa segun.
chorus_english:
Captivity is captive led;
For Jesus liveth that was dead.
chorus_yoruba:
A d‘igbekun ni ‘gbekun lo,
Jesu t‘O ku di alaaye.

title_english: Jesus lives! no longer now
passage_english: I AM ALIVE FOR EVERMORE, AMEN. REVELATION 1:18
passage_yoruba: KIYESI, EMI N BE LAAYE TITI LAE, AMIN. IFIHAN 1:18.
verses_english:
Jesus lives! no longer now
Can thy terrors, death, appall us;
Jesus lives! by this we know
Thou, O grave, canst not enthrall us.
Alleluia!

2. Jesus lives! henceforth is death
But the gate of life immortal;
This shall calm our trembling breath,
When we pass its gloomy portal.
Alleluia!

3. Jesus lives! for us He died;
Then, alone to Jesus living
Pure in heart may abide,
Glory to our Savior giving.
Alleluia!

4. Jesus lives! our hearts know well
Naught from us His love shall sever;
Life, nor death, nor powers of hell
Tear us from His keeping ever.
Alleluia!

5. Jesus lives! to Him the throne
Over all the world is given;
May we go where He is gone,
Rest and reign with Him in heaven.
Alleluia!
verses_yoruba:
Jesu ye, titi aiye
Eru iku ko ba ni mo;
Jesu ye; Nitorinaa
Isa oku ko n’ipa mo.
Alleluya!

2. Jesu ye; lat’oni lo
Iku je ona si iye;
Eyi y’o je ‘tunu wa
‘Gbat’ akoko iku ba de.
Alleluya!

3. Jesu ye; fun wa l’o ku
Nje Tire ni a o maa se;
A o f’okan funfun sin,
A o f’ ogo f’Olugbala.
Alleluya!

4. Jesu ye; eyii daju
Iku at’ipa okunkun
Ki yoo le ya ni kuro
Ninu ife nla ti Jesu
Alleluya!

5. Jesu ye; gbogbo ‘joba
L’orun, li aye, di Tire;
E je ki a ma tele e,
ki a le joba pelu Re.
Alleluya!

title_english: Go tell it to all the world,
passage_english: AND GO QUICKLY, AND TELL HIS DISCIPLES THAT HE IS RISEN. MATT 28:7
passage_yoruba: E LO SO FUN NAWON OMO EHIN RE PE O JINDE” - MATT. 28:7
verses_english:
Go tell it to all the world,
Spread the gospel all around,
Listening hears shall be opened,
Receptive hearts shall he saved.

2. Christ Jesus our Saviour Lord,
Whom we worship resurrects,
His sacrifice receiveth,
For the sins of sinful world.

3. He arose to die no more,
Firstborn amongst all the dead,
Whosoever shall believe,
Such shall live e'en though is dead.

4. Heaven angelic beings,
Chorus with the earthly beings,
Liberator Jesus arose,
Peace eternally unend.
verses_yoruba:
Lo so fun gbogbo aiye,
Lo tan ihin ayo yii,
Eti t'o ba gbo yoo si,
Okan t’o ba gbo yoo la.

2. Jesu Olugbala wa,
T‘a sin, fi boji sile,
Olorun gba ebo Re,
Ebo ese araiye.

3. O ji lati ma ku mo,
Akobi awon t‘o sun,
Eniti o ba gbagbo,
Yio ye, b'o tile ku.

4. Angeli! Eda orun,
E ba araiye gberin;
Jesu OIudande ji,
Alaafia titi lae.

title_english: The day of resurrection!
passage_english: BEHOLD, JESUS MET THEM, SAYING, ALL HAIL. MATT. 28:9
passage_yoruba: KIYESI I, JESU PADE WON, O WIPE ALAAFIA. MATT 28:9
verses_english:
The day of resurrection!
Earth, tell it out abroad;
The Passover of gladness,
The Passover of God,
From death to life eternal,
From earth unto the sky,
Our Christ hath brought us over,
With hymns of victory.

2. Our hearts be pure from evil,
That we may see aright
The Lord in rays eternal of
Resurrection light;
And listening to His accents,
May hear, so calm and plain,
His own All hail! and, hearing,
May raise the victor strain.

3. Now let the heavens be joyful!
Let earth the songs begin!
Let the round world keep triumph,
And all that is therein!
Let all things seen and unseen
Their notes in gladness blend,
For Christ the Lord hath risen,
Our joy that hath no end.
verses_yoruba:
Eyii l‘ojo ajinde,
K’aye wi kakiri
Irekoja didun ni,
T‘Olorun Oloore;
Lat ‘nu iku s‘iye,
Lat'aye si orun,
Ni Krist‘ ti mu wa koja,
Pel‘ orin isegun.

2. Oluwa we okan wa,
K’o ba le mo toto;
Ka ba le ri Oluwa
N‘nu ‘mole ajinde;
K’a si f’eti s’ohun Re
Ti n dun l’ohun jeje,
Pe “Alaafia fun yin
K’a nde, k’a si tele E.

3. Eyin orun, bu s’ayo
K‘aye bere orin;
Ki gbogbo aye yika
Dapo lati gberin;
Eda nla ati wewe,
E gbohun yin soke,
‘Tori Kristi ti jinde,
Ayo wa ki yoo pin.

title_english: The Lord rose up indeed
passage_english: AND THEY ENTERED IN, AND FOUND NOT THE BODY OF THE LORD JESUS. LUKE 24:3
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI WON WO INU IBOJI, WON KO SI BA OKU JESU OLUWA. LUKU 24:3
verses_english:
The Lord rose up indeed
The Saviour rose again,
He rose victorious
Over all the powers of hell,
In their great fear, the guards trembled
Fell down and became as dead men.

2. Behold the angel host
Assembled together
To list to His command
And also to worship,
They came with joy and they did fly
From heaven in the morn, to the tomb.

3. They did fly back to heaven
With glad tidings of joy
List to their sweet singing
As they flew back to heaven.
Their song was this, Jesus who died
Is ris'n again, is ris'n today.

4. All ye that are redeemed
Join the glad refrain
Let it echo around
To all the earth abroad
Shout and sing for Jesus who died
Is ris'n again, shall die no more.

5. All hail, our Saviour, King
Who bought us with His blood
Praise Him all o'er the earth
Thou who art ris'n again
We rise with Thee and reign with Thee
With Thee ever in heaven above
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ji looto
Olugbala dide,
O f‘agbara Re han;
L‘or‘orun apadi:
N‘iberu nla; awon eso
Subu lule, won si daku

2. Wo, egbe Angeli
Pade l‘ajo kikun:
Lati gbo ase Re
Ati lati juba;
Won f’ayo wa, won si n fo lo,
Lati orun s‘iboji na.

3. Won tun fo lo s‘orun.
Won mu ‘hin ayo lo;
Gbo iro orin won,
Bi won si ti n fo lo
Orin won ni Jesu t’ oku
Ti ji dide; O ji loni.

4. Eyin t‘a ra pada
E gberin ayo naa;
Ran iro orin won,
Si gbogbo agbaye
E ho f’ayo Jesu t‘ oku
Ti ji dide; ki yoo ku mo.

5. Kabiyesi! Jesu!
T‘O f‘eje Re gba wa
Ki iyin Re kale
Iwo t‘O ji dide
A ba O ji, a si joba,
Pelu Re lae; loke orun.

title_english: Welcome, happy morning! age to age shall say:
title_yoruba: Kaabo, ojo rere lao maa wi titi;
passage_english: AND HAVE THE KEYS OF HELL AND OF DEATH. REVELATION 1:18
passage_yoruba: MO SI NI KOKORO IKU ATI TI IPO OKU IFIHAN. 1:18.
verses_english:
Welcome, happy morning! age to age shall say:
Hell today is vanquished, Heav’n is won today!
Lo! the dead is living, God forevermore!
Him, their true Creator, all His works adore!

2. Maker and Redeemer, life and health of all,
Thou from heaven beholding human nature’s fall,
Of the Father’s Godhead true and only Son,
Mankind to deliver, manhood didst put on.
verses_yoruba:
Kaabo, ojo rere lao maa wi titi;
A sete ‘ku loni, Orun di ti wa,
‘Wo Oku d‘alaaye, Oba tit‘aye,
Gbogb‘ eda Re, Jesu ni won n juba Re.

2. Eleda, Oluwa, Emi alaaye!
Lat‘orun l‘o ti bojuwo ‘sina wa;
Om‘Olorun paapaa ni ‘Wo tile se,
K‘O ba le gba wa la; O di eniyan.

4. Tu igbekun sile, t‘esu de l‘ewon,
Awon t’o si subu, joo gbe won dide.
F‘ojurere Re han, je k‘aye riran,
Tun mu mole wa de, ‘WO sa ni ‘Mole.
chorus_english:
Welcome, happy morning! Age to age shall say,
Hell today is vanquished, Heav’n is won today!
chorus_yoruba:
‘Kaabo ojo rere’, lao maa wi titi
A sete ‘ku loni, orun di ti wa.

title_english: Awake, glad soul! Awake, awake!
title_yoruba: Ji, ji, okan ayo, ji, ji,
passage_english: AWAKE, LUTE AND HARP! I WILL AWAKEN THE DAWN. PSALMS 108:2
passage_yoruba: JI, OHUN-ELO ORIN MIMO ATI DURU; EMI TIKARAMI O SI JI NI KUTUKUTU. PS 108:2
verses_english:
Awake, glad soul! Awake, awake!
Thy Lord has risen long;
Go to His grave, and with thee take
Both tuneful heart and song.
Where life is waking all around,
Where love’s sweet voices sing,
The first bright blossom may be found
Of an eternal spring.

2. The shade and gloom of life are fled
This resurrection day;
Henceforth in Christ are no more dead,
The grave hath no more prey.
In Christ we live, in Christ we sleep,
In Christ we wake and rise,
And the sad tears death makes us weep,
He wipes from all our eyes.

3. And every bird and every tree,
And every opening flower,
Proclaim His glorious victory,
His resurrection power.
The folds are glad, the fields rejoice,
With vernal verdure spread,
The little hills lift up their voice
And shout that death is dead.

4. Then wake, glad heart! Awake, awake!
And seek Thy risen Lord;
Joy in His resurrection take,
And comfort in His Word.
And let thy life, through all its ways,
One long thanksgiving be:
Its theme of joy, its song of praise
Christ died, and rose for me.
verses_yoruba:
Ji, ji, okan ayo, ji, ji,
Oluwa re jinde:
Lo ‘boji Re, k’o si mura
Okan ati korin:
Gbogbo eda l’o si ti ji,
Ti won n korin didun,
Itanna ’kini t’o ko tan
Leba odo lo hu.

2. Isudede aye yoo lo
L’ojo ajinde yi,
Iku ko si mo ninu Kristi,
Iboji ko n’ ipa;
Ninu Kristi l’a n wa, t’a n sun,
T’a n ji, t’a si n dide,
Omije t’iku mu ba wa
Ni Jesu yoo nu nu.

3. Ki gbogb’eiye ati igi
At’ itanna ti n tan,
Ki won so ti isegun Re,
Ati t’ajinde Re.
Papa, e gbohun yin soke,
E bu s’orin ayo!
Eyin oke, e si gberin
Wipe, ’Iku ti ku.’

4. Okan ayo, e ji, e wa
Oluwa t’o jinde;
E yo ninu ajinde Re,
K’oro Re tu yin n’nu,
E gbohun yin soke, k’ e yin
Eni t’o ji dide;
L’ohun kan ni k’a gberin pe,
“Jesu jinde fun mi”

title_english: The strife is o’er, the battle done;
passage_english: SING TO THE LORD A NEW SONG, FOR HE HAS DONE MARVELOUS THINGS. PS 98:1
passage_yoruba: E KORIN TITUN SI OLUWA, NITORI TI O TI SE OHUN IYANU. ORIN DAFIDI 98:1
verses_english:
5. Lord, by the stripes which wounded Thee,
From death’s dread sting Thy servants free,
That we may live, and sing to Thee: Alleluia!
verses_yoruba:
Alleluya! Alleluya!! Alleluya!!!
Ija d‘opin, ogun si tan,
Olugbala jagun ‘molu,
Orin ayo la o ma ko; — Aleluya!

4. O d‘ewon orun apadi,
O s’ilekun orun sile,
E korin iyin ‘segun Re — Aleluya!

5. Jesu, nipa iya t‘O je
Gba wa lowo oro iku,
K‘a le ye, k’a si maa yin O - Aleluya

title_english: Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!
passage_english: CHRIST IS RISEN. MARK 16:6
passage_yoruba: KRISTI TI JINDE. MARKU 16:6.
verses_english:
Christ the Lord is risen today, Alleluia!
Sons of men and angels say, Alleluia!
Raise your joys and triumphs high, Alleluia!
Sing, ye heav’ns, and earth, reply, Alleluia!

2. Love’s redeeming work is done, Alleluia!
Fought the fight, the battle won, Alleluia!
Lo! the Sun’s eclipse is o’er, Alleluia!
Lo! He sets in blood no more, Alleluia!

3. Vain the stone, the watch, the seal, Alleluia!
Christ hath burst the gates of hell, Alleluia!
Death in vain forbids Him rise, Alleluia!
Christ hath opened paradise, Alleluia!

4. Lives again our glorious king, Alleluia!
Where, O death, is now thy sting? Alleluia!
Once He died our souls to save, Alleluia!
Where thy victory, O grave? Alleluia!

5. Soar we now where Christ hath led, Alleluia!
Following our exalted head, Alleluia!
Made like Him, like Him we rise, Alleluia!
Ours the cross, the grave, the skies, Alleluia!

6. Hail, the Lord of earth and Heaven, Alleluia!
Praise to Thee by both be given, Alleluia!
Thee we greet triumphant now, Alleluia!
Hail, the resurrection, thou, Alleluia!
verses_yoruba:
Krist‘ Oluwa ji loni: - Aleluya!
Eda at‘Angeli n wi: - Aleluya!
Gb‘ayo at‘isegun ga - Aleluya!
K‘orun at‘aye gberin - Aleluya!

2. Ise ti idande tan: - Aleluya!
O jija, O ti segun - Aleluya!
Wo sisu orun koja: - Aleluya!
Ko wo sinu eje mo - Aleluya!

3. Lasan n‘iso at‘ami, - Aleluya!
Krist‘ wo orun apadi - Aleluya!
Lasan l‘agbara iku - Aleluya!
Kristi si Paradise - Aleluya!

4. O tun wa, Oba Ogo - Aleluya!
Iku, itani re da - Aleluya!
Leekan l‘O ku, k‘O gba wa - Aleluya!
Boji isegun Re da? - Aleluya!

5. E je kawa goke lo - Aleluya!
S’odo Kristi, Ori wa, - Aleluya!
A sa jinde pelu Re: - Aleluya!
Bi a ti ku pelu Re - Aleluya!

6. Oluwa t’ aye t’ orun - Aleluya!
Tire ni gbogbo iyin - Aleluya!
A wole niwaju re - Aleluya!
‘Wo Ajinde at’Iye - Aleluya!

title_english: The Lord is risen indeed!
passage_english: NOW IS CHRIST RISEN FROM THE DEAD. I CORINTHIANS 15:20.
passage_yoruba: KRISTI TI JINDE KURO NINU OKU. I KOR. 15:20.
verses_english:
The Lord is risen indeed!
And are the tidings true?
Yes, we beheld the Savior bleed,
And saw Him living, too.

2. The Lord is risen, indeed!
Then Justice asks no more;
Mercy and Truth are now agreed
Who stood opposed before.

3. The Lord is risen indeed!
Now is his work performed;
now is the mighty captive freed,
and death's strong castle stormed.

4. The Lord is risen indeed!
Then hell has lost his prey;
With Him is risen the ransomed seed
To reign in endless day.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ji l’ooto,
Ihin naa ha s'ooto?
Won ti ri p‘Olugbala ku,
Won ri l‘aaye pelu.

2. Oluwa ji l’ooto
Ooto ko fe ju yi;
Anu at‘otito pade,
Ti won ti n s‘ota ri.

3. Oluwa ji l’ooto,
Ise Re l‘o setan;
A da ide onigbowo,
Ase apa iku.

4. Oluwa ji l’ooto,
Boji ko le se mo;
Awon t‘o ku si ji pelu,
Won ki o si ku mo.

title_english: The Lord is risen indeed!
passage_english: SAYING, THE LORD IS RISEN INDEED, AND HATH APPEARED TO SIMON. LUKE 24:34
passage_yoruba: N WIPE, OLUWA JINDE, NITOOTO O SI TI FI ARA HAN FUN SIMONI. LUKU 24:34
verses_english:
The Lord is risen indeed!
Now is his work performed;
now is the mighty captive freed,
and death's strong castle stormed.

2. The Lord is risen indeed!
Then hell has lost his prey;
with him is risen the ransomed seed
to reign in endless day.

3. The Lord is risen indeed!
He lives, to die no more;
he lives, the sinner's cause to plead,
whose curse and shame he bore.

4. The Lord is risen indeed!
Attending angels, hear!
Up to the courts of heaven with speed
the joyful tidings bear.

5. Then take your golden lyres,
and strike each cheerful chord;
join, all ye bright celestial choirs,
to sing our risen Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa ji looto
Ise ‘gbala pari,
A tu awon onde sile,
A si s‘ete iku

2. Oluwa ji loto
Esu so tire nu,
Awon t‘ara ji pelu Re
Lati joba laelae.

3. Oluwa ji looto
O n be, ko ni ku mo,
O n be, lati be f‘elese
Ti O ru egun won

4. Oluwa ji looto
Eyin Angeli gbo
S‘agbala orun, e sare,
Mu ‘hin ayo naa lo.

5. E mu duuru wura
K‘e si te ‘rin didun!
Eyin egbe orun dapo
Lati k‘ajinde Re

title_english:
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Hearts to Heaven and voices raise:
title_yoruba: Halleluya, Halleluya, E gbe ohun ayo ga,
passage_english: HOPE BY THE RESURRECTION OF JESUS. I PET. 1:3.
passage_yoruba: AYE IRETI NIPA AJINDE JESU. I PET 1:3
verses_english:
Alleluia, Alleluia!
Hearts to Heaven and voices raise:
Sing to God a hymn of gladness,
Sing to God a hymn of praise.
He, who on the cross a victim,
For the world’s salvation bled,
Jesus Christ, the King of glory,
Now is risen from the dead.

2. Now the iron bars are broken,
Christ from death to life is born,
Glorious life, and life immortal,
On the holy Easter morn.
Christ has triumphed, and we conquer
By His mighty enterprise:
We with Him to life eternal
By His resurrection rise.

3. Christ is risen, Christ, the first fruits
Of the holy harvest field,
Which will all its full abundance
At His second coming yield:
Then the golden ears of harvest
Will their heads before Him wave,
Ripened by His glorious sunshine
From the furrows of the grave.

4. Christ is risen, we are risen!
Shed upon us heavenly grace,
Rain and dew and gleams of glory
From the brightness of Thy face;
That we, with our hearts in Heaven,
Here on earth may fruitful be,
And by angel hands be gathered,
And be ever, Lord, with Thee.

5. Alleluia, alleluia!
Glory be to God on high;
Alleluia! to the Savior
Who has gained the victory;
Alleluia! to the Spirit,
Fount of love and sanctity:
Alleluia, alleluia!
To the Triune Majesty.
verses_yoruba:
Halleluya, Halleluya,,
E gbe ohun ayo ga,
E ko orin inu didun
K‘e si yin Olorun wa;
Enit‘a kan m‘agbelebu
T‘O jiya fun ese wa,
Jesu Kristi, Oba Ogo
Jinde kuro n‘nu oku.

2. Irin idabu se kuro,
Kristi ku, si tun ye;
O mu iye ati aiku
Wa l’ooro Ajinde Re;
Kristi ti segun, awa segun
Nipa agbara nla Re
Awa o jinde pelu Re
A o ba wo nu ogo.

3. Kristi jinde, akobi ni
Ninu awon t‘o ti sun;
Awon yi ni yoo ji dide
Ni abo Re ekeji;
Ikore ti won ti pon tan,
Won nreti Olukore,
Eniti yoo mu won kuro
Ninu isa oku won.

4. Awa jinde pelu Kristi,
To n fun wa l‘ohun gbogbo,
Ojo, iri, ati ogo
To ntan jade loju Re;
Oluwa b’a ti wa l‘aye,
Fa okan wa sodo Re
K‘awon angeli sa wa jo
Ki won ko wa d‘odo Re.

title_english: Jesus, who died a world to save,
title_yoruba: Jesu t‘o ku, k‘o gb‘aye la
passage_english: THOU HAST LED CAPTIVITY CAPTIVE. PSLAM 68:18
passage_yoruba: WO TI DI IGBEKUN NI IGBEKUN LO. ORIN DAFIDI 68:18
verses_english:
Jesus, who died a world to save,
Revives and rises from the grave,
By His almighty power;
From sin, and death, and hell set free,
He captive leads captivity,
And lives to die no more.

2. Lo! how He bursts the bonds of death,
And reassumes His vital breath,
To make our title good;
May all our souls to Heav’n aspire,
In thought, in will, in strong desire,
To earthly pleasure dead.

3. His church is all His joy and crown,
He looks with love and pity down
On her He did redeem;
He tastes her joys, He feels her woes,
And prays that she may spoil her foes,
And ever reign with Him.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu t‘o ku, k‘o gb‘aye la
Jinde kuro ninu oku,
Nipa agbara Re;
A da sile lo wo iku,
O d‘igbekun n‘igbekun lo,
Oye, k‘o ma kumo.

2. Eyin om‘Olorun, e wo
Olugbala ninu ogo;
O ti segun iku:
Ma banuje, ma beru mo,
O n lo pese aaye fun yin,
Yoo mu yin lo ‘le.

title_english: If sinners join their hands
passage_english: THE KINGS OF THE EARTH SET THEMSELVES, AND THE RULERS TAKE COUNSEL TOGETHER, AGAINST THE LORD
passage_yoruba: AWON OBA AYE KESE JO, ATI AWON IJOYE N GBIMO PO SI OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 2:2
verses_english:
If sinners join their hands
And rise against the Lord
Rebel against the Christ
And despise the great King
The world may mock
Satan may threat
It's all deceipts
It's all vain.

2. Our risen Saviour reigns
On Zion's holy hill
It is the Lord's decree
Upholds and keeps His son
From the cold tomb
He bids Him rise
And to ascend
That He might save

3. O serve the Lord in fear
Revere His blest command
With gladness come to Him
In awe stand before Him
Bow down the knee
And prostrate fall
Tell of His might
Kiss thou the son
verses_yoruba:
B‘elese s‘owo po,
Ti n won nde s‘Oluwa,
Dimo si Kristi Re,
Lati gan Oba naa,
B‘aye sata,
Pelu Esu,
Eke ni won,
Won n se lasan.

2. Olugbala joba!
Lori Oke Sion;
Ase ti Oluwa,
Gbe Omo Tire ro:
Lati boji
O ni k‘O nde,
K‘O si goke,
K‘O gba ni la.

title_english: Come, ye that love the Lord,
passage_english: THIS SAME JESUS, WHO WAS TAKEN UP FROM YOU INTO HEAVEN. ACTS 1:11
passage_yoruba: JESU NAA YII, TI A GBA SOKE ORUN YIO PADA BEE, BI E TI RII TI O N LO SI ORUN. ISE 1:11
verses_english:
Come, ye that love the Lord,
Who know His great might, come,
In oneness and in sweet
Fellowship, praise His love,
To heaven and earth, proclaim the name
Of your might Redeemer, Lord.

2. He left His throne on high
And left His glory too
He came down here in love,
He wept , He bled and died,
The pain He bore, who may declare,
To save us from eternal death.

3. He burst the grave and rose
Triumphant over death;
He taught His vanquished foes
How they may intercede
He went in truimp through the heaven's
In vict'ry to the throne of God.

4. He will soon come again
His chariots tarry not
To take His son and go
To land of endless day;
There we shall see Him face to face
And sing the triumph of His grace.

5. Jesus we cannot pay
The debt of love we owe
Teach us the way to pay
Accept our praise and thanks
Our soul and body to Thee giv'n
Accept though little it may be.
verses_yoruba:
Eyin t‘e f'Oluwa,
T’ o mo ‘pa Re, e wa,
E dapo ni sokan,
Lati yin oore Re,
F‘orun at‘aye, e kede
Oruko Oludande yin.

4. O fere pada wa,
Keke Re ki yoo pe,
Lati m‘omo Re LO
Si ile ailopin;
Nibe l‘ao ri lojukoju,
L‘ao ko isegun oore Re.

title_english: The promise is fulfill’d,
passage_english: AND WAS RAISED BECAUSE OF OUR JUSTIFICATION. ROMANS 4:25
passage_yoruba: O JINDE NITORI IDALARE WA. ROMU 4:25
verses_english:
The promise is fulfill’d,
Salvation work is done:
Mercy and truth are united,
The Son of God arose.

2. Oh my soul, praise the Lord,
Who all thy sins doth bear,
He died for the sins of the world;
He came to die no more.

3. His death purchas’d our rest:
And for thee He arose;
Believe and be fully pardon’d
Who was marked with the blood.
verses_yoruba:
A mu ileri se,
Ise ’gbala pari:
Ooto at’ aanu di ore,
Om’ Olorun jinde.

2. Okan mi, yin Jesu,
T’ O ru gbogbo’ ese re,
T’ O ku f’ ese gbogbo aiye;
O wa, k’ O ma ku mo.

3. Iku Re ra ’sinmi:
Fun o, l’ O ji dide;
Gbagbo, gba ekun ’dariji,
T’ a sa l’ aami eje.

title_english: Thine be the glory, risen conquering Son
title_yoruba: Tire ni ogo, Omo nla Baba
passage_english: OUGHT NOT THE CHRIST TO HAVE SUFFERED THESE THINGS AND TO ENTER INTO HIS GLORY?” LUKE 24:26
passage_yoruba: KO HA YE KI KRISTI KI O JIYA NKAN WONYII KI O SI WO INU OGO RE LO? LUKU 24:26
verses_english:
Thine be the glory, risen conquering Son
Endless is the victory Thou o'er, death hast won
Angels in bright raiment roll'd the stone away
Kept the folded grace-clothes where Thy body lay.

2. Lo! Jesus meet us risen from the tomb;
Loving He greets us, scatters fear and gloom
Let the church with gladness hymns of triumph sing
For her Lord now liveth, death hath lost its sting.

3. No more we doubt Thee, Glorious
Prince of life;
Life is nought without Thee aid us in our strife
Make us move than conquerors through Thy deathless love
Bring us safe through Jordan toothy home above.
verses_yoruba:
Tire ni ogo, Omo nla Baba
Titi ni ‘segun naa t‘O ni lori ‘ku
Awon angeli to y‘okuta naa kuro
F‘aso ogbo naa lele niboji Re

2. Wo! Jesu ji dide ninu oku
O si fi ‘fe tu eru okan wa ka
K‘ijo Olorun f‘ayo korin ‘segun
Oluwa n be, iku so oro re nu.

3. Aigba O gbo bila, Kristi Jesu
Laisi Re ko s‘iye, ran aini wa lowo
Mu wa j‘asegun lo nipa ife Re.
Tit‘ ao koja Jordan sile wa orun.
chorus_english:
Thine be the glory, risen, conquering son
Endless is the victory, Thou o'er death hast won.
chorus_yoruba:
Tire ni ogo Omo nla Baba
Titi ni‘segun naa t‘O ni lori'ku

title_english: He dies! the Friend of sinners dies!
passage_english: I AM HE THAT LIVETH, AND WAS DEAD; AND, BEHOLD, I AM ALIVE FOR EVERMORE, AMEN. REVELATION 1:18
passage_yoruba: EMI LI ENITI O NBE LAAYE, TI O SI TI KU; SI KIYESI I, MO SI N BE LAAYE TITI LAE. IFIHAN 1:18
verses_english:
He dies! the Friend of sinners dies!
Lo! Salem’s daughters weep around;
A solemn darkness veils the skies,
A sudden trembling shakes the ground.

2. Here’s love and grief beyond degree:
The Lord of Glory dies for men!
But lo! what sudden joys we see,
Jesus, the dead, revives again!

3. Break off your fears, ye saints, and tell
How high your great Deliv’rer reigns;
Sing how He spoiled the hosts of hell,
And led the monster death in chains!

4. Say, “Live forever, wondrous King!
Born to redeem, and strong to save;”
Then ask the monster, “Where’s thy sting?”
And, “Where’s thy vict’ry, boasting grave?”
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Ore elese ku,
Awon omo Salem n sokun,
Okunkun bo oju orun,
Isele nla se lojiji.

2. Nihin l’a r’aanu at’ife,
Oba ogo ku f’eniyan,
Wo! Ayo ki l’a tun ri yii,
Jesu t’O ku tun ji dide.

3. Ma beru mo, eyin mimo,
So bi Oluwa ti joba,
Korin b’O ti segun Esu,
Bi o si ti bori iku.

4. E wipe, ‘Oba wa titi,
Iwo t’a bi lati gba wa,
K’e b’iku pe, “Oro re da?
‘Iboji, isegun re da.

title_english: I am telling, each, everyone
passage_english: AND GO QUICKLY AND TELL HIS DISCIPLES THAT HE IS RISEN. MATTHEW 28:27
passage_yoruba: E YARA LO SO FUN AWON OMO EYIN RE PE, O JINDE. MATTEU 28:7
verses_english:
I am telling, each, everyone
That He arose and lives
And He is in our midst here too
By His quickening spirit.

2. Tell it to your neighbour also
That they may rise with us
That light may shine all round about
Through all our days on earth.

3. This world doth now have a foretaste
Of Father's home to us
The new life that His grace imparts
Makes it an heavenly place.

4. The way of the grave that He trod
Leads us on to the skies
Who ever follows His footsteps
Will go to Him in heaven.

5. He is alive and here with us
To the ends of the world
And when we give this vile body
Back to the dust, in hope.
verses_yoruba:
Mo wi fun olukuluku
Pe, Oun ji, O si ye;
O si wa laarin wa pelu,
Nipa Emi iye.

2. E wi fun enikeji nyin,
Ki won ji pelu wa,
K’ imole k’ o wa kaakiri
Ni gbogbo aye wa.

3. Nisisiyi aiye yi ri
Bi ile Baba wa:
Iye titun ti Oun fun ni,
O so d’ ile Baba.

4. Ona ookun ti Oun ti ri
Mu ni lo si orun;
Enit’ o rin bi Oun ti rin,
Yoo d’ odo Re l’ orun.

5. Oun ye, O si wa pelu wa,
Ni gbogbo aye yii;
Ati nigbat’ a f’ ara wa,
F’ erupe ni ’reti.

title_english: Jesus, stand among us
passage_english: AND STOOD IN THE MIDST, AND SAID, “PEACE TO YOU!” JOHN 20:26
passage_yoruba: JESU SI DURO LAARIN, O NI, ALAAFIA FUN YIN. JOHN 20:26
verses_english:
Jesus, stand among us
In thy risen power,
Let this time of worship
Be a hallowed hour.

2. Breathe the Holy Spirit
Into every heart,
Bid the fears and sorrows
From each soul depart.

3. Thus with quickened footsteps
We pursue our way,
Watching for the dawning
Of the eternal day.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, wa saarin wa,
L’agbar’ ajinde;
Je k’ isin wa nihin
Je isin owo.

2. Mi Emi Mimo Re,
Sinu okan wa;
Mu ’foya at’ aro
Kuro l’okan wa.

3. Bi a ti n yara lo,
Lona ajo wa;
K’a maa sona f’ooro
T’oj’ ayeraye.

title_english: This is the day of light:
passage_english: AND HE SHALL BE AS THE LIGHT OF THE MORNING, WHEN THE SUN RISETH, EVEN A MORNING WITHOUT CLOUDS. II SAM. 23:4
passage_yoruba: YIO SI DABI IMOLE OORO NIGBATI OORUN BA LA ATI OORO TI KO NI KUUKU. II SAM. 23:4
verses_english:
This is the day of light:
Let there be light today;
O Dayspring, rise upon our night
And chase its gloom away.

2. This is the day of rest:
Our failing strength renew;
On weary brain and troubled breast
Shed Thou Thy freshening dew.

3. This is the day of peace:
Thy peace our spirits fill;
Bid Thou the blasts of discord cease,
The waves of strife be still.

4. This is the day of prayer:
Let earth to heaven draw near;
Lift up our hearts to seek Thee there,
Come down to meet us here.

5. This is the first of days;
Send forth Thy quick’ning breath,
And wake dead souls to love and praise,
O Vanquisher of death!
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ‘mole l‘eyii,
Ki ‘mole wa loni,
Wo oorun ran s‘okunkun wa,
K‘o si le oru lo.

2. Ojo ‘sinmi l‘eyii;
S‘agbara wa d‘otun
S‘ori aibalo aya wa
Seri itura Re.

3. Ojo alaafia,
F‘alaafia fun wa:
Da iyapa gbogbo duro,
Si mu ija kuro.

title_english: Welcome, sweet day of rest,
passage_english: FOR A DAY IN THY COURTS IS BETTER THAN A THOUSAND. PS 84:10
passage_yoruba: OKO KAN FUN ADURA NINU ILE RE O SA JU EGBERUN OJO LO. O.D 84:10.
verses_english:
Welcome, sweet day of rest,
That saw the LORD arise;
Welcome to this reviving breast,
And these rejoicing eyes.

2. The King Himself comes near,
And feast his saints today,
Here may we stay, and see Him here,
And love, and praise, and pray.

3. One day of prayer and praise
His sacred courts within,
Is sweeter than ten thousand days
In pleasure's path of sin.

4. My willing soul would stay
In such a frame as this;
And wait to hail the brighter day
Of everlasting bliss.
verses_yoruba:
Kabo! Ojo‘sinmi
T‘o ri ajinde Jesu
Maa bo wa m‘okan yin soji,
Si mu inu mi dun.

2. Oba tikare wa
Bo Ijo Re loni,
Nihinyi l‘a wa t’a si rii,
A n yin in, a n gbadura.

3. Ojo kan f’adura
N’nu ile mimo Re
O san j‘egberun ojo lo
T‘a lo f’adun ese.

4. Okan mi yoo f’ayo
Wa n‘iru ipo yii,
Yoo si maa duro de ojo
Ibukun ailopin.

title_english: Hosanna to the living Lord!
passage_english: SAVE NOW, I PRAY, O LORD. PSALMS 118:25
passage_yoruba: GBA MI NISISIYI MO BE O, OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 118:25
verses_english:
Hosanna to the living Lord!
Hosanna to the incarnate Word!
To Christ, Creator, Savior, King,
Let earth, let heaven, hosanna sing!

3. O Saviour, with protecting care
Abide in this Thy house of prayer,
Where we Thy parting promise claim.
Assembled in Thy sacred Name:

4. But, chiefest, in our cleansèed breast,
Eternal! bid Thy Spirit rest;
And make our secret soul to be
A temple pure and worthy thee.

5. So in the last and dreadful day,
When earth and heaven shall melt away,
Thy flock, redeemed from sinful stain,
Shall swell the sound of praise again.
verses_yoruba:
Hosanna si Oluwa wa!
Hosanna si Jesu Oba!
Si Eleda, Olugbala,
K’aye, k’orun ko Hosanna:

3. Olugbala ti n toju wa,
Pada wa ’le adura yii;
A pejo ni oruko Re,
Mu ileri Re se si wa:

4. Sugbon, bori ohun gbogbo,
Fi Emi Re kun okan wa,
Ki okan wa je ibugbe
Mimo ati yiye fun O:

5. L’ojo k’ehin, ojo eru,
T’aye oun orun o koja,
Awon ti a ti rapada,
Yoo tun gbe orin iyin naa;
chorus_english: Hosanna Lord! Hosanna in the highest!
chorus_yoruba: Ko Hosanna, “Hosanna loke orun.”

title_english: Pleasant are Thy courts above,
passage_english: HOW AMIABLE ARE THY TABERNACLES? PSALM 84:1
passage_yoruba: AGO RE WONNI TI LEWA TO? ORIN DAFIDI 84:1
verses_english:
Pleasant are Thy courts above,
In the land of light and love;
Pleasant are Thy courts below
In this land of sin and woe;
O, my spirit longs and faints
For the converse of Thy saints,
For the brightness of Thy face,
For Thy fullness, God of grace.

2. Happy birds that sing and fly
Round Thy altars, O most High;
Happier souls that find a rest
In a heavenly Father’s breast;
Like the wandering dove that found
No repose on earth around,
They can to their ark repair,
And enjoy it ever there.

3. Happy souls, their praises flow
Even in this vale of woe;
Waters in the desert rise,
Manna feeds them from the skies;
On they go from strength to strength,
Till they reach Thy throne at length,
At Thy feet adoring fall,
Who hast led them safe through all.

4. Lord, be mine this prize to win,
Guide me through a world of sin,
Keep me by Thy saving grace,
Give me at Thy side a place;
Sun and shield alike Thou art,
Guide and guard my erring heart.
Grace and glory flow from Thee;
Shower, O shower them, Lord, on me.
verses_yoruba:
Bugbe Re ti l‘ewa to!
N‘ile ‘mole at‘ife!
‘Bugbe Re ti l‘ewa to!
Laye ese at‘osi!
Okan mi n fa nitooto
Fun idapo eeyan Re
Fun imole oju Re
Fun ekun Re Olorun.

2. Ayo ba awon eye
Ti nfo yi pepe Re ka,
Ayo okan t‘o sinmi
L‘aya Baba l‘o poju,
Gege b‘adaba Noa
Ti ko r‘ibi sinmi le,
Won pada sodo Baba
Won si nyo titi aye.

3. Won ko sinmi iyin won
Ninu aye osi yi;
Omi nsun ni aginju,
Manna nt‘orun wa fun won
Won n lo lat‘ipa de ‘pa
Titi won fi yo si O;
Won si wole l‘ese Re
T‘o mu won la ewu ja.

title_english: Oh, Our Heavenly Lord,
passage_english: MY SOUL LONGS, YES, EVEN FAINTS, FOR THE COURTS OF THE LORD. PSALMS 84:2
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI N FA NITOOTO, O TILE N POUNGBE FUN AGBALA OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 84:2
verses_english:
Oh, Our Heavenly Lord,
Thy tent here on the earth,
The dwelling place for Thee
How beautiful it is,
My soul longeth
to go up there
To Thy dwelling
O Lord my God.

2. Rejoice ye that worship,
In chosen place of God,
Ye that go there often
T worship together
They all praise Thee;
joy be to them,
That chose the way
to Mount Zion.

3. Lord God is our refuge,
Our light and our buckler;
His hands are full of gifts
To give to them that ask,
A lot of joy
for every one
That trust in Him
in God the Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa wa orun!
Ago re aye yi,
Ibugbe ife re,
Ewa re ti po to!
Okan mi n fa
Lati goke
S’ ibugbe Re,
Olorun mi.

3. Olorun l’asa wa,
Imole at’ odi;
Owo re kun f’ ebun
A n gba ‘bukun nibe:
Ayo pupo
Ni fun awon
T’ o gbekele
Olorun wa.

title_english: What are those Sabbaths of joy without end,
passage_english: THERE REMAINS THEREFORE A REST FOR THE PEOPLE OF GOD. HEBREWS 4:9
passage_yoruba: ISINMI KAN KU FUN AWON ENIYAN OLORUN HEBERU 4:9
verses_english:
What are those Sabbaths of joy without end,
Angels in light and the glorified spend:
Rest for the weary; for victors reward;
There God Himself all and in all adored?

2. Who is the Monarch? Who circle His throne?
What is the calm restful bliss of His own?
Tell us, ye blessed ones worshipping there,
Tell us, if words can your rapture declare.

3. Oh true Jerusalem, city most bright,
Whose perfect peace is eternal delight:
Longings in thee are fulfill'd ere express'd;
More than was long'd for embraced and possess'd.

4. Troubles all past, in the courts of our King
We without fear Zion's anthems shall sing
Off'ring Thee, Lord, in Thy presence above
Love's pure responses for gifts of Thy love.

5. There never Sabbath to Sabbath gives place;
One is their Sabbath who gaze on Thy face.
There never cease heaven's jubilee songs,
Chanted by saints and sweet angel tongues.

6. Meantime in heart and with faith-winged prayers
Seek we our Fatherland yonder and theirs;
While to Jerusalem bounden we roam,
Exiles returning from Babylon home.

7. Now before Him we adoringly fall,
Of whom and through whom and in whom are all;
Of whom the Father, and through whom the Son,
In whom the Spirit of Both, ever One.
verses_yoruba:
Kinni ’sinmi ayo ailopin ni,
T’ awon angel at’ awon mimo ni?
’Sinmi f’ alaare; f’ awon asegun,
Nibe l’ Olorun je ohun gbogbo.

2. ’Tal’ Oba naa? tani yi ’te Re ka?
Irora itura Re ha ti ri?
So fun mi, eyin ti nj osin nibe:
So fun mi, b’ oro to t’ayo yin so.

3. Jerusalem tooto, ilu mimo,
Alaafia eyit’ o je kik’ ayo;
A r’ ohun t’a n fe n’nu re k’a to wi,
A si ri gba ju eyit’ a n fe lo.

4. L’ agbala Oba wa, wahala tan,
L’ aiberu l’a o maa korin Sion;
Oluwa, niwaju Re l’ ao maa fi
Idahun ’fe han f’ ebun ife Re.

5. ’Sinmi ko le tele ’Sinmi nibe:
Enikan ni ’Sinmi ti n woju Re.
Nibe orin jubeli ko le tan,
T’ awon mimo at’ angeli yoo ko.

6. L’ aye yii, pelu ’gbagbo at’ adua,
L’ ao maa saferi ’le Baba ohun;
Si Salem l’awon ti a si nipo
N pada lo; lat’ ilu Babiloni.

7. N je awa teriba niwaju Re,
Ti Eniti ohun gbogbo jasi;
Ninu eniti Baba at’ Omo,
T’ Enit ‘ Emi je Okansoso lae.

title_english: “I know that my Redeemer lives”,
title_yoruba: “Mo mo p’ Oludande mi n be;”
passage_english: FOR I KNOW THAT MY REDEEMER LIVES. JOB 19:25
passage_yoruba: MO MO PE OLUDANDE MI N BE. JOBU 19:25
verses_english:
“I know that my Redeemer lives”,
Oh the sweet joy this sentence gives!
He lives, He lives, Who once was dead;
He lives, my everlasting Head.

2. He lives to bless me with His love,
And still He pleads for me above;
He lives to raise me from the grave,
Jesus, my Prophet, Priest, and King.

4. He lives my mansion to prepare;
And He will bring me safely there,
He lives, all glory to His name,
Jesus, unchangeably the same.

5. He lives within my heart to dwell,
And save me from the power of hell;
To comfort me whenever I faint,
And soothe my heaviest complaint.
verses_yoruba:
“Mo mo p’ Oludande mi n be;”
Itunu nla l’eyii fun mi!
O n be, Enit’ o ku lekan;
O mbe, Ori iye mi lae.

2. O n be, lati maa bukun mi,
O si n bebe fun mi loke;
O n be. lati ji mi n’boji,
Woli, Alufa, Oba mi.

3. O n be, Ore korikosun,
Ti yoo pa mi mo de opin;
O n be. lati ji mi n’boji,
Lati gba mi la titi lai.

title_english: See, the Lord ascends in triumph,
passage_english: HIS RIGHT HAND, AND HIS HOLY ARM, HATH GOTTEN HIM THE VICTORY. PS 98:1
passage_yoruba: OWO OTUN RE, ATI APA RE MIMO, LI O TI MU IGBALA WA FUN WA. ORIN DAFIDI 98:1
verses_english:
See, the Lord ascends in triumph,
Conqu'ring King in royal state
Riding on the clouds, His chariot
To His heav'nly palace gate;
Hark! The choirs of angel voices
Joyful alleluias sing,
And the portals high are lifted
To receive their heav'nly King.

2. Who is this that comes in glory
With the trump of jubilee?
Lord of battles, God of armies,
He has gained the victory.
He who on the cross did suffer,
He who from the grave arose,
He has vanquished sin and Satan;
He by death has spoiled His foes.

3. While He lifts His hands in blessing
He is parted from His friends;
While their eager eyes behold Him,
He upon the clouds ascends.
He who walked with God and pleased Him,
Preaching truth and doom to come,
He, our Enoch, is translated
To His everlasting home.

4. Now our heav'nly Aaron enters
With His blood within the veil;
Joshua now is come to Canaan,
And the kings before Him quail.
Now He plants the tribes of Israel
In their promised resting place,
Now our great Elijah offers
Double portion of His grace.
verses_yoruba:
Wo Asegun b‘O ti g‘oke,
Wo Oba n‘nu ola Re;
Ogun keke ofurufu
LO s‘orun agbala Re;
Gbo orin awon Angeli
Alleluya ni nwon nko,
Awon ‘lekun si si sile,
Lati gba Oba orun.

2. Tani ologo ti n bo yii,
T‘oun ti ipe Jubeli
Oluwa awon ‘mo-ogun,
Oun to ti segun fun wa
O j’iya lor‘agbelebu
O jinde ninu oku,
O segun esu at‘ese
Ati gbogbo ota Re.

3. B’o ti nbuk‘awon ore Re,
A gba kuro lowo won.
Bi oju won si ti n wo LO,
O nu nin‘awo sanma;
Eni t‘o ba Olorun rin
T’o si n waasu otito,
Oun, Enok‘ wa li a gbe LO
S‘ile Re loke Orun.

4. On Aaron wa gbe eje Re
Wo inu ikele lo;
Joshua wa ti wo Kenaan‘
Awon Oba nwariri;
A fi ‘di eya Israel‘
Mule nibi ‘sinmi won,
Elija wa si fe fun wa
N‘ilopo meji Emi.

title_english: Hail the day that sees him rise, Alleluia!
passage_english: WHILE HE BLESSED THEM, THAT HE WAS PARTED FROM THEM AND CARRIED UP INTO HEAVEN. LUKE 24:51
passage_yoruba: BI O TI NSURE FUN WON, A YA A KURO LODO WON, A SIGBE E LO SI ORUN. LUKU 24:51
verses_english:
Hail the day that sees him rise, Alleluia!
to his throne above the skies; Alleluia!
Christ, the Lamb for sinners given, Alleluia!
enters now the highest heaven! Alleluia!

2. There for him high triumph waits; Alleluia!
lift your heads, eternal gates! Alleluia!
he hath conquered death and sin; Alleluia!
take the King of glory in! Alleluia!

3. Lo! the heaven its Lord receives, Alleluia!
yet he loves the earth he leaves; Alleluia!
though returning to his throne, Alleluia!
still he calls mankind his own. Alleluia!

4. See! he lifts his hands above; Alleluia!
See! he shows the prints of love: Alleluia!
Hark! his gracious lips bestow, Alleluia!
blessings on his Church below. Alleluia!

5. Still for us he intercedes, Alleluia!
his prevailing death he pleads, Alleluia!
near himself prepares our place, Alleluia!
he the first fruits of our race. Alleluia!

6. Lord, though parted from our sight, Alleluia!
far above the starry height, Alleluia!
grant our hearts may thither rise, Alleluia!
seeking thee above the skies. Alleluia!
verses_yoruba:
Alafia f’ ojo naa, Alleluya!
T’o pada s’ ite lorun, Alleluya!
Od’ agutan elese, Alleluya!
Goke orun giga lo. Alleluya!

2. Iyin n duro de nibe, Alleluya!
Gb’ ori yin eyin ’lekun, Alleluya!
Gba Oba ogo sile, Alleluya!
Enit’ o segun iku. Alleluya!

3. Orun gba Oluwa re, Alleluya!
Sibe, O feran aiye, Alleluya!
B’o ti pada s’ ori ‘te, Alleluya!
O n p’ eda ni t’Oun sibe. Alleluya!

4. Wo, O gbowo Re soke, Alleluya!
Wo, O f’apa ife han, Alleluya!
Gbo, bi Oun ti n sure fun, Alleluya!
Ijo Re laye nihin. Alleluya!

5. Sibe, O n bebe fun wa, Alleluya!
Iku Re l’ o fi n bebe, Alleluya!
O n pese aaye fun wa, Alleluya!
Oun l’ akobi iran wa. Alleluya!

6. Oluwa, b’a ti gba O, Alleluya!
Jinna kuro lodo wa, Alleluya!
M’ okan wa lo sibe naa, Alleluya!
K’ a wa O loke orun. Alleluya!

title_english: Christ, Thou hast ascended,
passage_english: THOU HAST ASCENDED ON HIGH. PSLAM 68:18
passage_yoruba: IWO TI GOKE SI IBI GIGA. ORIN DAFIDI 68:18
verses_english:
Christ, Thou hast ascended,
Triumphantly on high,
By cherub guards attended
And armies of the sky:
Let earth tell forth the story,
Our very flesh and bone,
Emmanuel, in glory,
Ascends His FATHER's Throne.

2. There, there Thou standest pleading
The virtue of Thy Blood,
For sinners interceding,
Our Advocate with GOD;
And every changeful fashion
Of our brief joys and cares,
Finds thought in Thy compassion
And echo in Thy prayers.

3. Oh, for the priceless merit
Of Thy redeeming Cross,
Vouchsafe Thy Sevenfold SPIRIT,
And turn to gain our loss;
Till we, by strong endeavour,
In heart and mind ascend,
And dwell with Thee for ever
In glories without end.
verses_yoruba:
Kristi, leyin isegun
Iwo ti goke lo;
Kerub‘ at‘ogun-orun
Wa sin O goke lo;
K‘aye so ‘tan naa jade,
Emmanueli wa,
Ti s‘ara iy‘ara wa,
G’ori ite Baba.

2. Nibe l’o duro, t’o n so
Agbara eje Re;
O n bebe fun elese,
‘Wo Alagbawi wa,
Gbogbo ayidayida
T‘ayo, t‘aniyan wa
N‘Iwo n se iyonu si,
T‘Iwo si n bebe fun.

3. Nitori itoye nla
Ti agbelebu Re,
K‘O fi Emi Re fun wa
So ofo wa d‘ere,
Titi nipa iyanju
Okan wa o goke;
Lati ba O gbe titi,
Li,ayo ailopin.

title_english: God is gone up on high,
passage_english: MAKE A JOYFUL NOISE UNTO THE LORD, ALL YE LANDS. PSALM 100:1
passage_yoruba: E HO IHO AYO SI OLUWA, EYIN ILE GBOGBO. ORIN DAFIDI 100:1
verses_english:
God is gone up on high,
With a triumphant noise;
The clarions of the sky
Proclaim the angelic joys!

2. God in the flesh below,
For us He reigns above:
Let all the nations know
Our Jesu’s conquering love!

3. All power to our great Lord
Is by the Father given;
By Angel hosts adored,
He reigns supreme in Heav’n:

4. High on His holy seat
He bears the righteous sway;
His foes beneath His feet
Shall sink and die away:

5. His foes and ours are one,
Satan, the world, and sin;
But He shall tread them down.
And bring His kingdom in:
verses_yoruba:
Olorun goke lo
Pelu ariwo nla,
Awon ipe orun
N fi ayo Angeli han;

2. O j’ eniyan laye,
Oba wa ni loke;
Ki gbogbo ile mo
Ife nla Jesu wa.

4. L‘or‘ite Re mimo,
O gb‘opa ododo;
Gbogbo ota Re ni
Yio ku lo beere.
chorus_english:
Join all on earth, rejoice and sing;
Glory ascribe to glory’s King.
chorus_yoruba:
Gbogbo aye yo, k’e gberin
E f‘ogo fun Oba Ogo.

title_english: All Christian people come
passage_english: SEEING THEN THAT WE HAVE A GREAT HIGH PRIEST, THAT IS PASSED INTO THE HEAVENS. HEBREW 4:14
passage_yoruba: AWA NI OLORI ALUFA NLA KAN TI O TI KOJA LO SINU AWON ORUN. HEBERU 4:14
verses_english:
All Christian people come
Spiritual Israel,
Assembled here with joy
List to the glad tidings,

2. The day of atonement
Assemble, Israel
The sacrifice is made
That of the Lamb of God;

3. The holy of holies
There went our Saviour Lord
He with holy blood more
Pure than the blood of bull

4. Christians, now shout for joy
God accepts our offering
Jesus is pleading there
As our mediator;
verses_yoruba:
Onigbagbo, e wa,
Israeli t‘emi:
K‘a fi ayo pejo,
K‘a gbohun didun yii;

3. Ibi mimo julo,
L‘Olugbala wa lo,
Pelu eje mimo
T‘O ju t‘ewure lo;
chorus_english:
Jesus ascends up to the skies
Our great High Priest ascends on high.

Whosoever shall yield to Him
Shall obtain everlasting life
chorus_yoruba:
Jesu goke, O lo s‘orun,
Alufa giga wa r‘orun.

Enikeni t‘o f’ori fun un,
Yoo ni iye ainipekun.

title_english: O hear the song of rejoicing in heaven
title_yoruba: E gbo iro orin ayo orun,
passage_english: I GO TO PREPARE A PLACE FOR YOU. JOHN 14:2
passage_yoruba: EMI N LO, LATI PESE AAYE SILE FUN YIN. JOHANU 14:2
verses_english:
O hear the song of rejoicing in heaven
The song of joy of the triumph of Christ
All enemies have bowed down their heads for Him
Sin and death and the cold, dark grave also.

2. He is prepare to receive the kingdom
For God the Father, Creator of all,
He is prepared to receive a great praise
That's meet for Captain of our salvation.

3. His departure was a thing of sorrow
For His chosen disciples who loved Him,
Do not despair was the word of comfort
''I will go to prepare a place for you''.

4. The cloluds received the Lord out of their gaze
The firmament his the Saviour from view,
The hosts of heaven burst out in shouts of joy
For the return of the Lord of glory.

5. Do not allow your heart to be troubled,
Jesus our hope shall surely come again;
He shall come to take His own people where
They shall live and reign with Him forever.
verses_yoruba:
E gbo iro orin ayo orun,
Orin ayo ti isegun Jesu;
Gbogbo ota l’ o teri won ba fun un,
Ese, iku, isa- oku pelu.

2. O se tan lati lo gba ijoba,
Fun Baba, Olorun ohun gbogbo;
O se tan lati lo gba iyin nla,
T’ o ye Olori- ogun ’gbala wa.

3. Ohun ikaanu ni lilo Re, fun
Awon ayanfe omo- eyin Re.
E ma se konnu l’ oro itunu,
“Emi n lo pese aaye yin sile.”

4. Orun gbaa lo kuro leyin eyii,
Awosanma se Olugbala mo;
Awon Ogun- orun ho fun ayo,
Fun bibo Kristi Oluwa ogo.

5. E mase ba inu yin je rara,
Jesu, ireti wa, yio tun wa;
Yio wa mu awon eeyan Re lo,
Si’ biti won o baa gbe titi lai.

title_english: Thou art gone up on high,
passage_english: HE THAT DESCENDED IS THE SAME ALSO THAT ASCENDED UP FAR ABOVE ALL HEAVENS. EPHESIANS 4:1
passage_yoruba: ENI NAA TI O SOKALE NI O SI TI GOKE LO SI IBI TI O GA JU GBOGBO ORUN LO. EFESU 4:10
verses_english:
3. Thou art gone up on high;
But Thou shalt come again,
With all the bright ones of the sky Attendant in Thy train.
Lord, by Thy saving power
So make us live and die,
That we may stand in that dread hour at Thy right hand on high.
verses_yoruba:
Iwo ti goke lo
S‘ile ayo orun
Lojojumo yite Re ka
L‘a n gbo orin iyin;
Sugbon awa n duro
Labe eru ese
Joo ran Olutunu Re wa,
K’o si mu wa lo ‘le

2. Iwo ti goke lo;
Sugbon saaju eyii,
O koja ‘rora kikoro
K’o to le de ade;
And girt with griefs and fears
L‘ao maa te siwaju
K‘ona wa t’o kun f‘omije
To wa si odo Re

3. Iwo ti goke lo
Iwo o tun pada;
Awon egbe mimo l’oke
Ni yoo ba O pada
Nipa agbara Re,
K‘a wa, k‘a ku n‘nu Re,
Gba t‘a ba ji l’ojo ‘dajo,
Fi wa si otun Re.

title_english: He is gone—a cloud of light
passage_english: HE WAS TAKEN UP; AND A CLOUD RECEIVED HIM OUT OF THEIR SIGHT. ACTS 1:9
passage_yoruba: A GBE E SOKE AWOSANMO SI GBA A KURO L’OJU WON. ISE AWON APOSTELI 1:9
verses_english:
2. He is gone—and we remain
In this world of sin and pain:
In the void which He has left
On this earth, of Him bereft.
We have still His work to do,
We can still His path pursue;
Seek Him both in friend and foe,
In ourselves His image show.

3. He is gone—we heard Him say,
“Good that I should go away,”
Gone is that dear form and face,
But not gone His present grace;
Though Himself no more we see,
Comfortless we cannot be:
No, His Spirit still is ours,
Quickening, freshening all ours powers.

4. He is gone—towards their goal
World and church must onward roll;
Far behind we leave the past;
Forward are our glances cast:
Still His words before us range
Through the ages as they change:
Wheresoe’er the truth shall lead,
He will give whate’er we need.

6. He is gone—but not in vain,
Wait until He comes again:
He is risen, He is not here,
Far above this earthly sphere;
Evermore in heart and mind
There our peace in Him we find:
To our own eternal Friend,
Thitherward let us ascend.
verses_yoruba:
O ti lo, awosanmo
Ti gba kuro loju wa
S’oke orun, nibiti
Oju wa ko le tele;
O ti kuro l‘aye yii,
O ti de ibi mimo,
Laalaa ati ‘rora tan,
Ija tan, o si segun

2. O ti lo, awa si wa
L‘aye ese at‘ iku,
A ni ‘se lati se fun un,
L‘aye t’o ti fi sile
K’a si tele ona Re;
K’a tele tokantokan,
K’a s‘ota Re di ore,
K’a fi Kristi han n‘iwa wa.

3. O ti lo, Oun ti wipe,
Odara ki Emi lo
Ni ara sa l’o ya wa,
Sugbon oor‘ofe Re wa,
Oun ni awa ko ri mo
A ni Olutunu Re;
Emi Re si jo ti wa,
O n s‘agbara wa d‘otun.

4. O ti lo, l‘ona kanna
L’o ye k‘Ijo Re maa LO
K’a gbagbe ohun ehin
K’a si maa te siwaju,
Oro Re ni ‘mole wa
Titi de opin aye
Nibiti ooto Re wa
Yoo pese fun aini wa.

6. O ti lo fun ire wa,
E je ki a duro de,
O jinde ko si nihin,
Oti goke re orun,
Je k’a gb‘okan wa soke
Sibi ti Jesu ti lo,
Si odo Olorun wa.
Nibe l‘alafia wa.

title_english: Those eternal bowers man hath never trod,
title_yoruba: Ile ewa wonni, b‘o ti dara to!
passage_english: HE THAT OVERCOMETH SHALL INHERIT ALL THINGS. REVELATION 21:7
passage_yoruba: ENITI O BA SEGUN NI YIO JOGUN OHUN GBOGBO. IFIHAN 21:7.
verses_english:
Those eternal bowers man hath never trod,
Those unfolding flowers round the Throne of God:
Who may hope to gain them after weary fight?
Who at length attain them, clad in robes of white?

2. He who wakes from slumber at the SPIRIT's voice,
Daring here to number things unseen his choice;
He who casts his burden down at JESUS' Cross, ?
CHRIST's reproach his guerdon, all beside but loss

3. He who gladly barters all on earthly ground;
He who, like the Martyrs, says ''I will be crowned:''
He whose one oblation is a life of love,
Knit in GOD's salvation to the blest above

4. Shame upon you, legions of the Heavenly King,
Citizens of regions past imagining!
What, with pipe and tabor dream away the light,
When He calls to labour and faith's arduous fight?

5. JESU, LORD of Glory, as we breast the tide,
Whisper Thou the story of the other side;
Where the Saints are casting crowns before Thy Feet,
Safe for everlasting, in Thyself complete
verses_yoruba:
Ile ewa wonni, b‘o ti dara to!
Ibugbe Olorun, t‘oju ko ti ri;
Tal‘ o fe de ibe, leyin aye yii?
Tal‘ o fe k‘a wo un ni aso funfun?

2. Awon wonni t‘o ji ninu oorun won,
Awon t‘o ni ‘gbagbo si nkan t‘a ko ri:
Awon t‘o k‘aniyan won l‘Olugbala,
Awon ti ko tiju agbelebu Krist‘.

3. Awon ti ko nani gbogbo nkan aye,
Awon t‘o le sooto de oju iku.
Awon t‘o n rubo ife l‘ojojumo,
Awon t‘a f‘igbala Jesu rapada.

4. Itiju ni fun yin, Om‘ogun Jesu,
Eyin ara ile ibugbe orun,
Kinla! e ni fi fere at‘ilu sire
‘Gbat‘ o ni k‘e sise, t‘o si pe, “E ja”!

5. B‘igbi omi aye si ti n kolu wa,
Jesu, Oba Ogo, so si wa l‘eti;
Adun to wa lorun, ilu mimo ni,
Nibi t‘ isinmi wa lae ati laelae.

title_english: There is a Blessed Home
passage_english: IN MY FATHER'S HOUSE ARE MANY MANSIONS. JOHN 14:2
passage_yoruba: NINU ILE BABA MI OPOLOPO IBUGBE LO WA. JOHANU 14:2.
verses_english:
There is a Blessed Home
Beyond this land of woe,
Where trials never come,
Nor tears of sorrow flow;
Where faith is lost in sight,
And patient hope is crowned,
And everlasting light
Its glory throws around.

2. There is a land of peace,
Good Angels know it well;
Glad songs that never cease
Within its portals swell;
Around its glorious Throne
Ten thousand Saints adore
CHRIST, with the FATHER, ONE,
And SPIRIT, evermore.

3. Oh! joy all joys beyond,
To see the LAMB Who died,
And count each sacred Wound
In Hands, and Feet, and Side;
To give to Him the praise
Of every triumph won,
And sing through endless days
The great things He hath done.

4. Look up, ye saints of GOD,
Nor fear to tread below
The path your SAVIOUR trod
Of daily toil and woe;
Wait but a little while
In uncomplaining love,
His own most gracious smile
Shall welcome you above.
verses_yoruba:
Ile ‘bukun kan wa,
Leyin aye wa yii,
Wahala, irora,
At‘ekun ki de ‘be
Igbagbo yoo dopin,
Ao de‘reti l‘ade,
Imole ailopin
Ni gbogbo ibe je

2. Ile kan si tun n be
Ile alaafia
Awon Angeli rere
N korin n‘nu re laelae;
Y ‘ite ogo Re ka
L‘awon egbe mimo
N wole, won n teriba
F‘eni Metalokan.

4. W‘oke, eyin mimo,
E le iberu lo,
Ona hiha kannaa
L‘Olugbala ti gba;
E fi suuru duro
Fun igba die sa;
T‘erin-t‘erin l‘ Oun O
Fi gba yin sodo Re

title_english: Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
title_yoruba: Je ki n‘ni po mi lodo Re
passage_english: FATHER, I WILL THAT THEY ALSO, WHOM THOU HAST GIVEN ME, BE WITH ME WHERE I AM. JOHN 17:24
passage_yoruba: BABA, EMI FE KI AWON TI IWO FI FUN MI, KI O WA PELU MI, NIBITI EMI GBE WA. JOHANU 17:24.
verses_english:
Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
My SAVIOUR, my Eternal Rest!
Then, only, will this longing heart
Be fully and for ever blest!

2. Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Thine unveiled glory to behold;
Then, only, will this wandering heart
Cease to be faithless, treacherous, cold.

3. Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Where spotless Saints Thy Name adore;
Then, only, will this sinful heart
Be evil and defiled no more.

4. Let me be with Thee where Thou art,
Where none can die, where none remove;
Where life, nor death, my soul can part
From Thy blest Presence and Thy Love!
verses_yoruba:
Je ki n‘ni po mi lodo Re
Jesu, Iwo isinmi mi;
‘Gbanna l‘okan mi yoo sinmi,
Yoo si ri ekun bukun gba.

2. Je ki n n ‘ipo mi lodo Re,
K‘emi k‘ole ri ogo Re,
‘Gbanna ni okan etan mi
Yio ri eni f‘ara le.

3. Je ki n n ‘ipo mi lodo Re
Nibi awon mimo n yin O
‘Gbanna ni okan ese mi,
Yoo dekun ese ni dida.

4. Je ki n n ‘ipo mi lodo Re.
Nibi a ki yipo pada
Nib‘a ko n pe, o digbose,
Titi aye, titi aye.

title_english: Where high the heavenly temple stands,
passage_english: WE HAVE A GREAT HIGH PRIEST, THAT IS PASSED INTO THE HEAVENS. HEBREW 4:14
passage_yoruba: AWON TI NI OLORI ALUFA NLA KAN TI O TI KOJA LO SINU AWON ORUN. HEB. 4:14.
verses_english:
Where high the heavenly temple stands,
the house of God not made with hands,
a great High Priest our nature wears,
Jesus, the Son of God, appears.

2. He who for us our surety stood,
and poured on earth his precious blood,
pursues in heaven his mighty plan,
eternal God and Son of Man.

3. Though now ascended up on high,
he bends on earth a brother's eye;
partaker of the human name,
he knows the frailty of our frame.

4. Our fellow-sufferer yet retains
a fellow-feeling of our pains;
and still remembers in the skies
his tears, his agonies and cries.

5. In every pang that rends the heart
the Man of Sorrows has a part;
he sympathizes with our grief,
and to the sufferer sends relief.

6. With boldness, therefore, at the throne,
let us make all our sorrows known;
and ask the aid of heavenly power
to help us in the evil hour.
verses_yoruba:
Olor‘ Alufa giga kan,
To gb‘eda wa wo farahan
Nibiti tempil’ orun wa,
Ile Olorun t’a ko ko.

2. Oun, bi Onigbowo eniyan
To t‘eje ‘yebiye s‘ile
To n pari 'se nla Re l'orun;
Olugbala, Ore eniyan

3. B‘o tile goke lo s'orun
O n foju ife wo aye
Enit‘o n je ooko eeyan
O mo ailera eda wa.

4. Alabajiya wa si mo
Bi ‘rora wa si ti po to,
L‘orun, O si n ranti sibe
Omije oun ‘waya ja Re.

5. Ninu ibanuje okan,
Eni ‘banuje pin n‘nu Re
O n ba wa daro edun wa
O si n ran ojiya lowo

6. K‘a k‘edun wa lo sodo Re
Pelu ‘gboya, nibi ite
K‘a toro agbara orun;
Lati yo wa nigba ibi

title_english: Jerusalem, my happy home!
passage_english: AND SHEWED ME THAT GREAT CITY, THE HOLY JERUSALEM. REVELATION 21:10
passage_yoruba: O SI FI ILU NI HAN MI, JERUSALEM MIMO. IFIHAN. 21:10
verses_english:
Jerusalem, my happy home!
Name ever dear to me;
When shall my labors have an end,
In joy, and peace, and thee?

2. When shall these eyes thy heaven built walls
And pearly gates behold?
Thy bulwarks, with salvation strong,
And streets of shining gold?

3. There happier bowers than Eden’s bloom,
Nor sin nor sorrow know:
Blest seats, through rude and stormy scenes,
I onward press to you.

4. Why should I shrink at pain and woe?
Or feel at death dismay?
I’ve Canaan’s goodly land in view,
And realms of endless day.

5. Apostles, martyrs, prophets there
Around my Savior stand;
And soon my friends in Christ below
Will join the glorious band.

6. Jerusalem, my happy home!
My soul still pants for thee;
Then shall my labors have an end,
When I thy joys shall see.
verses_yoruba:
Jerusalemu, ibi ayo!
T’ o se owon fun mi,
‘Gbawo n’ ise mi o pari,
L’ ayo l’ alafia?

2. ‘Gbawo ni oju mi yoo ri
Enu bode Pearl Re?
Odi re t’ o le fun ‘gbala,
Ita wura didan.

3. Gbawo, ilu Olorun mi
L’emi o d‘afin Re?
Nibi ti Ijo ki ‘tuka
N‘ib’ayo ailopin

4. Ese t’ emi o ko iya,
Iku at’ iponju,
Mo n wo ile rere Kenaan’
Ile ‘mole titi.

5. Aposteli, Martyr, woli,
Won y’ Olugbala ka;
Awa tikara wa fere,
Dapo mo ogun na.

6. Jerusalemu, ilu ayo,
Okan mi n fa si o,
Gbati ma ba ri ayo re,
Ise mi yoo pari.

title_english: When ends earth's long and evil day
passage_english: AND REJOICE IN HOPE OF THE GLORY OF GOD. ROM. 5:2
passage_yoruba: AWA N YO NI IRETI OGO OLORUN. ROM 5:2
verses_english:
When ends earth's long and evil day
This world of misery and of woes
There is a place so bright
No change or decay there to find
No night, but all eternal day
Tell me, will you be there?

2. It's pearly gates are closed to sin
No unclean thing shall enter in
To spoil the place so bright,
That happy, shinning golden shore,
No curse will ever there be found,
Tell me, will you be there?

3. Who will be there the lowly heart?
Who served the Lord in godly fear
Who count the world but loss
Those led by the Holy Spirit
Those who walk in the narrow way,
They are those to be there?
verses_yoruba:
Leyin aye buburu yi,
Aye ekun oun osi yi,
Ibi rere kan wa;
Ayipada ko si nibe
Ko s’ oru, a f’ osan titi,
Wi mi, ‘wo o wa nibe?

2. ‘Lekun ogo re ti m’ ese,
Ohun eri ko le wo ‘be?
Lati b’ ewa re je;
L’ebute daradara ni,
A ko ni gburo egun mo,
Wi mi, ‘wo o wa nibe?

3. Tan’ yoo de ‘be? Onirele
T’ o f’ iberu sin Oluwa,
T’ won ko naani aye;
Awon t’ a f’Emi Mimo to,
Awon t’ o n rin l’ona tooro,
Awon ni o wa nibe.

title_english: Jerusalem on high
passage_english: FOR HE HATH PREPARED FOR THEM A CITY. HEB 11:16
passage_yoruba: O TI PESE ILU NLA KAN SILE FUN WON. HEB 11:16
verses_english:
Jerusalem on high
My song and city is
My home when’er I die
The center of my bliss

2. My heavenly city bright
Thy walls are made of pearls,
The gates are dazzling white,
Thy streets are paved with gold

3. The sun does not light there
Neither is there the moon,
All these are not needed
For Jesus is the light

4. There dwells my Lord, my King,
Judged here unfit to live;
There Angels to Him sing,
And lowly homage give:

5. The Patriarchs of old
There from their travels cease;
The Prophets there behold
Their longed-for Prince of Peace:

7. The bleeding Martyrs, they
Within those courts are found,
Clothed in pure array,
Their scars with glory crowned:

8. Ah! woe is me! that I
In Kedar's tents here stay:
No place like that on high;
LORD, thither guide my way.
verses_yoruba:
Jerusalem t'orun
Orin mi, ilu mi!
Ile mi bi n ba ku
Ekun Ibukun mi

2. Idi re, ilu mi
L’ a fi pearl se l’oso
‘Lekun re n dan fun yin
Wura ni ita re

3. Oorun ki ran nibe
Beeni ko s’osupa
A ko wa iwonyi
Kristi n’imole ‘be

4. Nibe l'Oba mi wa
T'a da l’ebi l’aye
Angeli n korin fun un
Won si n teriba fun un

5. Patriarki’ igbani
Par’ ayo won nibe
Awon woli, won n wo,
Omo alade won

6. Nibe ni mo le ri
Awon Apostili
At'awon akorin
Ti n lu harpu wura

7. Ni igbala wonni
Ni awon Martyr wa
Won wo aso ala
Ogo bo ogbe won

8. T'emi yii sa su mi
Ti mo n gb'ago Kedar
Ko si 'ru yii loke
Nibe ni mo fe lo.
chorus_english:
Oh happy place,
When shall I be
My God, with Thee,
To see Thy face.
chorus_yoruba:
Ibi ayo
Nigba wo ni
Un o r'oju Re
Olorun mi?

title_english: There is a happy land,
passage_english: “WE ARE SETTING OUT FOR THE PLACE OF WHICH THE LORD SAID, ‘I WILL GIVE IT TO YOU.’ COME WITH US. NUMBERS 10:29
passage_yoruba: AWA N LO SI IBITI OLUWA WIPE, EMI O FI FUN YIN, IWO BA WA KA LO. NUMERI 10:29
verses_english:
There is a happy land,
Bright, bright as day;
There saints in glory stand,
In glad array:
O, how they sweetly sing
Worthy is the Savior King!
Loud let his praises ring
For evermore.

2. Come to this happy land,
Come, come away;
Why will ye doubting stand?
Why still delay?
O, we shall happy be!
When from sin and sorrow free,
Lord, we shall live with thee,
Blest evermore.

3. Bright in that happy land
Beams ev'ry eye;
Kept by a Father’s hand,
Love cannot die.
O, then to glory run;
Be a crown and kingdom won,
And bright above the sun,
Reign evermore.
verses_yoruba:
Ile ayo kan wa
Ti o jinna,
Ni b’ awon mimo wa:
Won n ran b’ oorun;
A! nwon nkorin didun,
Yiye, l’ Olugbala wa:
Ki iyin Re k’ o ro,
Yin yin laelae.

2. Wa sile ayo yii,
Wa, wa k’ a lo;
E se n siyemeji?
E se n duro?
A o wa l’alaafia,
Kuro l’ ese at’ aro:
A o ba o joba,
L’ayo laelae.

title_english: A mount exist so high and bright!
title_yoruba: Oke kan n be t’ o n dan t’o ga,
passage_english: AND I SAW THE DEAD, SMALL AND GREAT, STANDING BEFORE GOD. REVELATION 20:12
passage_yoruba: MO SIRI AWON OKU KEKERE ATI NLA, WON DURO NIWAJU OLURUN. IFIHAN 20:12
verses_english:
A mount exist so high and bright!
Where-on our God is known;
He reigneth in heaven above,
The throne of God it is.

2. Who are those in proximity,
To watch over His throne?
Multitude abide there above.
All infants just like us.

3. The Saviour blot away their sins,
And made them whole and pure;
They love His word and love His days,
They love and Him they found.

4. Beneath the green pastures they lay,
And there took they their rest:
Their salvation and rest assured,
On the Saviour’s bossom.

5. May we all tread as those who trod,
The hea-venly bound path;
Seeking the forgiveness of God,
Who hath forgavest them.

6. Jesus hark the la/men/ta/tions,
That can our soul renew;
A top the high shinning mountain,
Shall we look unto Thee.
verses_yoruba:
2. Tal’ awon t’ o sunmo ibe,
Lati wo ite Re?
Egbarun won t’ o wa nibe,
Omode bi awa.

3. Olugbala w’ ese won nu,
O so won di mimo;
Won f’ oro Re, won f’ ojo Re,
Won fee, won si ri i.

4. Labe opo oko tutu,
L’ara won sinmi si:
Won ri ’gbala okan won he,
Laya Olugbala.

5. K’ awa k’ o rin bi won ti rin,
Ipa t’ o lo s’ orun;
Wa idariji Olorun,
T’ o ti dariji won.

6. Jesu n gbo irele ekun,
T’ o mu okan d’ otun;
Lori oke t’ o n dan, t’ o ga,
L’awa o maa wo O.

title_english: After this dismal and dark world
passage_english: AND SHOWED ME THE GREAT CITY, THE HOLY JERUSALEM. REVELATION 21:10
passage_yoruba: O SI FI ILU NLA NI HAN MI, JERUSALEM MIMO. IFIHAN 21:10
verses_english:
After this dismal and dark world
Eternal glory waits
A country of eternal joy
No mortal eye hath seen.

2. Our eyes long to see half Thy joy
Beautiful city, bright
How our hearts would have wished to leave
This world, the vale of tears.

3. No sickness nor pain will be there
No sorrow will be there,
It's health and joy e'en all day long,
Pleasures that never end.

4. No night in those fair cities bright
It is perpetual day
For sin, the source of all the curse
Will not enter therein.

5. May this cherished hope of heaven
Set all our hearts aflame
Grant to us that this faith and love
Lift high our thoughts to God.

6. O Lord, in mercy, make us meet
For Thy bright courts above,
And grant that our hearts may prepare
To join the heavenly throng.
verses_yoruba:
