Lehin aye okunkun yii,
Ogo ailopin n be;
At’ ilu ayo ti ki tan,
T’ oju eda ko ri.

2. Ilu ewa! oju wa ’ba
Ri ’daji ayo re,
Okan wa iba ti fe to
Lati f’ aye sile!

3. Aisan oun ’rora ki de ’be,
Ibanuje ko si;
Ilera ni lojo gbogbo,
Adun ti ko lopin.

4. Oru ko si n’ ilu wonni,
Osan ni titi lai;
Ese, orisun egbe wa,
Ko le wo ’be titi.

5. A! k’ ireti orun wa yii,
Mu okan wa gbona,
K’ igbagbo at’ ife nla yi
M’ ero wa lo soke.

6. Oluwa, ’laanu se wa ye
Fun agbala orun;
Si so f’ okan wa k’o dide
Dapo m’ awon t’ orun.

title_english: "Forever with the Lord!"
passage_english: AND THUS WE SHALL ALWAYS BE WITH THE LORD. I THESS. 4:17
passage_yoruba: BEE LI AWA O SI W ALAE LODO OLUWA. I TESS. 4:17
verses_english:
"Forever with the Lord!"
Amen; so let it be;
Life from the dead is in that word,
'Tis immortality.
Here in the body pent,
Absent from him I roam,
Yet nightly pitch my moving tent
A day's march nearer home.

2. My Father's house on high,
Home of the soul, how near!
At times to faith's foreseeing eye
Thy golden gates appear!
Ah! then my spirit faints,
To reach the land I love,
The bright inheritance of saints,
Jerusalem above.

3. "For ever with the Lord!"
Father, if 'tis thy will,
The promise of that faithful word
Even here to me fulfill.
Be thou at my right hand,
Then can I never fail;
Uphold thou me, and I shall stand,
Fight, and I must prevail.

4. So when my latest breath
Shall rend the veil in twain,
By death I shall escape from death,
And life eternal gain.
Knowing as I am known,
How shall I love that word,
And oft repeat before the throne,
"For ever with the Lord!"
verses_yoruba:
“Lai lodo Oluwa!”
Amin, beeni k’o ri.
Iye wa ninu oro naa,
Aiku ni titi lae.
Nihin ninu ara,
Mo sako jinna sii;
Sibe, alaale ni mo n fi,
Ojo kan sunmole!

2. Ile Baba loke,
Ile okan mi ni;
Emi n fi oju igbagbo
Wo bode wura re!
Okan mi n fa pipo,
S’ile naa ti mo fe,
Ile didan t’ awon mimo,
Jerusalem t’ Orun.

3. Awosanma dide,
Gbogbo ero mi pin;
Bi adaba Noa, mo n fo
Laarin iji lile.
Sugbon san mo kuro,
Iji si rekoja,
Ayo ati Alaafia
Si gba okan mi kan.

4. Loro ati l’ale,
Losan ati l’oru,
Mo n gbo orin orun, bori
Rudurudu aiye.
Oro ajinde ni,
Hiho isegun ni,
Lekan si, “Lae lod’ Oluwa”
Amin, beeni k’o ri.

title_english: O Paradise, O Paradise,
passage_english: HAVING A DESIRE TO DEPART AND BE WITH CHRIST. PHILLIPIANS 1:23
passage_yoruba: MO NI IFE ATI LO, KI EMI LE WA LODO KRISTI. FILIPI 1:23
verses_english:
O Paradise, O Paradise,
Who doth not crave for rest,
Who would not seek the happy land
Where they that loved are blest?

2. O Paradise, O Paradise,
The world is growing old;
Who would not be at rest and free
Where love is never cold?

4. O Paradise, O Paradise,
I want to sin no more,
I want to be as pure on earth
As on Thy spotless shore;

5. O Paradise, O Paradise,
I greatly long to see
The special place my dearest Lord
In love prepares for me;

6. Lord Jesus, King of Paradise,
O keep me in Thy love,
And guide me to that happy land
Of perfect rest above;
verses_yoruba:
Paradise! Paradise!
Tani ko fe simi?
Tani ko fe ’le ayo na,
Ile alabukun;

2. Paradise! Paradise!
Aiye ndarugbo lo;
Tani ko si fe lo simi,
Nib’ ife ki tutu?

3. Paradise! Paradise!
Aiye yi ma su mi!
Okan mi nfa sodo Jesu,
Emi nfe r’oju Re;

4. Paradise! Paradise!
Mo fe kin ye dese,
Mo fe ki nwa lodo Jesu,
Li ebute mimo;
chorus_english:
Where loyal hearts and true
Stand ever in the light,
All rapture through and through,
In God's most holy sight.
chorus_yoruba:
Nib’ awon oloto
W alai ninu ’mole,
Nwon nyo nigbagbogbo,
Niwaju Olorun.

title_english: We speak of the realms of the blest,
passage_english: THEY DESIRE A BETTER COUNTRY. HEB. 11:16
passage_yoruba: WON FE ILU TI O DARA JU. HEB. 11:16
verses_english:
We speak of the realms of the blest,
That country so bright and so fair,
And oft are its glories confessed—
But what must it be to be there!

2. We speak of its pathway of gold—
Its walls decked with jewels so rare,
Its wonders and pleasures untold—
But what must it be to be there!

3. We speak of its freedom from sin,
From sorrow, temptation and care,
From trials without and within—
But what must it be to be there!

4. Our mourning is all at an end,
When, raised by the life-giving word,
We see the new city descend,
Adorned as a bride for her Lord!

5. We speak of its service of love,
Of the robes which the glorified wear,
Of the church of the Firstborn above—
But what must it be to be there!

6. Do Thou, midst temptation and woe,
For Heaven my spirit prepare;
And shortly I also shall know
And feel what it is to be there.
verses_yoruba:
A nsoro ile ‘bukun ni
Ile didan at’ile wa
Gba gbogbo l’a n so T’ogo re
Yoo ti dun to lati de ‘be!

2. A nsoro ita wura re
Oso odi re ti ko l’egbe
Faaji re ko se fenu so
Yoo ti dun to lati de ‘be!

3. A n so p’ ese ko si nibe!
Ko s’ aniyan at’ ibanuje,
Pelu ‘danwo lode ninu,
Yoo ti dun to lati de be!

4. A n soro orin iyin re,
Ti a ko le f’orin aye we,
B’ o ti wu k’ orin wa dun to,
Yoo ti dun to lati de ’be!

5. A nsoro isin ife re,
Ti agbada t’awon mimo nwo,
Ijo akobi ti oke,
Yoo ti dun to lati de ‘be!

6. Joo, Oluwa t’ibi t’ire
Sa se emi wa ye fun orun
Laipe awa naa yio mo
B’o ti dun to lati de be

title_english: There is no night in heaven;
passage_english: THERE SHALL BE NO NIGHT THERE. REV. 22:5
passage_yoruba: ORU KI YIO SI SI NIBE. IFIHAN 22:5
verses_english:
There is no night in heaven;
In that blest world above
Work never can bring weariness,
For work itself is love.

3. There is no sin in heaven;
Behold that blessèd throng:
All holy is their spotless robe,
All holy is their song!

4. There is no death in heaven;
For they who gain that shore
Have won their immortality,
And they can die no more.

5. Lord Jesus, be our Guide;
O lead us safely on,
Till night and grief and sin and death
Are past, and heaven is won!
verses_yoruba:
Oru ko si l’orun,
N’ilu mimo l’oke;
Ise ko le mu aare wa,
Ise pade ife.

2. Aro ko si l’orun,
Ayo titi lae ni;
Ekun wa l’ohun isaju,
Ti o ti rekoja.

3. Ese ko si l’orun,
Wo ajo ’bukun naa;
Mimo ni aso ala won,
Mimo ni orin won.

4. Iku ko si l’orun,
Gbogb’ awon t’o de ’be,
Ti gba ere aiku titi,
Won ko tun le ku mo.

5. Jesu, s’amona wa,
Tit’ oru, at’ aaro,
T’ ese, at’ iku yio tan;
T’ a o si de orun.

title_english: Brief life is here our portion; / For thee, O dear, dear country,
title_yoruba: Kukuru l’oj’ aiye wa, / A! ilu daradara,
passage_english: FOR HERE WE HAVE NO CONTINUING CITY, BUT WE SEEK THE ONE TO COME. HEBREWS 13:14 (Part 1); HAVING A DESIRE TO DEPART AND BE WITH CHRIST. PHILIPPIANS 1:23 (Part 2)
passage_yoruba: AWA KO NI ILU TI O DURO PE NIHIN, AWA N WA OKAN TI N BO. HEBERU 13:14 (Apa 1); MO NI IFE ATI LO, KI EMI LE WA LODO KRISTI. FILLIPI 1:23 (Apa 2)
verses_english: PART 1

2. Oh happy retribution!
Short toil, eternal rest;
For mortals and for sinners
A mansion with the blest!

3. And now we fight the battle,
But then shall wear the crown
Of full and everlasting
And passionless renown.

4. And He, whom now we trust in,
Shall then be seen and known;
And they that know and see Him
Shall have Him for their own.

5. The morning shall awaken,
The shadows flee away,
And each true hearted servant
Shall shine as doth the day.

6. There God, our king and portion,
In fullness of His grace,
We then shall see forever,
And worship face to face.
PART 2

For thee, O dear, dear country,
Mine eyes their vigils keep;
For very love, beholding
Thy happy name, they weep.
The mention of thy glory
Is unction to the b1.reast
And medicine in sickness
And love and life and rest.

2. O one, O only mansion,
O paradise of joy,
Where tears are ever banished
And smiles have no alloy!
The Lamb is all thy splendor,
The Crucified thy praise;
His laud and benediction
Thy ransomed people raise.

4. Thou hast no shore, fair ocean;
Thou hast no time, bright day,
Dear fountain of refreshment
To pilgrims far away!
Upon the Rock of Ages
They raise thy holy tower;
Thine is the victor’s laurel
And thine the golden dower.
verses_yoruba: APA 1

1. Kukuru l’oj’ aiye wa,
Die l’ojo aro;
Aye ti ko l’opin n be,
Nibiti’ ekun ko si.

2. A! ere wo l’o to yii:
Isinmi ailopin;
At’ le nla t’o dara,
F’elese bi awa.

3. L’aye yi awa n jagun,
L’orun a o d’ade,
Ade ti ki dibaje,
Ti yoo maa dan titi.

4. Nibe l’awa o gbe ri
Enit’ a gbekele:
Iye awon to ba mo o,
Ni yio je tire.

5. Owuro ojo naa n bo,
Okunkun yoo ka lo,
Awon olokan pipe
Yoo maa ran bi oorun.

6. Olorun at’ ipin wa,
N’nu ekun oore Re,
Nibe ni a o maa woo
A o yin in lojukoju.
APA II

1. A! ilu daradara,
Mo fe lati ri o,
Opolopo ni nsunkun
Fun ’fe lati ri O.
Ogo ti mbe ninu re,
Ororo ni f’okan,
Egbogi ni fun aisan,
Ife ni, iye ni.

2. Ibugbe kansoso na,
Paradise ayo,
Nibit’ omije ki de,
Erin ni ’gbagbogbo;
Odagutan ti a pa,
On ni ewa ibe;
Awon ti a rapada
Nkorin ibukun Re.

4. Okun ti ko n’ebute,
Ojo ti ko n’opin;
Orisun ’tura didun,
Fun awon alare.
L’or’ Apat’ aiyeraiye
L’a mo odi re si;
Tire l’ade asegun,
Tire l’ade wura.

title_english: Our blest Redeemer, ere he breathed
passage_english: AND I WILL PRAY THE FATHER, AND HE WILL GIVE YOU ANOTHER HELPER, THAT HE MAY ABIDE WITH YOU FOREVER. JOHN 14:16
passage_yoruba: EMI O SI BERE LOWO BABA, OUN O SI FUN YIN LI OLUTUNU MIRAN KI O LE MA ABA YIN GBE TITI. JOHANU 14:16
verses_english:
Our blest Redeemer, ere he breathed
His tender last farewell,
A Guide, a Comforter, bequeathed
With us to dwell.

2. He came in semblance of a dove
With sheltering wings outspread,
The holy balm of peace and love
On earth to shed.

3. He came sweet influence to impart,
A gracious, willing Guest,
While he can find one humble heart
Wherein to rest.

4. And his that gentle voice we hear,
Soft as the breath of even,
That checks each fault, that calms each fear,
And speaks of heaven.

5. And every virtue we possess,
And every conquest won,
And every thought of holiness,
Are his alone.

6. Spirit of purity and grace,
Our weakness, pitying, see:
O make our hearts thy dwelling place
And worthier thee.
verses_yoruba:
Olurapada wa, k’ Oun to
Dagbere ikehin,
O fi Olutunu fun ni,
Ti n ba wa gbe.

2. O wa ni awo adaba
O na iye bo wa;
O tan ’fe oun alaafia
Sori aiye.

3. O de, o mu ’wa- rere wa,
Alejo Oloore;
Gbat’ Oba r’ okan irele
Lati maa gbe.

4. Tire l’ ohun jeje t’a n gbo,
Ohun kelekele;
Ti n bani wi, ti n l’ eru lo,
Ti n so, t’ orun.

5. Gbogbo iwa- rere t’a n hu,
Gbogbo isegun wa;
Gbogbo ero iwa- mimo,
Tire ni nwon.

6. Emi Mimo, Olutunu,
F’ iyonu be wa wo;
Jo s’ okan wa n’ ibugbe Re,
K’ o ye fun O.

title_english: O come and as Thou art,
passage_english: BUT YOU SHALL RECEIVE POWER WHEN THE HOLY SPIRIT HAS COME UPON YOU. ACTS 1:8
passage_yoruba: SUGBON EYIN O GBA AGBARA NIGBATI EMI MIMO B ABA LE YIN. ISE 1:8
verses_english:
O come and as Thou art,
Spirit of pow'r within!
And bring the glorious liberty
From sorrow, fear, and sin.

2. The seed of sin's disease,
Spirit of health, remove,
Spirit of finished holiness,
Spirit of perfect love.

3. Hasten the joyful day
Which shall my sins consume
When old things shall be passed away,
And all things new become.

4. The original offence
Out of my soul erase;
Enter Thyself, and drive it hence,
And take up all the place.

5. I want the witness, Lord,
That all I do is right,
According to Thy will and word,
Well-pleased in Thy sight.

6. I ask no higher state;
Indulge me but in this,
And soon or later then translate
To my eternal bliss.
verses_yoruba:
Emi alagbara,
Wa joko ninu mi,
Ki O si fun wa n‘idande
Low‘ eru oun ese

2. Emi imarale,
Gbe arun ese lo,
Emi iwa mimo pipe
Emi ife pipe.

3. M‘ojo naa yara de
Ti ao run ese mi,
T’ ohun atijo yoo koja,
T‘ohun gbogbo d‘otun.

4. Ese abinibi,
Pare li okan mi;
Wole, ki O si lee jade,
Gba gbogb‘ okan mi kan.

5. Oluwa, mo fe ni,
Eri pe, mo n se ‘re
Gegebi ‘fe at‘oro Re
B’o ti to l‘oju Re.

6. N ko fe ipo giga;
Sa fi eyi ke mi,
Ni ‘gbakugba t’o ba si ya,
Gba mi s‘orun rere.

title_english: When God of old came down from heaven,
passage_english: AND SUDDENLY THERE CAME A SOUND FROM HEAVEN AS OF A RUSHING MIGHTY WIND. ACTS 2:2
passage_yoruba: LOJIJI IRO SI TI ORUN WA, NI IRO EFUUFU LILE. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:2
verses_english:
When God of old came down from heaven,
in power and wrath he came;
before his feet the clouds were riven,
half darkness and half flame:

2. But when he came the second time,
he came in power and love;
softer than gale at morning prime
hovered his holy Dove.

3. The fires, that rushed on Sinai down
in sudden torrents dread,
now gently light, a glorious crown,
on every sainted head.

4. And as on Israel's awestruck ear
the voice exceeding loud,
the trump that angels quake to hear,
thrilled from the deep, dark cloud;

5. So, when the Spirit of our God
came down his flock to find,
a voice from heaven was heard abroad,
a rushing, mighty wind.

6. It fills the Church of God; it fills
the sinful world around;
only in stubborn hearts and wills
no place for it is found.
verses_yoruba:
‘Gbaaani t‘ Olorun sokale,
O wa ni ibinu,
Aara si n san niwaju Re,
Okunkun oun ina.

2. Nigbat‘O wa nigba n keji,
O wa ninu ife;
Emi Re si n tu ni lara
B‘afefe owuro.

3. Ina Sinai ijo kinni,
T‘owo Re n bu soke,
Sokale jeje bi ade,
Si ori gbogbo won.

4. Bi ohun eru naa ti dun
Leti Israeli,
Ti won si gbo iro ipe
To m’ohun Angeli gbon.

5. Bee gege nigbat‘ Emi wa
Ba le awon Tire,
Iro kan si ti orun wa;
Iro iji lile.

6. O n kun ijo Jesu, o n kun
Aye ese yi ka,
L‘okan alaigboran nikan
Ni aaye ko si fun un.

title_english: Lord God the Holy Ghost,
passage_english: THEY WERE ALL FILLED WITH THE HOLY SPIRIT. ACTS 2:4
passage_yoruba: WON SI KUN FUN EMI MIMO. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:4
verses_english:
Lord God the Holy Ghost,
In this accepted hour,
As on the day of Pentecost,
Descend in all thy power.
We meet with one accord
In our appointed place,
And wait the promise of our Lord,
The Spirit of all grace.

2. Like mighty rushing wind
Upon the waves beneath,
Move with one impulse every mind,
One soul, one feeling, breathe.
The young, the old inspire
With wisdom from above;
And give us hearts and tongues of fire,
To pray and praise and love.

3. Spirit of light, explore,
And chase our gloom away,
With luster shining more and more
Unto the perfect day.
Spirit of truth, be thou
In life and death our Guide;
O Spirit of adoption, now
May we be sanctified.
verses_yoruba:
Emi Olorun mi,
L’ojo ’tewogba yii;
Gege b’ ojo Pentikosti,
Sokale l’ agbara.
L’ okan kan l’ a pade
Ninu ile Re yii;
A duro de ileri Re,
A duro de Emi.

2. B’ iro iji lile,
Wa ku ’nu ile yii;
Mi Emi isokan si wa,
Okan kan, imo kan.
Fun ewe at’oke wa
L’ ogbon at’ oke wa;
Fi okan gbigbona fun wa:
K’a yin, k’a gbadura.

3. Emi imole, wa
Le okunkun jade;
Siwaju ni k’ imole tan
Titi d’osangangan.
Emi otito wa,
S’amona wa titi;
Emi Isodomo, si wa
S’okan wa di mimo

title_english: Creator Spirit, by whose aid
passage_english: AND THE SPIRIT OF GOD MOVED UPON THE FACE OF THE WATERS. GENESIS 1:2
passage_yoruba: EMI OLORUN SI N RABABA LOJU OMI. GENESISI 1:2
verses_english:
2. O Source of uncreated light,
The Father's promised Paraclete,
Thrice holy Fount, thrice holy Fire,
Our hearts with heavenly love inspire;
Come and Thy sacred unction bring
To sanctify us while we sing.
verses_yoruba:
Emi Eleda, nipa Re
L’a f‘ipile aye sole;
Masai be gbogbo okan wo,
Fi ayo Re si okan wa,
Yo wa nin‘ese at‘egbe,
K’o fi wa se ibugbe Re.

2. Orisun imole ni O,
Ti Baba ti se ileri
Iwo ina mimo orun
Fi’fe orun kun okan wa;
Joo tu ororo mimo Re
Sori wa bi a ti n korin.

title_english: I'm pressing on the upward way
passage_english: I'M PRESSING ON THE UPWARD WAY
passage_yoruba: MO NTESIWAJU L'ONA NA
verses_english:
I'm pressing on the upward way,
New height I'm gaining every day
Still praying as I onward bound
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground

2. My heart has no desire to stay
Where doubts arise and fears dismay
Tho' some may dwell where these abound
My pray'r my aim is higher ground.

3. I want to live above the world
Tho' satan's darts at me are hurl'd
For faith has caught the joyful sound
The song of saints on higher ground.

4. I want to scale the utmost height
And catch a gleam of glory bright
But still I'll pray till heav'n I've found
Lord, lead me on to higher ground.
verses_yoruba:
Mo n tesiwaju l'ona naa
Mo n goke sii lojojumo
Mo n gbadura bi mo ti n lo
Oluwa f’ ese mi mule,

2. Ife okan mi ko kuro
Si ‘lu beru oun ‘yemeji
Awon miran le ma gbe be
Ile giga l'okan mi n fe.

3. Mo fe takete si aye
B'esu tile gbogun ti mi
Igbagbo to gbo ‘ro ayo
T’ orin awon mimo loke.

4. Mo fe de 'bi giga julo
Ninu ogo didan julo
Mo n gbadura ki n le de be
Oluwa sin mi de 'le naa.
chorus_english:
Lord, lift me up and let me stand
By faith on heaven's table land
A higher plane than I have found
Lord, plant my feet on higher ground.
chorus_yoruba:
Oluwa, joo gbe mi soke,
Ki nduro lor’ ile orun,
T’ o ga ju ile gbogbo lo,
Oluwa f’ ese mi mule.

title_english: Lord, we believe to us and ours
passage_english: I WILL POUR OUT OF MY SPIRIT UPON ALL FLESH. ACTS OF APOSTLES. 2:17
passage_yoruba: EMI O TU NINU EMI MI JADE SARA ENIYAN GBOGBO. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:17
verses_english:
Lord, we believe to us and ours
The apostolic promise given;
We wait the pentecostal powers,
The Holy Ghost sent down from heaven.

3. 'The Holy Ghost, if I depart,
The Comforter, shall surely come,
Shall make the contrite sinner's heart
His loved, his everlasting home.'

4. Assembled here with one accord,
Calmly we wait the promised grace,
The purchase of our dying Lord:
Come, Holy Ghost, and fill the place.

5. If every one that asks may find,
If still thou dost on sinners fall,
Come as a mighty rushing wind;
Great grace be now upon us all.

6. Behold, to thee our souls aspire,
And languish thy descent to meet:
Kindle in each thy living fire,
And fix in every heart thy seat.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, awa gbagbo pe
Tiwa ni ‘leri igbanna;
A n ret‘ agbara Pentikost’,
Emi Mimo lat‘oke wa.

2. Fun gbogb‘eni ti Kristi pe
Ni ‘leri t’o daju n be fun;
O n pe gbogbo eyin Tire
E gba oro ti Jesu so.

3. Ma je k’a s‘ofo pe titi
N‘ifojusona bibo Re.
Ran Olutunu sokale,
K‘alejo orun ba wa gbe.

4. A f’okan kan pejo nihin,
A nret‘ ileri oor‘-ofe
T‘iku Oluwa wa ti ra,
Emi Mimo wa kun ihin.

5. B‘eni beere ba le ri gba
B’o ba n baa l‘elese sibe,
Wa b‘iro efufu lile;
Fun gbogbo wa l’oor‘ofe Re

6. Sa woo, Iwo l‘okan wa n wa,
A si n poungbe isokan Re;
Da ina iye sinu wa,
Fi okan wa se ‘bugbe Re.

title_english: Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
passage_english: MY SOUL CLEAVETH UNTO THE DUST: QUICKEN THOU ME ACCORDING TO THY WORD. PS. 119:25
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI LE MO ERUPE; SO MI DI AAYE GEGEBI ORO RE. PS. 119:25
verses_english:
Come, Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
With all Thy quick’ning powers;
Kindle a flame of sacred love
In these cold hearts of ours.

2. Look how we grovel here below,
Fond of these trifling toys;
Our souls can neither fly nor go
To reach eternal joys.

3. Dear Lord! and shall we ever live
At this poor dying rate?
Our love so faint, so cold to Thee,
And Thine to us so great?

4. Come, Holy Spirit, heav’nly Dove,
With all Thy quick’ning powers;
Come, shed abroad the Savior’s love
And that shall kindle ours.
verses_yoruba:
Emi mimo ‘Daba orun,
Wa li agbara Re;
K’o da inn ife mimo
Ni okan tutu wa.

2. Wo b’a ti n rapala nihin
T’a fe ohun asan;
Okan wa ko le fo k’o lo
K’o de b‘ayo titi.

3. Oluwa, ao ha wa titi
Ni kiku osi yii?
Ife wa tutu be si O,
Tire tobi si wa.

4. Emi mimo ‘daba orun
Wa ni agbara Re;
Wa dana ‘fe, Olugbala
Tiwa o si gbina.

title_english: Thou Holy Spirit, come down
passage_english: MY SOUL LONGS FOR YOU LIKE A THIRSTY LAND. PSALMS 143:6
passage_yoruba: OUNGBE RE N GBE OKAN MI, BI ILE GBIGBE. ORIN DAFIDI 143:6
verses_english:
Thou Holy Spirit, come down
Reveal the things of heav'n
May He bring light to the earth
Upon men everywhere
That we who are in darkness
May have the light and see
Because Jesus Christ has died
He died for all mankind.

2. Make me to know that I am
A sinner, lost, indeed
That I may put all my trust
In Him my Saviour, Lord
When I was washed by His blood
From my sins
That I may give the glory
To Thee, most Holy One.

3. Grant that I have the longing
To go unto Jesus
That He may reign in my heart
And sanctify my soul
May heart and soul and body
Join together to serve
Our great God the Holy One
The blessed Three in One.
verses_yoruba:
Emi Mimo sokale,
Fi ohun orun han;
K’ o mu imole w’ aye,
Si ara eniyan.
K’ awa t’ awa l’ okunkun,
Ki o le maa reran,
’Tori Jesu Kristi ku
Fun gbogbo enia.

2. K’ o fi han pe elese
Ni emi n se paapaa;
K’ emi k’ o le gbeke mi
Le Olugbala mi.
Nigbati a we mi nu
Kuro ninu ese,
Emi o le fi ogo
Fun Eni- mimo naa.

3. K’ o mu mi se aferi
Lati to Jesu lo;
K’o joba ni okan mi,
K’o so mi di mimo;
Ki ara ati okan,
K’ o dapo lati sin
Olorun Eni- mimo,
Metalokansoso.

title_english: Lord God the Holy Ghost,
passage_english: AND THEY WERE ALL FILLED WITH THE HOLY GHOST, ACTS. 2:4
passage_yoruba: WON SI KUN FUN EMI MIMO. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:4
verses_english:
Lord God the Holy Ghost,
In this accepted hour,
As on the day of Pentecost,
Descend in all thy power.
We meet with one accord
In our appointed place,
And wait the promise of our Lord,
The Spirit of all grace.

2. Like mighty rushing wind
Upon the waves beneath,
Move with one impulse every mind,
One soul, one feeling, breathe.
The young, the old inspire
With wisdom from above;
And give us hearts and tongues of fire,
To pray and praise and love.

3. Spirit of light, explore,
And chase our gloom away,
With luster shining more and more
Unto the perfect day.
Spirit of truth, be thou
In life and death our Guide;
O Spirit of adoption, now
May we be sanctified.
verses_yoruba:
‘Wo Olorun Emi
L‘ojo ‘tewogba yii
Gege bi ojo Pentikosti‘
Sokale l‘agbara,
L‘okan kan l’a pade
Ninu ile Re yii;
A duro de ileri Re,
Emi oore ofe.

3. Emi imole, wa
Le okunkun jade,
Siwaju ni ki ‘mole tan
Titi d‘osan gangan,
Emi otito, wa
Samona wa titi;
Emi isodomo, si wa
S‘okan wa di mimo.

title_english: O Holy Dove, from heav’n descend,
passage_english: TEACH ME GOOD JUDGMENT AND KNOWLEDGE. PSALMS 119:66
passage_yoruba: KO MI NI IWA, ATI IMO RERE. ORIN DAFIDI 119:66
verses_english:
OHoly Dove, from heav’n descend,
Lift us up on Thy wings divine,
Lift us above, the lusts and pride,
Above the world and all it’s sins.

2. We long to see Thy throne O God
High up heav’n within Thy courts.
The blessed Saviour sits up there,
And reigns with Thee in human frame.

3. The saints of God around Him stand,
All thrones and power before Him fall,
The Lord appeared in human frame,
And sheds Him glory all around.

4. O God, when will the day draw nigh
When I fly to Thy courts above?
And join to fall down before Thee,
To adore Thee, and sing Thy praise?
verses_yoruba:
Adaba orun, sokale,
Gbe wa lo l’ apa iye Re;
Ki o si gbe wa ga soke,
Ju gbogbo ohun aye lo.

2. Awa iba le ri ite
Olodumare Baba wa,
Olugbala joko nibe,
O gunwa l’ awo bi tiwa.

3. Egbe mimo duro yi ka,
Ite, Agbara wole fun un,
Olorun han ninu ara,
O si tan ogo yi won ka.

4. Oluwa, akoko wo
Emi o de bugbe loke?
T’ emi o maa ba won wole,
Ki n maa sin O, ki n maa korin?

title_english: Spirit of mercy, truth and love,
passage_english: FOR THE EARTH SHALL BE FULL OF THE KNOWLEDGE OF THE LORD, AS THE WATERS COVER THE SEA. ISAIAH 11:9
passage_yoruba: NITORI AYE YIO KUN FUN IMO OLUWA, BI OMI TI BO OKUN. ISAIAH 11:9
verses_english:
Spirit of mercy, truth and love,
O shed Thine influence from above,
And still from age to age convey
The wonders of this sacred day.

2. In every clime, by every tongue,
Be God’s amazing glory sung;
Let all the listening earth be taught
The wonders by our Savior wrought.

3. Unfailing Comfort, heavenly Guide,
Still o’er Thy holy Church preside;
Still let mankind Thy blessings prove,
Spirit of mercy, truth and love.
verses_yoruba:
Emi aanu, ooto, ife,
Ran agbara Re t’oke wa;
Mu lyanu ojo oni
De opin akoko gbogbo.

2. Ki gbogbo orile ede
Ko orin ogo Olorun;
Ki a si ko gbogbo aye
N'ise Olurapada wa.

3. Olutunu at‘Amona,
Joba Ijo Eniyan Re;
K'araye mo ibukun Re,
Emi aanu, ooto ife.

title_english: Come, Thou holy Paraclete,
passage_english: THOU SENDEST FORTH THY SPIRIT, THEY ARE CREATED. PSALAM 104:30
passage_yoruba: IWO RAN EMI RE JADE, A SI DA WON. ORIN DAFIDI 104:30
verses_english:
Come, Thou holy Paraclete,
And from Thy celestial seat
Send Thy light and brilliancy:

3. Come, of comforters the best,
Of the soul the sweetest guest,
Come in toil refreshingly:

4. Thou in labor rest most sweet,
Thou art shadow from the heat,
Comfort in adversity.

5. O Thou Light, most pure and blest,
Shine within the inmost breast
Of Thy faithful company.

9. Fill Thy faithful, who confide
In Thy power to guard and guide,
With Thy sevenfold mystery.

10. Here Thy grace and virtue send:
Grant salvation to the end,
And in Heav’n felicity.
verses_yoruba:
2. Baba talaka, wa ‘hin,
Olufunni l‘ebun, wa,
Imole okan, joo wa.

3. Baba Olutunu, wa
Alejo tooto f‘okan,
Pelu itura Re, wa.

4. ‘Wo n‘isinmi n‘nu laalaa,
Ibooji ninu ooru,
Itunu ninu iponju.

5. ‘Wo‘ mole t’o mo gaara
Tan sinu aye awon
Eniyan Re Olooto.

6. L’aisi Re, kil‘eda je?
Ise at‘ero mimo
Lat‘ odo Re wa ni won.

7. Eleeri so di mimo
Agbogbe, ma sai woo san,
Alaileso mu s‘eso.

8. Mu okan tutu gbona,
M‘alagidi, teriba,
Fa asako wa jeje

9. F‘emi jinle Re meje
Kun awon olooto Re,
F‘agbara Re s‘aabo won.

10. Ran oor‘-ofe Re, sihin,
Ekun igbala l‘aye
At‘alaafia l‘orun.

title_english: Come, Holy Ghost, our souls inspire,
title_yoruba: Wa mi si wa, Emi Mimo,
passage_english: HE BREATHED ON THEM, AND SAID TO THEM, “RECEIVE THE HOLY SPIRIT. JOHN 20:22
passage_yoruba: O MI SI WON, O NI E GBA EMI MIMO. JOHANU 20:22
verses_english:
Come, Holy Ghost, our souls inspire,
And lighten with celestial fire.
Thou the anointing Spirit art,
Who dost thy sevenfold gifts impart.
Thy blessed unction from above
Is comfort, life, and fire of love.

2. Enable with perpetual light
The dullness of our blinded sight.
Anoint and cheer our soiled face
With the abundance of thy grace.
Keep far from foes, give peace at home:
Where thou art guide, no ill can come.

3. Teach us to know the Father, Son,
And thee, of both, to be but One,
That through the ages all along,
This may be our endless song:
Praise to thy eternal merit,
Father, Son, and Holy Spirit.
verses_yoruba:
2. F’imole Re igbagbobgo,
Le okunkun okan wa lo.
F’ororo oore- ofe Re
Pa oju eeri wa k’o dan;
L’ota jinna s’ ibugbe wa:
Ire n’ igbe ’biti ’Wo n so.

3. Ko wa ka mo Baba, Omo,
Pelu Re l’okansoso;
Titi aye ainipekun,
Ni k’eyi maa je orin wa:
Lae, iyin, eye, ni fun O,
Baba, Omo, Emi Mimo.

title_english: Descend, gracious Holy Ghost
passage_english: AND HE WILL GIVE YOU ANOTHER HELPER, THAT HE MAY ABIDE WITH YOU FOREVER. JOHN 14:16
passage_yoruba: OUN O SI FUN YIN LI OLUTUNU MIRAN, KI O LE MA ABA YIN GBE TITI LAE. JOHANU 14:16
verses_english:
Descend, gracious Holy Ghost
Dwell Thou with us in this world
Things of God reveal to us
Inspire us to serve the Lord.

2. Sin is in our heart within
That is hard to overcome
Our own power is not enough
Except by Thy grace alone.

3. How we want sin be destroyed
Within our heart and without
Come, Thou Holy Spirit come
And wash away all our sins.

4. Thou, O God, art all our need
Give Thy Holy Ghost to us
That we may keep Thy precepts
And walk in Thy perfect way.
verses_yoruba:
Emi Mimo sokale,
Ba wa gbe ni aiye yi;
Fi ohun orun han ni,
Si ba ni sin Olorun.

2. Ese wa ni okan wa,
Ti a ko le fi sile;
Agbara wa ko to se,
Bi ’Wo ko ba pelu wa.

3. Awa n fe k’ ese parun,
L’ okan ati l’ ara wa;
Wa, Emi Mimo, joo wa,
K’ o we gbogbo ese nu.

4. Olorun, ’Wo l’ awa n fe,
Fi Emi Re naa fun wa;
K’ a le pa ofin Re mo,
K’ a si rin ni ona Re.

title_english: Come, gracious Spirit, heav’nly Dove,
passage_english: FOR AS MANY AS ARE LED BY THE SPIRIT OF GOD, THESE ARE SONS OF GOD. ROMANS 8:14
passage_yoruba: IYE AWON TI A FI EMI OLORUN TO, AWON NI I SE OMO OLORUN. ROMU 8:14
verses_english:
Come, gracious Spirit, heav’nly Dove,
With light and comfort from above;
Be Thou our Guardian, Thou our Guide,
O’er every thought and step preside.

2. The light of truth to us display,
And make us know and choose Thy way;
Plant holy fear in every heart,
That we from God may ne’er depart.

3. Lead us to holiness, the road
Which we must take to dwell with God;
Lead us to Christ, the living way,
Nor let us from His pastures stray.

4. Lead us to God, our final rest,
To be with Him forever blest;
Lead us to Heav’n, its bliss to share,
Fullness of joy forever there!
verses_yoruba:
Emi Mimo ‘Dada orun,
Wa mu itunu sokale;
Se Oga at’ Oluto wa,
Ma pelu gbogbo ero wa.

2. Jo fi otito Re han wa,
K’a le fe k’ a si m’ ona Re;
Gbin ife toto s’ okan wa,
K’ a ma le pada lehin Re.

3. Mu wa k’ a to ona mimo,
T’ a le gba d’ odo oLorun;
Mu wa to Krist, Ona, Iye,
Ma je ki awa sina lo.

4. Mu wa t’ Olorun, ‘simi wa,
K’ a le ma bag be titi lai:
To wa s’ orun, k’ a le n’ ipin,
L’ owo Otun Olorun wa.

title_english: Heavenly Father we assemble
passage_english: AND THEY WERE ALL FILLED WITH THE HOLY SPIRIT. ACTS 2:4
passage_yoruba: GBOGBO WON SI KUN FUN EMI MIMO. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:4
verses_english:
Heavenly Father we assemble
We are Thy helpless children,
Fill us with Thy Holy Spirit
And revive us with Thy power:
Come to us Holy Spirit come,
Fill our hearts with Thy new power!
Thy great gifts we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day.

2. Remember Thy promise Jesus
Pour Thy Spirit on us all,
Give to us the coveted peace
Which all the world cannot give,
Come to us Holy Spirit come,
Take away sins from our hearts,
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day.

3. Heavenly Dove come down on us
Fill us with Thy mighty power,
That the whole nations of the earth
May honour Jesus our Lord,
Let Thy name spread through the corners
Of this our very dark world;
Thy great gift we are craving for
Like that of Pentecost Day.
verses_yoruba:
Baba wa orun, awa de,
Awa alailagbara;
Fi Emi Mimo Re kun wa,
K’ o so gbogbo wa d’ otun.
Wa! Emi Mimo, jare wa!
F’ ede titun s’ okan wa.
Ebun nla Re ni l’ a n toro,
T’ ojo nla Pentikosti.

2. Ranti ileri Re, Jesu,
Tu Emi Re s’ ara wa;
Fi Alaafia Re fun wa,
T’ aye ko le fifun ni.
Wa! Emi Mimo, jare wa!
Pa ese run l’ okan wa.
Ebun nla Re ni l’ a n toro,
T’ ojo nla Pentikosti.

3. Adaba orun! ba le wa,
Fi agbara Re fun wa;
Ki gbogbo orile ede
Teriba f’ Olugbala.
K’ a gburo Re jakejado
Ile okunkun wa yii.
Ebun nla Re ni l’ a n toro,
T’ ojo nla Pentikosti.

title_english: Spirit divine, attend our prayer,
passage_english: FOR THE GLORY OF THE LORD HAD FILLED THE HOUSE OF GOD. II CHRONICLE 5:14.
passage_yoruba: OGO OLUWA SI KUN ILE OLORUN. II KRONIKA. 5:14
verses_english:
2. Come as the light! to us reveal
The truth we long to know;
Reveal the narrow path of right,
The way of duty show.

3. Come as the fire and purge our hearts
Like sacrificial flame,
Till our whole souls an offering be
In love’s redeeming name.

4. Come as the dew, and sweetly bless
This consecrated hour;
May barrenness rejoice to own
Thy fertilizing power.

5. Come as the dove, and spread Thy wings,
The wings of peaceful love;
And let Thy Church on earth become
Blest as Thy Church above.
verses_yoruba:
Emi orun, gbadura wa,
Wa gbe’nu ile yii
Sokale pel'agbara Re,
Wa, Emi Mimo wa.

2. Wa bi ‘mole, si fihan wa
B’aini wa ti po to;
Wa, to wa si ona iye,
Ti olododo n rin.

3. Wa bi ina ebo Mimo:
S’okan wa di mimo;
Je ki okan wa je ore,
F’ Oruko Oluwa.

4. Wa bi iri, si wa bukun
Akoko mimo yii:
Ki okan alaileso wa
Le yo l'agbara Re.

5. Wa bi adaba, n'apa Re,
Apa ife mimo;
Wa, je ki ijo Re l’aye
Dabi ijo t’orun.

6. Emi orun, gb’adura wa,
S’aye yi d’ile Re;
Sokale pel'agbara Re,
Wa, Emi Mimo wa.

title_english: To Thee, O Comforter divine,
passage_english: BUT THE COMFORTER, WHICH IS THE HOLY GHOST, HE SHALL TEACH YOU ALL THINGS. JOHN 14:26.
passage_yoruba: “OLUTUNU NAA, TI SE EMI MIMO … OUN NI O KO YIN NI OHUN GBOGBO”. JOHN 14:26.
verses_english:
To Thee, O Comforter divine,
For all Thy grace and power benign,
Sing we Alleluia!

2. To Thee, Whose faithful love had place
In God's great covenant of grace,
Sing we Alleluia!

3. To Thee, Whose faithful voice doth win
The wandering from the ways of sin,
Sing we Alleluia!

4. To Thee, Whose faithful power doth heal,
Enlighten, sanctify, and seal,
Sing we Alleluia!

5. To Thee, Whose faithful truth is shown
By every promise made our own,
Sing we Alleluia!

6. To Thee, our Teacher and our Friend,
Our faithful Leader to the end,
Sing we Alleluia!

7. To Thee, by Jesus Christ sent down,
Of all His gifts the sum and crown,
Sing we Alleluia!

8. To Thee, Who art with God the Son,
And God the Father ever One,
Sing we Alleluia!
verses_yoruba:
Si o Olutunu Orun
Fun oore at’agbara Re
A nko, Aleluya

2. Si O, ife enit’owa
Ninu Majemu Olorun
A nko, Aleluya

3. Si o ohun eniti n pe
Asako kuro n’nu ese
A nko, Aleluya

4. Si O agbara Eniti
O n we ni mo, t’o n wo ni san
A nko, Aleluya

5. Si o ododo eniti
Gbogbo ‘leri Re je tiwa
A nko, Aleluya

6. Si O, Oluko at’Ore
Amona wa tooto d’opin
A nko, Aleluya.

7. Si O, eniti Kristi ran
Ade oun gbogbo ebun Re
A nko, Aleluya. Amin.

8. Si o enit’ o je okan
Pelu Baba ati Omo
A nko, Aleluya

title_english: Spirit blest, Who art adored
passage_english: I WILL BE LIKE THE DEW TO ISRAEL. HOSEA 14:5
passage_yoruba: EMI O DABI IRIS I ISREAL. HOSEA 14:5
verses_english:
Spirit blest, Who art adored
With the Father and the Word,
One eternal God and Lord:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

2. Holy Spirit, heavenly Dove,
Dew descending from above,
Breath of life, and Fire of love;
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

3. Source of strength and knowledge clear,
Wisdom, godliness sincere,
Understanding, counsel, fear:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

4. Source of meekness, love, and peace,
Patience, pureness, faith’s increase,
Hope and joy that cannot cease:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

5. Spirit guiding to the right,
Spirit making darkness light,
Spirit of resistless might:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

6. Thou by Whom the Virgin bore
Him Whom heaven and earth adore,
Sent our nature to restore:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

7. Thou Whom Jesus from His throne,
Gave to cheer and help His own,
That they might not be alone:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

8. Thou Whose grace the church doth fill,
Showing her God’s perfect will,
Making Jesus present still:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

9. Thou by Whom our souls are fed
With the true living bread
Even him who for us bled
Hear us Holy spirit

10. All Thy sevenfold gifts bestow,
Gifts of wisdom, God to know,
Gifts of strength to meet the foe:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

11. All our evil passions kill,
Bend aright our stubborn will,
Though we grieve Thee, patient still;
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

12. Come to raise us when we fall,
And when snares our souls enthrall,
Lead us back with gentle call:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

13. Come, to strengthen all the weak,
Give Thy courage to the meek,
Teach our faltering tongues to speak:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

14. Come to aid the souls that yearn
More of truth divine to learn,
And with deeper love to burn:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

15. Keep us in the narrow way,
Warn us when we go astray,
Plead within us when we pray:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.

16. Holy, loving, as Thou art,
Come, and live within our heart.
Never from us to depart:
Hear us, Holy Spirit.
verses_yoruba:
Emi ’bukun ti a n sin
Pelu Baba at’ Oro,
Olorun ayeraiye;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

2. Emi Mimo, ’Daba orun,
Iri ti n se lat’ oke,
Emi ’ye at’ ina ’fe;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

3. Isun ipa at’ imo,
Ogbon at’ iwa- mimo,
Oye, imoran, eru;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

4. Isun ife, Alaafia,
Suuru, ibisi ’gbagbo,
’Reti, ayo ti ki tan;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

5. Emi Afonahan ni,
Emi ti n mu ’mole wa,
Emi agbara gbogbo;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

6. ’Wo t’ o mu Wundia bi,
Eni t’ orun t’ aye n bo,
T’a ran lati tun wa bi;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

7. ’Wo ti Jesu t’ oke ran
Wa tu eniyan Re ninu,
Ki won ma ba nikan wa;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

8. ’Wo t’O n f’ oore kun Ijo,
T’O n fi ife Baba han,
T’O n mu k’o maa ri Jesu;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

9. Iwo ti n founje iye,
At’ otito naa bo wa,
Ani, Oun t’O ku fun wa;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

10. F’ ebun meje Re fun ni,
Ogbon, lati m’ Olorun,
Ipa lati ko ota;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

11. Pa ese run lokan wa,
To ife wa si ona,
B’a ba n se O, mu suuru;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

12. Gbe wa dide, b’a subu,
Ati nigba idanwo,
Sa pe wa pada pele;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

13. Wa, k’O mu ailera le,
F’ igboya fun alaare,
Ko wa l’ oro t’a o so;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

14. Wa ran okan wa lowo,
Lati mo otito Re,
Ki ’fe wa le maa gbona;
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

15. Pa wa mo l’ona tooro
Ba wa wi nigb’a n sako,
Ba wa bebe l’ adura,
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

16. Eni Mimo, Olufe,
Wa gbe inu okan wa;
Ma fi wa sile titi:
Emi Mimo, gbo ti wa.

title_english: Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
passage_english: “DAY AND NIGHT THEY NEVER STOP SAYING: HOLY, HOLY, HOLY IS THE LORD GOD ALMIGHTY” REV. 4:8
passage_yoruba: “WON KO SINMI LI OSAN ATI LI ORU WIPE, MIMO, MIMO, MIMO OLUWA, OLORUN, OLODUMARE” IFI. 4:8.
verses_english:
1. Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
Early in the morning our song shall rise to thee;
holy, holy, holy! merciful and mighty,
God in three persons, blessed Trinity!

2. Holy, holy, holy! All the saints adore thee,
casting down their golden crowns around the glassy sea;
Cherubim and seraphim falling down before thee,
Who wert and art and evermore shalt be.

3. Holy, holy, holy! Though the darkness hide thee,
though the eye made blind by sin thy glory may not see,
only thou art holy; there is none beside thee,
perfect in power, in love, and purity.

4. Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
All thy works shall praise thy name, in earth and sky and sea;
holy, holy, holy! merciful and mighty,
God in three persons, blessed Trinity!
verses_yoruba:
1. Mimo, Mimo,Mimo, Olodumare
Ni kutukutu n’Iwo O gbo orin wa
Mimo, Mimo, Mimo, Oniyonu julo
Ologo meta, lae Olubukun!

2. Mimo, Mimo, Mimo, awon t’orun n yin In
Won n fi ade wura won lele y’ite ka
Kerubim, Serafim n wole niwaju Re
Wo t’O ti wa, t’O si wa titi lae.

3. Mimo, Mimo,Mimo! b’okunkun pa O mo
Bi oju elese ko le ri ogo Re
Iwo nikan l’O mo ko tun s’elomiran
Pipe ‘nu agbara ati n’ife.

4. Mimo, Mimo, Mimo! Olodumare!
Gbogbo ise Re n’ile l’oke l’o n yin O
Mimo, Mimo, Mimo! Oniyonu julo!
Ologo meta lai Olubukun

title_english: Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
passage_english: HOLY, HOLY, HOLY IS THE LORD GOD ALMIGHTY
passage_yoruba: MIMO, MIMO, MIMO OLUWA, OLORUN, OLODUMARE
verses_english:
Holy, holy, holy! Lord God Almighty!
Early in the morning our song shall rise to thee;
holy, holy, holy! merciful and mighty,
God in three persons, blessed Trinity!
verses_yoruba:
Mimo, Mimo,Mimo, Olodumare
Baba, Omo, Emii, Eleda, Olooto
Mimo, Mimo, Mimo, Olododo julo!
Pipe ‘nu iwa, lae Olubukun!

Mimo, Mimo, Mimo, Gbogbo aye gberin
Korin yin! k’aye yin Eni Metalokan
Olorun Alagbara, Olorun Olufe,
Olupamo, Oloore ofe.

Mimo, Mimo,Mimo! Yo eni irapada
Da ohun yin po mo t’awon ti n yin in l’orun
Titi lae ni k’eyin In;
Mimo, Mimo,Mimo! F’Eni Metalokan Ayeraye

Mimo, Mimo, Mimo! Olodumare!
Ogo, Ola, Ogbon, Agbara ni Tire
Mimo fun Eni Mimo ti o gunwa
“Eleru ni iyin, Eni ‘yanu”

title_english: Father of heaven above,
passage_english: WHO SHALL NOT FEAR YOU, O LORD, AND GLORIFY YOUR NAME? FOR YOU ALONE ARE HOLY. REVELATION 15:4
passage_yoruba: TANI KI O BERU RE, OLUWA TI KI YIO SI FI OGO FUN ORUKO RE? NITORI PE IWO NIKANSOSO NI MIMO. IFIHAN 15:4
verses_english:
Father of heaven above,
Dwelling in light and love.
Ancient of days,
Light unapproachable,
Love inexpressible,
Thee, the invisible,
Laud we and praise.

Christ the eternal Word,
Christ the incarnate Lord,
Saviour of all,
High throned above all height
God of God, Light of Light,
Increate, infinite,
On Thee we call.

O God, the Holy Ghost
Whose fires of Pentecost
Burn evermore,
In this far wilderness
Leave us not comfortless;
Thee we love, Thee we bless,
Thee we adore.

Strike your harps, heavenly powers;
With your glad chants shall ours
Trembling ascend;
All praise, O God, to Thee,
Three in One, One in Three,
Praise everlastingly,
World without end.
verses_yoruba:
Baba oke Orun,
T’ imole at’ ife,
Eni ‘gbani!
‘Mole t’ a ko le wo,
Ife t’ a ko le so,
Iwo Oba airi,
Awa yin O.

Kristi Omo laelae,
‘Wo t’o di eniyan,
Olugbala:
Eni giga julo,
Olorun, Imole,
Aida at’ Ailopin,
A kepe O.

Iwo Emi Mimo
T’ ina Pentikost’ Re,
N tan titi lae;
Mas’ aitu wa ninu,
L’ aye aginju yii:
‘Wo l’a fe, ‘Wo l’a yin,
A juba Re.

Angel’ e lu duru
K’orin t’awa ti yin;
Jumo dalu:
Ogo fun Olorun,
Metalokansoso;
A yin O tit’ aye
Ainipekun.

title_english: Three in One and One in Three,
passage_english: THE REDEEMED OF THE LORD SHALL RETURN AND COME WITH SINGING UNTO ZION… AND SORROW AND MOURNING SHALL FLEE AWAY. ISA. 51:11
passage_yoruba: AWON ENI-IRAPADA OLUWA YIO PADA, NWON O SI WA SO SIONI TI AWON TI ORIN … IKAANU ATI OFI YIO FO LO. ISA. 51:11
verses_english:
Three in One and One in Three,
Ruler of the earth and sea,
hear us while we lift to thee
holy chant and psalm.

Light of lights! with morning shine,
lift on us thy light divine;
and let charity benign
breathe on us her balm.

Three in One and One in Three,
darkling here we worship thee;
with the saints hereafter we
hope to bear the palm.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun metalokan
Oba ila at’okun
Gbo ti wa bi a ti n ko
Orin iyin Re

‘Wo imole lowuro
Tan ‘mole Re yi wa ka
Jeki ebun rere Re,
M’aiya wa bale

‘Wo ‘mole ni gb’oorun wo
K’a ri idariji gba
Ki alaafia orun
F’itura fun wa

Olorun – metalokan!
Isin wa laye ko to!
A n reti lati dapo
Mo awon t’orun

title_english: Father of heaven, whose love profound
passage_english: FOR THERE THE LORD COMMANDED THE BLESSING LIFE FOREVER MORE. PSALMS 133:3
passage_yoruba: NIBE L’ OLUWA GBE PASE IBUKUN ANI IYE LAELAE. ORIN DAFIDI 133:3
verses_english:
Father of heaven, whose love profound
A ransom for our souls hath found,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy pardoning love extend.

Almighty Son, Incarnate Word,
Our Prophet, Priest, Redeemer, Lord,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy pardoning love extend.

Eternal Spirit, by whose breath
The soul is raised from sin and death,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy pardoning love extend.

Jehovah - Father, Spirit, Son -
Mysterious Godhead, Three in One,
Before Thy throne we sinners bend;
To us Thy pardoning love extend.
verses_yoruba:
Baba orun, ’jinle ’fe Re,
L’o wa Oludande fun wa;
A wole niwaju ’te Re,
Na ‘wo ’dariji Re si wa.

Omo Baba, t’O d’ Eniyan,
’Woli, Alufa, Oluwa,
A wole niwaju ’te Re,
Na ‘wo ’dariji Re si wa.

Emi at’ ayeraiye lae,
Emi ti n ji oku dide,
A wole niwaju ’te Re,
Na ‘wo ’dariji Re si wa.

Jehofa, Baba, Omo, Emi
’Yanu ’jinle Metalokan,
A wole niwaju ’te Re,
Na ‘wo ’dariji Re si wa.

title_english: Give glory to the Father,
passage_english: GLORY TO GOD IN THE HIGHEST. LUKE 2:14
passage_yoruba: OGO NI FUN OLORUN LI OKE ORUN. LUKU 2:14
verses_english:
Give glory to the Father,
By whom we are made to live;
He hears the prayer of youths,
He listen to their Sweet Songs.

Give glory unto the Son,
Jesus Christ Thou art our King;
Come ye sing aloud the song,
Unto the Lamb of Sinners.

Glory be to Holy Ghost,
Like the day of Pentecost;
Stir up the souls of the youths,
Fill their lips with holy songs.

Glory be to God on high,
Three in One and One in Three;
For the gospel of our Lord,
And our God’s eternal love.
verses_yoruba:
E fi ogo fun Baba,
Nipa Eniti a wa;
O n gbo adura ewe,
O n f’ eti si orin won.

E fi ogo fun Omo,
Kristi, ’Wo ni Oba wa;
E wa, e korin s’ oke,
S’ Odagutan elese.

Ogo fun Emi Mimo,
Bi ojo Pentikosti;
Ru aya awon ewe,
F’ orin mimo s’ ete won.

Ogo ni l’ oke orun,
Fun Eni Metalokan;
Nitori ihin rere,
A ti ife Olorun.

title_english: Sing eternal praises
passage_english: PRAISE HIM ACCORDING TO HIS EXCELLENT GREATNESS! PSALMS 150:2
passage_yoruba: YIN IN GEGE BI TITOBI NLA RE. ORIN DAFIDI 150:2
verses_english:
Sing eternal praises
Unto the Father
Sing eternal praises
Ever to the Son
Sing eternal praises
To the Holy Ghost
Sing eternal praises
To the Three in One.

Sing eternal praises
For the Father's love
Sing eternal praises
For Emmanuel's love
Sing eternal praises
For the Spirit's love
Sing eternal praises
To the Three in One.
verses_yoruba:
F’ iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Baba,
F’ iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Omo,
F’ iyin ainipekun
Fun ife Emi,
F’ iyin ainipekun
Fun Metalokan.

title_english: Our Father and our God,
passage_english: “YOU ARE WORTHY, O LORD, TO RECEIVE GLORY AND HONOR AND POWER. REV. 4:11
passage_yoruba: OLUWA, IWO LI O YE LATI GBA OGO, ATI OLA, ATI AGBARA. IFIHAN 4:11
verses_english:
Our Father and our God,
Accept our songs of praise
On earth and heaven above,
The God who reigns in love,
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more.

Eternal Son of God
Who shed His blood for us,
Who rose up from the dead
And up to heaven ascend
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more.

To Thee the Holy Ghost,
We raise our songs of praise
Thou who has shed the light
Of life into our hearts,
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more.

Our Holy Triune God
We praise the Three-in-One
On earth and heaven above,
We raise our songs of praise
To Thee is due all praise and thanks
And majesty for ever more.
verses_yoruba:
Baba, Eleda wa,
Gbo orin iyin wa
L’ aye ati l’ orun,
Baba Olubukun:
Iwo l’ ogo ati iyin,
Ope, ati ola ye fun.

Si O Emi Mimo,
Ni a korin iyin:
Iwo t’ o f’ imole
Iye si okan wa;
Iwo l’ ogo, ati iyin,
Ope ati ola ye fun.

Mimo, Mimo, Mimo,
N’ iyin Metalokan:
L’ aye ati L’ orun,
L’ a o maa korin pe,
Iwo l’ ogo, ati iyin,
Ope ati ola ye fun.

title_english: Almighty God of creation,
passage_english: AND HIS NAME WILL BE CALLED WONDERFUL. ISAIAH 9:6
passage_yoruba: ORUKO RE NI IYANU. ISAIAH 9:6
verses_english:
Almighty God of creation,
Father, Son, Holy Ghost
Whose face no human eye can see
The Invisible God.

Thou Father our Almighty God
We tremble before Thee
All nations here shall worship Thee
Before Thine altar, Lord.

Lord Jesus our own dear close friend
Redemption Thou has brought
Forsake us not, Saviour Divine
But save us to the end.

Oh Holy Ghost, Spirit Divine
Full of Heav's Grace, Thou art
Bestow Thy wisdom from above
To know that God is love.

The Three in One, yet One in Three,
The Trinity Divine
The mystery unsearchable
The Trinity Divine.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun Olodumare,
Baba, Omo, Emi,
Riri enit’ a ko le mo,
Enit’ a ko le ri.

Ye! Baba Olodumare,
K’ a wariri fun O;
Ni gbogbo orile ede,
Li a o ma sin O.

Olorun Omo, Ore wa,
’Wo t’ o rawa pada,
Ma jowo wa, Olugbala!
Gba wa patapata.

A! Olorun Emi Mimo,
’Wo olore- ofe;
A be O, fun wa ni imo,
K’ a m’ Olorun n’ ife.

Okansoso sugbon meta,
Eni Metalokan,
Olorun awamaridi,
Eni Metalokan!

title_english: We give immortal praise
passage_english: THEY GIVE GLORY, HONOR AND THANKS TO HIM WHO SITS ON THE THRONE. REV. 4:9
passage_yoruba: WON SI FI OGO, ATI OLA, ATI OPE, FUN ENITI O JOKO LORI ITE. IFIHAN 4:9
verses_english:
We give immortal praise
To God the Father’s love,
For all our comforts here,
And better hopes above;
He sent His own eternal Son,
To die for sins that man had done.

To God the Son belongs
Immortal glory too,
Who bought us with His blood
From everlasting woe:
And now He lives, and now He reigns,
And sees the fruit of all His pains.

To God the Spirit’s name
Immortal worship give,
Whose new-creating power
Makes the dead sinner live;
His work completes the great design,
And fills the soul with joy divine.

Almighty God, to Thee
Be endless honors done,
The undivided Three,
And the mysterious One:
Where reason fails, with all her powers,
There faith prevails, and love adores.
verses_yoruba:
Mo, f'iyin ailopin,
Fun Olorun Baba,
Fun oore ayé mi,
At' ireti t'orun,
O ran omo Re ayanfe,
Lati ku fun ese ayé.

Mo f'iyin ailopin
Fun Olorun omo,
T'O f'eje Re we wa,
Kuro ninu egbe;
Nisisiyi O wa l'Oba,
O n ri eso irora Re.

Mo f'iyin ailopin,
Fun Olorun Emi;
Eni f'agbara Re,
So elese d'aaye,
O pari ise igbala,
O si fi ayo kun okan.

Mo f'ola ailopin,
Fun Olodumare,
'Wo Ologo meta,
Sugbon okan soso
B'O ti ju imo wa lo ni,
A o ma f'igbagbo yin O.

title_english: Holy Bible, Book divine,
passage_english: O HOW LOVE I THY LAW! PSLAM 119:97
passage_yoruba: EMI TI FE OFIN RE TO! ORIN DAFIDI 119:97
verses_english:
Holy Bible, Book divine,
Precious treasure, thou art mine:
Mine to tell me whence I came;
Mine to teach me what I am.

Mine to comfort in distress,
Suffering in this wilderness;
Mine to show by living faith,
We can triumph over death.

Mine to tell of joys to come,
And the rebel sinner's doom:
O thou holy book divine,
Precious treasure thou art mine.
verses_yoruba:
Bibeli mimo t‘orun,
Owon isura t’emi!
‘Wo ti n wi bi mo ti ri
‘Wo ti n so bi mo ti wa.

‘Wo nko mi bi mo sina,
‘Wo nfi ‘fe Oluwa han;
‘Wo l‘O si nto ese mi,
‘Wo l‘O ndare, at‘ebi.

‘Wo ni n maa tu wa ninu
Ninu wahala aye;
‘Wo n ko ni, nipa ‘gbagbo
Pe, a le segun iku.

‘Wo l‘O n so t‘ayo ti n bo
At‘iparun elese;
Bibeli mimo t‘orun,
Owon isura t’emi.

title_english: How shall our children and young ones
passage_english: WHEREWITHAL SHALL A YOUNG MAN CLEANSE HIS WAY? BY TAKING HEED THERETO ACCORDING TO THY WORD. PSLAM 119:9
passage_yoruba: NIPA EWO NI ODOMOKUNRIN YIO FI MU ONA RE MO? NIPA IKIYESI GEGEBI ORO RE. ORIN DAFIDI 119:9
verses_english:
How shall our children and young ones
Take heed and cleanse their way,
Only by taking heed thereto
According to thy word.

Thy word entered into the heart
And sheds its light abroad
It gives wisdom to the simple
And the knowledge of God.

Thy word, is sun, our light divine,
Our guide in noon-day bright,
A lamp unto our feet always
From dangers of the night.

Thy word is everlasting truth
It is all clean and pure,
Our guide in all our joyful days,
A staff for our old age.
verses_yoruba:
Bawo ni awon ewe wa,
Yoo ti maa sora won?
Bikose ‘nipa ‘kiyesi,
Gege bi oro Re.

‘Gba oro naa wo‘nu okan,
A tan imole ka;
Oro naa ko ope l‘ogbon,
At‘ imo Olorun.

Oorun ni, imole wa ni,
Amona wa l‘osan;
Fitila ti n fonahan wa,
Ninu ewu oru.

Oro Re, ooto ni titi,
Mimo ni gbogbo re:
Amona wa l‘ojo ewe.
Opa l‘ojo ogbo.

title_english: Lord, Thy Word abideth,
passage_english: THY WORD IS A LAMP UNTO MY FEET, AND A LIGHT UNTO MY PATH. PSALM 119:105
passage_yoruba: ORO RE NI FITILA SI MI LESE ATI IMOLE SI IPA ONA MI. ORIN DAFIDI 119:105
verses_english:
Lord, Thy Word abideth,
And our footsteps guideth;
Who its truth believeth
Light and joy receiveth.

When our foes are near us,
Then Thy Word doth cheer us,
Word of consolation,
Message of salvation.

When the storms are o’er us,
And dark clouds before us,
Then its light directeth,
And our way protecteth.

Who can tell the pleasure,
Who recount the treasure,
By Thy Word imparted
To the simple hearted?

Word of mercy, giving
Succor to the living;
Word of life, supplying
Comfort to the dying!

O that we, discerning,
Its most holy learning,
Lord, may love and fear Thee,
Evermore be near Thee!
verses_yoruba:
Jesu oro Re ye,
O si n to ‘sise wa,
Enit‘o ba gbagbo,
Yoo l‘ayo oun ‘mole.

Nigb‘ota sunmo wa,
Oro Re l‘odi wa;
Oro itunu ni,
Iko igbala ni.

B‘igbi at‘okunkun
Tile bo wa mole;
‘Mole Re yoo to wa,
Yo si dabobo wa.

Tani le so ayo,
T’o le ka isura
Ti oro Re n fi fun
Okan onirele?

Oro aanu o n fi
‘Lera fun alaaye;
Oro iye o n fi
Itunu f’eni n ku.

Awa iba le mo
Eko ti O n koni;
Ki a ba le fe O.
K‘a si le sunmo O.

title_english: Word of God incarnate,
passage_english: THY WORD IS A LAMP UNTO MY FEET, AND A LIGHT UNTO MY PATH. PSALM 119:105
passage_yoruba: OR RE NI FITILA FUN ESE MI ATI IMOLE SI IPA ONA MI. ORIN DAFIDI 119:105
verses_english:
Word of God incarnate,
O wisdom from on high,
O truth unchanged, unchanging,
O light of our dark sky:
We praise You for the radiance
That from the hallowed page,
A lantern to our footsteps,
Shines on from age to age.

The Church from You, our Savior,
Received the gift divine,
And still that light is lifted
O’er all the earth to shine.
It is the sacred vessel
Where gems of truth are stored;
It is the Heav’n drawn picture
Of Christ, the living Word.

The Scripture is a banner
Before God’s host unfurled;
It is a shining beacon
Above the darkling world.
It is the chart and compass
That over life’s surging tide,
Mid mists and rocks and quicksands,
To You, O Christ, will guide.

O make your Church, dear Savior,
A lamp of purest gold,
To bear before the nations
Your true light as of old.
O teach your wandering pilgrims
By this their path to trace,
Till, clouds and darkness ended,
They see You face to face.
verses_yoruba:
Iwo Oro Olorun,
Ogbon at‘oke wa;
Ooto ti ki ‘yipada,
Imole aye wa:
Awa yin O fun 'mole,
T‘inu Iwe Mimo;
Fitila fun ese wa
Ti n tan titi aye.

Oluwa l‘o f‘ebun yii
Fun Ijo Re l‘aye,
A n gbe ‘mole naa soke
Lati tan y‘aye ka,
Apoti wura n‘ise,
O kun fun otito,
Aworun Kristi si ni,
Oro iye, tooto

O n fe lele b‘asia
T'a ta loju ogun;
O n tan b'ina alore,
Si okunkun aye;
Amona eniyan ni,
Ni wahala gbogbo,
Nin‘aarin omi aye,
O n to wa sodo Kristi.

Olugbala, se‘jo Re
Ni fitila wura;
Lati tan Imole Re
Bi aye igbaani;
Ko awon ti o sako,
Lati lo‘mole yii
Tit‘ookun aye yoo pin,
Ti won o r‘oju Re.

title_english: God is the refuge of His saints,
passage_english: GOD IS OUR REFUGE AND STRENGTH. PSALMS 46:1
passage_yoruba: OLORUN LI AABO WA ATI AGBARA ORIN DAFIDI 46:1
verses_english:
God is the refuge of His saints,
When storms of sharp distress invade;
Ere we can offer our complaints,
Behold Him present with His aid.

That sacred stream, Thy holy Word,
That all our raging fear controls;
Sweet peace Thy promises afford,
And give new strength to fainting souls.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun l’ aabo eni Re,
Nigba iji iponju de;
K’ awa to se aroye wa,
A! sa woo t’ oun t’ iranwo Re.

B’ agbami riru n bu soke,
Okan wa n be l’ alaafia;
Nigb’ orile at’ etido,
Ba n jaya riru omi naa.

Iwe owo ni oro Re,
Kawo ibinu fufu wa;
Oro Re m’ alaafia wa,
O f’ ilera f’ okan aare.

title_english: There is a book, who runs may read,
title_yoruba: Iwe kan wa ti kika re
passage_english: O LORD, HOW MANIFOLD ARE THY WORKS. PSALM 104.24
passage_yoruba: OLUWA ISE RE TI PO TO!. ORIN DAFIDI 104:24
verses_english:
There is a book, who runs may read,
which heavenly truth imparts,
and all the lore its scholars need,
pure eyes and Christian hearts.

The works of God above, below,
within us and around,
are pages in that book, to shew
how God himself is found.

Two worlds are ours; 'tis only sin
Forbids us to descry
The mystic heaven and earth within,
Plain as the sea and sky..

Thou, who hast given me eyes to see
and love this sight so fair,
give me a heart to find out thee,
and read thee everywhere.
verses_yoruba:
Iwe kan wa ti kika re
Ko soro fun enia;
Ogbon ti awon to ka nfe
Ni Okan ti o mo.

Ise gbogbo t‘Olorun se
L‘oke n ‘ile, n‘nu wa;
Nwon j’okan ninu iwe na
Lati f‘Olorun han.

Imole osupa l’oke
Lat’ odo orun ni,
Bee l’ogo Ijo Olorun,
T’ odo Oluwa wa.

Iwo ti O jeki nle ri
Ohun to dara yi;
Fun mi l‘okan lati wa O,
K‘a ri O nibi gbogbo.

title_english: Father of mercies, in Thy Word
passage_english: THY STATUTES HAVE BEEN MY SONGS IN THE HOUSE OF MY PILGRIMAGE. PSALM 119:54
passage_yoruba: ILANA RE LI O TI NSE ORIN MI, NI ILE ATIPO MI. ORIN DAFIDI 119:54
verses_english:
Father of mercies, in Thy Word
What endless glory shines!
Forever be Thy name adored
For these celestial lines.

Here springs of consolation rise
To cheer the fainting mind,
And thirsting souls receive supplies
And sweet refreshment find.

Here the Redeemer's welcome voice
Spreads heavenly peace around,
And life and everlasting joys
Attend the blissful sound.

Oh, may these heavenly pages be
My ever dear delight;
And still new beauties may I see
And still increasing light!

Divine Instructor, gracious Lord,
Be Thou forever near;
Teach me to love Thy sacred Word
And view my Savior here.
verses_yoruba:
Baba orun nin‘ oro Re
Ni ogo orun ntan;
Titi lai l’a o ma yin O
Fun Bibeli Mimo.

Opo ‘tunu wa ninu re
Fun okan alare;
Gbogbo okan ti ongbe ngbe
Nri omi iye mu.

Ninu re l’alafia,
Ti Jesu fi fun wa,
Iye ainipekun si wa
N’nu re fun wa gbogbo.

Iba le ma je ayo mi,
Lati ma ka titi;
Ki nma ri ogbon titun ko
N‘nu re lojojumo.

Oluwa Oluko orun,
Mase jina si mi:
Ko mi lati fe oro Re .
Ki nri Jesu nibe.

title_english: The Bible everlasting book!
passage_english: THY WORDS WERE FOUND, AND I DID EAT THEM. JER. 15:16
passage_yoruba: MO RI ORO RE MO SI JE WON. JER. 15:16
verses_english:
The Bible everlasting book!
Who knows thy deep secrets?
Your beginning on earth who knows?
And who can know Thy end?

A book indeed among thousands,
A book of ancient days;
Thou made salvation way so plain,
To all mankind on earth.

The treasure of the Three-in-One
The blessed Trinity,
Do, interprete Thyself to me,
And all my doubts dispel.

The pages I’ll open with prayer,
To learn Thy doctorines Lord,
The everlasting Book divine,
Show me the saviour’s love.
verses_yoruba:
Bibel‘ iwe ayeraye!
Tani le r‘idi re?
Tani le so idide re?
Tani le m‘opin re?

Okan mi O laarin opo
Iwe aye ‘gbaani,
Iwo l‘o s‘ona igbala
Di mimo f‘araye.

Isura ti Metalokan,
Oba nla t‘O gunwa;
Joo, tumo ara re fun mi,
Ki ‘n‘ye s’iyemeji.

Ki‘m‘ si O pelu adura,
Ki‘m‘ k‘eko ninu re;
Iwo iwe ayeraye
F‘ife Jesu han mi.

title_english: For my sake and the Gospel's, go
passage_english: FOR MY SAKE AND THE GOSPEL'S. MARK 8:35
passage_yoruba: NITORI MI ATI NITORI IHINRERE. MARKU 8:35
verses_english:
For my sake and the Gospel's, go
And tell Redemption's story,`
His heralds answer, `Be it so,
And Thine, Lord, all the glory!`
They preach His Birth, His Life, His Cross,
The love of His Atonement
For Whom they count the world but loss,
His Easter, His Enthronement.

Hark, hark, the trump of Jubilee
Proclaims to every nation,
From pole to pole, by land and sea,
Glad tidings of salvation:
As nearer draws the day of doom,
While still the battle rages,
The Heavenly Dayspring through the gloom
Breaks on the night of ages.

Still on and on the anthems spread
Of Hallelujah voices,
In concert with the holy Dead
The warrior Church rejoices;
Their snow-white robes are washed in Blood,
Their golden harps are ringing;
Earth and the Paradise of God
One Triumph-song are singing

He comes, Whose Advent Trumpet downs
The last of Time's evangels,
Emmanuel crowned with many crowns,
The Lord of Saints and Angels:
O Life, Light, Love, the great I AM,
Triune, Who changest never,
The Throne of God and of the Lamb
Is Thine, and Thine for ever!
verses_yoruba:
Tori Mi at‘Ihinrere,
E lo so t‘Irapada,
Awon onse Re n ke, Amin
Tire ni gbogbo ogo;
Won n so t‘ibi, t‘iya, t‘iku,
Ife etutu nla Re;
Won ka ohun aye s‘ofo
T‘ajinde oun'joba Re

Gbo, gbo, ipe ti Jubeli,
O n dun yi gbogb‘aye ka,
N‘ile ati loju okun,
A tan ihin igbala;
Bi ojo naa ti n sunmole,
T‘ogun si n gbona janjan,
Imole Ila-oorun naa
Yoo mo laarin okunkun.

Siwaju ati siwaju
Lao maa gbo, 'Halleluya
Ijo Ajagun yoo maa yo
Pel‘awon oku mimo,
A fo aso won n‘nu eje,
Duuru wura won si n dun,
Aye at‘orun d‘ohun po,
Won n ko orin isegun.

O de Enit‘a n w’ona Re,
Eni ikehin naa de.
Imanueli to d‘ade,
Oluwa awon Mimo,
Iye, Imole at‘ife,
Metalokan titi lae;
Tire ni ite Olorun
Ati t‘odo-agutan.

title_english: Pray, always pray; the Holy Spirit pleads
title_yoruba: Ma gbadura; Emi mbebe n’nu re
passage_english: THAT MEN OUGHT ALWAYS TO PRAY, AND NOT TO FAINT. LUKE 18:1
passage_yoruba: O YE KI A MAA GBEDURA NIGBA GBOGBO KI A MA SI SAARE. LUKU 18:1
verses_english:
Pray, always pray; the Holy Spirit pleads
within thee all thy daily hourly needs.

Pray, always pray; beneath sin's heaviest load
Prayer sees the blood from Jesus' side that flow'd.

Pray, always pray; though weary, faint, and lone,
Prayer nestles by the Father's sheltering throne.

Pray, always pray; amid the world's turmoil
Prayer keeps the heart at rest, and nerves for toil.

Pray, always pray; if joys thy pathway throng,
Prayer strikes the harp, and sings the angels' song.

Pray, always pray; if loved one pass the veil,
Prayer drinks with them of springs that cannot fail.

All earthly things with earth shall fade away;
Prayer grasps eternity; pray, always pray.
verses_yoruba:
Ma gbadura; Emi mbebe n’nu re
Fun gbogbo aini re igbagbogbo.

Ma gbadura; labe eru ese,
Adura n ri eje Jesu ti n san.

Ma gbadura; b’ are tile mu o,
Adura ngbe wa s’eba ‘te Baba.

Ma gbadura; n’nu wahala aiye,
Adura l’o nfun okan n’ isinmi.

Ma gbadura; b’ ayo ba yi o ka,
Adura nlu harp, o n korin angel’.

Ma gbadura; b’awon t’o feran ku,
Adura n ba won mu omi iye.

Gbogb’ ohun aiye yoo b’aiye koja,
Adura wa titi: ma gbadura.

title_english: From every stormy wind that blows,
title_yoruba: Ninu gbogbo iji ti n ja,
passage_english: AND THERE I WILL MEET WITH YOU, AND I WILL SPEAK WITH YOU FROM ABOVE THE MERCY SEAT. EXSODU 25:22
passage_yoruba: NIBE L’EMI O PADE RE, EMI O SIBA O SORO LATI OKE ITE AANU WA. EKSODU 25:22
verses_english:
From every stormy wind that blows,
From every swelling tide of woes,
There is a calm, a sure retreat;
'Tis found beneath the mercy-seat.

There is a place where Jesus sheds
The oil of gladness on our heads,
A place than all besides more sweet;
It is the blood-stained mercy-seat.

There is a spot where spirits blend,
Where friend holds fellowship with friend,
Though sunder’d far by faith they meet
Around the common mercy-seat.

Ah, whither could we flee for aid,
When tempted, desolate, dismayed,
Or how the hosts of hell defeat,
Had suffering saints no mercy-seat?

There, there on eagle wings we soar,
And time and sense seem all no more,
And heaven comes down our souls to greet,
And glory crowns the mercy seat.
verses_yoruba:
Ninu gbogbo iji ti n ja,
Ninu gbogbo igbi ‘ponju,
Aabo kan n be, ti o daju;
O wa labe ite- aanu.

Ibi kan wa fun idapo,
Nibi ore n pade ore;
Lairi ‘ra, nipa igbagbo,
Nwon y’ ite- aanu kanna ka.

A! nibo ni a ba sa si,
Nigba ‘danwo at’ iponju?
A ba se le bori Esu,
Bosepe ko si ‘te- aanu?

A! bi idi l’a fo sibe,
B’enipe aye ko si mo,
Orun wa ‘pade okan wa,
Ogo si bo ite- aanu.

title_english: Go, when the morning shineth
passage_english: PRAY WITHOUT CEASING. 1 THESS. 5:17
passage_yoruba: E MAA GBADURA LI AISINMI. I TESS 5:7
verses_english:
Remember all who love thee,
All who are loved by thee;
Pray too for those who hate thee,
If any such there be:
Then for thyself in meekness
A blessing humbly claim,
And link with each petition
Thy great Redemeer's name.

Or if it's here denied thee
In solitude to pray,
Should holy thoughts come o'er thee,
When friends are round thy way,
Even then the silent pleading
Of thy spirit raised up
Will reach His throne of glory,
Who's mercy, truth, and love.

Oh, not a joy or blessing
With this can we compare;
The power that He has given us
To pour our souls in prayer;
Where'er thou pin'st in sadness,
Before His footstool fall,
And remember in thy gladness
His grace who gives thee all.
verses_yoruba:
Lo, l‘ooro kutukutu,
Lo, ni osangangan
Lo, ni igba asale,
Lo, l ‘oganjo oru;
Lo t‘iwo t‘inu rere
Gbagbe ohun aye
Si kunle n‘iyewu re,
Gbadura nikoko.

Ranti awon t‘o fe o
At‘ awon t‘iwo fe
Awon t‘o korira re,
Si gbadura fun won;
Lehin naa, toro ‘bukun,
Fun ‘wo tikalare,
Ninu adura re, maa
Pe oruko Jesu.

B‘ aaye lati gbadura
Nikoko ko si si;
T‘okan re fe gbadura
‘Gba t‘ ore yi o ka,
‘Gbanna, adura jeje,
Lat ‘inu okan re
Yoo de odo Olorun
Olorun Alaanu,

Ko si ayo kan l‘aye
T‘o si ju eyii lo
Nit‘ agbara t‘a fun wa
Lati maa gbadura;
‘Gbat‘inu re ko ba dun
Je k’okan ree wole,
Ninu ayo re gbogbo
Ranti oor‘ofe Re

title_english: There is an eye that never sleeps
title_yoruba: Oju kan n be ti ki togbe
passage_english: THE EVERLASTING GOD, FAINTETH NOT, THERE IS NO SEARCHING OF HIS UNDERSTANDING. Isaiah 40:28
passage_yoruba: OLORUN AYERAYE KI I SAARE, KO SI A WARI OYE RE. ISAIAH 40:28
verses_english:
There is an eye that never sleeps
Beneath the wing of night;
There is an ear that never shuts
When sink the beams of light.

There is an arm that never tires
When human strength gives way;
There is a love that never fails
When earthly loves decay.

But there’s a power which man can wield
When mortal aid is vain,
That eye, that arm, that love to reach,
That listening ear to gain.

That power is prayer, which soars on high,
Through Jesus, to the throne,
And moves the hand which moves the world,
To bring salvation down.

Oh, Thou whose mercy knows no end,
Whose love can never cease,
Grant that we have both faith and love,
So, we may always pray.
verses_yoruba:
Oju kan n be ti ki togbe
Nigbat‘ ile ba su,
Eti kan si n be ti ki I se
'Gbati oorun ba wo.

Apa kan n be, ti ko le re
‘Gba ‘pa eniyan pin;
Ife kan n be ti ko le ku
‘Gba‘fe aye ba ku.

Oju naa n wo awon Seraf!
Apa naa d‘orun mu;
Eti naa kun f‘orin Angel‘,
Ife na ga loke.

Ipa kan l‘eniyan le lo,
‘Gbat‘ ipa gbogbo pin,
Lati ri oju at‘apa
Ati ife nla na.

Ipa na ni adura wa
Ti n lo ‘waju ite;
T‘o n mi owo t‘o s‘aye ro
Lati mu ‘gbala wa.

Iwo t’aanu Re ko lopin
T’ife Re ko le ku,
Je k’a n igbagbo at ‘ife
K’a le maa gbadura.

title_english: Uncreated Fount of light,
passage_english: BUT YOU RECEIVED THE SPIRIT OF ADOPTION BY WHOM WE CRY OUT, “ABBA, FATHER.” ROMANS 8:15 PART 1
passage_yoruba: EYIN TI GBA EMI ISODOMO NIPA EYITI AWA FI N KE PE, ABBA BABA. ROMU 8:15 APA I
verses_english:
Uncreated Fount of light,
Glory without shade of night,
Everlasting, infinite
Holy Father, hear us.

Well of life that ever flows,
Life more pure than stainless snows,
Life in calm serene repose,
Holy Father, hear us.

Round about Thy sapphire throne,
Shines the rainbow’s emerald zone,
Breathing heavenly peace alone;
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou, whose deep compassions yearn
For the prodigal’s return,
And his far-off steps discern,
Holy Father, hear us.

Aching hearts that long for rest,
Wilder’d souls by doubt opress’d,
Babes that crave a parent’s breast,
Holy Father, hear us.

All have some great gift to seek,
Hungered, thirsty weary, weak;
All have wants no words can speak,
Holy Father, hear us.

Is not Thy paternal board
With all royal bounties stored,
Priceless, countless, unexplored?
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou who sparedst not Thy Son,
Him Thine own, Thine only One,
Till Thy work by Him was done,
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou in all His sorrow nigh,
Thou, who heardest His last cry,
Thou, who sufferedst Him to die,
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou, omnipotent to save
From destruction’s whelming wave,
Death and hell and vanquish’d grave,
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou, at whose right hand once more,
He is now, His conflict o’er,
Throned where He was throned before,
Holy Father, hear us.

Thou, who crownest Him with grace,
Foldest Him to Thine embrace,
Him the brightness of Thy face,
Holy Father, hear us.

All the richest gifts of heaven,
Sevenfold from the Spirits Seven,
Measureless to Him are given;
Holy Father, hear us.

At His word Thy Spirit came,
Crowns of light and tongues of flame:
Oh for our Redeemer’s name,
Holy Father, hear us.

Hear our cry, our voiceless needs:
Hear, in us Thy Spirit pleads;
Hear, for Jesus intercedes:
Holy Father, hear us.
verses_yoruba:
Kanga Iye ti n san lae;
Iye tiko l’ abawon,
Iye t’ o ni irora,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Y’ ite safire Re ka
L’ osunmare ogo n tan;
O kun fun Alaafia,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

N’ iwaju ’te aanu Re
L’ awon Angeli n pade,
Sugbon wo wa lese Re,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Iwo ti okan Re n yo
S’ amusua t’ o pada,
T’O mo ’rin re lokeree,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Gbogbo wa ni alaini
L’ ebi, l’ oungbe at’ aare;
Ko si ede f’ aini wa,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Isura opolopo
Ko l’O kojo bi Oba?
Ainiye, aidiyele?
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

’Wo ko da Omo Re si,
Omo Re kansoso naa,
Tit’ O fi par’ ise Re,
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

’Wo t’O sunmo, gb’ O n kedun,
T’O gbo ’gbe Re ikehin;
T’O jowo Re lati ku.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

’Wo ti o le gba ni
L’owo iji iparun,
L’owo ’boji at’ iku.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

’Wo low’ otun Eniti
Oun joko nisisiyii,
T’O gunwa bi t’ isaju
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

’Wo t’O f’ oore de l’ade,
T’O si gbe mo aya Re,
Oun n’ Imole oju Re.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Gbogb’ ebun meje orun,
Lodo Emi meje ni
A fi won fun un l’ ainiwon
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

L’ase Re ni Emi wa,
’Mole at’ ela ahon,
L’ooko Olurapada.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Fun wa li akoko yii,
Lat’ inu ebun Re wa,
’Mole, iye, agbara.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

Gbo ’gbe wa, gbo aini wa;
Gbo, Emi n bebe n’nu wa:
Gbo, tori Jesu n sipe.
Baba Mimo, gbo ti wa.

title_english: Begone unbelief, my Savior is near,
passage_english: THOUGH NOW YE SEE HIM NOT, YET BELIEVING. I PET 1:8
passage_yoruba: BI EYIN KO TILE RI I NISISIYI, SUGBON EYIN N GBA A GBO. I PET 1:8.
verses_english:
Begone unbelief, my Savior is near,
And for my relief will surely appear:
By prayer let me wrestle, and He wilt perform,
With Christ in the vessel, I smile at the storm.

Though dark be my way, since He is my Guide,
’Tis mine to obey, ’tis His to provide;
Though cisterns be broken, and creatures all fail,
The Word He has spoken shall surely prevail.

His love in time past forbids me to think
He’ll leave me at last in trouble to sink;
Each sweet Ebenezer I have in review,
Confirms His good pleasure to help me quite through.

Determined to save, He watched o’er my path,
When Satan’s blind slave, I sported with death;
And can He have taught me to trust in His name,
And thus far have brought me, to put me to shame?

How bitter that cup, no heart can conceive,
Which He drank quite up, that sinners might live!
His way was much rougher, and darker than mine;
Did Jesus thus suffer, and shall I repine?

Since all that I meet shall work for my good,
The bitter is sweet, the medicine is food;
Though painful at present, wilt cease before long,
And then, O! how pleasant, the conqueror’s song!
verses_yoruba:
Aigbagbo bila! Temi l'Oluwa
Oun o si dide fun igbala mi,
Ki n sa maa gbadura,
Oun o se 'ranwo:
'Gba Krist' wa lodo mi,
ifoya ko si.

B’ona mi ba su, Oun l'O sa n to mi,
Ki n sa gboran sa, On o si pese;
Bi iranlowo eda gbogbo saki,
Oro t’enu Re so,
y’o bori dandan.

Ife t’o n fi han, ko je ki n ro pe,
Yoo fi mi sile ninu wahala;
Iranwo ti mo si n ri lojojumo,
O n ki mi laya pe,
emi o la a ja.

Emi o se kun, tori iponju,
Tabi irora? O ti so tele!
Mo m’oro Re pawon ajogun 'gbala,
Won ko le s’aikoja,
laarin wahala.

Eda ko le so kikoro ago
T'Olugbala mu, k’elese le ye;
Aye Re tile buru ju t’emi lo,
Jesu ha le jiya,
K’emi si ma sa.

Nje b’ohun gbogbo ti n sise ire,
Adun n’ikoro, ounje li oogun;
B’oni tile koro, sa ko ni pe mo,
Gbanaa orin 'segun yio ti dun to!

title_english: Father, whate'er of earthly bliss
title_yoruba: Baba, b’ ife Re ni, lati
passage_english: THEN THE LORD SHALL BE MY GOD. GENESIS 28:21
passage_yoruba: NJE OLUWA NI YIO MAA SE OLORUN MI. GENESISI 28:21
verses_english:
Father, whate'er of earthly bliss
Thy sovereign will denies,
Accepted at thy throne, let this
My humble prayer, arise:

Give me a calm and thankful heart,
From every murmur free;
The blessing of thy grace impart,
And make me live to thee.

Let the sweet hope that thou art mine
My life and death attend,
Thy presence through my journey shine,
And crown my journey's end.
verses_yoruba:
Baba, b’ ife Re ni, lati
Du mi l’ ohun aye,
Sa je ki adura mi yii
Goke de ite Re.

K’ ero yi pe, ’Wo ni temi
Ma ba mi lo laiye;
Pelu mi lona ajo mi,
Si ba mi d’opin re.

title_english: The King of love my Shepherd is.
passage_english: THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD; I SHALL NOT WANT PSALMS 23:1.
passage_yoruba: OLUWA LI OLUSO-AGUTAN MI, EMI KI O SE ALAINI. OD 23:1
verses_english:
The King of love my Shepherd is.
Whose goodness faileth never.
I nothing lack if I am His
And He is mine for ever.

Where streams of living water flow
My ransomed soul He leadeth,
And where the verdant pastures grow
With food celestial feedeth.

Perverse and foolish oft I strayed;
But yet in love He sought me,
And on His shoulder gently laid,
And home rejoicing brought me.

In death's dark vale I fear no ill
With Thee, dear Lord, beside me;
Thy rod and staff my comfort still.
Thy Cross before to guide me.

And so through all the length of days
Thy goodness faileth never;
Good Shepherd, may I sing Thy praise
Within Thy house for ever!
verses_yoruba:
Jesu l‘Olus‘agutan mi,
Ore Eniti ki ye!
Ko s‘ewu bi mo je Tire,
T‘Oun si je t‘emi titi.

Nib‘ odo omi iye n san
Nibe l‘O nm‘ okan mi lo,
Nibiti oko tutu n hu,
L‘O n fonuje orun bo mi.

3Mo ti fi were sako lo,
N‘ife O si wa mi ri;
L‘ejika Re l‘O gbe mi si,
O fayo mumi wa ‘le.

N ko beru ojiji iku,
B‘iwo bawa lodo mi;
Ogo Re ati opa Re
Awon l‘o n tu mi ninu.

Bee l‘ojo aye mi gbogbo
Ore Re ki o ye lae
Olusagutan, un o yin O
Ninu ile Re titi.

title_english: O Lord, my God, do Thou Thy holy will:
passage_english: NOT MY WILL, BUT YOURS, BE DONE.” LUKE 22:42
passage_yoruba: IFE TI EMI KO BIKOSE TIRE, NI KI A SE. LUKU 22:42
verses_english:
O Lord, my God, do Thou Thy holy will:
I will lie still,
I will not stir, lest I forsake Thine arm,
And break the charm,
Which lulls me, clinging to my Father’s breast,
In perfect rest.

To the still wrestlings of the lonely heart
Doth Christ impart
The virtue of His midnight agony,
When none was nigh,
Save God and one good angel, to assuage
The tempest’s rage.

“O Father, not My will, but Thine, be done”,
So spake the Son.
Be this our charm, mellowing earth’s ruder noise
Of griefs and joys;
That we may cling for ever to Thy breast
In perfect rest.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa Olorun mi, se ’fe Re:
N ki o mi ’ra,
N ko ni dide, ki n ma ba sesi ta.
Owo naa nu,
Ti n mu mi ro mo aya Baba mi
Ni isinmi.

Okan ti n jijakadi, ni Kristi
Iwaya ija Re oru, ’gbati
Ko s’ enikan,
Ju Baba at’ Angeli rere kan
Ti n tuu ninu.

“Baba, ’fe mi ko, Tire ni k’a se”
Bee l’ Omo wi.
K’ eyi je ’siri wa laarin gbogbo
Laalaa aye,
K’a le ro mo aiya Re titi lae
Ni isinmi.

title_english: Long did I toil and knew no earthly rest,
title_yoruba: Laalaa mi po, n ko ni ’sinmi laye;
passage_english: “THE LORD IS MY PORTION,” SAYS MY SOUL,. LAMENTATIONS 3:24
passage_yoruba: OLUWA NI IPIN MI NI OKAN MI WI. EKUN JEREMIAH 3:24
verses_english:
Long did I toil and knew no earthly rest,
Far did I rove and found no certain home;
At last I sought them in his sheltering breast,
Who opens his arms and bids the weary come:
With him I found a home, a rest divine,
And I since them am his and he is mine.

The good I have is from his stores supplied,
The ill is only what he deems the best;
He for my Friend, I'm rich with nought beside,
And poor without him, though of all possessed:
Changes may come, I take or I resign,
Content, while I am his, while he is mine.

Whate'er may change, in him no change is seen,
A glorious Sun that wanes not nor declines,
Above the clouds and storms he walks serene,
And on his people's inward darkness shines:
All may depart, I fret not nor repine,
While I my Savior's am, while he is mine.

While here, alas! I know but half his love,
But half discern him and but half adore;
But when I meet him in the realms above
I hope to love him better, praise him more,
And feel and tell, amid the choir divine,
How fully I am his and he is mine.
verses_yoruba:
Laalaa mi po, n ko ni ’sinmi laye;
Mo rin jinna, n ko r’ ibugbe laye,
Nikehin mo wa won laya Eni
T’O n’owo Re, t’O si n pe alaare:
Lodo Re, mo r’ ile at’ isinmi:
Mo si di Tire, Oun si di temi.

title_english: Safe in the arms of Jesus,
passage_english: AND UNDERNEATH ARE THE EVERLASTING ARMS DEUT. 33:27
passage_yoruba: ATI NISALE LI APA AIYERAYE WA. DEUT 33:27
verses_english:
Safe in the arms of Jesus,
Safe on His gentle breast,
There by His love o’ershaded,
Sweetly my soul shall rest.
Hark! ’tis the voice of angels,
Borne in a song to me,
Over the fields of glory,
Over the jasper sea.

Safe in the arms of Jesus,
Safe from corroding care,
Safe from the world’s temptations,
Sin cannot harm me there.
Free from the blight of sorrow,
Free from my doubts and fears;
Only a few more trials,
Only a few more tears!

Jesus, my heart’s dear Refuge,
Jesus has died for me;
Firm on the Rock of Ages,
Ever my trust shall be.
Here let me wait with patience,
Wait till the night is over;
Wait till I see the morning break
On the golden shore.
verses_yoruba:
Laifoya l’apa Jesu,
Laifoya laya Re
Labe ojij 'ife Re
L’okan mi yo sinmi.
Gbo! ohun Angeli ni,
Orin won d’eti mi,
Lati papa ogo wa,
Lati okun Jaspi.

Laifoya lapa Jesu
Mo bo l’ow'aniyan,
Mo bo l’owo idanwo,
Ese ko n’ipa mo,
Mo bo l’owo 'banuje,
Mo bo lowo eru
O ku idanwo die!
O k‘omije die!

Jesu aabo okan mi,
Jesu ti ku fun mi,
Apata ayeraye
L’emi o gbekele,
Nihin l’emi o duro
Tit'oru yoo koja,
Titi un o fi r’imole
Ni ebute ogo.
chorus_english:
Safe in the arms of Jesus,
Safe on His gentle breast
There by His love o’ershaded,
Sweetly my soul shall rest.
chorus_yoruba:
Laifoya l’apa Jesu
Laifoya laya Re
Labe ojij 'ife Re
L’okan mi yo sinmi.

title_english: My spirit on Thy care,
passage_english: IN YOU, O LORD, I PUT MY TRUST; LET ME NEVER BE ASHAMED; DELIVER ME IN YOUR RIGHTEOUSNESS. PSALMS 31:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA, IWO NI MO GBEKE MI LE; MASE JE KI OJU KI O TI MI, GBA MI NINU ODOD RE. ORIN DAFIDI 31:1
verses_english:
My spirit on Thy care,
Blest Saviour, I recline;
Thou wilt not leave me to despair,
For Thou art Love divine.

In Thee I place my trust,
On Thee I calmly rest;
I know Thee good, I know Thee just,
And count Thy choice the best.

Whate’er events betide,
Thy will they all perform;
Safe in Thy breast my head I hide,
Nor fear the coming storm.

Let good or ill befall,
It must be good for me;
Secure of having Thee in all,
Of having all in Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Mo f’ emi mi sabe
Itoju Re Jesu;
‘Wo ko jo mi l’ ainireti,
‘Wo l’ Olorun Ife.

‘Wo ni mo gbekele
‘Wo ni mo f’ara ti:
Rere at’ Otito ni O,
Eyii t’ O se l’ o to.

Ohun t’o wu k’o de,
Ife re ni won n se:
Mo f’ ori pamo saya Re,
N ko foya iji yii.

B’ ibi tab’ ire de,
Yoo dara fun mi sa!
Ki n sa ni O l’ ohun gbogbo,
Ohun gbogbo n’nu Re.

title_english: In some way or other the Lord will provide.
passage_english: THE YOUNG LIONS LACK AND SUFFER HUNGER; BUT THOSE WHO SEEK THE LORD SHALL NOT LACK ANY GOOD THING. PSALMS 34:10
passage_yoruba: AWON OMO KINIUN A MAA SE ALAINI, EBI A SI MAA PA WON ……… AWON TI N WA OLUWA KI YIO SE ALAINI. ORIN DAFIDI. 34:10
verses_english:
Despond then no longer; the Lord will provide:
And this be the token—no word He hath spoken
Was ever yet broken: “the Lord will provide.”
verses_yoruba:
Li onakona, “Oluwa yoo pese.”
O le s’ais’ ona mi, o le s’ai se tire,
Sugbon lona ’ra Re, li Oun o pese!

Lakoko to ye, “Oluwa yoo pese,”
O le s’ aise temi, o le s’ aise tire,
Lakoko t’ ara Re, li Oun o pese!

Ma beru, tori “Oluwa yoo pese,”
Eyii n’ ileri Re, ko s’ oro ti O so,
Ti si yipada, “Oluwa o pese.”

Yan lo l’ aibikita, okun yoo pinya,
O f’ orin isegun se ona re logo,
Ao jumo gberin, “Oluwa y’o pese.”
chorus_english:
Then we’ll trust in the Lord, and He will provide;
Yes, we’ll trust in the Lord, and He will provide.
chorus_yoruba:
Ao gbeke l’Oluwa On yoo sip ese
Loto, ao gbekel’ E On yoo sip ese.

title_english: Peace, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?
passage_english: THOU WILT KEEP HIM IN PERFECT PEACE, WHOSE MIND IS STAYED ON THEE. ISA. 26.3
passage_yoruba: “OKAN ENITI O SINMI LE O, IWO O PA MO LI ALAAFIA”. ISAIAH 26:3.
verses_english:
Peace, perfect peace, in this dark world of sin?
The blood of Jesus whispers peace within.

Peace, perfect peace, by thronging duties pressed?
To do the will of Jesus, this is rest.

Peace, perfect peace, with sorrows surging round?
On Jesus’ bosom naught but calm is found.

Peace, perfect peace, with loved ones far away?
In Jesus’ keeping we are safe, and they.

Peace, perfect peace, our future all unknown?
Jesus we know, and He is on the throne.

Peace, perfect peace, death shadowing us and ours?
Jesus has vanquished death and all its powers.

It is enough: earth’s struggles soon shall cease,
And Jesus call us to Heaven’s perfect peace.
verses_yoruba:
Alaafia li aye ese yii?
Eje Jesu nwipe, “Alaafia”.

Alaafia ninu opo laalaa?
Lati se ife Jesu, ni ‘sinmi

Alaafia n’nu igbi ‘banuje’?
L’ aye Jesu ni dake-roro wa.

Alaafia, gb’ ara wa wa l’ ajo?
Ni ‘pamo Jesu, iberu ko si.

Alaafia, b’a ko tile m’ola?
Sugbon a mo pe Jesu wa titi laelae.

Alaafia, nigb’akoko iku?
Olugbala wa ti segun iku.

O to! Jakadi aye fere pin,
