Jesu yoo pewa s’ orun Alaafia.

title_english: Toss'd with rough winds, and faint with fear,
passage_english: BE OF GOOD CHEER! IT IS I; DO NOT BE AFRAID.” MATTHEW 14:27
passage_yoruba: E TUJUKA; EMI NI; E MASE BERU. MATTEU 14:27
verses_english:
Toss'd with rough winds, and faint with fear,
Above the tempest, soft and clear,
What still small accents greet mine ear?
'Tis I; be not afraid.

These raging winds, this surging sea,
Have spent their deadly force on Me:
They bear no breath of wrath to thee:
'Tis I; be not afraid.

Mine eyes are watching by thy bed,
Mine arms are underneath thy head,
My blessing is around thee shed:
'Tis I, be not afraid.

When on the other side thy feet
Shall rest mid thousand welcomes sweet,
One well-known Voice thy heart shall greet,
'Tis I; be not afraid.
verses_yoruba:
N’ irumi at’ iji aiye,
Mo gbo ohun itunu kan,
O n so si mi l’eti wipe,
Emi ni; mase beru.

Emi l’o we okan re mo,
Emi l’o mu ki o riran,
Emi n’ iye, imole re,
Emi ni; mase beru.

Awon igbi omi wonyii
Ti f’ agbara won lu mi ri,
Won ko le se o n’ibi mo:
Emi ni; mase beru.

Mo ti mu ago yi lekan,
’Wo ko le mo kikoro re,
Emi ti mo bi o ti ri,
Emi ni; mase beru.

Mo pe, l’or’ eni arun re,
Oju Mi ko ye l’ara re,
Ibukun mi wa l’ori re,
“Emi ni : mase beru.”

Gbat’ emi re ba pin l’aye,
T’ awon t’orun wa ’pade re,
’Wo o gbohun kan t’o mo, pe
“Emi ni: mase beru.”

title_english: My faith looks up to Thee,
passage_english: OUR EYES WAIT UPON THE LORD OUR GOD, PS. 123:2
passage_yoruba: OJU WA N WO OLUWA OLORUN WA. PS. 123:2
verses_english:
My faith looks up to Thee,
Thou Lamb of Calvary,
Savior divine!
Now hear me while I pray,
Take all my guilt away,
O let me from this day
Be wholly Thine!

May Thy rich grace impart
Strength to my fainting heart,
My zeal inspire!
As Thou hast died for me,
O may my love to Thee,
Pure warm, and changeless be,
A living fire!

While life’s dark maze I tread,
And griefs around me spread,
Be Thou my guide;
Bid darkness turn to day,
Wipe sorrow’s tears away,
Nor let me ever stray from
Thee aside.

When ends life’s transient dream,
When death’s cold sullen stream
Over me roll;
Blest Savior, then in love,
Fear and distrust remove;
O bear me safe above,
A ransomed soul!
verses_yoruba:
Igbagbo mi wo O,
Iwo Odagutan,
Olugbala,
Joo, gbo adura mi
M’ese mi gbogbo lo
K’emi lat’oni lo
Si je tire.

Ki oore ofe re,
F’ilera f’okan mi,
Mu mi tara;
B’iwo ti ku fun mi,
A! k’ife mi si O,
K’o maa gbona titi,
B’ina iye.

‘Gba mo n rin l’okunkun,
Ninu ibanuje,
S’amona mi,
M’okunkun lo loni,
Pa ‘banuje mi re,
k’n ma sako kuro
Li odo Re.

Gbati aye ba pin,
T’odo tutu iku,
N san lori mi:
Jesu, ninu ife,
Mu k’ifoya mi lo,
Gbe mi d’oke orun
B’okan t’a ra.

title_english: Christ Jesus, Saviour, I behold
passage_english: WHY ARE YOU CAST DOWN, O MY SOUL? PSALMS 34:5
passage_yoruba: EESE TI ORI RE FI TEBA, OKAN MI. ORIN DAFIDI 34:5
verses_english:
Christ Jesus, Saviour, I behold
Weary am I and groaning too
Here I come, Thee to rest upon
Thou art my rest.

Gaze upon me exhausted am I
The journey farther, beyond me
Thine helping strength by grace I seek
Thou art my strength.

Along my path am sore distressed
Darkness and storm engulfed the dusk
Beam to my path Thine shinning light
Thou art my light.

When satan’s arrows hence is shot
Nay scary, Thou I look upon
Thine sacred cross my protection
Thou art my peace.

Lonely am I at Jordan’s shore
Striving, tensely fighting as of old
Would Thou permit me all to see
Thou art my life.

For all my needs, Thou shall provide
In every wise unto the end
In life, in death and evermore.
Thou art my all.
verses_yoruba:
Idaamu ba mi l’ona mi,
Oru sookun, iji si n fe,
Tan imole si ona mi,
’Wo ’Mole mi.

Gba Satani ba tafa re,
’Wo ni mo n wo: nko beru mo;
Agbelebu Re l’aabo mi,
’Wo Alaafia mi.

Mo nikan wa leti Jordan,
Ninu ’waya- ’ja jelo ni:
’Wo ki yio je k’emi rii;
’Wo Iye mi.

Gbogbo aini, Iwo o fun mi
Titi d’opin; l’onakona;
Ni ’ye, ni ’ku, titi laelae,
’Wo Gbogbo mi.

title_english: Give to the winds thy fears;
passage_english: DO NOT FEAR, FOR I AM WITH YOU. GENESIS 26:24
passage_yoruba: MA BERU, EMI WA PELU RE. GENESIS 26:24
verses_english:
Through waves and clouds and storms
God gently clears the way.
Wait patiently; so shall this night
Soon end in joyous day.

Leave to God’s sovereign sway
To choose and to command.
So shalt thou, wondering, own God’s way,
How wise, how strong God’s hand!

Let us in life, in death,
Thy steadfast truth declare,
And publish with our final breath
Thy love and guardian care.
verses_yoruba:
F’eru re f’ afefe,
N’ ireti ma foya;
Olorun gbo ‘mikanle re,
Yio gb’ ori re ga.

N’ irumi at’ iji,
Y’o s’ ona re fefe:
Duro de igba Re; oru
Y’o pin s’ ojo ayo.

Iwo r’ ailera wa
Inu wa n’ iwo mo;
Gbe owo t’ o re si oke,
M’ ekun ailera le.

K’ awa , n’ iye n’ iku,
So oro Re tantan
K’ a so tit’ opin emi wa
Ife, itoju Re.

title_english: There is a fountain filled with blood
title_yoruba: Isun kan wa to kun f‘eje
passage_english: A FOUNTAIN OPENED FOR SIN AND FOR UNCLEANNESS. ZECHARIAH 13:1
passage_yoruba: ISUN KAN YIO SI SILE FUN ESE ATI FUN IWA AIMO. SEKARIAH 13:1
verses_english:
There is a fountain filled with blood
Drawn from Immanuel's veins;
And sinners, plunged beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains:
Lose all their guilty stains,
Lose all their guilty stains;
And sinners, plunged beneath that flood,
Lose all their guilty stains.

The dying thief rejoiced to see
That fountain in his day;
And there may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away:
Wash all my sins away,
Wash all my sins away;
And there may I, though vile as he,
Wash all my sins away.

Dear dying Lamb, Thy precious blood
Shall never lose its pow'r,
Till all the ransomed Church of God
Be saved, to sin no more:
Be saved, to sin no more,
Be saved, to sin no more;
Till all the ransomed Church of God
Be saved to sin no more.

E'er since by faith I saw the stream
Thy flowing wounds supply,
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die:
And shall be till I die,
And shall be till I die;
Redeeming love has been my theme,
And shall be till I die.

When this poor lisping, stamm'ring tongue
Lies silent in the grave,
Then in a nobler, sweeter song
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save:
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save,
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save;
then in a nobler, sweeter song
I'll sing Thy pow'r to save.
verses_yoruba:
Isun kan wa to kun f‘eje
To ti ha Jesu yo,
Elese mookun ninu re,
O bo ninu ebi.
O bo ninu ebi.
O bo ninu ebi.
Elese mookun ninu re,
O bo ninu ebi.

‘Gba mo f’igbagbo r‘isun naa,
Ti n san fun eje Re,
Irapada d‘orin fun mi
Ti un o maa ko titi.
Ti un o maa ko titi.
Ti un o maa ko titi.
Irapada d‘orin fun mi
Ti un o maa ko titi.

Orin t‘o dun ju eyii lo
Li emi o maa ko;
‘Gbat ‘akololo ahon yii
Ba dake ni ‘boji
Ba dake ni ‘boji
Ba dake ni ‘boji
‘Gbat ‘akololo ahon yii
Ba dake ni ‘boji

Mo gbagbo p‘O pese fun mi
Bi mo tile s‘aiye,
Ebun ofe t‘a f’eje ra
Ati duuru wura.
Ati duuru wura.
Ati duuru wura.
Ebun ofe t‘a f’eje ra
Ati duuru wura.

Duuru t‘a tow‘ Olorun se,
Ti ko ni baje lae,
Ti a o maa fi yin Baba wa
Oruko Re nikan.
Oruko Re nikan.
Oruko Re nikan.
Ti ao ma fi yin Baba wa
Oruko Re nikan.

title_english: Glorious things of thee are spoken,
title_yoruba: Ohun ogo Re l’ a nrohin,
passage_english: GLORIOUS THINGS ARE SPOKEN OF YOU, O CITY OF GOD! PSALMS 87:3
passage_yoruba: OHUN OGO RE L’A N ROYIN, ILU OLORUN. ORIN DAFIDI 87:3
verses_english:
Glorious things of thee are spoken,
Zion, city of our God;
He whose word cannot be broken
Formed thee for his own abode;
On the Rock of Ages founded,
What can shake thy sure repose?
With salvation's walls surrounded,
Thou may'st smile at all thy foes.

See! the streams of living waters,
Spring form eternal love,
Well supply thy sons and daughters
And all fear of want remove.
Who can faint, when such a river
Ever flows their thirst to assuage?
Grace which, like the Lord, the Giver,
Never fails from age to age.

Blest inhabitants of Zion,
Washed in the Redeemer's blood!
Jesus, whom their souls rely on,
Makes them kings and priests to God.
'Tis his love his people raises
Over self to reign as kings:
And as priests, his solemn praises
Each for a thank-offering brings.
verses_yoruba:
Ohun ogo Re l’ a nrohin,
Sion, ti Olorun wa:
Oro enit’ a ko le ye,
Se o ye fun bugbe Re.
L’ori apat’ aiyeraiye,
Kini le mi ’simi re?
A f’ odi ’gbala yi o ka,
K’ o le ma rin ota re.

Wo! ipado omi iye,
Nt’ ife Olorun sun wa,
O to fun gbogbo omo Re,
Eru aini ko si mo;
Tal’ o le re, ’gba odo na
Ban san t’ o le pongbe re?
Or’- ofe Olodumare
Ki ye lat’ irandiran.

Ara Sion alabukun,
T’ a f’ eje Oluwa we;
Jesu ti nwon ti ngbekele,
So won d’ oba, woli Re.
Sisa l’ ohun afe aiye,
Pelu ogo asan re,
Isura toto at’ ayo,
Kik’ omo Sion l’ o mo.

title_english: In all ways chosen by the Lord,
title_yoruba: L’ ona gbogbo t’ Oluwa yan,
passage_english: “DO NOT HINDER ME”. GENESIS 24:56
passage_yoruba: MA DA MI RO. GENESIS 24:56
verses_english:
In all ways chosen by the Lord,
My journey will I go;
Prevent me not the holy men,
I will follow thee there.

If Jesus moves in the furnace,
I will follow Him there;
Prevent me not will be my word,
If the world oppose me.

In adoration, temptation,
With Thy Command I’ll go:
Prevent me not, for I will go,
Unto Emmanuel.

And when my Saviour shall call me,
And still my cry shall be,
Prevent me not, death is coming,
I will follow with joy.
verses_yoruba:
L’ ona gbogbo t’ Oluwa yan,
A jo mi l’em’ o to;
Ma da mi ro, eyin mimo,
Emi o ba nyin lo.

Bi Jesu n lo ninu ina,
Emi o to lehin:
Ma da mi ro, l’ emi o ke,
B’ aye d’ ojuko mi.

Ninu isin at’ idanwo,
Emi’ o lo l’ ase Re:
Ma da mi ro, emi o lo,
S’ ile Emmanuel.

‘Gba Olugbala mi ba pe,
Sibe, k’ igbe mi je,
Ma da mi ro, iku maa bo,
Un o ba o lo l’ ayo.

title_english: Jesus Saviour is my Shepherd
passage_english: THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD. PSALM 23:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA LI OLUSO-AGUTAN MI. ORIN DAFIDI 23:1
verses_english:
Jesus Saviour is my Shepherd
Then, fear and distrust remove
From the lion and the wild bear
And from wild and evil beasts
Jesus will guard His lonely sheep
Jesus will care for His own.

Satan nearly over powered me
Jesus said, ''this is my sheep''
He died in order to save me
Jesus, what great love is this?
With Jesus, victory is sure
There's nought Him can overcome.

He leads me in the way of Life,
Near the gently flowing stream;
He makes me rest in green pastures
Where poisonous weeds do not grow,
There I hear the voice of Jesus
There He makes my heart rejoice.

When I walk the valley of death
And there's fear along my way
I shall not fear any evil
For my Shepherd is so near,
His rod and staff they comfort me
For they make His sheep rejoice.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu l‘Olusagutan mi,
N je k‘iberu lo jinna:
Lowo kiniun at‘ ekun,
Lowo eranko ibi,
Yio so agutan Tire,
Jesu yoo pa Tire mo.

Nigb‘ ota fe lati mu mi,
Oun ni: Agutan mi ni,
O si ku, lati gba wa la;
Jesu ife kil‘ eyii?
Isegun ni ona Tire,
Ko s‘ohun t‘o le se e.

Lona iye l‘o n dari mi,
Lat‘ isan t‘o n san pele;
Ninu oko tutu yoyo,
Nib‘ ewe oro ki hu,
Nibe ni mo gbohun Jesu,
Nibe l‘o m‘ okan mi yo.

Gba mo ba n lo s‘isa oku,
B‘eru tile wa l’ona,
Emi ki o berukeru,
Tor‘ Olusagutan wa;
‘Gba mo r‘ogo at‘opa Re
Mo mo p‘agutan Re yo.

title_english: When I can read my title clear
title_yoruba: ’Gba mo le ka oye mi re,
passage_english: IN MY FATHER’S HOUSE ARE MANY MANSIONS. JOHN 14
passage_yoruba: NINU ILE BABA MI, OPOLOPO IBUGBE LI O WA. JOHANU 14
verses_english:
When I can read my title clear
To mansions in the skies,
I bid farewell to every fear,
And wipe my weeping eyes.

Should earth against my soul engage,
And hellish darts be hurled,
Then I can smile at Satan’s rage,
And face a frowning world.

Let cares, like a wild deluge come,
And storms of sorrow fall!
May I but safely reach my home,
My God, my heaven, my all.

There shall I bathe my weary soul
In seas of heavenly rest,
And not a wave of trouble roll,
Across my peaceful breast.
verses_yoruba:
’Gba mo le ka oye mi re,
Ni ibugbe l’ oke;
Mo dagbere f’ eru gbogbo,
Mo n’ omije mi nu.

B’ aye kojuja s’ okan mi,
T’ a n so oko si i;
’Gbanaa mo le rin Satani,
Ki n si jeju k’ aye.

K’ aniyan de b’ ikun omi,
K’ iji banuje ja;
Ki n sa d’ ele Alaafia,
Olorun, gbogbo mi.

Nibe l’ okan mi yoo luwe,
N’nu okun isinmi;
Ko si wahala t’ o le de,
S’ ibale aiya mi.

title_english: Through the love of God, our Savior,
passage_english: IS IT WELL WITH THEE? IT IS WELL. 2 KINGS 4
passage_yoruba: ALAAFIA KI O WA BI? ALAFIA NI. II AWON OBA 4.
verses_english:
Through the love of God, our Savior,
all will be well;
free and changeless is his favor,
all will be well;
precious is the blood that healed us,
perfect is the grace that sealed us,
strong the hand stretched out to shield us,
all will be well.

Though we pass through tribulation,
all will be well;
ours is such a full salvation,
all will be well.
happy when in god confiding,
fruitful if in Christ abiding,
holy through the Spirit's guiding,
all will be well.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ola yio dara,
Ki yoo si nkan.
‘Gbagbo le korin n’ iponju
Ki yoo si nkan.
A gbekele ‘fe Baba wa;
Jesu n fun wa l’ ohun gbogbo;
Ni yiye tabi ni kiku,
Ko le si nkan.

title_english: I heard the voice of Jesus say,
passage_english: INCLINE YOUR EAR, AND COME UNTO ME. ISAIAH 55
passage_yoruba: E TETILELE, KI E SI WA SODO MI. ISAIAH 55
verses_english:
I heard the voice of Jesus say,
Come unto Me and rest;
Lay down, thou weary one, lay down
Thy head upon My breast.
I came to Jesus as I was,
Weary and worn and sad;
I found in Him a resting place,
And He has made me glad.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,
Behold, I freely give
The living water; thirsty one,
Stoop down, and drink, and live.
I came to Jesus, and I drank
Of that life giving stream;
My thirst was quenched, my soul revived,
And now I live in Him.

I heard the voice of Jesus say,
I am this dark world’s Light;
Look unto Me, thy morn shall rise,
And all thy day be bright.
I looked to Jesus, and I found
In Him my star, my sun;
And in that light of life I’ll walk,
Till traveling days are done.
verses_yoruba:
Mo gbohun Jesu t‘o wipe,
Wa sinmi lodo Mi;
Gbe ori re, wo alaare
Le ookan-aya Mi!
Nin’ aare oun ibinuje,
Ni mo to Jesu wa;
O je ib’ isinmi fun mi,
O si mu ‘nu mi dun.

Mo gbohun Jesu to wipe,
Iwo ti oungbe n gbe,
Un o f’omi ‘ye fun o lofe,
Bere, mu, k’o si ye!
Mo to Jesu wa, mo si mu
Ninu omi ‘ye naa;
Okan mi tutu, o soji,
Mo d‘alaaye n‘nu Re

Mo gbohun Jesu t’o wipe,
Mole aye l‘Emi;
Wo mi, Emi ni orun re,
Ojo re yoo dara,
Mo wo Jesu, emi si rii
‘B’oorun ododo mi;
Ninu‘ mole yi l‘em ‘o rin
Tit‘ajo mi yo pin.

title_english: Change is our portion here;
passage_english: FOR I AM THE LORD, I CHANGE NOT…….. MALACHI 3
passage_yoruba: EMI LI OLUWA, EMI KO YIPADA……. MALAKI 3.
verses_english:
Change is our portion here;
soon fades the summer sky,
the landscape droops in autumn sear,
and spring flowers bloom to die:
but faithful is Jehovah's word,
“I will be with thee,” saith the Lord.

Change is our portion here,
along the heavenly road:
in faith and hope and holy fear,
in love towards our God:
how often we distrust the word,
“I will be with thee,” saith the Lord.

Change is our portion here:
yet midst our changing lot,
midst withering flowers and tempests drear,
there is that changes not.
unchangeable Jehovah's word,
“I will be with thee,” saith the Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Nihin l‘ayida wa,
L‘ona ajo orun;
N‘nu gbagbo ‘reti at‘eru,
N‘nu ‘fe s‘Olorun wa:
A n saika oro yi si ‘po!
Un o wa pelu re”, ni Oun wi.

title_english: Thine forever! God of love,
passage_english: MY SHEEP SHALL NEVER PERISH. JOHN 10
passage_yoruba: AWON AGUTAN MI KI YIO SEGBE. JOH. 10
verses_english:
Thine forever! God of love,
hear us from thy throne above;
thine forever may we be
here and in eternity.

Thine forever! O how blest
they who find in thee their rest!
Savior, Guardian, heavenly Friend,
O defend us to the end.

Thine forever! Lord of life,
shield us through our earthly strife;
thou, the Life, the Truth, the Way,
guide us to the realms of day.

Thine forever! Savior, keep
these thy frail and trembling sheep,
safe alone beneath thy care,
let us all thy goodness share.

Thine forever! Thou our Guide,
all our wants by thee supplied,
all our sins by thee forgiven,
lead us, Lord, from earth to heaven.
verses_yoruba:
Tire laelae l’awa se,
Baba, Olorun ife;
Je k’aje tire titi,
L’aye yi, ati laelae.

Tire laelae, l’awa se,
Maa toju wa l’ aiye yii
‘Wo iye, ona ooto,
To wa si ilu orun.

Tire laelae - Abukun,
L’awon t’ o se sinmi won!
Olugbala, ore wa,
Gba ‘ja wa ja de opin.

Tire laelae, Jesu pa,
Awon agutan Re mo,
L’abe iso rere Ae,
Ni k’ o pa gbogbo wa mo.

Tire laelae, aini wa
Ni o je aniyan Re
O ti f’ese wa ji wa
To wa si ibugbe Re.

title_english: We saw Thee not when Thou didst come
passage_english: BLESSED ARE THEY THAT HAVE NOT SEEN, AND YET HAVE BELIEVED. JOHN 20
passage_yoruba: ALABUKUN LI AWON TI KO RI MI, SUGBON TI WON SI GBAGBO. JOHANU 20
verses_english:
We saw Thee not when Thou didst come
To this poor world of sin and death;
Nor yet beheld Thy cottage home,
In that despisèd Nazareth.
But we believe Thy footsteps trod
Its streets and plains, Thou Son of God.

We did not see Thee lifted high,
Amid that wild and savage crew;
Nor heard Thy meek, imploring cry,
Forgive, they know not what they do!
Yet we believe the deed was done,
That shook the earth and veiled the sun.

We stood not by the empty tomb,
Where late Thy sacred body lay;
Nor sat within that upper room,
Nor met Thee on the open way.
But we believe that angels said,
Why seek the living with the dead?
verses_yoruba:
A ko ri O lori igi
T‘eeyan buburu kan O mo
A ko gbo igbe Re, wipe
Dariji won, tor‘ aimo won
Sibe, a gbagbo pe: 'ku Re
Mi aye, o si m'oorun su.

A ko duro leti 'boji
Nibiti a gbe te O si;
A ko joko ‘nu yara ni,
A ko ri O loju ona
Sugbon a gbagbo p‘angeli
Wipe, “lwo ti ji dide”.

A ko r‘awon wonni t‘O yan
Lati ri ‘goke - rorun Re;
Won ko fi iyanu woke
Won si f’eru dojubole
Sugbon a gbagbo pe won ri O
Bi O ti n goke lo s‘orun.

Iwo n joba l‘oke loni,
‘Wo si n bukun awon Tire
Imole ogo Re ko tan
Si aginju aye wa yii,
Sugbon, a gba oro Re gbo
Jesu, Olurapada wa.

title_english: God moves in a mysterious way
passage_english: THY FOOTSTEPS ARE NOT KNOWN. PSALM 77
passage_yoruba: “IPASE RE NI A KO SI MO”. ORIN DAFIDI 77
verses_english:
God moves in a mysterious way
His wonders to perform;
He plants His footsteps in the sea
And rides upon the storm.

Deep in unfathomable mines
Of never failing skill
He treasures up His bright designs
And works His sovereign will.

Ye fearful saints, fresh courage take;
The clouds ye so much dread
Are big with mercy and shall break
In blessings on your head.

Judge not the Lord by feeble sense,
But trust Him for His grace;
Behind a frowning providence
He hides a smiling face.

His purposes will ripen fast,
Unfolding every hour;
The bud may have a bitter taste,
But sweet will be the flower.

Blind unbelief is sure to err
And scan His work in vain;
God is His own interpreter,
And He will make it plain.
verses_yoruba:
Ona ara l'Olorun wa,
N gba sise Re l’aye,
A n ri ‘pase Re l’or'okun,
O n gun igbi l’esin.

Ona Re, enikan ko mo,
Awamaridi ni;
O pa ise ijinle mo,
O si se bi Oba.

Ma beru mo, eyin mimo,
Orun t’o su bee ni
O kun fun aanu, yoo rojo
Ibukun s’ ori n yin.

Mase da Oluwa l’ ejo
Sugbon gbeke re lee;
‘Gbati o ro pe O binu,
Inu Re dun si o.

Ise Re fere ye wa na
Yoo ma han siwaju
Bi o tile koro l’oni,
O n bo wa dun l’ola.

Afoju ni alaigbagbo,
Ko mo ‘se Olorun,
Olorun ni Olutumo,
Yoo m’ ona Re ye ni.

title_english: My hope is built on nothing less
passage_english: FOR IT WAS FOUNDED UPON A ROCK. MATT. 7
passage_yoruba: E FI IPILE RE SOLE LORI APATA. MATT. 7
verses_english:
When He shall come with trumpet sound,
Oh, may I then in Him be found,
Clothed in His righteousness alone,
Faultless to stand before the throne!
On Christ, the solid Rock, I stand;
All other ground is sinking sand.
verses_yoruba:
Igbagbo mi duro l’ori
Eje at’ododo Jesu
N ko je gbekele ohun kan
Leyin oruko nla Jesu
Mo duro le, Krist' Apata
Ile miran, iyanrin ni

B'ire-ije mi tile gun
Oor’ ofe Re ko yi pada
B’o ti wu k'iji na le to
Idakoro mi ko niye
Mo duro le Krist' Apata
Ile miran iyanrin ni

Majemu ati eje Re
L'emi o ro mo b'ikunmi de
Gbati ko s’atileyin mo
O je ireti nla fun mi
Mo duro le Krist' Apata
Ile miran iyanrin ni

Gbat'ipe kehin ba si dun
A! n mba le wa ninu Jesu
Ki n wo ododo Re nikan
Ki n duro niwaju ite
Mo duro le Krist' Apata
Ile miran iyanrin ni

title_english: O, for a faith that will not shrink,
title_yoruba: A ba le n‘ igbagbo aaye,
passage_english: AND THE APOSTLES SAID UNTO THE LORD, INCREASE OUR FAITH. LUKE 17
passage_yoruba: AWON APOSTELI SI WI FUN OLUWA PE, BUSI IGBAGBO WA. LUKE 17
verses_english:
O, for a faith that will not shrink,
Though pressed by every foe,
That will not tremble on the brink
Of poverty or woe!

That will not murmur nor complain
Beneath the chastening rod;
But in the hour of grief or pain,
Will lean upon its God.

A faith that keeps the narrow way
Till life’s last spark is fled,
And with a pure and heavenly ray
Lights up a dying bed.

Lord, give me such a faith as this,
And then, whate’er may come,
I’ll taste, e’en here, the hallowed bliss
Of an eternal home.
verses_yoruba:
A ba le n‘ igbagbo aaye,
B‘o ti wu k‘ota po,
Igbagbo ti ko je mira
Fun aini at‘ osi.

Igbagbo ti ko je rahun
L‘abe ibawi Re,
Sugbon ti n sinmi l‘Olorun
Nigba ibanuje.

Igbagbo ti n tan siwaju
‘Gbat‘ iji ‘ponju de;
Ti ko si je siyemeji
N‘nu wahala gbogbo.

Igbagbo ti n gb‘ona tooro,
Titi emi o pin,
Ti yoo si f‘imole orun
Tan akete iku.

Jesu f‘igbagbo yi fun mi,
N je b‘o ti wu k‘o ri,
Lat‘ aye yii lo, un o l‘ayo
Ilu orun rere.

title_english: Thee will I love, my Strength, my Tower,
title_yoruba: Un o feran Re, ‘Wo odi mi,
passage_english: I WILL LOVE THEE, O LORD, MY STRENGTH. PSLAM 18
passage_yoruba: UN O FE O, OLUWA AGBARA MI. ORIN DAFIDI 18
verses_english:
Thee will I love, my Strength, my Tower,
Thee will I love, my Joy, my Crown,
Thee will I love with all my power,
Thee will I love in all thy works,
Thee will I love, till the pure fire
Fill my whole soul with pure desire.
verses_yoruba:
Un o feran Re, ‘Wo odi mi,
Un o feran Re, ‘Wo ayo mi
Un o feran Re, patapata,
Un o feran Re, tor’ise Re,
Un o feran Re, tit‘ okan mi,
Y‘o fi kun fun ife rere.

N’nu ire – ije mi laye,
Maa se alabojuto mi;
Fi agbara fun ese mi
Ki n le t’ese m’ona rere,
Ki n ba le f’ipa mi gbogbo
F’Oruko Re t’o l’ogo han.

Un o feran Re, ‘WO ade mi
Un o feran Re, Oluwa mi;
Un o feran Re nigba gbogbo,
L‘ojo ibi, l‘ojo ire,
‘Gbati ojo iku ba de,
Un o feran Re titi laelae.

title_english: Jesus, the very thought of thee
passage_english: THAT CHRIST MAY DWELL IN YOUR HEARTS BY FAITH. EPHESIANS 3
passage_yoruba: KI KRISTI LE MAA GBE OKAN YIN NIPA IGBAGBO. EFESU 3
verses_english:
Jesus, the very thought of thee
with sweetness fills the breast;
but sweeter far thy face to see,
and in thy presence rest.

No voice can sing, no heart can frame,
nor can the memory find,
a sweeter sound than Jesus' Name,
the Savior of mankind.

O hope of every contrite heart,
O joy of all the meek,
to those who fall, how kind thou art:
how good to those who seek!

But what to those who find? Ah, this
nor tongue nor pen can show;
the love of Jesus, what it is,
none but who love him know.

Jesus, our only joy be thou,
as thou our prize wilt be;
in thee be all our glory now,
and through eternity.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, kiki ironu Re
Fi ayo kun okan;
Sugbon k‘a ri O l‘o dun ju,
K‘a sinmi lodo Re.

Enu ko so, eti ko gbo,
Ko ti okan wa ri:
Ooko t‘o s‘owon, t‘o dun bi
Ti Jesu Oluwa.

Ireti okan ti n kaanu,
Oloore elese;
O seun f‘awon ti n wa O
Awon t‘o ri O yo.

Ayo won, enu ko le so
Eda ko le rohin;
Ife Jesu b‘o ti po to
Awon Tire l‘o mo on.

Jesu, ‘Wo maa je ayo wa
‘Wo sa ni ere wa
Maa je ogo wa nisiyii
Ati titi laelae.

title_english: How sweet the Name of Jesus sounds
title_yoruba: B’ oruko Jesu ti dun to
passage_english: YOUR NAME IS OINTMENT POURED FORTH. SONG OF SOLOMON 1
passage_yoruba: ORUKO RE DABI IKUNRA TI A TU JADE. ORIN SOLOMONI 1
verses_english:
How sweet the Name of Jesus sounds
In a believer's ear!
It soothes his sorrows, heals his wounds,
And drives away his fear.

It makes the wounded spirit whole,
And calms the troubled breast;
'Tis manna to the hungry soul,
And to the weary, rest.

Dear Name, the rock on which I build,
My shield and hiding-place,
My never-failing treasury, filled
With boundless stores of grace!

Jesus, my Shepherd, Husband, Friend,
My Prophet, Priest and King,
My Lord, my life, my way, my end,
Accept the praise I bring.

Weak is the effort of my heart,
And cold my warmest thought;
But, when I see Thee as Thou art,
I'll praise Thee as I ought.

Till then I would Thy love proclaim
With every fleeting breath;
And may the music of Thy Name
Refresh my soul in death.
verses_yoruba:
B’ oruko Jesu ti dun to
Leti olugbagbo!
O tan banuje oun ogbe,
O le eru re lo.

O wo okan t’o gbogbe san,
O mu aya bale;
Manna ni fun okan ebi,
Isinmi f’ alaare.

Apata ti mo kole le,
Ibi isadi mi:
Ile isura mi t’o kun,
F’opo oore- ofe.

Jesu, Oko mi, Ore mi,
Woli mi, Oba mi:
Alufa mi, Ona, Iye,
Gba orin iyin mi.

Ailera l’agbara ‘nu mi,
Tutu si l’ero mi:
‘gba mo ba ri O b’ O ti ri,
Un o yin O b’o ti ye.

title_english: My blessed Saviour, is Thy Love
passage_english: FOR THE LOVE OF CHRIST CONSTRAINETH US. 11CORINTHIANS 5
passage_yoruba: IFE KRISTI LI O N RO WA. II KORINTI 5
verses_english:
My blessed Saviour, is Thy Love
So great, so full, so free?
Behold, I give my love, my heart,
My life, my all, to Thee.

I love Thee for the glorious worth
Which in Thyself I see:
I love Thee for that shameful cross
Thou hast endured for me.

Though in the very form of God,
With heavenly glory crown'd,
Thou wouldst partake of human flesh
Beset with troubles round.

Thou wouldst like wretched man be made
In every thing but sin,
That we as like Thee might become
As we unlike had been.

Like Thee, in faith, in meekness, love,
In every beauteous grace;
From glory thus to glory changed,
As we behold Thy face.
verses_yoruba:
Olugbala mi, ife Re
Ha tobi bee si mi?
Woo, mo f’ife mi, okan mi,
A t‘aye mi fun O.

Mo fe O nitori toye
Ti mo ri ninu Re,
Mo fe O nitori iya
T‘o f’ ara da fun mi.

Bi iwo ti je Olorun
T‘a f‘ogo de l’ade;
Iwo ko ko awo eniyan
T’o kun fun iyonu.

‘Wo je k‘a bi O l‘eniyan,
Sugbon ‘Wo ko l‘ese;
K‘awa le ri b‘lwo ti ri,
K‘a le se b‘O ti se.

title_english: Love divine, all loves excelling,
passage_english: CHRIST IN YOU, THE HOPE OF GLORY. COLOSSIAN 1
passage_yoruba: KRISTI NINU YIN, IRETI OGO. KOLOSSE 1
verses_english:
Love divine, all loves excelling,
joy of heaven, to earth come down,
fix in us thy humble dwelling,
all thy faithful mercies crown.
Jesus, thou art all compassion,
pure, unbounded love thou art;
visit us with thy salvation,
enter every trembling heart.

Come, almighty to deliver,
let us all thy life receive;
suddenly return, and never,
nevermore thy temples leave.
Thee we would be always blessing,
serve thee as thy hosts above,
pray, and praise thee without ceasing,
glory in thy perfect love.

Finish then thy new creation;
pure and spotless let us be;
let us see thy great salvation
perfectly restored in thee:
changed from glory into glory,
till in heaven we take our place,
till we cast our crowns before thee,
lost in wonder, love, and praise.
verses_yoruba:
Ife orun lailegbe,
Ayo orun, sokale,
Fi okan wa se ‘bugbe Re,
Se asetan aanu Re.
Jesu Iwo ni alaanu
Iwo l‘onibu ife
Fi igbala Re be wa wo
M‘okan eru wa duro

Wa, Olodumare, gba wa
Fun wa l‘oore-ofe Re.
Lojiji ni k‘o pada wa,
Ma si fi wa sile mo;
Iwo l‘a o maa yin titi,
Bi won ti n se ni orun
Iyin wa ki yio l’opin
A o sogo n‘nu ‘fe Re.

S‘asepe awa eda Re
Je ka wa lailabawon
K‘a ri titobi ‘gbala Re
Li aritan ninu Re.
Mu wa l’at’ogo de ogo,
Titi di ibugbe wa;
Titi awa o fi wole
N‘iyanu, ife, iyin.

title_english: There is a name I love to hear,
title_yoruba: Oruko kun n be ti mo fe
passage_english: THE NAME OF THY HOLY CHILD JESUS. ACTS OF APOSTLE 4:30
passage_yoruba: ORUKO JESU OMO MIMO RE. ISE AWON APOSTELI 4:30
verses_english:
There is a name I love to hear,
I love to sing its worth;
It sounds like music in mine ear,
The sweetest name on earth.

It tells me of the Lamb of God
Who died to set me free;
It tells me of His precious blood,
The sinner's perfect plea.

It tells me of a Father's smile
Beaming upon His child;
It cheers me through this little while,
Through desert, waste, and wild.

Jesus, the name I love so well,
The name I love to hear;
No saint on earth its worth can tell,
No heart conceive how dear.

This name shall shed its fragrance still
Along this thorny road,
Shall sweetly smooth the rugged hill,
That leads me up to God.

And there with all the blood-bought throng
From sin and sorrow free,
I'll sing the new eternal song
Of Jesus' love to me.
verses_yoruba:
Oruko kun n be ti mo fe
Mo fe maa korin Re;
Iro didun ni l'eti mi,
Oruko didun ni.

O so ife Olugbala
T‘oku lati ra mi,
O so t’eje Re ‘yebiye
Etutu f’elese.

O so ti iyanu Baba,
Ti o ni s‘Omo Re,
O m‘ara mi ya, lati la
Aginju aye ja.

Jesu, oruko ti mo fe,
T‘o si dun l‘eti mi;
Ko s‘eni mimo kan l‘aye
T‘o mo b‘O ti po to.

Oruko yii j’oorun didun
L‘ona egun t‘a n rin;
Yio tun ona yangi se
T‘o lo s‘od‘Olorun.

Nibe pelu awon mimo
Ti won bo nin‘ ese
Emi o korin titun ni
T‘ife Jesu si mi.

title_english: We love Thee, Lord; yet not alone,
passage_english: HER SINS, WHICH ARE MANY, ARE FORGIVEN; FOR SHE LOVED MUCH. LUKE 7:47
passage_yoruba: A DARI ESE RE TI O PO JI I, NITORI TI O NI IFE PUPO. LUKU 7:47
verses_english:
We love Thee, Lord; yet not alone,
because Thy bounteous hand
Showers down its rich and ceaseless gifts on ocean and on land;
We praise Thee, gracious Lord, for these, yet not for these alone
The incense of Thy children's love arises to Thy throne.

We love Thee, Lord, becuase when we had err'd and gone astray,
Thou didst recall our wandering souls into the heavenward way,
When helpless, hopeless, we were lost in sin and sorrow's night,
A guiding ray was granted us from Thy pure fount of light.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa a fe o,
‘Tori gbogbo ebun
N t‘owo Re da lat‘ oke wa,
B‘iri si gbogb‘ aye;
A yin O nitori wonyii,
K‘ise fun won nikan,
Ni awon omo-odo Re
Se n gbadura si O.

Awa fe O, Olugbala,
‘Tori ‘gba t‘ a sako,
Iwo pe okan wa pada
Lati t‘ona iye;
‘Gba t‘a wa ninu okunkun,
T’a ri ninu ese,
‘Wo ran imole Re si wa
Lati f‘ona han wa.

Baba orun awa fe O,
Nitori ‘Wo fe wa
‘Wo ran Omo Re lati ku,
Ki awa le n‘iye;
Gbat‘a wa labe ‘binu Re
'Wo fun wa n‘ireti;
Bi ese t‘a da ti po to
Bee l‘o dariji wa.

title_english: When this passing world is done,
passage_english: THEREFORE, BRETHREN, WE ARE DEBTORS. ROMANS 8:13
passage_yoruba: NJE NITORINA, ARA, AJIGBESE LI AWA. ROMU 8:12.
verses_english:
When this passing world is done,
When has sunk yon glaring sun,
When we stand with Christ in glory,
Looking o’er life’s finished story,
Then, Lord, shall I fully know—
Not till then—how much I owe.

When I stand before the throne,
Dressed in beauty not my own,
When I see Thee as Thou art,
Love Thee with unsinning heart,
Then Lord, shall I fully know—
Not till then—how much I owe.

When the praise of Heav’n I hear,
Loud as thunders to the ear,
Loud as many waters’ noise,
Sweet as harp’s melodious voice,
Then, Lord, shall I fully know—
Not till then—how much I owe.

Even on earth, as through a glass
Darkly, let Thy glory pass,
Make forgiveness feel so sweet,
Make Thy Spirit’s help so meet,
Even on earth, Lord, make me know
Something of how much I owe.

Chosen not for good in me,
Wakened up from wrath to flee,
Hidden in the Savior’s side,
By the Spirit sanctified,
Teach me, Lord, on earth to show,
By my love, how much I owe.
verses_yoruba:
Gbat’aye yii ba koja,
Ti oorun re ba si wo
Ti a ba wo ‘nu ogo,
T’a bojuwo ehin wa,
Gbanna, Oluwa un o mo,
Bi ‘gbese mi ti po to.

‘Gba mo ba de ‘b ‘ite re,
L’ewa ti ki se t’emi
‘Gba mo ri O b’o ti ri,
Ti mo fe O l’afetan,
Gbanna, Oluwa un o mo,
Bi ‘gbese mi ti po to.

‘Gba n ba gbo orin orun,
Ti n dun bi ohun ara,
Bi iro omi pupo;
T’o si n dun b’ohun duuru,
Gbanna, Oluwa un o mo,
Bi ‘gbese mi ti poto.

Oluwa joo, je k’a ri,
Ojiji Re l’aye yii.
K’a mo adun dariji,
Pelu iranwo Emi,
Kin tile mo l’aye yii,
Die ninu gbese mi.

Oore – ofe l’o yan mi
L’o yo mi ninu ewu,
Jesu l’Olugbala mi,
Emi so mi di mimo,
Ko mi, ki n fi han l’aye,
Bi gbese mi tip o to!.

title_english: We sing a song of Thy great love
passage_english: WE LOVE HIM, BECAUSE HE FIRST LOVED US. 1 JOHN 4:19
passage_yoruba: AWA FEE, NITORI OUN LO KOKO FE WA. 1 JOHANU 4:19
verses_english:
We sing a song of Thy great love
Almighty and glorious God
There's nought Thy power cannot provide,
Thy goodness endureth for aye

In love He created the world,
And He made man to dwell in it,
And have dominion over all,
Sing a song to our Creator.

Every day He takes care of us,
He feeds and provides all our needs,
Without asking ought of our hand,
Praise our God the giver of all.

He finds us roaming in darkness,
Not knowing how to worship Him
In His love He showed us the way
Praise His name, our benefactor

In love He gave Jesus to us
Christ, His only begotten Son
He came to redeem us from sin
We praise Thy great love, our Saviour.

In love He sent His word to us
And this Thy love opened our ears,
And established us in faith
Sing His wonderful grace to us.

Creation is full of Thy love
Our God, King of the universe,
All join the chorus of His praise
And sing of the love of our God
verses_yoruba:
Awa ko orin ife Re
Obangiji Oba Ogo;
Ko s'ohun ti lalasi Re,
Ola Re ko si nipekun.

Lojoojumo l‘O n toju wa,
O si n bo, O si n sike wa;
Beeni ki gba n kan lowo wa,
Korin ‘yin s‘onibu ore.

Ife Re ran oro Re wa,
Ife Re l‘o si wa leti,
Ife Re si mu wa duro;
E korin oore-ofe Re.

Gbogbo eda kun fun‘fe Re
Oluwa wa, Oba aye;
Gbogbo agbaye, e gberin,
Orin ife Olorun wa.

title_english: Hark, my soul! it is the Lord;
passage_english: LOVEST THOU ME MORE THAN THESE. JOHN 21:15
passage_yoruba: IWO FE MI JU AWON WINYI LO BI? JOHANU 21:15
verses_english:
I delivered thee when bound,
And, when bleeding, healed thy wound;
Sought thee wandering, set thee right,
Turned thy darkness into light.

Can a woman's tender care
Cease toward the child she bare?
Yes, she may forgetful be;
Yet will I remember thee.

Mine is an unchanging love,
Higher than the heights above,
Deeper than the depths beneath,
Free and faithful, strong as death.

Lord, it is my chief complaint
That my love is weak and faint;
Yet I love Thee, and adore:
O for grace to love Thee more!
verses_yoruba:
Okan mi, Oluwa ni,
Jesu re ni, gboro Re.
Jesu n so, O n ba o so,
Pe elese. 'wo fe mi?

‘Gbat‘a de o, Mo da O,
O gb‘ogbe, Mo wo o san,
Gb‘o sako, Mo mu o bo;
Mo s‘ookun re d‘imole.

Kike iya ha le pin
Si Omo re ti o bi?
Lotito, o le gbagbe,
Sugbon Em‘o ranti re:

Ife t‘Emi ki ye lae,
O ga rekoja orun;
O si jinna ju okun lo,
Ife alailegbe ni.

‘Wo fere r‘ogo Mi na,
‘Gba‘ se oore-ofe tan;
‘Wo o ba Mi gunwa po
Wi, elese ‘wo fe Mi?

Olori aroye mi
Ni pe ife mi tutu;
Sugbon mo fe O Jesu,
A! n ba fe O ju yii!

title_english: O love divine, how sweet Thou art!
title_yoruba: Ife orun, o ti dun to!
passage_english: MY SOUL FOLLOWS CLOSE BEHIND YOU. PSALMS 63:8
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI N TELE O GIRIGIRI. ORIN DAFIDI 63:8
verses_english:
O love divine, how sweet Thou art!
When shall I find my willing heart
All taken up by Thee?

I thirst, I faint, I die to prove
The greatness of redeeming love,
The love of Christ to me.

My only care, delight, and bliss,
My joy, my heaven on earth be this
To hear the Bridegroom's voice.
verses_yoruba:
Ife orun, o ti dun to!
Gbawo ni un o ri t’ okan mi,
Yoo kun fun kiki re?

K’o j’ aniyan at’ ife mi,
K’o si j’ orun fun mi laye,
Lati maa gbohun Re.

title_english: Jesus, my Lord, my God, my All,
passage_english: NOW REMAIN IN MY LOVE. JOHN 15:9
passage_yoruba: E DURO NINU IFE MI. JOHN 15:9
verses_english:
Jesus, what didst Thou find in me
That Thou hast dealt so lovingly?
How great the joy that Thou hast brought,
So far exceeding hope or thought!
Jesus, my Lord, I Thee adore;
O make me love Thee more and more.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa, Oba mi
Gbohun mi nigba ti mo n pe
Gbohun mi lati ‘bugbe Re
Ro’jo oore-ofe sile
Oluwa mi mo feran Re
Je ki n le maa feran Re si.

Jesu, mo ti jafara ju
N o se le fe O, b’o ti ye,
Em’ o se le gb’ogo Re ga,
Ati ewa oruko Re,
Oluwa mi mo feran Re
Je ki n le maa feran Re si.

Jesu kil’o ri ninu mi
Ti’fe naa fi po to bayii?
Oore Re si mi ti po to!
O ta gbogbo ero mi yo.
Oluwa mi mo feran Re
Je ki n le maa feran Re si.

Jesu ‘Wo o je orin mi
Tire l’aya at'okan mi
Tire ni gbogbo ini mi
Olugbala ‘Wo ni temi
Oluwa mi mo feran Re
Je ki n le maa feran Re si.

title_english: More love to Thee, O Christ,
passage_english: YEA, LORD; THOU KNOWEST THAT I LOVE THEE. JOHN. 21:15.
passage_yoruba: BENI OLUWA; IWO MO PE, MO FERÀN RE. JOHN. 21:15
verses_english:
More love to Thee, O Christ,
More love to Thee!
Hear Thou the prayer I make
On bended knee,
This is my earnest plea:
More love, O Christ, to Thee;
More love to Thee, More love to Thee!

Once earthly joy I craved,
Sought peace and rest;
Now Thee alone I seek,
Give what is best.
This all my prayer shall be:
More love, O Christ to Thee;
More love to Thee, More love to Thee!

Let sorrow do its work,
Come grief or pain;
Sweet are Thy messengers,
Sweet their refrain,
When they can sing with me:
More love, O Christ, to Thee;
More love to Thee, More love to Thee!
verses_yoruba:
Je ki ‘banuje de
At’ irora
Didun l’ ojise Re
At’ ise won;
‘Gba won n ba mi korin
Ki nfe o si Kristi
Ki nfe o si, Ki nfe o si.

Nje, opin emi mi
Yoo y’iyin Re,
Eyii yoo je oro,
Keyin mi,
Adura mi y’o je
Ki nfe o si Kristi
Ki nfe o si, Ki nfe o si.

title_english: He gave to me a seal
passage_english: AND WHEN THEY HAD NOTHING TO PAY, HE FRANKLY FORGAVE THEM BOTH. LUK. 7:42
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI NWON KÒ SI NI TI NWON O SAN, O DARIJÌ AWON MEJEJI. LUK. 7:42
verses_english:
He gave to me a seal
Of the great debt I owe
And as He gave, he smiled and said,
“Always, remember me.”

He gave to me a seal
All of my debts he paid,
And as he gave, He smiled and said
“Always, remember me.”

I shall treasure the seal
Though, the debts is all paid
The seal told of the love of one
Who paid the debt for me.

I looked at it and smiled,
Again, I looked and wept
The earnest of His love for me,
I’ll ever treasure it.

It is more than a seal
It is in remembrance,
That all the debt of sin was paid
By the Lord, Emmanuel.
verses_yoruba:
O fun mi l'edidi,
‘Gbese nla ti mo je
B'O ti fun mi,O si rerin
Pe, ”Mase gbagbe mi!"

O fun mi l'edidi,
O san gbese nla naa
B'o ti fun mi, O si rerin
Wipe, "Maa ranti mi".

Un o p'edidi naa mo
B’ igbese tile tan
O n so Ife enit’o san
Igbese naa fun mi.

Mo woo,mo si rerin,
Mo tun woo, mo sokun,
Eri Ife Re si mi ni,
Un o toju re titi.

Ki tun s'edidi mo,
Sugbon iranti ni!
Pe gbogbo gbese mi ni
Emmanueli san

title_english: “Love him who’s thy neighbour”
passage_english: THESE THINGS I COMMAND YOU, THAT YE LOVE ONE ANOTHER. JOHN 15:17
passage_yoruba: NKAN WONYI NI MO PALASE FUN YIN PE, KI ENYIN KI O FERAN ARA NYIN. JOHN 15:17
verses_english:
“Love him who’s thy neighbour”
It is the Lord’s command
He made Himself an example
By the way He loved us.

“Love him who’s thy neighbour”
Whether in peace or war
He taught us to love our foes,
Repay evil with good.

“Love him who’s thy neighbour”
The Lord’s voice trumpets still
So, all of us ought to prepare
To love all our neighbours.

“Love him who’s thy neighbour”
And those living next door
Those that are in your neighbourhood
And all your enemies.

love your neighbours as
Jesus Himself loved us
Jesus loved all His enemies
And blessed and prayed for them.
verses_yoruba:
“Fe enikeji re”
Ase Oluwa ni
O sa f’ara Re sapere,
Ni fife t’ O fe wa.

“Fe enikeji re”
N’ire tabi n’ ija
O ko wa pe k’ a f’ ota wa,
K’ a f’oore san ibi.

“Fe enikeji re”
Oluwa n ke tantan,
O ye ki gbogbo wa mura,
K’ a f’enikeji wa.

“Fe enikeji re”
At’ aladugbo re
Pelu gbogb’ eni yi o ka,
At’ ota re pelu.

K’ a f’ enikeji wa,
Bi Jesu ti fe wa
Jesu sa f’awon ota Re,
O si sure fun won.

title_english: Jesus, Lord, we look to Thee;
title_yoruba: Jesu, Iwo ni a n wo,
passage_english: LET BROTHERLY LOVE CONTINUE. HEBREWS 13:1
passage_yoruba: KI IFE ARA KI O PE TITI HEBERU 13:1
verses_english:
Make us of one heart and mind,
Courteous, pitiful, and kind,
Lowly, meek in thought and word,
Altogether like our Lord.

Let us for each other care,
Each his brother’s burdens bear;
To Thy church the pattern give,
Show how true believers live.

Let us then with joy remove
To the family above;
On the wings of angels fly,
Show how true believers die.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Iwo ni a n wo,
K‘a repo l‘oruko Re;
Alade alaafia
Mu k‘ija tan l‘aarin wa.

Je k‘a wa ni okan kan
K‘a se aanu at‘ oore;
K‘a tutu l‘ero, l‘okan
Gege bi Oluwa wa,

K‘a kuro ni ibinu,
K‘a sinmi le Olorun;
K‘a so ti ibu ife
At‘ iwa giga mimo.

K‘a f’ayo kuro laye,
Lo si ijo ti orun,
K‘a f‘iye Angeli fo,
K‘a le ku b‘eni mimo

title_english: Brethen let us walk together,
title_yoruba: Ara, e je k‘a jumo rin
passage_english: THAT HE WHO LOVETH GOD LOVE HIS BROTHER ALSO. 1 JOHN 4:21
passage_yoruba: ENITI O BA FE OLORUN, O FE ARAKUNRIN RE. 1 JOHANU 4:21
verses_english:
Brethen let us walk together,
In love and the peace of God,
Ought we to begin to question,
Whether we should cease all strife?
In communion, sweet communion,
Will our love and joy increase.

As we make our journey homeward,
Let us help ourselves along,
Our foes encircle us around,
Snares are laid out on our way,
Our duty is, our duty is,
To bear each other's burden.

When we think of what God has done,
In forgiving o'er and o'er,
Brethren, ought we not to learn that,
Striving should be set aside,
Let us avoid, let us avoid,
All the anger and the strife.

Let us seek our brother's honour,
More than we would seek our own,
Let us leave all spite and hatred,
And our hearts be filled with love,
'Twill be sweeter, 'twill be sweeter,
If we're in oneness on earth.
verses_yoruba:
Ara, e je k‘a jumo rin
N‘ife oun alaafia;
A ha le maa tun bere pe,
O to k‘a ba f‘ija mo?
Ni repo, Ni irepo
l‘ayo, ife, y‘o fi po

Nigbat‘ a r‘ohun Baba se,
T‘o ti fi ji, t‘o n fiji,
Ara, ko t’o k‘awa k‘o ko,
Lati maa fija sile?
K‘a mu un kuro, k’a mu un kuro.
Ohun ‘ba mu ‘binu wa.

title_english: Blest be the dear uniting love,
passage_english: BEAR YE ONE ANOTHER'S BURDENS. GALATIANS 6:2
passage_yoruba: E MA RU ERU OMONIKEJI YIN. GALATIA 6:2
verses_english:
Blest be the dear uniting love,
That will not let us part;
Our bodies may far off remove,
We still are one in heart.

Joined in one spirit to our Head,
Where He appoints we go;
And still in Jesu's footsteps tread,
And show His praise below.

O may we ever walk in Him,
And nothing know beside;
Nothing desire, nothing esteem,
But Jesus crucified!

Closer and closer let us cleave
To His beloved embrace;
Expect His fullness to receive
And grace to answer grace.
verses_yoruba:
Alabukun ni fun ife
Ti ki o je k‘aya;
Bi ara wa jinna s‘ara,
Okan wa wa l‘okan.

Da opo emi s‘ori wa,
Ona t‘o la l‘a n to;
Nipa ti Jesu l‘a si n rin,
Iyin Re l‘a n fi han.

Awa ‘ba maa rin l‘ona RE,
K‘a ma si m‘ohun kan;
K‘a ma fe ‘hun kan bikose
Jesu t‘a pa fun wa.

K‘a sunmo O girigiri
Ati si ona Re;
K‘a maa r‘ore gba l’ odo Re,
Ekun oore-ofe.

title_english: Behold how pleasant for brethren
title_yoruba: Wo! b‘o tidun to lati ri
passage_english: BEHOLD, HOW GOOD AND HOW PLEASANT IT IS FOR BRETHREN TO DWELL TOGETHER IN UNITY. PSALM 133:1
passage_yoruba: KIYESI O TI DARA O SI TI DUN TO FUN AWON ARA LATI MAA JUMO GBE NI IREPO. ORIN DAFIDI 133:1
verses_english:
Behold how pleasant for brethren
To dwell in unity,
Brethren whose hearts are on oneness
In holy fellowship.

When streams of love from Christ doth flow
It flows to every heart,
The peace of the Almighty God
Protects and keeps them all.

It is like the precious ointment
That ran down Aaron's beard
And on it went down to his skirts
And brought forth sweet perfume.

For it is pleasant as the dew
That descends on Zion;
Where God reveals His great glory
And shows to us His grace.
verses_yoruba:
Wo! b‘o tidun to lati ri
Awon ara t’ ore;
Ara ti okan won s’okan,
L’egbe ide mimo.

‘Gba isan ‘fe t’odo Kristi sun,
O san s’okan gbogbo,
Alaafia Olodumare,
Dabo bo gbogbo re.

O dabi ororo didun
Ni irungbon Aaron;
N’ikan re m‘aso re run re
O san s‘agbada re.

O dara b‘iri owuro
T‘o n se soke Sion;
Nibit‘Olorun f‘ogo han,
T’ o m’ oore-ofe han.

title_english: Come, and let us sweetly join
passage_english: O COME, LET US SING UNTO THE LORD: PSALM 95:1
passage_yoruba: E WA, E JE KI A KORIN SI OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 95:1
verses_english:
Come, and let us sweetly join
Christ to praise in hymns divine!
Give we all, with one accord,
Glory to our common Lord;

Strive we, in affection strive;
Let the purer flame revive,
Such as in the martyrs glowed,
Dying champions for their God:

We, like them, may live and love;
Called we are their joys to prove,
Saved with them from future wrath,
Partners of like precious faith.

Sing we then in Jesu's name,
Now as yesterday the same;
One in every time and place,
Full for all of truth and grace:

We for Christ, our Master, stand,
Lights in a benighted land:
We our dying Lord confess;
We are Jesu's witnesses.
verses_yoruba:
E wa, e jek‘a jumo
F‘orin mimo yin Kristi;
K‘a f’ ohun kan fi ogo
Fun Oluwa gbogbo wa.

A n gbiyanju n‘nu ife;
Jek‘ ina ife soji,
Ti n jo n‘nu awon martyr
T‘oku n‘tori Olorun.

Awa le ni‘fe bi won,
A le pin n‘nu ayo won,
Agba wa lowo.‘ binu,
Nipa igbagbo kannaa.

A n korin iyin Jesu,
Okannaa l‘ana, l‘oni;
Okannaa nigbagbogbo,
Oloore-ofe julo.

A duro f‘Oluwa wa,
Bi ‘mole n’ le ookun;
A jewo Jesu t‘o ku
Awa ni eleri Re.

Eleri pe, Krist‘ ti ku,
A kan awa Re mo ‘gi,
Krist‘ ti da ide iku,
Emi iye Re l‘a n mi;

title_english: All praise to our redeeming Lord,
passage_english: THEY WERE ALL WITH ONE ACCORD IN ONE PLACE.ACTS 2:1
passage_yoruba: GBOGBO WON FI OKAN KAN WA NIBI KAN. ISE AWON APOSTELI 2:1
verses_english:
All praise to our redeeming Lord,
Who joins us by His grace;
And bids us, each to each restored,
We hand in hand go on.

He bids us build each other up;
And, gathered into one,
The grace through every vessel flows,
We hand in hand go on.

The gift which He on one bestows,
We all delight to prove;
The grace through every vessel flows,
In purest streams of love.

E’en now we think and speak the same,
And cordially agree;
Concentered all, through Jesus’ name,
In perfect harmony.

And if our fellowship below
In Jesus be so sweet,
What height of rapture shall we know
When round His throne we meet!
verses_yoruba:
E je k‘a yin Olugbala
T‘ Oda wa po l‘okan
T‘O pase ki a tun pade,
N’nu isokan emi.

O pase k‘a gbe ‘ra wa ro:
Awa jumo n lepa
Oor‘ofe naa n san laarin wa
N‘nu isokan emi.

Ebun t‘O fun wa, lokokan
L‘awa n fi ayo lo;
Oor‘ofe naa n san laarin wa,
Ninu ife mimo.

Ero at‘oro wa j‘okan
Ife wa si j‘okan
Awa wa n‘irepo pipe
Li oruko Jesu.

A n se ajopin ayo wa,
At‘alaafia wa,
Alaafia t‘aye ko mo,
Li oruko Jesu.

B‘idapo wa ninu Jesu
Ba dun bayii laye,
Ayo wa yoo ti tobi to
Gba ba yi ‘te Re ka!

title_english: Blest be the tie that binds
passage_english: AND THE MULTITUDE OF THEM THAT BELIEVED WERE OF ONE HEART AND OF ONE SOUL. ACTS 4:32
passage_yoruba: IJO AWON TI O GBAGBO SI WA LI OKAN KAN ATI INU KAN. ISE 4:32
verses_english:
Blest be the tie that binds
Our hearts in Christian love;
The fellowship of kindred minds
Is like to that above.

Before our Father’s throne
We pour our ardent prayers;
Our fears, our hopes, our aims are one
Our comforts and our cares.

We share each other’s woes,
Our mutual burdens bear;
And often for each other flows
The sympathizing tear.

When we asunder part,
It gives us inward pain;
But we shall still be joined in heart,
And hope to meet again.

This glorious hope revives
Our courage by the way;
While each in expectation lives,
And longs to see the day.

From sorrow, toil and pain,
And sin, we shall be free,
And perfect love and friendship reign
Through all eternity.
verses_yoruba:
Awa yin ife Re
To so okan wa po,
T‘a n jumo n‘idapo didun
Bi won ti n se loke.

Nib‘ ite Baba wa,
A n f‘itara bebe;
A n jumo so edun wa fun un,
A si n r‘itunu gba.

A n b‘ara wa kedun
A n b‘ara wa y‘ayo;
Ohunkohun t‘o wu ko de,
A n jumo f‘ife pin in.

B‘ipinya ba si de,
O n ba wa ninu je;
Ibi kan wa fun idapo
Ti ore n ri ‘ra won.

Eyii n‘ireti wa,
Ti n so okan wa ji;
Pe ao pade lai pinya mo,
L‘ese Jesu l‘oke.

A o bo low‘aniyan,
Ao bo lowo ese,
Ife pipe yoo so wa po
Titi ayeraye

title_english: There's a glorious work before us,
title_yoruba: A ni ‘se to logo kan se,
passage_english: AND ON SOME HAVE COMPASSION, BUT OTHERS SAVE. JUDE 1:22-23
passage_yoruba: E MAA SAANU AWON ELOMIRAN, E MAA GBA AWON ELOMIRAN LA. JUDA 1:22-23.
verses_english:
There's a glorious work before us,
A work both great and grand;
Every man at once should join us,
And help with heart and hand.

There are homes now full of sadness,
Whence peace and love are flown;
We must fill these homes with gladness,
And make the Saviour known.

There are drink bound slaves around us,
Who writhe in helpless woe;
We must snap the bonds that bind them,
And lay the tyrant low.

There are wives and mothers weeping,
Whose hearts are cold and sad;
We must give them joyous greeting,
And bid them yet be glad.

There are crowds of little children,
Deep sunk in sin and night;
We must raise them from their darkness,
And lead them up to light.

Let us then gird on our armour,
And God our strength shall be;
He the host is onward leading
To certain victory!
verses_yoruba:
A ni ‘se to logo kan se,
Ise ribiribi;
Ki gbogb' aye dapo mo wa,
Lati se ise naa.

‘Banuje kun opo ile,
T‘alaafia ko si;
Je k‘a f‘ayo kun ‘le wonyii,
K‘a f‘Olugbala han.

Eru o ti po yi wa ka,
Won n yira n‘nu egbe;
Je k‘a da ewon t‘o de won
K'a pa ibi naa re.

Opo aya pelu iya,
N sokun fun ‘banuje;
Je ki a tu won ni inu
Pe, ireti si n be.

Opolopo l‘awon omo
Ti n be ninu ese;
Je k‘a yo won ninu ookun
Si inu imole.

Je k‘a wo ihamora wa
Olorun n‘ipa wa,
Oun l‘o n samona ogun wa,
Si ‘segun t‘o daju.

title_english: Happy The Heart Where Graces Reign
passage_english: BUT THE GREATEST OF THESE IS CHARITY. 1 CORINTHIANS 13:13
passage_yoruba: EYII T’O TOBI JULO NI IFENI. I KORINTI 13:13
verses_english:
Happy The Heart Where Graces Reign
Where Love Inspires The Breast;
Love Is The Brightest Of The Train,
And Perfects All The Rest.

Faith, Alas! ‘Tis All In Vain,
And All In Vain Our Fear;
Our Stubborn Sins Will Fight And Reign,
If Love Be Absent There.

This Is The Grace That Lives And Sings.
When Faith And Hope Shall Cease;
‘Tis This Shall Strike Our Joyful Strings
In The Sweet Realm Of Bliss.
verses_yoruba:
Alaafia ni f‘okan naa,
Nibit‘ ife gbe wa;
Ife ni o tobi julo
Ninu gbogbo ebun.

Asan ni gbogbo ‘gbagbo je,
Asan ni ‘beru wa:
Ese yoo bori okan wa
B‘ife ko si nibe.

Ife nikan ni yoo r‘opin
Igbagbo oun ‘reti;
Nipa re l‘a o maa korin
Loke orun lohun.

title_english: More holiness give me, more strivings within.
title_yoruba: Fun mi n’iwa mimo; igbona okan
passage_english: MAKE ME ALIVE. PSALMS 119:25
passage_yoruba: SO MI DI AYE – ORIN DAFIDI 119:25
verses_english:
More holiness give me, more strivings within.
More patience in suffering, more sorrow for sin.
More faith in my Savior, more sense of His care.
More joy in His service, more purpose in prayer.

More gratitude give me, more trust in the Lord.
More zeal for His glory, more hope in His Word.
More tears for His sorrows, more pain at His grief.
More meekness in trial, more praise for relief.

More purity give me, more strength to o’ercome,
More freedom from earth-stains, more longings for home.
More fit for the kingdom, more useful I’d be,
More blessèd and holy, more, Savior, like Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Fun mi n’iwa mimo; igbona okan
Suru ninu iya; aro fun ese
Igbagbo n’nu Jesu; ki n mo ‘toju Re
Ayo n’nu isin Re; emi adura

Fun mi l’okan ope; igbekele Krist’
Itara f’ogo Re; ‘reti n’n’oro Re
Ekun fun iya Re; ‘rora f’ogbe Re
Irele n’nu ‘danwo; iyin fun ‘ranwo.

Fun mi n’iwa funfun; fun mi n’isegun
‘We abawon mi nu; fa ‘fe mi s’orun
Mu mi ye ‘joba Re; ki nwulo fun O
Ki nj’alabukun fun; ki ndabi Jesu.

title_english: And dost Thou say, Ask what thou wilt?
passage_english: ASK WHAT I SHALL GIVE THEE. 1 KING 3:5
passage_yoruba: BEERE OHUN TI EMI O FI FUN O. I OBA 3:5
verses_english:
And dost Thou say, Ask what thou wilt?
Lord, I would seize the golden hour:
I pray to be released from guilt,
And freed from sin and Satan's power.

More of Thy presence, Lord, impart,
More of Thine image let me bear;
Erect Thy throne within my heart,
And reign without a rival there.

Give me to read my pardon sealed,
And from Thy joy to draw my strength,
To have Thy boundless love revealed,
Its height, and depth, its breadth, and length.

Grant these requests, I ask no more,
But to Thy care the rest resign;
Living or dying, rich or poor,
All shall be well if Thou art mine.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, Iwo ha wipe
Ki N beere ohun ti mo n fe?
Joo, je ki n bo Iowo ebi,
Ati low‘ese oun Esu.

Joo, fi ara Re han fun mi,
Si je ki n ru aworan Re,
Te ite Re si okan mi,
Si ma nikan joba nibe.

Jeki n mo p‘O dariji mi,
Ki ayo Re s' agbara mi,
Ki n mo giga, ibu, jijin
Ati gigun ife nla Re.

Eyi nikan ni ebe mi
Eyit‘o ku di owo Re
Iye, iku, aini, oro
Ko je nkan b‘O je t‘emi.

title_english: Amazing grace! how sweet the sound!
passage_english: MUCH MORE THEY WHICH RECEIVE ABUNDANCE OF GRACE AND OF THE GIFT OF RIGHTEOUSNESS SHALL REIGN IN LIFE BY ONE, JESUS CHRIST. ROM. 5:17
passage_yoruba: AWON TI O TI GBA OPOLOPO OORE-OFE ATI EBUN ODODO, YIO JOBA NINU IYE NIPA ENIKAN JESU KRISTI. ROM. 5:17
verses_english:
T'was grace that taught my heart to fear,
And grace my fears relieved;
How precious did that grace appear
The hour I first believed!

Through many dangers, toils, and snares,
I have already come;
'Tis grace has brought me safe thus far,
And grace will lead me home.

Yes, when this heart and flesh shall fail,
And mortal life shall cease,
I shall possess within the vail
A life of joy and peace.
verses_yoruba:
Oore-ofe! b‘o ti dun to!
T‘o gba em‘ abosi;
Mo ti sonu, O wa mi ri,
O si si mi loju.

Oor‘ofe ko mi ki n‘beru,
O si leru mi lo,
B‘oore-ofe naa ti han to
Nigba mo ko gbagbo!

Opo ewu at‘ idekun
Ni mo ti la koja;
Oor‘-ofe n pa mi mo d’oni
Yoo si sin mi de ‘le.

N je gbat’ara at’okan ye,
Ti emi ba si pin,
Un o gb’ayo at’alaafia
Loke orun lohun.

title_english: The roseate hues of early dawn,
passage_english: FOR WE WHO ARE IN THIS TENT GROAN, BEING BURDENED. II CORINTHIANS 5:4
passage_yoruba: NITORI AWA TI O WA NINU AGO YII N KERORA, ERU N PA WA. II KORINTI 5:4
verses_english:
The roseate hues of early dawn,
The brightness of the day,
The crimson of the sunset sky,
How fast they fade away!
O for the pearly gates of heav'n!
O for the golden floor!
O for the Sun of Righteousness
That setteth nevermore!

The highest hopes we cherish here,
How fast they tire and faint!
How many a spot defiles the robe
That wraps an earthly saint!
O for a heart that never sins!
O for a soul washed white!
O for a voice to praise our King,
Nor weary day or night!

Here faith is ours, and heavenly hopes,
And grace to lead us higher;
But there are perfectness and peace
Beyond our great desire.
O by Thy love and anguish, Lord,
O by Thy life laid down,
O that we fall not from Thy grace,
Nor cast away our crown.
verses_yoruba:
Ewa ’tanna ooro kutu,
’Mole osan gangan,
Pipon orun li ojoro,
Won ti n yara sa to!
A n fe enubode orun,
Ita wura didan:
Awa n fe Oorun Ododo,
Ti ki wo titi laelae.

B’ ireti giga wa laye
Ti n tete saki to!
Abawon melomelo ni
N b’agbada Kristian je?
A n fe okan ti ki dese:
Okan ti a we mo:
Ohun lati yin Oba wa,
Losan- loru titi.

Nihin ’gbagbo oun ’reti n be,
Lati to wa soke;
Lohun, pipe alaafia
Ju b’a ti le fe lo:
Nipa ife oun ’rora Re,
Nitori iku Re,
Ma je k’a subu lona Re,
K’a so ade wa nu.

title_english: Jesus, I my cross have taken,
passage_english: BUT WHAT THINGS WERE GAIN TO ME, THOSE I COUNTED LOSS FOR CHRIST. PHIL. 3:7
passage_yoruba: ?UGBON OHUNKOHUN TI O TI JASI ÈRE FUN MI, AWON NI MO TI KÀ SI ÒFO NITORI KRISTI. FIL. 3:7
verses_english:
Jesus, I my cross have taken,
All to leave and follow Thee,
Destitute, despised, forsaken,
Thou from hence my all shall be.
Perish every fond ambition,
All I’ve sought or hoped or known.
Yet how rich is my condition!
God and Heaven are still mine own.

Man may trouble and distress me,
’Twill but drive me to Thy breast.
Life with trials hard may press me; Heaven will bring me sweeter rest.
Oh, ’tis not in grief to harm me,
While Thy love is left to me;
Oh, ’twere not in joy to charm me,
Were that joy unmixed with Thee.

Haste then on from grace to glory,
Armed by faith, and winged by prayer,
Heaven’s eternal day’s before thee,
God’s own hand shall guide thee there.
Soon shall close thy earthly mission,
Swift shall pass thy pilgrim days;
Hope soon change to glad fruition,
Faith to sight, and prayer to praise.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, mo gb’ agbelebu mi,
Ki n le maa to O leyin,
Otosi at’ eni egan
‘Wo l’ ohun gbogbo fun mi,
Bi ini mi gbogbo segbe,
Ti ero mi gbogbo pin,
Sibe oloro ni mo je
Temi ni Kristi at’ orun

Eda le maa wahala mi,
Yoo mu mi sunmo O ni,
Idanwo aye le ba mi,
Orun o mu sinmi wa,
Ibanuje ko le se nkan,
B’ife Re ba wa fun mi,
Ayo ko si le dun mo mi,
B’ Iwo ko si ninu re.

Okan mi gba igbala re,
Bori ese at’ eru,
F’ ayo wa ni ipokipo,
Maa sise lo, ma w’eyin,
Ro t’ Emi t’ o wa ninu Re,
At’ ife Baba si o,
W’ Olugbala t’ o ku fun o,
Omo orun mase kun!

N je koja lat’oore s’ ogo,
N’ nu adura oun igbagbo,
Ojo ailopin wa fun O,
Baba yoo mu o de ‘be
Ise re l’ aye fere pin,
Ojo ajo re n buse,
Ireti yoo pada s’ayo,
Adura s’ orin iyin.

title_english: Nearer, my God, to thee,
passage_english: A PEOPLE NEAR UNTO. PS. 148:14
passage_yoruba: AWON ENIYAN TI O SUNMO ODO RE. PS. 148:14
verses_english:
Nearer, my God, to thee,
Nearer to thee!
E'en though it be a cross
That raiseth me,
still all my song shall be,
nearer, my God, to thee;
nearer to thee!

Though, like a wanderer,
The sun gone down,
Darkness comes over me,
My rest a stone;
Yet in my dreams I’d be
Nearer, my God, to Thee,
Nearer to Thee.

Then, with my waking thoughts
Bright with thy praise,
Out of my stony griefs
Bethel I'll raise;
So by my woes to be
Nearer, my God, to thee;
Nearer, to thee!

Or if, on joyful wing
Cleaving the sky,
Sun, moon, and stars forgot,
Upward I fly,
Still all my song shall be
Nearer, my God, to thee;
Nearer, to thee!
verses_yoruba:
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O
B’o tile se ‘ponju
L’o mu mi wa
Sibe orin mi je
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

Ni ona ajo mi,
B’ ile ba su
Bi okuta si je
Irori mi
Sibe nin’ ala mi
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

Nibe je ki n r’ ona,
T’o lo s’ orun;
Gbogb’ ohun t’ o fun mi
Nin’ aanu Re
Angel lati pe mi,
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

Nje gbati mo ba ji,
Em’ o yin O,
Un o f’ akete mi se
Betel fun O
Bee ninu osi mi,
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

‘Gba n ba fi ayo lo,
S’ oke orun
T’o ga ju orun lo
S’oke giga
Orin mi yio je!
Un o sunm’ O Olorun,
Un o sunmo O.

title_english: Thou art the Way: to Thee alone
passage_english: I AM THE WAY, THE TRUTH, AND THE LIFE. JOHN 14:6
passage_yoruba: JESU WIPE: EMI LI ONA ATI OTITO ATI IYE. JOHANU. 14:6.
verses_english:
Thou art the Way: to Thee alone
From sin and death we flee:
And he who would the Father seek
Must seek Him, Lord, by Thee.

Thou art the Truth, Thy word alone
True wisdom can impart;
Thou only canst inform the mind,
And purify the heart.

Thou art the Life: the rending tomb
Proclaims Thy conquering arm;
And those who put their trust in Thee
Nor death nor hell shall harm.

Thou art the Way, the Truth, the Life:
Grant us that Way to know,
That Truth to keep, that Life to win,
Whose joys eternal flow
verses_yoruba:
Iwo l‘ona; odo Re ni
Awa o ma saa bo;
Awon t‘o n saferi Baba
Yio wa s‘odo Re

Iwo l‘Ooto, oro Tire
L‘o le f‘ogbon fun wa;
Iwo nikan l‘o le ko wa,
T‘o si le we okan.

Iwo n‘lye; iboji Re
Fi agbara Re han;
Awon t‘o gbekele won le O,
Won bo l‘owo iku.

Iwo L‘Ona, Ooto, Iye,
Je k‘a mo Ona re;
K‘a mo otito at‘iye,
T‘ayo re ko l‘opin.

title_english: Jesus calls us over the tumult
title_yoruba: Jesu n pe wa, losan, loru
passage_english: AND HE SAITH UNTO THEM, FOLLOW ME, ... AND THEY STRAIGHTWAY LEFT THEIR NETS, AND FOLLOWED HIM. MATT. 4:19-20
passage_yoruba: O SI WI FUN WON PE, E MAA TO MI LEYIN…. WON SI FI AWON WON SILE LOJUKANNAA, WON N TO O LEYIN. MATT. 4:19-20.
verses_english:
Jesus calls us over the tumult
Of our life’s wild, restless, sea;
Day by day His sweet voice soundeth,
Saying, Christian, follow Me!

As of old Saint Andrew heard it
By the Galilean lake,
Turned from home and toil and kindred,
Leaving all for Jesus’ sake.

Jesus calls us from the worship
Of the vain world’s golden store,
From each idol that would keep us,
Saying, Christian, love Me more!

In our joys and in our sorrows,
Days of toil and hours of ease,
Still He calls, in cares and pleasures,
Christian, love Me more than these!

Jesus calls us! By Thy mercies,
Savior may we hear Thy call,
Give our hearts to Thine obedience,
Serve and love Thee best of all.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu n pe wa, losan, loru
Laarin irumi aye
Lojojumo l’a n gbohun Re
Wipe, "Kristian, tele Mi."

Awon Apostili 'gbaani
Ni odo Galili ni
Won ko ile, ona, sile
Gbogbo won si n to leyin

Jesu n pe wa, kuro ninu
Ohun aye asan yii
Laarin afe aye, o n wi
Pe, "Kristian, e feran mi."

Laarin ayo at’ekun wa
Laarin laalaa oun ‘rorun
Tantan l'o n pe l’ohun rara
Pe, "Kristian e feran Mi."

Olugbala nip'aanu Re
Je ki a gbo ipe Re
F’eti 'gboran fun gbogbo wa
K’a fe O ju aye lo.

title_english: Christian! Seek not yet repose,
passage_english: BE YE THEREFORE SOBER, AND WATCH UNTO PRAYER. I PETER 4:7
passage_yoruba: E WA LAIREKOJA, E SI MAA SORA SII PELU ADURA. I PETERU 4:7
verses_english:
Christian! Seek not yet repose,
hear thy guardian Angel say,
thou art in the midst of foes,
Watch and pray.

Principalities and powers,
Must ring their unseen array,
Wait for thy unguarded hour,
Watch and pray.

Hear the victors who o’ercame,
Still they mark each warrior’s way,
All with ne consent exclaim,
Watch and pray.

Hear, above all, hear thy Lord,
Him thou lovest to obey,
Hide within thy heart His word;
Watch and pray.

Watch, as if on that alone,
Hung the issued of the day,
Pray, that help may be sent down,
Watch and pray.
verses_yoruba:
Kristian! Ma ti wa ‘sinmi,
Gbo b‘Angeli re ti n wi:
Ni aarin ota l’o wa,
Maa sora.

Ogun orun apadi,
T‘a ko ri n ko ‘ra won jo;
Won n so ijafara re,
Maa sora.

Awon t’o segun saju,
Won n wo wa b‘awa ti n ja;
Won n fi ohun kan wipe:
Maa sora.

Maa sora bi enipe
Nibe ni ‘segun re wa,
Gbadura fun ‘ranlowo,
Maa sora.

title_english: I am a stranger here,
passage_english: STRANGER IN A FOREIGN LAND. EXS 2:22
passage_yoruba: ALEJO NI ILE AJEJI. EKSODU 2:22
verses_english:
There at my Saviour's side?
Heaven is my home?
I shall be glorified,
Heaven is my Home;
There are the good and blest,
Those I love most and best;
And there I too shall rest,
Heaven is my Home.

Therefore, I murmur not,
Heaven is my Home,
Whate'er my earthly lot,
Heaven is my Home;
And I shall surely stand
There at my Lord's right Hand
Heaven is my Fatherland,
Heaven is my Home.
verses_yoruba:
Nihin mo j’ alejo,
Orun n’ ile.
Atipo ni mo n se,
Orun n’ ile.
Ewu oun banuje
Wa yi mi kaakiri;
Orun ni ilu mi,
Orun n’ ile.

B’ iji ba tile n ja,
Orun n’ ile:
Kukuru l’ ajo mi,
Orun n’ ile.
Iji lile ti n ja,
Fe rekoja lo naa;
Un o sa de ’le dandan,
Orun n’ ile.

Lodo Olugbala,
Orun n’ ile;
A o se mi logo,
Orun n’ ile.
Nib’ awon mimo wa,
Lehin ’rin- ajo won,
Ti n won ni ’sinmi won,
Nibe n’ ile.

N je n ki o kun, tori
Orun n’ ile:
Ohun t’ o wu ki n ri,
Orun n’ ile.
Un o sa duro dandan,
L’ otun Oluwa mi:
Orun ni ilu mi
Orun n’ ile.

title_english: Guide me, O thou great Jehovah,
passage_english: AND CONFESSED THAT THEY WERE STRANGERS AND PILGRIMS ON THE EARTH. HEB. 11:13
passage_yoruba: WON JEWO PE, ALEJO ATI ATIPO LI AWON LORI ILE AYE. HEB. 11:13
verses_yoruba:
Maa toju mi, Jehofa nla,
Ero l’aye osi yii
Emi ko n’okun, iwo ni
F’owo agbara di mi mu
Ounje orun, ounje orun,
Maa bo mi titi laelae.

Silekun isun ogo ni,
Orisun imarale
Je ki imole Re orun,
Se amona mi jale
Olugbala, Olugbala
S’agbara at’ asa mi

‘Gba mo ba te eba Jordan
F’okan eru mi bale
Iwo t’o ti segun iku,
Mu mi gunle Kenaan je,
Orin iyin, orin iyin,
L’emi o fun O titi.

title_english: Lead us, heavenly Father, lead us
title_yoruba: Maa to wa Baba wa orun
passage_english: THE ARK OF THE COVENANT OF THE LORD WENT BEFORE THEM. NUMBERS 10:33
passage_yoruba: APOTI ERI OLUWA SIWAJU WON. NUMERI 10:33
verses_english:
Saviour, by your grace restore us -
all our weaknesses are plain;
you have lived on earth before us,
you have felt our grief and pain:
tempted, taunted, yet undaunted,
from the depths you rose again.

Spirit of our God, forgive us,
fill our hearts with holy peace;
love with every passion blending,
pleasure that can never cease:
thus provided, pardoned, guided,
ever shall our joys increase.
verses_yoruba:
Maa to wa Baba wa orun
Laarin ‘daamu aye yii,
Pa wa mo k‘o si maa bo wa,
A ko n‘iranwo miran,
Sugbon gbogbo ‘bukun l‘a ni
B'Olorun je Baba wa

Olugbala, dariji wa,
Iwo sa m‘ailera wa,
‘Wo ti sin aye saju wa,
‘Wo ti mo ‘se inu re,
B’ en’ ikaanu at’alaare
L’o ti la ‘ginju yii ja.

Emi Olorun, darijiwa,
F‘ayo orun k‘okan wa,
K‘ife dapo mo iya wa
At‘adun ti ki su ni,
B‘a ba pese fun wa bayii,
Ki l’o le mi ‘sinmi wa?

title_english: Jesus still lead on
passage_english: WHO WENT IN THE WAY BEFORE YOU, TO SEARCH YOU OUT A PLACE TO PITCH YOUR TENTS IN, IN FIRE BY NIGHT. DEUT. 1:33
passage_yoruba: ENITI N LO LONA SAJU YIN, NINU INA LI ORU, LATI FI ONA HAN YIN, ATI NINU AWOSANMA LOSAN. DEUT. 1:33
verses_english:
If the way be drear,
If the foe be near,
Let no faithless fears overtake us,
Let not faith and hope forsake us;
Safely past the foe
To our home we go.

When we seek relief
From a long felt grief,
When temptations come alluring,
Make us patient and enduring;
Show us that bright shore
Where we weep no more.

Jesus, still lead on
Till our rest be won;
Heavenly leader, still direct us,
Still support, console, protect us,
Till we safely stand
In our fatherland.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, maa to wa,
Tit‘ ao fi sinmi;
Bi ona wa ko tile dan
A o tele O l‘aifoya.
F‘owo Re to wa,
S‘ilu Baba wa.

B‘ona ba lewu,
B‘ota sunmo wa,
Ma je k‘aigbagbo m‘eru wa,
Ki gbagbo oun ‘reti ma ye,
Tor‘aarin ota
L‘a n lo sile wa.

Gbat‘ a fe ‘tunu
Ninu ‘banuje,
Gbat‘ idanwo titun ba de
Oluwa fun wa ni suuru;
F’ ilu ni han wa
Ti ekun ko si.

Jesu, maa to wa;
Tit‘ ao fi sinmi
Amona orun, toju wa
Dabobo wa, tu wa ninu,
Titi ao fi de
Ilu Baba wa

title_english: Oft in danger, oft in woe,
passage_english: BE STRONG IN THE LORD, AND IN THE POWER OF HIS MIGHT. EPH. 6:10
passage_yoruba: JE ALAGBARA NINU OLUWA, ATI NINU AGBARA IPA RE. EFE. 6:10.
verses_english:
Oft in danger, oft in woe,
Onward, Christians, onward go;
Fight the fight, maintain the strife,
Strengthened with the Bread of Life.

Shrink not, Christians: will ye yield?
Will ye quit the painful field?
Will ye flee in danger's hour?
Know ye not your Captain's power?

Let not sorrow dim your eye,
Soon shall every tear be dry;
Let not fears your course impede,
Great your strength if great your need.

Onward then to glory move,
More than conquerors ye shall prove;
Though opposed by many a foe,
Christian soldiers, onward go.
verses_yoruba:
Larin ewu at‘osi,
Kristian, ma tesiwaju;
Roju duro, jija na,
K‘ounje ‘ye mu o lokun.

Kristian, mate siwaju,
Wa ka d‘oju ko ota;
E o ha beru ibi?
S‘e mo ‘yi Balogun yin?

Je ki okan yin ko yo,
Mu ‘hamora orun WO;
Ja, ma ro pe ogun npe,
Isegun yin fere de.

Maje k‘inu yin baje,
Oun y‘O n‘omije yin nu;
Mase je k‘eru ba yin,
B‘aini yin lagbara yin.

Nje e ma tesiwaju,
E o ju asegun lo;
B‘op‘ota doju ko yin,
Kristian, e tesiwaju.

title_english: Lord of our life and God of our salvation,
title_yoruba: Olorun emi wa, at’ igbala wa,
passage_english: OUR SOUL WAITS FOR THE LORD; HE IS OUR HELP AND OUR SHIELD. PSALMS 521
passage_yoruba: OKAN WA DURO DE OLUWA; OUN NI IRANLOWO WA ATI ASA WA. ORIN DAFIDI 33:20
verses_english:
Lord of our life and God of our salvation,
Star of our night and Hope of every nation:
Hear and receive Your Church's supplication,
Lord God Almighty.

See round Your ark the hungry billows curling;
See how Your foes their banners are unfurling.
And with great spite their fiery darts are hurling,
O Lord, preserve us.

Peace in our hearts, where sinful thoughts are raging,
Peace in Your Church, our troubled souls assuaging,
Peace when the world its endless war is waging,
Peace in Your heaven.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun emi wa, at’ igbala wa,
’Mole okunkun wa, ’reti ile wa,
Gbo, ki O si gba ebe Ijo Re yi,
Olodumare.

Wo bi ibinu ti yi Arki Re ka,
Wo b’ awon ota Re ti n t’ asia won,
Bi won si ti n ju oko oloro won,
’Wo le pa wa mo.

Ran wa lowo tit’ ota o pehinda,
Fun won l’ooto Re, ki a le dariji won,
K’a r’ alaafia laye, lehin ija wa,
Alaafia l’orun.

title_english: Strangers, pilgrims, sojourners
passage_english: CONFESSED THAT THEY WERE STRANGERS AND PILGRIMS ON THE EARTH. HEBREWS 11:13
passage_yoruba: WON SI JEWO PE, ALEJO ATI ATIPO LI AWON LORI ILE AYE. HEBERU 11:13
verses_english:
Strangers, pilgrims, sojourners
In this world, In this world!
We dwell in hunger and thirst,
There’s surfeit of this suffering,
In this world, In this world.

It is in the dark we walk
In this world, In this world!
All living being are blind,
Jesus, we pleas, be our light,
In this world, In this world.

All our hearts are full of filth,
In this world, In this world!
There’s surfeit of lovelessness,
And we dwell amongst sinners
In this world, In this world.

Indeed death is very near
In this world, In this world!
Every day we move around
Amidst danger and disease
In this world, In this world.

We are in the battle front
In this world, In this world
Satan our enemy’s strong,
Only Jesus can save us,
In this world In this world.

Weeping and regret are much
In this world, In this world
Its beauty is a shadow
True joy’s unattainable
In this world, In this world.

Lord, sustain us with your love
In this world, In this world
Save us from this world’s evil
Make us abide in your love
In this world, In this world.
verses_yoruba:
A! alejo at’ ero!
Laiye yii, Laiye yii!
L’ ebi at’ oungbe l’a wa,
Irora si po jojo,
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! l’okunkun l’awa n rin
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Oju eda gbogbo fo,
Jesu, joo se ’mole wa
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! egbin wa lokan wa,
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Irira okan wa po,
L’ agbo ese l’a si wa
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! iku ko jin si wa
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Laarin ewu at’ arun
L’a si n rin lojo gbogbo
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! loju ija l’a wa
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Esu ota wa n’ ipa,
Jesu l’o le gba wa la,
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! ekun, ose poju
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Ewa re, ojiji ni;
Pipe ayo ko si si
Laye yii, Laye yii.

A! Oluwa pa wa mo
Laye yii, Laye yii!
Yo wa n’nu buburu re;
F’ itegun Re s’aarin wa
Laye yii, Laye yii.

title_english: Why should I fear the darkest hour,
title_yoruba: Un o se foya ojo ibi?
passage_english: THE LORD IS ON MY SIDE; I WILL NOT FEAR. WHAT CAN MAN DO TO ME? PSALMS 118:6
passage_yoruba: OLUWA N BE FUN MI, E MI KI O BERU; KILI ENIYAN LE SE SI MI. ORIN DAFIDI 118:6
verses_english:
Why should I fear the darkest hour,
Or tremble at the tempter's power?
Jesus vouchsafes to be my tower.

Though hot the fight, why quit the field?
Why must I either flee or yield?
Since Jesus is my mighty shield?

Though sin would fill me with distress,
The throne of grace I dare address,
For Jesus is my righteousness.

Though faint my prayers and cold my love,
My steadfast hope shall not remove
While Jesus intercedes above.
verses_yoruba:
Un o se foya ojo ibi?
Tabi ki n maa beru ota?
Jesu paapaa ni odi mi.

title_english: Shepherd Christ Jesus will provide,
passage_english: THE LORD IS MY SHEPHERD; I SHALL NOT WANT. PASLMS 23:1
passage_yoruba: OLUWA LI OLUS’ AGUTAN MI, EMI KI YIO SE ALAINI. ORIN DAFIDI 23:1
verses_english:
Shepherd Christ Jesus will provide,
With green pastures He shall feed me;
His blessed hands shall profer help,
His eyes shall watch all over me,
At dawn shall follow me about,
And shall protect me through the dusk.

Whilst I was wandering all about
In all my wilderness journey,
To the peaceful plain, I He brought,
My feet He led to the pathway;
Beside the peaceful flowing stream,
In the midst of greener pastures.

E’en though I trod through the path way
In the dreadful valley of death,
I will never fear nor be fraught,
For thou art ever with me be;
Thine rod and staff shall aid me to
Trod the valley of death unhurt.

Aftermath weariness of strife,
Thou set a table before me;
Thine goodness and mercy I found,
Mine cup filleth, over runeth:
Heavenly hope offer me Thou,
My eternal mansion above.
verses_yoruba:
Nigbati mo n rare kiri
Ninu isina l’ aginju,
O mu mi wa si petele,
O fi ese mi le ona;
Nib’ odo tutu n san pele,
Laarin papa oko tutu.

Bi mo tile n rin koja lo
Ni afonifoji iku,
Emi ki o berukeru,
’Tori Iwo wa pelu mi;
Ogo at’ opa Re yoo mu
Mi la ojiji iku ja.

Lehin are ija lile,
’Wo te tabili kan fun mi;
Ire at’ aanu ni mo n ri,
Ago mi si n kun wo sile:
’Wo fun mi n’ ireti orun,
Ibugbe aiyeraiye mi.

title_english: Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
title_yoruba: E maa te siwaju, Kristian ologun
passage_english: FOR THE LORD THY GOD, HE IT IS THAT DOTH GO WITH THEE. DEUT. 31:6
passage_yoruba: NITORI OLUWA OLORUN RE, OUN NI N BA O LO. DEUT 31:6
verses_english:
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus going on before.
Christ, the royal Master, leads against the foe;
Forward into battle see His banners go!

Like a mighty army moves the Church of God;
Brothers, we are treading where the saints have trod.
We are not divided, all one body we,
One in hope and doctrine, one in charity.

Crowns and thrones may perish, kingdoms rise and wane,
But the church of Jesus constant will remain.
Gates of hell can never gainst that church prevail;
We have Christ’s own promise, and that cannot fail.

Onward then, ye people, join our happy throng,
Blend with ours your voices in the triumph song.
Glory, laud and honor unto Christ the King,
This through countless ages men and angels sing.
verses_yoruba:
E maa te siwaju, Kristian ologun
Maa tejumo mo Jesu t’o n be niwaju;
Kristi Oluwa wa ni Balogun wa
Wo! asia Re wa niwaju ogun.

Ni oruko Jesu ogun Esu sa,
N je Kristian Ologun, maa n so si segun;
Orun apadi mi ni hiho iyin
Ara gbohun yin ga, gb’orin yin soke.

Bi egbe ogun nla, n’ijo Olorun,
Ara, a n rin l’ona t’awon mimo n rin
A ko ya wa n’ipa, egbe kan ni wa
Okan n’ireti, l’eko, okan n’ife.

Ite at’ijoba, wonyii le parun,
Sugbon Ijo Jesu yoo wa titi lai,
Orun apadi ko le bor’ ijo yi
A n’ileri Kristi, eyIi ko le ye.

E maa ba ni kalo, eyin eniyan;
D’ohun yin po mo wa, l’orin isegun,
ogo, iyin, ola fun Kristi Oba
Eyii ni yoo maa je orin wa titi.
chorus_english:
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus going on before.
chorus_yoruba:
E maa te siwaju Kristain ologun
Sa tejumo, Jesu to n be niwaju.

title_english: Why those fears? Behold, 'tis Jesus
title_yoruba: Ese d’ eru? wo, Jesu ni!
passage_english: WHY ARE YOU FEARFUL. MATT 8:26.
passage_yoruba: EESE TI EYIN FI SOGO BEE? MATT 8:26
verses_english:
Why those fears? Behold, 'tis Jesus
Holds the helm and guides the ship:
Spread the sails, and catch the breezes
Sent to waft us through the deep;
To the regions
Where the mourners cease to weep.

Though the shore we hope to land on
Only by report is known,
Yet we freely all abandon,
Led by that report alone;
And with Jesus
Through the trackless deep move on.
verses_yoruba:
Ese d’ eru? wo, Jesu ni!
Oun tikare l’ o n t’oko;
E ta ’gbokun si afefe,
Ti yoo gbe wa la ibu,
Lo si ilu
’Bit’ olofo ye sokun.

B’ ayo wa o ti to lohun,
Iji ki ja de ibe:
Nibe l’ awon ti n sota wa
Ko le yo wa lenu mo:
Wahala pin
L’ ebute alaafia naa.

title_english: O for a closer walk with God,
passage_english: WHY ARE YE FEARFUL? MATTHEW 8:26
passage_yoruba: EESE TI EYIN FI SOJO BEE? MATT. 8:26
verses_english:
O for a closer walk with God,
a calm and heavenly frame,
a light to shine upon the road
that leads me to the Lamb!

Where is the blessedness I knew
when first I saw the Lord?
Where is the soul-refreshing view
of Jesus and his word?

What peaceful hours I once enjoyed!
How sweet their memory still!
But they have left an aching void
The world can never fill.

Return, O holy Dove, return,
sweet messenger of rest;
I hate the sins that made thee mourn,
and drove thee from my breast.

The dearest idol I have known,
whate'er that idol be,
help me to tear it from thy throne,
and worship only thee.

So shall my walk be close with God,
calm and serene my frame;
so purer light shall mark the road
that leads me to the Lamb.
verses_yoruba:
Emi ‘ba le f’ iwa pele,
Ba Olorun mi rin;
Ki n ni imole ti n to mi,
Sodo Odagutan!

Ibukun ti mo ni ha da
‘Gba mo ko mo Jesu?
Itura okan naa ha da
T’oro Kristi fun mi.

Alaafia mi nigbanna,
‘Ranti re ti dun to!
Sugbon won ti f’aaro sile,
Ti aye ko le di.

Pada, Emi mimo, pada
Ojise itunu,
Mo ko ese t’o bi o n’nu
T’o le O l’okan mi.

O sa ti mo ‘fe rekoja
Ohun t’o wu k’o je,
Ba mi yoo kuro lokan mi
Ki n le sin ‘Wo nikan.

Beyii ni un o b’Olorun rin
Ara o ro mi woo;
‘Mole orun yoo ma to mi,
S’odo Odagutan.

title_english: O Holy Saviour, Friend unseen,
passage_english: WHO IS THIS THAT COMETH UP FROM THE WILDERNESS, LEANING UPON HER BELOVED? SONG OF SOLOMON
passage_yoruba: TANI EYII TI N GOKE LATI AGINJU WA, TI O FI ARA TI OLUFE RE? ORIN SOLOMON 8:5
verses_english:
O Holy Saviour, Friend unseen,
The faint, the weak on Thee may lean:
Help me, throughout life's varying scene,
By faith to cling to Thee.

Blest with communion so divine,
Take what Thou wilt, shall I repine,
When, as the branches to the vine,
My soul may cling to Thee?

Far from her home, fatigued, opprest,
Here she has found a place of rest;
An exile still, yet not unblest,
While she can cling to Thee.

What though the world deceitful prove,
And earthly friends and joys remove,
With patient uncomplaining love,
Still would I cling to Thee.

Oft when I seem to tread alone
Some barren waste with thorns o'ergrown,
A Voice of love in gentlest tone
Whispers, `Still cling to Me.`

Though faith and hope awhile be tried,
I ask not, need not, aught beside;
How safe, how calm, how satisfied,
The souls that cling to Thee!

They fear not life's rough storms to brave,
Since Thou art near and strong to save;
Nor shudder e'en at death's dark wave,
Because they cling to Thee.

Blest is my lot whate'er befall:
What can disturb me, who appal,
While, as my strength, my rock, my all,
Saviour, I cling to Thee?
verses_yoruba:
Jesu mimo, Ore airi,
Oluranlowo alaini,
N‘nu ayida aye ko mi
K‘emi le romo O.

Ki n sa n‘idapo mimo yii,
Gba ohun t‘O fe un o kun bi?
B‘okan mi, b‘eka ajara
Ba sa le romo O.

Aare ti m’okan mi pupo
Sugbon o wa r‘ibi isinmi;
Ibukun si de s‘okan mi
T’ori t‘o ro mo O.

B‘aye d‘ofo mo mi l‘oju,
B’a gba ore at‘ara lo,
Ni suuru ati laibohun
L‘emi o ro mo O.

‘Gbat‘o k‘emi nikansoso,
L’aarin idaamu aye yii,
Mo gb‘Ohun ife jeje naa
Wipe, ‘Sa ro mo Mi.

B‘aare ba fe mu igbagbo,
T‘ireti ba si fe saki,
Ko si ewu fun okan naa,
Ti o ba ro mo O.

Won ko beru ‘rumi aye
Nitori ‘Wo wa nitosi;
Won o si gbon b‘iku ba de
‘Tori won ro mo O.

Ire sa ni l‘ohun gbogbo,
Wo agbara at’asa mi
Olugbala, ki yoo si nkan,
Bi n ba ti ro mo O.

title_english: Best of the weary, joy of the sad;
passage_english: A MAN WILL BE AS A HIDING PLACE FROM THE WIND, AND A COVER FROM THE TEMPEST. ISAIAH 32:2
passage_yoruba: ENIKAN YIO SI JE BI IBI ILUMO KURO LOWO EFUUFU, ATI AABO KURO LOWO IJI. ISAIAH 32:2
verses_english:
When my feet stumble, I'll to Thee cry;
Crown of the humble, Cross of the high:
When my steps wander, Over me bend,
