Truer and fonder, SavioUr and Friend.

Ever confessing Thee, I will raise
Unto Thee blessing, Glory and praise
All my endeavour, World without end,
Thine to be ever, Saviour and Friend.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Oba, ayo alaare,
Itunu onirobinuje;
Ile alejo, agbara lae,
Ibi isadi, Olugbala.

Bi mo kose, em’ o kepe O,
Iwo ti s’ ade onirele;
Bi mo sako, fi ona han mi,
Olugbala at’ Ore tooto.

Un o jewo oore Re, un o korin
Ibukun, ogo, iyin si O;
Gbogbo ’pa mi tit’ aye yoo je
Tire Olugbala, Ore mi.

title_english: Brightly gleams our banner, pointing to the sky,
title_yoruba: Didan l‘opagun wa, o n toka s‘orun!
passage_english: LEAD ME INTO THE LAND OF UPRIGHTNESS. PSLAM 143:10
passage_yoruba: FA MI LO SI ILE IDUROSINSIN. ORIN DAFIDI 143:10
verses_english:
Brightly gleams our banner, pointing to the sky,
Waving on Christ's soldiers to their home on high
Marching through the desert, gladly thus we pray,
Still with hearts united singing on our way.

Jesus, Lord and Master, at Thy sacred feet,
Here, with hearts rejoicing, see Thy children meet.
Often have we left Thee, often gone astray;
Keep us, mighty Saviour, in the narrow way

Then with saints and angels may we join above,
Offering prayers and praises at Thy throne of love,
When the march is over, Then come rest and peace,
Jesus in His beauty, songs that never cease.
verses_yoruba:
Didan l‘opagun wa, o n toka s‘orun!
O n fona han ogun, sile won orun!
Laarin aginju l’a n rin, L‘ayo l’a ngbadua
Pel‘okan isokan l‘a m‘on‘ orun pon.

Jesu Oluwa wa, l‘ese mimo Re
Pelu okan ayo l‘Omo Re pade,
A ti fi O sile, a si ti sako,
To wa Olugbala, si ona tooro.

To wa l‘ojo gbogbo, l‘ona t‘awa n to,
Mu wa n so s‘isegun l‘ori ota wa;
K‘Angeli Re s‘asa wa ‘gb‘oj‘orun su
Dariji, si gba wa lakoko iku.

K’a le pelu awon Angeli loke,
Lati jumo maa yin n‘ite ife Re:
‘Gbat‘ ajo wa ba pin, isinmi yoo de;
At‘alaafia, at‘orin ailopin.
chorus_english:
Onward, Christian soldiers, marching as to war,
With the cross of Jesus going on before.
chorus_yoruba:
Didan l‘opagun wa, O n toka s‘orun,
O n fonahan ogun, si ile won t‘orun.

title_english: Whither, pilgrims, are you going,
title_yoruba: Eyin ero, nibo l'e n lo
passage_english: COME THOU WITH US, AND WE WILL DO THEE GOOD. NUM. 10:29
passage_yoruba: IWO BA WA KA LO, AWA O SI SE O NI IRE. NUM 10:29.
verses_english:
Whither, pilgrims, are you going,
Going each with staff in hand?
We are going on a journey,
Going at the King's command,
Over hills and plains and valleys,
We are going to His palace,
We are going to His palace,
Going to the better land;
We are going to His palace,
Going to the better land

Tell us, pilgrims, what you hope for
In that far-off, better land?
Spotless robes, and crowns of glory,
From a Saviour's loving hand,
We shall drink of life's clear river,
We shall dwell with God for ever,
We shall dwell with God for ever,
In that bright, that better land,
We shall dwell with God for ever,
In that bright, that better land

Doth ye not fear the way ye trod
O ye little pilgrim band?
The Friend unseen goeth with us
Angels doth surround us still
Jesus Christ our Lord doth guide us,
He shall watch us, He shall lead us,
He shall watch us, He shall lead us,
On this holy pilgrimage,
He shall watch us, He shall lead us,
On this holy pilgrimage

Pilgrims, may we travel with you
To that bright and better land?
Come and welcome, come and welcome
Welcome to our pilgrim band.
Come, oh, come! and do not leave us;
Christ is waiting to receive us,
Christ is waiting to receive us,
In that bright, that better land,
Christ is waiting to receive us,
In that bright, that better land.
verses_yoruba:
Eyin ero, nibo l'e n lo
T' eyin t' opa lowo yin?
A n rin ajo mimo kan lo,
Nipa ase Oba wa,
Lori oke oun petele,
A n lo s' aafin Oba rere,
A n lo s' aafin Oba rere,
A n lo s' ile t' o dara,
A n lo s' aafin Oba rere,
A n lo s' ile t' o dara.

Eyin ero, e so fun ni,
Ti ‘reti ti eyin ni?
Aso mimo, ade ogo
Ni Jesu yoo fi fun wa;
Omi iye l' a o maa mu;
A o ba Olorun wa gbe,
A o ba Olorun wa gbe,
N' ile mimo didara
A o ba Olorun wa gbe,
N' ile mimo didara.

E ko beru ona t'e n rin,
Eyin ero kekere?
Ore airi n pelu wa lo,
Awon Angeli yi wa ka,
Jesu Kristi l' amona wa;
Yoo maa so wa, yoo maa to wa,
Yoo maa so wa, yoo maa to wa,
Ninu ona ajo wa;
Yoo maa so wa, yoo maa to wa,
Ninu ona ajo wa.

Ero, a le ba yin kegbe,
L' ona ajo s' ile naa?
Wa maa kalo, wa maa kalo,
Wa si egbe ero wa,
Wa, e ma se fi wa sile,
Jesu n duro, O n reti wa,
Jesu n duro, O n reti wa,
N' ile mimo t' o dara;
Jesu n duro, O n reti wa,
N' ile mimo t'o dara.

title_english: Ho, my comrades, see the signal,
title_yoruba: Ha! Egbe mi, e w’ asia
passage_english: BUT THAT WHICH YE HAVE ALREADY HOLD FAST TILL I COME. REV. 2:25
passage_yoruba: ?UGBON EYI TI ENYIN NI, E DI I MU SINSIN TITI EMI O FI DE. IFIHAN 2:15.
verses_english:
Ho, my comrades, see the signal,
Waving in the sky!
Reinforcements now appearing,
Victory is nigh.

See the mighty host advancing,
Satan leading on;
Mighty ones around us falling,
Courage almost gone!

See the glorious banner waving!
Hear the trumpet blow!
In our Leader’s Name we triumph
Over every foe.

Fierce and long the battle rages,
But our help is near;
Onward comes our great Commander,
Cheer, my comrades, cheer!
verses_yoruba:
Ha! Egbe mi, e w’ asia
Bi ti nfe lele!
Ogun ‘Jesu fere de na,
A fere segun!

Wo opo ogun ti n bo wa,
Esu n ko won bo;
Awon alagbara n subu,
A fe damu tan.

Ogun ngbo’na girigiri,
Iranwo wa n bo;
Balogun wa n bo wa tete
Egbe tujuka.
chorus_english:
“Hold the fort, for I am coming,
Jesus signals still;
Wave the answer back to Heaven,
By Thy grace we will.”
chorus_yoruba:
D’odi mu, Emi fere de
Beeni Jesu n wi,
Ran ‘dahun pada s’ orun pe,
Awa o di mu!

title_english: We’ve no abiding city here:
passage_english: FOR HERE WE HAVE NO CONTINUING CITY, BUT WE SEEK THE ONE TO COME. HEBREWS 13:14
passage_yoruba: AWA KO NI ILU TI O DURO PE NIHINYI, AWA N WA OKAN TI N BO. HEBERU 13:14
verses_english:
We’ve no abiding city here:
This may distress the worldling’s mind,
But should not cost the saint a tear,
Who hopes a better rest to find.

We’ve no abiding city here:
Sad truth, were this to be our home,
But let this thought our spirits cheer;
We seek a city yet to come.

O sweet abode of peace and love,
Where pilgrims freed from toil are blest;
Had I the pinions of the dove,
I'd flee to thee and be at rest.

But hush, my soul, nor dare repine;
The time my God appoints is best:
While here, to do His will be mine,
And His to fix my time of rest.
verses_yoruba:
A ko ni ’bugbe kan nihin,
O buru b’ ihin je ’le wa;
K’ iro yii mu inu wa dun,
Awa n wa ilu nla t’ o n bo.

Iwo ti n se ’bugbe ife,
Ibiti ero gbe n sinmi;
Emi ba n’ iye b’ adaba,
N ba fo sinu re, n ba sinmi.

Dake okan mi, ma binu,
Akoko Oluwa l’ o ye;
T’ emi ni lati se ’fe Re,
Tire, lati se mi l’ ogo.

title_english: Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
passage_english: THAT YE MAY BE ABLE TO WITHSTAND IN THE EVIL DAY. EPH 6:13
passage_yoruba: KI ENYIN KI O LE DURO TIRI SI OJO IBI, EFESU 6:13
verses_english:
Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
Ye soldiers of the cross;
Lift high His royal banner,
It must not suffer loss.
From victory unto victory
His army shall He lead,
Till every foe is vanquished,
And Christ is Lord indeed.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
The trumpet call obey;
Forth to the mighty conflict,
In this His glorious day.
Ye that are brave now serve Him
Against unnumbered foes;
Let courage rise with danger,
And strength to strength oppose.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
Stand in His strength alone;
The arm of flesh will fail you,
Ye dare not trust your own.
Put on the Gospel armor,
Each piece put on with prayer;
Where duty calls or danger,
Be never wanting there.

Stand up, stand up for Jesus,
The strife will not be long;
This day the noise of battle,
The next the victor’s song.
To him who overcometh
A crown of life shall be;
They with the King of Glory
Shall reign eternally.
verses_yoruba:
Duro, duro fun Jesu,
Eyin om’ogun Krist:
Gbe asia Re soke
A ko gbodo fe ku;
Lat’ isegun de ’segun
Ni yoo to ogun Re;
Tit’a o segun gbogb’ota,
Ti Krist yoo j’Oluwa.

Duro, duro fun Jesu
F’eti s’ohun ipe
Jade lo s’oju ija
L’oni ojo nla Re:
Enyin akin ti n ja fun
Laarin ainiye ota,
N’nu ewu eni ‘gboya
E koju ‘ja s’ ota.

Duro, duro fun Jesu,
Duro l’agbara Re
Ipa eniyan ko to
Ma gbekele tire:
Di’ hamora ‘hinrere
Maa sona, maa gbadura
B’ise tab’ ewu ba pe
Ma se alai de ’be.

Duro, duro fun Jesu
Ija naa ki yoo pe;
Oni, ariwo ogun,
Ola, orin ’segun,
Eni to ba si segun,
Yoo gba ade iye
Yoo ma ba Oba Ogo
Joba titi lailai

title_english: Soldiers of Christ, arise,
passage_english: BE STRONG IN THE LORD, AND IN THE POWER OF HIS MIGHT. EPHS. 6:10
passage_yoruba: E JE ALAGBARA NINU OLUWA ATI NINU IPA AGBARA RE. EFESU 6:10
verses_english:
Soldiers of Christ, arise,
And put your armour on,
Strong in the strength which God supplies
Through His eternal Son.

Strong in the Lord of Hosts,
And in His mighty power,
Who in the strength of Jesus trusts
Is more than conqueror.

Stand then in His great might,
With all His strength endued;
But take, to arm you for the fight,
The panoply of God.

From strength to strength go on,
Wrestle, and fight, and pray;
Tread all the powers of darkness down,
And win the well-fought day.

That having all things done,
And all your conflicts passed,
Ye may o'ercome through Christ alone,
And stand entire at last.
verses_yoruba:
Om’Ogun Krist, dide,
Mu hamora yin wo;
Mu ‘pa t’Olorun fi fun yin,
Nipa ti Omo Re.

Gbe ‘pa Olorun wo,
T‘Oluwa om‘ ogun,
Enit‘o gbekele Jesu,
O ju asegun lo.

Ninu ipa Re nla,
Oun ni ki e duro,
Tori k‘e ba le jija naa,
E di hamora yin.

Lo lat‘ ipa de ‘pa
Maa ja, maa gbadura;
Te agbara okunkun ba,
E ja, k‘e si segun.

Leyin ohun gbogbo,
Leyin gbogbo ija,
K‘e le segun n‘ipa Kristi
K‘e si duro sinsin.

title_english: The Son of God goes forth to war,
passage_english: AND THE ARMIES WHICH WERE IN HEAVEN FOLLOWED HIM. REVELATION 19:14
passage_yoruba: AWON OGUN ORUN SI N TO O LEYIN. IFIHAN 19:14
verses_english:
Who best can drink his cup of woe,
Triumphant over pain,
Who patient bears his cross below,
He follows in His train.

The martyr first, whose eagle eye
Could pierce beyond the grave,
Who shaw his Master in the sky,
And called on Him to save;

Like Him, with pardon on his tongue
In midst of mortal pain,
He prayed for them that did him wrong:
Who follows in his train?

A glorious band, the chosen few
On whom the Spirit came,
Twelve valiant saints, their hope they knew,
And mocked the cross and flame;

They met the tyrant's brandished steel,
The lion's gory mane,
They bowed their necks the death to feel:
Who follows in their train?

A noble army, men and boys,
The matron and the maid,
Around the Saviour's throne rejoice,
In robes of light arrayed;

They climbed the steep ascent of heaven,
Through peril, toil and pain:
O God, to us may grace be given
To follow in their train.
verses_yoruba:
Omo Olorun n lo s‘ogun,
Lati gb‘ade Oba;
Opagun Re si n fe lele.
Tal’o s‘om‘ ogun Re?

Enit‘o le mu ago naa,
T‘o le bori ‘rora,
T‘o le gbe agbelebu Re,
Oun ni Om‘ ogun Re

Martir ikinni t’o ko ku,
T‘o r‘orun si sile;
T‘o ri Oluwa Re loke,
T‘o pe k‘o gba oun la.

T’oun ti idariji l’enu
Ninu ‘rora iku,
O bebe f‘awon t’o n pa lo,
Tani le se bi Re?

Won f‘aya ran ida ota,
Won ba eranko ja,
Won f‘orun won lele fun‘ku
Tani le se bi won?

Egbe ogun t‘agba t‘ewe,
T‘okunrin t‘obinrin
Won y‘ite Olugbala ka.
Won wo aso funfun.

Won de oke orun giga,
N‘nu ‘se at’iponju:
Olorun fun wa l‘agbara
Ki a le se bi won.

title_english: My God and Father, while I stray
title_yoruba: Baba mi, ‘gba n ba n sako lo
passage_english: IF THIS CUP CANNOT PASS AWAY FROM ME UNLESS I DRINK IT, YOUR WILL BE DONE.” MATT 26:42
passage_yoruba: BI AAGO YII KO BA LE RE MI KOJA, BIKOSE MO MU UN; IFE TIRE NI KA SE. MATT 26:42
verses_english:
My God and Father, while I stray
Far from my home, on life’s rough way,
Oh teach me from my heart to say,
Thy will be done.

Though dark my path and sad my lot,
Let me “be still,” and murmur not,
Or breathe the prayer divinely taught,
Thy will be done.

What though in lonely grief I sigh,
For friends beloved no longer nigh,
Submissive still would I reply,
Thy will be done.

If but my fainting heart be blest
With Thy sweet Spirit for its guest,
My God, to Thee I leave the rest--
Thy will be done.

Renew my will from day to day,
Blend it with Thine, and take away
All now that makes it hard to say,
Thy will be done.

Then when on earth I breathe no more
The prayer oft mix’d with tears before,
I’ll sing upon a happier shore,
Thy will be done.
verses_yoruba:
Baba mi, ‘gba n ba n sako lo
Kuro l’ ona Re l’ aye yii;
Ko mi ki n le wi bayii pe,
Se ‘fe Tire.

B’ ipin mi l’ aye ba buru,
Ko mi ki n gba, ki n mase kun!
Ki n gbadura t’ o ko mi, wipe,
Se ‘fe Tire.

B’ o ku emi ni kansoso,
Ti ara oun ore ko si;
Ni’ teriba un o maa wipe,
Se ‘fe Tire.

B’ o fe gba ohun owo mi,
Ohun t’ o se owon fun mi;
Un o fi fun O, se Tire ni?
Se ‘fe Tire.

Sa fi Emi Re tu mi n’nu,
Ki Oun k’ o si maa ba mi gbe;
Eyii t’ o ku, o d’ owo Re.
Se ‘fe Tire.

Tun ‘fe mi se lojoojumo
K’ O si mu ohun naa kuro,
Ti ko je k’ emi le wipe,
Se ‘fe Tire.

‘Gbat’ emi mi ba pin l’ aiye,
N’ ilu t’ o dara ju aiye,
L’ emi o maa korin naa titi.
Se ‘fe Tire.

title_english: Through the night of doubt and sorrow,
passage_english: SO THE RANSOMED OF THE LORD SHALL RETURN, AND COME TO ZION WITH SINGING. ISAIAH 51:11
passage_yoruba: AWON ENI IRAPADA OLUWA YIO PADA, WON O SI WASI SIONI TI AWON TI ORIN. ISAIAH 51:11
verses_english:
Through the night of doubt and sorrow,
Onward goes the pilgrim band,
Singing songs of expectation,
Marching to the promised land.

Clear before us through the darkness
Gleams and burns the guiding light:
Trusting God we march together
Stepping fearless through the night.

One the light of God's own presence,
O'er his ransomed people shed,
Chasing far the gloom and terror,
Brightening all the path we tread:

One the object of our journey,
One the faith which never tires,
One the earnest looking forward,
One the hope our God inspires.

One the strain the lips of thousands
Lift as from the heart of one;
One the conflict, one the peril,
One the march in God begun:

One the gladness of rejoicing
On the far eternal shore,
Where the one almighty Father
Reigns in love for evermore.

Onward, therefore, pilgrim brothers,
Onward with the cross our aid;
Bear its shame, and fight its battle,
Till we rest beneath its shade.

Soon shall come the great awaking,
Soon the rending of the tomb;
Then the scattering of all shadows,
And the end of toil and gloom.
verses_yoruba:
Ninu oru ibanuje
L’ awon egbe ero n rin;
Won n korin ’reti at’ ayo,
Won n lo sile ileri.

Niwaju wa nin’ okunkun,
Ni imole didan n tan;
Awon arakonrin n sate,
Won n rin lo li aifoya.

Okan ni imole orun,
Ti n tan s’ ara eniyan Re;
Ti n le gbogbo eru jinna,
Ti n tan yi ona wa ka.

Okan ni iro ajo wa,
Okan ni igbagbo wa;
Okan l’ Eni t’ a gbekele,
Okan ni ireti wa.

Okan l’ orin t’ egberun n ko,
Bi lati okan kan wa;
Okan n’ ija, okan l’ ewu,
Okan ni irin orun.

Okan ni inu didun wa,
L’ ebute ainipekun;
Nibiti Baba wa orun,
Yoo ma joba titi lai.

N je k’ a maa n so, arakunrin,
T’ awa ti agbelebu:
E je k’ a ru u, k’ a si jiya,
Tit’ a o fi ri ’sinmi.

Ajinde nla fere de na,
Boji fere si sile;
Gbogbo okun yoo si tuka,
Gbogbo laalaa yoo si tan.

title_english: Ye servants of the Lord,
passage_english: “LET YOUR WAIST BE GIRDED AND YOUR LAMPS BURNING. LUKE 12:35
passage_yoruba: E DI AMURE YIN KI INA YIN KI O MAA TUN TAN. LUKU 12:35
verses_english:
Ye servants of the Lord,
Each in his office wait,
Observant of his heavenly word,
And watchful at his gate.

Let all your lamps be bright,
And trim the golden flame:
Gird up your loins, as in his sight,
For awful is his name.

Watch; 'tis your Lord's command,
And while we speak, he's near;
Mark the first signal of his hand,
And ready all appear.

O happy servant he,
In such a posture found!
He shall his Lord with rapture see,
And be with honor crowned.

Christ shall the banquet spread
With his own royal hand,
And raise that favored servant's head
Amid the angelic band.
verses_yoruba:
Iranse Oluwa!
E duro nid’ ise;
E toju oro mimo Re,
E maa sona Re sa.

Je k’ imole yin tan,
E tun fitila se;
E damure girigiri,
Oruko Re l’ eru.

Sora! l’ ase Jesu,
B’a ti n so, ko jinna;
B’o ba kuku ti kan ’lekun,
Ki e si fun un logan.

Iranse ’re l’ eni
Ti a ba nipo yii;
Ayo l’ oun o fi r’ Oluwa,
Yoo f’ ola de e l’ ade.

Kristi tikalare
Yoo te tabili fun un,
Yoo gb’ ori iranse naa ga
Laarin egbe Angel.

title_english: Jesus, I rest in Thee,
passage_english: TAKE MY YOKE UPON YOU …… AND YOU WILL FIND REST FOR YOUR SOULS. MATT 11:29
passage_yoruba: E GBA AJAGA MI SORUN YIN ……. EYIN O SI ISINMI FUN OKAN YIN. MATT 11:29
verses_english:
Jesus, I rest in Thee,
In Thee myself I hide;
Laden with guilt and misery,
Where can I rest beside?
'Tis on thy meek and lowly breast
My weary soul alone can rest.

Thou Holy One of God!
The Father rests in thee,
And in the savour of that blood
Which speaks to him for me:
The curse is gone – in thee I'm blessed;
God rests in thee – in thee I rest.

The slave of sin and fear,
Thy truth my bondage broke;
My happy spirit loves to wear
Thy light and easy yoke:
Thy love, which fills my grateful breast,
Makes duty joy, and labour rest.

Soon the bright, glorious day,
The Rest of God shall come;
Sorrow and sin shall pass away,
And I shall reach my home:
Then, of the promised land possessed,
My soul shall know eternal rest.
verses_yoruba:
Mo sinmi le Jesu,
’Wo ni mo gbekele,
Mo kun fun ese at’ osi,
Tani n ba tun to lo?
Li ookan aya Re nikan
L’ okan aare mi sinmi le.

Iwo Eni Mimo!
Baba sinmi n’nu Re;
Eje etutu ti O ta,
L’o si n bebe fun mi:
Egun tan, mo d’ alabukun:
Mo sinmi ninu Baba mi.

Eru ese ni mi!
’Wo l’o da mi n’ ide;
Okan mi si fe lati gba
Ajaga Re s’ orun:
Ife Re t’o gba aya mi,
So ’se ati laalaa d’ ayo.

Opin fere de na,
Isinmi orun n bo;
Ese at’ irora yoo tan,
Emi o si de ’le:
Un o jogun ile ileri,
Okan mi o sinmi laelae.

title_english: Take my life, and let it be
passage_english: BUT AS FOR ME AND MY HOUSE, WE WILL SERVE THE LORD. JOSHUA 24:15
passage_yoruba: SUGBON BI O SE TI EMI ATI ILE MI NI, OLUWA LI AWA O MA SIN. JOSUA 24:15
verses_english:
Take my life, and let it be
Consecrated, Lord, to Thee,
Take my moments and my days;
Let them flow in ceaseless praise.

Take my hands, and let them move
At the impulse of Thy love,
Take my feet, and let them be
Swift and beautiful for Thee.

Take my voice, and let me sing
Always, only, for my King,
Take my lips, and let them be
Filled with messages from Thee,

Take my silver and my gold;
Not a mite would I withhold.
Take my intellect, and use
Every power as Thou shalt choose.

Take my love, my Lord,
I pour at Thy feet its treasure store.
Take myself, and I will be ever,
Only, all for Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Gba aiye mi oluwa,
Mo ya si mimo fun O
Gba gbogbo akoko mi
Ki won kun fin iyin Re.

Gba owo mi, k’O si je
Ki n maa lo fun ife Re;
Gba ese mi, k’O si je
Ki won maa sare fun O

Gba ohun mi, je ki n maa
Korin f’Oba mi titi;
Gba ete mi, je ki wom
maa jise fun O titi.

Gba wura, fadaka mi
Oun kan n ki o da duro;
Gba ogbon mi, k’o si loo
Gege bi O ba ti fe.

Gba ’feran mi, Oluwa
Mo fi gbogbo re fun O
Gb’emi paapaa; lat’ oni
Ki ‘n’ je, Tire titi lai.

title_english: Trusting in the Lord thy God,
passage_english: FORGETTING THOSE THINGS WHICH ARE BEHIND, AND REACHING FORTH UNTO THOSE THINGS WHICH ARE BEFORE. PHILIPPIANS 3:13
passage_yoruba: EMI N GBAGBE NKAN WONNI TI O WA LEYIN, MO SI N NAGA WO NKAN WONNI TI O WA NIWAJU. FILLIP 3:13
verses_english:
Trusting in the Lord thy God,
Onward go! onward go!
Holding fast His promised word,
Onward go!
Ne'er deny His worthy name,
Though it bring reproach and shame;
Spreading still His wondrous fame,
Onward go!

Has He given thee golden grain?
Onward go! Onward go!
Sow, and thou shalt reap again;
Onward go!
To thy Master's gate repair
Watching be and waiting there;
He will hear and answer prayer:
Onward go!

Has he said the end is near?
Onward go! Onward go!
Serving Him with holy fear,
Onward go!
Christ thy portion, Christ thy stay,
Heavenly bread upon the way;
Leading on to glorious day:
Onward go!
verses_yoruba:
Gbekele Olorun re
K‘o ma n so! K‘o ma n so!
D‘ileri Re mu sinsin,
K‘o ma n so!
Mase se oruko Re,
B‘o tile mu egan wa,
Maa tan ihin Re kale,
Si ma n so.

O ti pe o s‘ise Re?
Sa ma n so! Sa ma n so!
Oru n bo wa,'mura sinsin!
Sa ma n so!
Sin n‘ife at‘igbagbo;
Gbekele agbara Re,
Fi ori ti de opin,
Sa ma n so.

O ti fun o ni ‘rugbin?
Sa ma n so! Sa ma n so!
Maa gbin ‘wo o tun kore!
Sa ma n so;
Maa sora, si maa reti
L‘enu ona Oluwa;
Yoo dahun adura re,
Sa ma n so!

O ti wipe opin n bo?
Sa ma n so! Sa ma n so!
N je fi eru mimo sin in!
Sa ma n so!
Kristi l‘atileyin re,
Oun naa si ni ounje re,
Yoo sin o de 'nu ogo,
Sa ma n so.

Ni akoko die yii;
Sa ma n so! Sa ma n so!
Jewo Re ni ona re
Sa ma n so!
Ka ri okan Re n‘nu re,
K‘ife Re je ayo re,
L‘ojo aye re gbogbo
Si ma n so!

title_english: Work, for the night is coming, work through the morning hours;
title_yoruba: Sise tori oru n bo! sise li owuro
passage_english: THE NIGHT COMETH, WHEN NO MAN CAN WORK. JOHN 9:4
passage_yoruba: ORU MBO WÁ NIGBATI ENIKAN KÌ O LE SE ISE. JOHANU 9:4
verses_yoruba:
Sise tori oru n bo! sise li owuro
Sise nigbat’ iri nse, sise n’nu tanna’;
Sise ki osan to pon, sise nigb’ oorun n ran
Sise ‘tori oru nbo! gba ‘se o pari.

Sise tori oru n bo! sise losan gangan
F’ akoko rere fun ‘se, isinmi daju;
F’ olukuluku igba ni, nkan lati pamo,
Sise ‘tori oru n bo! gba ‘se o pari.

Sise ‘tori oru n bo! Oorun fere won a,
Sise ‘gbat’ imole wa; ojo bu lo tan,
Sise titi de opin, sise titi d’ale
Sise ‘gbat’ ile ba nsu, gba ‘se o pari.

title_english: To the work! To the work! We are servants of God,
title_yoruba: A o sise! A o sise! Om’ Olorun ni wa,
passage_english: I COME QUICKLY. REVELATION 22:12
passage_yoruba: EMI N BO NISISIYI ..... IFIHAN 22:12
verses_english:
To the work! To the work! We are servants of God,
Let us follow the path that our Master has trod;
With the balm of His counsel our strength to renew,
Let us do with our might what our hands find to do.

To the work! To the work! In the strength of the Lord,
And a robe and a crown shall our labor reward,
When the home of the faithful our dwelling shall be,
And we shout with the ransomed, "Salvation is free!"
verses_yoruba:
A o sise! A o sise! Om’ Olorun ni wa,
Je k’ a tele ipa ti Oluwa wa to,
K’ a f’ imoran Re so agbara wa dotun,
K’ a fi gbogbo okun wa sise ta o se.

A o sise! A o sise! bo awon t’ ebi npa,
Ko awon alaare lo s’ orisun iye!
Ninu agbelebu l’ awa o maa sogo,
‘Gbat’ a ba n kede pe, “Ofe n’ Igbala”.

A o sise! A o sise! Gbogbo wa ni yoo se
Ijoba okunkun at’ iro yio fo,
A o si gbe oruko Jehofa leke,
N’ nu orin iyin wa pe, “Ofe n’ igbala”.

A o sise! A o sise! Lagbara Oluwa,
Agbada at’ ade yoo si je ere wa,
‘Gbat’ ile awon olooto ba di tiwa,
Gbogbo wa o jo ho pe, “Ofe n’ Igbala”.
chorus_english:
Toiling on, toiling on,
Toiling on, toiling on,
Let us hope, let us watch,
And labor till the Master comes.
chorus_yoruba:
Foriti! Foriti!!
Maa reti, maa sona
Titi Oluwa o fi de

title_english: Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
title_yoruba: Yo awon ti n segbe, sajo eni n ku,
passage_english: PREACH THE GOSPEL TO EVERY CREATURE. MARK 16:15
passage_yoruba: WASU IHINRERE FUN GBOGBO EDA. MARK 16:15
verses_english:
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Snatch them in pity from sin and the grave;
Weep o’er the erring one, lift up the fallen,
Tell them of Jesus, the mighty to save.
verses_yoruba:
Yo awon ti n segbe, sajo eni n ku,
F’aanu ja won kuro ninu ese,
Ke f’awon ti n sina, gb’ eni subu ro,
So fun won pe, Jesu le gba won la.

Bi won o tile gan, sibe O n duro
Lati gb’ omo t’o ronupiwada;
Saf’ itara ro won, si ro won jeeje.
Oun o dariji, bi won je gbagbo.
chorus_english:
Rescue the perishing, care for the dying,
Jesus is merciful, Jesus will save.
chorus_yoruba:
Yo awon ti n segbe, sajo eni n ku,
Alaanu ni Jesu, yio gbala.

title_english: Weary heart, there is a home,
title_yoruba: Okan aare, ile kan n be,
passage_english: BUT HE THAT SHALL ENDURE UNTO THE END, THE SAME SHALL BE SAVED. MATT 24:13
passage_yoruba: ENITI O BA FORITI I TITI FI DE OPIN, OUN NAA LI A O GBALA. MATT 24:13.
verses_english:
Weary heart, there is a home,
Beyond the reach of toil and care;
A home where changes never come:
Who would not fain be resting there?

If in thy path some thorns are found,
Oh, think who bore them on His brow;
If grief thy sorrowing heart has found,
It reached a holier than thou.

Toil on! Nor deem, though sore it be,
One sigh unheard, one prayer forgot;
The day of rest will dawn for thee:
Wait, meekly wait, and murmur not!
verses_yoruba:
Okan aare, ile kan n be,
L’ona jinjin s'aye ise,
Ile t'ayida ko le de,
Tani ko fe sinmi nibe.

Bi wahala ba o mole,
B’ipin re laye ba buru,
W'oke s'ile ibukun naa,
Sa roju, duro mase kun.

Bi egun ba wa lona re,
Ranti ori t'a f'egun de,
B’ibanuje bo okan re,
O ti ri bee f'Olugbala.

Maa sise lo, mase ro pe
A ko gb'adura edun re,
Ojo isinmi n bo kankan,
Sa roju duro, mase kun.
chorus_english:
Oh wait, meekly wait, and murmur not! (2x)
Oh wait, oh wait, oh wait, and murmur not!
chorus_yoruba:
Duro roju duro mase kun (2ce)
Duro, duro, sa roju duro mase kun!

title_english: Thy life was given for me;
passage_english: BUT FIRST GAVE THEIR OWN SELVES TO THE LORD. II CORINTHIAN 8:5
passage_yoruba: WON FI AWON TIKARA WON FU OLUWA. II KORINTI. 8:5
verses_english:
Long years were spent for me,
in weariness and woe,
that through eternity
thy glory I might know.
Long years were spent for me;
have I spent one for thee?

Thy Father's home of light,
thy rainbow-circled throne,
were left for earthly night,
for wanderings sad and lone.
Yea, all was left for me;
have I left aught for thee?

Thou, Lord, hast borne for me
more than my tongue can tell
of bitterest agony,
to rescue me from hell.
Thou sufferedst all for me;
what have I borne for thee?

And thou hast brought to me,
down from thy home above,
salvation full and free,
thy pardon and thy love.
Great gifts thou broughtest me;
what have I brought to thee?

O let my life be given,
my years for thee be spent,
world fetters all be riven,
and joy with suffering blent!
Thou gavest thyself for me;
I give myself to thee.
verses_yoruba:
Mo f’ara Mi fun,
Mo ku nitori re,
Ki n le ra o pada,
K’o le jinde n‘n‘ oku,
Mo f’ara mi fun o,
Kinni ‘wo se fun mi?

Mo f‘ojo aye Mi,
Se wahala fun o;
Ki iwo ba le mo
Adun ayeraye,
Mo l‘opo ‘dun fun O,
O lo ‘kan fun Mi bi?

Ile ti Baba mi
At‘ite ogo Mi
Mo fi sile w‘aye
Mo d‘alarinkiri
O f’ ile tori mi,
Ki l’o f’ile fun mi?

Mo jiya po fun o,
Ti enu ko le so
Mo jijakadi nla
‘Tori igbala re,
Mo jiya po fun o,
O le jiya fun Mi?

Mo mu igbala nla
Lat‘ile Baba Mi,
Wa lati fi fun o,
Ati idariji;
Mo m‘ebun wa fun o,
Kil‘ o mu wa fun mi?

Fi ara mi fun Mi,
Fi aye mi sin Mi.
Diju si nkan t’aye,
Si wo ohun t‘orun,
Mo f‘ara Mi fun O,
Si f’ara re fun Mi.

title_english: Take up thy cross, the Saviour said,
passage_english: AND HE SAID TO THEM ALL, IF ANY MAN WILL COME AFTER ME, LET HIM DENY HIMSELF, AND TAKE UP HIS CROSS DAILY, AND FOLLOW ME. LUKE 9:23
passage_yoruba: BI ENIKAN BA NFE LATI MAA TO MI LEHIN KI O SE ARA RE, KI O SI GBE AGBELEBU RE LOJO GBOGBO, KI O SI MAA TO MI LEHIN. LUKU 9:23
verses_english:
Take up thy cross, the Saviour said,
If thou wouldst My disciple be;
Deny thyself, the world forsake,
And humbly follow after Me.

Take up thy cross; let not its weight
Fill thy weak spirit with alarm;
My strength shall bear thy spirit up,
And brace thy heart, and nerve thine arm.

Take up thy cross, nor heed the shame,
Nor let thy foolish pride rebel;
Thy Lord for thee the Cross endured,
To save thy soul from death and hell.

Take up thy cross then in His strength,
And camly every danger brave;
'Twill guide thee to a better home,
And lead to victory o'er the grave.

Take up thy cross, and follow Christ,
Nor think till death to lay it down;
For only he who bears the cross
May hope to wear the glorious crown.

To thee, Great Lord, the One in Three,
All praise for evermore ascend;
O grant us in our Hope to see
The Heavenly life that knows no end
verses_yoruba:
Gb‘agbelebu re ni Krist‘ wi
B‘o ba fe s‘omo eyin Mi;
Se ‘ra re, ko aye sile,
Si ma fi ‘rele tele Mi.

Gb‘agbelebu re, ma je ki
Iwuwo re fo o laya,
Ipa Re y‘ogb‘emi rero,
Y‘o m‘okan at‘apa re le.

Gb‘agbelebu re matiju,
Ma je k‘okan were re ko;
Oluwa ru agbelebu
Lati gba o l‘owo iku.

Gb‘agbelebu re, ma tele,
Mase gbe sile tit‘iku
Eni t‘O ru agbelebu
L‘o le reti lati d‘ade.

‘Wo Olorun, Metalokan,
L’a o ma yin titi aye;
Fun wa, k‘awa le ri n‘ile
Ayo orun ti ko lopin.

title_english: Shine Thou upon us, Lord,
passage_english: I WILL BE WITH THY MOUTH, AND TEACH THEE WHAT THOU SHALT SAY. EXODUS 4:12.
passage_yoruba: EMI O SI SI PELU ENU RE, EMI O SI KO O LI EYITI IWO O WI. EKSODU. 4:12
verses_english:
Shine Thou upon us, Lord,
True light of men, today,
And through the written Word
Thy very self display,
That so from hearts which burn
With gazing on Thy face
Thy little ones may learn
The wonders of Thy grace.

Breathe Thou upon us, Lord,
Thy Spirit’s living flame,
That so with one accord
Our lips may tell Thy name.
Give Thou the hearing ear,
Fix Thou the wandering thought,
That those we teach may hear
The great things Thou hast wrought.

Speak Thou for us, O Lord,
In all we say of Thee;
According to Thy Word
Let all our teaching be,
That so Thy lambs may know
Their own true Shepherd’s voice,
Where’er He leads them go,
And in His love rejoice.

Live Thou within us, Lord,
Thy mind and will be ours;
Be Thou beloved, adored,
And served with all our powers,
That so our lives may teach
Thy children what Thou art,
And plead, by more than speech,
For Thee with every heart.
verses_yoruba:
Tan ‘mole Re si wa
Loni yi, Oluwa
Fi ara Re han wa
N‘nu oro mimo Re:
Jo m‘okan wa gbona,
Ka maa wo oju Re
K‘awon ‘mode le ko
Iyanu oore Re

Mi si wa, Oluwa
Ina emi mimo;
K’a le fi okan kan
Gbe oruko Re ga;
Joo fi eti igbo,
At‘okan ironu,
Fun awon ti a nko
L‘ohun nla t‘O ti se.

Gbe ‘nu wa Oluwa,
K‘ife Re je tiwa;
Iwo nikan lao fi
Ipa wa gbogbo sin;
K‘iwa wa je eko,
Fun awon omo Re,
K’o si maa kede Re
Ninu gbogbo okan.

title_english: Come, labor on!
passage_english: GO WORK TO DAY IN MY VINEYARD. MATT. 21:28
passage_yoruba: “LO SISE LONI L’OGBA AJARA MI”. MATT. 21:28
verses_english:
Come, labor on!
Who dares stand idle, on the harvest plain
While all around him waves the golden grain?
And to each servant does the Master say,
Go work today.

Come, labor on!
Claim the high calling angels cannot share—
To young and old the Gospel gladness bear;
Redeem the time; its hours too swiftly fly.
The night draws nigh.

Come, labor on!
The enemy is watching night and day,
To sow the tares, to snatch the seed away;
While we in sleep our duty have forgot, He slumbered not.

Come, labor on!
Away with gloomy doubts and faithless fear!
No arm so weak but may do service here:
By feeblest agents may our God fulfill
His righteous will.

Come, labor on!
No time for rest, till glows the western sky,
Till the long shadows o’er our pathway lie,
And a glad sound comes with the setting sun,
Well done, well done!
verses_yoruba:
Wa maa sise!
Tani gbodo s’ ole ninu oko,
‘Gbati gbogbo eniyan n kore jo,
Kaluku ni Baba pase fun pe,
“Sise loni”.

Wa maa sise!
Gba ‘pe giga ti angeli ko ni,
Mu ‘hinrere to t’ agba t’ ewe lo,
Ra ‘gba pada, wawa l’ akoko nlo,
Ile su tan.

Wa maa sise!
Oko po, alagbase ko si to,
Aye n’ibi titun gba, a nip o ‘ro,
Ohun ona jijin, at’ itosi,
N kigbe pe; “Wa”.

Wa maa sise!
Le ‘yemeji oun aigbagbo jina,
K’ o s’ alailera ti ko le se nkan,
Ailera l’ Olorun a maa lo ju,
Fun ‘se nla Re.

Wa maa sise!
‘Sinmi ko si nigbati ise osan,
Titi oorun yoo fi wo l’ ale,
Ti awa o si gbo ohun ni pe,
“O seun, omo?”.

Wa ma sise!
Laalaa naa dun ere re si daju,
‘Bukun f’ awon t’ o f’ ori ti d’ opin,
Ayo won, ‘simi won yoo tipo to!
“Lod’ Oluwa”.

title_english: O Saviour, may we never rest
passage_english: ARE CHANGED INTO THE SAME IMAGE FROM GLORY TO GLORY. II CORINTHIANS 3:18
passage_yoruba: A N PA WA DA SI AWORAN KAN NAA LATI OGO DE OGO II KORINTIA. 3:18
verses_english:
O Saviour, may we never rest
Till Thou art formed within,
Till Thou hast calmed our troubled breast,
And crushed the power of sin.

O may we gaze upon Thy Cross,
Until the wondrous sight
Makes earthly treasures seem but dross,
And earthly sorrows light.

Until, released from carnal ties,
Our spirit upward springs,
And sees true peace above the skies,
True joy in heavenly things.

There as we gaze, may we become
United, Lord, to Thee,
And, in a fairer, happier home,
Thy perfect beauty see.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu mase je k‘a simi
Titi’ O fi d‘okan wa;
T‘O fun wa ni ‘bale aya,
T‘O wo ite ese.

A ba le wo agbelebu,
Titi iran nla naa
Yoo so ohun aye d‘ofo,
T‘y'o mu ‘banuje tan.

Tit’ okan wa yio goke,
T‘ao bo lowo ara;
T‘ao fi r‘alaafia pipe,
Ati ayo orun.

Bi a si ti n tejumo O,
K‘a d‘okan pelu Re;
K‘a si ri pipe ewa Re
N‘ile ayo l‘oke.

title_english: Lord, speak to me, that I may speak
title_yoruba: Ko mi Oluwa, bi a ti
passage_english: MY FELLOW WORKERS IN CHRIST JESUS. ROMANS 16:3
passage_yoruba: AWON OLURANLOWO NINU KRISTI JESU. ROMU 16:3
verses_english:
Lord, speak to me, that I may speak
In living echoes of Thy tone;
As Thou hast sought, so let me seek
Thy erring children lost and lone.

O lead me, Lord, that I may lead
The wandering and the wavering feet;
O feed me, Lord, that I may feed
Thy hungering ones with manna sweet.

O strengthen me, that while I stand
Firm on the rock, and strong in Thee,
I may stretch out a loving hand
To wrestlers with the troubled sea.

O teach me, Lord, that I may teach
The precious things Thou dost impart;
And wing my words, that they may reach
The hidden depths of many a heart.

O give Thine own sweet rest to me,
That I may speak with soothing power
A word in season, as from Thee
To weary ones in needful hour.

O fill me with Thy fulness, Lord,
Until my very heart o’erflow
In kindling thought and glowing word,
Thy love to tell, Thy praise to show.

O use me, Lord, use even me,
Just as Thou wilt, and when, and where,
Until Thy blessed face I see,
Thy rest, Thy joy, Thy glory share!
verses_yoruba:
Ko mi Oluwa, bi a ti
Je gbohungbohun oro Re;
B’ o ti wa mi, je k’ emi wa
Awon omo Re t’ o ti nu.

To mi Oluwa, ki n le to
Awon asako si ona;
Bo mi Oluwa, ki n le fi
Manna Re b’ awon t’ ebi n pa.

Fun mi l’ agbara; fi ese
Mi mule lori apata;
Ki n le na owo igbala
S’ awon t’ o n ri sinu ese.

Ko mi Oluwa, ki n le fi
Eko rere Re k’ elomi;
F’ iye f’ oro mi, ko le fo
De ikoko gbogbo okan.

F’ isiNmi ’didun Re fun mi,
Ki n le mo, b’o ti ye lati
Fi pelepele s’oro Re
Fun awon ti aare ti mu.

Jesu, fi ekun Re,
Fi kun mi li opolopo;
Ki ero ati oro mi
Kun fun ife at’ iyin Re.

Lo mi, Oluwa, an’ emi,
Bi o ti fe, nigbakugba;
Titi em’ o fi r’ oju Re
Ti un o pin ninu ogo Re.

title_english: Sow in the morn thy seed,
passage_english: BLESSED ARE YOU WHO SOW BESIDE ALL WATERS. ISAIAH 32:20
passage_yoruba: ALABUKUN FUN NI EYIN TI NFONRUGBIN NIHA OMI GBOGBO. ISAIAH 32:20
verses_english:
Sow in the morn thy seed,
At eve hold not thy hand;
To doubt and fear give thou no heed,
Broadcast it o’er the land.

Thou know’st not which may thrive,
The late or early sown;
God keeps His precious seed alive,
When and wherever thrown.

And duly shall appear,
In verdure, beauty, strength,
The tender blade, the stalk, the ear,
And the full corn at length.

Thou canst not toil in vain;
Cold, heat, and moist, and dry,
Shall foster and mature the grain
For garners in the sky.

Thence, when the glorious end,
The day of God is come,
The angels reapers shall descend,
And Heav’n cry, “Harvest Home.”
verses_yoruba:
Funrugbin lowuro,
Ma sinmi tit’ ale;
F’ eru oun ’yemeji sile,
Maa fun sibi- gbogbo.

’Wo ko mo ’yi ti n hu,
T’ ooro tabi t’ ale:
Oore- ofe yio pa mo,
’Bit’ o wu k’o bo si.

Yio si hu jade
L’ ewa tutu yoyo,
Beeni yoo si dagba soke,
Yoo s’ eso nikehin.

’Wo k’ yoo sise lasan!
Ojo, iri, oorun,
Yio jumo se ise po
Fun ikore orun.

N je nikehin ojo,
Nigbat’ opin ba de,
Awon Angel’ yoo si wa ko
Ikore lo sile.

title_english: God of all wisdom and goodness
passage_english: TRAIN UP A CHILD IN THE WAY HE SHOULD GO. PROVERBS 22:6
passage_yoruba: TO OMODE L’ONA TI YIO TO. IWE OWE 22:6.
verses_english:
God of all wisdom and goodness
Give us Thy light and truth
To show the strait and narrow way
And our footsteps to guide.

When in danger to be our guide
And on the rocky steep;
To pilot our ship safely through
Until we reach the shore.

And as we grow more in Thy grace,
To teach them as Thy word;
Help us to teach all our children
According to Thy ways.

In time, destroy their vain desire
The lust and pride of life,
Help to teach them the holy way
To their Saviour and Lord.

We want to look up and follow
Thy good example, Lord
Channel their hope and fear to Thee,
Their thoughts to be renewed.

We want to woo them to have faith
And show their zeal for Thee;
Grant that we teach not peevishly
Rather, teach them with love.

In faith we ask for this from Thee
E'en wisdom from above;
Grant them a childish fear in Thee
And with a perfect love.

Help us to guide their bent to evil
Away from all dangers,
That we may gently bend their hearts
And draw them close to Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun ogbon at‘ore,
Tan ‘mole at’ooto,
Lati f’ona tooro han wa,
Lati to ‘sise wa.

Lati to ‘pa wa n’nu ewu
Li aarin apata;
Lati maa rin lo laarin won,
K’a m’oko wa gunle.

B’ oore-ofe Re ti n mu wa je
Ka ko won b’ eko Re,
A wa lati to omo wa
Ni gbogbo ona Re.

Li akoko, pa ife won,
Oun ‘gberaga won run,
K‘a fi ona mimo han won,
Si Olugbala won.

A fe woke nigbakugba
K’a to apere Re;
K’a ru ‘beru, oun ‘reti won,
K’a tun ero won se.

A fe ro won lati gbagbo
Ki won f’itara han;
Ki a mase lo ikanra,
Gbat’a ba le lo ‘fe.

Eyii l‘o f’igbagbo bere,
Ogbon t’o t‘ oke wa!
K’a f’eru omo s’aya won,
Pelu ife mimo.

K‘a so’fe won ti n te s’ibi
Kuro l’ona ewu;
K‘a fi pele te okan won
K’a fa won t’ Olorun.

title_english: I and all those of my household
passage_english: BUT AS FOR ME AND MY HOUSE, WE WILL SERVE THE LORD. JOSHUA 24:15
passage_yoruba: BI O SE TEMI ATI ILE MI, OLUWA L’AWA O MAA SIN. JOSUA. 24:15.
verses_english:
I and all those of my household
Will worship and serve the Lord God,
But I even I will
By my words and by my actions
Show that I know the God of heav'n
And serve Him truthfully.

I will create good example
And remove every obstacle
From the way of my ward;
By my life, show them their duty
Yet, in my duty, to obtain
Honour that comes through love.

I'll be easily entreated
And in wrath remember mercy,
The Lord's true disciple;
I also want to be holy
And bring my household and loved ones
Into the narrow way.

When Thou has put the flame of love
Within this chosen vessel's heart
Receive it to Thyself;
Lord, do Thy goodwill within me,
Help to show by my life how each
Bible Christian should live.

Grant to me, dear Lord, Thy good grace;
Behold, I come to testify
Of Thy wonderful name
That saved my soul from perdition
And the grace that is felt within
Of which each tongue can speak.

I who have been set free from sin
Desire my household to be saved;
I would tell of pardon
To my child, my wife and servants
To make them walk in the good way
To a holy heaven.
verses_yoruba:
Emi at‘ ara ile mi,
Yio maa sin Oluwa wa
Sugbon emi paapaa
Yio f’iwa at‘oro han,
Pe mo mo Oluwa t‘orun,
Mo n fokan tooto sin in.

Em’o f‘apere ‘re le ‘le;
Un o mu idena naa kuro
Lodo om‘ odo mi
Un o f‘ise won han n ‘iwa mi
Sibe n‘nu ‘se mi ki n si ni
Ola naa ti ife.

Emi ki yoo soro gb‘ipe
Emi ki yoo pe tu ninu
Om‘eyin Olorun
Mo si fe je eni mimo
Ki n si fa gbogbo ile mi
S’oju ona orun.

Jesu, b‘O ba da ‘na fe naa
Ohun elo t‘Iwo fe lo,
Gba s‘owo ara Re
Sise ife rere n‘nu mi
Ki n fi b‘onigbagbo tooto
Ti n gbe laye han won.

Fun mi l‘oore-ofe tooto
N je! Emi de lati jeri
‘Yanu oruko Re
Ti o gba mi l’owo egbe
Ire eyii t‘a mo l‘okan
Ti gbogb‘ ahon le so.

Emi t‘o bo lowo ese,
Mo wa lati gba‘le mi la
Ki n waasu ‘dariji:
F‘omo, f’aya f’omo ‘do mi
Lati mu won to‘na rere
Lo si orun mimo.

title_english: Come ye yourselves apart and rest awhile,
title_yoruba: E wa s’apakan, k’e sinmi die,
passage_english: “COME ASIDE BY YOURSELVES TO A DESERTED PLACE AND REST A WHILE.” MARK 6:31
passage_yoruba: E WA EYIN TIKARA YIN SI IBI IJU LI APAKAN, KI EYIN KI O SINMI DIE. MARKU 6:31
verses_english:
Come ye yourselves apart and rest awhile,
Weary, I know it, of the press and throng;
Wipe from your brow the sweat and dust of toil,
And in my quiet strength again be strong.

Come ye aside from all the world holds dear,
For converse which the world has ever known,
Alone with me and with my Father here,
With me and with my Father, not alone.

Come, tell me all that ye have said and done,
Your victories and failures, hopes and fears.
I know how hardly souls are wooed and won:
My choicest wreaths are always wet with tears.

Come ye and rest: the journey is too great,
And ye will faint beside the way and sink;
The Bread of life is here for you to eat,
And here for you the Wine of love to drink.

Then, fresh from converse with your Lord, return
And work till daylight softens into even:
The brief hours are not lost in which ye learn
More of your Master and his rest in heaven.
verses_yoruba:
E wa s’apakan, k’e sinmi die,
Mo mo aare ati wahala nyin,
E nu oogun oju yin nu kuro,
K’e tun gb’ agbara n’nu agbara Mi.

E takete s’ ohun adun aye,
E wa fun idapo t’aye ko mo,
E nikan wa lodo Mi oun Baba,
Lodo Mi oun Baba egbe yin kun.

E wa so gbogb’ ohun t’e se fun mi,
So t’isegun ati t’isubu yin,
Mo mo b’ ise emi ti soro to,
Ade t’o dara t’oun t’omije ni.

E wa sinmi; ajo naa jin pupo,
Aare o mu yin, e o ku l’ona;
Ounje iye wa nihin, e wa je,
Nihin l’omi iye wa, e wa mu.

Jade l’otun lat’ odo Oluwa,
E pada lo sise titi sule:
E ko padanu wakati t’e lo
F’eko mi si, at’ isinmi orun.

title_english: O where shall rest be found,
passage_english: LET US LABOUR THEREFORE TO ENTER INTO THAT REST. HEBREWS 4:11
passage_yoruba: E JEKI A SE LAALAA LATI WO INU ISINMI NAA. HEBERU 4:11
verses_english:
O where shall rest be found,
Rest for the weary soul?
’Twere vain the ocean’s depths to sound,
Or pierce to either pole.

The world can never give
The bliss for which we sigh;
’Tis not the whole of life to live,
Nor all of death to die.

Beyond this vale of tears,
There is a life above,
Unmeasured by the flight of years,
And all that life is love.

There is a death, whose pang
Outlasts the fleeting breath:
O what eternal horrors hang
Around the second death!

Lord God of truth and grace,
Teach us that death to shun;
Lest we be banished from Thy face,
And evermore undone.

Here would we end our quest:
Alone are found in Thee,
The life of perfect love the rest
Of immortality.
verses_yoruba:
Nibo n‘isinmi wa
‘Sinmi f’ okan aare?
Lasan l‘a wa s‘opin okun,
Ati s‘ opin ile.

Aye ko le fun ni
N‘isinmi ti a n fe;
K‘a le pe titi laye ko!
K‘a si tete ku ko!

Aye kan m be loke
T‘o jinna s‘ aiye yii,
Won ko n siro odun nibe;
Ife ni aye naa!

Iku n be, apa re
Kawo eemi wa yii;
B‘ irora kikoro ti to
Ninu iku keji!

Olorun, joo ko wa
K‘a sa fun iku yii;
K‘a ma ba le wa lodo Re,
K‘a si segbe laelae.

Nihin l‘ebe wa mo!
Aye ife pipe,
Ati isinmi ailopin
Wa ninu Re nikan.

title_english: Yet there is room: the Lamb’s bright hall of song,
passage_english: AND THE SERVANT SAID, LORD, IT IS DONE AS THOU HAST COMMANDED, AND YET THERE IS ROOM. LUK. 14:22
passage_yoruba: A SE BI O TI WI TAN, AAYE SI N BE NILE SIBE LUK 14:22
verses_english:
Yet there is room: still open stands the gate,
The gate of love; it is not yet too late:
Room, room, still room! O enter, enter now.
verses_yoruba:
“Aye si n be!” ile Od’agutan
Ewa ogo re n pe o pe “Maa bo”
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyii.

Ojo lo tan, orun si fere wo
Okunkun de tan, ‘mole n koja lo
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyii.

Ile iyawo na kun fun ase!
Wole, wole to oko ‘yawo lo
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyii.

Aye si mbe ilekun si sile
Ilekun ife, iwo ko pe ju
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi

Wole, Wole! tire ni ase naa,
Wa gb’ebun ‘fe ayeraye lofe!
Wole, wole wole nisisiyi.

Kiki ayo l’o wa nibe, wole !
Awon angeli npe o fun ade
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi.

L’ohun rara n’ipe ife na ndun !
Wa ma jafara, wole, ase na !
Wole, wole, wole nisisiyi.

nkun ! o nkun ! ile ayo na nkun
Yara ! mase pe ko kun ju fun O !
Wole,wole,wole nisisiyi.

K’ile to su, ilekun na le ti
‘Gbana o k’abamo ! “Ose! Ose!”
Ose! Ose! ko s’aye mo Ose!.

title_english: Days are quickly fleeting by
title_yoruba: Ojo n sure, o n koja;
passage_english: SEEK YE THE LORD WHILE HE MAY BE FOUND, CALL YE UPON HIM WHILE HE IS NEAR. ISAIAH 55:6
passage_yoruba: E WA OLUWA NIGBATI E LE RI I, E PEE NIGBATI O WA NITOSI. ISAIAH 55:6
verses_english:
Days are quickly fleeting by
Death hurries close near at hand,
Sinner, still in mockery yet
Death stares you full in the face.

Life is fleeting, when it ends
You will ne'er come back again
You go to eternity
Is it not meet that you think?

God hears and He answers prayer,
Pray before your life is o'er
Wait not for His judgement throne
Till mercy's o'er; vengeance falls.

Prepare quickly death is near
If you linger, you'll perish
Wake up, arise and hurry
The Saviour's expecting you
verses_yoruba:
Olorun n gbo, gbadura,
Ki igba re to koja;
K‘ Ite ‘dajo Re to de,
K‘ aanu to tan k‘ esan de.

title_english: What means this eager, anxious throng,
passage_english: JESUS OF NAZARETH PASSETH BY. LUKE 18:37
passage_yoruba: JESU TI NASARETI LI O N KOJA LO. LUK 18:37
verses_english:
What means this eager, anxious throng,
Which moves with busy haste along,
These wondrous gatherings day by day,
What means this strange commotion, pray?
ln accents hushed the throng reply,
"Jesus of Nazareth passeth by!".

Who is this Jesus? why should he
The city move so mightily?
A passing stranger, has he skill
To charm the multitude at will?
Again the stirring tongues reply,
"Jesus of Nazareth passeth by! ".

Jesus! 'tis he who once below
Mans pathway trod, 'mid pain and woe,
And burdened ones where'er he came
Brought out their sick and deaf and lame;
The blind rejoiced to hear the cry,
"Jesus of of Nazareth passeth by".

But if you still his call refuse
And all his wondrous love abuse,
Soon will he sadly from you turn,
Your bitter prayer for pardon spurn;
"Too late, too late!" will be your cry,
Jesus of Nazareth has passed by.
verses_yoruba:
Eredi irokeke yii
Ti eniyan ti n wo koja?
L‘Jojumo n‘iwojopo naa,
Eredi re, ti won n se bee?
Won dahun lohun jeje Pe (2ce)
‘Jesu ti Nasareti l‘O n koja. (2ce)

Tani Jesu? Eese ti Oun
Fi n mi gbogbo ilu bayii?
Ajeji Ologbon n bi?
Ta gbogb‘ eniyan n to leyin?
Won dahun lohun jeje pe (2ce)
‘Jesu ti Nasaret‘ l‘O n koja. (2ce)

Jesu Oun naa l‘O ti koja
Ona irora wa laye
‘Bikibi t‘Oun ba de, won nko
Orisi arun wa ‘do Re
Afoju yo, b‘o ti gbo pe; (2ce)
‘Jesu ti Nasaret‘ l‘O n koja. (2ce)

Oun si tun de! nibikibi
Ni awa si n ri ‘pase Re,
O n rekoja lojude wa
O wole lati ba wa gbe,
Ko ha ye k‘a f’ayo ke pee (2ce)
‘Jesu ti Nasaret‘ l‘O n koja.)2ce

Ha! e wa eyin t‘orun n wo!
Gba ‘dariji at‘ itunu,
Eyin ti e ti sako lo
Pada gba or‘ofe Baba,
Eyin t‘a n danwo, aabo n mbe (2ce)
‘Jesu ti Nasaret‘ l‘O n koja (2ce).

title_english: When tempatations round me about,
passage_english: WHERE ART THOU? GENESIS 3:9
passage_yoruba: NIBO NI IWO WA? GENESISI. 3:9.
verses_english:
When tempatations round me about,
And world problems encompass me,
When the foe appear as a friend
To seek after my destruction

When satan tends to deceive me,
To world’s highest hill then llift me,
With his commande to bow for Him,
That I may posses all world’s lusts.

When glorious of the worlds tend to,
Force me to go against Thy laws,
When behind me stood against me,
With promise that, all will be well.

When all my expectation fails,
And idol and strange gods follow,
When incantations be my song,
And spells became my morning prayer.

When in my will, I love to walk,
In heretic love of my heart,
And when my heart moves here and there,
When neither cold nor hot I am.

When I am lost like the bush dog,
Who fails to hear the hunter’s call,
When hope to return failure be,
Then in sins I wallow always.

When there is no sympathizers,
And comforters far’ way from me,
When sorrows like storm covers me,
And bow my head in repentance.
verses_yoruba:
Nigbat‘ Esu n‘nu ‘tanje re,
Gbe mi gori oke aye,
T‘o ni ki n teriba fun on,
K‘ohun aye le je temi.

Gbat‘ ogo aye ba fe fi,
Tulasi mu mi rufin Re,
T‘o duro gangan lehin mi:
Ni ileri pe “ko si nkan”.

Nigbati igbekele mi,
Di t‘oogun ati t‘orisa,
T‘ogede di adura mi,
Ti ofo di ajisa mi.

Nigbati mo fe lati rin,
L‘adamo at‘ife ‘nu mi,
T‘okan mi nse hilahilo,
Ti nko gbona ti nko tutu.

Nigba mo sonu bi aja,
Laigbo ifere ode mo,
Ti n ko nireti ipada,
Ti mo n pa fo ninu ese.
chorus_english:
O Lord call upon me to come,
As thou in garden call’d Adam,
Saying, where art thou o sinner,
That I may from the fault be free.
chorus_yoruba:
Oluwa joo, ma s‘aipemi,
B’o ti pe Adam nin‘ogba,
Pe, “Nibo lo wa” elese?
Ki n le bo ninu ebi naa.

title_english: Tomorrow, Lord, is Thine
passage_english: BUT EXHORT ONE ANOTHER DAILY, WHILE IT IS CALLED TO DAY. HEBREWS 3:13
passage_yoruba: E MAA GBA ARA YIN NIYANJU LOJOJUMO, NIGBATI A N PE LONI. HEBERU 3:13
verses_english:
Tomorrow, Lord, is Thine
Lodged in Thy sovereign hand;
And if its sun arise and shine,
It shines by Thy command.

The present moment flies,
And bears our life away;
O make Thy servants truly wise,
That they may live today.

Since on this wingèd hour
Eternity is hung,
Waken, by Thine almighty power,
The agèd and the young.

One thing demands our care,
O be it still pursued;
Lest, slighted once, the season fair
Should never be renewed.

To Jesus may we fly
Swift as the morning light,
Lest life’s young golden beam should die
In sudden, endless night.
verses_yoruba:
Tire l‘ola Baba,
O wa n‘ikawo Re;
B‘ojum‘ Ola si mo ba ni,
Nipa ase Re ni.

Akoko yi n fo lo,
O n gbe emi wa lo,
Oluwa, mu ‘ranse Re gbon,
Ki won le wa fun O.

Akoko t’o n lo yii,
L‘ayeraye ro mo;
Fi agbara Re Oluwa,
Ji agba at‘ewe.

Je k’a sa to Jesu,
K‘a si sure tete;
K‘emi wa ma baa ku, k‘o ri
S‘ookun biribiri.

title_english: Come and drink, all ye thirsty souls,
title_yoruba: E yin t‘ oungbe ngbe, e wa mu
passage_english: HO, EVERY ONE THAT THIRSTETH, COME YE TO THE WATERS. ISAIAH 55:1
passage_yoruba: GBOGBO ENITI OUNGBE N GBE E WA SIBI OMI. ISAIAH 55:1
verses_english:
Come and drink, all ye thirsty souls,
Water of life freely,
Fetch water of life without price
From Jesus the Fountain.

Behold how long you've been drinking
From the broken cisterns,
Wasting all your labour and sweat
On things that will perish.

Jesus tells us that His treasures
Lasts through enternity
Health that endures, He gives to those
Who hear Him and obey.
verses_yoruba:
E yin t‘ oungbe ngbe, e wa mu
Omi iye ti n san;
Lati orisun ti Jesu
Laisanwo l ‘awa n buu.

Woo! b‘o ti pe to t‘e ti n mu
Ninu kanga eke
T‘e n l‘agbara at‘ogun yin
Ninu n kan t‘o n segbe.

Jesu wipe, isura Mi,
Ko lopin titi lae
Yio f’ilera laelae fun
Awon t‘o gbo Tire.

title_english: The Spirit in our hearts
passage_english: AND THE SPIRIT AND THE BRIDE SAY, “COME!” REVELATION 22:17
passage_yoruba: EMI ATI IYAWO WIPE, MA ABO WA. IFIHAN 22:17
verses_english:
The Spirit in our hearts
Is whispering, “Sinner, come”;
The Bride, the Church of Christ, proclaims
To all His children, “Come.”

Let him that heareth say
To all about him, “Come”;
Let him that thirsts for righteousness
To Christ the Fountain come.

Yes, whosoever will
O let him freely come,
And freely drink the stream of life;
’Tis Jesus bids him come.

Lo, Jesus Who invites,
Declares, “I quickly come.”
Lord, even so; I wait Thy hour:
Jesus, my Savior, come.
verses_yoruba:
Emi okan wa n pe,
O n p’elese k’o wa;
’Yawo, Ijo Kristi si n pe,
K’ awon omo re wa.

Je k’ enit’ o gbo, wi
F’ awon t’ o yika, wa;
Enit’ oungbe ododo n gbe,
K’ o wa sodo Kristi.

Looto, eni t’ o fe,
Je ki o wa l’ ofe;
K’ o mu omi iye l’ ofe,
Jesu l’ o pe k’ o wa.

Gbo bi Jesu ti n pe,
Wipe, n bo Kankan;
Beeni, Jesu mo n reti Re,
Maa bo Olugbala.

title_english: Hasten, sinner, to be wise
passage_english: INCLINE YOUR EAR, AND COME UNTO ME. ISAIAH 55:3
passage_yoruba: E TETILELE, KI E SI WA SODO MI. ISAIAH 55:3
verses_english:
Hasten, sinner, to be wise!
Stay not for the morrow's sun;
Wisdom, if you still despise,
Harder is it to be won.

Hasten, mercy to implore!
Stay not for the morrow's sun;
Lest thy season should be o'er,
Ere this evening's stage be run.

Hasten, sinner, to return!
Stay not for the morrow's sun,
Lest thy lamp should fail to burn
Ere salvation's work is done.

Hasten, sinner, to be blest!
Stay not for the morrow's sun,
Lest perdition thee arrest,
Ere the morrow is begun
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Yara, elese, k‘o gbon!
Ma reti ojo ola;
Ogbon t’oke ma n kilo
K’o yana iku sile.

Yara tete wa aanu,
Ma reti ojo ola,
Akoko re le koja
K‘ise ale yii to tan.

Yara, elese pada,
Ma reti ojo ola;
Ki fitila re to ku,
K‘ise igbala to tan.

Jesu, y’elese pada,
Ji kuro nin ‘oorun re;
Ma je k’o ko ipe Re,
K’o maa ba r’ibinu Re.
(Amin).

title_english: Today the Savior calls
passage_english: TODAY IF YE WILL HEAR HIS VOICE, HARDEN NOT YOUR HEART. PSALM 95:7-8
passage_yoruba: LONI BI EYIN BA N FE GBO OHUN RE, E MA SE AYA YIN LE. ORIN DAFIDI 95:7,8
verses_english:
Today the Savior calls:
Ye wanderers, come;
O ye benighted souls,
Why longer roam?

Today the Savior calls:
O listen now!
Within these sacred walls
To Jesus bow.

Today the Savior calls:
For refuge fly;
The storm of justice falls,
And death is nigh.
verses_yoruba:
Loni ni Jesu pe!
Asako wa,
A! okan okunkun
Ma kiri mo.

Loni ni Jesu pe!
Tetisile
Wole fun Jesu, ni
Le owo yii.

Loni ni Jesu pe!
Sa asala,
Iji igbesan n bo,
Iparun n bo.

Loni ni Emi pe!
Jowo ‘ra re;
Ma mu k’o binu lo
S’aanu mi.
(Amin).

title_english: You children of the dead
passage_english: ‘O DRY BONES, HEAR THE WORD OF THE LORD! EZEKIEL 37:4
passage_yoruba: EYIN EGUN GBIGBE, E GBO ORO OLUWA. ESEKIEL 37:4
verses_english:
Believe the divine word.
Which His servant proclaims;
The Lord is merciful
Indeed His name is Truth:
Come back you souls that are fallen,
Stops distrusting, there’s always room.

You who the Lord’s love draws,
Unto Him draw you near;
Christ from above calls you,
Hear His sweet loving voice;
Let whoever is willing come,
In Mercy’s bosom there is room.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Eyin t’ ife re fa,
E sunmo odo Re;
Kristi t’ oke pen yin,
E gb’ ohun didun Re;
Enikeni t’ o fe k’ o wa,
Ni aya aanu aaye n be.
(Amin).

title_english: Come unto me, ye weary
passage_english: HIM THAT COMETH TO ME I WILL IN NO WISE CAST OUT. JOHN 6:37
passage_yoruba: ENITI O BA TO MI WA, EMI KI YIO TAA NU BI O TI WU KO RI. JOHANU 6:37
verses_english:
"Come unto me, ye weary,
And I will give your rest."
O blessed voice of Jesus,
Which comes to hearts opprest!
It tells of benediction,
Of pardon, grace, and peace,
Of joy that has no ending,
Of love that cannot cease.

"Come unto me, ye wanderers,
And I will give your light."
O loving voice of Jesus,
Which comes to cheer the night!
Our hearts were filled with sadness,
And we had lost our way;
But thou hast brought us gladness
And songs at break of day.

"Come unto me, ye fainting,
And I will give you life."
O cheering voice of Jesus,
Which comes to aid our strife!
The foe is stern and eager,
The fight is fierce and long;
But thou hast made us mighty
And stronger than the strong.

"And who so ever cometh,
I will not cast him out."
O patient love of Jesus,
Which drives away our doubt,
Which, though we be unworthy
Of love so great and free,
Invites us very sinners
To come, dear Lord, to thee!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Wa sodo Mi, alaare,
Un o fun yin n‘isinmi,
A! ohun didun Jesu,
Ti o p‘elese wa
O n so, ti Ore-ofe
Ati t‘alaafia,
Ti ayo ti ko lopin,
Ti ife ti ko le tan.

E wa eyin omo Mi
Un o fun yin n‘imole,
A! ohun ife Jesu,
Ti n le okunkun lo.
Awa kun fun ibanuje,
A ti s‘ona wa nu;
Imole yoo m‘ayo wa,
Oro yoo m‘orin wa.

E wa, eyin ti n daku
Un o fun yin ni iye
Ohun alaafia Jesu
T‘o f‘opin s‘ija wa,
Oju ota wa koro,
Ija si le pupo
Sugbpn ‘Wo fun wa n‘ipa
A bori ota wa.

Enikeni t‘o ba wa,
Emi ki o taa nu
A! ohun suuru Jesu
T‘o le ‘yemeji lo,
Ninu ife iyanu,
T‘o pe awa elese,
B‘a tile je alaye
S‘odo Re, Oluwa.
(Amin).

title_english: Prepare O sinner to be wise
passage_english: TO DAY IF YE WILL HEAR HIS VOICE, HARDEN NOT YOUR HEART. PSALM 95:7-8
passage_yoruba: BI EYIN O BA GBO OHUN RE, E MA SE AYA YIN LE. ORIN DAFIDI 95:7-8
verses_english:
Prepare O sinner to be wise
Do not wait until tomorrow
As long as you deride wisdom
The more hidden wisdom will be.

Get ready to ask for mercy
Do not wait for until tomorrow
Before thy days on earth are o'er
Before this world's sunset arrives.

Prepare, O sinner to return
Do not wait until tomorrow
So you do not become accursed
Before tomorrow's day begins.

Prepare to receive a blessing
Do not wait until tomorrow
So that your lamp does not burn out
Before you begin a new life.

Lord, make the sinner to repent
Rouse him from his foolish slumber
May he not kick against wisdom
And be slack concerning his doom.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mura, elese, lati gbon,
Ma duro de ojo ola;
Niwon b‘o ti kegan ogbon,
Bee l‘o si soro lati ri.

Mura lati beere aanu,
Ma duro de ojo Ola;
Ki igba re ko ma baa tan,
Ki ojo ale yii to tan.

Mura, elese, k‘o pada,
Ma duro de ojo ola;
Nitori k‘ egun ma ba o,
K‘ ojo ola k‘o to bere.

Mura lati gba ibukun,
Ma duro de ojo ola;
Ki fitila re ma ba ku,
K‘ise rere re to bere

Oluwa, y‘elese pada,
Ji kuro ninu were re;
Ma je k‘o tapa s‘imo Re,
K‘o ma f’egbe re se ‘lora.
(Amin).

title_english: Who are ye, who art His temple
passage_english: THEY BROUGHT HIM TO JERUSALEM TO PRESENT HIM TO THE LORD. LUKE 2:22
passage_yoruba: WON GBE JESU WAS I JERUSALEM LATI FI I FUN OLUWA. LUKU 2:22
verses_english:
Who are ye, who art His temple
The Lord we have expected
The prophet has for long foretold
And God brings His word to pass.
Those who have been redeemed shall sing
And praise the Lord with one voice,

In the arms of virgin mother
Behold and see how He sleeps.
He it was that the elders served
Before they died in the faith;
Hallelujah, Hallelujah
Behold the king of glory.

Jesus by being lifted up
Thou hast borne all our sorrows,
May we see Thy great salvation,
Fulfil Thy promise to us.
Take us to see Thy great glory
Up to a holy Father.

Thou the prince of our salvation
May Thy goodwill be our wong.
Jesus, all glory be to Thee
For Thy work of redemption
With the Father and the Spirit
O Lord God our creator.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
L’ apa wundia iya Re,
E sa woo bi O ti sun,
T’ awon alagba ni si n sin,
Ki won to ku ’nu gbagbo:
Halleluya, halleluya,
W’ Olorun Oga- ogo.

Jesu, nipa ifihan Re,
O ti gba iya wa je:
Joo, je k’ a ri ’gbala nla Re,
Mu ’leri Re se si wa,
Mu wa lo sinu ogo Re,
Sodo Baba mimo ni.

’Wo Alade igbala wa,
K’ ife Re je orin wa:
Jesu, Iwo l’ a fiyin fun,
Ni t’ aye t’ O ra pada;
Pelu Baba ati Emi,
Oluwa Eleda wa.
(Amin).

title_english: For all your saints, O Lord
passage_english: BUT FOLLOWERS OF THEM WHO THROUGH FAITH AND PATIENCE INHERIT THE PROMISES. HEB. 6:12
passage_yoruba: SUGBON ALAFARAWE AWON TI WON TI IPA IGBAGBO ATI SUURU TI O JOGUN ILERI WONNI. HEB 6:12
verses_english:
For all your saints, O Lord,
Who strove in you to live,
Who followed you, obeyed adored,
Our grateful hymn receive.

For all your saints, O Lord,
Who strove in you to die,
Who counted you their great reward,
Accept our thankful cry.

They all in life and death,
With you, their Lord, in view,
Learned form your Holy Spirit’s breath
To suffer and to do.

For this your name we bless
And humbly pray anew
That we like them in holiness
May live and die in you.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
F’ awon eniyan Re,
T’ o ti f’ aye sile,
Awon t’ o mo O, t’o O sin,
Gba orin iyin wa.

F’ awon eniyan Re,
Gba ohun ope wa;
Awon t’ o fi O s’esan won,
Won ku n’ igbagbo Re.

Ni gbogbo aye won,
‘Wo ni won n wo l’oju,
Emi mimo Re l’o n ko won,
Lati s’ ohun gbogbo.

Fun eyii, Oluwa,
A nyin oruko Re,
Je k’ a maa tele iwa won,
Ki a le ku bi won.
(Amin).

title_english: Who are these like stars appearing
passage_english: AND THEY THAT BE WISE SHALL SHINE AS THE BRIGHTNESS OF THE FIRMAMENT. DANIEL 12:3
passage_yoruba: AWON OLOGBON YIO SI MAA TAN BI IMOLE OFURUFU. DANIEL 12:3
verses_english:
Who are these like stars appearing,
these before God's throne who stand?
Each a golden crown is wearing;
who are all this glorious band?
Alleluia! Hark, they sing,
praising loud their heav'nly King.

Who are these of dazzling brightness,
these in God's own truth arrayed,
clad in robes of purest whiteness,
robes whose lustre ne'er shall fade,
ne'er be touched by time's rude hand?
Whence come all this glorious band?

These are they whose hearts were riven,
sore with woe and anguish tried,
who in pray'r full oft have striven
with the God they glorified;
now, their painful conflict o'er,
God has bid them weep no more.

These, like priests, have watched and waited,
off'ring up to Christ their will;
soul and body consecrated,
day and night to serve him still:
now in God's most holy place
blest they stand before his face.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Tal‘awon wonyii b‘irawo
Niwaju ite mimo,
Ti won si de ade wura,
Egbe ogo wo l‘eyii?
Gbo! won n ko Alleluya!
Orin iyin Oba won!

Tali awon ti n ko mana
T‘a wo l‘aso ododo?
Awon ti aso funfun won
Yoo maa funfun titi lae,
Beeni ki yoo gbo laelae,
Nibo l‘egbe yi ti wa?

Awon wonyii l‘o ti jagun
F‘ola Olugbala won;
Won jijakadi tit‘iku,
Won ki b‘elese kegbe
Wonyii ni ko sa f‘ogun,
Won segun nipa Kristi.

Awon wonyii l‘o ti wa,
Ti won f’ife won fun Krist‘;
Won si y‘ara won si mimo
Lati sin nigbagbogbo;
Nisisiyi li orun,
Won wa l’ayo l’odo Re
(Amin).

title_english: For all the saints who from their labors rest
passage_english: WE ALSO ARE COMPASSED ABOUT WITH SO GREAT A CLOUD OF WITNESSES. HEB. 12:1
passage_yoruba: BI A TI FI AWOSANMO TI O KUN TO BAYI FUN AWON ELERI YI WA KA. HEB. 12:1
verses_english:
For all the saints who from their labors rest,
Who Thee by faith before the world confess,
Thy name, O Jesus, be forever blest,
Alleluia! Alleluia!

Oh, may Thy soldiers, faithful, true and bold,
Fight as the saints who nobly fought of old
And win with them the victor's crown of gold.
Alleluia! Alleluia!

O blest communion, fellowship divine,
We feebly struggle, they in glory shine;
Yet all are one in Thee, for all are Thine.
Alleluia! Alleluia!

And when the fight is fierce, the warfare long,
Steals on the ear the distant triumph song,
And hearts are brave again, and arms are strong.
Alleluia! Alleluia!

From earth's wide bounds, from ocean's farthest coast,
Through gates of pearl streams in the countless host,
Singing to Father, Son, and Holy Ghost,
Alleluia! Alleluia!

The golden evening brightens in the west;
Soon, soon, to faithful warriors cometh rest.
Sweet is the calm of Paradise the blest.
Alleluia! Alleluia!
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
F’awon eniyan Re to lo ‘sinmi
Awon ti o f’igbagbo jewo Re;
K’a yin oruko Re Olugbala
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Iwo l’apata won at’odi won.
Iwo ni Balogun won l’oju ‘ja,
Iwo ni imole okunkun won
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Je ki awon omo-ogun Re l’aye
Jagun nitoto b’awon ti’gbaani
Ki nwon le gba ade ogo bi won
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Idapo ibukun wo lo to yi!
Awa nja nihin, awon nyo lohun!
Bee Tire kanna l’awa at’ awon.
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Gbat’ija ba n gbona, ti ogun nle
A dabi eni ngb’orin ayo won
Igboiya a si de, at’agbara.
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Ojo n lo, oorun wa fere wo na
Awon ajagun tooto yoo sinmi
Didun ni isimi Paradise,
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Lehin eyii ojo ayo kan nbo,
Awon mimo yoo dide n’nu ogo:
Oba ogo yio wa laarin won.
Aleluya, Aleluya!

Lat’ opin ile lat’ opin okun
Ogunlogo n ro wo ‘bode Pearli,
Won yin Baba, Omo ati Emi
Aleluya, Aleluya!
(Amin).

title_english: Come, let us join our friends abov
title_yoruba: Wa, k‘a da m‘awon ore wa
passage_english: THE WHOLE FAMILY IN HEAVEN AND EARTH. EPHESIANS 3:15
passage_yoruba: IDILE KAN LI ORUN ATI LI AYE. EFESU 3:15
verses_english:
Come, let us join our friends above
That have made sure the prize,
And on the eagle wings of love
To joy celestial rise.

Let all the saints terrestrial sing,
With those to glory gone:
For all the servants of our King,
In earth and heaven, are one.

One family, we dwell in Him,
One Church, above, beneath;
Though now divided by the stream,
The narrow stream of death.

One army of the living God,
To His command we bow;
Part of His host hath crossed the flood,
And part is crossing now.

Our spirits too shall quickly join,
Like theirs with glory crown'd;
And shout to see our Captain's sign,
To hear His trumpet sound.

Then, Lord of Hosts, be Thou our Guide,
And we, at Thy command,
Through waves that part on either side,
Shall reach Thy Blessèd Land.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Wa, k‘a da m‘awon ore wa
Ti won ti jere naa;
N‘ife k‘a f‘okan ba won lo
Sode orun l‘ohun.

K‘awon t‘aye d‘orin won mo
T‘awon t‘o lo s‘ogo,
Awa l‘aye, awon l‘orun
Okan ni gbogbo wa.

Idile kan n‘nu Krist‘ ni wa,
Ijo kan l‘a si je;
Isan omi kan l‘o ya wa!
Isan omi iku.

Egbe ogun kan t‘Olorun,
Ase Re l‘a si n se;
Apakan ti wedo naa ja,
Apakan n wee lowo!

Emi wa fere dapo na,
Yoo gb‘ade bi ti won;
A o yo s‘aami Balogun wa
Lati gbo ipe Re.

Jesu, so wa, s‘amona wa
Gbat‘ oniko ba de
Oluwa pin omi meji,
Mu wa gunle l‘ayo
(Amin).

title_english:
We adore / Thee O Lord.
Thou head of the church
passage_english: SMALL AND GREAT, STANDING BEFORE GOD. REVELATION 20:12
passage_yoruba: EWE ATI AGBA, WON DURO NIWAJU OLORUN. IFIHAN 20:12
verses_english:
We adore / Thee O Lord.
Thou head of the church / of Thy people,
The Churches here on earth / and in heav’n:
Hallelujah!

Thou who died / and rose for us,
Who is with the Father / pleading for us,
Glory and honour/be to Thee;
Hallelujah!

And on great day / of Pentecost,
Thou who sent paraclete / to the World,
His comfort is a / biding with us;
Hallelujah!

From Thy throne above / in the sky,
Where He’s looking / at His servant,
He is coming / for His martyrs:
Hallelujah!

Praise, honour and majesty / to His name,
For the death / of His servants,
Throughout / the world at large:
Hallelujah!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Awa f’ ori bale fun / O Jesu,
’Wo ti s’ Olori Ijo awon / eeyan Re,
Ijo ti n be laye yii, ati lo/run pelu:
Alle/luya!

’Wo to ku, t’o si jin / de fun wa,
T’o n be lodo Baba b’ Ala / gbawi wa,
K’ ogo at’ olanla / je Tire:
Alle /luya!

Ati li ojo nla Pen/ tikosti,
Ti o ran Parakliti / si aiye
Olutunu nla Re ti n ba wa gbe:
Alle| luya!

Lat’ ori ite Re l’ o/ ke orun,
L’O si n wo gbogbo awon o/ jise Re,
T’O si nsike gbogbo awon Aje| riku Re:
Alle / luya!

A fi iyin at’ olanla f’ o/ ruko Re,
N’tori iku gbogbo awon o/ jise Re,
Ni gbogbo ile Yo| ruba yii:
Alle / luya!
(Amin).

title_english: King of saints, to whom the number
passage_english: THE LORD KNOWETH THEM THAT ARE HIS. II TIM. 2:19
passage_yoruba: OLUWA MO AWON TI ISE TIRE. II TIM. 2:19
verses_english:
King of saints, to whom the number
Of Thy starry host is known,
Many a name, by man forgotten,
Lives forever round Thy throne;

Lights, which earth-born mists have darkened,
There are shining full and clear,
Princes in the court of Heaven,
Nameless, unremembered here.

How he toiled for Thee and suffered
None on earth can now record;
All his saintly life is hidden
In the knowledge of his Lord.

None can tell us; all is written
In the Lamb’s great book of life,
All the faith, and prayer, and patience,
All the toiling, and the strife;

There are told Thy hidden treasures;
Number us, O Lord, with them,
When Thou makest up the jewels
Of Thy living diadem.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oba awon eni mimo,
T’ o mo ýe awon ‘rawo;
Opo eni t’ eda gbagbe,
Wa yika ite Re lae.

‘Mole ti ikuuku aye bo
N tan ‘mole roro loke,
Won je om-alade lorun
Eda gbagbe won laye.

Laalaa at’ iya won fun o,
Eda ko royin re mo,
Iwa rere won f’ ara sin,
Oluwa nikan lo mo o.

Won f’arasin fun wa sugbon,
A ko won s’ iwe iye,
Igbagbo, adura, suru,
Laalaa oun ‘jakadi won.

Won mo isura Re l’ohun;
Ka wa mo won, Oluwa,
Nigbat’ O ba n siro oso,
Ti n be lara ade re.
(Amin).

title_english: Head of Thy Church triumphant
passage_english: THAT WE MUST THROUGH MUCH TRIBULATION ENTER INTO THE KINGDOM. ACTS. 14:22.
passage_yoruba: NINU IPONJU PUPO LI AWA O FI DE IJOBA ORUN. ISE AWON APOS. 14:22.
verses_english:
Head of Thy Church triumphant,
We joyfully adore Thee;
Till Thou appear, Thy members here
Shall sing like those in glory.
We lift our hearts and voices
With blest anticipation,
And cry aloud, and give to God
The praise of our salvation.

While in affliction’s furnace,
And passing through the fire,
Thy love we praise, which knows our days,
And ever brings us nigher.
We clap our hands exulting
In Thine almighty favor;
The love divine which made us Thine
Shall keep us Thine for ever.

Thou dost conduct Thy people
Through torrents of temptation,
Nor will we fear, while Thou art near,
The fire of tribulation.
The world with sin and Satan
In vain our march opposes,
Through Thee we shall break through them all,
And sing the song of Moses.

By faith we see the glory
To which Thou shalt restore us,
The cross despise for that high prize
Which Thou hast set before us.
And if Thou count us worthy,
We each, as dying Stephen,
Shall see Thee stand at God’s right hand,
To take us up to Heaven.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olori Ijo t’orun
L’ayo l’a wole fun O
K’O to de, ijo t’aye
Y’o maa korin bi t’orun
A gbe okan wa s’oke
Ni ‘reti t’o ni ‘bukun
Awa kigbe, awa f’iyin
F’Olorun igbala wa.

‘Gbat’a wa ninu ‘ponju
T’a n koja ninu ina
Orin ife l’awa o ko
Ti o n mu wa sunmo O
Awa sope a si yo
Ninu ojurere Re:
Ife t’o so wa di Tire
Y’o se wa ni Tire lai.

Iwo mu awon eeyan Re
Koja isan idanwo
A ki o beru wahala
T’ori O wa nitosi
Aiye ese at’esu
Kojuja si wa lasan
L’agbara Re, a o segun
A o si korin Mose.

Awa f’ igbagbo r’ogo
T’o tun n fe fi wa si
A kegan nitori
Ere nla iwaju wa
Bi O ba si ka wa ye
Awa pelu Stefen t’o ku
Yoo ri O bi O ti duro
Lati pe wa lo s’ orun
(Amin).

title_english: Hark! hark, my soul! Angelic songs are swelling
title_yoruba: Gbo, okan mi, bi Angeli ti n korin
passage_english: ANGEL OF THE LORD SPEAK TELL THE PEOPLE ALL THE WORDS OF THIS LIFE. ACTS 5:20
passage_yoruba: ANGELI OLUWA WIPE, LO SO GBOGBO ORO IYE YII. ISE AWON APOS. 5:20
verses_english:
Hark! hark, my soul! Angelic songs are swelling,
O’er earth’s green fields and ocean’s wave-beat shore:
How sweet the truth those blessèd strains are telling
Of that new life when sin shall be no more.

Onward we go, for still we hear them singing,
Come, weary souls, for Jesus bids you come;
And through the dark, its echoes sweetly ringing,
The music of the Gospel leads us home.

Far, far away, like bells at evening pealing,
The voice of Jesus sounds o’er land and sea;
And laden souls, by thousands meekly stealing,
Kind Shepherd, turn their weary steps to Thee.

Rest comes at length: though life be long and dreary,
The day must dawn, and darksome night be past;
Faith’s journeys end in welcome to the weary,
And Heaven, the heart’s true home, will come at last.

Angels, sing on, your faithful watches keeping;
Sing us sweet fragments of the songs above,
Till morning’s joy shall end the night of weeping,
And life’s long shadows break in cloudless love. (Amen).
english_chorus:
Angels of Jesus, angels of light,
Singing to welcome the pilgrims of the night!
verses_yoruba:
Gbo, okan mi, bi Angeli ti n korin
Yika orun ati yika aiye
E gbo bi oro orin won ti dun to
Ti n so gbati ese ki yoo si mo.

B’a si ti nlo, bee l’a si ngbo orin won
Wa, alare, Jesu l’o ni k’e wa
L’okunkun ni a n gbo orin didun won
Ohun orin won ni n fona han wa.

Ohun Jesu, ni a n gbo l’ona rere
Ohun na n dun b’agogo y’aye ka
Egbeegberun awon t’o gbo ni si nbo
Mu won w’odo Re, Olugbala wa.

Isinmi de, bi wahala tile po,
Ile yoo mo, lehin ookun aye;
Irin ajo pari, f’awon alaare
Won o d’orun ‘bi isinmi, ni keyin:

Maa korin n so, eyin Angeli rere
E maa korin didun k’a ba maa gbo;
Tit’ao fi nu omije oju wa nu
Ti a’o si ma yo titi laelae.
(Amin).
yoruba_chorus:
Angeli Jesu, angel’ mole
Won n korin ayo pade ero l’ona

title_english: Blessed are they in jesus
passage_english: BEHOLD, WHAT MANNER OF LOVE THE FATHER HATH BESTOWED UPON US, THAT WE SHOULD BE CALLED THE SONS OF GOD. I JOHN 3:1
passage_yoruba: E WO IRU IFE TI BABA FI FE WA, TI A FI NPE WA NI OMO OLORUN. I JOHN 3:1
verses_english:
Blessed are they in jesus
Those that are children of God 
Redeemed are they by His blood 
They passed from death into life.

Those who have been justified 
By His good, abundant grace 
Theier sins are all washed away
They shall be free from judgement.

They bear fruits of the spirit 
In good works of righteousness ,
The work of sin they abhor 
The words of God dwell in them.

Thro’ precious blood of the lamb 
They become co-heirs with God 
Through the saviour’s majesty 
They wear robe of righteousness 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Alabukun n‘nu Jesu, 
Ni awon om‘Olorun 
Ti a fi eje Re ra 
Lat‘inu iku s‘iye;

Awon ti a da l‘are 
Nipa oore ofe Re. 
A we gbogbo ese won, 
Won o bo l‘ojo ‘dajo.

Won s‘eso oore-ofe 
Ninu ise ododo, 
Irira l‘ese si won, 
Or‘Olorun n gbe ‘nu won.

Nipa ej‘Odagutan, 
Won n ba Olorun k‘egbe 
Pelu Ola-nla Jesu. 
A wo won l‘aso ogo. 
(Amin).
english_chorus:
Thanks God, I’m counted worthy 
In this world and in the next
yoruba_chorus:
Ope, a ka wa mo won, 
L‘aye yii, ati l‘orun.

title_english: Who would help raise fallen Jacob
passage_english: OH, THAT JACOB MAY STAND. AMOS 7:2
passage_yoruba: JAKOBU YIO HA SE KED IDE? AMOSI 7:2
verses_english:
“Who would help raise fallen Jacob?”
Jacob’s friends are too few,
The most surprising is this fact
They are disunited.

“Who would help raise fallen Jacob?”
His enemies proved tough,
I could now read victorious bliss
They thought that was his end.

“Who would help raise fallen Jacob?”
And make this pronouncement,
A branch that’s hewn and still lies down
Can still resuscitate.

My God, my Lord it is Thy work,
There’s no one beside Thee
Shower blessings on fallen Jacob.
And Jacob shall arise. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
“Tani o gbe Jakob dide?”
Ore Jakob ko po;
Eyi t’o je ’yanu ni pe,
Imo won ko sokan.

“Tani o gbe Jakob dide?”
Ota Jakob n’ ipa:
Mo r’ayo ’segun l’oju won,
Nwon ni, “o pari fun un.”

“Tani o gbe Jakob dide?”
A ha r’eni le wi?
Eka t’o ro nibule yii,
O ha tun le ye mo?

Oluwa mi, ise Re ni!
Ko s’eni t’o le se:
Se b’ iri s’ori Jakobu,
Oun yio si tun ye. 
(Amin).

title_english: Father, before Thy throne of light
passage_english: AND ALL THE ANGELS STOOD ROUND ABOUT THE THRONE. REVELATION 7:11
passage_yoruba: AWON ANGELI SI DURO YI ITE NAA KA. IFIHAN 7:11
verses_english:
Father, before Thy throne of light
The guardian angels bend,
And ever in Thy presence bright
Their psalms adoring blend;
And casting down each golden crown,
Beside the crystal sea,
With voice and lyre, in happy quire,
Hymn glory, Lord, to Thee.

And as the rainbow luster falls
Athwart their glowing wings,
While seraph unto seraph calls,
And each Thy goodness sings;
So may we feel, as low we kneel
To pray Thee for Thy grace,
That Thou art here for all who fear
The brightness of Thy face.

Here, where the angels see us come
To worship day by day,
Teach us to seek our heav’nly home,
And love Thee e’en as they;
Teach us to raise our notes of praise,
With them Thy love to own,
That childhood’s flower and manhood’s power
Be Thine, and Thine alone.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Didan osumare si n tan 
Si ara lye won; 
Bi Seraf’ ti n ke si Serafu 
Ti won n korin ‘yin Re; 
Bi a ti kunle nihinyii 
Ran oore Re si wa, 
K‘a mo pe ‘Wo wa nitosi 
Lati da wa lohun.

Nihin, nibit‘ awon Angeli 
N wo wa b‘a ti n sin O 
Ko wa, k‘a wa ile orun, 
K‘a sin O bi ti won; 
K‘a ba won ko orin iyin. 
K‘a ba won mo ‘ fe Re: 
Titi agbara yoo fi di 
Tire, Tire nikan. 
(Amin).

title_english: Come, let us join our cheerful songs
title_yoruba: E wa, k‘a da orin wa po
passage_english: A GREAT MULTITUDE, WHICH NO MAN COULD NUMBER …….. STOOD BEFORE THE THRONE. REVELATION 7:9
passage_yoruba: OPOLOPO ENIYAN TI ENIKENI KO LE KAYE ……….. DURO NIWAJU ITE. IFIHAN 7:9
verses_english:
Come, let us join our cheerful songs
With angels round the throne.
Ten thousand thousand are their tongues,
But all their joys are one.

"Worthy the Lamb that died," they cry,
"To be exalted thus!"
"Worthy the Lamb," our hearts reply,
"For he was slain for us!"

Jesus is worthy to receive
Honor and power divine;
And blessings more than we can give,
Be, Lord, forever thine.

Let all that dwell above the sky,
And air, and earth, and seas,
Aonspire to lift thy glories high,
And speak thine endless praise!

The whole creation join in one,
To bless the sacred Name
Of him who sits upon the throne,
and to adore the Lamb.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
E wa, k‘a da orin wa po 
Mo t‘awon Angeli; 
Egbeegberun ni ohun won 
Okan ni ayo won.

Won n korin, pe, Ola nla ye 
Odaguntan t‘a pa; 
K‘a gberin pe, Oba nla ye 
Tori O ku fun wa.

Jesu, li o ye lati gba 
Ola at‘agbara; 
K‘iyin t‘enu wa ko le gba 
Je Tire, Oluwa.

K‘awon t‘o wa l‘oke orun 
At‘ile at‘okun
Dapo lati gb‘ogo Re ga, 
Jumo yin Ola Re.

Ki gbogbo eda d‘ohun po, 
Lati yin oruko 
Enit‘o joko lor‘ite, 
Ki won si wole fun un. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesu, with Thy Church abide
passage_english: CHRIST ALSO LOVED THE CHURCH, AND GAVE HIMSELF FOR IT. EPHESIANS 5:25
passage_yoruba: KRISTI FE IJO-ENIYAN RE, O SI FI ARA RE FUN UN. EFESU 5:25
verses_english:
Jesu, with Thy Church abide,
Be her Savior, Lord, and Guide,
While on earth her faith is tried:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Keep her life and doctrine pure,
Help her, patient to endure,
Trusting in Thy promise sure:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Be Thou with her all the days,
May she, safe from error's ways,
Toil for Thine eternal praise:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May her voice be ever clear,
Warning of a judgment near,
Telling of a Saviour dear:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

All her fettered powers release,
Bid our strife and envy cease,
Grant the heavenly gift of peace:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she one in doctrine be,
One in truth and charity,
Winning all to faith in Thee:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she guide the poor and blind,
Seek the lost until she find,
And the broken-hearted bind:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Save her love from growing cold,
Make her watchmen strong and bold,
Fence her round, Thy peaceful fold:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May her priests Thy people feed,
Shepherds of the flock indeed,
Ready, where Thou call'st, to lead:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Judge her not for work undone,
Judge her not for fields unwon,
Bless her works in Thee begun:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

For the past give deeper shame,
Make her jealous for Thy Name,
Kindle zeal's most holy flame:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Raise her to her calling high,
Let the nations far and nigh
Hear Thy herald's warning cry:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May her lamp of truth be bright,
Bid her bear aloft its light
Through the realms of heathen night:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May her scattered children be
From reproach of evil free,
Blameless witnesses for Thee:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

Arm her soldiers with the cross,
Brave to suffer toil and loss,
Counting earthly gain but dross:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she holy triumphs win,
Overthrow the hosts of sin,
Gather all the nations in:
We beseech Thee, hear us.

May she soon all glorious be,
Spotless and from wrinkle free,
Pure, and bright, and worthy Thee.
We beseech thee, hear us.

Fit her all Thy joy to share
In the home Thou dost prepare,
And be ever blessed there:
We beseech Thee, hear us.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, ba ijo Re gbe, 
Samona at‘odi re, 
B‘o ti n la ‘danwo koja 
Awa n be O, gbo wa.

F‘owo ife Re yii ka; 
Dabobo lowo ota, 
Tu ninu nigba ibi, 
Awa n be O, gbo wa.

M‘eko at‘iwa re mo 
Je k‘o fi suuru duro; 
K‘o sinmi le ‘leri Re, 
Awa n be O, gbo ti wa.

Pelu re lojo gbogbo,
