K‘o bo lowo isina, 
K‘o maa sise fun ‘yin Re, 
Awa n be O, gbo wa.

K‘ohun re maa ja gooro 
N‘ikilo ‘dajo ti n bo; 
Ni siso ife Jesu, 
Awa n be O, gbo ti wa.

Wa tun ibaje re se, 
Wa tun Tempili Re ko; 
Fi ara Re han nibe, 
Awa n be O, gbo ti wa.

Wa da gbogbo ide re, 
Mu ‘lara at‘ija tan; 
M‘alaafia orun wa, 
Awa n be O, gbo ti wa.

Mu gbogbo ona re to, 
Ma je k‘owo Esu tee
Ki aye ma lae tan an je, 
Awa n be O, gbo wa.

K‘eko re je okan na 
N‘nu otito at‘ife; 
K‘o fa opo si ‘gbagbo, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

K‘o ma toju alaini 
K‘o si ma wa asako 
At‘oni robinuje; 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

Ma je k‘ife re tutu, 
M‘awon oluso gboya, 
S‘agbara y‘agbo Re ka, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

K‘awon alufa ma bo, 
Ki won j‘oluso toto . 
Lati ma to ijo Re, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

Ki won se bi won ti nso, 
K‘won f‘apere mimo han 
Bi asaju agbo Re, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

F‘or‘ofe eni t‘O ku, 
At‘ife Baba ba gbe; 
K‘Emi ma s‘amona re, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

We gbogbo arun re nu, 
L‘eru on ‘yemeji lo; 
Mu ‘segun Re de kankan, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

Ran ‘lowo nigba awe 
Tit‘ise re o pari; 
T‘Oko ‘yawo y‘o si de 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa.

Nigbana k‘o se logo 
Ati ni ailabawon, 
L‘ewa didan t‘o ye O 
Awa nbe O, gbo wa.

Mu ye ki on ba le pin 
N‘nu aye t‘Iwo npese;
K‘o n‘ibukun nibe lae, 
Awa mbe O, gbo wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: Lord of heaven and earth and sea
passage_english: FOR ALL THINGS COME OF THEE, AND OF THINE OWN HAVE WE GIVEN THEE. 1 CHRONICLE 29:14
passage_yoruba: OHUN GBOGBO ODO RE NI TI WA, ATI NINU OHUN OWO RE LI AWA TI FI FUN O. 1 KRON. 29:14.
verses_english:
Lord of heaven and earth and sea,
to thee all praise and glory be;
how shall we show our love to thee,
who givest all?

The golden sunshine, vernal air,
sweet flowers and fruits, thy love declare;
where harvests ripen, thou art there,
who givest all.

For peaceful homes and healthful days,
for all the blessings earth displays,
we owe thee thankfulness and praise,
who givest all.

Thou didst not spare thine only Son,
but gav'st him for a world undone,
and freely, with that blessèd One,
thou givest all.

Thou giv'st the Spirit's blessèd dower,
Spirit of life and love and power,
and dost his sevenfold graces shower
upon us all.

For souls redeemed, for sins forgiven,
for means of grace and hopes of heaven,
Father, all praise to thee be given,
who givest all.

We lose what on ourselves we spend,
we have as treasure without end
whatever, Lord, to thee we lend,
who givest all.

Whatever, Lord, we lend to Thee,
Repaid a thousand-fold will be;
Then gladly will we give to Thee
Who givest all.

To Thee, from whom we all derive
Our life, our gifts, our power to give:
O may we ever with Thee live,
Who givest all. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa orun oun aye 
‘Wo n’ iyin at’ ope ye fun 
Bawo l’a ba ti fe O to,
Onibu ore.

Orun ti nran, at’ afefe
Gbogbo eweko nso ‘fe Re 
‘Wo l’O nmu irugbin dara
Onibu ore

Fun ara lile wa gbogbo 
Fun gbogbo ibukun aye
Awa yin o, a si dupe,
Onibu ore.

O ko du wa li Omo Re,
O fi fun aye ese yi,
O si f’ebun gbogbo pelu 
Onibu ore.

O fun wa l’emi Mimo Re 
Emi iye at’ agbara
O rojo ekun bukun Re 
Le wa lori.

Fun idariji ese wa,
Ati fun ireti orun
Kil’ ohun t’a ba fi fun o
Onibu ore.

Owo ti a n na, ofo ni
Sugbon eyi t’a fi fun o 
O je isura tit’ aye
Onibu ore.

Ohun t’a bun o, Oluwa
‘Wo o san le pada fun wa,
L’ayo l’ a o ta o lore 
Onibu ore.

Ni odo Re lati san wa 
Olorun Olodumare 
Je k’a le ba o gbe titi
Onibu ore. (Amin)

title_english: We give Thee but Thine own
title_yoruba: Ohun t’ a fi fun O
passage_english: AS EVERY MAN HATH RECEIVED THE GIFT, EVEN SO MINISTER THE SAME ONE TO ANOTHER, AS GOOD STEWARDS. 1 PET. 4:10
passage_yoruba: BI OLUKULUKU TI RI EBUN GBÀ, BEENI KI E MÃ SE IPINFUNNI RE LARIN ARA NYIN, BI IRIJU RERE. 1 PET. 4:10
verses_english:
We give Thee but Thine own,
Whate’er the gift may be;
All that we have is Thine alone,
A trust, O Lord, from Thee.

May we Thy bounties thus
As stewards true receive,
And gladly, as Thou blessest us,
To Thee our firstfruits give.

O hearts are bruised and dead,
And homes are bare and cold,
And lambs for whom the Shepherd bled
Are straying from the fold.

To comfort and to bless,
To find a balm for woe,
To tend the lone and fatherless
Is angels’ work below.

The captive to release,
To God the lost to bring,
To teach the way of life and peace—
It is a Christ-like thing.

And we believe Thy Word,
Though dim our faith may be;
Whate’er for Thine we do, O Lord,
We do it unto Thee.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ohun t’ a fi fun O,
Tire ni, Oluwa 
Gbogbo ohun ti a si ni,
Owo Re lo ti wa.

Je k’a gba ebun Re 
Bi iriju rere,
Bi O si ti n bukun wa to,
Bee l’a o fi fun O.

Opo ni ise n se,
Ti won ko r’ounje je
Opo l’o si ti sako lo,
Kuro l’agbo Jesu.

K’ a ma tu ni ninu,
K’ a ma re ni l’ekun 
K’ a ma bo alainibaba,
N’ ise t’ a ba mase

K’ a tu onde sile
K’ a f’ona iye han,
K’a ko ni lona Olorun,
B’ iwa Kristi l’ o ri.

A gba oro Re gbo,
Busi igbagbo wa,
Ohun t’a se fun eni Re,
Jesu, a se fun O. 
(Amin).

title_english: Thou who art fount of all good things
passage_english: BEAR YE ONE ANOTHER'S BURDENS. GALATIANS 6:2
passage_yoruba: E MAA RU ERU OMONIKEJI YIN. GALATIA 6:2
verses_english:
Thou who art fount of all good things
We want to do thy will
What is it we can give to thee
Thou king of all the earth.

Lord in this world thou hast the poor
Who are thine own people
Their names thou promised to confess
Before thy father’s throne.

And when they cry out in their pain
It is thy cry, we hear,
When we rise up to care for them
We are caring for thee.

Jesus accept our offering 
Bestow thy blessings there
Pour out thy blessings on our gifts
Which are given the poor.

To father, son and holy ghost,
Our God whom we adore 
Be glory now and evermore 
Ever world without end
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
‘Wo orisun ohun rere, 
Awa fe se ‘fe Re, 
Ohun wo l‘a le fi fun O, 
Oba gbogbo aye?

L‘aye yii, ‘Wo ni otosi 
T‘o je eniyan Re; 
Oruko won n‘lwo n jewo, 
Niwaju Baba Re.

‘Gba won ba n ke n‘inira won 
Ohun Re l‘awa n gbo; 
‘Gba ba si n se itoju won, 
Awa n se ‘toju Re.

Jesu, ma sai gba Ore wa, 
Si f’ibukun Re sii; 
Maa f’ibukun Re s’ebun wa, 
Fun awon t’a fi fun.

Fun Baba, Omo, at’ Emi
Olorun ti a n sin;
Ni ki a maa fi ogo fun,
Titi ayeraye.
(Amin).

title_english: I go; the poor, My poor are with you still
title_yoruba: Mo n lo; talaka Mi n be lodo yin
passage_english: FOR YE HAVE THE POOR WITH YOU ALWAYS, AND WHENSOEVER YE WILL YE MAY DO THEM GOOD. MARK 14:7
passage_yoruba: NIGBAGBOGBO LI EYIN SA NI TALAKA LODO YIN, KI EYIN KI O SI MAA SORE FUN NIGBAKUGBA TI EYIN FE. MARKU 14:7
verses_english:
`I go; the poor, My poor are with you still,
And ye may help them when and as ye will.

Such was the legacy Incarnate Love
Bequeath'd His own before He soar'd above.

Not gold or jewels, but His poor to claim
Our succour for the sake of His dear name.

No weary burden, but a rich bequest,
Whereby who blesses is himself twice bless'd.

Is it not ours today? Are not the poor,
The hungry and the naked, at our door?

And do not still the moans of anguish rise,
By day and night from sufferers to the skies?

The wounded soul, the broken heart's distress;
Tears of the widow and the fatherless?

And He, who gave Himself for all, has given
To us His servants of the balm of heaven.

None are so poor but have some love to shower
On poorer than themselves, and this is power.

This is the worship pure and undefiled
The father claims of every heaven-born child
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo n lo; talaka Mi n be lodo yin, 
E le maa sore fun won b‘e ti n fe,

Eyii ni ogun t‘Olugbala wa 
Fi sile f‘awon Tire k‘o to lo.

Wura on jufu ko, otosi ni; 
Ka maa ran won lowo nitori Re.

Eru nla ko, ogun t‘o l‘oro ni; 
Ti n f‘ilopo ‘bukun f’eni n tore.

T’iwa k’ise naa bi? L‘ojude wa 
Ko ni talaka at‘ asagbe wa?

Ohun irora awon t‘iya n je 
Ko ha n ke si wa lati faanu han?

Okan to gb‘ogbe, okan ti n sise 
Ekun opo, at‘alaini baba.

Oun to f’ara Re fun wa, si ti fi 
Etu orun f‘ara awa iranse Re.

Ko s‘otosi kan ti ko le s’aajo 
F‘eni tosi ju lo, agbara ni.

Isin mimo ailabawon l‘eyii, 
Ti Baba n beere lowo gbogbo wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, Thou Joy of loving hearts
passage_english: I AM THAT BREAD OF LIFE. JOHN 6:48
passage_yoruba: EMI LI OUNJE IYE NI. JOHANU 6:48
verses_english:
Jesus, Thou Joy of loving hearts,
Thou Fount of life, Thou Light of men,
From the best bliss that earth imparts,
We turn unfilled to Thee again.

We taste Thee, O Thou living Bread,
And long to feast upon Thee still;
We drink of Thee, the Fountainhead,
And thirst our souls from Thee to fill.

Our restless spirits yearn for Thee,
Wherever our changeful lot is cast;
Glad when Thy gracious smile we see,
Blessed when our faith can hold Thee fast.

O Jesus, ever with us stay,
Make all our moments calm and bright;
Chase the dark night of sin away,
Shed over the world Thy holy light.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, ayo okan gbogbo, 
Orisun ‘ye, imole wa, 
Nin‘ opo bukun aye yii, 
Lainitelorun, a to O wa.

Otito Re duro laelae 
Wo n gb‘awon to kepe O la; 
Awon ti o wa O ri O, 
Bi gbogbo nin‘ohun gbogbo.

A to O wo Ounje Iye, 
A fe je l‘ara Re titi; 
A mu ninu Re, Orisun, 
Lati pa oungbe okan wa.

Oungbe Re sa n gbe okan wa 
Nibikibi t‘o wu k‘a wa; 
‘Gbat‘a ba ri O awa yo, 
A yo nigbat‘ a gba O gbo.

Jesu wa ba wa gbe titi, 
Se akoko wa ni rere; 
Le okunkun ese kuro, 
Tan ‘mole Re mimo s‘aye. 
(Amin).

title_english: According to Thy gracious word
passage_english: THIS DO IN REMEMBRANCE OF ME. LUK 22:19
passage_yoruba: E MAA SE EYII NI IRANTI MI. LUKE 22:19
verses_english:
According to Thy gracious word,
In meek humility,
This will I do, my dying Lord,
I will remember Thee.

Thy body, broken for my sake,
My bread from Heaven shall be;
The testamental cup I take,
And thus remember Thee.

Gethsemane can I forget?
Or there Thy conflict see,
Thine agony, and bloody sweat,
And not remember Thee?

Remember Thee, and all Thy pains
And all Thy love to me;
Yea, while a breath, a pulse remains,
Will I remember Thee.

And when these failing lips grow dumb
And mind and memory flee,
When Thou shalt in Thy kingdom come,
Jesus, remember me.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gege bi oro oore Re, 
Ninu irele nla; 
Emi o se yi Oluwa, 
Emi o ranti Re.

Ara Re ti a bu fun mi 
Yio je ounje mi; 
Mo gba ago majemu Re, 
Lati se ranti Re.

Mo le gbagbo Getsemane, 
Ti mo r‘ijamu Re, 
Iya oun ogun eje Re, 
Ki n ma si ranti Re.

Un o ranti gbogbo ‘rora Re, 
At‘ ife Re si mi, 
Bi o ku emi kan fun mi,
Emi o ranti Re.

Gbati enu mi ba pamo, 
Ti lye mi ba ra; 
Ti o ba de n‘ijoba Re, 
Jesu joo ranti mi. 
(Amin).

title_english: All the night, at the dusk of woe
passage_english: YOU PROCLAIM THE LORD’S DEATH TILL HE COMES. I CORINTHIANS 11:26
passage_yoruba: EYIN N FI IKU OLUWA HAN TITI YIO FI DE. I KORINTI 11:26
verses_english:
All the night, at the dusk of woe;
When hade erupteth in its strength,
Unto Wonderful Son of God,
Gift of victory against His foe.

Ere commence His passion and strife,
The bread He offereth, art though blessed:
Thou who Thine work in all art love,
Hark his word spoken art of grace.

His sacred flesh offered for sin,
Partake, oh, bread of life it be;
The sacred wine He gavest thee,
This art my covenant, my blood.

This He commandeth do till aye,
In mem’ry of thy sacred friend;
Whence thou shall meet, recall to thee
Thy departed God is but love.

Christ Jesus Thy commands our joy,
Thine redemptive death, hymns reveal;
Ere Thou cometh hither below
Supper we shall with Thee partake. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Li oru ibanuje ni,
T’ agbara isa oku n de,
S’ Omo iyonu Olorun,
Ore ta A fun ota Re.

Ki ’wayaja Re to bere,
O mu akara, O si buu;
Wo ife n’ ise Re gbogbo,
Gb’ oro oore- ofe t’ O so.

“Eyii l’ ara t’ a bu f’ ese,
Gba, k’ e si je ounje iye;”
O si mu ago, O bu waini,
Eyii majemu eje Mi.

O wipe, “S’ eyii tit’ opin,
N’ iranti iku ore yin;
’Gba t’ e ba pade, maa ranti
Ife Olorun yin t’ o lo.

Jesu, awa n yo s’ ase Re,
Awa f’ iku Re han l’ orin;
K’ Iwo to pada, ao maa je
Ounje ale Odagutan. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus Thy service bestow
passage_english: “THEY SHALL BE ABUNDANTLY SATISFIED WITH THE FATNESS OF THY HOUSE.” PSALM 36:8
passage_yoruba: “ORORO ILE RE YOO TE WON L’ORUN GIDIGIDI.” ORIN DAFIDI 36:8
verses_english:
Jesus Thy service bestow,
Perfect joy on earth below;
Jesus Thy service bestow
Perfect comfort though in death.

Beyond death, there is a joy.
Joy eternal, ne’er to end;
God be mine is all my plea,
My joy knows no end for aye.
verses_yoruba:
Isin Jesu ni ‘funni
L’ay?? tot?, l’aiye yi;
Isin Jesu ni ‘funni
N’ itunnu ninu iku.

L?hin ‘ku, ay?? na mb?,
Ti kò ni d’opin lailai;
K’ ?l?run sa j? t’emi,
Ay?? mi kì o l’opin.

title_english: I THIRST, thou wounded Lamb of God,
passage_english: LET US GO INTO HIS TABERNACLE; LET US WORSHIP AT HIS FOOTSTOOL. PSALMS 132:7
passage_yoruba: AWA O LO SINU OGO RE; AWA O MAA SIN NIBI APOTI AGBARA RE. ORIN DAFIDI 132:7
verses_english:
I THIRST, thou wounded Lamb of God,
To wash me in Thy cleansing blood,
To dwell within Thy wounds; then pain
Is sweet, and life or death is gain.

Take my poor heart, and let it be
For ever closed to all but Thee!
Seal Thou my breast, and let me we;
That pledge of love for ever there!

How blest are they who still abide
Close sheltered in Thy bleeding side,
Who life and strength from thence derive,
And by Thee move, and in Thee live.

How can it be, Thou heavenly King,
That thou shouldst us to glory bring?
Make slaves the partners of thy throne,
Decked with a never-fading crown?

Ah, Lord! enlarge our scanty thought,
To know the wonders thou hast wrought;
Unloose our stammering tongues, to tell
Thy love immense, unsearchable.

First-born of many brethren thou!
To Thee, lo! all our souls we bow:
To Thee our hearts and hands we give:
Thine may we die, Thine may we live!
verses_yoruba:
Odo Agutan Olorun,
Joo we mi ninu eje Re;
Sa je ki n mo ‘fe Re, ‘gbanaa
Irora dun, iku l’ ere.

Fa okan mi kuro l’aye,
K’ o je k’ o se Tire titi;
Fi edidi Re s’ aya mi,
Edidi’ fe titi aye.

A! awon wonni ti yo to,
T’ o f’ iha Re se ‘sadi won!
Won fi O se agbara won,
Won n je, won si n mu ninu Re.

O kun wa loju p’ Olorun
Fe m’awa yii lo sin’ ogo!
Pe, O so eru d’ om’ Oba,
Lati maa je faaji laelae!

Baba, mu wa ronu jinle,
K’ a le mo ise nlanla Re;
Ma sai tu okun ahon wa,
K’ a le so ibu ife Re.

Jesu, Iwo l’ olori wa,
‘Wo l’ a o teri wa ba fun,
‘Wo l’ a o fi okan wa fun,
B’ a ku, b’ a wa, k’ a je Tire.

title_english: The hour is come, the feast is nigh
passage_english: I WILL NOT DRINK HENCEFORTH OF THIS FRUIT OF THE VINE, UNTIL THAT DAY WHEN I DRINK IT NEW WITH YOU IN MY FATHER'S KINGDOM. MATT. 26:29
passage_yoruba: EMI KI YIO MU NINU ESO AJARA MO, TITI DI OJO NAA, NIGBATI EMI O SI BA YIN MU UN NI TITUN NI IJOBA BABA MI. MATT. 26:29
verses_english:
The hour is come, the feast is nigh
I give Myself to you
Behold I give my blood to you
Shed for your redemption.

Till my Father's kingdom above
Before I drink again
By then, no more shall tears be shed
It shall be joy for aye.

This supper shall e'er continue
Until His kingdom come
All o'er the world shall many souls
Eat this supper and drink.

God's blessings shall be poured from heav'n
Upon all those who eat
And from my Father's throne on high
I'll prepare them a place.

But now, for the present I'll drink
The bitter cup for you
And for your sakes, I'll drink the cup
Of sore anguish of death.

Ye cannot know my deep sorrow
Nor yet, my glory see
But thism, continue ye to do
And thus, remember me.
verses_yoruba:
Ojo ko‘ ase naa leyii,
Mo f‘ara mi fun yin
E woo, mo f’eje mi fun yin,
Lati ra yin pada.

O di ‘nu ‘joba Baba mi,
Ki n to tun ba yin mu;
‘Gbanaa ekun ko ni si mo,
A o maa yo titi.

Titi l‘ao maa je ounje yii,
K‘o to di igba naa;
Ka gbogb‘ aye l‘opolopo
Yoo maa je, yoo maa mu'.

‘Bukun atorunwa yoo maa,
Wa lor‘ awon t‘o n jee;
Un o gbe or‘ite Baba mi
Maa pes‘ aaye fun won.

Sugbon nisisiyii, ago
Kikoro l‘em‘ o mu,
Emi o mu nitori yin,
Ago rora iku.

E ko le mo ‘banuje mi,
E ko ti r‘ogo mi;
Sugbon e maa s‘eyii titi,
K‘e maa fi ranti mi.

title_english: Jesus, to Thy table led,
passage_english: AND TO KNOW THE LOVE OF CHRIST, WHICH PASSETH KNOWLEDGE. EPH. 3:19
passage_yoruba: LATI MO IFE KRISTI T’O POJU IMO GBOGBO LO. EFESU 3:19
verses_english:
Jesus, to Thy table led,
Now let every heart be fed
With the true and living Bread.

While in penitence we kneel,
Thy sweet presence let us feel,
All Thy wondrous love reveal.

While on Thy dear Cross we gaze,
Mourning o'er our sinful ways,
Turn our sadness into praise.

When we taste the mystic wine,
Of Thine outpoured blood the sign,
Fill our hearts with love divine.

Lead us by Thy pierced hand,
Till around Thy throne we stand,
In the bright and better land.
verses_yoruba:
Gba ta ti nwo agbelebu,
T‘a si n sokun ese wa,
So oro wa di ayo.

Gba to ba f’enu kan waini
Ti n sapere eje Re.
M’okan wa kun fun ife.

Fa wa si bi iha Re,
Nibiti isun ti n san,
F’ alaafia Re fun wa.

Joo tu ide ese wa
Si busi igbagbo wa,
F‘alaafia Re fun wa,

Maa f’ owo Re to wa n so,
Tit‘ ao fi de ‘bugbe Re.
N‘ile t‘o dara julo

title_english: Be known to us in breaking bread,
passage_english: AND THEY TOLD WHAT THINGS WERE DONE IN THE WAY, AND HOW HE WAS KNOWN OF THEM IN BREAKING OF BREAD. LUKE 24:35
passage_yoruba: WON SI N ROYIN NKAN TI O SE LI ONA ATI BI O TI DI MI MO FUN WON NI BIBU AKARA. LUKU 24:35
verses_english:
Be known to us in breaking bread,
But do not then depart;
Saviour, abide with us, and spread
Thy table in our heart.

There sup with us in love divine;
Thy body and Thy blood,
That living bread, that heavenly wine,
Be our immortal food.
verses_yoruba:
Farahan wa n‘ibi ounje,
Ma si se lo nihin;
Olugbala ba wa joko,
Ko si ba wa jeun.

Fi ife mimo ba wa jeun;
K‘ ara oun eje Re,
Ounje iye, waini t‘orun
Maa bo wa titi lae.

title_english: Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power?
title_yoruba: O ti to Jesu lo fun ‘wenumo bi?
passage_english: UNTO HIM THAT LOVED US, AND WASHED US FROM OUR SINS IN HIS OWN BLOOD. REV. 1:5
passage_yoruba: ENITI O FE WA, TI O SI WE WA NINU EJE RE KURO NINU ESE WA. IFI. 1:5.
verses_english:
Have you been to Jesus for the cleansing power?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Are you fully trusting in His grace this hour?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Are you walking daily by the Savior’s side?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Do you rest each moment in the Crucified?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?

When the Bridegroom cometh will your robes be white?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
Will your soul be ready for the mansions bright,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb?

Lay aside the garments that are stained with sin,
And be washed in the blood of the Lamb;
There’s a fountain flowing for the soul unclean,
O be washed in the blood of the Lamb!
verses_yoruba:
O ti to Jesu lo fun ‘wenumo bi?
A we O n‘n‘ eje Od‘agutan?
Iwo ha gbekele Ore-Ofe Re?
A we O n‘n‘ eje Od‘agutan?

O mba Olugbala rin l‘ojojumo
A we'o n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan?
O ha gbekele Enit‘a kan mo ‘gi?
A we o n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan?

Aso re ha mo lati pade Jesu?
A fo mo n‘n‘ eje Od‘agutan
Iwo ha mura fun ‘le didan ni?
K‘a we o n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan?

Bo ewu eeri-ese si apakan,
K‘a we o n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan?
Isun kan n san fun gbogbo okan aimo,
Joo lo we n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan.
chorus_english:
Are you washed in the blood,
In the soul cleansing blood of the Lamb?
Are your garments spotless? Are they white as snow?
Are you washed in the blood of the Lamb?
chorus_yoruba:
A we O n‘nu eje
Ninu eje ti nwe okan mo?
Aso re ha funfun, o si mo laulau?
A we o n‘n‘eje Od‘agutan?

title_english: What can wash away my sin?
title_yoruba: Ki l’o le w’ese mi nu,
passage_english: THE BLOOD OF JESUS CHRIST. 1 JOHN 1:7
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU KRISTI. 1 JOHN 1:7
verses_english:
What can wash away my sin?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus;
What can make me whole again?
Nothing but the blood of Jesus.

For my pardon, this I see,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus;
For my cleansing this my plea,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus.

Nothing can for sin atone,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus;
Naught of good that I have done,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus.

This is all my hope and peace,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus;
This is all my righteousness,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
verses_yoruba:
Ki l’o le w’ese mi nu,
Ko si, leyin eje Jesu;
Ki l’o tun le wo mi san,
ko si, leyin eje Jesu.

Fun ’wenumo mi, n ko ri
Nkan mi, lehin eje Jesu;
ohun ti mo gbekele,
Fun ’dariji, l’eje Jesu.

Etutu f’ese ko si,
Ko si, lehin eje Jesu;
Ise rere kan ko si,
Ko si, lehin eje Jesu.

Gbogbo igbekele mi,
Ireti mi, l’eje Jesu;
Gbogbo ododo mi ni
Eje, kiki eje Jesu.
chorus_english:
Oh! precious is the flow
That makes me white as snow;
No other fount I know,
Nothing but the blood of Jesus.
chorus_yoruba:
A! eje yebiye
T’o mu mi fun bi sno
Ko si ‘sun miran mo,
Ko si, lehin eje Jesu

title_english: Sweet feast of love divine,
passage_english: HE BROUGHT ME TO THE BANQUETING HOUSE. SONG OF SOLOMON. 2:4
passage_yoruba: “O MU MI WA SIBI ASE" - ORIN SOLOMONI .2:4
verses_english:
Sweet feast of love divine,
Tis grace that makes us free,
To feed upon this bread and wine,
In mem‘ry, Lord of Thee.

Here every welcome guest Waits,
Lord, from Thee to learn
The secrets of Thy Father’s breast,
And all Thy grace discern.

Here conscience ends its strife,
And faith delights to prove,
The sweetness of the bread of life,
The fullness of Thy love.

The blood that flow‘d for sin,
In symbol here we see,
And feel the blessed pledge within,
That we are loved of Thee.

Oh, if this glimpse of love,
Is so divinely sweet,
What will it be, O Lord, above,
Thy gladdening smile to meet.

To see Thee face to face,
Thy perfect likeness wear,
And all Thy ways of wondrous grace, Through endless years declare.
verses_yoruba:
Ase ife Orun,
Oore-Ofe l’o je,
K’a je akara, k’a mu wain,
Ni ‘ranti Re Jesu.

Oluwa, a n duro,
Lati ko eko naa,
T’ohun ti n be l’aye Baba,
At'oore-ofe Re.

Eri-okan ko to,
lgbagbo l'o fi han,
Pe adun akara iye,
Ekun ife re ni.

Eje ti n san f’ese,
L'a r’apere re yii,
Eri si ni li okan wa,
Pe lwo feran wa.

A! eri die yii,
Bi o ba dun bayii,
Yoo ti dun to l'oke orun,
Gbat' a ba r'oju Re?

Lati ri oju Re,
Lati ri b'O ti ri,
K'asi maa so ti oore Re,
Titi aiyeraiye.

title_english: King of mercy, from Thy throne on high
passage_english: GIVE EAR, O SHEPHERD OF ISRAEL, THOU THAT LEADEST JOSEPH LIKE A FLOCK. PSALM 80:1
passage_yoruba: FI ETI SI NI, IWO OLUSO-AGUTAN ISRAELI, IWO TI O NDA JOSEFU BI OWO-AGUTAN. ORIN DAFIDI 80:1
verses_english:
King of mercy, from Thy throne on high
Look down in love, and hear our humble cry.

Thou tender Shepherd of the blood-bought sheep,
Thy feeble wandering flock in safety keep.

O gentle Saviour, by Thy death we live;
To contrite sinners life eternal give.

Thou art the Bread of heaven, on Thee we feed,
Be near to help our souls in time of need.

Thou art the mourmer's Stay, the sinner's Friend,
Sweet Fount of joy and blessings without end.

O come and cheer us with Thy heavenly grace;
Reveal the brightness of Thy glorious face.

In cooling cloud by day, in fire by night,
Be near our steps, and make our darkness light.

Go where we go, abide where we abide,
In life, in death, our Comfort, Strength and Guide.

O lead us daily with Thine eye of love,
And bring us safely to our home above.
verses_yoruba:
‘Wo Oba aanu, lat‘ ori ‘ite Re.
Fi ife wo wa, si gbo igbe wa.

‘Wo Olusagutan eniyan Re,
Pa awon agbo agutan Re mo.

Olugbala, iku Re n‘iye wa,
F‘iye ainipekun fun gbogbo wa.

Ounje orun, Iwo ni ounje wa,
Se ranwo okan wa nigba ponju;

‘Wo l‘Alabaro, Ore elese.
‘Wo n‘ibu ayo wa titi laelae.

Wa f‘oore-ofe Re mu ‘nu wa dun,
Si je k‘a maa ri ojurere Re.

Nigba osan, ati nigba oru,
Sunmo wa, k‘o s‘ookun wa d‘imole.

Ma ba wa lo, k‘O si maa ba wa gbe,
N‘iye, n‘iku, maa je itunu wa.

L‘ojoojumo f‘oju ‘fe Re to wa,
Si mu wa de le wa l‘aalafia.

title_english: Lord, to whom except to Thee
passage_english: LORD, TO WHOM SHALL WE GO? THOU HAST THE WORDS OF ETERNAL LIFE. JOHN 6:68
passage_yoruba: OLUWA ODO TALI AWA O LO! IWO LI O NI ORO IYE AINIPEKUN. JOHANU 6:68
verses_english:
Lord, to whom except to Thee
Shall our wandering spirits go;
Thee Whom it is light to see,
And Eternal Life to know?
Awful is that Life to Thine
Which the Spirit's Breath inspires;
And the Food must be Divine
Which each new-born soul desires.

Israel on Heavenly seed
Fed and died in days of yore:
But the souls, that on Thee feed,
Never thirst nor hunger more.
Lord, to whom except to Thee
Shall we go when ills betide?
Who except Thyself can be
Hope and help and strength and guide?

Who can cleanse the soul from sin,.
Hear the prayer, and seal the vow?
Who can fill the void within,
Blessed Saviour, who but Thou?
Therefore evermore I'll give
Laud and praise, my God, to Thee:
Evermore in Thee I live,
Evermore live Thou in me.
verses_yoruba:
Tal‘ awa iba to lo
Bikos‘ odo Re Jesu?
‘Wo ti se imole wa,
At‘iye ainipekun
Emi Re ti l‘owo to
T‘Emi Mimo n mi si wa?
Ounje Re Atorunwa,
Li okan atunbi n fe.

Israeli li atijo,
Won je manna, won si ku;
Awon t‘o je l‘ara Re
Won ki yoo kebi laelae
Tal‘ awa iba to lo
‘Gbat‘ ibi ba yi wa ka?
Bikos‘ odo Re Jesu
‘Wo t’ise iranwo wa.

Tal‘o le we okan wa,
T‘o si le gbo igbe wa?
Tani le kun okan wa
Olugbala, lehin Re,
Iyin at‘ope fun O
Titi, ‘Wo Olorun mi;
Ninu Re l’em’ o maa wa,
Ma wa ninu mi titi.

title_english: Here, O my Lord, I see Thee face to face
title_yoruba: Oluwa, mo n ba O pade nihin
passage_english: I WILL LOVE HIM, AND WILL MANIFEST MYSELF TO HIM. JOHN 14:21
passage_yoruba: EMI O SI FE E, EMI O SI FI ARA MI HAN FUN UN. JOHANU 14:21
verses_english:
Here would I feed upon the bread of God,
Here drink with Thee the royal wine of Heaven;
Here would I lay aside each earthly load,
Here taste afresh the calm of sin forgiven.

Too soon we rise; the symbols disappear;
The feast, though not the love, is past and gone.
The bread and wine remove, but Thou art there
Nearer than ever still my shield and sun.

Feast after feast thus comes and passes by;
Yet, passing, points to the glad feast above,
Giving sweet foretaste of the festal joy,
The Lamb's great bridal feast of bliss and love. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, mo n ba O pade nihin 
Igbagbo mu mi wo ohun orun 
Un o fi agbara ro mo oore Re, 
Un o si fi ara aare mi ti O.

Emi o je akara Olorun, 
Emi o mu waini orun pelu Re, 
Nihin, un o so eru aye kale, 
Nihin, un o gba idariji ese

Emi ko ni ‘ranwo mi lehin Re, 
Apa re l‘o to lati f‘ara ti, 
O to wayii, Oluwa mi, o to, 
Agbara mi n be ninu ipa Re.

Temi ni ese, Tire l‘ododo, 
Temi l‘ebi, Tire l‘eje ‘wenu, 
Ewu, aabo, oun alaafia mi 
L‘Eje at‘ododo Re Oluwa.

Bi ase yii ti n de ti o si n lo, 
O n ran wa leti ase nla t‘orun; 
O n fi ayo didun ase naa han 
Ase ayo, ‘yawo Od‘ -Aguntan. (Amin).

title_english: Saviour of all, to thee we bow
passage_english: EXCEPT YE EAT THE FLESH OF THE SON OF MAN, AND DRINK HIS BLOOD, YE HAVE NO LIFE IN YOU. JOHN 6:53
passage_yoruba: BIKOSEPE EYIN BA JE ARA OMO ENIYAN, KI EYIN KI O SI MU EJE RE, EYIN KO NI IYE NINU YIN. JOHANU 6:53
verses_english:
Saviour of all, to thee we bow,
And own thee faithful to thy word;
We hear thy voice, and open now
Our hearts to entertain our Lord.

Come in, come in, thou heavenly guest,
Delight in what thyself hast given;
On thy own gifts and graces feast,
And make the contrite heart thy heaven.

Smell the sweet odour of our prayers,
Our sacrifice of praise approve,
And treasure up our gracious tears,
And rest in thy redeeming love.

Beneath thy shadow let us sit,
Call us thy friends, and love, and bride,
And bid us freely drink and eat
Thy dainties, and be satisfied.

O let us on thy fulness feed,
And eat thy flesh, and drink thy blood!
Jesu, thy blood is drink indeed,
Jesu, thy flesh is angels' food.

The heavenly manna faith imparts,
Faith makes thy fulness all our own;
We feed upon thee in our hearts,
And find that heaven and thou are one. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, a teriba fun O 
A mo p‘O mu oro Re se 
A gbo ohun Re a si si 
Okan wa lati gba O si.

Wole wa, Alejo orun 
Layo si ohun t‘O fun wa 
Ba wa je ninu ebun Re 
So okan ‘kaanu d‘ile Re.

Joo tewogba adura wa 
K‘O si gba ebo iyin wa 
F‘omije wa s‘iranti Re 
Sinmi n‘nu ‘fe ‘rapada Re.

K‘a joko labe iji Re 
Pe wa l‘ore at‘ olufe 
Jek‘a je, k‘a si mu l’ofe 
K‘a ni ‘telorun lodo Re.

O let us on thy fulness feed, 
And eat thy flesh, and drink thy blood! 
Jesu, thy blood is drink indeed, 
Jesu, thy flesh is angels' food.

Gbagbo n f’ounje orun bo wa 
L‘o n fi oore ofe to wa. 
A n fi O s‘ounje l’okan wa 
A mo pe orun n be n‘nu Re 
(Amin).

title_english: Draw nigh and take the Body of the Lord
passage_english: THIS IS MY BODY WHICH IS GIVEN FOR YOU: THIS DO IN REMEMBRANCE OF ME. LUKE 22:19
passage_yoruba: ARA MI TI A FI FUN YIN LI EYII, E MAA SE EYII NI IRANTI MI. LUKU 22:19
verses_english:
Draw nigh and take the Body of the Lord;
And drink the holy Blood for you outpoured.

Saved by His Body, hallowed by His Blood,
With souls refreshed we render thanks to God.

Salvation's Giver, Christ, the only Son,
By His dear Cross and Blood the victory won.

Offered was He for greatest and for least,
Himself the Victim, and Himself the Priest.

Victims were offered by the law of old,
Which in a type celestial mysteries told.

He, Ransomer from death, and Light from shade,
Now gives His Holy grace His saints to aid.

Approach ye then with faithful hearts sincere,
And take the pledges of Salvation here.

He, that in this world rules His saints, and shields,
To all believers life eternal yields.

With Heavenly Bread makes them that hunger whole,
Gives Living Waters to the thirsting soul.

O Judge of all, our only Saviour Thou,
In this Thy feast of love be with us now.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Sunmohin, k‘o gba Ara Oluwa, 
K‘o mu Eje mimo t‘a ta fun O.

Ara at‘eje naa l‘o gba o la 
N‘itura okan, f‘ope f‘Olorun.

Elebun igbala, Omo Baba, 
Agbelebu Re fun wa n‘isegun.

A fi Oun rubo fun tagba tewe, 
Oun tikare, l‘Ebo, Oun l‘Alufa.

Gbogb’ebo awon Ju laye ‘gbani 
J’apere ti n so t’Ebo ‘yanu yii.

Oun l‘Oludande, Oun ni Imole, 
Oun n f‘Emi ran awon Tire lowo.

N je e f’okan igbagbo sunmo, ‘hin, 
Ki e si gba eri igbala yii.

Oun l‘o n sakoso eniyan Re laye, 
Oun l‘o n f‘ iye ainipekun fun wa.

O n f’ounje orun f’awon t‘ebi n pa, 
Omi iye fun okan ti n poungbe.

Onidajo wa, Olugbala wa, 
Pelu wa ni ase ife Re yii 
Amin.

title_english: Till He come Oh, let the words
passage_english: YE DO SHEW THE LORD'S DEATH TILL HE COME. 1 CORINTHIANS 11:26
passage_yoruba: EYIN FI IKU OLUWA HAN TITI YIO FI DE. I KORINTI 11:26
verses_english:
When the weary ones we love
Enter on their rest above,
Seems the earth so poor and vast,
All our life-joy overcast?
Hush! be every murmur dumb:
It is only till He come.

Clouds and conflicts round us press:
Would we have one sorrow less?
All the sharpness of the Cross,
All that tells the world is loss,
Death, and darkness, and the tomb,
Only whisper? Till He come.`

See, the Feast of Love is spread,
Drink the Wine, and break the Bread;
Sweet memorials --- till the Lord
Call us round His Heavenly Board;
Some from earth, from glory some
Severed only, till He come.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbat‘ awon ti a feran 
Bo si ‘sinmi won l’oke, 
T‘o jo pe aye wa pin, 
Ti adun re si koro; 
E dakun, e ma b‘ohun 
Kiki k‘Oun to de saa ni.

Ibanuje yi wa ka, 
A ha fe k‘o dinku bi? 
Gbogbo eru iponju 
Gbogbo ofo aye yii, 
Iku, ofo oun ‘boji 
N so jeejee pe, ‘K‘ Oun to de.

Wo tabil‘ ife t‘a te, 
Mu waini, si j‘akara; 
‘Ranti didun, k‘Oluwa 
To pe wa s‘ounje orun, 
Ni lat‘aye ‘mi l‘orun, 
Won pinya tit‘ Oun fi de. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, we lift our souls to Thee
passage_english: THAT SO MANY OF US AS WERE BAPTIZED INTO JESUS CHRIST WERE BAPTIZED INTO HIS DEATH? ROMANS 6:3
passage_yoruba: IYE AWON TI A BAPTIST SINU JESU KRISTI, A BAPTIST WON SINU IKU RE. ROMU 6:3
verses_english:
Oh let Thine unction on them rest,
Thy grace their souls renew;
And write within their tender breast
Thy name and nature too.

Thy faithful servants let them prove
Girded with truth divine;
Be sharers in Thy dying love,
And followers of Thine.

Lord, plant us all into Thy death,
That we Thy life may prove;
Partakers of Thy cross beneath,
And of Thy crown above.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Iwo l‘a gbohun si, 
Mi Emi Mimo Re 
Si awon eniyan wonyii 
Baptis‘ won s‘iku Re

K‘o fi agbara Re fun won. 
Fun won l‘okan titun; 
Ko ‘ruko Re si aya won,
Fi emi Re kun won.

Je ki won ja bi ajagun 
Labe opagun Re; 
Mu won f‘otito d‘amure, 
Ki won rin l‘ona Re.

Oluwa, gbin wa s‘iku Re, 
K‘a jogun iye Re; 
Laye, k’a ru agbelebu, 
K‘a ni ade Orun. 
(Amin).

title_english: This is Jehovah’s great command
passage_english: UNLESS ONE IS BORN OF WATER AND THE SPIRIT, HE CANNOT ENTER THE KINGDOM OF GOD. JOHN 3:5
passage_yoruba: BIKOSEPE A TUN ENIYAN BI NIPA OMI ATI NIPA EMO OUN KI YIO LE WO IJOBA OLORUN. JOHN 3:5
verses_english:
This is Jehovah’s great command,
And ever it shall be;
Let sinners like you and like me,
Be regenerated.

Our paths, no doubt, shall be darken’d,
If we are still in sin;
His kingdom then we cannot see,
If we ’re not born again.

If we are baptized many time
Vanity shall they be
It cannot wash away our sins
If we ‘re not born again.

All the evil works that we do,
Without the help of God;
They cannot renew all our hearts,
If we ‘re not born again.

Depart from thy daily sins now
Cut satan’s chain away;
Believe the Lord with all thy hearts
Thou shalt be born again. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Eyii l’ ase nla Jehofa,
Yio wa titi lae;
Elese b’ iwo at’ emi,
K’ a tun gbogbo wa bi.

Okunkun yoo je ipa wa,
B’ a wa ninu ese;
A ki o ri ijoba Re,
Bi a ko d’ atunbi.

Bi baptisi wa je ’gbaarun,
Asan ni gbogbo re;
Eyii ko le w’ ese wa nu,
Bi a ko tun wa bi.

Wo ise were ti a n se,
Ko ni iranwo Re;
Won ko s’ okan wa di otun,
B’ awa ko d’ atunbi.

Lo kuro ninu ese re
Ja ewon Esu nu;
Gba Kristi gbo tokantokan
Iwo o d’ atunbi. 
(Amin).

title_english: Stand, soldier of the cross
passage_english: AND NOW WHY TARRIEST THOU? ARISE, AND BE BAPTIZED, AND WASH AWAY THY SINS, CALLING ON THE NAME OF THE LORD. ACTS OF APOSTLE. 22:16
passage_yoruba: KINI IWO SI DURO SI NISISIYII, DIDE KI A BAPTISI RE, KI IWO KI O SI WE ESE RE NU, KI O SI MAA PE ORUKO OLUWA. ISE AWON APOSTELI. 22:16
verses_english:
Stand, soldier of the cross,
Thy high allegiance claim,
And vow to hold the world but loss
For thy Redeemer’s name.

Arise, and be baptized,
And wash thy sins away;
Thy league with God be solemnized,
Thy faith avouched today.

Our heavenly country now,
Our Lord and Master, thine,
Receive imprinted on thy brow
His passion's awful sign.

No more thine own, but Christ’s,
With all the saints of old,
Apostles, seers, evangelists,
And martyr throngs enrolled.

In God’s whole armor strong,
Front hell’s embattled powers:
The warfare may be sharp and long,
The victory must be ours.

O bright the conqueror’s crown,
The song of triumph sweet,
When faith casts every trophy down
At our great captain’s feet.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Duro, omo ogun, 
F‘enu re so f‘aye, 
Si jeje pe, ofo l‘aye 
Nitori Jesu re.

Dide, k’a baptis‘ re, 
K’o we ese re nu, 
Wa b‘Olorun da majemu 
So igbagbo re loni.

Tire ni Oluwa,
Ati ijo orun,
Sa gb’ aami yii siwaju re,
Aami Oluwa re.

‘Wo ki se t‘ara re 
Bikose ti Kristi; 
A ko oruko re po mo 
T‘awon mimo ‘gbani.

Ni‘hamora Jesu 
Kojuja si esu;
Bo ti wu k‘ogun na le to 
Awa ni yo segun.

Ade didara ni, 
Orin na, didun ni; 
‘Gba ta ba ko ikogun JO 
S‘ese Olugbala. 
(Amin).

title_english: Herein doth perfect rest abide
passage_english: THE BLOOD OF JESUS CHRIST HIS SON CLEANSETH US FROM ALL SIN. 1 JOHN 1:7
passage_yoruba: EJE JESU KRISTI OMO RE NI N WE WA NU KURO NINU ESE WA GBOGBO. 1 JOHANU 1:7
verses_english:
Herein doth perfect rest abide
By His side where blood flows
This alone is my only hope
That Jesus died for me.

Jesus, my Saviour and my Lord
The foundation for my sins,
Sprinkle me with Thy precious blood
That I may be made pure.

Wash me, Lord, and make me thine own
Wash me, and be Thou mine
Wash me, and not my feet alone
My hands and my heart too.

Work Thou in my heart, Lord Jesus
Till faith comes to an end
And until hope comes to an end
And my heart comes to rest.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Nihin yii n‘isinmi gbe wa, 
Niha Re t‘ eje n san; 
Eyiinikan n‘ireti mi, 
Pe Jesu ku fun mi.

Olugbala, Olorun mi, 
Orisun f‘ese mi; 
Maa f‘eje Re won mi titi, 
K‘ emi le di mimo.

We mi, si se mi ni Tire, 
We mi, si je temi; 
We mi, k‘ is‘ ese mi nikan, 
Owo at‘ okan mi.

Maa sise l‘okan mi, Jesu, 
Titi ‘gbagbo yoo pin; 
Titi’ reti yoo fi dopin, 
T‘ okan mi yoo sinmi. 
(Amin).

title_english: Our great captain and our saviour
passage_english: NOW THEN IT IS NO MORE I THAT DO IT, BUT SIN THAT DWELLETH IN ME. ROMANS 7:17
passage_yoruba: NJE NISISIYI KI ISE EMI LI O NSE E MO, BIKOSE ESE TI O NGBE INU MI. ROMU 7:17.
verses_english:
Thou the beauty of the father,
Make these little ones like thee;
Create them in thy own image,
Prepared for thy courts above.

Make them valiant warriors for thee,
Soldiers brave and strong we pray,
Strong to vanquish hosts of satan,
And to overcome the world.

Let Thy words like coals of fire,
In the mouth of Thy children,
Burn sin totally to ashes,
That our bodies be made whole.

Keep them all for thy glorious work,
And that spotless they may be;
Teach them all how to bear the cross,
Each day they live here on earth.

Blessed be the plan of salvation,
For the good of these they youths;
Deliver them, lead them, watch them,
And at last, do save their souls. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Balogun! Olugbala wa, 
Gb‘ omo wonyi t‘a bun O; 
Se won ye fun ise Tiree, 
Arole iye wonyii.

Arewa Baba wa orun, 
Mu k‘awon wonyii jo O 
N‘nu aworan Tire paapaa, 
Lo won s‘agbala oke.

Se won l‘ agannigan mimo, 
Om-ogun t‘o lera; 
Ki won fo itegun Esu. 
Ki won si segun aye.

K‘ oro Re dabi ogunna, 
L‘enu awon omo Re; 
Ti yoo jo ese l‘ ajorun, 
K‘ ara ba le da sasa

Pa won mo fun ‘se ogo Re, 
Ki won wa lailabawon; 
KO won lati r‘agbelebu,
Lojoojumo aye won.

Bukun ‘lana igbala yii, 
Fun ire omo wonyii; 
Gba won, to won, si maa so won, 
Nikeyin gb‘ okan won la. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, Thou that feedeth Thy flock
title_yoruba: Jesu, ‘Wo ti n bo agbo Re
passage_english: I AM THE GOOD SHEPHERD. JOHN 10:14
passage_yoruba: EMI NI OLUSO-AGUTAN RERE. JOHN 10:14
verses_english:
Jesus, Thou that feedeth Thy flock
Like the kind and good shepherd
Who gives to them Thy tender care
And embraces the young ones.

Receive these children, we pray Thee
Draw them to Thy dear embrace,
We have the blest assurance that
No evil can harm them there.

There, they will never go astray,
The lion will not hunt them,
And let Thy compassionate love
Be their portion all their life.

In Thy green pastures up on high
Let them find a place of rest;
Let them eat the green, tender grass
And drink waters of Thy love.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, ‘Wo ti n bo agbo Re, 
B‘ olus‘agutan rere, 
Ti ‘sike awon t‘o dera, 
Ti ‘gb‘awon odo mora.

Jowo! gba omode wonyii, 
F‘aanu gba won mo aya; 
L‘o daniloju pe, 
Ewu ki yoo wu won n‘be.

Nibe, won ko ni sako mo 
Ekun ki yoo le pa won; 
Je ki ‘ronu ife nla Re 
Dabo won l’ona aye.

N‘nu papa Re oke orun, 
Je ki won ri 'bi 'sinmi 
Ki won j‘oko tutu yoyo. 
Ki won m‘omi ife Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: See Israel’s gentle shepherd stand
passage_english: AND HE TOOK THEM UP IN HIS ARMS, …… AND BLESSED THEM. MARK 10:16
passage_yoruba: OS I GBE WON L’APA RE ……. O SURE FUN WON. MARKU 10:16
verses_english:
See Israel’s gentle shepherd stand
With all-engaging charms;
Hark! how He calls the tender lambs,
And folds them in His arms.

Permit them to approach, He cries,
Nor scorn their humble name;
For ’twas to bless such souls as these
The Lord of angels came.

We bring them, Lord, in thankful hands,
And yield them up to Thee;
Joyful that we ourselves are Thine,
Thine let our offspring be.

Ye little flock, with pleasure hear;
Ye children, seek His face,
And fly with transport to receive
The blessings of His grace.

If orphans they are left behind,
Thy guardian care we trust,
That care shall heal our bleeding hearts,
While weeping o’er their dust.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Woo b‘Olusagutan Israel‘ 
Ti fi ayo duro; 
Lati gb’ awon Od‘agutan, 
K’O si ko won mora.

OUn si wipe, Je ki won wa 
E mase kegan won 
Lati sure fun iru won, 
L‘Oba Angel‘ se wa.

Pelu ope l‘a gbe won wa, 
A jowo won fun O, 
A yo; bi a ti je Tire 
K‘omo wa je Tire.

E maa yo; odo agutan,
K’e maa saferi Re,
Pelu ayo ni k’e sunmo on,
K’o le sure fun yin.

Bi a ba fi won s’aye lo,
‘Wo to Baba fun won,
B won si ku ni owo wa,
Tu wa ninu, Jesu.
(Amin).

title_english: Come, Holy Ghost! come from on high
passage_english: BAPTIZING THEM IN THE NAME OF THE FATHER, AND OF THE SON, AND OF THE HOLY GHOST. MATT. 28:19.
passage_yoruba: BAPTISI WON L’ORUKO BABA, ATI NITI OMO ATI NITI EMI MIMO. MATT. 28:19.
verses_english:
Come, Holy Ghost! come from on high,
Baptizer of our spirits Thou!
The sacramental seal apply,
And witness with the water now.

Exert Thy gracious power divine,
And sprinkle thou th'atoning blood;
May Father, Son, and Spirit join
To seal this child a child of God.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Wa, Emi Mimo sokale 
Oni baptisi okan wa; 
M‘edidi majemu Re wa, 
K‘o si se eri omi yii.

Tu agbara nla Re jade, 
K‘o si won eje etutu; 
Ki Baba, Omo at‘Emi, 
Jo so (won) o d‘omo Olorun. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, we lift our souls to Thee
title_yoruba: Jesu a gb’ okan wa si O
passage_english: “LET THE LITTLE CHILDREN COME TO ME”. MARK 10:14.
passage_yoruba: “E JE KI AWON OMO KEKERE KI O WA SODO MI”. MARKU 10:14
verses_english:
Oh let Thine unction on them rest,
Thy grace their souls renew;
And write within their tender breast
Thy name and nature too.

Thy faithful servants let them prove
Girded with truth divine;
Be sharers in Thy dying love,
And followers of Thine.

Lord, plant us all into Thy death,
That we Thy life may prove;
Partakers of Thy cross beneath,
And of Thy crown above. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu a gb’ okan wa si O,
Mi Emi Re si won;
Si baptis’ omode wonyii,
Baptis’ won s’ iku Re.

K’ ororo Re wa l’ ori won (re),
Si tun emi (re) won se:
Ko oruko Re Oluwa,
Si aya gbogbo won.

Ki won (oun) je iranse Tire,
K’ ooto s’ amure won (re):
Ki won (oun) s’ olupin iku Re,
At’ omo lehin Re.

Gbin gbogbo wa si iku Re,
K’ a le ni iye Re;
K’ a le gbe agbelebu Re,
K’ a le ni ade Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: Come! Holy Spirit come
passage_english: “WHOEVER RECEIVES ONE OF THESE LITTLE CHILDREN IN MY NAME RECEIVES ME.” MARK 9:37
passage_yoruba: ENIKENI TI O BA GBA OKAN NINU AWON OMODE WONYII LI ORUKO MI O GBA MI. MARKU 9:37
verses_english:
Come! Holy Spirit come,
Thine faithful to baptize;
With them in Holy Covenant,
Cleanse them from sin we plead.

Satan’s scepter destroy,
Immerse them in Thine
Father and Son and Holy Ghost,
Them adopt Thine to be. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Emi Olorun wa,
Baptis’ awon wonyii:
Ba won da majemu mimo,
We won kuro l’ ese.

Fo ’pa Esu tutu,
We won ’nu eje Re;
Baba, Omo, Emi Mimo,
So won di Omo Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: O God our strength, our hope
passage_english: “AND I WILL RECEIVE YOU I WILL BE A FATHER TO YOU… MY SONS AND DAUGHTERS, SAYS THE LORD ALMIGHTY.” II COR. 6:17-18
passage_yoruba: EMI O GBA YIN, EMI O SI JE BABA FUN YIN …OMOKUNRIN MI ATI OMOBINRIN MI L’OLUWA OLODUMARE WI”. II KORINTI 6:17-18
verses_english:
O God our strength, our hope, our rock
Whose promise faileth never,
Into Thy chosen blood-bought flock
Receive this child for ever.

Now seal’d with Thy thrice holy Name
In these baptismal waters,
For him a place we humbly claim
Among Thy sons and daughters.

We stamp the cross upon his brow,
The symbol of Thy passion;
O Christ, vouchsafe his earliest vow
May be his life’s confession.

And, Father, grant nor life nor death
From Thee Thy child may sever,
Thy soldier true to plighted faith,
Thy servant, Thine for ever. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Baba, Apat’ agbara wa,
Ileri eniti ki ’ye,
Sinu agbo eniyan Re,
Joo, gba omo yi titi lae.

A ti f’omi yii saami fun un,
Li Oruko Metalokan;
A si n toro ipo kan fun un,
Laarin awon omo Tire.

A sa l’aami agbelebu,
Apere iya ti O je;
Krist, k’ ilera re owuro
Je ’jewo ojo aye re.

Fifunni, k’iku oun iye,
Maa je omo Re lodo Re;
K’ oun je om’- ogun Re tooto,
Om’odo Re, Tire laelae. 
(Amin).

title_english: esus, Father of the Child
passage_english: AND DO NOT FORBID THEM. MARK 10:14
passage_yoruba: E MA SI SE DA WON L’EKUN. MARKU 10:14
verses_english:
Jesus, Father of the Child,
Thine commands all we obey;
The child brought we unto Thee,
Adopt and make him Thine own.

In sin was he begotten,
Cleanse him thoroughly from sin;
By Thine blood he is redeemed,
May he of Thine Gift partake. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, Baba omode,
Ase Re ni awa n se;
A m’omo yi wa ’do Re,
Ki iwo so di Tire.

Ninu ese ni a bii,
Wee kuro nin’ ese re;
Eje Re ni a fi raa,
K’o pin ninu Ebun Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: Come, Holy Spirit, come
passage_english: HE WILL ALSO BE FILLED WITH THE HOLY SPIRIT. LUKE 1:15
passage_yoruba: OUN O SI KUN FUN EMI MIMO. LUKU 1:15
verses_english:
Thy light, Thy love impart,
And let it ever be
A holy, humble, happy heart,
A dwelling-place for Thee.

Let Thy rich grace increase,
Through all my early days,
The fruits of purity and peace,
To Thine eternal praise. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Wa, Emi Mimo, wa,
Gb’ ebe irele mi;
Fi okan mi se ile Re,
F’ ibukun Re sibe.

F’ ife Re s’ okan mi,
K’ o si mu k’ o maa je
Okan mimo, okan ayo,
Ati ibugbe Re.

Ni igbe ewe mi,
Ki oore- ofe Re
Mu opo eso rere wa,
Fun ’yin Oruko Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: Gentle Jesus, meek and mild
passage_english: AND JESUS CALLED A LITTLE CHILD UNTO HIM. MATT. 18:2
passage_yoruba: JESU SI PE OMO KEKERE KAN SODO RE. MATT. 18:2
verses_english:
Gentle Jesus, meek and mild,
Look upon a little child;
Pity my simplicity,
Suffer me to come to Thee.

Fain I would to Thee be brought,
Dearest God, forbid it not;
Give me, dearest God, a place
In the kingdom of Thy grace.

Loving Jesus, gentle Lamb,
In Thy gracious hands I am;
Make me, Savior, what Thou art,
Live Thyself within my heart.	
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, ‘Wo onirele, 
Wo mi, emi omode; 
Kaanu fun aimokan mi, 
Si je k‘ emi wa do Re.

Odagutan Olorun 
‘Wo ni k‘o j‘apere mi, 
Iwo tutu, ‘Wo tenu; 
O si ti s‘omode ri.

Jesu, Ore omode, 
Ni owo Re ni mo wa; 
Se mi gege b‘O ti ri 
Si maa gbe ‘nu mi titi. 
(Amin).

title_english: Now the day is over
passage_english: WHEN THOU LIEST DOWN, THOU SHALT NOT BE AFRAID: YEA, THOU SHALT LIE DOWN, AND THY SLEEP SHALL BE SWEET. PROVERB 3:24
passage_yoruba: NIGBATI IWO DUBULE, IWO KI YIO BERU; NITOOTO, IWO DUBULE, OORUN RE YIO SI DUN. OWE 3:24
verses_english:
Now the day is over,
Night is drawing nigh,
Shadows of the evening
Steal across the sky.

Now the darkness gathers,
Stars begin to peep,
Birds, and beasts and flowers
Soon will be asleep.

Jesus, give the weary
Calm and sweet repose;
With Thy tenderest blessing
May mine eyelids close.

Grant to little children
Visions bright of Thee;
Guard the sailors tossing
On the deep, blue sea.

Comfort those who suffer,
Watching late in pain;
Those who plan some evil
From their sin restrain.

Through the long night watches
May Thine angels spread
Their white wings above me,
Watching round my bed.

When the morning wakens,
Then may I arise
Pure, and fresh, and sinless
In Thy holy eyes.

Glory to the Father,
Glory to the Son,
And to Thee, blest Spirit,
While all ages run. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ojo oni lo tan 
Oru sunmole; 
Okunkun ti de na, 
Ile si ti su.

Okunkun bo ile, 
Awon ‘rawo yo; 
Eranko at‘eye 
Lo si busun won.

Jesu f‘oorun didun 
F‘eni alaare; 
Je ki ibukun Re 
Pa oju mi de.

Je k‘omo kekere 
La ala rere; 
S‘oloko t‘ewu n wu 
Ni oju omi.

Maa toju alaisan 
Ti ko r‘oorun sun; 
Awon ti n ro ibi 
Joo, da won l‘ekun.

Ninu gbogbo oru, 
Je k‘angeli Re 
Maa se oluso mi 
L’ori ‘eni mi.

‘Gba‘ ile ba si mo 
Je k‘emi dide 
B‘omo ti ko l‘ese 
Niwaju Re

Ogo ni fun Baba, 
Ati fun Omo, 
Ati f‘Emi Mimo 
Lae ati laelae. (Amin).

title_english: By cool Siloam’s shady rill
passage_english: AND THE CHILD GREW, AND WAXED STRONG IN SPIRIT. LUKE 2:40
passage_yoruba: OMO NAA SI N DAGBA, O SI LE L’OKAN. LUKU 2:40.
verses_english:
By cool Siloam’s shady rill
How fair the lily grows!
How sweet the breath, beneath the hill,
Of Sharon’s dewy rose!

Lo! such the child whose early feet
The paths of peace have trod,
Whose secret heart, with influence sweet,
Is upward drawn to God.

By cool Siloam’s shady rill
The lily must decay;
The rose that blooms beneath the hill
Must shortly fade away.

O Thou Whose infant feet were found
Within Thy Father’s shrine,
Whose years with changeless virtue crowned,
Were all alike divine.

Dependent on Thy bounteous breath,
We seek Thy grace alone,
In childhood, manhood, age, and death
To keep us still Thine own.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Bi osun gbege eti ‘do, 
Tutu mini-mini; 
B‘igbo dudu eti omi, 
B‘itanna ipado.

Bee l‘omo naa yio dagba 
Ti n rin l‘ona rere; 
T‘okan re n fa si Olorun 
Lat‘ igba ewe re.

Ewe tutu l‘eba odo 
B‘o pe, a re danu; 
Be n‘itanna ipa omi 
Si n re l‘akoko re.

Ibukun ni fun omo naa 
Ti n rin l‘ona Baba; 
Oba ti ki pa ipo da, 
Eni mimo laelae.

Oluwa, ‘Wo l‘a gbekele, 
Fun wa l ’oore-ofe; 
L‘ewe l‘agba ati n‘iku, 
Pa wa mo b‘Omo Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: Little drops of water
passage_english: FOR WHO HATH DESPISED THE DAY OF SMALL THINGS? ZECHARIAH 4:10
passage_yoruba: TANI HA N KEGAN OJO OHUN KEKERE? SEKARIAH 4:10.
verses_english:
Little drops of water,
little grains of sand,
make the mighty ocean
and the beauteous land.

And the little moments,
humble though they may be,
make the mighty ages
of eternity.

Little deeds of kindness,
little words of love,
make our earth an Eden,
like the heaven above.

So our little errors
lead the soul away,
from the paths of virtue
into sin to stray.

Little seeds of mercy
sown by youthful hands,
grow to bless the nations
far in heathen lands.

Glory then for ever
be to God on high,
beautiful and loving,
to eternity.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Opo ikan omi, 
Yanrin kekeke, 
Wonyi l‘od‘okun nla 
At‘ile aye.

Iseju wa kookan 
Ti a ko ka si 
L‘o n d‘odun aimoye 
Ti ainipekun.

Iwa oore die, 
Oro‘fe die, 
L‘o n s‘aye di Eden 
Ni oke orun.

Isise kekere 
L‘o n m‘okan sina, 
Kuro l‘ona rere 
Si ipa ese.

Ise aanu die 
T‘a se l‘omode 
Di ‘bukun f’orile 
T‘o jinna rere.

Awon ewe l‘ogo 
N gberin angeli; 
Se wa ye, Oluwa 
F‘egbe mimo won. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus is our Shepherd, wiping every tear
passage_english: I AM THE GOOD SHEPHERD. JOHN 10:11
passage_yoruba: EMI LI OLUSO-AGUTAN RERE. JOHN 10:11
verses_english:
Jesus is our Shepherd, wiping every tear;
Folded in His bosom, what have we to fear?
Only let us follow whither He doth lead,
To the thirsty desert, or the dewy mead.

Jesus is our Shepherd: well we know His voice,
How its gentlest whisper makes our heart rejoice;
Even when He chideth, tender is His tone:
None but He shall guide us; we are His alone.

Jesus is our Shepherd, for the sheep He bled;
Every lamb is sprinkled with the blood He shed:
Then on each He setteth His own secret sign:
They that have My Spirit, these, saith He, are Mine.

Jesus is our Shepherd, Guarded by His arm,
Though the wolves may ravin, none can do us harm:
When we tread death's valley, dark with fearful gloom,
We will fear no evil victors o'er the tomb.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluso-agutan l‘Olugbala wa, 
B‘a ba wa l‘aya Re, ki l’a o beru? 
Sa je k‘a lo s‘ibi ti Oun n to wa si, 
Ibaaje asale tab‘oko tutu.

Oluso-agutan awa m‘ohun Re 
Woo b‘oro kele Re ti n m‘okan wa dun; 
B‘o tile m ba wa wi, jeje l‘ohun Re, 
Laisi Re leyin wa awa o segbe.

Oluso-agutan ku f‘agutan Re, 
O f’eje Re won awon agutan Re, 
O si fi aami Re, s‘ara won, O ni; 
Awon t‘o l‘emi mi, awon ni t‘Emi.

Oluso-agutan, l‘abe iso Re, 
Bi koriko ba wa, ki y‘o le se nkan; 
Bi awa tile n rin lojiji iku, 
Awa ki yoo beru, awa o segun. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, meek and gentle
passage_english: AND YE SHALL KNOW THE TRUTH, AND THE TRUTH SHALL MAKE YOU FREE. JOHN 8:32
passage_yoruba: EYIN O MO OTITO, OTITO YIO SI SO YIN DI OMINIRA. JH 8:32
verses_english:
Jesus, meek and gentle,
Son of God most high,
Gracious, loving Savior,
Hear Thy children’s cry.

Pardon our offenses,
Loose our captive chains,
Break down every idol
Which our soul detains.

Give us holy freedom,
Fill our hearts with love;
Draw us, holy Jesus,
To the realms above.

Lead us on our journey,
Be Thyself the way
Through our earthly darkness
To the heavenly day.

Jesus, meek and gentle,
Son of God most high,
Gracious, loving Savior,
Hear Thy children’s cry.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Onirele,
Omo Olorun :
Alaanu, Olufe,
Gbo ‘gbe omo Re.

Fi ese wa ji wa,
Si da wa n’ ide;
Fo gbogbo orisa
Ti mbe l’ okan wa.

Fun wa ni omnira,
F’ ife s’ okan wa ;
Fa wa Jesu mimo,
S’ ibugbe l’ oke.

To wa l’ ona ajo,
Si je ona wa
La okun aiye ja
S’ imole orun.

Jesu onirele,
Omo Olorun;
Alaanu, Olufe,
Gbo ‘gbe omo Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: I want to be like Jesus
title_yoruba: Mo fe ki n dabi Jesu
passage_english: AND LEARN OF ME; FOR I AM MEEK AND LOWLY IN HEART. MATT. 11:29
passage_yoruba: KO EKO TI EMI, NITORI ONINU TUTU ATI ONIRELE OKAN LI EMI. MATT. 11:29
verses_english:
I want to be like Jesus,
So lowly and so meek,
For no one marked an angry word
That every heard Him speak.

I want to be like Jesus,
So frequently in prayer;
Alone upon the mountain-top,
He met His Father there.

I want to be like Jesus,
I never, never find
That He, though persecuted, was
To any one unkind.

I want to be like Jesus,
Engaged in doing good,
So that of me it may be said,
`She hath done what she could.`

I want to be like Jesus,
Who sweetly said to all,
`Let little children come to Me:`
I would obey the call.

But oh, I'm not like Jesus,
As any one may see;
Then, gentle Saviour, send Thy Grace,
And make me like to Thee.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo fe ki n dabi Jesu, 
Ninu iwa pele; 
Ko s’ enit’ o gboro ‘binu 
L’ enu Re leekan ri.

Mo fe ki n dabi Jesu, 
L’ adura ‘gba gbogbo; 
Lori oke ni Oun nikan 
Lo pade Baba Re.

Mo fe ki n dabi Jesu, 
Emi ko ri ka pe 
Bi won ti korira Re to, 
O s’ enikan n’ ibi.

Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu, 
Ninu ise rere; 
K’ a le wi nipa t’ emi pe, 
“O se ‘won t’o le se.”

Mo fe ki ndabi Jesu, 
T’o f’ iyonu wipe, 
“Je k’ omode wa s’ odo mi” 
Mo fe je ipe Re.

Sugbon n ko dabi Jesu 
O si han gbangba be; 
Jesu fun mi l’ ore-ofe 
Se mi ki ndabi Re. 
(Amen).

title_english: Jesus loves me, This I know
title_yoruba: Jesu fe mi, mo mo bee
passage_english: PUT HIS HANDS UPON THEM, AND BLESSED THEM. MARK 10:16
passage_yoruba: O GBE OWO RE LE WON, O SI SURE FUN WON. MARKU 10:16
verses_english:
Jesus loves me, This I know
For the Bible tells me so
Little ones to Him belong
They are weak, but He is strong.

Jesus loves me, This I know
As He loved so long ago
Taking children on His knee.
Saying, "Let them come to Me."

Jesus loves me still today
Walking with me on my way
Wanting as a friend to give
Light and love to all who live.

Jesus loves me! He will stay
Close beside me all the way
Thou hast bled and died for me
I will henceforth live for Thee...
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu fe mi, En’ t’o ku 
Lati si orun sile; 
Yio we ese mi nu, 
Jeki omo Re wole.

Jesu fe mi, sibe sii, 
Bi emi tile s’ aisan, 
Lor’ akete aisan mi, 
Yoo t’ ite Re wa so mi.

Jesu fe mi, yoo duro 
Ti mi ni gbogb’ ona mi; 
Gba n ba f’ aye yii sile, 
Yoo mu mi re ‘le orun. 
(Amin).

title_english: When He cometh, when He cometh
title_yoruba: Gbat’ O ba de, gbat’ O ba d
passage_english: AND THEY SHALL BE MINE, SAITH THE LORD OF HOSTS, IN THAT DAY WHEN I MAKE UP MY JEWELS. MALACHI 3:17
passage_yoruba: WON O SI JE TEMI, LI OLUWA AWON OMO OGUN WI, LI OJO NAA NIGBATI MO BA NSIRO OSO MI. MALAKI 3:17
verses_english:
When He cometh, when He cometh
To make up His jewels,
All His jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own.

Chorus:
Like the stars of the morning,
His brightness adorning,
They shall shine in their beauty,
Bright gems for His crown.

He will gather, He will gather
The gems for His kingdom;
All the pure ones, all the bright ones,
His loved and His own.

Little children, little children,
Who love their Redeemer,
Are the jewels, precious jewels,
His loved and His own.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbat’ O ba de, gbat’ O ba de, 
Lati sir’ oso Re; 
Gbogb’ oso Re iyebiye, 
Awon ti O fe!

Chorus:
Bi irawo owuro, 
Won ns’ ade Re loso, 
Ewa won o yo pupo, 
ewa f’ ade Re.

Yio ko jo, yio kojo, 
Oso ijoba Re; 
Awon mimo, awon didan, 
Awon ti O fe.

Awon ewe, awon ewe, 
T’ o fe Olugbala, 
Ni oso Re, iyebiye, 
Awon ti O fe. 
(Amin).

title_english: Once in royal David's city
passage_english: THE CHILD IS JESUS. LUKE 2:43.
passage_yoruba: OMO NAA NI JESU. LUK 2:43
verses_english:
Once in royal David's city
Stood a lowly cattle shed,
Where a mother laid her Baby
In a manger for His bed:
Mary was that mother mild,
Jesus Christ her little Child.

He came down to earth from heaven,
Who is God and Lord of all,
And His shelter was a stable,
And His cradle was a stall;
With the poor, and mean, and lowly,
Lived on earth our Savior holy.

And through all His wondrous childhood
He would honor and obey,
Love and watch the lowly maiden,
In whose gentle arms He lay:
Christian children all must be
Mild, obedient, good as He.

And our eyes at last shall see Him,
Through His own redeeming love;
For that Child so dear and gentle
Is our Lord in heaven above,
And He leads His children on
To the place where He is gone.

Not in that poor lowly stable,
With the oxen standing by,
We shall see Him; but in heaven,
Set at God's right hand on high;
Where like stars His children crowned2
All in white shall wait around. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Nigba kan ni Betlehemu 
Ile kekere kan wa 
Nib'iya kan te ‘mo re si 
Lori ibuje eran 
Maria n'iya Omo naa 
Jesu Kristi’ si l'Omo naa

O t'orun wa s'odo aye 
Oun l'Olorun Oluwa 
O f'ile eran se ile 
'Buje eran fun 'busun 
Lodo awon otosi 
Ni Jesu gbe li aye

Ni gbogbo igba ewe Re 
O n gboran, o si n b'ola 
O feran O si n teriba 
Fun iya ti n toju Re! 
O ye ki gbogbo' omode 
K'o se olugboran bee

'Tori Oun je awose wa 
A maa dagba bi awa 
O kere, ko le da nkan se 
A maa sokun bi awa 
O si le ba wa daro 
O le ba wa yo pelu

A o f’oju wa rii nikeyin 
Ni agbara ife Re 
Nitori Omo rere yii 
Ni Oluwa wa lorun 
O nto awa omo re 
S'ona ibiti Oun lo.

Ki ise ni ibuje eran 
Nibiti malu n jeun 
L'awa o rii; sugbon lorun 
Lowo otun Olorun 
'Gba 'won 'mo Re b'irawo 
Ba wa n'nu aso la. 
(Amin).

title_english: There’s a friend for little children
passage_english: ALL ARE YOUR'S; AND YE ARE CHRIST'S. I COR. 3:22-23
passage_yoruba: TI YIN NI GBOGBO WON, EYIN NI KRISTI. I KOR. 3:22-23
verses_english:
There’s a friend for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A friend who never changes,
Whose love will never die;
Our earthly friends may fail us,
And change with changing years,
This friend is always worthy
Of that dear name He bears.

There’s a rest for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
Who love the blessèd Savior,
And to the Father cry
A rest from every turmoil,
From sin and sorrow free,
Where every little pilgrim
Shall rest eternally.

There’s a home for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
Where Jesus reigns in glory,
A home of peace and joy
No home on earth is like it,
Nor can with it compare;
For everyone is happy
Nor could be happier there.

There’s a crown for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
And all who look for Jesus
Shall wear it by and by;
A crown of brightest glory,
Which He will then bestow
On those who found his favor
And loved His name below.

There’s a song for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
A song that will not weary,
Though sung continually;
A song which even angels
Can never, never sing
They know not Christ as Savior,
But worship Him as king.

There’s a robe for little children
Above the bright blue sky,
And a harp of sweetest music,
And palms of victory.
All, all above is treasured,
And found in Christ alone:
O come, dear little children
That all may be your own. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Isinmi kan n be f’ omode 
Loke orun lohun; 
F’ awon t’ o f’ Olugbala, 
Ti nke “Abba Baba;” 
Isinmi lowo ‘yonu, 
Low’ ese at’ ewu; 
Nibiti ‘awon omode 
Yoo sinmi titi lai.

Orin kan n be fun omode 
L’ oke orun lohun, 
Orin ti ko le su ni, 
B’ o ti wu k’ a koo to! 
Orin t’awon angeli, 
Ko le ri ko titi; 
Krist’ ki s’ Olugbala won, 
Oba l’ o je fun won

Ewu kan a be fun omode, 
Loke orun lohun, 
Harpu olohun didun! 
Imo pe isegun! 
Gbogbo ebun rere yii, 
L’ a ni ninu Jesu; 
E wa, eyin omode, 
Ki won le je ti yin. (Amin).

title_english: The sun shines its light
passage_english: AND THE LITTLE HILLS REJOICE ON EVERY SIDE. PSALMS 65:12
passage_yoruba: A FI AYO DI AWON OKE KEKEKE LI AMURE. ORIN DAFIDI 65:12
verses_english:
Even when I end,
This my song of praise
May my soul be rested in you today. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oro dun mo mi,
Ope f’ Olorun:
Oluso ti n so mi nigba mo sun.

Gbo, ’gba mo ba n de,
Orin ’yin mi yi
K’ okan mi k’o ba o duro loni. 
(Amin).

title_english: When Jesus enter’d the temple
passage_english: THE CHILDREN CRYING IN THE TEMPLE, AND SAYING, HOSANNA. MATT. 21:15
passage_yoruba: AWON OMODE NKE NI TEMPILI WIPE HASANNA. MATT. 21:15
verses_english:
When Jesus enter’d the temple
The shout of praise, we heard,
The children acknowledged His right,
And they rejoic’d in Him.

Honnassa raise the temple high,
And mixed with divers tongues
Hosannah to the King of heav’n
Unto the Davi’s seed.

Renew our days, O Lord in Thee,
O when children praise Thee,
Great is Thy strength and goodness Lord,
As in the days of old. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gba Jesu wo tempili lo, 
Ohun iyin l’a gbo; 
Omode jewo eto Re, 
Gbogbo won si n yo sii.

Hosanna mu tempili ro, 
Ahon pipo dalu; 
Hosanna si Oba t‘orun, 
S‘ iru mimo Dafidi.

Oluwa ‘sojo wa d‘otun, 
‘Gbat‘ omode yin O; 
Agbara at‘ oore Re po 
Bi t‘ojo igbani. 
(Amin).

title_english: O God the throne of Thy glory
passage_english: YOU, O GOD, PROVIDED FROM YOUR GOODNESS FOR THE POOR. PSALMS 68:10
passage_yoruba: IWO OLORUN NINU OORE RE LI O TI N PESE FUN AWON TALAKA. ORIN DAFIDI 68:10
verses_english:
O God the throne of Thy glory,
Shall forever exist;
Our parents all are very poor,
Give us Thy blessings now.

As it please Thee to make us poor;
We now beseech Thee Lord
To be our Master and our Friend.
When we are in the world.

We know that we belong to Thee,
And we are called by Thee,
We are but strangers now make us
Thy chosen children be.

Come Thou Our Shepherd visit us,
Preserve Thy little flock;
Lead us with Thy rod and Thy staff,
We children of Thy flock. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olorun ite ogo Re,
Yio wa titi lae;
Obi wa, talaka ni nwon,
F’ ibukun Re fun wa.

O wuu O ni, lati se wa,
Ni talaka; sugbon
Maa se alabojuto wa,
’Gba ti a wa l’ aye.

A mo, b’ a tile je Tire,
T’ a j’ oruko mo O,
A j’ alejo; sugbon se wa
L’ omo asayan Re.

Oluso Aguntan wa, wo
Agbo kekere Re;
F’ ogo at’ opa Re to wa,
Omo agbo Tire. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jehovah, the Lord of glory
passage_english: OUT OF THE MOUTH OF BABES AND SUCKLINGS HAST THOU ORDAINED STRENGTH. PSALM 8:2
passage_yoruba: LATI ENU AWON OMO OWO ATI OMO-OMU, NI IWO TI SE ILANA AGBARA. ORIN DAFIDI 8:2
verses_english:
Jehovah, the Lord of glory
Let the children praise Thy name
We humbly bow down before Thee
Thy great goodness is our song;
Seraph hosts, join us in praising
His loving kindness on high;
O Lord, God of glory hear us
As we praise Thy holy name.

Emmanuel, Thou who art born
And then hanged upon the cross;
Thou hast called the little children
That they should come unto Thee,
Lord, we have come to answer Thee
Let us Thy mercy receive,
That we and all Thy dear children
Come to love and serve Thee best.

O, that we would live to love Thee
And to fear Thee all our life,
And at last come and dwell with Thee
Behold Thee and praise Thy name
Jesus, Thou God of all comforts
The greatest of friends, arise
Bless us with Thy great salvation
And accept our hymns of praise.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jehofa! Olorun ogo, 
Je ki omode yin O; 
A wole n‘irele fun O, 
Oore Re ni orin wa, 
Ogun Seraf‘ dapo gb’erin 
Ife Re l‘oke orun; 
Olorun ogo, gbo tiwa, 
B‘a ti n yin oruko Re.

Emmanueli! Iwo t‘a bi, 
T‘a si fi ko or‘ igi,
O pe omode kekere,
Lati wa si odo Re; 
Oluwa, b‘o ti pe, a de, 
Je k‘a ri aanu Re gba! 
K‘awa, pel‘ awon omo Re, 
K‘a sin O, k‘a si fe O.

A ba le wa, k‘a si fe O, 
K‘a si beru Re l‘aye; 
Nikehin, k‘a wa pelu Re, 
K‘a ri O, k‘a si yin O, 
Jesu! Olorun itunu, 
Olori ore! dide, 
Fi igbala Re bukun wa, 
Joo tewogba orin wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: I love to hear the story
passage_english: THOUGH HE WAS RICH, YET FOR YOUR SAKES HE BECAME POOR. 11 COR. 8:9
passage_yoruba: BI OUN TI JE OLORO RI, SUGBON NITORI YIN O DI ALAINI. II KORINTI 8:9
verses_english:
I love to hear the story 
which angel voices tell,
How once the King of glory 
came down on earth to dwell.
I am both weak and sinful; 
but this I surely know,
The Lord came down to save me, 
because He loved me so.

I’m glad my blessèd Savior 
was once a child like me,
To show how pure and holy 
His little ones might be;
And, if I try to follow 
His footsteps here below,
He never will forget me, 
because He loves me so.

To sing His love and mercy 
my sweetest songs I’ll raise;
And, though I cannot see Him, 
I know he hears my praise;
For He has kindly promised 
that even I may go
To sing among His angels, 
because He loves me so. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo fe gbo itan kannaa
T’ awon angeli n so;
Bi Oba Ogo ti wa
Gbe aye osi yii;
Bi mo tile J’elese,
Mo mo eyii daju,
Pe Oluwa wa gba mi,
’Tori O fe mi bee.

Mo yo pe Olugbala
Ti je omode ri;
Lati fi ona mimo
Han awon omo Re;
Bi emi ba si tele
Ipase Re nihin,
Oun ko ni gbagbe mi lai,
’Tori O fe mi bee.

Ife ati aanu Re,
Y’o je orin fun mi;
B’emi ko tile le rii,
Mo mo pe, O n gbo mi;
O si ti se ileri,
Pe, mo le lo korin
Laarin awon angeli,
’Tori O fe mi bee. 
(Amin).

title_english: Heavenly Father, send your light
passage_english: HE SHALL CALL UPON ME, AND I WILL ANSWER HIM. PSALMS 91:13
passage_yoruba: OUN O PE ORUKO MI, EMI O SI DA A LOHUN. ORIN DAFIDI 91:13
verses_english:
Heavenly Father, send your light,
To us our dear children
That we ma worship and love you
From youth and all life through.

We are miserable blind sinners,
We tread the ways of death;
In thought and even in our deeds
We are God’s enemies.

But our friends, parents and guardians,
Help to keep us bridled,
They persuade us to seek your face
Which no one seeks in vain.

We lift up eyes to the hills,
From whence salvation comes,
Thou Sun of Righteousness, arise
With healing in your wings.

Arise, shine on this wretched world,
Go on shining for aye;
And until we grow old, do thou
Show us the Christian way. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, ran imole Re,
Si awa omo Re;
K’ awa le sin k’ a si fe O
Lat’ ewe tit’ opin.

Awa dese, a si foju,
A n rin l’ ona ’parun;
L’ okan, ati n’ iwa l’ a fi
Je ota Olorun.

Sugbon ore at’ oluto,
Won n ko wa n’ ijanu;
Won n ko wa, k’ a wa oju Re,
T’ a ko le wa l’ asan.

A gb’ oju wa s’ ori oke,
Nibi ’gbala ti nwa;
’Wo OOrun Ododo, dide,
Lati m’ ara wa ya.

Dide, ran s’ aiye osi yii,
Maa ran titi aye!
Titi awa o fi dagba,
Maa f’ ona Kristian han. 
(Amin).

title_english: When little Samuel woke
passage_english: SPEAK, LORD; FOR THY SERVANT HEARETH. I SAMUEL 3:9
passage_yoruba: MAA WI, NITORI OMO-ODO RE N GBO. I SAMUELI 3:9
verses_english:
When little Samuel woke,
And heard His Maker's voice,
At every word He spoke,
How much did he rejoice!
Oh, blessed, happy child! to find
The God of heaven so near and kind.

If God would speak to me,
And say He was my Friend,
How happy I should be!
Oh, how I would attend!
The smallest sin I then wold fear,
If God Almighty were so near.

And does He never speak?
Oh, yes, for in His Word
He bids me come to seek
The God that Samuel heard.
And every sin I well may fear,
Since God Almighty is so near.

And I Beneath His Care,
May Safely Rest My Head;
I Know That God Is There
To Guard My Humble Bed,
And Every Sin I Well May Fear
Since God Almighty Is So – Near.

Like Samuel let us say,
Whene'er we read His Word,
"Speak, Lord, I would obey
The voice that Samuel heard;
And when I in Thy hose appear,
Speak, for Thy servant waits to hear."
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gbati Samueli ji 
T’o gb ‘ohun Eleda 
Ni gbolohun kookan, 
Ayo re ti po to! 
Ibukun ni f‘omo t‘o ri (2x)
Olorun nitosi re bee.

B‘Olorun ba pe mi 
Pe, ore mi li Oun, 
Ayo mi yoo ti to!
Un o si f‘eti sile; 
Un o sa f‘ese t‘o kere ju (2x) 
B‘Olorun sunmo tosi be

Ko ha n ba ni soro? 
Beeni, n‘nu Oro Re 
O n pe mi lati wa 
Olorun Samuel, 
N‘nu Iwe na ni mo kaa pe (2x) 
Olorun Samuel npe mi.

Gba n ba n ka oro Re,
Ki n wi ni Samuel pe 
"Ma wi, Oluwa mi 
Emi yoo gbo Tire
‘Gba mo ba si wa n’ile Re, 
Maa wi, ‘tori ‘ranse Re ngbo. 
(Amin).

title_english: Behold, who are these little ones
passage_english: AND I SAW THE DEAD, SMALL STANDING BEFORE GOD. REVELATION 20:12
passage_yoruba: MO SI RI AWON OKU, EWE, WON DURO NIWAJU OLORUN. IFIHAN 20:12
verses_english:
Behold, who are these little ones
Who've finished soon their pilgrimage
And have arrived in glory land
The place they have been longing for?

‘I am from Greenland's snowy hills,`
I am from the land of India,`
Am from the land of Africa,`
And `I am from those far off isles.`

Our pilgrimage are over now
Weeping and suffering are all past
We all meet together at last
At the bright pearly gates of heav'n.

We hope to hear the Lord say, `Come
Ye victor over sin and death
Lift up your heads, then, O ye gates
And let the children pilgrims in.`
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Awon kekeke wo l’ eyii
T’ won tete l’ ajo aye ja,
Ti won si de ’bugbe ogo,
Eyiti won ti n f’ oju si?

“Emi t’ oke Grinlandi wa.”
“Emi, lati ile India.”
“Emi t’ ile Afrika wa.”
“Emi, lat’ Erekusu ni.”

Irin ajo wa ti koja,
Ekun ati irora tan;
A jumo pade nikehin,
Li enu ibode orun.

A n reti lati gbo pe, “Wa,”
Asegun ese oun iku:
Gb’ ori nyin soke, ilekun,
K’ awon ero ewe wole. 
(Amin).

title_english: Tender Shepherd, Thou hast stilled
passage_english: HE …. WILL GATHER THE LAMBS WITH HIS ARM. ISAIAH 40:11
passage_yoruba: OUN…YIO SI FI APA RE KO AWON ODO-AGUNTAN. ISAIAH 40:11
verses_english:
Tender Shepherd, Thou hast stilled
Now Thy little lamb’s brief weeping.
Ah, how peaceful and how mild
In its narrow bed ’tis sleeping!
And no sigh of anguish sore
Heaves that little bosom more.

In this world of pain and care,
Lord, Thou wouldst no longer leave it;
To Thy heav'nly meadows fair
Lovingly Thou dost receive it.
Clothed in robes of spotless white,
Now it dwells with Thee in light.

O Lord Jesus, grant that we
There may live where it is living,
And the blissful pastures see
That its heav'nly food are giving.
Lost awhile our treasured love,
Gained forever, safe above. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Odagutan, ’Wo ti re
Omo Re kekere l’ ekun:
Woo b’ o ti dubule jee
Layo ninu iboji Re:
Ko s’ aami irora mo,
T’ o n yo okan Re lenu.

L’ aipe titi, Oluwa
Mu wa de ’bi t’ omo yii lo;
Mu wa r’ ile ayo naa,
T’ o n f’ ounje orun bo won:
B’ O ti gb’ ayo wa lo yii,
’Gbanaa ao tun jere re. 
(Amin).

title_english: There is a path that leads to God
title_yoruba: Ona kan l’o n toka sorun
passage_english: BECAUSE STRAIT IS THE GATE, AND NARROW IS THE WAY, WHICH LEADETH UNTO LIFE, AND FEW THERE BE THAT FIND IT. MATT. 7:14
passage_yoruba: NITORI IBI HIHA L’ENU ONA NAA ATI TOORO LI OJU ONA NAA TI O LO IBI IYE, DIE LI AWON TI O N RIN IN. MATT. 7:14
verses_english:
There is a path that leads to God
All others go astray;
Though narrow, pleasant is the road,
And Christians love the way.

It leads us through this world of sin,
And dangers must be passed;
But those who boldly walk therein
Will come to Heaven at last.

How shall an infant pilgrim dare
This dangerous path to tread?
Do I not need a shepherd’s care
To be securely led?

While the broad road, where thousands go,
Lies near and opens fair;
And many turn aside, I know,
To walk with sinners there.

Be Thou, O Lord, my guard, my guide,
Nor let me from Thee stray;
Uphold my footsteps, lest I slide
Or wander from Thy way.

Then I may go without alarm
And trust His Word of old
The lambs, He’ll gather with His arm,
And lead them to the fold.

Thus I may safely venture through
Beneath my shepherd’s care;
And keep the gate of Heaven in view,
Till I shall enter there.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ona kan l’o n toka sorun 
Isina ni ‘yoku 
Hiha si l‘oju ona naa, 
Awon Kristian l’o fe.

Lat‘ aye, o lo taarata 
O si la ewu lo; 
Awon ti n f’ igboya rin in, 
Yoo d‘orun nikehin

Awon ewe yoo ha ti se 
Le la ewu yii ja? 
‘Tori idekun po lona 
F‘awon odomode.

Gbigbooro lona t‘opo n rin 
O si teju pelu 
Mo si mo pe lati dese 
Ni won se n rin nibe.

Sugbon k’ese mi ma baa ye 
Ki n ma si sako lo; 
Oluwa joo s‘oluto mi, 
Emi ki o sina.

N je mo le lo lais ‘ifoya 
Ki n gbeke l‘oro Re 
Apa Re yoo s‘agutan Re 
Emi ki o sina.

Beeni un o la ewu yii ja 
Nipa itoju Re; 
Un o tejumo ‘bode orun 
Titi un o fi Wole. 
(Amin).

title_english: Around the throne of God in Heaven
passage_english: AND HAVE WASHED THEIR ROBES, AND MADE THEM WHITE IN THE BLOOD OF THE LAMB. REV. 7:14
passage_yoruba: WON SI FO ASO IGUNWA WON, AWON SI SO WON DI FUNFUN NINU EJE OD’AGUNTAN. IFIHAN 7:14
verses_english:
Around the throne of God in Heaven,
Thousands of children stand,
Children, whose sins are all forgiven,
A holy, happy band,
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

In flowing robes of spotless white
See everyone arrayed;
Dwelling in everlasting light
And joys that never fade,
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

What brought them to the world above,
That heaven so bright and fair,
Where all is peace, and joy, and love;
How came those children there,
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

Because the Saviour shed His blood
To wash away their sin:
Bathed in that pure and precious flood,
Behold them white and clean,
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

On earth they sought the Saviour's grace,
On earth they loved His Name;
So now they see His bless
And stand before the Lamb,
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!

And is that fountain flowing yet?
Blest Saviour, lead us there.
That we those happy ones may meet,
And in their praises share.
Singing: Glory, glory, glory!
(Amen.)
verses_yoruba:
Yika or‘ite Olorun 
Egberun ewe wa; 
Ewe t‘a dari ese ji. 
Awon egbe mimo 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo.

Woo! olukuluku won wo 
Aso ala mimo; 
Ninu imole ailopin 
At‘ ayo ti ki sa. 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo.

Kil‘o mu won de aaye naa, 
Orun t‘o se mimo; 
Nib‘ alafia at‘ayo, 
Bi won ti se de ‘be, 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo.

Nitori Jesu ta ‘ je Re 
Lati k‘ese won lo; 
A ri won ninu eje naa, 
Won di mimo laulau, 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo.

L‘aye won wa Olugbala, 
Won fe oruko Re; 
Nisisiyi won r‘oju Re, 
Won wa niwaju Re, 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo.

Orisun naa ha n san loni? 
Jesu mu wa de be; 
K‘a le ri awon mimo naa, 
K‘a si ba won yin O, 
N korin Ogo, ogo, ogo. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, who lived above the sky
passage_english: FOR CHRIST ALSO HATH ONCE SUFFERED FOR SINS, THE JUST FOR THE UNJUST, THAT HE MIGHT BRING US TO GOD. I PET. 3:18
passage_yoruba: KRISTI JIYA LEKAN NITORI ESE WA, OLOOTO FUN ALASOOTO KI O LE MU WA DE ODO OLORUN. I PET. 3:18.
verses_english:
Jesus, who lived above the sky,
Came down to be a Man and die;
And in the Bible we may see
How very good He used to be.

He went about He was so kind 
To cure poor people who were blind;
And many who were sick and lame,
He pitied them and did the same.

And more than that, He told them, too,
The things that God would have them do;
And was so gentle and so mild,
He would have listened to a child.

But such a cruel death He died!
He was hung up and crucified!
And those kind Hands that did such good
They nailed them to a Cross of wood.

He knew how wicked man had been.
And knew that God must punish sin;
So, out of pity, Jesus said
He'd bear the punishment instead.

And so He died! and this is why
He came to be a Man and die!
The Bible says He came from Heaven
That we might have our sins forgiven.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu t‘o wa l‘oke orun 
Sokale d‘eniyan, o ku; 
Ninu Bibeli l‘a le ri 
Bi Oun I ti maa se rere.

O n kiri, O si n se rere 
O n la ‘ju awon afoju; 
Opo awon t‘o si yaro
O saanu won, o si wo won.

Sugbon iku t‘ oku buru; 
A fi ko ‘ri agbelebu 
Owo rere t‘o se nkan yii, 
Won kan an mo‘gi agbelebu.

O mo b‘eniyan ti buru, 
O mo b‘iya ese ti ri, 
Ninu aanu, Jesu wipe,
Oun o gba iya ese je.

Bee l‘o ku nitori yi naa, 
O d‘eniyan, k’o ba le ku; 
Bibeli ni, o t‘orun wa, 
K‘o le dari ese ji ni. 
(Amin).

title_english: When Jesus left his Father's throne
title_yoruba: Gba Jesu f’ ite Re sile
passage_english: FOR I AM GENTLE AND LOWLY IN HEART. MATTHEW 11:29
passage_yoruba: ONINU TITE ATI ONINU TUTU LI EMI. MATTHEW 11:29
verses_english:
When Jesus left his Father's throne,
He chose an humble birth;
Like us, unhonored and unknown,
He came to dwell on earth.

Like him may be found below
In wisdom's path of peace;
Like him in grace and knowledge grow
As years and strength increase.

Sweet were his words and kind his look,
When mothers round him pressed;
Their infants in his arms he took,
And on his bosom blessed.

Safe from the world's alluring harms,
Beneath his watchful eye,
Thus in the circle of his arms
May we for ever lie.

When Jesus into Zion rode,
The children sang around;
For joy they plucked the palms and strowed
Their garments on the ground.

Hosanna our glad voices raise,
Hosanna to our King!
Should we forget our Savior's praise,
The stones themselves would sing. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
’Gba Jesu f’ ite Re sile,
O mu ’po irele;
Ni ’rele o mu awo wa,
O wa gbe ’nu aye.

A ba le rin bi Oun ti rin,
Nipa ona ogbon;
K’ a dagba l’ oore at’ ogbon,
Bi odun ti n po sii.

Labe itoju Re, nwon bo
Lowo ’tanje aye:
Bayii ni k’ awa dubule,
Ni iso oju Re.

’Gba Jesu gun ketekete,
Awon ’mode n korin;
L’ ayo won ke eka igi,
Nwon si te ’so sile.

B’ awa gbagbe iyin Jesu,
Okuta yoo korin!
Hosanna ni awa o ko,
Hosanna s’ Oba wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, high in glory
passage_english: SUFFER THE LITTLE CHILDREN TO COME UNTO ME, AND FORBID THEM NOT: FOR OF SUCH IS THE KINGDOM OF GOD. MARK 10:14
passage_yoruba: E JE KI AWOM OMO KEKERE KI O WA SODO MI, E MA SI SE DA WON LEKUN. MARKU 10:14
verses_english:
Jesus, high in glory,
Lend a listening ear;
When we bow before Thee,
Children’s praises hear.

Though Thou art so holy,
Heav’n’s almighty king,
Thou wilt stoop to listen
When Thy praise we sing.

We are little children,
Weak and apt to stray;
Savior, guide and keep us
In the heav’nly way.

Then when Jesus calls us
To our heav’nly home,
We will gladly answer,
Savior, Lord, we come.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu, t‘o po logo, 
Joo, deti sile; 
Gbo ‘yin awa ewe, 
B‘a ti n juba Re.

B‘O ti je mimo to, 
Olodumare, 
‘Wo yoo teti sile 
Gba t‘a ba yin O.

Omode l‘awa je, 
A ko pe sako; 
Olugbala, to wa
Si ona orun.

title_english: Ye little ones keep close to God
passage_english: SERVE THE LORD WITH FEAR. PSALM 2:11
passage_yoruba: E FI IBERU SIN OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 2:11
verses_english:
Ye little ones keep close to God
In trembling and humility,
Let all knees bow down before Him,
Our Lord and Saviour and our friend.

O Saviour, let Thy great mercy
Fill us with gratitude to Thee
And in our pilgrimage on earth
May we receive more of Thy grace.

O Saviour, may all evil thoughts
Be far away flung from our hearts,
And each day, give us Thy wisdom
To choose to walk the narrow way.

In times of sickness and good health,
In times of plenty or in need,
And when the hour of death shall come
Deliver us with Thy great pow'r.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Omode, e sunm‘ Olorun. 
Pelu irele at‘eru; 
Ki eekun gbogbo wole fun 
Olugbala at‘Ore wa.

Oluwa, je k‘aanu Re nla, 
Mu wa kun fun ope si O; 
Ati b‘a ti n rin lo l‘aye, 
K‘a maa ri opo aanu gba.

Oluwa! m‘ ero buburu, 
Jinna rere si okan wa; 
L‘ojojumo fun wa l‘ogbon, 
Lati yan ona tooro ni.

Igba aisan, at‘ilera 
Igba aini tabi oro; 
Ati l‘akoko iku wa, 
Fi agbara Tire gba wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: Heaven-ly father! May Thy love
