passage_english: FOR THERE THE LORD COMMANDED THE BLESSING, EVEN LIFE FOR EVERMORE. PSALM 133:3
passage_yoruba: NIBE L’OLUWA GBE PASE, IBUKUN ANI IYE LAELAE. ORIN DAFIDI 133:3
verses_english:
Heaven-ly father! May Thy love 
beam upon us from above
let this infant find a place 
in thy covenant of grace.

Son of God, be with us here
listen to our humble prayer;
let thy blood on calvary spilt 
cleanse this child from nature’s guilt.

Holy Ghost! To Thee we cry 
thou this infant sanctify 
thine almighty power display
seal it to redemption’s day.

Great Jehoval! Father, son,
holy Spirit Three in one
let the blessing come from Thee;
thine shall all the glory be!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Baba orun, k‘ife Re, 
Tan s‘ori wa lat‘ oke; 
Je k‘omo yIi ni ipo 
N‘nu majemu oore Re.

Ba wa pe, si gb‘adura 
Jesu, Omo Olorun, 
K‘eje Re ti Kalfari 
W‘ese ibi omo yii.

Emi mimo sokale, 
Ya omo yii si mimo; 
Fi agbara nla Re han, 
S‘amona re tit‘ opin.

Jehofa, Baba, Omo, 
Eni Meta, Okan ‘so; 
K‘ibukun t‘odo Re wa, 
Tire ni gbogbo ogo. 
(Amin).

title_english: Almighty God, theme of the song
passage_english: PRAISE OUR GOD, ALL YOU HIS SERVANTS BOTH SMALL AND GREAT!” REV. 19:5
passage_yoruba: E YIN OLORUN WA EYIN IRANSE RE ATI EWE ATI AGBA. IFIHAN 19:5
verses_english:
Almighty God, theme of the song
Angels in heaven sing,
Look down in mercy from Thy throne
And do, teach us Thy fear.

We want to learn Thy holy word
From this our childhood days,
Teach us to know the Lord, who is
The way, the truth, the life.

We talk to all Thy glory, Lord
And Thy goodness to us,
Enthrone Thyself within our hearts
And make us to fear Thee. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, orin eniti
Awon Angeli n ko;
Wo ’le lati bujoko Re!
Ko wa, k’ a beru Re!

Oro mimo Re l’ a fe ko,
Lat’ igba ewe wa;
K’ a ko t’ Olugbala ti se
Ona, Iye, Ooto.

Jesu, ogo at’ oore Re,
L’ a n so nisisiyii;
Se bujoko Re s’ okan wa,
Si je k’ a beru Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: Be present at our table, Lord
passage_english: AND HE TOOK THE FIVE LOAVES AND THE TWO FISH, HE BLESSED AND GAVE THE LOAVES TO THE DISCIPLES. MATTHEW 14:19
passage_yoruba: O MU ISU AKARA MARUN ATI EJA MEJI, O SURE, O SI FI FUN AWON OMO EYIN RE. MATTEW 14:19
verses_yoruba:
Wa, ba wa jeun, Oluwa,
Je k’ a maa yin oruko Re;
Wa busi ounje wa; si je
K’ a le ba O jeun l’ orun. 
(Amin).

title_english: We thank Thee, Lord, for this our food
title_yoruba: A f’ ope fun O, Oluwa
passage_english: FOR EVERY CREATURE OF GOD IS GOOD, … IF IT IS RECEIVED WITH THANKSGIVING. I TIMOTHY 4:4
passage_yoruba: GBOGBO EDA OLORUN LI O DARA ………. BI A BA FI OPE GBA A. I TIMOTEU. 4:4
verses_english:
We thank Thee, Lord, for this our food,
For life, and health, and every good:
By Thine own hand may we be fed;
Give us each day our daily bread. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
A f’ ope fun O, Oluwa,
Fun ounje wa, at’ ebun mi;
Fi ounje orun b’ okan wa,
Ounje iye lat’ oke wa. 
(Amin).

title_english: Here we suffer grief and pain
passage_english: AND THERE WILL BE ONE FLOCK AND ONE SHEPHERD. JOHN 10:16
passage_yoruba: AGBO KAN ATI OLUSO-AGUNTAN KAN NI YIO SI JE. JOHANU 10:16
verses_english:
Here we suffer grief and pain,
Here we meet to part again;
In heaven we part no more.
Oh, that will be joyful!
Joyful, joyful, joyful!
Oh, that will be joyful!
When we meet to part no more.

All who love the Lord below,
When they die to heaven will go,
And join with saints above.
Oh, that will be joyful, etc.

Little children will be there,
Who have sought the Lord by prayer
From every Sunday School.
Oh, that will be joyful, etc

Teachers, too, will meet above,
Pastors, parents, whom we love,
Shall meet to part no more.
Oh, that will be joyful, etc

Oh, how happy we shall be!
For our Saviour we shall see
Exalted on His throne.
Oh, that will be joyful, etc

There we all shall sing for joy,
And eternity employ
In praising Christ the Lord.
Oh, that will be joyful!
Joyful, joyful, joyful!
Oh, that will be joyful!
When we meet to part no more. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Nihin l’ awa n je ’rora,
Nihin ni a ma pinya;
L’ orun, ko si ’pinya.
A! bi o ti dun to!
Dun to, dun to, dun to!
A! bi o ti dun to!
’Gba t’ a ki o pinya mo!

Awon t’ o feran Jesu,
Won o lo s’ oke orun,
Lo b’ awon to ti lo,
A! bi o ti dun to! &c.

Oluko, baba, iya,
Won o pade nibe naa;
Won ki o pinya mo.
A! bi o ti dun to! &c.

Bi a o ti yo po to!
’Gba t’ a ba r’ Olugbala,
Ni ori ite Re!
A! bi o ti dun to! &c.

Nibe l’ao korin ayo;
Titi aye ailopin,
L’ ao maa yin Jesu
A! bi o ti dun to!
Dun to, dun to, dun to!
A! bi o ti dun to!
’Gba t’ a ki o pinya mo!. 
(Amin).

title_english: Today is past
passage_english: FOR THE DAY GOES AWAY, FOR THE SHADOWS OF THE EVENING ARE LENGTHENING. JEREMIAH. 6:4
passage_yoruba: OJO N LO, OJIJI OJO ALE NAA JADE. JEREMIAH 6:4
verses_english:
Today is past,
Our Lord Jesus,
Behold me now Thy little child.

Thou art the Light,
Look upon me; Let Thy light shine
Upon me lord.

My dear Saviour,
I’ll never fear,
Because Thou art now by my side.

And everytime
I watch Thy face,
When there is none to be with me.

And everytime
Incline Thine ears
Unto the pray’rs of little ones.

And now therefore
Without terror,
I slept and I Rest upon Thee.

Thou, Father, Son
And Holy Ghost
Worthy of praise, in earth and heav’n. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oj’ oni lo,
Jesu Baba,
Boju Re w’ emi omo Re.

Olugbala,
N ko ni beru,
Nitori O wa lodo mi.

Nigba gbogbo
Ni oju Re
N so mi, gbat’ enikan ko si.

Nigba gbogbo
Ni eti Re
N sis i adura omode.

Nitorina
Laisi foya,
Mo sun, mo si sinmi le O.

Baba, Omo,
Emi Mimo
Ni iyin ye l’ orun l’ aye. 
(Amin).

title_english: O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
passage_english: I WAS GLAD WHEN THEY SAID UNTO ME, LET US GO INTO THE HOUSE OF THE LORD. PSALM 122:1
passage_yoruba: INU MI DUN NIGBATI WON WI FUN MI PE, E JE KI A LO SI ILE OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 122:1
verses_english:
O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
O how I love Thee well,
I am happy, it makes me glad
To rejoice at Thy birth.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Thy friendship suits me well;
Both young and old will sing Thy song
We long for Sunday School.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Christ was Thy first teacher,
The Holy Spirit, Great Teacher
Does manifest in thee.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
This testimony's sure,
That God, the Father Almighty,
Poured His blessing on thee.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
Though the sun be so bright
Or if the clouds be black with rain,
I'll be in Sunday School.

O Sunday School, on the Lord's day
I rejoice to see thee;
Will Thou pass over me today
Without my being blest?
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ile-eko ojo ‘sinmi, 
A! mo ti fe O to! 
Inu mi dun mo daraya, 
Lati yo ayo re.

Ile-eko ojo ‘sinmi 
Oore re p’ apoju 
T‘agba t‘ewe wa n korin re, 
A n se aferi re.

Ile-eko ojo ‘sinmi 
Jesu l‘o ti ko O; 
Emi Mimo Olukoni, 
L‘o si n se 'toju re.

Ile-eko ojo‘sinmi 
Awa ri eri gba, 
P'Olorun Olodumare 
F‘ibukun sori re.

Ile-eko ojo‘sinmi 
B‘oorun n ran l‘aranju, 
Bi ojo su dudu lorun 
Ninu re l‘emi o wa.

Ile-eko ojo ‘sinmi 
Mo yo lati ri O, 
‘Wo yoo ha koja lori mi 
Loni, l‘airi ‘bukun? 
(Amin).

title_english: Hallowed Day and Holy
passage_english: BUT THE SEVENTH DAY IS THE SABBATH OF THE LORD THY GOD. EXODUS 20:10
passage_yoruba: OJO KEJE LI OJO ISINMI OLUWA OLORUN EXODUS 20:10
verses_english:
Hallowed Day and Holy
Thou holy day of rest
We ought to give one full day
To God, the good and kind
Other days bring the tear drops
Thou wipes the tears away
Thou art a day of gladness
I love thy happy morn.

Hallowed Day and Holy
There is no work today
We will suspend our labour
Until tomorrow's day
How beautiful and how bright
Thou blessed day of rest
Other days speak of troubles
But thou give hope of rest.

Hallowed Day and Holy
Hear how the church bell says
Give one day to thy Maker
Who gave to you six days.
We shall take leave of labour
To go and worship there
Both we and all our dear friends
On to the house of prayer.

Hallowed Day and Holy
Thy hour delight me so
A taste of heaven you give us
Like that eternal rest
Lord, let me be partaker
Of rest beyond the grave
To sing and serve thee ever
With all thy saints above.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ose, Ose, rere,
Iwo ojo, ‘simi;
O ye k’a fi ojo kan,
Fun Olorun rere;
B’ojo mi ba m’ekun wa,
‘Iwo n’oju wa nu,
Iwo ti s’ ojo ayo,
Emi fe dide re.

Ose, Ose, rere,
A ki o sise loni,
A o f’ise wa gbogbo
Fun aisimi ola;
Didan l’oju re ma dan
‘Wo arewa ojo:
Ojo mi nso ti laalaa,
Iwo nso ti ‘simi.

Ose, Ose, rere,
Ago tile nwipe:
F’Eleda re l’ojo kan,
T’o fun o n’ijo mefa;
A o fi ‘se wa sile
Lati lo sin nibe;
Awa ati ore wa,
A o lo sile adua.

Ose, ose rere
Wakati re wu mi 
Ojo orun ni ‘wo se 
‘Wo apere orun 
Oluwa, je ki njogun 
‘Simi leyin iku 
Ki nle ma sin O titi 
Pelu eniyan Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: We come, Lord, to thy feet
passage_english: DRAW NIGH TO GOD, …… HE WILL DRAW NIGH TO YOU. JAMES 4:8
passage_yoruba: E SUNMO OLORUN …. OUN YIO SI SUNMO YIN. JAKOBU 4:8
verses_english:
We come, Lord, to thy feet
on this thy holy day:
O come to us, while here we meet
to learn, and praise, and pray!
verses_yoruba:
Jesu a w‘odo Re, 
L‘ojo Re mimo yii,
To wa wa b‘awa ti pejo, 
Si ko wa fun ‘ra Re.

Dari ese ji wa, 
Fun wa l‘Emi mimo;
Ko wa, k’ ihin je ibere 
Aye ti ko l’opin.

F‘ ife kun aya wa, 
Gba’se oluko wa;
K‘awa at‘ awon le pade 
Niwaju Re loke. 
(Amin).

title_english: O lord, our hearts would give thee praise
passage_english: BUT OTHER FELL INTO GOOD GROUND, AND BROUGHT FORTH FRUIT. MATT. 13:8
passage_yoruba: OMIRAN SI BO SI ILE RERE, O SI SO ESO. MATT. 13:8
verses_english:
O lord, our hearts would give thee praise
Ere now our school we end,
For this thy day, the best of days
Jesus, the children’s friend.

Lord, graft thy word in every heart
Our sould from sin defend
That we from Thee may ne’er depart
Jesus, the children’s friend.

Lord, bless our homes and give us grace
Thy Sabbaths so to spend
That we in heaven may find a place,
With Thee, the children’s friend.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
K ‘awa to pari eko wa, 
Awa f’iyin fun O; 
‘Tori ojo Re mimo yi, 
Jesu Ore ewe.

Gbin oro Re si okan wa, 
Gba wa lowo ese. 
Ma je k‘a pada leyin Re, 
Jesu Ore ewe.

title_english: Do no sinful action
passage_english: RESIST THE DEVIL, AND HE WILL FLEE FROM YOU. JAMES 4:7
passage_yoruba: KOJUJA SI ESU, OUN O SI SA KURO LODO YIN. JAKOBU 4:7
verses_english:
Do no sinful action,
Speak no angry word;
Ye belong to Jesus,
Children of the Lord.

Christ is kind and gentle,
Christ is pure and true;
And His little children
Must be holy, too.

There’s a wicked spirit
Watching round you still,
And he tries to tempt you
To all harm and ill.

But ye must not hear him,
Though ’tis hard for you
To resist the evil,
And the good to do.

For ye promised truly,
In your infant days,
To renounce him wholly,
And forsake his ways.

Ye are newborn Christians,
Ye must learn to fight
With the bad within you,
And to do the right.

Christ is your own Master,
He is good and true,
And His little children
Must be holy, too.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mase huwa ese 
Ma soro ‘binu; 
Omo Jesu l‘e se 
Omo Oluwa.

Krist‘ je Oninure, 
At‘ Eni Mimo; 
Bee l‘awon omo Re 
Ye k‘o je mimo.

Emi ibi kan wa 
T‘o n so irin re;
O si n fe dan o wo 
Lati se ibi.

E ma se gbo tire, 
B‘o tile soro 
Lati ba Esu ja 
Lati se rere.

Eyin ti se ‘leri 
Ni omo owo; 
Lati k‘Esu sile 
Ati ona re.

Om‘ ogun Krist‘ ni yin, 
E ko lati ba 
Ese inu yin ja, 
E maa se rere.

Jesu l‘Oluwa yin, 
O se Eni re; 
Ki eyin omo Re 
Si maa se rere 
(Amin).

title_english: Faithful Shepherd, feed me
passage_english: GIVE EAR, O SHEPHERD OF ISRAEL. PSLAM 80:1
passage_yoruba: FI ETI SI NI, OLUSO-AGUNTAN ISRAELI. ORIN DAFIDI 80:1
verses_english:
Faithful Shepherd, feed me
In the pastures green;
Faithful Shepherd, lead me
Where Thy steps are seen.

Hold me fast, and guide me
In the narrow way;
So, with Thee beside me,
I shall never stray.

Daily bring me nearer
To the Heavenly shore;
May Thy love grow dearer,
May I love Thee more.

Give me joy or sadness,
This be all my care,
That Eternal gladness
I with Thee may share.

Day by day prepare me,
As Thou seest best,
Then let angels bear me
To Thy promised rest.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olusaguntan mi 
Maa bo mi titi; 
Olusaguntan mi, 
Maa to ese mi.

Di mi mu, si to mi, 
Ni ona hiha, 
B‘O ba wa lodo mi, 
Si mu mi fe O.

Sin mi s‘ona orun, 
Ni ojoojumo, 
Maa busi ‘gbagbo mi, 
Si mu mi fe O.

K‘ ayo tabi ekun, 
Ti odo Re wa; 
K‘iye ainipekun, 
Le je ayo mi.

Maa pese okan mi, 
Ni ojoojumo; 
Si je k‘ Angeli Re, 
Sin mi lo ile. 
(Amin).

title_english: Hosanna! raise the pealing hymn
passage_english: THE CHILDREN CRYING IN THE TEMPLE, AND SAYING, HOSANNA TO THE SON OF DAVID. MATT. 21:15
passage_yoruba: AWON OMODE SI N KE NINU TEMPILI WIPE, HOSANNA SI OMO DAFIDI. MATT. 21:15
verses_english:
Hosanna! raise the pealing hymn
To David’s Son and Lord;
With cherubim and seraphim,
Exalt th’Incarnate Word.

Hosanna! Lord, our feeble tongue
No lofty strains can raise:
But Thou wilt not despise the young,
Who meekly chant Thy praise.

Hosanna! Sovereign, Prophet, Priest,
How vast Thy gifts how free!
Thy blood, our life Thy Word, our feast
Thy name, our only plea.

Hosanna! Master, lo! we bring
Our offerings to Thy throne;
Not gold, nor myrrh, nor mortal thing,
But hearts to be Thine own.

Hosanna! once Thy gracious ear
Approved a lisping throng:
Be gracious still, and deign to hear
Our poor, but grateful song.

O Savior! if, redeemed by Thee
Thy temple we behold;
Hosannas, through eternity,
We’ll sing to harps of gold!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Hosanna! e korin s‘oke 
S‘omo nla Dafidi 
Pelu Kerub‘ ati Seraf, 
K‘a yin Om‘Olorun.

Hosanna! eyii naa nikan 
L‘ahon wa le maa ko! 
Iwo ki o kegan ewe 
Ti n korin iyin Re.

Hosanna! Alufa, Oba, 
Ebun Re ti po to! 
Eje Re l‘o je iye wa 
Oro Re ni ounje.

Hosanna! Baba awa mu 
Ore wa wa fun O; 
Ki se wura oun ojia 
Bikose okan wa.

Hosanna! Jesu lekan ri
O yin awon ewe; 
Saanu fun wa, si f‘eti si 
Orin awa ewe.

Jesu b‘O ba ra wa pada, 
T‘a si wo ‘joba Re; 
A o fi harpu wura ko 
Hosanna titi lae. 
(Amin).

passage_english: THERE IS A FRIEND THAT STICKETH CLOSER THAN A BROTHER. PROVERBS 18:24
passage_yoruba: ORE KAN NBE TI O FI ARA MONI JU ARAKUNRIN LO. OWE 18:24.
verses_english:
One there is above all others,
O how He loves!
His is love beyond a brother's.
O how He loves!
Earthly friends may fail or leave us,
One day soothe, the next day grieve us,
But this Friend will ne'er deceive us,
O how He loves!

'Tis eternal life to know Him,
O how He loves!
Think, O think how much we owe Him,
O how He loves!
With His precious blood He bought us,
In the wilderness He sought us,
To His fold He safely brought us,
O how He loves!

We have found a friend in Jesus,
O how He loves!
'Tis His great delight to bless us,
O how He loves!
How our hearts delight to hear Him--
Bid us dwell in safety near Him:
Why should we distrust or fear Him?
O how He loves!

Through His Name we are forgiven,
O how He loves!
Backward shall our foes be driven,
O how He loves!
Best of blessings He'll provide us.
Nought but good shall e'er betide us,
Safe to glory He will guide us,
O how He loves!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Enikan n be t‘O feran wa, 
A! O fe wa! 
Ife Re ju ti’ yekan lo, 
A! O fe wa; 
Ore aye n ko wa sile, 
B‘oni dun, ola le koro; 
Sugbon ore yii ko n tan ni, 
A! O fe wa!

Iye ni fun wa, b‘a ba mo on, 
A! O fe wa! 
Roo b‘a ti je ni gbese to, 
A! O fe wa! 
Eje Re l‘O si fi ra wa 
Nin‘ aginju lo wa wa ri; 
O si mu wa wa s‘agbo Re; 
A! O fe wa!

Oro ododo ni Jesu, 
A! O fe wa! 
O fe lati maa bukun wa 
A! O fe wa! 
Okan wa fe gbo ohun Re 
Okan wa fe lati sunmo on; 
Oun na ko si ni tan wa je, 
A! O fe wa!

Looko Re l‘a n ri ‘dariji 
A! O fe wa! 
Oun o le ota wa s‘ehin, 
A! O fe wa! 
Oun o pese ‘bukun fun wa; 
Ire l‘a o maa ri titi 
Oun O fi mu wa lo s‘ogo, 
A! O fe wa! 
(Amin).

title_english: Shall we gather at the river
title_yoruba: A o pa de leti odo
passage_english: AND HE SHEWED ME A PURE RIVER OF WATER OF LIFE, CLEAR AS CRYSTAL REV. 22:1
passage_yoruba: O SI FI ODO OMI IYE KAN HAN MI, TI O MO BI KRISTALI. IFIHAN 22:1
chorus_english:
Yes, we’ll gather at the river,
The beautiful, the beautiful river;
Gather with the saints at the river
That flows by the throne of God.
chorus_yoruba:
A o pade leti odo
Odo didan, odo didan naa
Pelu awon mimo leba odo
To san leba ite ni.
verses_english:
Shall we gather at the river,
Where bright angel feet have trod,
With its crystal tide forever
Flowing by the throne of God?

On the margin of the river,
Washing up its silver spray,
We will talk and worship ever,
All the happy golden day.

Ere we reach the shining river,
Lay we every burden down;
Grace our spirits will deliver,
And provide a robe and crown.

At the smiling of the river,
Mirror of the Savior’s face,
Saints, whom death will never sever,
Lift their songs of saving grace.

Soon we’ll reach the silver river,
Soon our pilgrimage will cease;
Soon our happy hearts will quiver
With the melody of peace.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Leti bebe odo na yi
Pel’ Oluso-aguntan wa,
A o ma rin a o ma sin
B’a ti ntele ’pase Re.

K’a to de odo didan naa,
A o s’eru wa kale
Jesu y’o gba eru ese
Awon ti y’o de l’ade.

Nje l’eba odo tutu na,
A o r’oju Olugbala;
Emi wa ki o pinya mo
Yoo korin Ogo Re.

A fe de odo didan na,
‘Rin ajo wa fere pin;
Okan wa fere kun f’orin,
Ayo at’ Alafia. 
(Amin).

title_english: Lord, shall Thy children come to Thee
title_yoruba: Oluwa, k’ a ha w’ odo Re?
passage_english: TODAY YOU HAVE PROCLAIMED THE LORD TO BE YOUR GOD. DEUTERONOMY 26:17
passage_yoruba: IWO JEWO OLUWA LI ONI PE, OUN NI I SE OLORUN RE. DEUTERONOMI 26:17
verses_english:
Lord, shall Thy children come to Thee?
A boon of love divine we seek;
Brought to Thine arms in infancy,
Ere heart could feel, or tongue could speak,
Thy children pray for grace, that they
May come themselves to Thee to-day.

Lord, shall we come? and come again,
Oft as we see Thy table spread,
And tokens of Thy dying pain,
The wine pour'd out, the broken bread?
Bless, bless, O Lord, Thy children's prayer,
That they may come and find Thee there.

Lord, shall we come? not thus alone.
At holy time, or solemn rite,
But every hour till life be flown,
Through weal or woe, in gloom or light,
Come to Thy throne of grace, that we
In faith, hope, love, confirm'd may be?

Lord, shall we come? come yet again?
Thy children ask one blessing more:
To come, not now alone; -- but then
When life, and death, and time be o'er,
Then, then to come, O Lord, and be
Confirm'd in heaven, confirm'd by Thee. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, k’ a ha w’ odo Re?
Ebun orun ni a n toro;
Nigbati a wa ni ewe,
L’a ti gbe wa wa odo Re,
Fun wa ni oore- ofe Re,
K’ a le to O wa fun ’ra wa.

Oluwa, k’ a ha w’ odo Re,
Nigb’ a ba te tabili Re,
T’ a n se apere iku Re,
Ni jij’ akara, mimu wain?
Gb’ adura awon omo Re,
Ki won k’o le ri O nibe.

Oluwa, k’ a ha w’ odo Re,?
Ki se nigba yi nikan ni,
Sugbon ni gbogbo ojo wa,
Nigba oro tabi ise
K’a wa s’ idi ’te oore-ofe,
K’ a duro sinsin n’ igbagbo.

Oluwa, k’ a ha w’ odo Re?
A fe, beere ebun kan sii;
Pe, ’gbati aye ba koja,
Ti ipe ikehin ba dun,
K’ a le w’ odo Re, Oluwa,
K’ a si n’ipo wa l’ aya Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: I will go to Thee, Lord Jesus
passage_english: COME TO ME. ISAIAH 55:3
passage_yoruba: WA SODO MI. ISAIAH 55:3
verses_english:
I will go to Thee, Lord Jesus
He who has called me to come
He who is the blessed Saviour
For a sinner such as I.

I will go to Thee, Lord Jesus
Abomination and wrath
Wickedness and all evil work
That men do, Thou possess not.

I will go to Thee, Lord Jesus
It delights me so to do;
Who loves me like the Lord Jesus
He who can save one from sin.

I will go to Thee, Lord Jesus
Jesus Christ who is our friend
With Him is abundant mercy
For a sinner such as I. 
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Emi o lo sodo Jesu,
Eni n pe mi pe ki ’n wa,
Enit’ o se Olugbala
Fun elese bi emi.

Emi o lo sodo Jesu,
Irira at’ ibinu,
Ika at’ ise t’o buru,
T’eniyan n se, Oun ko ni.

Emi o lo sodo Jesu,
O dun mo mi ki n se bee;
Tal’ o fe mi bi ti Jesu,
Eniti o gba ni la?

Emi o lo sodo Jesu,
Jesu t’ o se Ore wa:
Aanu wa ninu Re pupo,
Fun elese bi emi.
(Amin).

title_english: O Jesus, I have promised
passage_english: IF ANYONE SERVES ME, LET HIM FOLLOW ME. JOHN 12:26
passage_yoruba: BI ENIKENI BA N SIN MI, KI O MAA TO MI LEYIN. JOHANU 12:26
verses_english:
O Jesus, I have promised
To serve thee to the end:
Be thou ever near me,
My Master and my friend;
I shall not fear the battle
If thou art by my side,
Nor wander from the pathway
If thou wilt be my guide.

Oh let me hear thee speaking
In accents clear and still,
Above the storms of passion,
The murmurs of self-will;
Oh speak to reassure me,
To hasten or control;
Oh speak, and make me listen,
Thou guardian of my soul.

O Jesus, thou hast promised
To all who follow thee,
That where thou art in glory
There shall thy servant be;
And, Jesus I have promised
To serve thee to the end;
Oh give me grace to follow,
My Master and my friend.

O let me see thy footmarks,
And in them plant mine own;
My hope to follow duly
Is in thy strength alone.
Oh guide me, call me, draw me,
Uphold me to the end;
And then in heaven receive me,
My Savior and my Friend. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Mo ti seleri, Jesu,
Lati sin O d’opin;
Maa wa lodo mi titi,
Baba mi, Ore mi.
Emi k’ yoo beru ogun,
B’ iwo ba sunmo mi,
Emi ki yoo si sina,
B’ o ba f’ona han mi.

Je ki n mo p’ O sunmo mi,
‘Tor’ ibaje aye;
Aye fe gba okan mi,
Aye fe tan mi je;
Ota yi mi ka kiri,
Lode ati ninu’
Sugbon Jesu, sunmo mi,
Dabobo okan mi.

Je ki emi k’ o maa gbo
Oun Re, Jesu mi,
Ninu igbi aye yii,
Titi nigbagbogbo;
So, mu k’ o da mi l’oju,
K’ okan mi ni ‘janu;
So, si mu mi gbo Tire,
‘Wo olutoju mi.

‘Wo ti se ‘leri, Jesu,
F’ awon t’ o tele O,
Pe ibikibi t’ O wa,
L’ awon yio si wa;
Mo ti se ‘leri, Jesu,
Lati sin O dopin.
Je ki n maa to O lehin,
Baba mi, Ore mi.

Je ki n maa ri ‘pase Re,
Ki n le ma tele O:
Agbara Re nikan ni,
Ti n ba le tele O.
To mi, pe mi, si fa mi,
Di mi mu de opin;
Si gba mi si odo Re,
Baba mi, Ore mi. (Amin).

title_english: Thine ? Thine for ever
title_yoruba: Tire titi lai l’ awa se
passage_english: I AM THINE, SAVE ME. PSLAMS 119:94
passage_yoruba: TIRE LI EMI, GBÀ MI. ORIN DAFIDI 119:94
verses_english:
''Thine ? Thine for ever'' ? blessed bond
That knits, us, Lord to Thee;
May voice, and heart, and soul respond
Amen, so let it be

When this world strikes its dulcet harp,
And earth our heaven appears,
Be ''Thine for ever`, clear and sharp,
God's trumpet in our ears

When sin in pleasure's soft disguise
Would work us deadliest harm,
May ''Thine for ever'' from the skies
Steal down, and break the charm

When Satan flings his fiery darts
Against our weary shield,
May ''Thine for ever'' in our hearts
Forbid us faint or yield

Thine all along the flowery spring,
Along the summer prime,
Till autumn fades in welcoming
The silver frost of time

''Thine, Thine for ever,'' body, soul,
Henceforth devote to Thee,
While everlasting ages roll
Amen, so let it be
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Tire titi lai l’ awa se,
Oluwa wa orun 
K’ohun at’okan wa wipe,
Amin beeni k’ o ri

Gba ti aye ba n dun mo ni 
T’ o si nfa okan wa 
K’i ro yi pe “Tire l’ awa”,
Le ma dun l’ eti wa.

Gba t’ese pelu etan re 
Ba fe se wa n’ ibi 
K’ iro yi pe “Tire l’awa”,
Tu etan ese ka.

‘Gba ti esu ba n tafa re 
S’ ori ailera wa;
K’ iro yi pe; “Tire l’ awa”,
Ma je ki o re wa.

Tire, n’ igb’a wa l’ omode
Tire n’igb’ a n dagba
Tire, n’igb’ a ba darugbo,
Ti aye wa n buse.

Tire titu lai l’ awa se
A f’ ara wa fun o,
Titi aye ainipekun,
Amen, beeni k’ o ri.
(Amin).

title_yoruba: Ojo nla l’ojo ti mo yan
passage_english: MY HEART IS FIXED, O GOD, MY HEART IS FIXED. PS. 57:7.
passage_yoruba: OKAN MI TI MURA, OLORUN, OKAN MI TI MURA PS. 57:7.
chorus_english:
Happy day, happy day
When Jesus washed my sins away!
He taught me how to watch and pray
And live rejoicing every day
Happy day, happy day
When Jesus washed my sins away!
chorus_yoruba:
Ojo nla l’ojo na!
Ti Jesu we ese mi nu
O ko mi ki nma gbadura
Ki nma sora ki nsi ma yo
Ojo nla l’ojo na!
Ti Jesu we ese mi nu.
verses_english:
O happy day that fixed my choice
On Thee, my Saviour and my God!
Well may this glowing heart rejoice
And tell its rapture all abroad.

It's done: the great transaction's done! 
I am the Lord's and he is mine; 
he drew me and I followed on, 
charmed to confess the voice divine.

O happy bond, that seals my vows 
To him who merits all my love! 
Let cheerful anthems fill his house, 
while to that sacred shrine I move.

Now rest my long-divided heart,
Fixed on this blissful centre, rest
Here have I found a nobler part; 
here heavenly pleasures fill my breast.

High heaven, that heard the solemn vow
That vow renewed shall daily hear,
Till life’s latest hour I bow,
And bless in death a bond so dear.
(Amen)
verses_yoruba:
Ojo nla l’ojo ti mo yan
Olugbala l’Olorun mi;
O ye ki okan mi ma yo,
K’o si ro ihin na ka ‘le.

Ise igbala pari na 
Mo di t’Oluwa mi loni 
Oun l’o pe mi ti mo sije 
Mo fayo jipe mimo naa

Eje mimo yi ni mo je 
F’enit’ o ye lati feran
Je k’orin didun kun ‘le Re
Nigba mo ba nlo sin nibe.

Sinmi, aiduro okan mi,
Sinmi le Jesu Oluwa;
Tani je wipe aiye dun,
Ju odo awon Angeli

Eyin Orun, gbo eje mi 
Eje mi ni ojoojumo,
Em’ o maa so dotun titi 
Iku yoo fi mu mi re ‘le 
(Amin)

title_english: Awake, my soul, stretch every nerve
passage_english: I PRESS TOWARD THE MARK FOR THE PRIZE OF THE HIGH CALLING OF GOD. PHILS. 3:14
passage_yoruba: EMI N LEPA LATI DE IBI AAMI NI FUN ERE IPE GIGA OLORUN. FILLIP 3:14
verses_english:
Awake, my soul, stretch every nerve,
And with vigour on;
A heavenly race demands thy zeal,
And an immortal crown.

A cloud of witnesses around
Hold thee in full survey;
Forget the steps already trod,
And onward urge thy way.

'Tis God's all-animating Voice
That calls thee from on high;
'Tis His own Hand presents the prize
To thine aspiring eye.

Blest Saviour, introduced by Thee,
Have I my race begun;
And crown'd with victory, at Thy feet,
I'll lay my honours down.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ji, okan mi dide giri, 
Maa lepa n so kikan; 
F‘itara sure ije yii,
Fun ade ti ki sa.

Awosanma eleri wa,
Ti won n f’oju sun o;
Gbagbe irin ateyinwa,
Sa ma te siwaju.

Olorun n f’ohun igbera 
Ke si o lat‘ oke; 
Tikare l‘O n pin ere naa, 
T’o n noga lati wo.

Olugbala, ‘Wo l‘o mu mi 
Bere ‘re ‘je mi yii; 
Nigbat‘ a ba de mi l‘ade, 
Un o wole l‘ese Re. 
(Amin).

title_english: My God, accept my heart this day
passage_english: SAVE NOW, I PRAY, O LORD. PSALMS 118:25
passage_yoruba: SE IGBALA NISISIYII EMI BE O OLUWA. ORIN DAFIDI 118:25
verses_english:
My God, accept my heart this day,
And make it always Thine,
That I from Thee no more may stray,
No more from Thee decline.

Before the cross of him who died,
Behold, I prostrate fall;
Let every sin be crucified,
And Christ be all in all.

Anoint me with Thy heavenly grace,
And seal me for Thine own;
That I may see Thy glorious face,
And worship near Thy throne.

Let every thought and work and word
To thee be ever given:
Then life shall be thy service, Lord,
And death the gate of heaven.

All glory to the Father be,
All glory to the Son,
All glory, Holy Ghost, to thee,
While endless ages run.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olorun, gb’ okan mi loni,
Si maa se ni Tire’;
Ki n ma sako lodo Re mo,
Ki n ma ye lodo Re.

Woo! Mo wole buruburu
L’ese agbelebu;
Kan gbogbo ese mi mo ‘gi,
Ki Krist’ j’ohun gbogbo.

F’ oore- ofe orun fun mi,
Si se mi ni Tire;
Ki n le r’ oju Re t’o logo,
Ki n maa sin n’ite Re.

K’ero, oro, at’ ise mi
Je Tire titi lae;
Ki n fi gbogb’ aye mi sin O,
K’ iku je isinmi.

Ogo gbogbo ni fun Baba,
Ogo ni fun Omo,
Ogo ni fun Emi Mimo,
Titi ainipekun. 
(Amin).

title_english: O perfect Love, all human thought transcending
title_yoruba: Ife pipe, t‘o t’ayo ero eda
passage_english: NEVERTHELESS LET EVERY ONE OF YOU IN PARTICULAR SO LOVE HIS WIFE EVEN AS HIMSELF. EPHS. 5:33
passage_yoruba: SUGBON KI OLUKULUKU YIN KI O FERAN AYA RE BEE GEGEBI OUN TIKARA RE. EFESU 5:33
verses_english:
O perfect Love, all human thought transcending,
lowly we kneel in prayer before thy throne,
that theirs may be the love which knows no ending,
whom thou forevermore dost join in one.

O perfect Life, be thou their full assurance,
of tender charity and steadfast faith,
of patient hope and quiet, brave endurance,
with childlike trust that fears nor pain nor death.

Grant them the joy which brightens earthly sorrow;
grant them the peace which calms all earthly strife,
and to life's day the glorious unknown morrow
that dawns upon eternal love and life.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ife pipe, t‘o t’ayo ero eda, 
Niwaju Re l‘a wole l‘adura 
Pe, ki ife ailopin le je t‘awon 
Ti iwo so d‘okan titi aye.

Iye pipe, maa je igbekele won 
Fun ife oun igbagbo ododo; 
Fun ireti oun emi ifarada, 
Pelu ‘fokan tan lai beru iku.

Fun won l‘ayo ti a bori ibanuje 
Fun won l‘alaafia ti n m‘aye dun, 
Titi owuro ologo yoo fi mo; 
Ojo ife oun iye ailopin. 
(Amin).

title_english: O Father, all-creating
passage_english: WHAT THEREFORE GOD HATH JOINED TOGETHER, LET NOT MAN PUT ASUNDER. MATT. 19:6
passage_yoruba: OHUN TI OLORUN BA SO SOKAN, KI ENIYAN KI O MASE YA WON. MATT. 19:6
verses_english:
O Father, all-creating,
Whose wisdom and whose pow'r
First bound two lives together
In Eden's primal hour;
Today to these Thy children
Thine earliest gift renew;-
A home by Thee made blessed,
A love by Thee kept true.

O Saviour, Guest most bounteous 
Of old in Galilee,
Vouchsafe to-day Thy presence,
With these who wait on Thee;
Their store of earthly gladness
Transform to heav'nly wine,
And teach them, in the tasting,
To know the gift is Thine.

O Spirit of the Father,
Breathe on them from above,-
So searching in Thy pureness,
So tender in Thy love;
That guarded by Thy presence,
From sin and strife kept free,
Their lives may own Thy guidance
Their hearts be ruled by Thee.

Except Thou build it, Father,
The house is built in vain;
Except Thou, Lord, sustain it,
The joy will turn to pain:
But nought can break the union
Of hearts in Thee made one,
And love which Thou hast hal-lowed,
Is endless love begun.
Amen.
verses_yoruba:
N‘igbeyawo Galili,
Iwo ba won pejo
Jo, sokale s‘arin wa,
Bukun oko, aya;
So ikoro di adun,
So ekun di erin;
Ko won lati mo O li
Onise iyanu.

Emi Orun alaye,
Mi si won lat‘oke;
Fun won ni iwa-mimo,
Fun won n‘ife pipe,
Jo, ma je amona won,
Ki won le sa fese
Se akoso aye won,
Ki won le dabi Re.

title_english: THE voice that breathed o'er Eden
passage_english: AND GOD BLESSED THEM. GEN 1:28
passage_yoruba: OLORUN SI SURE FUN WON. GEN. 1:28
verses_english:
THE voice that breathed o'er Eden!
That earliest wedding-day,
The primal marriage blessing,
It hath not passed away.

Still in the pure espousal
Of Christian man and maid,
The Holy Three are with us,
The threefold grace is said,

For dower of blessed children,
For love and faith's sweet sake,
For high mysterious union,
Which nought on earth may break.

Be present, awful Father,
To give away this bride,
As Eve thou gav'st to Adam
Out of his own pierced side.

Be present, gracious Saviour,
To join their loving hands,
As thou didst bind two natures
In thine eternal bands.

Be present, Holiest Spirit,
To bless them as they kneel,
As thou for Christ the Bridegroom
The heavenly spouse dost seal.

O spread thy pure wings o'er them!
Let no ill power find place,
When onward to thine altar
The hallowed path they trace,

To cast their crowns before thee,
In perfect sacrifice,
Till to the home of gladness
With Christ's own bride they rise!
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ire ta su ni Eden,
N’igbeyawo kinni,
Ibukun t’a bunkun won,
O wa sibe sibe.

Sibe titi di oni,
N’ igbeyawo Kristiani,
Olorun wa larin wa,
Lati sure fun wa.

Ire ki won le maa bi
Ki won k’o si maa re
Ki won ni ‘dapo mimo
T’enikan k’ yoo le tu

Ba ni pe, Baba, si fa
Obinrin yi f’oko
Bi O ti fi Efa fun
Adam lojo kini

Ba wa pe Emmanuel,
Si so owo won po,
B’eda meji ti papo,
L’ara ijinle Re

Ba wa pe, Emi Mimo
F’ibukun Re fun won
Si se won ni asepe
Gege b’O ti maa se

Fi won sabe aabo Re
K’ibi, kan ma ba won
‘Gba won n para ile Re
Maa toju okan won

Pelu won loj’ aye won
At’oko at’aya
Titi won o d’odo Re
N’ile ayo l’orun.
(Amin).

title_english: Jesus, do manifest Thyself
passage_english: AND BOTH JESUS WAS CALLED, AND HIS DISCIPLES, TO THE MARRIAGE. JOHN 2:2
passage_yoruba: A SI PE JESU ATI AWON OMO EYIN RE PELU SI IBI IGBEYAWO. JOHANU 2:2
verses_english:
Jesus, do manifest Thyself
At this matrimony
We beseech Thee to come, O Lord
Reveal Thyself to us.

Pour out Thy blessings on these ones
Whose hands are joined in one
Look down in favour of their match
And bless this their union.

Fill both their bosoms with Thy love
Give to them contentment
Give them Thy peace O Lord, we pray
And supply all their needs

Through Thy perfect love, make them one
That they, may by Christ's love,
Make domestic cares become light
By helping each other.

Let them be help to each other
In matters of their faith
And bless thou them with good children
Who will stablish their home.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu f‘ara han nitooto 
Nibi ase ‘yawo 
Oluwa, awa be O, wa 
F‘ara Re han nihin.

Fi ibukun Re fun awon 
Ti o dawopo yii; 
F‘ojurere wo ‘dapo won, 
Si bukun egbe won.

F‘ebun Ife kun aya won, 
Fun won n ‘itelorun; 
Fi alaafia Re fun won, 
Si busi ini won.

F'lfe mimo so won d‘okan 
Ki won f‘ife Kristi 
Mu aniyan ile fere; 
Nipa ajumose.

Je ki won ran ‘ra won lowo 
Ninu igbagbo won; 
Ki won si ni omo rere, 
Ti yoo gbe ‘le won ro! 
(Amin).

title_english: Rest in the Lord ? from harps above
passage_english: REST IN THE LORD, AND WAIT PATIENTLY FOR HIM. PSALM 37:7
passage_yoruba: SINMI NINU OLUWA KI O SI FI SUURU DURO DEE. ORIN DAFIDI 37:7
verses_english:
Rest in the Lord ? from harps above
The music seems to thrill ?
Rest in His everlasting love
Rest and be still.

Rest thou, who claimest for thine own
Thy chosen bride today,
Affianced in His faith alone
Thy bride for aye.

And thou, whose trustful hand is given
Avouching here thy spouse,
Rest, for a Father seals in heaven
His children's vows.

Rest ye, who cluster round them both
To mingle praise and prayers;
Your God affirms the plighted troth,
Your God and theirs.

Rest, for the Heavenly Bridegroom here
Is standing by your side,
And in this union draws more near
His mystic bride.

Rest in the Lord ? thrice Holy Dove,
In us Thy word fulfil ?
Rest in His everlasting love,
Rest and be still.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Sinmi, Iwo oko t‘o gbe 
Iyawo re loni; 
Ninu Jesu, ‘yawo re ni 
Titi aye.

Iwo ti a fa owo re 
F‘oko n‘nu ile yii; 
Sinmi, Baba f‘edidi Re 
S’ ileri yin.

E sinmi, eyin ore won, 
T‘e wa ba won pejo; 
Olorun won ati ti yin 
Gba ohun won.

Sinmi; Jesu Oko Ijo 
Duro ti yin nihin; 
Ninu idapo yin, O n fa 
Ijo mora.

E sinmi Adaba mimo, 
M‘oro Re se n'nu wa, 
Sinmi le ‘fe Re ailopin; 
Si duro Je. 
(Amin).

title_english: Lord my God, on thee I'll call
passage_english: I CRIED UNTO THE LORD WITH MY VOICE… HE GAVE EAR UNTO ME. PSALMS 77:1
passage_yoruba: EMI O FI OHUN MI KIGBE SI OLORUN … O SI FI ETI SI MI. OD 77:1
verses_english:
Lord my God, on thee I'll call
I am in pains, O hear my cry;
When floods of water cover me
Forbid that my heart should backslide.

Thou Lord art friend of the infirm
To whom shall I make my complaint?
If not to Thee, and only Thee,
Who calls the miserable to Him.

Who has e'er wept to Thee in vain?
Has Thou e'er shunned anyone's cry?
Art Thou not the One who promis'd
No one shall e'er seek Thee in vain?

This could have been my heart' sorrow
That Thou Lord does not answer pray'r,
But Thou has been answ'ring my pray'rs
O Lord, Thou has been my helper.

I know I am needy and poor
But Thou God will not forget me
He, for whom Jesus is pleading
Is set free from all his troubles.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Olorun mi, ‘Wo l‘em‘ o pe; 
Ara nni mi, gbo igbe mi: 
Gba ‘san omi ba bori mi, 
ma je k‘okan mi fa sehin.

Iwo Ore alailera, 
Tani mba s’ aroye mi fun? 
Bikose ‘Wo nikansoso, 
T‘O npe otosi w‘odo Re?

Tal‘ o sokun to lasan ri? 
Wo ko igbe enikan ri? 
Se Iwo ni O ti so pe, 
Enikan k‘yo wa O lasan?

Eyi ‘ba je ‘binuje mi 
Pe, O ko ndahun adura; 
Sugbon ‘Wo ti ngbo adura, 
Iwo l‘O nse iranwo mi.

Mo mo pe alaini l‘emi, 
Olorun ko ni gbagbe mi; 
Eniti Jesu mbebe fun, 
O bo lowo gbogbo ‘yonu 
(Amin).

title_english: Thou art my hiding-place, O Lord
passage_english: YOU ARE MY HIDING PLACE. PSALMS 32:7
passage_yoruba: IWO NI INI IPAMO MI. ORIN DAFIDI 32:7
verses_english:
When storms of fierce temptation beat,
And furious foes assail,
My refuge is the mercy-seat,
My hope within the veil,
From strife of tongues and bitter words
My spirit flies to Thee:
Joy to my heart the thought affords,
My Saviour died for me.

Mid trials, heavy to be borne,
When mortal strength is vain,
A heart with grief and anguish torn,
A body rack'd with pain, ---
Ah! what could give the sufferer rest,
Bid every murmur flee,
But this, the witness in my breast,
My Saviour died for me.

And when Thine awful voice commands
This body to decay,
And life, in its last lingering sands,
Is ebbing fast away,
Then, though it be in accents weak,
And faint and tremblingly,
O give me strength in death to speak,
“My Savior died for me.”
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Jesu ’Wo n’ ibi sadi mi,
’Wo ni mo gbekele;
Oro Re n’ iranlowo mi,
Emi alailera.
Nko ni ejo kan lati ro,
Ko s’ ohun ti un o wi;
Eyii to, pe Jesu mi ku,
Jesu mi ku fun mi.

Igba iji ’danwo ba n ja,
T’ota n dojuko mi,
Ite aanu n’ isadi mi,
Nibe n’ ireti mi.
Okan mi yoo sa too wa,
’Gba ’banuje ba de;
Ayo okan mi l’eyii pe,
Jesu mi ku fun mi.

Laarin iyonu t’o wuwo,
T’eniyan ko le gba;
Laarin ibanuje okan,
Ati ’rora ara;
Kil’o le fun ni n’ isinmi,
Ati suuru f’okan mi pe?
T’o n s’ eleri l’ okan mi pe,
Jesu mi ku fun mi.

’Gba ohun Re ba si pase
K’ ara yii dibaje,
Ti emi mi, b’ isan omi,
Ba si san koja lo,
B’ ohun mi ko tile jale,
Nigbanaa, Oluwa,
Fun mi n’ipa ki n le wipe,
Jesu mi ku fun mi. 
(Amin).

title_english: We would see Jesus; for the shadows lengthen
title_yoruba: A fe ri Jesu, ’tori ojiji wa n gun
passage_english: “SIR, WE WISH TO SEE JESUS.”. JOHN 12:21
passage_yoruba: “ALAGBA, AWA N FE RI JESU”. JOHANU 12:21
verses_english:
We would see Jesus; for the shadows lengthen
Across this little landscape of our life;
We would see Jesus, our weak faith to strengthen
For the last weariness, the final strife.

We would see Jesus; for life’s hand hath rested
With its dark touch upon both heart and brow;
And though our souls have many a billow breasted
Others are rising in the distance now.

We would see Jesus, the great rock foundation
Whereon our feet were set with sovereign grace;
Nor life nor death, with all their agitation,
Can thence remove us, if we see His face.

We would see Jesus; yet the spirit lingers
Round the dear objects it has loved so long,
And earth from earth can scarce unclasp its fingers;
Our love to Thee makes not this love less strong.

We would see Jesus: sense is all too binding,
And heaven appears too dim, too far away;
We would see Thee, Thyself our hearts reminding
What Thou hast suffered, our great debt to pay.
verses_yoruba:
A fe ri Jesu, ’tori ojiji wa n gun,
Ojiji igba ojo aiye wa;
A fe ri Jesu, k’O busi gbagbo wa,
Nigba akoko titan wa ba de.

A fe ri Jesu, aare n mu okan wa,
A fe ri I, aare n mu ara wa;
Igbi iyonu pupo l’ o ti n lu wa,
Igbi mi si tun n dide to wa bo.

A fe ri Jesu, Apata ’pile wa,
Li ori eyiti a duro le;
Iye, iku, gbogbo wahala aye,
Ko le y’ ese wa, b’ a ba roju Re.

A fe ri Jesu, aye ko l’adun mo,
Ohun t’a n yo si ri sa l’oju wa,
Awon ore wa gbogbo l’o ti n koja lo,
Ao kedun won mo, se awa naa n bo.

A fe ri Jesu, sugbon oju n ro wa,
Nitori awon ara at’ ore;
Ara wa pelu ko fe f’aye sile,
Ife wa si O ko mu ’fe yii dinku.

A fe ri Jesu, oju okan wa fo,
Orun su, o si jinna loju wa;
A fe ri O, O ran okan wa leti
Iya t’O je lati san gbese wa.

A fe ri Jesu, eyii l’ohun t’a fe,
Gba t’a ba ri O, ayo nla yoo de;
’Wo t’O ku, t’O jinde, t’O n bebe fun wa,
’Gbanaa, ’mole yoo de, ookun yoo si lo. 
(Amin).

title_english: Oh, the bitter shame and sorrow
title_yoruba: O s’ ohun t’o ti mi loju
passage_english: I HAVE BEEN CRUCIFIED WITH CHRIST; IT IS NO LONGER I WHO LIVE, BUT CHRIST LIVES IN ME. GALATIANS 2:20
passage_yoruba: AKAN MI MO AGBELEBU PELU KRISTI, SUGBON MO WA LAAYE; SUGBON KI ISE EMI, BIKOSE KRISTI TI O WA LAAYE NINU MI. GALATIA 2:20
verses_english:
Oh, the bitter shame and sorrow,
That a time could ever be,
When I let the Savior’s pity
Plead in vain, and proudly answer’d,
“All of self and none of Thee”.

Yet He found me; I beheld Him
Bleeding on the cursed tree;
Heard Him pray, Forgive them, Father,
And my wistful heart said faintly,
“Some of self, and some of Thee”.

Day by day His tender mercy,
Healing, helping, full and free,
Sweet and strong, and ah! so patient,
Brought me lower, while I whispered,
“Less of self, and more of Thee”,

Higher than the highest heavens,
Deeper than the deepest sea,
Lord, Thy love at last hath conquer’d;
Grant me now my heart’s petition,
“None of self, and all of Thee”.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
O s’ ohun t’o ti mi loju,
Pe, nigba kan l’aye mi,
Olugbala n kaanu lasan,
O n pe mi, mo si n dahun pe,
“T’ emi sa, nko naani Re.”

Sugbon O ri mi; mo si wo
L’ or ‘igi agbelebu;
Mo si gbo, “Fi ji won Baba,”
Okan mi f’ inira wipe,
Em’ o naani Re die.”

Lojojumo li aanu Re
N se ’wosan fun okan mi,
Agbara at’ ife l’ O fi
N fa mi mora, mo si wipe,
“Un o naani Re die si.”

Ife Re ga ju orun lo,
O si jin ju okun lo;
Ife Re naa l’ o segun mi,
Je ki n le wi nitooto pe,
“Em’ o wa fun O titi.” 
(Amin).

title_english: There is rest in heaven but not in this world
title_yoruba: Isimi wa l’orun, ko si l’aiye yi
passage_english: THERE THE WICKED CEASE FROM TROUBLING, AND THERE THE WEARY ARE AT REST. JOB 3:17
passage_yoruba: NIBE NI ENI-BUBURU SIWO IYONILENU ENI-ARE WA NINU ISINMI. JOBU 3:17
verses_english:
There is rest in heaven but not in this world
Shall I grumble when tribulation threaten;
Take rest my soul; mind not whate’er happens
Tho’ my journey shortens, I am homeward bound.

Time amest not for me to take my rest here,
And to build my solace now here in the world
I thirst after the Divine dwelling above
I am looking towards a world quite sinless.

My life may be surrounded by many thorns,
Nay I shall never put my trust in my world
For I look not for a resting dwelling here
Till I shall find a complete rest in Jesus.

Though tribulations come, they shall not prevail,
Only Jesus love could change sadness to joy
His smiles only can turn sorrow to laughter
As when the mighty winds blow rain clouds away.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Isimi wa l’orun, ko si l’aiye yi,
Emi o se kun, gbati ’yonu ba de;
SiNmi, okan mi, eyikeyi t’o de,
O din ajo mi ku, o mu k’ile ya.

Ko to fun mi, ki n maa sinmi nihinyii,
Ki n si ma kole mi ninu aye yii;
Oungbe ilu t’a ko f’ owo ko n gbe mi,
Mo n reti aye ti ese ko baje.

Egun osusu le maa hu yi mi ka,
Sugbon emi ko ni gbe ‘ra le aye;
Emi ko wa isinmi kan ni aye
Tit’ em’ o fi sinmi l’ aya Jesu mi.

’Yonu daamu, sugbon ko le pa mi,
Oju ’fe Jesu le so ’yonu d’ erin,
Erin Re le so ekun wa di ayo,
B’ igba t’ efufu fe ojo sisu lo. 
(Amin).

title_english: Tell me the old, old story
passage_english: THE LOVE OF CHRIST WHICH PASSES KNOWLEDGE. EPHESIANS 3:19
passage_yoruba: IFE KRISTI TI O JU IMO GBOGBO LO. EFESU 3:19
verses_english:
Tell me the old, old story,
Of unseen things above,
Of Jesus and His glory,
Of Jesus and His love;
Tell me the story simply,
As to a little child,
For I am weak and weary,
And helpless and defiled.
Tell me the old, old story,
Tell me the old, old story,
Tell me the old, old story,
Of Jesus and His love.

Tell me the story slowly,
That I may take it in—
That wonderful redemption,
God’s remedy for sin;
Tell me the story often,
For I forget so soon,
The early dew of morning
Has passed away at noon.
Tell me the old, old story &c.

Tell me the story softly,
With earnest tones and grave;
Remember I’m the sinner
Whom Jesus came to save;
Tell me the story always,
If you would really be,
In any time of trouble,
A comforter to me.
Tell me the old, old story &c.

Tell me the same old story,
When you have cause to fear
That this world’s empty glory
Is costing me too dear;
And when the Lord’s bright glory
Is dawning on my soul,
Tell me the old, old story:
“Christ Jesus makes thee whole.”
Tell me the old, old story. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
So itan kannaa fun mi,
T’ ohun ni t’a ko ri;
Ti Jesu oun ogo Re,
Ti Jesu oun ’fe Re.
So itan kannaa fun mi,
B’o ba ti so f’ ewe,
’Tor’ alailera l’ emi,
Emi ko si n’ okun.
So itan kannaa fun mi,
So itan kannaa fun mi,
So itan kannaa fun mi,
Ti Jesu oun ’fe Re.

So ’tan naa fun mi jeje,
Li ohun otito:
Ranti p’ elese l’ emi,
Ti Jesu wa gbala.
So fun mi nigbakugba,
Bi iwo ba fe se
Olutunu mi n’ igba
Ojo ibi ba de.
So itan kannaa fun mi, &c.

So itan kannaa fun mi,
Igba ti o ba ri
Pe ogo aye wa yi
Fe gba mi li aya:
’Gba ogo oke orun,
Ba si n farahan mi;
So ’tan kannaa fun mi pe,
Krist mu o l’ ara da.
So itan kannaa fun mi, & c. (Amin).

title_english: Thy way, not mine, O Lord
passage_english: MAKE THY WAY STRAIGHT BEFORE MY FACE. PSLAM 5:8
passage_yoruba: MU ONA RE TO TAARA NIWAJU MI. ORIN DAFIDI 5:8
verses_english:
Thy way, not mine, O Lord,
However dark it be;
Lead me by thine own hand,
Choose out the path for me.

Smooth let it be or rough,
It will be still the best;
Winding or straight, it leads
Right onward to thy rest.

I dare not choose my lot;
I would not if I might:
Choose thou for me, my God,
So shall I walk aright.

The kingdom that I seek
Is thine, so let the way
That leads to it be thine,
Else I must surely stray.

Take thou my cup, and it
With joy or sorrow fill,
As best to thee may seem;
Choose thou my good and ill.

Choose thou for me my friends,
My sickness or my health;
Choose thou my cares for me,
My poverty or wealth.

Not mine, not mine, the choice
In things or great or small;
Be thou my guide, my strength,
My wisdom, and my all.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ona Re, Oluwa, 
B‘o ti wu ko di to! 
Fi owo Re to mi; 
Yan ipa mi fun mi.

B‘o rorun, b‘o soro, 
Daradara l’o je; 
B‘o run, tab‘o wo ni, 
Dandan s’ isinmi ni.

Ijoba t’emo n wa, 
Tire ni; je k‘ona 
T’o re ‘be je Tire, 
Bi beeko, un o sina.

Gba ago mi, fayo 
Tab‘ibanuje kun 
B‘o ti to loju Re;
Yan ‘re tab‘ ibi mi.

Yan oro mi fun mi,
Aisan tab’ ilera 
Yan aniyan fun mi,
Aini tabi oro

Yiyan k ‘ise t’emi 
Ninu ohunkohun; 
Iwo s‘Oluto mi, 
Ogbon, oun gbogbo mi. 
(Amin).

title_english: Hark the divine voice from on high
title_yoruba: Gb’ ohun t’o t’ orun wa ti wi
passage_english: BLESSED ARE THE DEAD WHO DIE IN THE LORD. REVELATION 14:13
passage_yoruba: ALABUKUN FUN LI AWON OKU TI O KU NIPA TI OLUWA. IFIHAN 14:13
verses_english:
Hark the divine voice from on high,
To the dead, to the saints:
Sweet is the mem’ry of their name,
Their state with comfort filled.

Sound they slept in Blessed Jesus,
How sweet and sound they slept!
Through in deep agong and sin,
From travails they are free.

Further away from sinful world,
With the Lord they abide;
Their toil on deadly earth below,
Crowned with a great reward.
(Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Gb’ ohun t’o t’ orun wa ti wi,
F’ awon oku mimo:
Didun n’ irant’ oruko won,
’Busun won n’itura.

Won ku n’nu Jesu abukun,
Oorun won ti dun to!
Ninu irora oun ese,
Won yo ninu ’danwo.

Lona jijin s’aye ise,
Won n be lod’ Oluwa;
Ise won l’aye iku yii,
Pari li ere nla. 
(Amin).

title_english: When our heads are bowed with woe
passage_english: “JESUS, SON OF DAVID, HAVE MERCY ON ME!”. MARK 10:47
passage_yoruba: JESU IWO, OMO DAFIDI SAANU FUN MI. MARKU 10:47
verses_english:
When our heads are bowed with woe,
When our bitter tears o’erflow,
When we mourn the lost, the dear,
Jesus, Son of Mary, hear!

Thou our throbbing flesh hast worn,
Thou our mortal griefs hast borne,
Thou hast shed the human tear;
Jesus, Son of Mary, hear!

Thou hast bowed the dying head,
Thou the blood of life hast shed,
Thou hast filled a mortal bier;
Jesus, Son of Mary, hear!

When the heart is sad within
With the thought of all its sin;
When the spirit shrinks with fear,
Jesus, Son of Mary, hear!
verses_yoruba:
Gbat’ a kun fun banuje,
Gb’ omije n san loju wa;
Gbat’ a n sokun, t’a n sofo,
Olugbala, gbo ti wa.

Gbat’ okan wa ba baje,
Nitori ese t’a da;
Gbat’ eru ba b’okan wa,
Olugbala, gbo ti wa.

’Wo ti mo eru ese,
Ese ti ki ’se Tire:
Eru ese naa l’O gbe,
Olugbala, gbo ti wa.

O ti silekun iku,
O ti s’etutu f’ ese;
O wa low’ otun Baba,
Olugbala, gbo ti wa.
(Amin).

title_english: Hark! They are now at the shore,
title_yoruba: A! won ti gun s’ ebute,
passage_english: CROSSED OVER THE JORDAN. JOSHUA 3:17
passage_yoruba: GOKE JORDANI. JOSUA 3:17
verses_english:
Hark! They are now at the shore,
In heaven, In heaven;
No more food, no more hunger,
No more pain and no more care,
In heaven, In heaven.

There they need no light to see,
In heaven, In heaven;
There is light in all their days,
Jesus Christ their light their all,
In heaven, In heaven.

Ha! the streets are all but gold,
In heaven, In heaven;
And so great is their glory,
Holy Band of Christ they are
In heaven, In heaven.

Ha! no one will quarrel there,
In heaven, In heaven
Jesus Christ has saved them there,
And He ever walk with them
In heaven, In heaven.

Ha! no weeping with the Lord,
In heaven, In heaven;
Jesus being always with them,
Will for ever joy with them,
In heaven, In heaven.

Ha! one day we shall join them,
In heaven, In heaven;
When our time shall come in peace,
And our Lord will call us home
In heaven, In heaven. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
A! won ti gun s’ ebute,
Loke orun; Loke orun;
Ebi ko ni pa won mo,
Won bo lowo irora,
Loke orun; Loke orun.

A! won ko wa fitila,
Loke orun; Loke orun;
’Mole ni l’ojo gbogbo,
Jesu si n’ Imole won,
Loke orun; Loke orun.

A! wura n’ ita won je,
Loke orun; Loke orun;
Ogo ’be si po pupo,
Agbo Jesu ni nwon je
Loke orun; Loke orun.

A! won dekun ija’ ja,
Loke orun; Loke orun;
Jesu l’o ti gba won la,
T’ awon Tire l’ o si n rin,
Loke orun; Loke orun.

A! won ko ni sokun mo,
Loke orun; Loke orun,
Jesu sa wa lodo won,
Lodo Re ni ayo wa,
Loke orun; Loke orun.

A! a o dapo mo won,
Loke orun; Loke orun,
A n reti akoko wa,
’Gba Oluwa ba pe ni
S’ oke orun; S’ oke orun. (Amin).

title_english: How sweet the hour of closing day,
passage_english: HE SHALL ENTER INTO PEACE. ISAIAH 57:2
passage_yoruba: OUN O WO INU ALAAFIA. ISAIAH 57:2.
verses_english:
How sweet the hour of closing day,
When all is peaceful and serene,
And when the sun, with cloudless ray,
Sheds mellow luster o’er the scene!

Such is the Christian’s parting hour;
So peacefully he sinks to rest,
When faith, endued from Heav’n with power,
Sustains and cheers his languid breast.

Mark but that radiance of his eye,
That smile upon his wasted cheek;
They tell us of his glory nigh,
In language that no tongue can speak.

A beam from Heav’n is sent to cheer
The pilgrim on his gloomy road;
And angels are attending near,
To bear him to their bright abode.

Who would not wish to die like those
Whom God’s own Spirit deigns to bless?
To sink into that soft repose,
Then wake to perfect happiness? (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Igba asale ti dun to!
Ti ara tu ohun gbogbo:
’Gbat’ itansan oorun ale
Ba n tan mole s’ ohun gbogbo!

Beeni ’kehin onigbagbo,
Oun a sinmi l’ alaafia;
Igbagbo to gbona janjan
A mole ninu okan re.

Imole kan mo loju re,
Erin si bo ni enu re;
O n f’ ede t’ ahon wa ko mo
Soro ogo t’o sunmole.

Itansan ’mole t’ orun wa,
Lati gba niyanju lona;
Awon angel duro yika
Lati gbee lo s’ibugbe won.

Oluwa, je k’ a lo bayii,
K’a ba O yo, k’a r’ oju Re;
Te aworan Re s’ okan wa,
Si ko wa b’ a ti ba O rin. (Amin).

title_english: As the mourning bell loudly sound
title_yoruba: Bi agogo ọfọ t’ a nlu,
passage_english: I DIE DAILY. I CORINTIANS 15:31
passage_yoruba: I DIE DAILY. I CORINTIANS 15:31
verses_english:
As the mourning bell loudly sound
Calling upon the passing souls
Let every one to probe himself
Are we prepared if death now calls.

Now to forsake all earthy stock
And straight depart the judgment throne
And the voice of the Judge to hear
He shall my lot to me disclose.

Will I be pleased, if He should say
“Get thee away from me thou cursed?”
To eternal furnance in hell
“Prepared for satan and his hosts?”

Lord Jesus Saviour, save my soul
I repose my trust upon Thee;
Perdition way teach me to see
Teach me to live ever with Thee. Amen.
verses_yoruba:
Bi agogo ọfọ t’ a nlu,
Ti npè ọkàn yi kọja lọ,
K’ olukuluku bi ‘r rẹọ,
“Mo ha ọetan b’ iku pè mi?”

“Ki nf’ ohun ti mo fẹ silẹ,
Ki nlọ sid’ itẹ idajẹ
Ki ngbohùn Onidajẹ na,
Ti y’o sọ ipò mi fun mi.”

Ara mi ha gba, b’ o wipe,
“Lọ lọdọ mi eni egùn?”
Sinu ina t’ a ti pèse
Fun Eṣu ati ogun rẹọ?”

Jesu Oluwa, jẹ gbà mi,
Iwẹ, ni mo gbẹkẹ mi le;
Kọọ mi ki nr’ ọna ewu yi,
Kọọ mi ki mba ọ gbe titi. Amin.

title_english: Now the laborer’s task is o’er;
passage_english: “BEFORE I GO HENCE, AND BE NO MORE. PSALM 39:13
passage_yoruba: “BEFORE I GO HENCE, AND BE NO MORE. PSALM 39:13
verses_english:
There the Shepherd, bringing home
Many a lamb forlorn and strayed, Shelters each, no more to roam,
Where the wolf can ne’er invade.
Father, in Thy gracious keeping

There the sinful souls, that turn
To the cross their dying eyes,
All the love of Christ shall learn
At His feet in Paradise.
Father, in Thy gracious keeping

There no more the powers of hell
Can prevail to mar their peace;
Christ the Lord shall guard them well,
He Who died for their release.
Father, in Thy gracious keeping

“Earth to earth, and dust to dust,”
Calmly now the words we say;
Left behind, we wait in trust
For the resurrection day.
Father, in Thy gracious keeping (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Nibẹ l’ oluṣọ agùtan
Nko awọn agutan lẹ;
Nibẹ l’ o ndabòbo wọẹn,
Kòríkò ko le de ‘bẹẹ.
Baba, labẹ itọju Rẹ,

Nibẹ l’ awọ̣n ọlọṣẹ,
Ti ntọju m’ agbelebu,
Y’o mọọ ifẹ Kristi tan,
L’ọsẹ Rẹọ ni Paradis,
Baba, labẹ itọju Rẹ,

Nibẹ l’ agbara Eṣu
Kò le b’ ayọọ wọẹn jẹ mọ;
Kristi Jesu sa nṣọ wọẹn,
On t’o ku fun ‘dane wọẹn.
Baba, labẹ itọju Rẹ,

“Erupẹ fun erupe,”
L’ ède wa nisisiyi;
A tẹ silẹ lati sùn
Titi d’ọjọ ajinde.
Baba, labẹ itọju Rẹ, (Amin).

title_english: Servant of God, well done
passage_english: ‘WELL DONE, GOOD AND FAITHFUL SERVANT; ……… ENTER INTO THE JOY OF YOUR LORD.’ MATTHEW 25:21
passage_yoruba: O SEUN, IWO OMO-ODO RERE ATI OLOTITO ………. BO SINU AYO OLUWA RE. MATT. 25:21
verses_english:
Servant of God, well done
From all your labours, rest;
Thou has fought and Thou has triumphed
Enter Thy Master's joy,`
The call came in the night,
He raised himself to hear,
The arrow of death entered in,
He fell, but did not fear.

The midnight cry went forth,
Arise to meet Thy God`
He woke, and saw his commander,
Through prayer and in faith
His soul rose up at once,
Left this body of clay;
When morn broke, this body of clay
Was found lying down dead.

The pangs of death is past,
Cares and distress are o'er,
The days of fighting are all gone,
His heart has found real peace;
Soldiers of Christ, `well done`
Keep singing songs of joy;
Take thy rest in Thy Saviour's breast,
And rest eternally. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Igbe ta loganjo,
“Pade Olorun re.”
O ji, o ri Balogun re;
N’n’ adura oun ’gbagbo,
Okan re n de wiri,
O bo amo sile,
Gbat’ ile mo, ago ara
Si sun sule l’ oku.

’Rora iku koja,
Lala at’ ise tan:
Ojo ogun jaja pari,
Okan re r’ alaafia;
Omo- ogun Krist’, o seun!
Maa korin ayo sa!
Sinmi lodo Olugbala,
Sinmi titi aye. (Amin).

title_english: The saints of God! their conflict past,
passage_english: THAT THEY MAY REST FROM THEIR LABOURS. REVELATION 14:13
passage_yoruba: WON SINMI NINU LAALAA WON. IFIHAN 14:13
verses_english:
The saints of God! their conflict past,
And life’s long battle won at last,
No more they need the shield or sword,
They cast them down before their Lord:
O happy saints! forever blest,
At Jesus feet’ how safe your rest!

The saints of God! their wand’rings done,
No more their weary course they run,
No more they faint, no more they fall,
No foes oppress, no fears appall:
O happy saints! forever blest,
In that dear home how sweet your rest!

The saints of God! life’s voyage o’er,
Safe landed on that blissful shore,
No stormy tempests now they dread,
No roaring billows lift their head:
O happy saints! forever blest,
In that calm haven of your rest!

The saints of God their vigil keep,
While yet their mortal bodies sleep,
Till from the dust they too shall rise
And soar triumphant to the skies:
O happy saints! rejoice and sing:
He quickly comes, your Lord and King!
verses_yoruba:
Awon mimo, laalaa pari 
		Won ti ja, won si ti segun 
		Won ko fe ohun ija mo 
		Won da won ‘le l‘ese Jesu 
		A! eyin eni ibukun 
		Isinmi yin ti daju to!

Awon mimo, irin pari 
		Won to tun sure ije mo 
		Aare at‘isubu d‘opin 
		Ota oun eru ko si mo 
		A! eyin eni ibukun 
		Isinmi yin ha ti dun to!

Awon mimo, ajo pari, 
		Won ti gun s’ile ibukun 
		Iji ko deruba won mo, 
		Igbin omi ko n’ipa mo 
		A! eyin eni ibukun 
		E n sinmi n‘ibi Alaafia.

Awon mimo, oku won sun 
		Ninu ile, awon n sona, 
		Titi won yio fi jinde 
		Lati fi ayo goke lo!
		A! eni ‘bukun, e korin 
		Oluwa at‘Oba yin n bo

Olorun won, ‘Wo l‘a n kepe, 
		Jesu, bebe fun wa l‘oke 
		Emi mimo, Oluto wa 
		F‘oore-ofe fun wa d‘opin 
		K‘a le b‘awon mimo sinmi 
		Ni paradise pelu Re. (Amin).

title_english: Year in, year out souls are revived,
passage_english: “THERE IS BUT A STEP BETWEEN ME AND DEATH”. 1 SAMUEL 20:3.
passage_yoruba: “ISISE KAN NI NBE LAARIN EMI ATI IKU. 1 SAMUELI 20:3.
verses_english:
Year in, year out souls are revived,
Granted Thou unto us,
What, where and how ever we be,
To the grave we shall end.

All around us dangers abound,
That we may thus ensnared;
Epidemics around exists,
TO send us there beyond.

Eternal joy or woe unended,
For all our souls doth wait
Uncaring we trod all about,
A 'brink of death and grave.

Revive us Lord from our slumber,
Path of danger to see;
When our souls are hence called oh Lord,
To dwell ever with Thee. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ọdun nyipo, o nji emi,
T’O ti fi fun wa ri,
Ibikibi t’o wù k’a wà,
Isà okú l’ a nrè.

Yi ilẹ ka l’ ewu duro,
K’ o lè tì wa s’ isà;
Arun buburu si duro,
Lati le wa lọ ‘le.

Ayọọ tab’ egbe ailopin,
Duro de ọmi wa;
Wo! b’ a ti nrin l’ aibikità,
Leti bèbe ikú.

Oluwa, ji wa l’ orun wa,
K’a r’ ọna ewu yi;
Nigbat’ a ba pe ọkàn wa,
K’a ba ọ gbe titi. (Amin).

title_english: The flow' rs that beautified the field,
passage_english: “IN THE MORNING IT FLOURISHETH, AND GROWETH UP; IN THE EVENING IT IS CUT DOWN, AND WITHERETH.” PSALM 90:6
passage_yoruba: “NI KUTUKUTU O LI AWO LARA, O SI DAGBA SOKE LI ASALE A KE E LULE O SI RO.” ORIN DAFIDI 90:6
verses_english:
This example is fit for us,
According to God's word;
Let young and old take heed and know
That they are but like grass.

Put not your trust fleeting breath,
Call not your times your own;
Around, we see sickle of death,
Cut down thousands of souls.

Tose who are spared untill this day,
Soon, life will also end;
Prepare, be wise before the time,
The death angel will come.

O Lord, help us answer Thy call,
Let us depart from sin;
And when we fall down like the grass,
Let our souls come to Thee. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Itana t’o bò ‘gbe l’aṣọ,
T’o tutù yọyọ be;
Gba doje ba kan, a si kú,
A ṣubu, a si rọ.

Apẹrẹ yii yọ f’ara wa,
B’ọrọ Ọlọrun ti wi;
K’ọmọde at’ agbalagba
Mọọ ‘ra wọẹn l’eweko.

A! má gbẹkẹle ẹ̀mi rẹ,
Má pè ‘gba rẹ ntirẹ;
Yika l’a nri doje ikú,
O mbẹọ ‘gberun lulẹọ.

Ẹnyin t’a dasi di oni,
Laipẹ, ẹ̀mí y’o pin,
Mura k’ọ si gbọọn l’akoko,
K’ ikọọ ikú to de.

Oluwa, jọọ k’a jipé Rẹ,
K’a kuro n’nu ẹ̀ṣẹọ;
Gbat’ a lulẹọ bi koriko,
K’ ọkàn wa yọ si Ọ. Amin.

title_english: Thou art gone to the grave, but we will not deplore thee;
title_yoruba: Awa ti gbe ọ sin, niwọn l’ao daro rẹ,
passage_english: “THAT YE SORROW NOT, EVEN AS OTHERS WHICH HAVE NO HOPE.” 1 THESSALONIANS 4:13
passage_yoruba: “E MASE BINUJE, BI AWON ELOMIRAN TI KO NI IRETI.” 1 TESS 4:13
verses_english:
Thou art gone to the grave, we no longer behold thee,
Nor tread the rough paths of the world by thy side;
But the wide arms of mercy are spread to enfold thee
And sinners may hope, since the Savior hath died.

Thou art gone to the grave, and thy cradle's forsaken.
With us thy fond spirit did not tarry long,
But the sunshine of heaven beamed bright on thy waking,
And the sound thou didst hear was the seraphim's song.

Thou art gone to the grave, but 'twere wrong to deplore thee,
When God was thy ransom, and guardian, and guide.
He gave thee, and took thee, and soon will restore thee,
Where death hath no sting, since the Savior hath died. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Awa ti gbe ọ sin, niwọn l’ao daro rẹ,
B’o tilẹọ jẹ nin’ okunkun l’a sin ọ si;
Jesu rẹ ti là ọna kanna kọja,
Fitilà ifẹ Rẹọ ni y’o ma ṣaju rẹ.

Awa ti gbe ọ sin, oju wa kò ri ọ mọ,
O kò si tun ba wa rìn laiye yi mọ;
Ṣugbọ̣n Jesu ti n’ apa ifẹ Rẹọ si ọ,
Nj’ ọlọṣẹ lè kú, nitori Jesu ti kú.

Awa ti gbe ọ sin, o ti bọọ agọ rẹ silẹọ,
Bọya ọsẹ ọmí rẹ kọọlẹọ lati lẹọ;
Ṣugbọ̣n iwọ ti ji s’imọlẹ Paradise,
‘Wọ si ti ngbọ orin awọ̣n Serafu.

Awa ti gbe ọ sin, niwọn l’a o daro rẹ,
Ọlọrun rẹ li Olurapada rẹ,
O gba ọ lọwọ wa, y’o si ji ọ dide,
Ikú kò n’ oro mọ, ‘tori Jesu ti kú. (Amin).

title_english: Death is the end of everything;
passage_english: “FOR DUST THOU ART, AND UNTO DUST SHALT THOU RETURN.” GENESIS 3:19
passage_yoruba: “FOR DUST THOU ART, AND UNTO DUST SHALT THOU RETURN.” GENESIS 3:19
verses_english:
Death is the end of everything;
No matter how high I climb,
The grave cannot fail to act,
For mankind is destined to die.

After a few short days on earth,
Spent in dreams and illusions,
In sickness and in weakness,
The call of death will come.

Laughter in the morning, tears at night,
Joy mingled with sorrow,
Days of hunger, days of plenty,
All end in death.

Ah! Blessed rest for those who die
In the Savior;
They die to all suffering,
They rise into glory.

The way leads into life
For all believers;
Who would wish to remain here forever
In this restless world?

Deliver us from the second death,
Jesus our Savior;
Grant us life through Your death,
After the sleep of this world. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Iku l’ opin ohun gbogbo;
B’ o ti wu k’ emi gun,
Egun ni ko le sai ma se
T’ a ti fi eda gun.

Lehin ojo die l’ aiye,
T’ a lo ninu lala,
Ninu aisan at’ ailera,
Iko iku yio de.

Erin l’ oro, ekun l’ ale,
Ayo on ‘banuje,
Ojo ebi, ojo ayo
L’ opin ninu iku.

A! egun ‘re f’ awon t’ o ku
Ninu Olugbala;
Nwon ku si iponju gbogbo,
Nwon ji sinu ogo.

Ona l’ o je sinu iye
F’ awon onigbagbo,
Tani few a nihin titi
Ninu aisimi yi?

Gba wa lowo iku keji,
Jesu Olugbala,
K’ a r’ iye ninu iku Re,
Lehin lala aiye. (Amin).

title_english: Hush! blessed are the dead
passage_english: “BLESSED ARE THE DEAD WHO DIE IN THE LORD FROM NOW ON.” REV. 14:13
passage_yoruba: “IBUKUN NI FUN OKU TI O KU NIPA TI OLUWA.” IFIHAN 14:13
verses_english:
Hush! blessed are the dead
In Jesus' arms who rest,
And lean their weary head
For ever on His breast.

Oh beatific sight!
No darkling veil between,
They see the Light of Light,
Whom here they loved unseen.

For them the wild is past
With all its toil and care;
Its withering midnight blast
Its fiery noonday glare.

Ours only are the tears,
Who weep around their tomb
The light of bygone years
And shadowing year to come.

Their voice, their touch, their smile,
Those love-springs flowing o'er
Earth for its little while
Shall never know them more.

O tender hearts and true,
Our long last vigil kept,
We weep and mourn for you;
Nor blame us: Jesus wept.

But soon at break of day
His calm Almighty voice,
Stronger than death, shall say,
Awake, arise rejoice. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ibukun ni f’okú,
T’o simi le jesu;
Awọn t’o gb’ ori wọn
Le okan aiya Rẹọ.

Iran ‘bukun l’eyi,
Ko si ‘bòju larin;
Nwọn ri Ọn’ Imọlẹọ,
Ti nwọn ti fẹ lairi.

Nwọn bọ lọwọ aiye,
Pẹlu aniyàn rẹọ;
Nwọn bọ lọwọ ewu,
T’o nrin l’ ọsan, l’ oru.

Lori iboji wọn,
L’awa nsọkun lonik
Nwọn j’ ọ̀n’ ire fun wa,
T’ a kì y’o gbagbe lai.

A k’yo gbohùn wọn mọ,
Ohùn ifẹ didun;
Lat’ oni lọ, aiye
Kì o tun mọọ wọn mọ.

Ẹnyin oninure,
Ẹ fi wa sìlẹọ lọ;
Ao sọkun nyin titi,
Jesu pa sọkun ri.

Ṣugbọ̣n a fẹ gbóhùn
Olodumare na;
Y’o kẹ, y’o si wipe,
Ẹ dide, ẹ si yọọ. (Amin).

title_english: Brother, thou art/ gone be-/fore us,
passage_english: “AND THE SPIRIT SHALL RETURN UNTO GOD WHO GAVE IT.” ECCLESIASTES 12:7
passage_yoruba: “EMI YIO SI PADA TO OLORUN TI O FI FUN NI.” ONIWASU 12:7
verses_english:
Brother, thou art/ gone be-/fore us,
And thy saintly /soul is /flown
Where tears are wiped from /every /eye,
And /sorrow is un-/known.

From the burden/ of the /flesh,
And from /care and/ sin re/leased,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest.

Thou art sleeping now, like Lazarus,
On his Father’s faithful breast,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest.

And there thou ’rt sure to meet the good,
Whom on earth thou lovest best,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest.

But thy spirit, brother, soars away
Among the faithful blest,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest.

And when the Lord shall summon us
Whom thou now hast left behind,
May we, untainted by the world,
As/ sure a/ welcome/ find;

May each, like thee, de-/part in/ peace,
To be a glorious, happy guest,
Where the wicked cease from troubling,
And the weary are at rest. (Amen).
verses_yoruba:
Ará, iwọ ̀ṣi |waju wa lọ,
Ẹmi rẹ mi | mọọ sì ti fò lọ,
Sibiti kò ni | s’ ọkun mọ;
Ti | kò si irora.

O bọọ lọwọ | ọrù ara
Ati lọwọ | aniyàn aiye:
Nib’ ọni-buburu | ye yọnu,
Ti a|larẹọ si simi.

‘Wọ ti rìn ajò | aiye ja,
O ti | gb’ agbelebu rẹ;
Krist ti fi ęsẹ rẹ | le ọna,
Lati | de ib’ isimi.

Bi Lasaru | l’o si sùn,
L’ a|kaiya Baba rẹ,
Nib ọni-buburu |ye yọnu,
Ti a|larẹọ si simi.

Ẹṣẹ kò le | bà ọ jẹọ mọ,
I|yemeji d’ opin;
Igbagbọ rẹ ni|nu Kristi
At’ Ẹmi | kò ni yọọ mọ lai.

L’ ọrun lọhun | n’ iwọ o bá
Awọ̣n ọrẹọ | t’o ti lọ ṣaju;
Nib’ ọni-buburu | ye yọnu,
Ti a|larẹọ si simi.

Alufa ti wi ni|sisiyi pe,
Eru f’eru, e|rupẹọ f’erupẹọ;
Awa si ko e|rupẹọ bò ọ,
A si | samì s’orì rẹ.

Ṣugbọ̣n ẹmi rẹ | ti fò lọ,
Sọ|dọ awọ̣n mimọ;
Nib’ ọni-buburu | ye yọnu,
Ti a|arẹọ si simi.

‘Gbat’ Olu|wa ba si pè
A|wa t’o kù lọhin;
Oluwa wa, | awa bẹọ ọ,
K’ai|ye má bà jẹọ,

K’ olukuluku wa, b’ a|rá wa yi,
Le ri | àye lọdọ Rẹ,
Nib’ ọni-buburu | ye yọnu,
Ti a|arẹọ si simi. (Amin).

title_english: Jesus Thy service bestow
passage_english: “THEY SHALL BE ABUNDANTLY SATISFIED WITH THE FATNESS OF THY HOUSE.” PSALM 36:8
passage_yoruba: “ORORO ILE RE YOO TE WON L’ORUN GIDIGIDI.” ORIN DAFIDI 36:8
verses_english:
Jesus Thy service bestow,
Perfect joy on earth below;
Jesus Thy service bestow
Perfect comfort though in death.

Beyond death, there is a joy.
Joy eternal, ne’er to end;
God be mine is all my plea,
My joy knows no end for aye.
verses_yoruba:
Isin Jesu ni ‘funni
L’ay?? tot?, l’aiye yi;
Isin Jesu ni ‘funni
N’ itunnu ninu iku.

L?hin ‘ku, ay?? na mb?,
Ti kò ni d’opin lailai;
K’ ?l?run sa j? t’emi,
Ay?? mi kì o l’opin.

title_english: We love the place, O God,
passage_english: “LORD, I HAVE LOVED THE HABITATION OF THY HOUSE.” PSALM 26:8
passage_yoruba: “LORD, I HAVE LOVED THE HABITATION OF THY HOUSE.” PSALM 26:8
verses_english:
We love the place, O God,
Wherein Thine honor dwells;
The joy of Thine abode
All earthly joy excels.

It is the house of prayer,
Wherein thy servants meet;
And thou, O Lord, art there
Thy chosen flock to greet.

We love the sacred font;
For there the Holy Dove
To pour is ever wont
His blessing from above.

We love the word of life,
The word that tells of peace,
Of comfort in the strife,
And joys that never cease.

We love to sing below
For mercies freely given;
But oh we long to know
The triumph-song of heaven.

Lord Jesus, give us grace
On earth to love Thee more,
In heaven to see Thy face,
And with Thy saints adore.
verses_yoruba:
?l?run, awa f?
Ile t’?la R? wà;
Ay?? ibugbe R?
Ju gbogbo ay?? l?.

Ile adurà ni,
Fun awa ?m? R?;
Jesu, O wà nib??,
Lati gb? ?b? wa.

Awa f? àse R?,
Kil’ o dùn to l’aiye;
Nib’ aw?n olot?,
Nri ? nitosi w?n.

Awa f? ??r? R?,
?r? Alafia;
T’itunu at’ ìye,
?r? ay? titi.

A f? k?rin anú,
T’a nri gbà l’aiye yi;
?ugb?n awa f? m??
Orin ay?? t’?run.

Jesu, Oluwa wa,
Busi ‘f? wa nihin;
Mu wa de ‘nu ogo,
Lati yìn ? titi.

title_english: All people that on earth do dwell,
title_yoruba: Gbogbo eyin ti n gbe aye
passage_english: SERVE THE LORD WITH GLADNESS. PS 100:2
passage_yoruba: FI AYO SIN OLUWA. PS 100:2
verses_english:
All people that on earth do dwell,
Sing to the Lord with cheerful voice.
Him serve with fear, His praise forth tell;
Come ye before Him and rejoice.
verses_yoruba:
Gbogbo eyin ti n gbe aye
E f’ayo korin s’Oluwa;
F’iberu sin, e yin l’ogo
E wa s’odo Re, k’e si yo.

Nje, f’iyin wo ile Re wa
F’ayo sunmo agbala Re;
Yin, k’e bukun oruko Re,
’Tori o ye bee lati se.

Eese! Rere l’Olorun wa,
Aanu Re o wa titi lae,
Ooto Re ko figbakan ye,
O duro lat’ irandiran.

title_english: The Church's one foundation
passage_english: AS CHRIST IS THE HEAD OF THE CHURCH. EPHESIANS 5:23
passage_yoruba: KRISTI NI ORI IJO ENIYAN RE. EFESU 5:23
verses_english:
Elect from every nation,
Yet one o'er all the earth,
Her charter of salvation
One Lord, one faith, one brith,
One holy name she blesses,
Partakes one holy food,
And to one hope she presses,
With every grace endued.

Though with a scornful wonder
Men see her sore oppressed,
By schisms rent asunder,
By heresies distressed;
Yet saints their watch are keeping,
Their cry goes up: How long?
And soon the night of weeping
Shall be the morn of song.

Mid toil and tribulation,
And tumult of her war,
She waits the consummation
Of peace for evermore,
Till with the vision glorious
Her longing eyes are blest,
And the great Church victorious
Shall be the Church at rest.

Yet he on earth hath union
With God the Three in One,
And mystic sweet communion
With those whose rest is won.
O happy ones and holy!
Lord, give us grace that we,
Like them, the meek and lowly,
On high may dwell with Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Jesu Oluwa ni ‘se
Ipinle Ijo Re,
Omi ati oro Re
Ni Oun si fi tun da;
O t‘orun wa, O fi se
Iyawo mimo Re,
Eje Re l’O si fi ra
Ti O ku fun un.

Nile gbogbo l’a sa won,
Sugbon won je okan;
Oluwa kan gbogbo kan
Ati baptisimu kan:
Oruko kan ni won n yin,
Ounje kan ni won n je;
Opin kan ni won n lepa,
Nipa oore ofe

Bi aye tile n kegan,
Gbat‘ iyonu ba de:
B‘ija oun eko-ke-ko
Ba mu iyapa wa;
Awon mimo yoo maa ko
Wipe, “Yio ti pe to?
Oru ekun fere di
Oro orin ayo.

L‘aarin gbogbo‘banuje
At‘iyonu aye,
O n reti ojo ‘kehin
Alaafia laelae;
Titi yoo f’ oju re ri
Iran ologo naa!
Ti ijo nla segun
Yoo d‘ijo ti n simi.

L‘aye yii ni‘dapo
Pelu Metalokan;
O si ni ‘dapo didun
Pel'awon t’o ti sun;
A! alabukun mimo!
Oluwa, fi fun wa,
K’a ba le ri bi awon,
K’a ba O gbe l‘orun.

title_english: O Lord, here am I at Thy throne
passage_english: WASH ME THROUGHLY FROM MINE INIQUITY. PSALM 51:2
passage_yoruba: WASH ME THROUGHLY FROM MINE INIQUITY. PSALM 51:2
verses_english:
O Lord, here am I at Thy throne
Where mercy e'er abounds!
I need forgiveness of my sins,
Renew my heart, O Lord.

O Lord, I need not bother Thee,
With this my one request,
Before I ask, you know my heart,
The very thing I need.

For mercy Lord, I now implore,
This is my heart's desire
Mercy is my soul's greatest need,
Bestow Thy mercy, Lord.
verses_yoruba:
Oluwa, mo de ‘bi ‘t? R?,
Nibiti anu p??!
Mo f? dariji ???? mi,
K’o mu ?kàn mi dá.

Oluwa, kò y? k’ emi s?
Ohun ti mba berè;
O ti m?? k’ emi to berè,
Ohun ti emi f?.

Oluwa, mo t?r? anu,
Eyiyi l’opin na;
Oluwa, anu l’o y? mi,
J? ki anu R? wá.

title_english: Jesus, Lord we come to Thee,
passage_english: AND YE SHALL SEEK ME, AND FIND ME, WHEN YE SHALL SEARCH FOR ME WITH ALL YOUR HEART. JEREMIAH 29:13.
passage_yoruba: “EYIN O SI SAFERI MI, E O SI RI MI, TI E BA FI GBOGBO OKAN YIN WA MI. JEREMIAH 29:13.
verses_english:
Jesus, Lord we come to Thee,
At Thy feet we humbly kneel,
Despise not our petition,
Ah! shall we seek Thee in vain?

In the way Thou choose for us,
We are seeking Thee this hour,
O Lord, we shall not depart,
Until Thou will bless us all.

Send a message in Thy word
That gives joy unto our hearts,
May Thy spirit here bestow
Forgiveness to all our hearts.

Let us seek Thee and find Thee
As a benevolent God;
Heal the sick, set-captives free,
Let us all rejoice in Thee.

Oluwa, a kì o l?,
Titi ‘W? o bukun wa.

Ran?? lat’ ??r? R? wá,
Ti o fi ay?? fun wa;
J? ki ?mi R? k’o fun
?kàn wa ni igbala.

J? k’ a wá, k’a si ri ?
Ni ?l?run Olore;

Ki gbogbo wa y? si ?.

title_english: O Lord wilt Thou not receive me,
passage_english: “BE THOU MY STRONG HABITATION”. PSALM 71:3
passage_yoruba: “IWO NI KI O SE IBUJOKO APATA MI”. ORIN DAFIDI 71:3
verses_english:
O Lord wilt Thou not receive me,
A wretched man like me,
That I may draw nigh to Thy throne,
And cry Abba Father”?

Lord Jesus fill me with Thy word
Turn my darkness to light;
Let all my joy return to me,
Throw away with my sins.

I serve Thee Lord wonderfully,
Great is Thy goodness, Lord;
Preserve me saviour in Thy love.
That I may sin no more.
verses_yoruba:

?ni o?i b’ emi,

Ki gbogbo ay? tun pada,
Ti mo f’???? gb??n nù.

Oluwa mo f’iyanu sin,
Ore R? tobi ju;

title_english: My God, is any hour so sweet
passage_english: HOUR OF PRAYER. ACTS 3:1
passage_yoruba: WAKATI ADURA ISE. 3:1
verses_english:
My God, is any hour so sweet
From blush of morn to evening star,
As that which calls me to Thy feet,
The hour of prayer?

Blest is that tranquil hour of morn,
And blest that hour of solemn eve,
When, on the wings of prayer upborne,
The world I leave.

For then a day-spring shines on me,
Brighter than morn's ethereal glow;
And richer dews descend from Thee
Than earth can know.

Lord, till I reach yon blissful shore,
No privilege so dear shall be
As thus my inmost soul to pour
In prayer to Thee.
verses_yoruba:
Olorun lat‘ ooro d‘ale,
Wakati wo l‘o dun pupo,
B‘eyii t‘O pe mi wado Re,
Fun adura?

Ibukun n‘itura ooro
Ibukun si l‘oju ale;
Gbati mo f‘adura goke
Kuro l‘aye!

‘Gbanna ‘mole kan mo si mi
O dan ju 'mole oorun lo
Iri ‘bukun t‘aye ko mo
T' odo Re wa.

Gbana l‘agbara mi d‘otun,
Gbana l‘a f'ese mi ji mi,
‘Gbana l‘o f‘ireti orun
M'ara mi ya.

Enu ko le so ibukun
Ti mo nri f‘aini mi gbogbo
Agbara, itunu, ati
Alafia.

Eru at' lyemeji tan,
Okan mi f‘orun se ile
Omije ‘ronupiwada
L‘a nu kuro.

Titi un o de ‘le‘bukun naa,
Ko s‘anfaani t’o le dun bi
Ki n ma tu okan mi fun O
Nin‘ adura!

title_english: Sweet hour of prayer!
passage_english: HOUR OF PRAYER. ACTS OF APOSTLE 3:1
passage_yoruba: WAKATI ADURA. ISE AWON APOSTELI 3:1
verses_english:
Sweet hour of prayer!
That calls me from a world of care,
And bids me at my Father’s throne
Make all my wants and wishes known.
In seasons of distress and grief,
My soul has often found relief
And oft escaped the tempter’s snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer!
And oft escaped the tempter’s snare
By thy return, sweet hour of prayer!

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
Thy wings shall my petition bear
To Him whose truth and faithfulness
Engage the waiting soul to bless.
And since He bids me seek His face,
Believe His Word and trust His grace,
I’ll cast on Him my every care,
And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer!
I’ll cast on Him my every care,
And wait for thee, sweet hour of prayer!

Sweet hour of prayer! sweet hour of prayer!
May I thy consolation share,
Till, from Mount Pisgah’s lofty height,
I view my home and take my flight:
This robe of flesh I’ll drop and rise
To seize the everlasting prize;
And shout, while passing through the air,
“Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!”
And shout, while passing through the air,
“Farewell, farewell, sweet hour of prayer!”
verses_yoruba:
Wakati adura didun!
T'o gbe mi lo kuro layé,
Lo 'waju ite Baba mi,
Ki n so gbogbo edun mi fun;
Nigba 'banuje at'aro,
Adua l'abo fun okan mi:
Emi si bo lowo Esu,
'Gbati mo ba gb'adua didun
Emi si bo lowo Esu,
'Gbati mo ba gb'adua didun

Wakati adura didun!
Iye re yoo gbe ebe mi,
Lo sod' Enit'o s’eleri,
Lati ‘bukun okan adua:
B'O ti ko mi, ki n w’oju Re,
Ki n gbekele, ki n si gbagbo:
Un ó ko gbogb' aniyan mi le,
Ni akoko adua didun,
Un ó ko gbogb' aniyan mi le,
Ni akoko adua didun.

Wakati adura didun!
Je ki n maa r'itunu Re gba,
Titi un ó fi d'oke Pisga,
Ti un ó r'ile mi l'okere,
Un ó bo ago ara sile,
Un ó gba ere ainipekun:
Un ó korin bi mo ti n fo lo,
O digbose! Adua didun,
Un ó korin bi mo ti n fo lo,
O digbose! adua didun.

title_english: Behold the throne of grace,
passage_english: LET US THEREFORE COME BOLDLY UNTO THE THRONE OF GRACE. HEB. 4:16
passage_yoruba: E JE KI A FI IGBOYA WA SI IBI ITE OORE-OFE. HEB. 4:16.
verses_english:
Behold the throne of grace,
The promise calls us near,
There Jesus shows a smiling face
And waits to answer prayer.

That rich atoning blood,
Which sprinkled round we see,
Provides for those who come to God
An all prevailing plea.

Beyond thy utmost wants
His love and pow’r can bless;
To praying souls He always grants,
More than they can express.

Thine image, Lord, bestow,
Thy presence and Thy love;
I ask to serve Thee here below,
And reign with Thee above.
verses_yoruba:
Sa wo ite aanu,
Oro Re pe mi wa;
Nibe Jesu f’oju ‘re han
Lati gbo adura.

Eje etutu ni
Ti a ti ta sile
Pese ebe t‘o le bori
F‘awon t‘o n t‘Olorun.

Ife Re le fun mi,
Ju bi mo ti fe lo;
A maa fun enit‘o beere
Ju bi won ti n fe lo

Fun wa l‘aworan Re
At‘ oju rere Re;
Je ki n le sin O nihinyii,
Ki n ba le ba O gbe.
